review_body: Ayo shorty uhh Stephanie and buddy omar was hella helpful folk nem gave recommendations of The city and things like that the trip was amazing any questions I had they were always helpful they were really dope

I can't say enough great things about this hotel. I have been to NYC several times and generally like to stay in the midtown area. The hotels where I usually stay were pretty pricey this time and since Cassa was in the general area and within my price range I decided to take a chance. Everything about this hotel was awesome. We arrived early and were pleasantly surprised that our room was ready! The suite was a nice size and the sofa bed was nice and comfy. We called down to the front desk a few times for odds and ends and the staff were always so accommodating and super quick. They always had a smile and a greeting for us every time they saw us. The elevators were quick and the location was perfect, within walking distance of everything. The hotel was even able to provide a car service that was much nicer than Uber or a taxi service and for the same price. Do yourself a favor a try this hotel, you won't be disappointed!

This place was Great! With the help of Stephanie I was able to find this place for a great price! Which was convenient for me and my family. She even recommended some place for us to visit during our stay. I highly recommend this place.

I was so taken away by this place! My husband and I especially enjoyed the fitness center area, and I felt really comfortable using the facilities with the help of Ms. Stephanie. We would’ve been lost if it wasn’t for her! I plan on staying again, 10/10 would recommend!

I still felt safe with all the chaos going on across the country with the corona virus. I stayed here for two nights and didn't get sick. Omar and stefanie l helped me at the front desk and fixed my reservation after I had to extend last minute. The rooms are pretty small but worth the low price.

Cassa Hotel is a great deal in a great location. The staff are fantastic, Nivar and Adam went way out of their way to help my family. While the physical hotel is due for a refresh, everything was clean and neat. Highly recommend.

Lovely hotel, staff were fantastic, welcoming and couldn’t do enough for you. There were a few different staff members who dealt with us and all gave and exemplary service however I only got the name from the lady that checked us in which was Tasha. The room was spacious and clean with a coffee maker and a large TV as well as an iron/ironing board and a hairdryer. Beds were very comfy. Great location for exploring! Thank you for a pleasant stay.

We stayed at Cassa in early March. A lovely friendly welcome on our arrival from Stephanie, Adam and Nivar. We arrived before check-in time but Stephanie sorted a room out for us (on the 22nd floor as I’d requested a higher floor).Our room was spacious for New York with a very comfy bed, coffee maker and large TV. Bathroom had a lovely waterfall shower and there was an abundance of hot water. No fridge but we didn’t need one, there was an iron and ironing board. Room also has useful usb charging sockets on the desk and by the bed - very handy. Our room was clean and a special mention to Mery for the little notes, cleaning the room and for dealing with all of our meal rubbish!Located just off 6th Avenue it’s an ideal spot if you don’t want all the noise of Times Square but it’s only 5 minutes walk away if you do. Given it’s location you don’t get the dazzling views but as the idea of being in NYC is to be out enjoying it, not in the room, that’s fine with me. There’s a Pret next door which is ideal to grab a coffee/breakfast bite and there are restaurants and a couple of bars 2 minutes further on 45th Street.They were happy to securely store our cases on our final day so we could spend a last few hours in the city enjoying ourselves.Would I stay there again - definitely.

The hotel is literally a hole in the wall. Hallways are dim with dull lighting and the decor is dated and drab. Bed linens were stained, AC fan was extremely loud and windows so dirty you could barely see outside. While the room was nothing to get excited about, the staff was friendly. There is a restaurant onsite but the staff did not recommend it. No need with the abundance of surrounding eateries. The proximity to Time Square was great. Central Park was only about a dozen blocks away. It was an $85 USD cab ride from Newark airport.

Stayed for 3D/2N. We were able to do an early check in and got upgraded to a slightly bigger room by being an Expedia VIP holder. Parked one block away and walked 5mins to the hotel. It was really easy to find. We knew we were in the center of all the things we wanted to see/do but what we didnt realize until our 2nd day how close we really were to everything! We walked to all of our destinations (avoided taking the subway). I even had time to freshen up in the afternoon before heading to our night schedule. I also loved that they allowed us to leave our luggage after check in so we can walk to the Times Square and buy our Jollibee to bring back home to NH. Will definitely stay here again.

Just got back from a week at Cassa. Good room and bathroom, nice staff, specially Evita and Stephany!! Couldn’t get a room in the morning when we arrived, but got nicely compensated for by Evita. Most of the staff is friendly and helpful. Had a nice stay!! One suggestion, would be to change the shampoos for disposable ones, instead of the big bottles...other than that, all great!

I can highly recommend this hotel. Great location, nice and clean room, and very friendly staff. Especially Tasha at the reception was very helpful. I will definitely stay at this hotel again during my next visit to NYC!

Grabbed this hotel kind of last minute and was unsure but upon arrival Tasha greeted us with a smile and helped us quickly and efficiently. Completely painless interaction and explained all the details about our stay in minutes. Upgraded our room and gave us tips about food! Room is incredibly clean and has everything we need. Plenty of space for two. Quiet too.

This Hotel wasn’t to bad.Tasha the front desk agent made our stay lovely. Thank you so much Tasha for all your help. Her Manager was kind of a stick in the mud. Until I had to remind him he wasn’t being friendly

I debated & debated on where we should spend our anniversary night in NYC. I actually booked at a different hotel, but when I talked to someone from the front desk about the parking situation, she couldn't have been nicer & welcoming of my questions. She sold me! After parking 1 street over on 46th street ($40/day for our SUV) we cut through a park area & landed right in front of the hotel. Evita & Stephanie A. were there to greet us & let us know we had been chosen as their "Guest of the Day"!! How exciting!! We were upgraded to a Studio Suite on the 6th floor. I was a little nervous that we were so close to the elevator, but we never hear any noise from it. They also provided us with a lovely treat and wine for our anniversary. So special! The room was very clean & spacious. My only complaint on checkout was the shower. If you followed the directions on the faucet, & turned all the way to hot, it was ice cold. We found backing it up worked. There was no barrier between the glass and the tub so a ton of water spilled out onto the floor. We had to use a hand towel to try to keep most of the water in. No biggie. Hopefully it will be fixed. The heater that went off & on was a little noisy, but I quickly got used to it. And one of our neighbors decided to pump up their music at midnight, but shutting the bathroom door solved that problem. The hotel is in a great location. A block & a half from central Time Square perfect for walking. I would definitely come back to this hotel.

We recently stayed at the Cassa Hotel and couldn't fault the hotel in any aspect. Ultimately we were only in the room to sleep as we were out and about most of the day and night however the hotel was ideal. The staff were very welcoming and were always happy to help. Each day we returned the rooms were cleaned and tidied to a very high standard. One day we were left bottled water which was nice (would be good to get that every day) however there is a Pret Mangier next door which is useful.Location wise the hotel is ideal. Close to Times Square but far enough away not to be right on top of it.A very pleasant stay and would certainly recommend.

Last minute booking success! Tasha was excellent - checked us in no sweat and gave us all the info we needed. Extremely friendly and helpful. Room is well appointed and spacious for the price and location- can I take the shower home with me?!

Had the King Executive room at a great price due to good timing. Evita and Nijar at the front desk were kind, courteous, and swift with their service. I was able to check-in four hours earlier and the room was already spotless, ready-to-go. Spacious and cozy. It's a great place to stay, and great location, too.

Gorgeous room, friendly staff (Nivar and Evita especially!), and great amenities. Great way to be right in the middle of everything while on vacation. We were in town early and they offered us early check-in, which was a great boon for a couple of folks who needed a place to drop off their bags.

We’ve stayed at Cassa 45 twice and we had a great experience both times! Excellent service, the staff is super friendly and helpful, especially Stephanie L and Adam! Rooms are clean. Best location! Overall, enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend!

Check in was easy. I went right to my room that was spacious (for a NY hotel). They turned the mini bar into a mini fridge (thank you for that!), and the closet was small, but it had really cool soft closing shoe drawers and a safe inside. The internet was fast, and they had Direct TV on the flat screen.  The shower has a glass door that closes, a rain shower and handheld wand. LOVE those! They had the big bottles of shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, and hand soap.  If there was an adjoining room, unfortunately you can hear whatever was going on in the next room. There is daily housekeeping, but if you prefer privacy, make sure your “do not disturb” sign is clearly displayed. The comfort and location is what did it for me. It’s just a block away from Times Square.  This was a comfy, convenient, walkable hotel. And I look forward to staying here again.

First time visiting this hotel, great experience! The room was clean and the staff at the front desk were friendly, especially Stephane and Adam! The restaurant they have in the location is also delicious! You guys should definitely check in

Had such a great time at this hotel. The rooms were so clean and the beds are super comfortable!Stephanie and Adam greeted us at the front desk and made our stay 10 times better. 10/10 would recommend, will definitely come back again

Amazing hotel, great location. Our room was lovely and clean, very comfortable bed, bathroom very nice and modern. Hotel staff was very professional and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble.Would definitely stay again.

Great spot in midtown; highly recommend for business and leisure. Comfortable clean rooms and polite staff. The fast elevator is a plus. Close to transit and pubs. Check out Astros for breakfast 5 min walk up 6th ave on the way to central park, or get coffee and a bagel at the shop next door.

Always staying in this Hotel when being in New York! Super central location and cozy Hotel! Also love the Spirit of the employees, always in a Good Mood, super friendly and lovely! Special thanks to Stephanie L., Evita, Adam and Kiefer for everything!

Close enough to Times Square but not too close that you feel trapped in the mayhem. Hotel very clean. We had a room with 2 king beds and the room was huge for the 3 of us - really impressive. Reception staff always on hand and approachable. I have tried to book again for this year but rather expensive. Would def stay again and i stayed with my mum and a friend. We all loved it. Starbucks at the end of the road!! Bonus

Was in town to see a show and visit my son, so I wanted a reasonably-priced hotel near the theatre district. The hotel was about a 15-minute walk from the theatre and about the same from Central Park. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and the manager even called to say I'd left my iPad in the room after I checked out. Fortunately, I hadn't left NYC let. The bed was comfortable, the pillows were pretty good, and the room was quiet. I also like that they don't use those small shampoo bottles, which tend to be wasteful. Instead, they use larger ones which, I guess, they refill as needed. Much more environmentally wise.

We had an outstanding stay! Hotel is stunning, updated and chic - the staff is amazing, helpful and accommodating We will most certainley come back and stay at the Cassa. Thank you Kiefer, Ruth and Novar!

Although I booked two nights at Cassa, I decided on a whim to stay an extra day. The staff was accommodating of my request for a bathtub for my initial booking, and then Jonathan was very helpful in making sure I got to keep my room and made sure checkin/out was painless. Thank you for making my stay easy and stress-free!

friendly knowledgeable staff, very pleasant to deal with it. Location of the hotel is amazing, two blocks from time square, near lots of things! Hotel was clean and comfortable, wish the view as better but there is a deck on the 10th floor that is nice to sit at!

Our last visit to this tired hotel that has sadly gone done hill over 3 years. Been staying here every year for 7 years last year we said we would nt stay again because it had really gone downhill from previous stays , but staff are fabulous and assured us things would get better as it had changed hands. Arrived 8 th December and the amazing Christmas tree was not there in fact 2 tacky £1 Christmas decs was all the foyer had. Rooms are really out dated now no more robes and slippers , 2 coffee creamers per day no coffee available in the morning No more hot chocolateof an evening. No we’re to sit whilst waiting for car to take you too airport as they now rent out the lounge . Used to be our favourite hotel but it’s on a slippery slope despite changing hands 3 times in 2 years. All that remains of this once fab hotel are the lovely door men

This hotel is located in a good location and its staff are friendly. There is water on the ground floor so I can go out every morning after drinking water. It's good to go to Times Square on foot. There are many restaurants nearby.

My room at Cassa Hotel was small but well appointed, with a very comfy bed, Keurig and bottled water, free wifi, an amazing shower, and a potent hair dryer. I was in a corner room on the 26th floor and had no trouble with noise from the street or otherwise. I also received a kind and warm welcome when I checked in. Do be aware that hallways are a bit dated, I had quite a wait for the elevators, and the temp in my room was a bit too hot (and I couldn't adjust it). I'd stay at Cassa again though!

We stayed here for a few nights with our daughter, she was in a pull out bed in our room. The staff were fantastic, so helpful, friendly & really made our stay. Great location, good size rooms & all clean & well equipped. We’d stay here again for definite.

At the last minute, we decided to go to a Broadway show. While we could easily do as a day trip, we decided to see if we could get a hotel deal. Given we went after the holiday rush, we scored an amazing deal at this hotel. The front desk was very friendly, the room was clean and bigger than other reviews led us to believe and the rainfall shower was great. The location is less than 10 mins to Times Square and there are plenty of decent restaurants and cocktails bars for pre and post theater. Also just ten minutes from St. Pat’s if you are looking to attend Sunday mass. We would return to this hotel for another quick getaway weekend.

Stephanie Apunte was really kind and answered all of our questions. She was very nice! I liked the hotel too, great facilities and comfortable rooms! They’re all very clean and it is at a great location!

I booked the Cassa Hotel NY as a present for me and my new Wife as a wedding present. I checked a few reviews and looking on a map I thought it looked in a fairly good position, I wasn’t disappointed !! The Hotel is in a perfect location and we could get anywhere with ease. We didn’t want to go in all day for the ball drop on New Year but obviously wanted to see it if possible. We managed to see it from 42nd st after going to a fantastic restaurant “Benjamin’s” recommended by Johnathan at the hotel he was fantastic and did all the reservation for us. All the staff were friendly and helpful but I would really say that Johnathan went that extra mile.The room was clean and a fair size for New York. (Not much wardrobe space but wasn’t really expecting much) Overall I would 100% stay here again and would recommend for anyone that wants to be right in the centre of New York but still have a quite clean room this is the place to be!

We stayed with a baby girl at the hotel during the Christmas season. We are in three different rooms. Everything we needed. The bed is very comfortable as well, the queen and king are the same size so do not have to book the king. Cold water is available 24 hours at reception. Quiet rooms and no noise from other rooms. Always hot water in the shower. Shampoo, conditioner and body lotion are great and high quality available in the rooms. The bad things: We had to go through a room three times! The first room didn't look at all like the picture, very cramped and small so we couldn't open the shower door because it was locked in a bed. In general, a poorly designed (high-rise king room) smelled badly in a room of suffocation and dust, no bedside table as it appears on the website, and the terrible noise of the shower opening the warm water. Second night we were transferred to Queen's room, although we paid for King because there were no other rooms and we did not get a refund.And we were not compensated for a room upgrade... There was a bath in the room which is nice, the room was better organized, the problem was that in the room there was an unbearable tractor coming out of the water heating the whole building and it didn't stop, the noise was so loud that our baby couldn't sleep at night and cried a lot. In the morning, we were completely exhausted, moved us to another room of accessibility. He was on the 14th floor and we were very pleased, he looked more modern with a good smell, clean and well organized. As we expected from the beginning.Have a portable shower room that is not self-evident from America, which is great for those who come with children or just prefer. Too bad they don't have breakfast, even as small as coffee and curasson, it could add to the hotel

The stuff are very welcome, always with smile andWith full of helpful. Special the guy who checked us when we did arrive, and the lady who gave us the best room when we asked for change the room, and NIVAR how was in front desk when we checked out .Obviously the others stuff did and doing the bestto help for everything.We have the best room, quite and clean.Excellent place in the city.

good location nice place nice service at receptio with Tenzin, Kiefer and Stephanie, L. Accesible to all tha places we want to go. We don't use the services of the hotel so I can't give a review of that, but if I have to stay there I do it again

We knew what to expect and like to stay at Cassa. You cannot beat the location - it’s one of reasons we choose it. The rooms are very clean and the bed is comfortable (and I sleep on a $9K SleepIQ at home). We in stayed king bed room 1201 this visit and it was quiet at night with nice darkening drapes to keep morning sunshine out. It’s nice size by NYC standard. We had room to lay 2 suitcases on floor. Frig & safe are in room. Would definitely stay with Cassa again.

We won’t stay here again. Not sure if we were penalized by booking through hotels.com or this hotel is just a second rate joint with sub-par rooms. Our room was a joke. The bathroom door couldn’t open all the way because it would hit the left side of the bed. Yes, that small! There was no closet, just a tall box with hangars which partially blocked TV viewing from the bed. It wouldn’t stay closed so we had to use a suitcase as a barricade to keep it shut. I couldn’t hang my suit properly because the hangars weren’t high enough anyway.And next to the bed on the right, blocking one of the two windows was a crooked mirror whose only purpose seemed to be to block me from getting to the bathroom in the middle of the night. The tiny room was transformed into an obstacle course. No end table on the right side of the bed as there’s no room. While a bit hard and lumpy in spots the actual bed was decent.The bathroom brought its own drama. Sometimes hot water would come out of the cold water tap in the sink. While we could get used to that, the “bath” towels (which were really slightly larger than hand towels) were cheap skimpy and rough. No bathrobes were available. We just had to stop and laugh. The staff were kind and somewhat attentive. No complaints there. Bottom line, there must be a hundred hotels in this price range in Manhattan to try.We won’t even get into the tiny lobby with suitcases askew and the elevators which take forever to arrive or the restaurant which may, or may not be open for breakfast or lunch.....

This was by far the worst experience I have ever had at a hotel. On the first day of my stay, I noticed the hot water was not working in my room. After the hotel failed to fix the problem, they moved me to another room. However, they did not give me a key to the second room as their system was down. They assured me I'd have a key within a few hours, but the following morning, I still had no key. That afternoon, they moved me to a third room, but did not move any of my belongings to the third room. After waiting in my empty room for 45 minutes, they decided to move me back to the second room with no explanation for wasting my time. It appears from the other reviews that the water issue is an ongoing problem. To top it off, the customer services was poor and staff was disinterested it trying to make it right. After talking with several people, I was finally promised one night compensated, but I still have not received my credit. I will never stay here again.

I want to give a special thank you to Mr Tenzin for making our check-in process exceptional. He accommodates our early arrival with friendliness and professionalism. It was much appreciated after such early morning travel.The rooms are small, but clean and efficient. The fact that Butter restaurant is in the lobby does not hurt!We are just here for 1 night to see a show, and would for sure stay again.

Tenzin is the man, he checked us in quickly and was very friendly. Hotel suit is very roomy with a little perfect size living room and big bathroom. Additional staff left waters and two candy's which was nice. I highly recommend this place. Thank you Cassa and Tenzin.

The hotel is in an excellent location, Most of the hot spots are within 15 minutes walk (Times Square, Empire State Building, Central Park, Broadway etc) Good service. The rooms and infrastructure are a bit outdated.

This was honestly the worst experience I've ever had at a hotel and considering the room was $700 a night, it was inexcusable. To keep it short and sweet with just the major offenses, we came back from dinner after midnight and our door wouldn't open. So up and down the elevator we went as they assumed we didn't know how to open a door. Our door wouldn't open and all of our things were inside so after an hour of waiting in the dismal lobby as they tried to open our door at 1:30 am they finally said they couldn't open it and would put us in an upgraded room but it was not an upgraded room it was actually a smaller room for wheelchair bound guests and obviously was a significant downgrade from the larger room we had paid for. We had to go to Duane Reade in the middle of the night to buy a few supplies like cheap t shirts to sleep in. (They didn't seem to think being locked out of your room all night was much of an issue.)In the morning the hotel ran out of hot water while I was in the shower and then all water stopped. We had to call and go to the desk multiple times to push them to get our original room door open. It took hours and they offered us nothing. We finally got one person to say we didn't have to pay for the night we didn't have our room and the manager was obviously annoyed that the person made us this offer. Gee thanks.We decided to change hotels. The staff was disinterested and the elevator floors were very dirty. It was an all around bad experience. There are so many better hotels for the same price. Seriously, don't stay here.

I’m not say I was very impressed with the Cassa hotel. I would definitely come back the staff was so accommodating we were on the 21st floor shuffled everything you don’t really have to take any vehicle or Uber anywhere your two blocks up from Times Square two blocks up from New York Central Park and basically you can walk anywhere from this hotel. I would definitely come back with my daughter to experience her Turning 21 this is a place that I would come back again. Especially want to thank Nivar He was able to take care of me and my significant other by ordering a limo and private service to the airport thank you so much for taking care of us and ensuring that we had a Pleasant stay with the hotel.

Perfect location, size and service. A must if you need and excellent, no nonsense hotel right in Times Square. Staff was corteous. I stress that the location was right on target. Plenty of restaurants and bars nearby for winding down after a long day's walk.

My family of three recent stayed at the Cassa Hotel and loved it. We came to NYC for the parade and this hotel was perfect. Literally right of the parade route. We had the best spot. The room was great as well. It was clean and enough space for the 3 of us. My daughter loved the shower. All staff was super friendly and helpful. We look forward to staying here again.

Cassa Hotel was part of our dream um NY. The hotel is amazing. The location is great, you can walk everywhere. Only 2 blocks from Times Square!! The room is excellent, super clean, everything is new and working. The bathroom is also really good, even the shampoo they offer is great. The staff was also really friendly and efficient. I just loved this hotel!!

We had a great experience during our stay! Tenzint Kiefer accommodated a last minute change and was so easy to work with making sure we were very comfortable and made special arrangements. We recommend going straight to Tenzint!

Unbelievable , Fantastic HotelStayed at the Cassa Hotel 20th -25th November family of 4. As soon as you walk through the door you are made to feel welcome at this hotel. All the Cassa Staff were friendly, polite, and very professional. Rooms very clean and well equipped with all the amenities you would need, even the coffee maker with tea, coffee, decaf etc., bedrooms clean, beds very comfy, even the sofa bed was very comfortable to sleep on. Bathroom spotless with a huge walk in shower. Overall the hotel is very Immaculate and its central to all attractions. I cannot fault this hotel in any way. We will definitely be back.

Appreciated Stephanie's help at the front desk. She was extremely patient when answering my million questions since it was my first time in the big apple. Good location- close to time square. Not the best view.

We travelled to New York for a family wedding. We booked through booking.com who let us down at the last minute. They wanted us to move hotels and when we refused they wanted to charge us double. The manager at the Cassa hotel fixed everything for us. The hotel's location is fantastic. Right in the centre of everything. The room we had (2 doubles) was big for Manhattan. The bathroom was great. Really modern with a huge walk in shower. The hotel ia also immaculate. Even though we were in the centre of everything it was very quiet in the room. The staff were so friendly too and were super nice to my two young sons. I cannot fault this hotel in any way. We will definitely be back.

Honestly there were quite a few issues with the heat in my room but the staff was very accommodating. The room sizes are decent for the location and the price matched the general area. Thanks to Stephanie and Adam for the laughs and welcome.

We stayed for four nights and had a wonderful time. The staff (all of them, but especially Nivar and Stephanie) went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable, especially my elderly mother. The room was super comfy and the beds were great. Thank you!

Hotel staff friendly and helpful. Great location to lots of attractions. Our room was cleaned regularly to a good standard. Main bedroom a little dated. Bathroom was modern and spacious. Would highly recommend a stay.

Arrived after a long drive from JFK, had a pleasant greeting from Jonathon who promptly checked us in. The room was very spacious with two double beds and a decent sized bathroom. We found the beds and pillows very comfy and enjoyed a lovely nights sleep. Went out to explore next day and found we were really close to Times Square. Late Saturday night we noticed we didn’t have any running water, thought it was a minor problem, turned out the whole hotel was without water ... and when I spoke to the front desk it was suggested we could stay at hotel or move to another. this is where the fun began. We packed all our stuff without having a shower etc. I managed to get a hotel a few blocks away, we arrived in reception to see an oriental woman at a computer who totally blanked us, (rather rude). I asked how far this other hotel was and all the guy said was between 8th and 9th Avenue......and....We are two women in our sixties and didn’t relish lugging cases etc, I asked if they could get us a cab, he just repeated how far it was grrr. Once outside a taxi was hailed and the bloody driver had no interest whatsoever in taking us there I was livid. The no water situation was NOT our fault, we were offered no help at all. Either finding an other hotel or how to get there, was very unhelpful, not a great way to treat your guests. By all means stay there but don’t expect any support if anything goes wrong.

We were greeted by very friendly staff when we arrived who made us feel comfortable and were genuinely interested in why we had come to New York and where we are from. We were upgraded to a suite free of charge which was a great surprise. The room itself was very clean and well presented with complementary water bottles and coffee (for a coffee machine) in the room which were replaced every day. The bathroom was spotless with a very nice bath and strong shower. When we came back to the hotel our room was cleaned very well and they even laid out our toiletries neatly by the sink, separated for myself and my partner which was a nice touch. Checkout was very quick and easy, as was leaving our baggage to explore the city before we left.Location wise, the hotel is perfect. It is a few minutes walk from Times Square and a subway station, with everything you need nearby. As it is in such a busy area, it also feels safe to walk nearby late in the evening.We would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York.

Cassa is located in a very central position, within walking distance to Central Park and Empire Stat Building etc.However, the hotel itself is not that pleasant a place to stay. The bed is uncomfortable, and there is no facility for making a cup of coffee. There was a tea making machine, but no coffee. The hotel itself was a bit grotty, that’s includes the room.

My Girlfriend and I stayed in Cassa over the Halloween week. The staff were on the front desk 24 hours to help. Which came especially in use when we could not sleep for running water outside our room at 3:00am. Stephanie on the front desk was only too happy to help use once we had identified the issue, she moved us immediately to a room where we could get some sleep and then moved us completely to that room in the morning once we had recovered! Thank you Stephanie! We were very happy with our stay. The hotel was positioned suitably in walking distance to multiple major tourist spots! I suspect we'll be back in future!

Great location. Close to Whole Foods ( Bryant park ) , and Times Square . Nivar ( front desk guy ), helped me a lot to find everything and Adam too . You have to check out at noon , but they’re are not annoying for the check out time .

We have just returned, we had a great time. The room was fine, we had a Kuerig coffee machine which was lovely. The bathroom was lovely and that shower. The toiletries where good as my daughter has sensitive skin and she was fine using them. It is in an excellent location. The staff where helpful. Also they have a car service, which is a flat rate. We used this for our taxi to airport. Excellent service. Also they had scales to weigh your luggage.

One of the best stays in New York City. We Booked last minute plans for hotel and EVITA at the front desk could not have be nicer. She got us an upgrade at check in. Everyone was very accommodating in every aspect. Thank you NIVAR,ADAM,AND BRYAN. hotel was extremely clean and close to the park. Definitely staying here again.

I stayed at the Cassa Hotel in October 25th, Stephanie A couldn’t have been more helpful and genuine. After a long day of traveling Stephanie greeted us with a pleasant face and was more than glad to assist with all of my questions. In addition, the rooms were clean and a good size. I’ll definitely be back to stay and hopefully Stephanie A will be there again to help me.

Me and my familly (wife and three children wich are 15, 13 and 8 yrs old) just returned home from our NYC trip and we still can't forget the great time we had. Many thanks goes for our vacation succes goes to the Cassa hotel with the best location there is. Sure there are some better but for the value not by a long mile. The staff was super nice and professional, no matter who was at the front desk. Even the maid who we met once was frindly and met all our wishes. Room was clean and well equipped with all the amenities you would need. Even the coffe maker with tee, coffe, decaf etc. Communication, reservation and payment was no hustle whatsoever. Shower in the room was spacious with great watter preassure. Hairdryer, iron and tv are in the room. TV has an abundance of tv channels to choose from. There is a gym in the building but we did not use it. There is a restaurant Buter in the building. Elevators are fast. Time sqare is 5 minutes away 5th awenue even closer (NBA shop and many many others). Empire state building and all others uper Manhattan attractions are in walking distance, even Central park if you are fit (30min), and there is a lot to see on the way too. Long story short... Two thumbs and both toes up for the Cassa hotel on 45th.

Stayed here for a few nights with friends and family, ideal location for anything you want to do in New York, right near a subway. Hotel was lovely and the staff really made it - Stephanie and Adam especially. They helped with everything, provided impeccable service and really brightened up our day, gave us candy too!! Definitely stay here and hope you get to meet them too!

We had a great stay in Cassa Hotel! Provided everything we needed for the trip. Adam and Stephanie were particularly helpful, made us feel really welcome and answered all our questions. Thank you guys!

I recommend the Cassa Hotel very highly. Without exception the staff are truly exceptional! Excellent, well priced, hotel in the perfect mid-town location. No shortcomings... none!Thank you for contributing so much to our enjoyment of 6 days in New York.Stay here if you can.

Stayed here for 4 nights with my partner, it was our first ever trip to New York and has been our dream holiday for years. The hotel staff were friendly and the room was nice and clean. Don't see why people are complaining that the rooms are too small, seemed like a standard nice room that you get in most hotels in my opinion, wasn't expecting Caesars Palace. This hotel is in a perfect location in Manhattan, very close to Times Square and a short walk to popular attractions such as the Rockefeller, Empire State building and Grand Central Terminal. It is also near many subway stations which made it very easy to travel around Manhattan. There are also a lot of restaurants and pubs around the area, big fan of the food even American Mcdonalds is better than England's. Overall though it was an amazing trip, hotel was lovely and to top it off I proposed to my girlfriend at the top of the rock and she said yes!

I already wrote my review with 3 starts, and I said that its nothing special, but after discovering that I was overcharged 60 something bucks I'm changing it to 1. Anyways, after discovering this mistake I wrote couple emails with my reservation confirmation enclosed and they were IGNORED! You are the first hotel that just IGNORES YOUR CUSTOMERS! is this high level of service you were talking about answering in my first review?) I guess so..then I called to you directly and was recommended to write another e-mail‍♀️ whatever, I called couple more times, and finally some lady at front desk told me that it was mistake due to overnight audit, I was ok as long as you fix it, and I wanted to get my receipt, to avoid any misunderstanding in future. Guess what: money's on my account, but I never got my receipt even though, I confirmed my email address with front desk agent. WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!

Very nice and comfortable room, the bathroom was a very pleasant surprise, and the location was perfect. We even enjoyed some of the Brazilian festivities during that weekend. I certainly recommend it. The front-desk people were awesome too.

Me and my boyfriend absolutely loved our stay here! The room was amazing and the customer service was even better. A very huge special thank you to Stephanie Lang at the front desk, she definitely made the stay worth wild. Her friendly attitude and helpfulness made our stay so much more comfortable.Great Experience!!

Stephanie, Adam, and Brian were so nice at check in! Super fast check in, excellent service! The room was very clean and bigger than I was expecting for a room in the city. Bathroom was big enough for two people to be in at the same time!

We didn't have really high expectations for this place as the price was lower than your typical NYC hotel- it was during Christmas week and the area was buzzing because the location is not far from the tree on 50th. Parking was hard to get to (as the area is all one way streets) and roads were closed because of the New Years Crowd...but it is a home base, and in an not-horrible area. This is not a five star hotel... so set your expectations accordingly. It is like a super 8 in the middle of a city.... which again, is, most of the time, good-enough.

Stephanie L and Adam were awesome with my check in... very welcoming, and it was a pleasurable and seamless experience getting settled ...Arrived earlier than scheduled heck in time and they did everything to make sure I was comfy while I waited and got me something as quick as possible make sure I ask for either of them on ur next visit

The location of the hotel is great-close to Times Square, Grand Central Station, Bryant Park, Rockefeller Center, subway, etc. The hotel itself is good. Rooms are acceptable and clean. The staff, most times, didn't acknowledge us as we walked in or out. They weren't rude or unfriendly, just not interested or welcoming. Nothing really bad, nothing really exceptional about the hotel.

Our family just returned from a really pleasant stay at this little boutique hotel in New York, New York. It is extremely well located with many sites in walking distance - especially Times Square (and just why is it square?). The two people who greeted us, Stephanie and Kiefer (family friend is Kiefer Sutherland) were extremely pleasant and helpful. The rooms were spare, but the pillows were really large and soft; and a large lg tv. If you are looking for a hotel with all the amenities - heated toilet seat; massive rooms; and travertine throughout, you will be disappointed. But I can stand only so much marble and be jealous that the bathrooms are nicer than the ones I have at home. Showers are really nice. Rooms really clean (we had to have four for our family, as we were attending a funeral).. Discounted parking. Subways nearby. If you are driving as we were, it is really tough to find - it is at the end of the block on the left side. Overall, we were fine and had a good time.

Cassa Hotel was a great place for our stay in NYC! The staff was very helpful and attentive. We had a plumbing issue and were able to change rooms with ease. They offered advice, transport to the airport and always greeting us with a smile. We were on the 17th floor and elevator was quick and we rarely saw other guests in a sold out hotel. Location was excellent for us and the theatre district.

We just spent a three night long weekend in New York and stayed in this hotel. We found the check in to be very friendly and received a great recommendation for dinner. We had a small problem with the room assigned but it was fixed quickly. Other reviews talk about noise - we did not find it noisy. It is NY - there was some street noise, but not anymore than other hotels I have stayed at in big cities. The location is fantastic. Short walk to Times Square. We walked to our two Broadway Plays (one was 15 minutes and one was 7 or 8 minutes). Rockefeller Plaza, Radio City Music Hall are all very close as well. Also walked to Central Park (a longer walk but very pleasant). Within a 10 min walk there are dozens of good restaurants. The room was clean and well serviced by housekeeping over our stay. Would recommend.

ok.. so i just got an email from the hotel i set up my ny trip for... saying my booking was canceled ... there was an issue with my card.... (amex) i went on to the amex site.. and it is down so I don't know the issue... so.. within 10 minutes of getting the email i called the hotel and said i will give you a different card... they had already given my room away... uh... WTF.. my reservation was for the next day. needless to say... I have no review to give you...I am a bit disappointed in the hotel...and find it hard to believe that within a 10 minute window my $500 a night room was given away. ok.. $518 a night....I did find another hotel not far... very nice (and will do that review once I stay there). this is one hotel that I will not revisit ... which is a shame.. I was looking forward to it.

Upon arrival we were greeted by two receptionists and began the checking in process only to be told we didn’t have a room as we had apparently cancelled our reservation!! The room we required was a standard double room. This was not a great start to our week away as this made myself and my boyfriend very upset as we were told there were no other rooms available so this meant we had no place to stay! The receptionist recommended we stay elsewhere for one night and then return to Cassa for the rest of the week when rooms became available!However according to our records and confirmation emails with booking.com it was clear we had not cancelled this room reservation so we stood our ground and worked with the receptionist to find our reservation. The issue was eventually resolved when the receptionist told us there was a separate reservation under the same name that was still active and once we had confirmed the booking reference numbers we were shown to our room. There was much confusion over what was nothing really and made our arrival very stressful which was not what we needed after a long flight.The room was clean, modern and tidy! The air conditioning was noisy but nothing too drastic! The bathroom was the highlight of the room in my opinion! It was very spacious, with a walk in shower and a little desk with a mirror and chair where I could sit and do my hair and makeup.The bar area was modern and comfortable to enjoy a quiet drink in the evening.All in all the hotel is nice and in a perfect location with Times Square and Subway stations just minutes away! Apart from the hiccup at the beginning of our stay we had no issues with this hotel at all!

This was our first trip to New York, check in was easy and a free upgrade was given to us on arrival by Stephanie. As it was our first time in nyc we had many questions and Stephanie was very happy to help us on our way. Most mornings when we left for the day we had questions regarding travelling on the subway and directions and all the staff were so helpful and took the time to show us where to go. The rooms are more than adequate for travel, beds are large and comfy and the shower was very nice with full size luxury shampoo and conditioner. The room itself was very clean with a big tv and good facilities. As there is so much to do in nyc we only actually came back to the hotel late at night and left early in the morning. There is no street noise when you are inside the room which is surprising due to the central location! Overall we really enjoyed our stay, the staff were really helpful and the rooms very satisfactory.

I visited the hotel with my family during the summer. The location is very good and the interiors and amenities work well. But we will never come back to this place. The front desk and general manager attitude on helping us solve a reservation issue was really terrible. On the online reservation they accepted the size of our family (5). But that was not the case when we arrived. The general manager seemed to be angry and not willing to find a solution. He yelled at me and used violent words. We ended up taking 2 rooms and promising our selves never to go back to Cassa Hotel NY.

I’m a frequent traveler and had to come to NYC during UN week. Hotels were sparse and expensive. Found a room at Cassa Hotel that looked good. Check-in was pleasant and the room small, but clean and functional. Nothing exceptional, but OK. After about 30 mins in my room, the compressor to the A/C unit kicked in and was incredibly noisy. The room was pretty much vibrating. I called the front desk and they would send an engineer. 1.5 hrs later, still no engineer. I left for a meeting and told front desk no one had showed up. They apologized and said they would send someone. I returned at 10 PM and it had still not been fixed. I called again and this time they sent someone who said it couldn’t be fixed. I called the front desk, again. This time I was told there was nothing they could do, they had no other rooms, but they could refund the money and I could go find another hotel. At 10.30 PM during UN week. Thanks! At 10.45 two engineers showed up and jointly tried to fix it. It wasn’t fixable so the solution was to put the thermostat at a level where the A/C didn’t kick-in. Additionally the deadbolt didn’t work on the door and they couldn’t fix that either. It was a hot and somewhat disconcerting night.

Cassa hotel is well positioned on 45th street .You will be greeted by friendly staff on arrival, Tenzin and other staff members were always very helpful .The Rooms were a good size ,and bathroom was very nice .Had a great shower and room was very clean ,We shared a double room with my teenage boys thumbs up .Cassa hotel is only a short stroll to Times Square (3 min walk) .From that point you can get the hop on hop off bus .but the advantage of that is you start your bus trip at stop 1 . Hotel was in between 5th & 6th ave. You can’t get any better value for money @ Service basically you get bang for your buck here . We will definitely stay again .

I was really really worried about booking this hotel because of all the bad reviews that state the hotel cancelled their booking due to the price being too low on booking.com.I booked through booking.com anyway as the offer was too good to be true and got an absolute bargain for 4 nights. Right up until the day of flying I was constantly checking my emails to ensure they hadn't canceled my room and even during the flight I thought what happens if we get there and they've cancelled it.Well, they didn't cancel it and we had a great stay.The rooms are basic, there was no kettle or fridge, no tea or coffee. The rooms are clean and the guys at reception are friendly.This hotel is perfect location to Times Square, it is literally a 5 minute walk. I can't complain about anything because like they say you get what you pay for and this hotel was a steal compared to all the others!Thank you Cassa. :)

Stayed here for a week for work and was hoping it would be a nice, comfortable. The hotel needs to be renovated. I opened one of the cupboards and the wood is cracked and possibly rotting. I got to my room and I checked out the fridge hoping to get some food to put in there. I found old blackberries! I also got my room cleaned one of the days and while they replaced the k-cup for coffee- they didn’t provide new cups to drink out of.

Read some reviews before coming and wasn’t too sure what to expect. The hotel is spot on. Right bang in the mix. 2 blocks from Times Square and two blocks from a subway station. The rooms are exactly what you need. Comfy bed, tv, fridge and nice and clean. We were on the 7th floor. Never waited once for the lift. Staff friendly and helpful. Always someone at reception to help you. Couldn’t fault it. I’ll be back!!

Cassa is truly an amazing hotel and located at the very center of New York City. The rooms were nice & clean but most importantly I loved how welcoming and professional the reception was. Specifically Stephanie, she hasn’t only checked us in but was always available and ready to help us in anything we needed. She really put the customers first and went out of her way to facilitate us as much as possible. #StephAsManager !!!!!

I was in NYC for one night, decided oaths hotel due to the location and promotional price of $250 for the night which was pretty good. I was disappointed that the KING room I had reserved was not available and was put in a Queen or Full. They did "upgrade" me to a suite, the suite consisted of a small living area and bathroom through a connecting door which I did not discover until the end of the stay almost. I was wondering what upgrade they were talking about since the bedroom part go the room was tiny. The bathrooms wee clean and bright, however the bed had two to three long hairs, maybe from when it was made. I was supposed to have received $30 off my rate but never did. This is a boutique hotel, don't expect large hotel chain service when it comes down to you not being content with the service. This hotel is not worth a penny over what I paid. Do not book it unless it's a good rate under 250.

We just came back from NY, where we had special weekend for ourselves (wedding anniversary), that is conveniently happens to be during long weekend in the US. We're super happy and excited! It's not the first visit to the city, but this hotel was the worst from all we've stayed before. I've wrote in advance about our special occasion and received kind response from the hotel,so we got room on 7th floor, but unfortunately we could not enjoy the view, because windows were SOSOSOSO dirty!also you can hear the elevator every time it arrives or departs from the floor, so we didnt have particularly good sleep there eather. During check in time front desk agent mentioned some amenities they was going to send to our room, which we never got. It was kind of disappointment, if you don't want to do anything special for your guests, just dont mention it then. Also, I noticed that you don't offer early check ins, which is very weird, all another hotels we've been will find you room earlier check in time, so you dont need to wait in lobby for hours like your guests did. That runs me to conclusion, that you don't care that much about your guests. All in all our experience was "nothing special", website looks promising and makes you expect something special, which this hotel is definitely not, for sure.

They stole money from my credit card and refuse to reimburse it. Have never experienced such bad customer service, guess they just don't care but what you are doing is called STEALING. Too bad I have to leave such a bad review because the location is great, but I will just refuse to shut up and pretend as nothing has happened. It is hard-earned money you stole from me!

Booked this hotel 7 months in advance for a weeks visit to nyc.Didn’t even get to stay-the hotel cancelled my booking without no warning-4 days before I was due to travel!  Without any communication, without any explanation. I emailed to ask the hotel about a left luggage area and was emailed back a “one liner” that my booking had been cancelled! After that they did not reply and refused to talk to me or booking.comDo not book this hotel!! If I had not happened to email the hotel then I would have arrived without a clue!

I believe that the positive of this hotel is that the location is great. However, the billing/customer service is very shady and I never write poor reviews about Hotels. I even do a fair amount of research to avoid bad places. Regardless, I found a good deal for this hotel as well as pretty decent reviews. The main problem behind the hotel is that these "deals" are not set in stone. First, they make you book online but they never charge your card in order to easily cancel you if they sell the hotel at full price. Then, they do not include many of the charges in your initial payment which highly inflates the cost when you get there. Then, they deceive you and ask for a card to cover "for any potential charges or damages" but this is the card that they will actually bill you with instead of the one you originally paid for. Everything is very deceitful and as a consequence they hire people in the front desk who are pretty shady characters.This isn't really a 3-star place. Its a good location, but that is it. The front desk is filled with shady characters and just poorly mannered staff. I had an issue with the billing, and was polite originally but the front desk person just started escalating in order to flare tempers. No professional approach at all, which is laughable and represents a type of mentality that truly questions how capable someone is that they cannot handle dealing with simple customer requests. Anyway, the front desk lied and said they couldn't reverse my card charges for 30 days out of pure pride because of looking ridiculous in front of other customers just by me pointing out the pointlessness of their policy (which wasn't a policy in the first place). In the future, I'd pick another hotel instead of one run out of shadiness. The location was good though, that was the big positive. And the bathrooms were pretty nice too.

Front desk lady Stephanie was so helpful and so gorgeous (could help but stare!). She made sure my stay was a awesome one. Also recommended me to the best places in city. This location is prime for walking to everything. Everything was clean and comfortable. I would return here!

Booked to stay here for a week via Booking.com, on a whim I emailed the hotel about something and got no reply (great start) after chasing via Facebook messenger for nearly 2 weeks someone finally replied and told me my booking had been cancelled. Well, this was news to me! The booking was still confirmed in my Booking.com account, and I hadn't received any correspondence since I booked in February. 6 MONTHS PRIOR! I spoke to someone at Booking.com who advised me that the hotel have said the prices on Booking.com are incorrect (not sure how that works as I know the hotels have to input their own prices?) and said the hotel wouldn't honour the price shown. The service I received from the hotel's sale coordinator, Nermine, was disgusting. They kept saying that it was Booking.com who had cancelled the stay and was nothing to do with them. Not quite sure how that's true as Booking.com was showing as confirmed. They also stopped replying when I asked if they would honour the booking. The worst part about this is they would have never of told me that the booking had been cancelled until I turned up if I had not contacted them beforehand about something else. This would have left two young women stranded in New York in the middle of the night. You can see from other reviews this is a common occurrence, funnily enough it happened to my friends parents when they'd booked a cruise package which included a few nights stay at the same hotel (only found this out once it happened to me). In a few of the posts below they have replied and stated that they would honour the price shown. This is a blatant lie. If you've booked to stay here I advise you try and contact them, if you're thinking about it I'd say don't bother!!

My mum and I stayed at the Cassa Hotel NY 45th street for just shy of three weeks this past July for the 5th time, and there is a reason we keep coming back. Not only are the rooms spacious (a rarity in the city!), the amenities modern compared to most hotels, but the staff are second to none - particularly the lovely Adam who is incredibly kind and goes above and beyond for guests! When you are staying in a place for this amount of time, you want your hotel to feel like home - Cassa truly makes you feel at home! The location is perfect for first time visitors to the city, or seasoned return visitors like ourselves, and honestly, there's no other hotel we'd prefer to stay at.

Coming from Paris, I had a wonderful stay in your hotel for my business travel. I only spent 3 nights it was very confortable and well located ! I will come back thank you so much for the warm welcoming

My wife and I just stayed 6 nights and had a wonderful trip. The accommodations were top notch with comfortable, quiet rooms in a nicely located hotel near dining, sights and theater. We would gladly stay again at this gem of a property with friendly staff and clean comfortable rooms.

I booked this hotel on booking.com months before going to New York City. I received an email 2 months later stating that I was charged the wrong price so my booking was being cancelled. I had read similar reviews to this before booking but didn’t think it would happen. It has and now I am without a hotel and all other hotels have increased in price leaving me in a difficult situation. I want to make people aware that this does happen so be careful if you are thinking of booking this hotel. Terrible customer service.

We stayed here overnight so that we could see a Broadway play. Tenzin who was at the front desk upgraded us to a junior suite and gave us breakfast vouchers for the restaurant Butter. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was clean and very spacious. Bed was comfortable and roomy. We had coffee in the room and a mini refrigerator. Would definitely return. This Hotel is in the heart of Manhattan. While we were there, a food fair was happening down the block. We were very close to our play a big plus. Also, the restaurant Butter was awesome. We had dinner there before the play. Great Place overall.

Location is great and the staff was very professional and cordial. Room was very clean and comfortable. Lemon water at the lobby was a plus to quench thirst. Will stay again for sure! Keep up the good work!

The hotel is really good, the location is perfect! It has really new rooms, with great bathrooms. The service couldn't be better. The locations couldn't be better as well, you will be close to Times Sq., the Rockefeller centre and the shops of 5th av. You could also walk a bit further to the Empire state building. I really recommended and for sure I will be back next time.

We stay in this lovely hotel as often as we can..the rooms are always well appointed, clean, and comfortable. The staff is outstanding! They are always smiling and willing to do whatever they can to make our stay satisfactory.

Perfectly located in the heart of Manhattan, where the city stays alive with Broadway shows, upscale dining, bars, clubs, and cultural street vendors that culminate in creating the ultimate vacation experience, is the amazing Casa Hotel. Its staff members are incredibly professional and caring. As a recently retired Army veteran, I wanted a vacation that would allow me, my wife, and our six-year-old daughter to explore new adventures and unwind in the most relaxing environment. Casa Hotel allowed us to do that. We enjoyed every second of our stay. The first impression of the Casa Hotel are the amazing staff members that consistently greeted us with heartwarming smiles and engaged us in mini conversations that ranged from our personal shared experiences, to recommendations of great vacation activities that are must dos for all tourists. The hotel manager, Mr. Henry, took pride in making sure that our hotel stay was the highlight of our New York experience, and it was. Its fitness facility located on the tenth floor offered us a breathtaking view of the city and has all the equipment needed for a great cardio workout followed by a weight training regimen. Our room was beautiful, with elegant décor, modern furniture and design, and was quite spacious. At the end of our daily excursions, we would return to our room that was immaculate, thanks to Miss Mery. During our stay, the city had a heat wave. The caring front desk staff members like Omar, Kiefer, and Stephanie made sure when leaving the hotel, we each received a cold bottle of water, to help us stay cool. Thanks to Omar, Kiefer, Stephanie, Mery, Mr. Henry, and all the staff at the Casa Hotel in Manhattan for a truly wonderful vacation experience

the bed is so low that it is like sleeping on the floor. the room was small, the bathroom ok. I don't recommend this hotel, despite its great location. the building is long and narrow, so there's not much lobby space either.
user_name:
Patricia R
Bantam, Connecticut, United States

review_body: This place has a lot going for it. I knew I was going to like it as soon as we arrived thanks to the staff who were super-friendly and super-helpful. We had a king room. The room had a small entry hall with the bed to the left and the bathroom to the right. The bed was comfortable. The room was spacious. And I loved the bathroom. The hotel is very close to Times Square but far enough away so you don't wake up to that craziness. The air conditioning is excellent and was much needed in July. It’s a shame the room didn’t have a fridge but I should have checked that out earlier. I noticed someone else titled their review “Nothing special.” I disagree. I can’t imagine what some people are expecting.

Hotwire rated it over 4 stars, not! upper Hyatt, Omni, etc is my ideal 4. So five stars is Ritz and up and like Four Seasons. Friendly staff, clean except for carpet as it needs replacing, the gym is dated.

My husband and I just spent 6 nights at the Cassa on 45th. The location is simply perfect... a few blocks from Times Square, Bryant Park and Rockefeller’s. We booked a king studio suite, lots of room (especially for New York City) and a large bathroom with two sinks and a tub and shower. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was awesome, even accommodated us with an early and late arrival. We have been to NYC over 50 times and have stayed in a lot of different hotels ... we will return to this one next time.

the location is great, there is everything just around the corner: starbucks two in a block from the hotel, mcdonalds one block from the hotel, convenient stores, pizza places, pubs etc...the hotel itself is ok, very good value for money. the bedroom is not big, but is ok for a couple. in the bedroom we got there was no space for an extra bed.

Huge shoutout for Tenzin and Kiefer at the front desk who were awesome hosts and were very knowledgable about the local area for recommendations. The hotel is well located for Times Square activities. If you dont mind smaller rooms, this is the best place to stay!

Good location. Walking distance to Times Square, three blocks away from Rocefeller Centre, again three blocks from New York Public Library. 24/7 desk. Very clean room and bathroom, but no coffee facilities in the room.

My wife and I came back to NYC for our second time and brought our 2 teenage daughters. My wife book through a 3rd party site. Amazing price, especially for the location. The front desk staff was some of the best and most professional people I have met in our travels. So courteous, helpful, and pleasant. We did not visit Butters, so we can’t speak for that, but our stay could not have been better. The 10th floor balcony/overlook was a favorite spot for us to enjoy breakfast. Thank you so much to the staff for making our girls’ first visit to New York so incredible.

Stayed at the Cassa for 3 nights with my wife and 10 year old son. The room was more than adequate. Initially we were surprised that, having stated clearly when we booked directly with the hotel that we wanted a room for 2 adults and one child, there was just one double bed. However, following a phone call to reception, a roll-away bed was brought up immediately which was fine for our son. The staff offered to move us to a bigger room the following day but we were happy to stay where we were. On our second night the AC wasn’t working, which made for an uncomfortable night. Here again, one mention to the reception staff and they arranged for the issue to be sorted out immediately. Unfortunately it was necessary for us to curtail our break because of a family matter at home - the hotel manager was most sympathetic and arranged for us to check out a day earlier than planned in our reservation, and he refunded the final night’s charge. The hotel is very well located for Times Square and Broadway etc - and also Bryant Park which is a real oasis in the heart of the city with a fantastic vibe. We loved it! Overall we had an enjoyable time at the Cassa and would stay here again when we next visit NY.

We, like some below, booked to stay here at the end of August but had our room cancelled becuase they could not honour the price. We complained to booking.com and direct with the hotel and neither were helpful. I notice one of the responses below says that the hotel will help directly...we found this to be untrue, after a week the hotel responded to our email to say ^speak to booking.com", Avoid this hotel if you want good service or even just a room.

I tried to stay at this hotel when in NY in May. Could not check me in as the system was down. Fair enough, but staff was apathic (and quite rude) and could only offer me to wait in the reception. Would not let me into my room and would not let me register my credit card whenever the system was back up. After waiting 10-15 minutes I tried to cancel my booking which they could not do because the manager was not there (which they consistently called "the leprechaun" for some reason). Overall poor service, rude and condescending staff. Stayed at Royalton instead - completely different experience

Stayed briefly in the residential section of the Cassa building in a NY summer. Located in a very convenient part of Mid Town with groceries, souvenirs, restaurants and entertainment all quite close to the building, and don’t forget the crowds.Our apartment, 28A, was in need of some desperate TLC. We found the layout of the apartment to be completely impractical. Tiny combined kitchenette, lounge and meals area with the television, an afterthought that made the whole room even more impractical.Compared to the adjoining vastly oversized bedroom with miniature en-suite , someone in the design team really stuffed up. . I don’t know how anyone could stay here for any length of time.This apartment desperately deserves new paint, blinds and flooring but more importantly than all of these basic amenities - the air conditioning doesn’t work properly! Can’t simply open all the windows in a modern hi-rise building. Even if you could, the city noise would prevent most human functions.Staff were lovely but this apartment really let the building down I only hope the hotel accommodation is better.

Rooms might be a bit larger than average NYC, but just a bit, and that doesn't say much. Horribly inadequate lighting to get work done, there's a box for a fridge but you'll find the actual appliance in the closet - still welcome and almost a must for me. Décor is modern melamine mixed with mid-century 'teak' and tufted leather - it's a look. The bed is comfortable (low, if that's an issue). Shower is decent, towels are not. There's a bag of nuts (nice) and two robes (superfluous - who hangs around in a closet sized room?). Lobby basically isn't and the desk clerks are preoccupied with their own perceived hipness. This was a well discounted stay, so priced about right: but at standard rates, sigh. Welcome to midtown.

Booked a room 4 months in advance on booking.com. 4 weeks before we were due to stay, Cassa hotel cancelled the room as they 'could not honour' the room rate which i booked. Outrageous. Called booking.com, it was the hotel who cancelled it, not the booking company. Obviously reselling the rooms to make more money. I wouldnt risk this hotel, you could very well be left without a room .

The stay in the Cassa Hotel was great. The location is unbeatable, right at Times Square but far enough to be quiet. The staff is super friendly and does make your stay a memorable experience.We will come back.

I would not be so harsh if this hotel didn't bill itself as a four star property. THere is nothing four star about this totally charmless, rather sad hotel. Despite its proximity to Times Square, the rooms are generic, the lobby devoid of personality, the reception sloppy. Think three steps below a Hilton Garden Inn. No mini bar, no room service, no coffee in the room. In other words, a two star hotel that sells itself as four. For the price, totally, totally not worth it. The only saving grace is the restaurant, Butter.
user_name:
Mimiviajera
Key Biscayne, Florida, United States

review_body: I booked a room in February in this hotel, FOUR MONTHS in advance of my stay through a holiday provider.A MONTH before my holiday, this hotel told the holiday provider they were not agreeing with the prices they had fixed. And so, they decided to cancel a bunch of reservations. Just when prices are rocketing every day.I never had to write a review before using the service in Tripadvisor, but since it looks this situation is not the first that happens, I prefer to warn any prospective customer about the way they work and their 'policy' to communicate customers about cancellations.You have lost a customer even before I had the chance to stay in your hotel.

Hotel is inna great location, very close to Time Square. Big rooms, clean and nice designed. Staff are professional and very pleasant. Coffee machine and water in lobby for free. Recommended al in all.

The Cassa on 45th has been so accomodating and comfortable. Comfy bed, big shower and clean. That being said, it has been primarily the staff that has put that golden touch on the stay. Every time we entered the lobby, we were greeted with smiles and care about what our day has been like or is going to be. Omar, Adam, Kiefer, Jonathan, just to name a few of all the great staff, made our visit memorable and homely. Would recommend the Cassa on 45th to anyone!

It was really good to stay at this hotel. Location wise, it is really centered and near to all the attractions in the city. The hotel staff gave us an extraordinary service, Very helpful and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to New York City.

Booked this hotel months in advance and they charged my credit card for the full amount of my four nights weeks ahead. While on the plane to NYC, someone from the hotel called to tell me that if I don’t call them back, they can’t guarantee my room. Since I was on the plane, I didn’t get the message until later. Turns out that they had a bad credit card number and needed it to hold the room. Whatever... I gave them a different card which really was the same card they didn’t work. It worked when I called. I hade to deal with this in the airport when I landed with my daughter there. We got to the hotel late, around 7. When we checked in, there were three employees at the desk having a casual conversation and no other people. Nobody would even acknowledge my existence. Finally I said excuse me politely and one of them asks what they can help me with as I stood there with my luggage. I don’t know-maybe check me in??? I thought. As he is checking me in, he states that they are doing maintenance on the air but it will be back up in the next 30 minutes to an hour and that I need to be patient. I said nothing, dragged my luggage to the room, and then my daughter and I went to go find dinner as we hadn’t eaten all day. We decided to hang around Times Square and eat and got back to the hotel at 10, three hours after he claimed the ac would be working. We went to the room. NO AC. Went down and they told me to be patient. At that moment the maintenance guy was there and he said he would come to fix it. He came up and explained what to do and signs it isn’t working. He left and I gave it an hour. Still not working. Went down to get help again and the manager again tells me to be patient. I expressed that I had been and have a young kid and it is 90 in the room. The guy came back up and “fixed” it again. I waited another 30 minutes and it actually got hotter in the room. I went down again and asked if he could move us to a room he knew the AC worked. He said no, obviously because there were no rooms with working AC. I asked for my money back and he did not argue. Called several hotels and finally ended up at The Time Hotel NY. They were great and their customer service was top notch, and it was less expensive. Stay away from this hotel. I know that stuff happens and it is out of their control, but their demeanor and service from the beginning was terrible and there are many hotels where you can be treated decently. They need to fire the manager. Not for the AC, but total lack of caring about people. Also, they should have said something on the phone when they wanted my credit card, or at the very least should have said that they won’t charge me if the ac is not working or they could line up an alternative hotel. While that would be turning away a visitor, it would have made me consider staying there another time or recommending the place. I do not recommend this place. Go to The Time NY. They know how to deal with people. BTW, the room I got at that hotel had broken AC also, but they moved me into a room that worked and took one night off. It was like we were cursed but that hotel did it right.

I loved my stay at Cassa Hotel. The location is great- near several subway stops. I reserved the smallest room (199 sq feet) and was a little nervous but found it adequate and comfortable. The room was modern and the bathroom was updated and gorgeous. I had two windows that brought light in and made the room airy. The elevators were quick and efficient. The bed was a small double, but I was travelling solo so it worked for me. TV had cable including HBO. The shampoo and products they supplied were wonderful and the towels and linens fresh and clean. Maid came every day to clean my room. My only wish was a coffee/tea maker in the room, but there was a Pret A Manger and Starbucks close by. The front desk staff were wonderful! So friendly and upbeat music playing in the lobby. The room also had an iron and refrigerator, which was nice. Plenty of plugs to charge phones, etc.Overall a brilliant stay. Will book this hotel again next time.

My wife and I and our 17 yr old son stayed in a One Bedroom suite over Memorial Day weekend. This was our 2nd time staying at Cassa. Room was immaculate and very comfortable. My wife and I had a king bed and our son had sofa bed in separate living room which gave us the privacy we wanted. The only thing that complicated things was that the bathroom can only be accessed off of the bedroom which meant our son needed to come though our room to get to the bathroom. A minor inconvenience and just a byproduct of the suite design. Not that big of a deal, but worth noting for anyone considering this type of room. Cassa is definitely our go to hotel for NYC trips. After our first stay a year ago we tried another hotel and were not nearly as happy. HighlyRecommend this hotel. Cassa is clean, safe, comfortable, has great service, and a perfect location for Times Square/ Theatre district. Alsoa short walk to Empire State Building, 30Rock, or the subway station to get to lower Manhattan to see World Trade Center sights. There is also a nice parking garage 1 block away on 44th street.

The AC was broken the 5 nights I stayed there - and I even switched rooms. They sent someone to my room every day to try to fix it. The first guy who came was such a jerk and told me it wasn't broken even though the temp said it was 78 degrees in my room and I had the AC set to 64. I finally asked for a room change and the same thing happened. I would wake up in the middle of the night with the temp in the high 70s even though I had it set at 64. Every morning, had to call someone to come fix it which they would and by the end of the day it would be back to being hot. The hotel was EXTREMELY rude about it and basically tried to tell me each time it was in my head and that the AC was working. I was supposed to stay here for another week in July but just cancelled my reservation and will be staying somewhere else. I will never stay at this hotel again.

We recently stayed at the Cassa overnight as we were seeing a concert at the new Sony Hall Theatre. We were greeted with the knowledge that we were the guests of the week and would be receiving an upgrade. We have visited this hotel before and were always met with smiling faces and excellent service but this time was special. The room was spacious and very comfortable. The attention we received was beyond, the expected. The personnel we encountered were wonderful, kind, caring and very helpful. They truly couldn’t do enough to accommodate our needs.This had not been our first visit to the Cassa and definitely will not be our last. Thank you to all the Cassa family.

The PEOPLE (especially Adam, Stephanie, and Evita...a couple more also but I can't remember their names) were so friendly and helpful and they went out of their way to make our stay great, even decorating our room for my daughter's birthday and giving us some chocolate treats and breakfast vouchers. They also remembered my daughter's name every time we came through the lobby and she felt so special. Thanks for making it personal, guys! Additionally, the location is perfect, and our room was clean, spacious, and wonderful. I hope we can return!

Great great location. Many things within walking or quick Uber ride. The front desk always super friendly, the rooms are clean and New York small (but to be expected). There is a restaurant under the hotel that is ok. Not sure how someone paid $500 and then complained. This is a great value hotel that I would stay at again
