For $500 a night a got a smaller room than someone in the pokey. They announced I was the “guest of the day!” Which entitled me to 2 free bottled waters and 2 guest robes to use. I got neither! No refrigerator in the room just a hole where it was or should be.

This was our 4th stay and yet again... the service and staff were incredible! A comfortable hotel and remarkably quiet... for NYC . The reception staff went out of their way to make our stay amazing. Adam on the door was so kind to my son . Ask the staff about the best places to eat ... we asked Jon and he recommended a superb place . He was also very helpful on check in . They are all so so lovely. Thank you for making our stay so comfortable, safe and overall... fabulous We will return again to Cassa

We stayed 4 nights and were accommodated by letting us check in 3 hours early with no additional charge. The room was very small, but expected for NYC. It was in a great, convenient location 2 blocks from Times Square. Complete with iron, ironing board and a safe. TV and service was great. The only downfall was no fridge. Water was super hot and the cold water very cold. Elevators was very fast to reach any floor (we were on 23rd floor). Traffic noise below was minimal. Front staff greeted us every time we came back from a trip outside the hotel. Overall, our stay was very good. Highly recommended.

We had great time in Cassa hotel 45th on 6 avenue. amazing location, practically on Times Square.. friendly front desk people.. fresh and free coffee and tea in the morning and lemon water all day. highly recommended!! True home away from home :)Thanks again!

5 day trip to NYC with my daugther. Staff was very friendly and helpful - Thanks Evita & rest of the crew for taking good care of us! Location close to times square (but not too close ;-)) and very convenient for all activities. Want to return here for sure!

Our expectations were surpassed by the customer service of the Cassa Hotel’s team at every encounter. Our 3-night stay followed a cruise debarkation at Bayonne, NJ. Early, about 09:30 we checked in with Tinzin? at front desk. He could not have been more helpful with his friendly demeanor and graciousness. Almost immediately he arranged our luggage storage with Adam; and carefully prepared the tourist map with nearby destinations, including Metro access. Since 3:00 p.m. is the official check-in time, Tinzin offered to contact me “no later than 3 p.m. as soon as rooms were ready”.The room, on 23, faced East with a bright view over rooftops and between neighboring high-rises. -The room was spacious and very well appointed. The bathroom and shower were expansive, with upgraded appliances and very attractive tile, stonework. The towels and toiletries were luxuriant. I know, it’s New York City with a midtown convenience that draws millions daily. The first night, Friday was noisy. My constant travel companion, earplugs, came in handy as the festive sounds from some public location below continued well beyond midnight. Nights 2 and 3 were quiet.-Cassa Hotel provided a lovely room and glorious bedding. Thank you to all the staff at the Cassa. R. Peters 2301

My wife and I stayed at Cassa hotel last month and had a very pleasant experience. The hotel is located a couple of blocks from Times Square, it was about a 10 minute walk. The room was nice and always kept clean thanks to housekeeping staying on top of it, even when we left later in the morning after housekeeping made their rounds, we would return to a clean room. The front desk personnel were very nice and informative. From the moment we arrived we were asked if this was our first time in NYC (which it was) and the employee Adam gave us great suggestions of where to eat, places to visit and even local events happening if we wanted to get out of the tourist areas. He also told us the best and most affordable ways to get around NYC without spending too much money on transportation.The next day as my wife and i were heading out, he suggested my wife take a warmer jacket for the day, she told him that was the only jacket she had and he went out of his way to walk us to a clothing store nearby where my wife was able to find a jacket at a very reasonable price. And he was right, she definitely needed a warmer jacket! On another occasion, it began to rain and as we left the hotel Adam was kind enough to give us an umbrella for the day and suggested we visit all the indoor places like Museums or watch a Broadway Show since the day would be rainy and gloomy. So we did! And we had a great time visiting museums and watched the Broadway Show "Aladdin" (recommended by Adam) which was AMAZING!We will definitely be staying here again the next time we Visit NYC.

That's good one - not the best but good - good location (if you could find them...), friendly reception people, clean room. If you could be lucky you can get room with good view from your window but as a Golden Radisson member I got something "worse". Will I come back again ? Not sure yet... Thank you Guys !

The staff were very friendly and our room quiet and clean. Great location to all the things we wanted to see close to Bryant park. New York City library 5th Ave. And Times Square. Would stay again. I would recommend this hotel and staff

The hotel's location is great, the staff very friendly and the room was very clean and quiet. Special shout out to the ever so helpful and kind bellman Keifer! I can highly recommend this hotel and will for sure be coming back.

I ran into a huge issue and had to cancel my reservation. General Manager Elizabeth Ardiles was respectful and super helpful. She returned my phone call as soon as possible and we were able to work everything out.

Location of this hotel was excellent for us in first visit to New York. Spotlessly clean room with everything you needed including high quality toiletries and a coffee machine. Check out was noon and we could leave our luggage. The reception team were brilliant and looked after us from our arrival until we left, including arranging transport to JFK. Thanks guys, hope to see you all again!!

I have been in the hotel for 5 days. Great location, great room and bathroom. Friendly staff, with some amenities at the front desk. The price was far and I will recommend it for everyone. Everything perfect.

Stayed at this midtown hotel for 3 nights and found the location ideal (2 blocks from a subway station and minutes from the rockefella and time square by foot. The rooms were smart and tidy and had everything you need apart from coffee making facilities (you had to go reception in the mornings only to get one) staff were friendly, efficient and helpful. Would recommend.

I booked this hotel by accident as had meant to get the Times Square one but in the end was very pleased with this one. The hotel is between 5 and 6 avenue so you’re within a 10 minute walk of rockerfeller plaza. Times Square and Bryant park. Despite the central location the hotel is very quiet.Room is a decent size (we were in a standard double), bed was comfortable and all seemed clean. There was a small fridge in the room and you can ask for a coffee machine (Keurig) to be put in the room. Bathroom was nice though I didn’t see the point of having a tub when you would never take a bath in there (due to the rough anti slip mat). It was a nice touch that the toiletries were in large bottles and seemed to be good quality. If I’d known that I wouldn’t have brought my own. This is a small hotel (165 rooms) and we never had to wait more than a few seconds for the lift. The lobby was also small me rarely busy.The room has a good sized HD tv.Overall we really enjoyed our stay here and would not hesitate to recommend.The one thing which would have made it 5 stars is if the windows had been clean. They were filthy so you didn’t get a clear look out of the room.Plenty of places nearby for food. I would particularly recommend cafe manhattan for a good value breakfast.

My daughter and I stayed here for a 5 day trip to New York. We stayed on the 7th floor. I found that the corridors were a little dark and on first impressions I wasn’t so sure we had chosen the right hotel but I had nothing to worry about. The rooms were quite basic but very clean. There was a tv, radio alarm clock and safe in the room. Bathroom had toiletries and a hairdryer. Rooms were cleaned daily. Staff were very polite and extremely helpful. The only downside was not having tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms however you could get these from the lobby every morning and water was available from the lobby 24 hours a day. Plus you are never to far from a coffee shop. The location was excellent, the hotel is within walking distance to Times Square this took about 3 mins to get to and a 10 minute walk to Central Park. We used the hotels car service to get to the airport on departure and it was well worth the $75 to jfk airport. All in all this was a great hotel for the price and we would definitely use this hotel and on returning to New York .

We had a really wonderful stay at Cassa Hotel NY 45th. My husband and I live in Philly and took a short trip to NYC to celebrate our 1 year anniversary. The staff were so accommodating and kind. Tenzin, in particular, was really great. He upgraded our room to a gorgeous suite to help us celebrate the occasion and it felt very special. The room itself was large and looked out onto a little park with pretty green trees, perfect for spring. The bathroom with soaker tub was a luxury. The hotel location is perfect for touristy things, which is exactly what we were looking for. We like walking and this allowed us to walk everywhere. I'd definitely stay at this hotel again and would recommend to anyone looking for a fun stay in NYC!

You can walk to every attraction from here. Its literally 5 min walk into Times Square. The hotel is very clean and the staff very friendly they even went as far as to put up balloons for my partners birthday. We had a king bedroom and it was very comfortable and everything we needed. The only downside if you can call it that was there was no breakfast served on site. It didnt really bother us as outside the door were several places to eat and that to me was all part of the experience. Getting to the hotel from JFK was easy and painless. $5 sky train to Jamaica. Then $3 ish to 44th street via the subway. Took maybe 45mins total. I would definately stay here again should i return.

This hotel is right in the centre of NYC, 2 min walk from Times Square. Reception staff very helpful & friendly. Rooms are ideal, beds really comfortable, cleaned daily. Sometimes air con can be noisy, we just turned it off through the night. Would definitely stay here again.

Don't even think of using that Do Not Disturb sign. I got in late Friday evening and decided to have a leisurely morning in my hotel room. Less than 24 hours and I already have the housekeeping manager calling the room to demand his staff be able to clean it. Definitely avoid the ride staff here.

Michael is the rudest reception staff member i have ever experienced! I cannot even get a reservation here by calling them as he continues to put me on hold and basically leave me there! Three times i have tried to call and speak with someone however, on hold again. AmazingIf this is how they treat their customers, i would NEVER stay here!!!

I am currently staying at this hotel and due to leave on the 29th March. The hotel is in a great location and is clean. The staff are very friendly. The only problem for me is the noise from what I think is the heating system. It wakes me up each morning from 4am. It’s a very loud buzzing noise. And is on and off all morning so you cannot get back to sleep. I haven’t reported this to the reception staff as the couple who me and my husband have travelled with are staying in a different room and they have told me they are experiencing the same problem and it wakes them up too every morning. So not much point asking to move rooms if it does it everywhere else. It’s such a shame as the hotel is brilliant as far as cleanliness and location go. But for the reason of the noise and not having a very good nights sleep I would not return to this hotel.

The location, rooms and service were all excellent. Staff at reception were always happy to help, friendly and smiley. They also arranged transfers to and from the airport which was very helpful. My students and myself found the hotel staff extraordinary. The location is the best in between 5th and 6th Avenue, Times Square only a minute walk. Room service and a special button on the phone says: your desires. I've asked for Ice and and iron and were delivered within minutes.

I would say this hotel ticked all the boxes, Location200 yards from Times Square so within easy reach of most of the to do list in New York HotelStaff very friendly and always on hand to help with any questions we had, always hot water and rooms cleaned every day during our stay which was 4 night. WiFi fast for what I needed and was free (this was for 2 devices but could pay for extra)Rooms Perfect for our stay and very clean, couldn’t hear anyone from other rooms and also we was in front of the lift but again didn’t hear anything. Big screen tv with loads of channels. Would have loved if the hotel had a bar but and looks like there is on the 10th floor but maybe closed due to the season. There’s a restaurant below called butter which again would have to score really high. Thanks for the stay and will be back again in the near future.

Stayed here for 2 nights recently. I would stay here again, without hesitation.Highlights were: STAFF! Really friendly, helpful. Great bathrooms, no problem with hot water. Room had a fridge and it wasn’t filled with stuff to buy, so you could actually put things in it. Rooms had a safe, though mine was a little hard to get to on the ground, under the night stand. Minuses: It could be cramped for 2 people, but it is NYC. Fitness room could be a lot better- equipment is old, but the room is clean. It would be nice if they did valet parking, but it really wasn’t much of a hassle.

Lovely rooms, and really helpful staff. They helped me with a map of where I was and let me know how to get about. The location was excellent, just a few minutes walk to Times Square and loads of places to eat and drink next to the hotel too. The room was lovely with a really comfortable bed and a big walk in shower. At night it was so quiet which I couldn’t quite believe because of how central it was. I would recommend this hotel highly and I can’t wait to go back!

Location, excellent. Staff, excellent. Showers, excellent. (Think: Shower head higher than 4 ft tall and actual hot water). Room was clean and comfy and they got us in early after a redeye flight, so we were very thankful.Minor downsides were the closets are small and tough to fit much in, and I think the refrigerator in my room was out or not very cold, but I'm sure they would have fixed it had I asked. For the price and location, we were very happy and loved the helpful, friendly staff. Will definitely stay here again.

Just returned from a 4 night break at the Cassa. From start to finish the staff were very helpful. Upgraded our room to a suite for my wifes birthday. The hotel is also has residential apartments in it. Coffee and Tea and fruit in the morning from the front desk. 5 minute walk to Times Square if even that. Room was big large bathroom and shower. TGI Fridays on 5th Ave has happy hour $4 beers and $5 cocktails. Lots of places nearby for eating. We got the bus into the city from Newark , Got off at Bryant Park and the hotel was 5 minute walk. Real easy. $5 and below on the corner of 5th Ave for your snacks and drinks rather than pay crazy prices.

Lovely hotel in the heart of midtown. Very convenient location. We were greeted by a very pleasant member of staff and receive an upgrade to our room as we were celebrating our anniversary. We have enjoyed our view from the 27th floor. You can come down to the reception area every morning for a complimentary tea/coffee and some fruit. We won’t hesitate to visit this hotel again on our next trip to New York.

Enjoyed our stay at Cassa hotel. Only a couple of blocks from Times Square. Very comfy bed and spacious modern hot shower. Wardrobe too small and lived out of suitcase. Large tv in room and safe. Good size rooms. No tea or coffee in room but had down at reception. Reception staff very helpful telling us where to dine and ordering a taxi to the airport. Would benefit from having a bar.

This was our first trip to the US and NYC. A great location but the photos I’d seen of a red reception desk were old. It’s now black and very tired. No lounge or bar. Just a desk, lifts and rooms. It could be so much better - there’s a small terrace on the tenth floor but they’ve not done anything with it.On the plus side the reception staff were lovely and we were granted a complementary extra one hour check out due to an evening flight. We stayed in a queen room which was basic but a lovely comfy bed and soft pillows. The shower was good (rain shower) and there were large bottles of shampoo, body wash, conditioner and body lotion. There was also an adequate hair dryer.The bedroom had a large wall mounted flat screen tv with loads of movies and channels. The wardrobe was tiny with no full height hanging space and there were no drawers anywhere - we literally lived out of our suitcases. There was a fridge (locked) in the wardrobe and a good (free) safe. No tea or coffee in the room though - just completely tea (no milk) in the reception / lobby.You really can’t best its location though - we were able to walk everywhere!

This Hotel was booked as part of a package . The hotel is basic but clean with a small gym . Is central to most attractions , shops , underground train connections , restaurants and bars.The hotel is a good base from which to explore. We arrived after a delayed flight with subzero temperatures. The room was cold but we asked for extra blankets which were promptly provided for us . The mattress was very soft and lumpy . Hot showers and fresh towels every day . Not sure we would stay here again but enjoyed our stay .

Great location close to theater, inexpensive parking convenient to hotel. Room was clean and big enough for two. Staff very helpful at check-in.Went to Butter restaurant just for drinks and appetizers ,good selection good martini

Unfortunately everything with our stay went wrong. First there was a system crash and we could not be checked in for ages but had to wait in the cold lounge. We had time pressure since we had a table booked in the evening. Then when we finally got a room it was a wrong room, other than what we had booked. Then there was also an alarm due to a water leakage and the elevators could not be used so we had to take the fire stairs out in order to get to our restaurant on time.In the late evening we finally got the room we actually had paid for. The room was unfresh and unbelievably cold so we were freezing the entire stay. Also, the big luggage from the wrong room needed to be dragged around all over the building and up and down the fire stairs (by ourselves) since the elevators could not be used.

We had a great time staying at Cassa for 3 days. Great value. Centrally located 5 mins walk to Times Square but far enough not to hear much street noise. Clean room, comfortable bed and updated bathroom. Helpful and friendly staff who helped us with directions. Great breakfast place and pizza on the same block.

Very central location, near to many of the main attractions. Room was nice and hotel staff very friendly! José Was especially very helpful! We were on the 21st floor and was very quiet at night. Shower took a little while to get hot but apart from that I couldn’t really fault our stay here!

I returned to New York after 25 years and this hotel is in the perfect location for the new, tourist friendly, great city of New York.5 minutes walk from Times Square and The Empire State Building. Access to all of the 5 boroughs is simple. Great boutique hotel.

Close to theater district, easy access to transportation, super friendly staff who were so accommodating. Arrived early and given access to our room. Helpful staff allowed us to leave our bags in the hotel for several hours with no issue! Great place, great people!

I can't imagine a better-located hotel to most of the main sights in Manhattan. The hotel is modern with a minimal lobby. The rooms are also modern with all amenities (even though I'd have liked a mini-fridge). Rooms are low on storage space. Bathrooms are quite nice with great water pressure. ;The front desk staff are exceptional across-the-board. The on site restaurant "Butter" is an extraordinary restaurant and worth a visit.

I travel to NY every other month for work. Usually stay 5-6 nights. Have stayed in quite a few different hotels. As far as the "boutique" style hotels, this is the place to stay. The employees are always nice and quick to help. Hotel is clean, beds are comfortable, and bathrooms are larger than many of the rooms I have experienced. You have free wifi for two devices in each room. Hotel has a shower door, which seems small but it helps keep from water splashing all over the bathroom. Most rooms have a mini fridge option and provides free coffee and tea in the lobby which is not done in most of the hotels I have stayed in. Also has a gym in hotel versus having to walk to another location. A lot of hotels partner with a gym nearby. Hotel is in a good location. Overall I've had a good experience here and would recommend it to others.

Cassa New York was a happy discovery. I had looked for places in my rewards program before my trip. I was staying with family and friends for most of my vacation, but decided to spend the last night in the city. Not only is Cassa New York surprisingly affordable, the customer service is outstanding, the location ideal. Upon check-in, I was not only upgraded but allowed to have my room three hours earlier than the standard check-in time. Great bathroom. Very comfortable bed and fabulous pillows. When I was trying to figure out how to get to the airport, I discovered that the bus to the airport was just a short walk from the hotel. It's a great block with lots of dining options. I would not recommend the restaurant associated with the hotel, Butter. Had a disappointing experience. But there are many more choices on that block and in the immediate area. I'm so excited to have found my new place to stay in the city.

Hotel manager claimed I have no status with Radisson rewards even after showing him my card and my account online.I was "kicked out" of the room at 12:30 after I was promised a late check out on check in.Room was ok but maintenance was not good! All USB outlets were broken and furnitures were not in great condition.

Good location, a very new building which is unusual in New York. Rooms are a decent size, bathrooms are very nice. There is a restaurant, Butter, which was nice. The rest of the place is very small and the fitness area wasn't that nice. Partially this takes minimalist design and just doesn't get it. Price was not that expensive but i went at a slow time of the year. A rational choice if a bit price sensitive and expectations aren't too high.
user_name:
Flyway2much
New York City, New York

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Cassa Hotel and were upgraded to an Executive King room on an award stay, thanks to our Radisson Gold Status. Tenzin at reception was great and made us feel welcome. One negative note was that we were celebrating a birthday, but we were disappointed that the hotel didn't acknowledge it, even though it was in the reservation notes. The room was average size for Manhatten with modern furniture.  One bedside table had easily accessible outlets (but not the other side of the bed), and unfortunately, the built-in USB didn't work. The bathroom had a fun rain-shower head with plenty of hot water. It was surprising that the room didn't include a coffee maker (one is available per request, but it wasn't clear if there was a charge for this service). Wifi was consistent but limited to two devices per room which seems inadequate considering how many people work while they travel and since there were two of us on this trip it meant we couldn't connect all our devices. Overall we had a pleasant stay and decided on this hotel because it's part of the Radisson family. One thing that's always disappointing about Radisson rewards is that they don't offer complimentary breakfast to gold elites (such as Hilton does for example).  But it's a toss-up on whether we would choose this hotel in the future over their competition.

Noisy buzzing heater! Can’t even hear the TV when it goes off. I demand refund of my payment. The assistant manager was not helpful at all. He told me basically to deal with it. Not even apologetic at all.

Clean and quiet for NYC. We have stayed here before and love it. Would have liked better communication with the hotel. The street was closed and never notified us of all the road closures. We had to walk at least 6 blocks to get there

Nice hotel, if you want to explore the city you are close to everything. We took the metro and walked around. We got a really good price from secret escape, so for us the value was very good for the area. Service was nice and efficient. Bathroom could use some renovation. Bed was good, room was very clean. We didnt have breakfast there. There are a lot of good breakfast options near by, just be aware the prices are really high some places (and others not, but same quality).

Great value for money. Great location. Great staff. Spotless room. Perfect pillows and beds. Room only for us. But so many places to eat close by. Highly recommend any of the Irish bars close by also. What’s not to like.

My boyfriend and I have just returned home from a 6 night stay at Cassa hotel - and I couldn’t recommend enough. Unbelievable location - 2 minutes from Times Square, the hotel is just what you want. Clean, well decorated room with minimal noise from road. Pleasantly surprised at how big the room was too! (With the most comfortable bed) The staff were so helpful and kind - ask them any questions/recommendations and they’re happy to help. An amazing stay and I would certainly go back.

Hotel is near Broadway, classy and updated. Staff could come up from their phones and greet guests or acknowledge them. I love music but there are times that the lobby was more like a dance club. The music was a little loud. It would be nice to have an extra blanket in the room.

Our stay at Cassa 45th was nothing short of exceptional. The location means that most, if not all, major sights are within walking distance (we walked to the 9/11 memorial in about an hour) and was wonderfully situated between Times Square and Fifth Avenue - very exciting for first time visitors! The hotel's location also means that taxis and Ubers can pick you up with relative ease.The front of house staff were all, without question, exceedingly friendly and welcoming, and could not do enough for you. Even the small gestures, like opening doors and offering water, were exchanged with sincere smiles and genuine appreciation for the guests. We did not have room service, so I cannot comment on that. The room was marvellous after a long flight. Our room (510) was large, with an XXL bed and an XXL television, which meant snuggling down to watch a film at the end of busy days was a welcome treat! Our room was also very well soundproofed, we couldn't hear a peep from Times Square round the corner! We also had a safe and plenty of storage space for our bits and bobs.The bathroom was beautifully marbled with a rainfall shower, water always hot, and bath deep enough to really relax your feet and back after a long day in the city. We bought our own toiletries, but the ones provided smelt exceptional and were not your average hotel ones that dry your hair out. Much appreciated! Checking out at 12pm may be a turn-off for some, but be assured that Team Cassa will ensure that all your belongings are kept safely until your return at no extra cost - they will also arrange transfers if you've not done so already (sidenote: we used Uber, and it cost us $68.10 to get from Cassa to JFK.)We are so thankful for all the staff that were on hand to accommodate us during our stay and will definitely be returning in the future, as well as recommending to friends and family!

The bathroom is great in terms of cleanliness and size. The amenities are of the highest quality. The bed is of great quality as well as the sheets and pillows. The room size is great, compared to NY ones. I did not use any room service in order to evaluate.In my room there was no safe and no fridge. There was their place, but the equipment was not in the room. I think the hotel has to take extra care with the equipments that are made available in the rooms for guests.I stayed for a week at the hotel, and throughout that time there was a single elevator running. The other elevator was under maintenance for a week. I fully understand that the lifts should go through maintenance, but a week only with an elevator for about 45 floors, was exhausting.

What an absolute gem of a hotel, the staff were always there greeting us with the most welcoming smiles, and really couldn’t do enough for us. After reading reviews was a little sceptical about the rooms being a little small etc, but I needn’t of worried after staying in New York several times the room size was quite standard, and very clean and essentials provided. I will definitely stay here again, and would like the management to take note how kind and thoughtful the lobby staff were, they are all a credit to the hotel, especially Johnathan who was so kind and thoughtful with us, as he was aware of my husband hurting his back and made our final day enjoyable as it could of easily been miserable under the circumstances so Thankyou Johnathan once again.

Excellent locations, walking distance to time square, 5th ave and the theater districts for broadway shows. The room was clean and have a very nice modern design that I appreciated. The stand up shower was awesome!

Pillows and bedding weren’t very comfortable but the shower was amazing and made up for that a bit. Location is great and easy access to subways and most parts of town. The hallways and carpets could use an update.

From the welcome, to the room quality and cleanliness, to the baggage delivery experience, to the restaurant, and finally our departure, this was an exceptional stay all around. Thank you, Team Cassa!

The hotel is an amazing location and I definitely would stay again but for the price they charge they should be a little better. we got there before checkin and it was pissing rain . there were atleast 10 people who checked out so I asked nicely if they had an umbrella I could use. I was told no because they are in the room. I thought for a high end hotel they could have had extras or since people checked out they could have given me one while they clean the room and make that our room. but no. We left our bags and went on our way. When we came back our room was ready but our bags were not put in our room. I found that just a way to get a tip. I asked to bring my bags up myself but I was forced to use a bell boy. The room is very nice and comfortable. we had set the thermostat since it was set very cold. We went to eat and came back and it was still cold but it had went up a couple of degrees. So I left it and we went to bed. I woke up in the middle of the night for the thermostat to be at 63 degrees and making clicking noises. I know they would have fixed this but it was like 1 in the morning and I did not want to wake my wife so I left it.also at night I had asked them to print something for me which I was told it would be waiting for me at checkout. we checked out and I told the lady about the umbrellas where she told me well we cant give them out and about the thermostat she said well you should have told us. I was not complaining just informing her. Also in their room menu it says seasonal drinks are served in the afternoon which they did not have, Their answer for that was its not the season so I asked which season do you have the drinks they were dumbfounded. we then left the hotel and about 10 minutes later realized they did not give me my printed item so I had to go back. THe hotel is a good location and bed is comfy . Thermostat easily could have been fixed so for that I give it no problem. Service though I am not impressed again.

The hotel is well located on 45th St between 5th Ave and 6th Ave. Most of entertainment and shopping places are within a 15 mins walk. Staff are friendly and helpful. Not much choices on breakfast and too pricey. Should just get your breakfast outside the hotel. From the front of hotel, turn right toward 5th Ave. There are Pret a Manger, Pizza restaurant those serve a reasonable price breakfast. The hotel room is small, but good enough if you don’t stay in during the day. You can leave your luggages kwith no additional charge after check out until midnight.
user_name:
N3551UOnatalies
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed in the hotel for 6 nights,the overall experience was good. The hotel in perfect location.The lobby is not inviting and small, the rooms are reasonably sized and clean and the bathrooms are spacious.The staff is very nice but the room service is not in stable service (they came every time to clean us up the room afternoon..., and not in the morning as usual)Overall definitely worth the price.

We enjoyed everything about our stay at Cassa Hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was attractive and immaculate. Everything was brand new and in good taste. The room was quiet and, as we were on the 24th floor, we did not hear any street noises. And breakfast was a welcome addition. The choices were plentiful and of good quality. We would stay again!

My stay at Cassa Hotel NY and my experienceHotel is close to Time Square.Nice and friendly staffs always ready to help at all timeVery close to NY Port Authority,so it was easy for me and my family moving from NY to Washington DC

This was my first time in NYC. Being from another state I was nervous . However the staff was understanding and kind. The only small negative thing was where we had to park and walk from. It was a nice walk but long.

Stayed here over Christmas 2018. The hotel is exactly where you need it to be when doing the tourist thing in NYC. Excellent location for many of the key locations. We were upgraded to a king suite and it was huge. The bed extremely comfortable and you couldn't tell you were only a few hundred meters from times square.We had an issue with the heating in our room and the team arrived within 5 minutes to fix it, which I was stunned at how quickly it was sorted.On our last night we wanted a take away,but didn't want to call and it cost a fortune. Not a problem the front desk called and organised this for me.Only concerns we had was the design of the shower meant the bathroom flooded every time you had a shower, which meant you had to mop it up, but that aside it was perfect.Tea and coffee in the morning was free as was the Wi-Fi. Many thanks!

We stayed at Cassa for 2 nights. Comfortable and spacious rooms, excellent bathrooms, efficient service and facilities. Would highly recommend for a business visit. If with family, midtown is a great location - you can't go wrong. Breakfast could be offered - that's always a 'nice' touch.

Cassa is a good hotel with an excellent location on 45th St between 5th & 6th Avenues. This makes it an deal base for sightseeing, attending events, theater district, etc. Within a few minutes there is a wide variety of local bars and restaurants. Wi-fi was consistently good with no problems.

Couldn’t fault this in any way. The rooms are great, nice and clean with all the amenities you would expect. The service was excellent from the moment I stepped into the hotel and the location is literally a couple of minutes walk to Times Square. It’s perfect. Will definitely be back!

Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights with 2 other couples in early December. Check in was very quick and efficient and we were given rooms on the 26th floor. Our room was very clean and tidy and the bed was super comfortable. The shower gels/ shampoo/ moisturiser etc were good quality. The only thing we didn't have in our room was a safe. We requested a safe from reception and it was placed in our room within a couple of hours. Staff were extremely polite and helpful. We had a coffee maker in our room and there was very little noise from street level. We did not dine in the hotel but did have a drink and a dessert in the hotel restaurant which was luscious (raspberry beignets and prosecco). The hotel is ideally located for all the attractions and we would definitely stay here again.

Location is excellent and the service is very very good. It is near everything including: Times SquareRockefeller CenterRadio City Music HallBryant ParkGrand Central StationMacysSacksEmpire State BuildingRestaurantsand more!!!

Spent a night here as part of our Xmas break with my wife on Saturday Dec. 29th. The location is perfect. Parking on 51st was only $40/night. Staff was friendly. We had a full size bed which was fine but the mattress what shot soft and no support for 2 adults.The only downer was availability of ice. We needed some and called the front desk who keep putting us on hold. Eventually after calling back 3 times, we had to order ice which showed up 30 minutes later after as we prepared to leave making it useless.Fast elevators made up/down to the room very quick.

Great location, friendly and helpful staff. Comfortable room. Would definitely stay here again. Butter, the restaurant in the hotel, was closed for a private event during my stay, which was disappointing, but will have to try again soon.

There is absolutely no doubt that this hotel is in an excellent location and central for just about all of Manhattan's attractions and hot spots. Other than that I fail to see why so many guests are giving it such high marks. It is a three star hotel at best - not four, and certainly does not meet up to the description of either Virgin Holidays' website or the hotel's own website - where was my bathrobe, iPod docking station and coffee machine?!On arrival the receptionist gleefully told us that we had been upgraded.... to what?! Rooms were dark and dreary. The air conditioning / heating was so loud that we had to make a decision whether to keep it on during the night, or switch it off completely. There was no plug socket near the mirror, and while there was a safe it wasn't bolted down so you could pick it up and walk away with it!Service? What service? OK, so we did get housekeeping every day, but apart from arrival an departure, there was no service. Staff didn't even look up to say good morning, and as we left we didn't even get their full attention as they were chatting to each other.There was tea and coffee available in reception first thing (I keep saying reception, because it isn't much of a lobby) but nobody told us about breakfast being served in the adjoining restaurant. In fact, I don't believe it was.... or else it was just empty every day.And the 10th floor lounge? Virgin Holidays - the 10th floor lounge was not in use.... although it was the only accessible bathroom in the hotel after you'd checked out.Brilliant holiday in New York. This hotel is saved by its location, but I won't reserve a room here again, nor would I recommend it.

Enjoyed our stay at Cassa. Great location, staff was friendly and went above and beyond to be helpful. Housekeeping was great, our room was always very clean. We enjoyed dining at Butter. Not a large menu, everything we tried was wonderful. The location was an easy walk to Times Square.

Room had sofa but not sofabed. Room a “suite” but, nevertheless,too small for a cot. Room had a water leak.Card keys stopped working prematurely in morning. Slow and inadequate response to problems by staff.Continental breakfast not very good. No room service available.Huge downgrade from previous Radisson NYC property at Martinique. Excellent location but otherwise very unsatisfying stay. Radisson needs a much better NYC hotel than this! Very mediocre.

Although the staff were friendly and location decent, the room itself was a complete mess. The decor is dreary and the bathroom was disgusting to the point I did not want to be barefoot inside the shower. The shower pressure was so strong that it hurt and was not adjustable. The beds were so uncomfortable my S.O. literally tossed and turned but could not sleep for two consecutive nights. To top it off, there is no luggage storage at the hotel. After check out we had to walk a couple blocks in the rain with all of our luggage and paid $40 to store our bags for a few hours until our flight. No one informed us that we would be having to pay to store our bags. Initially we decided to go with this hotel hoping to save a few bucks and regretted it deeply. Do yourself a favor and stay away.

There’s nothing to the hotel really. But it’s a nice room in midtown Manhattan if you’re just putting your head down to sleep. We used points so well worth the price. The rooms are very clean and the front desk was friendly. The restaurant in the basement (it’s in the basement, so it’s not like you walk by it when you check in or even see it unless you look down) has great reviews.
user_name:
Amacdonald116
New York City, New York

review_body: I usually stay elsewhere in NYC but I saw this property advertised and thought I'd give it a try. Good location. Nice modern facilities. Breakfast room. My deal included continental breakfast. Very good value.

Arriving in NY and driving in, the hotel had a reserved spot for me a few blocks away for parking. This was fantastic. The staff was there to great, answer questions and most importantly helped us with our Pet. The hotel is extremely pet friendly and safe. The door staff, check-in staff and cleaning team were always there, with.a smile on there face. The rooms were clean, well kept and the bed extremely comfortable. The rooms were also exceptionally quiet considering you are so near Times Square. TV, Plenty of coffee for free on demand. In fact I can't mention how kind the staff was constantly. I'm a Radison gold member, and let me tell you this hotel is not branded Radisson but they treated me even better than some of the hotels I stay at. My stay was for a few day's. The hotel is walking distance from Times Square (5 Minutes), Central Park (10 Minutes), and Subway (5 Minutes). It was the most convenient hotel. I honestly have to say I'm staying here when I come to NY without a doubt. Wow just exceptional!!!!!

Amazing location. This hotel is situated on West 45th, corner of 6th Ave. To the left of the hotel 1 block is Times Square & to the right is 5th Ave & Rockefeller Centre. Everything is in walking distance or at the least, to a subway. We mostly used ‘Bryant Park 42nd Street Subway line’ - just 3 blocks down from Cassa or ‘47-50th Street Rockefeller Subway line’ - just 2 blocks up from Cassa but again, there are plenty situated around you. Times Square Subway Line is around a 10 minute walk & links to the majority NYC subway lines. Staff couldn’t do enough for us, very helpful & friendly.The hotel rooms are clean, good sized and include televisions, hairdryers, soap, shampoo, conditioner, shower-gel, shower-caps, iron & ironing board & large walk in power shower. Unlike other NYC hotels, you are not waiting around here to be checked in or out, or for maintenance to assist you. Staff handle issues & deal with their guests very productively. The elevators are useable at all times (no long ques unlike most other hotel in the city). There is a restaurant on sight called Butter but we mostly used the ‘Pret a Manager’ next door as this was handy at breakfast, late night for a coffee & on the go. I would absolutely recommend this hotel & stay here again! The receptionist even arranged our taxi back to the airport with short notice. Thankyou Cassa for a wonderful stay! Happy Holidays

The room was fairly basic. If visiting go for a room with at least a King Size bed. The location is excellent. Don’t be tempted to have breakfast at the Butter Restaurant below the hotel. It was awful and a rip off at $25 per head.

We were looking for a nice hotel in the area and this was a perfect choice. Close to subway, close to theater district, times square, close to everything you need. Nice staff at the hotel, easy check in and checkout.

What a great stay. The location of this hotel can’t be beat. Blocks away from everything. Everyone from management to front desk to doormen to house cleaners should get a huge pat on the back. What a great team to have. We had quite the experience during our stay that had nothing to do with the hotel but anytime we needed something we had help immediately. One thing to note when staying in this area. STAY AWAY FROM ANY CAR RIDE. Trust me, take a subway wherever you can. Midtown is impossible by car. Maybe it was just the time of year with the holidays but any Uber we took was a nightmare. Also, the hotel has a flat rate car to and from airports. Cost is less than an Uber SUV.

Perfect. We stayed here while visiting NY the week before Christmas. No breakfast at the hotel, but the location, room and service were awesome. Would stay here again in a NY Minute. Beds were clean and comfortable. Fridge in the room. Nice shower and tub. Towels were large and soft. Elevators were both working and pretty fast. Overall, great value.

the hotel is in a great location. the bed was very comfortable and room a decent size with bathroom also good. my only complaints were the breakfast which wasn't acceptable there was hardly any food on offer(!) and the carpet smelled of sick in the room(!) and the TV wasn't working (however they fixed this quickly),

We stayed in a room with a king size bed on the 28th floor and enjoyed our stay. The bathroom was good size, and the shower was wonderful. It was big and the rain shower head was a nice treat to start the day. The bed was very comfortable and room temperature was also comfortable. Nice full size ironing board. I liked having a couple bottles of complimentary water in the room as well as the lemon infused water in the lobby. It was easy to get coffee down in the lobby each morning, and a Pret A Manger next door made for a nice, simple breakfast option. The side tables near the bed were a little run down, and the iPhone player in the room was for a much older iPhone, so it was not usable (and took up a lot of space). The only other negative is that there isn't a dresser and it was a small closet, so we weren't able to take all our clothes out of our suitcases. Overall, a good room and an excellent location within easy walking distance to Bryant Park, Radio City etc. The only downside to the location is that the traffic is very heavy in mid-town. Would definitely consider staying here again.

Wonderful stay ...thank you for making this a memorable weekend in NYC the hotel is wonderful and the location is perfect everything was suburb about this hotel the room was large and clean with a wonderful bathroom

Firstly I’ll address the only poor thing. Rooms are lovely and a good size for New York but carpets and decor are looking a little tired. That’s the only negative I can think of so now for the real review:We arrived a couple of hours early expecting to have to wait around but they were waiting for us and the room was ready which allowed us to get straight out there. The sheets on the bed were pure white and soft and the bed was THE most comfortable bed I’ve slept in abroad! When I first lay on it I thought it would be too soft but it was amazingly comfortable. The bathroom was a good size with lovely full size toiletries and the shower was AMAZING!!!! Perfect for after you’ve been out all day. The one thing that stands out in this hotel is the staff. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. Doorman always asked if you needed help and the reception staff were always helpful when we asked questions. Day of departure José arranged all of our transport for us constantly calling the company to check eta. He really couldn’t do enough to help us he was brilliant - even though he couldn’t understand my accent he is a credit to the hotel! Jonathan was also really friendly and helpful and kept checking on us while we were waiting for our pick up. Unfortunately I didn’t get the doorman’s name but when our shuttle bus couldn’t get to the hotel due to traffic he picked up both our cases and said come on let’s go I’ll take you to where your shuttle is parked .... no hesitation ... brilliant customer service! The staff here make this hotel worth going to - they’re all awesome! Would I stay here again? Most definitely!

Me and my wife stayed here for a couple nights for a quick weekend getaway. The Uber ride was $38 from LaGuardia Airport. At check in we were told that we had been upgraded. But after entering the room...I could not tell what the upgrade was. It had one king bed as we paid for, a view of a water tower through our dirty window(dirt on outside only), and probably the tiniest room we've ever stayed in. No big deal though, everything in the room seemed clean. And that's all we really care about. Perhaps the desk clerk shouldn't mention getting free upgrades, because all it did was gave us false hope. The hotel seems to be pretty centrally located next to Times Square, Rockefeller, etc. If you're planning to spend any time at all in your room, you may want to opt for a larger room elsewhere. But if you're like us, and just want a clean room to sleep in at night, then this place works.

A great location. Clean and friendly. Did not eat in. A little expensive for what you get. The location is the big plus. Lots to see and do nearby. Recommend the Cick and Bull as a bar to use as a base
user_name:
John B
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Basic small rooms for price paid. Expected more, rooms were full and views were poor.Hotel staff were helpful and friendly. We were able to leave luggage due to early checkout in comparison to flights.Brilliant location - close to Times Sq and 5th Avenue

Great stay at the Cassa. Fridge , safe in room. Easy access to wi-fi.Very central , giving us easy access to everything we wanted to do/see.Coffee in lobby in mornings was extremely welcome.Staff were helpful and friendly

Excellent location, close Times Square, Broadway, Rockerfellow centre and Grand CentralLoads of bars and restaurants nearby alsoplenty metro stops or use hop on hop off busesStaff friendly and helpfulrooms cleaned everday, fresh towels etc

The hotel is close to everything, 15min walk to central park or Macys. Clean rooms, friendly staff, easy check-in and check-out. Could have been coffee available in reseption 24/7 or maybe coffee makers in rooms?

Fantastic location near to everything you want to see and easy transport downtown. The reception and staff were friendly and polite but the room was filthy and small with damage to most surfaces and items therein. Second room we moved to was clean at least but so small there was only space for one bedside table! The other side was a foot from the wall and claustrophobic! The wardrobe poked out in the middle of the room - no shelves or drawers free standing, lamp shades were split and torn and plug sockets, safe and phone didn’t work. Bathroom was great but didn’t make up for the rest of the issues! All in all, overpriced and disappointing.

Decided to spend a couple days in New York see a play and decided to book this hotel . I Camp rave more about this hotel the staff was amazing helpful courteous polite I could not recommend a nicer place to stay !

I had a few days business in NYC and chose to stay close by in this hotel. Having been to New York before there is huge choice, but some hotels are much better than others ! This falls in the 'much better' category.Welcomed by friendly staff at check in in a fairly small reception area. the room was on the 15th floor and at the rear, so the view was just of more buildings, but this is New York. The room was a fair size with room to move and store luggage. The bathroom was great with a huge walk in shower which was superb. There was a fridge in the room, which was empty, so very handy. There was no tea/coffee in the room, but was available for free each morning in the lobby.The room was very quiet, which can be unusual in NY. There are only around 6 or so rooms per floor so little noise inside, and being at the back the outside noise was limited also.There was breakfast, but I didn't try it, as there are so many great places locally, including a Pret right next door for quick coffee and pastry breakfasts.The location was great, just off 6th Ave on 45th, so very close to Times Square and The Rockefeller. The closest subway was about 5 minute walk at Bryant Park.All in all, for Manhattan, I was very pleased with my stay and would certainly go back again

This hotel is in an excellent central location to explore the city. The hotel is well presented, and the executive king room we had was spacious, clean and very quiet considering the busy main roads outside. The hotel do offer a coffee machine for the room, however they do not top up the tea,coffee, milk daily so I recommend taking your own. There is no breakfast or food room service available, which is the only thing this hotel is really missing.We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend to all.

We booked here using our points for 5 nights and it’s located centrally near Times Sq. Check in was smooth we got a room on the 24th floor. For NYC standard, it is quite spacious with good simple design. They installed a coffee machine for our room so we could make hot drinks. They even surprised my wife with some marshmallow sweets for her birthday. Overall, very happy and highly recommended.

Stayed at the cassa for 4 nights. Room was lovely and clean. Very quiet up on the 24th floor. Ideally placed for times square etc.Only recommendations could add is for tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms. It would have been nice to have an early morning/late evening drink in our room..

Small rooms very outdated furniture, not great value for money - I would suggest 2 star experience at bestNo where to unpack suitcases- minimal wardrobe space - poor service regarding making up room more of a lottery as to whether it was done or not.Poor coffee/ tea facilities

First let me say, there are TWO Cassa Hotel's in NYC. After landing LGA our driver took us to Cassa Hotel Times Square (they sound similar, yes?) NO. What should have likely been a 40min ride from the airport took almost 2 hours. Arrival & check-in at the hotel was seamless, once we got there, and the room was exactly what we had booked which was great. It was clean, beds were comfy, shower was great. I was only in town for the weekend and didn't have a need to have my room serviced. I put the 'do not disturb' on my door handle from day one. After running some errands and being out for much of the 2nd day I came back to find my room had been serviced. I was a bit upset, mainly because I don't pick all my personal items up and I just wasn't anticipating it. I told them at the front desk and they put a note on my room/account to not have it serviced the remainder of the stay. We booked this hotel rather far in advance and got a great deal on it - so it can certainly get you in a great spot, for a great price if you book early enough. I would recommend staying here again.

This hotel was set right in the heart of the city and in walking distance to a few attractions, great for shopping and eating out. The rooms were comfortable and a reasonable size, we got a great sleep in the large bed.

We spent two nights here at the beginning of the Christmas season. The hotel is located near the Rockefeller center. The staff was very friendly and helpful with suggestions for nearby amenities. The room was what they called an executive king room. It was small but adequate. The bed was comfortable and the shower was great. We did not use the exercise room but there is one available on the 10th floor.

Stayed here for a week with my partner we loved it the staff are amazing nothing was to much trouble .Room quality good with comfortable beds and fab shower.Perfectly central location right Between 5th and 6th ave easy access to metro times square . Thank you Isha Jonathan keifer and Krystal for making our 1st stay in new york great will be back again

Perfectly central location in Midtown Manhattan with easy metro access to everything on Manhattan, Brooklyn - with very friendly and helpful staff. Room quality good with comfortable beds and spacious bathroom.

Would definitely recommend this hotel, amazing location rightBetween 5th and 6th and just a few blocks away from times square. It was so easy to access everything from here. The rooms were far bigger than other new York hotels we've stayed in

My wife and I stayed for our honeymoon. Check in was a breeze and the staff provided a bottle of wine on arrival which was a really nice gesture.The front of house staff were fantastic during our stay. The location is perfect- close enough to Times Square to see everything but far enough away to avoid the chaos.The biggest disappointment came when we checked out. Despite doing a pre-authorisation for the cost of our stay plus the security deposit, a second pre-authorisation was taken out upon checkout for the cost of the stay. As a result an additional $2000 we put away for Black Friday sales is still pending as an authorisation and can’t be used, meaning we couldn’t spend money we had set aside for almost 12 months. While these things happen, the lack of urgency and support provided by the hotel after notifying them is really disappointing. They have an “it’ll eventually return” attitude without understanding that the shopping we aimed to do before leaving the US can’t be done.

I think there is a BIG story around location here -- few mins walk from time square, subway stations and major mid-town attractions. Even though the rooms are tiny, they are very well equipped for business travel. The staff was courteous enough to allow an early arrival and a late checkout even though the hotel was on max capacity.

I am surprised to see very positive comments in Tripadvisor. Becuase of positive feedback, I increased my budget and decided to stay in Cassa Hotel 45th New York. However I didn’t find anything beyond my expectation.If you want to stay in midtown area, location of the hotel is very good. It has easy access to subway. Last year I stay in Hotel St. James which is at the same street and very close. It looks like more outdated hotel but with the price performance, I would pick there instead of Cassa 45th.I know expectations in New York should be low. Nevertheless I still think room is too small. More importantly I hate the double bed in the room. It is not even queen size bed. Two person can barely sleep there. Air condition works very loud. While we were sleeping, we switched it off. On the other hand bathroom is clean and provides enough space. Ther is safe in the room and works properly. I found employees are also good.When compared to its cost, I wouldn’t pick this hotel.

Nice place. Comfortable rooms, vero cleaned. Soft pillows. Breakfast not included in the room rate, but water, coffee and tea are served at the reception.Staff always available to give directions and information.

We stayed for our honeymoon, and we had a great stay. The room was very nice, spacious and the bed was great. The bathroom was stocked with any essentials, and we always felt we could ask for anything with the staff, who was always very kind and helpful. The location, lack of an ordinary and expenssive minibar and the free coffee and tea in the morning made cassa hotel a great stay for us the entire trip.

It's a great location..walking distance to most major attractions, that's why there are any stars on this hotel! However, good location is the only good thing. Everything else lowers its rating. The room is extremely small which is still fine but it's totally outdated, cracks, dirty, dingy hallways and run down everything. It's definitely NOT a 4 star, it's more like a 2.5 or 3 star hotel AT MOST taking into consideration the room, the quality of the room, the foyer of the hotel and the level of professionalism of the workers. There was blood on the white duvet and we didnt see this until the next day since it covered with a sheet. We reported it to the concierge and they gave us a new one but i mean that's enough to make me not recommend this place.

Really nice staff. Clean room and nice bathroom but no fan. Had trouble getting a bucket of ice but other than that the service was great. Right in the middle of Manhattan so we could get anywhere we needed with a short walk.

From start to finish a wonderful stay at the Cassa Hotel. Centrally located 2 blocks from Times Square (5 min walk) we had a very warm welcome from Jonathan. A queen room, and although quite small more than enough for New York - where you are using the room as a base and somewhere to rest your head. There is a restaurant co-located to the hotel so meals are available, however you are very close to many many diners, cafes and restaurants. Very clean with tea and coffee available in the lobby 6-11am every morning. Would definitely recommend the Cassa and stay if we ever get a chance to visit NYC again.

Enjoyed our stay at the Cassa. All the staff are lovely and welcoming. The location is great, very close to Times Square, food and shopping! Also enjoyed the coffee provided in the lobby every morning.

Really enjoyed the stay and the fact that the hotel was so close to everything.The staff were helpful and the house porter in particular was very thoughtful.The gentleman who looked after the breakfast room was very attentive.

My friend and I stayed here after it was recommended to us. It is perfect for visiting everything from Central Park to Times Square (a block away) and the open top bus is nearby to get around the city. We had a warm welcome on arrival and check in was really simple. The doorman offered helpful advice and the staff told us if we needed anything at all to come back to them.The public areas are plain and unfussy and, in all honesty, a little tired but the bedrooms were quiet, sparkling clean, well laid out and there was a bottle of water in the room ($4) The toiletries were very good.We had a brilliant stay and would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat. Opposite is an absolutely wonderful cafe where you can buy breakfast to eat in or takeaway. A full buffet is on offer. They also do Twinings Chai Tea which is not available in the UK, that made me happy.I cannot recommend this hotel enough.

We booked based on some very positive reviews and its location. We were very disappointed. The hallways are brown, dark, dreary and smell and are greatly in need of refurbishing. Just a real downer every time you leave and return to your room. The room itself was ok,, but most of the furniture was badly nicked and worn. Overall, the hotel desperately needs a refurbish.

3 NIGHTS STAY, not a 5* property, 3.5 at most vastly overrated in my opinion. Tiny room, tiny bathroom, dirty carpet, filthy bathroom walls. The worst mattress we've ever slept on. No minibar, hairdryer didn't work. The only good things were its location and the staff. Would recommend the Sofitel next door, very disappointed as a silver member with Radisson. I would definitely not pay the 250-300$/night asked and would look elsewhere. ROOM 1207 Nov 09th to Nov 12th 2018

Described as a 4 star hotel, I would consider this more 3 to 3.5. The rooms are very small. Even with an upgrade, which I had to pay for, (you would think on a birthday they might provide a free upgrade but whatever), the room was still very tiny. The rep at the desk was kind enough to charge half price for the upgrade and even upgraded us to what is called the executive king room. Don’t waste your breath, nothing executive about this room at all. Please tell me how this differs from your basic level room. Disappointing because you think you’re getting luxury but you’re really not.

I was on a business trip and had meetings in the area, which is the reason I picked the hotel.I arrived late at night, was very tired and just wanted to sleep, but there was something itchy in the bed and then I saw them when I woke up - there were small insects, what I assume to be "bed bugs" - I understand it's New York City and the building is probably infested, but the hotel needs to do something about this. It's completely unacceptable!

This is a perfect location to stay if you want to stay central in upper Manhattan. You feel welcome by the staff. They are very helpful with any questions. Rooms are good with enough space for two. Even if it is central it was very quiet.

My hubby and I absolutely love this hotel. The service is top notch, the location..superb, the decor is lovely and there is even a little cafe around the corner that delivers for free. You couldn’t ask for a better place in Manhattan when it comes to quality and price. I highly recommend it. The only drawback is the rooms are quite small, but who goes to NYC to stay in their room?!

Me and my boyfriend stayed at the cassa hotel for a week whilst we were in New York. My boyfriends sister had stayed their previously and had recommended it to us. When we got there we were granted an upgrade to a queen's bed, and the service throughout our stay was fantastic. The room service was amazing it was tidied every single day to a great standard. The beds are so comfy and the shower is amazing!! The gym upstairs is also to a good standard! There was tea and coffee for free every morning and the staff were so polite and pleasant, especially crystal the receptionist, who made our visit so perfect (shes a diamond!!) Thank you to all the staff at cassa for making our first experience in New York so incredible!!

Great location in mid town and for once, a bathroom which was properly lit. Towels were poor quality. Room was small but clean. Good service. We did not eat in Butter, but it looked very good. Gym was very poor...too small, too ill equipped, too hot and not enough equipment.

Great front desk personnel, fresh water at lobby, easy access from taxi drop off, clean room, nice bedding, quite room, We got the king bed plenty of room to stretch out, two big windows fill the room with natural light. Walking distance to Time Square, Central Park, we walked as far as Madison Square Park for a Shake Shack burger.

Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 5 nights from Oct 31st- Nov 5th. The location is great! It’s close enough to time square (about 3 min walk) but far enough away to relax without the noise of time square. The hotel is right next to 5th Avenue and has many subway stations nearby to get you around. Perfect! Check in was really easy and quick. Mery helped us- she was really friendly and gave us an overview of all of the features in the hotel. Very welcoming especially as we arrived at midnight! Our room was very clean and we were happy with the level of housekeeping. There were no tea and coffee machines in the room but they had hot drink making facilities in reception in the morning along with some fruit. There is a breakfast available which you can pay for- we didn’t get a chance to try this. Check out was really simple too- Jonathan helped us and was very friendly. He made sure we had transport to the airport and organised it for us. The fact that he went out of his way to do this left us very impressed! He also offered to look after our cases while waiting for the transfer to arrive which gave us some extra time to shop and have lunch. We didn’t encounter any problems during our stay, staff were happy to help and the location was fantastic. There’s many shops nearby to grab some snacks- There’s a Walgreens on 5th Avenue and a Pret right next door. Overall we were really happy with our stay and would definitely stay here again!

The Cassa Hotel 45th Street New York didn't make too terribly great of an impression, either good or bad. A particularly small lobby and a bit of a wait for the room didn't make the best initial impression upon arrival, but the staff was pleasant and apologetic for the delay. In all fairness, the hotel was extremely busy and we were slightly early. However, since there is virtually no seating (and in our case it was raining outside) any wait can be a painful experience. The room was extremely comfortable, modern and fairly large by Manhattan standards. The climate control was excellent and outside noise was only slightly audible. A larger TV would have provided a small upgrade. The bathroom was very clean and well lit.The location is such an important role in choosing this hotel. It is truly only a couple of minutes walk from Times Square with relatively easy access to subways. I would have to suppose that parking would be a nightmare if you have a vehicle.This Cassa is worth considering if the price is right. The pleasant rooms make up for some of the other inconveniences.

Unimpressed. Staff were the best part of my stay. In a jam it will work but there are more and better options in NY, even in this neighborhood. I guarantee that the restaurant in the basement has the most expensive scrambled eggs and toast special in the country.

On October 12th I went to the webisite and BEGAN the process of booking for Thanksgiving and stopped short of hitting the confirm/submit because the reservations were noted as non-refundable. This is simply unacceptable when booking six weeks in advance. I backed out of the application and within minutes I received a confirmation email. 1) Called immediately and was told to email reservations email address. Clerk could not handle. 2) emailed thsi address. No reply. 3) Emailed another email address posted on the web site twice. No reply. 4) Called again and was told to email Fred the manger at email address given by second clerk. 5) No reply from Fred. 6) Dosputed charged with AMEX.I received no discount for the risk of a non refundable reservation six weeks out.Book at your own risk. Highly rigid and unresponsive.

Excellent centrally based hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was clean and quiet. This is an ideal place to stay in New York not far from Times Square and all the hustle, bustle and noise....but a welcome place to chill and relax after a busy day.

Maybe all you should expect from a Times Square Hotel. We found it almost as a hostel as reception was very tiny, no services or engaging staff. Of course there was staff but well few smiles or personal touch. Room ok. Bathroom very good.

can find better hotels in that price, no lobby at the hotel to relax .the service in the hotel is below the average the location is very good between the 5th to 6th avenue in 45 street.i don't recommend on this hotel

Great location, the hotel was clean and comfortable for a short business trip. Wish the hotel had a restaurant, especially for breakfast. Service was very good, close to my meetings, everything was very nice. Second stay and will come back next trip to NYC.

What a wonderful hotel couldn’t do enough for us....brought a bottle of champagne to our beautiful room....would definitely stay there again and an excellent location for Times Square....lovely shops and restaurants around the area and v near Radio City Hall

Rarely have I been treated so poorly. This hotel is just not of a good enough standard to be included in the Radisson Group. The hotel is tired, has no facilities and is just very bad value. The fact that you book via an app other than theirs means you get treated entirely differently to a Rewards Client who does. The small efforts they made to make a gesture did not make me feel like a valued guest.

We found the hotel to be very well located in between 5th and 6th Avenues. We could walk to many of the main attractions easily including the Rockefeller Centre, Grand Central, Central Park and the Empire State building. It was good value and the service was excellent.

a small but very nice place with a bathroom you rarely find in american hotels, outstanding good, very convenient bed, all in all the rooms are very small, and so therefore the preíce is too high, but nevertheless a very good expreience

Familiy stay. No upgrade offered as Radisson platinum member with 6 nights booked 5 weeks ahead. You get a low quality breakfast in a small meeting room with 3 tables- not fancy. Buffet breafast is not offered for radissaon rewards members. Rooms are small but it is NYC. Staff answers politely but cannot do much. Value for points is very average.

Excellent location in Midtown close to restaurants, theatres, shopping and time square but away from the noise. Very clean hotel with helpful front desk staff. Note there is no coffee making facility in the room but each morning is available at reception.Would definitely stay here again.

I was extremely satisfied with the service from this hotel. From the front desk to the door man to even our driver to the airport. Everyone was extremely patient, helpful and gave great advise for going around the city. Glad I was able to book this hotel through Priceline.

Was able to say here for work. What a hidden gem. From the fantastic and helpful front desk staff to the immaculate large rooms, this was the first of many stays here. Fantastic location close to Times Square and 5th Avenue and many great restaurants. Just a wonderful stay and I am thankful for the staff and a great property!

My wife and I loved this hotel. Great location! The rooms were very clean and also very quiet. Great customer service with a special shout out to Jonathan who answered all our questions with his great knowledge of the area. The hotel is a very short distance to Times Square, 30 Rock and all points in between. We had a very nice stay at the Cassa Hotel.

All the location was excellent, this hotel was very disappointing - and the worst of four hotels we stayed at on our trip of Boston - New England and New York. We changed to much better rooms, but our first were quite small, tucked round the side of the building, and had no tea/coffee making facilities.Carpets in the corridor needed replacing and were frayed. Our second room was much better with good view of buildings - but again no tea/coffee maker. We had no access to the basement bar or rooftop bar all the time we were there because they were continuously occupied for private functions. There were only a few seats by reception and so nowhere to come back to and have a chat and drink at the end of the day. On the positive side, the staff did try their best and were very helpful, and we could deposit our cases on the final day. So if you just wanted a basic room in a good location this would fit the bill, but offering poor value for money.

I went to NY for a night this past weekend for an 8 am charity event. I specifically booked this side of the city via Hotwire for the run. I arrived at 7pm the night before and was told that due to a "pipe leak" there were no more rooms, but that I had been transferred to a lesser hotel in times square. I explained that I had already paid in full and I deliberately stayed away from times square to get a good sleep for the early charity run, but no sympathy. While trying to discuss with the hotel, at least seven additional groups of people came and checked in- so clearly rooms were available, it was just my Hotwire rate that the hotel didn't like. I also went online and the hotel was still advertising rooms for sale for the same night-again, clearly not room availability that was the issue, but rather the price I had already paid, in full. The only saving grace was the manager Omar who ultimately took pity on me and found me another room in a quiet hotel in the area for a similar price at 1 am, but the whole thing was ridiculous and clearly just part of some broader scam where the hotel feels like it can pick and choose which contracts it wants to honour. To cap it off, I did make the charity run the next morning, and met a friend who had the exact same experience with this hotel- only he did accept the room at the lesser hotel in times square and was kept up all night with the noise. Never trust your booking with this place.

I redeemed 100,000 Radisson reward points for a 2 night stay, and I was disappointed. The water took a long time to get warm and we received a towel that had holes in it. The toilet also didn't flush well. I contacted Radisson when I got home because I wasn't happy with the 100,000 points and my experience. They said someone from the hotel would contact me in a few days and that hasn't happened. I will say all the employees were extremely helpful.

Hotel is in walking distance to anything you can imagine including the Port Authority & subway. Its off the beaten path of the craziness of Time Square but close enough if you so desire! The views aren't great but who is in their hotel room looking out the window anyway...you should be out experiencing everything the city has to offer...sleep at home!

We stayed here for a week in December 2017 it was a special trip for us and the hotel did not dissapoint. The rooms weren’t huge but adequate for the amount of time you are in the room absolutely spotless the bathroom however was massive in our room and was also very lovely and New. The maids did a great job. We were always happy with our service. The manager,reception staff and door security/staff were always happy to see you and give any help or guidance. The location is also perfect on the first day as we came out the door confident in our map reading skills we turned right to find times Sqaure and couldn’t find it for a while. If we had just turned left you were in Times Square, on foot in under 2 mins. We loved every second of our stay here soMuch so we’re aiming to stay again for a part of our honeymoon. Couldn’t rate the place enough.

Been staying at Cassa45’s Residence wing for over a month - what a disaster. Started with a filthy and stained sofa that took them 2 weeks to change, only for it to be replaced by a bizarre thing that looks like it was borrowed from an office waiting room. The fortnightly cleaning service is elusive to say the least. The second elevator hasn’t stopped on half the floors for 3 weeks, meaning you need to use game theory to figure out how to get the one that stops on your floor. The AC has broken down twice and most recently the hot water has broken. The front desk staff seem generally helpful and embarrassed, but the management doesn’t seem to care in the least. An absolute rip off.

Stayed here a couple of nights prior to joining a cruise. Great location for Time Square and lots more. Close to a subway, best way to get around NY. The hotel was clean and comfortable. No restaurant but one next door as well as Pret de Manger for breakfast.

Stayed for three nights and loved it. Perfectly clean and fantastic location at heart of Midtown. All staff superb but special thanks to front desk for excellent restaurant recommendations and Adam for all his help.We will be back!
