We decided to book last minute reservations for an overnight trip to NYC. We were looking for a hotel close to all (subway, Times Square and the theater.) Cassa Hotel definitely fit the bill. The staff was very friendly and helpful with suggestions of local attractions and places to dine. The only negative was the size of the room which was a little smaller than we were expecting. Overall would come back especially for the service.

Booked a room with points and was kind of disappointed, in spite of getting an upgrade to an Executive Room. About the only pro was that the hotel was conveniently located and relatively quiet. The guy at check-in was friendly, but beyond that, the front desk staff were cold at best - said "good morning" to one of them and just got a blank stare. Upon checking into the room, we were met with a kind of musty smell and the carpet felt sticky/damp. One of the built in headboard lamps was missing. No in-room coffee so you have to go down to the lobby which is a pain if you're on an upper floor. The hotel's associated restaurant has their smoking area 10 feet from the lobby door so you're greeted by cigarette smoke anytime you enter the building and the lobby reeks of stale cigarettes. Would not stay here again.

Just spent 5 days in the Cassa hotel on 45 street. What a fantastic boutique hotel just one block from T S. Rooms were a great size, very clean, plenty of towels and the staff were fantastic so very helpful, everyone of them, keep the good work up. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel

We Enjoyed our stay at the Cassa, very good location just a block or 2 away from Times Square. Rooms were clean & basic all we needed really as didn’t spend much time in the hotel. No added amenities & the staff seemed nice-didn’t really have much to do with them! Overall pleasant stay, would stay here again!.

Travelled solo, room was clean, modern and not tiny like others I’ve stayed in. The complimentary tea and coffee in the lobby was great each morning. I felt this was the best location for just getting out into the city each day. Nice staff and just no fuss. Excellent sound insulation on the windows (when they’re OPEN you hear just how loud NYC is, but when closed the room was almost dead silent. Overall a great stay, would happily book here again.

For the 2th time in this hotel. The place is in the centre where everything happens. Near 5th avenue , a subway is near, all kind of shops to buy breakfest if you don't have it in the hotel. The rooms especially the juniorsuite is big and a large bathroom. Also very clean. The personel is very helpful. A good hotel for a nice stay in New York!!

Highly recommend this hotel location great, cleanliness great, shower amazing bit the stand out for me is the staff nothing too much trouble friendly, approachable and knowledgeable. The complimentary coffee in the lobby in the morning was very welcome

Wonderful hotel, very close to Times Square, extremely clean rooms, bed sheets & towels very clean, very polite & helpful staff, not too noisy inside the hotel for saying it is very busy outside the hotel.

We have stayed at Cassa Hotel twice and will do so again next time in NYC.Great location, clean comfortable rooms and very friendly staff.Cassa is the perfect place to stay for a visit to NYC and we highly recommend it.

Please note that Cassa Residence and Hotel has a huge problem with ariconditioning in that it does not function MOST of the time .They appear to have significant maintenance problems with are not able to be addressed .This is totally unpleasant in the current high temp, high humidity NY weather !

Location is the only positive. The room was not properly cleaned at check-in as we had a leftover bottle of wine in a plastic bag, in the cabinet that would serve for a mini bar... If there was a mini bar... Remind you this hotel is rated “4 star”. We aldo had a blood stain on our bed sheets and told the front desk. They offered us nothing in compensation, not even a “sorry”. The bed was a “large twin”. Never seen that before in my life. It was also way too soft. Just plain uncomfortable. At checkout, no one asked us how our stay was. Wish they had asked. Clearly, service is not a priority at this hotel, and why would it need to be... It’s manhattan, it will get filled no matter what. This hotel is due for a downgrade.

Hotel's location is perfect as it is a block away from main touristic attractions of NYC. However the biggest issue i faced was with parking, there should be valley service which should be part of the accommodation deal. Front desk staff needs to be more warm and courteous to guests.

Nice enough boutique hotel near Times Square, but on a quieter street.Rooms were relatively small and dark, no overhead lights! We spent very little time in the hotel, so not too much of a problem.The beds were comfortable and bathroom was nice and modern (albeit small).Staff were pleasant, but not very personal.No issues - could stay here again. But would probably look to find something a bit more updated (although receptionist did say the hotel would get a big refurb next year).

We walked out of a previously booked hotel to come to the Cassa hoping that we would not be disappointed. We weren't. The place is centrally located, the staff was very kind, the rooms were comfortable and the breakfast was wholesome. however, what sets it apart is the breathtaking view of the Manhattan Skyline from the well maintained terrace garden. There was a mist in the air and it was magical.

Stayed here for 5 nights in June, check in was incredibly quick and was upgraded to a King Room. Room was of a very high standard with a lovely bathroom. Air con was a bit of an issue and at one point there were 5 people in my room trying to sort it out which they did.Also during my stay only one elevator was working but that didn't detract from my enjoyment

I booked a room for 2 nights. At 3, the room was not ready and had to wait longer. During this time, the supervisor went behind the front desk employee and reminded him to apologize for the delay and so he did (he was very indifferent initially). The employee also mentioned that they are upgrading because of the delay, but when I got to the room, it was a regular room. The air conditioner in the room did not work and it was very hot inside. I informed the front desk and they said they will fix it. After 3 hrs I went back to the same condition. I went downstairs and reminded them, they said they will send someone. After 2 hours, they called and informed me they could not fix the problem and they will send a Dyson fan for the night and I could change the room the day after. The day after, I went to a new regular room, and WHAT A SURPRISE, the same AC problem. I informed the front desk and they had to send someone to fix it (This time, it was fixed).My stay was very disturbing as the first room was too hot to sleep in and the staff were very indifferent about it. For my 3rd day, I went to a hotel few meters away and had a great stay there. You can find better hotels with much better service and comparable prices nearby.

Have just returned to UK after a stay at the Cassa. What a great find, first time in New York and a little nervous, just a short walk to 5th Ave., Times Square, Bryant Park and Rockerfeller Centre. Central Park, Union Station, Empire State Building and Macy's a little further but perfectly walkable even with arthritis. Room was not as small as made out in other reviews, certainly by European not the biggest, but perfectly adequate. Spotless rooms, clean bed linen, air conditioning a little noisy but worked really well, shower and toileteries provided, lovely bathroom bigger than ours at home. View was a brick wall but with New York street layout can't be helped, you sleep there and go out for views. Noisy street buskers but out of the hotel's hands, we were so tired after street pounding that we slept through it.Reception staff really friendly, nothing too much trouble for any of them, free hot coffee in reception from 6am and iced infused water in the afternoon. Email any printing requirements at no charge.Only gripe would be WiFi limited to 2 devices.Large tv in room, clock alarm with sub charging points.Fantastic stay and when we return to New York will stay again.

The hotel is in an excellent location with very good access to all major points. It is very clean and the hotel stuff very good and customer centric. There are some areas for improvement as the internet access to more than two devices per room as also the size of the beds. To pay 250$ per night and to only allow 2 devices per room as also to sleep 2 people in beds of 1.4m then it is totally unacceptable. Last but not least , during our stay we reported a problem in the HVAC system which it was never resolved. During our stay the days were hot and humid which consequently made the room very hot.

I was here for business. location was good for mid-town being nearer Bryant Park and just enough away from Times Square. Internet was free which is a plus. I didn't use the gym so can't comment on that. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The room was small but nice. I did have an issue with my bathroom one night but the staff took care of it immediately and put me into another room. They provided me with a few complimentary items to make up for it. Overall a good stay.

I spent some time researching places to stay for our trip. Booked Cassa based on some previous reviews. Paid that little bit extra as I thought we were getting something for our money. Wrong ... The location is fine if you want to be by times square. However, not so great if you want a decent nights sleep. We could hear some kind of street music playing constantly outside. It was so annoying. Couldn't see exactly where from as the view from the room was a brick wall. The front desk staff were nice. No toilet in the lobby, you have to take the lift up numerous floors. Our room smelt musty and the carpets were outdated. Shower was nice and spacious. Bathroom door nearly took my finger off plenty of times - dangerous. Lights didn't work properly. The light in the little hallway didn't work and the large corner lamp didn't work either so found the room to be dark and even more dingy. I know it's new york but for a 4 star rated hotel I expected so much more. No fridge as it had been ripped out of the wall. A very small hotel which I was expecting so much more from. Couldn't even try the restaurant as it was being used for private functions. I would go back to my first choice and stay in the Ameritania if I ever returned.

Great hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful. Not the biggest rooms in NY but more than adequate to meet our needs. Clean and in a fantastic location. Excellent value for money. Would use this hotel again.

My overall experience is bad starting with the fact that they only have one credit card machine that couldn't authorize my card because it doesn't ask for pin. I had to pay in cash, bearing in mind that the same card was used before in another NYC hotel without any issues and was used earlier in the US during the same trip.Although I got really nervous, the front desk staff contained my anger and remained very professional.I checked into my room, it was plain awful, it didn't even have a mini bar. That was it for me, I asked for the manager, he wasn't there, they have me his card I wrote an email to Mr Jermaine with my complaint on 11 August 2018, to this day, it remains unanswered. A gentleman from the front desk moved me to a better room, no thanks to the Mr Jermaine. The new room was better but still left a lot to be wished for.The hotel was built so cheaply, there are no signs to tell you the directions for rooms according to number, the toilet seats are in a funny place, you cannot sit and then close the door. Water is for 4 dollars per small bottle but then there's nothing in the mini bar. My room was on the fifteenth floor but the street noise was ever so present.I'm certainly avoiding this hotel in my next visits.

I've stayed at Cassa several times and have never been disappointed. The staff is always eager, friendly and helpful. The rooms are great size, modern and clean. The location can't be beat. No matter the reason for my visit, Cassa is always my first choice when staying in NYC.

A good hotel very close to Times Square. I found the staff friendly and helpful and the room was clean and comfortable with coffee and tea provided. I slept well. The gym was small with limited equipment.Not cheap, but I would stay there again.

The hotel was excellently positioned for everything in Midtown Manhattan and the room was clean and comfortable. Best of all, however... the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful - a great place to stay in NYC!

The location/price combination made me a bit sceptical before arriving at the hotel, but it turned out to be great value. The hotel is just as nice as the pictures indicate, the room reasonably sized given the location, nicely decorated and well laid out. The staff was super helpful with good advice and getting us sorted to the airport after the stay. I´d definitely go back there.

Where to begin? This was our first trip to NYC and it formed part of our honeymoon. We arrived Saturday 4th August and were met with lovely reception staff who as we were on honeymoon upgraded our room! We thought that was a lovely gesture, the room was large, big bathroom, slight view of Times Square; however the room was like a sauna!! The air-con simply didn’t/doesn’t work on higher floors as this was on the 26th floor. We complained and the manager offered a refund of 25%(which we are still waiting on)due to ground work causing water pressure issues?? The second night was even worse and after me going to reception at 4am they agreed to move us the following day. On Tuesday they moved us into the 20th floor and, the air-con was incredible!! The room was even slightly nicer than the previous one and they moved our bags etc for us however it was just a pain repacking cases etc for the move. The staff to be fair were lovely, the hotel is fairly nice - no frills really but ideally situated for central NYC. I’d stay again, providing I’m assured the air con is working before I get to my room. Finally, can the manager action our 25% refund as promised as virgin holidays have no notice of this yet and we’ve been home over a week. For record we were booked into room 2008 in the name of Lawson. Thanks

This is a nice hotel. It is well decorated and the room was clean and comfortable with a spacious bathroom. We received an upgrade to a superior room, so thank you for that! The location is great if you want to be in the thick of everything, but man, it's busy around there! I'm glad we were on an upper floor so the noise was fairly distant. Bring earplugs though to be on the safe side! I would have given 5 stars except for the fact that the shower would not stay hot. By the time the two of us had finished showering, it was stone cold. Staff were fantastic - helpful and friendly. I would probably stay somewhere quieter again if I came back to NYC, but that's just personal preference.

Went to New York for a couple of days on our way home from L A and had a great stay. The location is fantastic, staff is friendly, rooms are nice and modern. Nothing to complain about. Can really recommend it to anyone that want to be in Manhattan in the middle of things.

In the past few years, my husband and I have been fortunate to be able to vacation in NYC once a year or so, and since we found Cassa, we haven't stayed anywhere else. The location is absolutely perfect for us because we come to the city primarily to see live theater and eat at places like Le Bernardin...and we can walk to both. The hotel is also close to terrific shopping, Rockefeller Center, and Grand Central (as well as other subway/bus stops). It is also very quiet. We've never heard any of our neighbors, and I really like the idea of a smaller boutique hotel where the staff gets to know us during the week. The area is also full of great casual places to eat, like the Pret a Manger almost next door, the Strip House for steaks on 44th, and DB Bistro Moderne around the corner on 44th, one of our go to places to eat. The rooms are fairly comfortable, though the mattresses are miserably hard and need an upgrade. The housekeeping was terrific and responsive, and all of the staff were quick to help when they could. We were in NYC during a heat wave, and the first night our room temp wouldn't go below 80--but the hotel moved us the next morning to a different floor and we were fine after that.

Excellent hotel with friendly and qualified staff to ensure our city trip was great. Relatively large rooms for NY. You experience the ambition of the staff to make sure you are comfortable during your stay.

This was our first time in New York and thanks to the staff at Cassa on 45th (particularly Jonathan and Adam) when, not if, we come back we will stay with them again. Superb customer service, great location, wonderful rooms, and... GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!

I recently had the pleasure of visiting New York for a few days. I stayed in the Cassa hotel. Location is probably unbeatable as it is within walking distance of most of the attractions in Mid town. The room is spacious and the facilities are good. The staff are helpful and friendly. Should I return to New York in the future, I would stay in the Cassa again.

When I checked in the A/C wasn't working and the room temp was 81 degrees. Front desk sent maintenance engineer to fix the problem. He reboot the system and left. The reboot didn't fix the problem and the room temp stayed at 81 degrees all night. I asked for a fan since another room was not available. They promised to send on up, but never did. When I spoke to the front desk the next morning they promised to have the manager contact me, but he/she never did

beautiful place would recommend just need better parking and all rooms need refridgerators overall expierience was awesome staff was great will be back the Cassa hotel in new york will see me and my family again

Loved this Hotel, location is 1 block from times square and the staff are so welcoming . Rooms not massive but all you need for a good nights rest. Would def use again! Ask for a high level floor as Its pretty loud out there!

Wonderful staff. They were so helpful in offering directions and good places to eat and visit. Room was small but most are in the city. It was fully updated, very clean and it is in a perfect location for visiting New York!

We spent the weekend at this understated hotel and found it to be very convenient - one block from Times Square - and reasonably priced. Rooms are clean and not tiny as some NYC hotels. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Solid recommendation.

Lovely hotel in a perfect location. Ideal for visiting the main sights of NYC, just minutes from Times Square. Very comfortable bed, great shower, nice decor and very clean. Would definitely recommend for a city break!

Great location! Quiet nice rooms with good beds and the bathrooms have big showers, NO showercurtains (hate those) and are nice and bright. The staff was friendly and helpful and placed us in rooms next to each other as requested, that was nice.

I always stay at the Cassa. Very close to Times Square. Great staff. Great value for the money.I stay here frequently for business, and the whole staff makes me feel at home when I come to stay. I would chose them over cheaper hotels that are closer to my office—and there are a couple—because of the way the staff steps up to make me feel like a welcome member of a family.

Front desk was super friendly and helpful, but the facilities do not reflect a 4 star hotel. Had I known this, I wouldn’t have paid the price for this hotel. Worst experience was the keepers not changing our dirty bedsheets (after making our room). I asked front desk to get the keepers to change our bedsheets, only to find thst they’re still the same dirty sheets at night. Annoying!

Worst experience I have ever had in my life of travelling and hotel staying.I travelled for work and my company had booked my hotel for me. On Friday I thought I was checking out so I pack my bags and go to the front desk and tell them I’m checking out and they tell me that my company had actually booked until Saturday. I’m like “oh ok, I will confirm with them that’s if fine and if it’s not I’ll call you during the day”.The conversation ends with the front desk guy telling me that he would have my luggage brought back to my room.At night I get back to the hotel, get to my room with my key, get in and my luggage is not there.I go down back to the lobby and explain them the situation and the answer is “madam you asked to be checked out so we checked you out”. They basically forced my check out while that was not the arrangement and offered me to reinstate my reservation at 50$ (so nice!!!). Plus i got into a room of somebody else with my still working key (kudos to security!!). It is unbelievable that a hotel (customer centric business) is even capable of doing something like this.

Business traveler here with Platinum RR status.Check-in was very quick and efficientRoom exceeded my expectations for in terms of size and amenities. It did not have a desk lamp which I had to request.Clenliness: top notchIn room welcome gift: present and a handwritten note - very nice touch!Bathroom: spacious with big toiletry bottles, but had a rather unpleasant smell of clogged drain or sth similar which i got used toSelection of teas, coffee machine and cream providedSoundproofing - good, no outside or guest noiseBreakfast: ok overall, but not much choice, only two or three dishes you can have, definitely bit below Radisson standards in terms of variety.Check-out was very quick and efficient.Would I return? Yes, with pleasure.

Hadn't visited this hotel previously, took a recommendation from a friend and glad we did ! Just off Times Square, the location is perfect for a wide variety of attractions and we have used this as a base for 5 days of exploring in Manhattan, Brooklyn and Queens. Clean, staff super friendly, internet connection is strong and supports two devices per room on standard tariff - very important factor for anyone travelling with kids as I'm sure you know. The rooms are modest in size, but functional, clean, modern and the bathroom is high spec fittings, Radisson has achieved a good outcome with this unit. I also had the pleasure of meeting many of the Radisson execs whilst staying here - pleased to say all very friendly, especially Michael who treated me like the most important guest - very flattering ! Coffee is great, available in reception in the mornings from early doors - free papers and the TV is high spec cable. Downstairs there is a fine dining option with Butter - a quality venue and last night the venue was hosting one of many corporate functions. Noise levels are not an issue - we were on fl. 24 and aside aircon, couldn't hear a thing - not bad for a hotel close to Times Square. In short, exception value for money and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this to anyone seeking a 3-5 day stop-over.

No room service..no vending machine..no ice machine..no coffee in room...no breakfast available . Standard hotel amenities are absent. The rooms are fairly quiet. There too many other hotel options in the area to miss any these marks.

This is a great little spot very convenient to much of what NYC has to offer. I checked in later at night and they gave me a very nice little suite with a sitting area and a bedroom. The bathroom was HUGE by NYC standards. Water pressure and temp were great. The bath products were excellent. Bed was comfy and clean. Front desk staff was helpful but not hovering. Coffee and whatnot was in my room, but they also had it available in the lobby. This is not a frills hotel, but is more than sufficient for most people visiting the city. Free wifi for up to two items.

We stayed at this hotel (room 401) from 13th to 16th July. The hotel is ideally located in walking distance from the majority of sites we wanted to visit.The check in and out was very quick and no queues. The staff were friendly and helpful.The room was a good size, we paid for a deluxe room with Queen sized bed. The bathroom facilities were good.However, I was surprised to find my safe on the floor next to our bed that could be picked up and moved. I raised this with reception who were surprised and said it should be in our cupboard and would send someone up. They never arrived. I went back to reception and spoke to a different person who claimed all rooms had safes that weren’t fixed to a surface. They added that someone couldn’t leave hotel with safe as staff watched people leaving and they had cameras and how the safe was fitted with a deadlock so couldn’t be opened if taken out of the hotel. That wouldn’t help me if our passports and other valuables were in it, regardless if they could open the safe, I wouldn’t get my valuables back. We carried our valuables everywhere which was a pain. To be fair the cupboard was too small to fit the safe in so it was lucky we were only staying for a weekend. There were no tea making facilities in the room but you could get tea from reception in the morning and ice cold water at other times.The rooms has sound proofing so you don’t hear the noise from the street but you could hear every conversation from the room next door and those walking in the corridor. However we were only woken once by guests at 4am who were walking in the corridor so not too bad.

Stayed in this hotel with my family , the front desk staff were very polite . We stayed in a suite . Rooms were clean , Internet connection was not very good .Location is great , steps away from Times Square area.Good hotel but there was no complimentary water provided in the rooms . I wish like most hotels they should at least offer some complimentary water in the rooms .

This is a very clean cut, modern hotel. The location is great being minutes from great locations such as Times Square and subway stations to get anywhere you want in NYC. The entire city is at your fingertips. The front desk service can be a bit slow, but that’s to be expected with just 1 person working and 1 taking luggage. They always had water infusions and current newspapers and flyers in the lobby. Hot tea and coffee were available there each morning as well. If you’re looking for a clean and quiet hotel, look no further!

Excellent hotel. Clean rooms, nice staff. Would be happy to stay at this hotel again in the future.Bathroom is large. Hotel is quiet. I’d recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a nice, clean hotel in NY.

TThis was my first stay at Cassa Hotel 45th. Don't confuse this location with the other Cassa location. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was average in size for New York. The bedroom and bathroom was very clean and comfortable. I stayed in the deluxe king room which is perfect for two people. It is a very short walk to the theater district, 5th Ave shopping and restaurants. The elevators are very fast. The staff is above excellent in friendliness and service. Upon check in, I asked about water for the room, the front desk clerk immediately gave us two bottles of water complimentary. Each time we entered or exited the property, the front desk staff acknowledged us and spoke. We will come back again.

My family came to NYC on the end flight from Italy for two days but after staying at the Cassa Hotel I know that when I am in New York I have found where I will be staying Cassa here I come. A wonderful place to stay and well centered and only the 1 train to the University. The hotel manager and guest services are great.
user_name:
Lyoness W
Rocky Mount, North Carolina

review_body: Overall great experience:+ Service. The staff at Cassa is like an island in a sea of people. They were are friendly and helpful.+ Location. In the center of everything. Minutes walk from theaters, Time Square, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Station, Theaters+ Very clean.+ Well appointed, functional room.+ Excellent wifi+ Recognized as Radisson Rewards member and received complimentary upgrade.I would stay at this hotel again in the future and recommend it to my friends.

This is a small hotel that is conveniently located. Mostly like every other NY hotel. Decent rooms which are airy,clean and purposeful,though the beds are unbelievably small. Spacious and usable toilets. The staff is mostly helpful. Tenzin and Jonathan at the front desk were courteous, approachable and a pleasure to deal with.Jonathan the technician was super helpful and went out of his way to see ifsome how he could get our non-working AC to work in 85 Degrees. Here is what happened. The AC in our room stopped working at 7.30 PM. No issues, things like these happen. I called the front desk and they send in a technician who tried to work on the unit in our room but said that it needs to be done from the outside. Again no issues. One hour passes and he is still working. Okay, things take time. It is over 85 degrees in the room by now. Finally at around 9.30 PM I go downstairs to see what is happening and the manager named Omar says that they are still working on it and that I need to wait. Finally at 10.15 after repeatedly trying to get answers ( all this while he behaved as if nothing was wrong) he tells me that yeah the AC is not going to work so we ll have to do with fans which he will provide. I told him that the room is full of the gaseous smell from the AC he said that he can give us an exhaust fan for circulation.I asked him to shift us somewhere else as we had a long 24 hour international flight the very next morning but he denied saying no rooms were available . I then asked him to shift us to a different hotel for the night as it is impossible to sleep in that room. And he ignored and left.Fuming, we finally decided at 11.00 to pack our bags and leave. Only after I had to put my foot down and have the front desk call him to the lobby ( he refused to come downstairs and wanted to talk on the phone) he said that he managed to get us a room at a nearby 3 star hotel.Waiting for him with 5 large bags, he explains us the way to the new hotel from the lobby and leaves. No taxi, no bell boy nothing. Thanks to the front desk in-charge Tenzin who helped us with our luggage and taxi. And Oh, when I told him that this is going to reflect in my review online he says thats okay. A perfectly decent hotel completely let down by 1 man.

This was our second stay here (first was 5 years ago) and it was fine this time, certainly not as good as the first stay. Staff tried their best, including the manager, to accomodate us as it wasn't their mistake. The room's AC was very loud and it couldn't be fixed so they moved us to another room which didn't have a fridge/minibar. They did bring one when we told them as we had a toddler with us. Then when they arranged airport transfer which came late. It was a list of things that didn't go right for some reason but not really the staff fault most of the time.Now the good things, the location is fantastic. Few minutes walk from Times Square, few minutes from 5th avenue and Grand Central station. The rooms are well apponted including the beds/pillows which were excellent (other than the noisy AC in the first room).Overall, I still give it a thumbs up.

A small and understated lobby belies the spacious hotel rooms above at the Cassa. The concierge was very friendly and helpful throughout our stay, which helped make it very enjoyable, and although a tiny glitch here and there presented itself at times with the A/C, the awesome rain shower, attached sprayer, and consistently temperatured water in the nice bathroom was like a bonus trip to the spa-- especially after a 100-degree day on the streets below. The fridge in the room was also nice, and actually worked well! Great location, in close walking distance to Times Square, but quietly removed from the noisy, crowded madness. Great value found for the online promotional price paid!

Enjoyed my stay, the room was cleaned and well prepared for my stay. Big tv and comfortable bedding, nice bathroom and quiet place to spend a night. Would definitely recommend this place. Have not had a chance to eat at the restaurant, but I hope I will do next time!

If you're on 45th, you're a 15 minute walk to Central Park if the lights are on your side. You're 2 minutes from Bryant Park and the Library, near the shops and you back on to Butter, a great restaurant for all occasions. The check-in was a little slow, but that was all. The room was great, with a decent amount of space and a comfy bed. I called down for a European plug adapter and had one at my door within 10 minutes. The shower was great and the bathroom was really well presented. The bed was comfy, but for feather pillows, and whilst the aircon was a bit of a nightmare to get right, it was only my fault for messing around with it - as it was fine when I arrived. Wifi was easy to connect to and had decent speeds and upgrade options. The gym has a couple of cardio machines, some free weights and assisted cables. Some apples and ice water for you, as well. 99% sure the cleaners accidentally cleaned up my padlock for my suitcase, but otherwise a great experience and somewhere I'd likely visit again.

I booked 2 rooms for 3 nights and stayed here on 6/29, 6/30 and 7/1. We did a late check-in @ 8:30 pm and it was a breeze. Were given 2 rooms on the same floor and the bell boy assisted us with our luggage (tipped him of course). The front desk also gave me a coupon for parking on the adjacent street for 50$ a night, without the coupon it’s 75$ a night. After checking in to our rooms and the luggage dropped off, we turned on the AC in both the rooms, freshened up and went out for dinner thinking by the time we get back to the room it would cool down. Note, the 3 days we stayed in New York, there was a heat wave and record temperatures. After we came back from dinner, one of the rooms was still hot and the AC doesn’t seem to be working. Tried to call the front desk and the phone didn’t work. So, I went down and complained to the girl at the front desk about the AC and the phone not working. She sent a maintenance guy right away to look at it. He worked on the AC for 10/15 minutes, did a reset and the AC started to blow cold air. He couldn’t fix the phone as he said the phone in this and another room has been down for a while (from the day before) and they’ve already put a work order for it. Frustrated on being given a room that has no AC and phone, I told him that I am not worried about the phone not working as long as the AC works to which he said, “he fixed the AC and it will take some time for the room to cool down”. Within 5 mins after the maintenance guy left, the AC stopped blowing cold air. I went downstairs again to the front desk and politely requested the girl to move us to another room as the AC doesn’t work in the room and it’s very hot (81F, see pic) and I can’t keep going up and down as it’s already 11:30 PM at night. The girl understood my frustration, acted very professional and called her manager Omar, who came to the front desk after 5 mins. This is when things got really ugly. I told Omar what the problem is and that we wanted another room as it is 81F in the room, to which he casually said, they are sold out for the night. I asked him what my options are, as my elderly parents cannot sleep in that hot room, to which he said, he would have a “Dyson” fan (stressed on the make as he said Dyson fan 2-3 times) put in the room that will cool down the entire room. I said I am aware of what a Dyson fan is and it is not the same as AC, because if it is, no one would spend money on getting AC and instead use a “Dyson” fan. Over the course of this conversation I also said that I am not paying full room rate if the only option is to use a fan to which he said, “I haven’t charged your card yet and you are more than welcome to leave if you want to”. When I heard it, I lost my patience and told him that it was very unprofessional on his part to say something like that and he doesn’t own the property. I insisted on talking to his manager. He gave his managers card and said the manager is out over the weekend and the only person I have to deal at this time is, him. He acted like he was on a power trip. I took his managers card and told him that this is absolutely the worst customer service that I’ve ever seen from a manager and I can’t believe that his management has left the property to be run by such an incompetent person. Coming into his senses and realizing what he said "asking the hotel guests to leave at midnight and find another hotel" was absolutely wrong, he toned down a bit and said he will work it out with me the next day as he has no information on my booking. I asked him to pull up my booking information on the computer in the front desk and he came up with the dumbest excuse or should I say, another lie that his IT team has not fixed his credentials yet for him to be able to log on to the front desk computer and he has to go downstairs somewhere for that. Thinking in my mind I’ve had enough of this person I just asked the girl to put the fan (see pics) in the room and I’ll deal with this situation the next day. The next morning, I got a call from a gentleman named Patrick who was very polite and professional in the way he spoke. He told me that he came to know about the problem I had the night before and has called me to set things straight. He upgraded us to suites for the rest of the stay and also gave us a free breakfast voucher for a day. I made it clear to Patrick that it’s not about free upgrades and vouchers, it comes down to treating your guests in a professional way. Being in service industry, you should earn our business and not make us a hostage to the situation and ask your guest to leave at midnight. He acknowledged that it was very wrong on their part to say something like that and apologized on Omar's behalf. A true professional. I would have given this hotel a one star rating if not for Patrick. Coming to the property it is centrally located and I would recommend it and will give 4 stars (one star removed because of the robe with hole, see pic), as long as you don’t have to deal with people like Omar.

The A/C was broken in our room the first night we arrived. The front desk sent men to fix the problem not once, not twice, but THREE times before offering to move us to a different room. When we complained the second time, we were told to keep our fingers crossed about the A/C being on when we returned home that night. Before moving us to a different room on time number three, Patrick at the front desk told us that they were

We asked for two rooms together but we were not even on the same floor. Hotel is in an excellent position but in both our rooms there was a problem with the air conditioning which we reported numerous times. On last day one of our bags went missing for 25 minutes! There is no policy or procedure in place to deal with missing bags. Eventually it was found but we nearly missed our airport shuttle. The televisions in the rooms are brilliant and it is great as there is a small fridge that can be used. Bottled water though is $4 for a small bottle is purchased from hotel so best to get own. The hotel is very quiet which is lovely but the air conditioning is a problem. When on it is very very noisy but we had quiet a few nights where it was on and noisy but not working. Room was about 80 degrees (the thermostat in the room tells you this) which made it hard to sleep. A simple remedy would be to have some dyson fans available for hot periods when air conditioning seems over whelmed! I would have said that I would return as the hotel is in a great position. But when my bag went missing at the last minute the way it was dealt with was terrible. I was advised all bags etc are under CCTV so I suggested we watch this to see where it was put, but only the manager can, and it was his day off! Surely the duty manager should be able to do this! It certainly would have helped me find my bag more quickly, without all the stress I went through. Maybe I was unlucky but I also got bitten by something every night so came home with 7 or 8 bites!

We picked the Cassa hotel on 45th Street and 6 Ave off a third party website. It was a great deal. We were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel room. It was super clean and had everything we needed. We stayed in the standard room, it wasn’t big but it was definitely enough for NY. You should spend your time on the streets not in the hotel room. That being said the standard bed is smaller than a queen but not as small as a double. It is kind of in between. We are pretty average size people so it was just fine for us. We asked for a complimentary upgrade but it wasn’t granted. No worries. Checkin: it wasn’t fast by any means the lobby is small and doesn’t offer anything in the way of a relaxing seating area. There is coffee and water available but that is it. There also isn’t a dedicated concierge. This is something we really missed. We had been to NY before but it is always nice to ask questions. Yes you could ask the clerks but they were always helping checkins Staff: the staff was polite, both the clerks and the maintenance staff. Everyone said hello and wished us a good day. Elevators: previous posts complained about the elevators but we didn’t have any problems. We would leave in the morning come back in the afternoon and then leave again for the night and not once were the elevators slow or not working. Area: the hotel is in a great area of New York. You will be in close walking distance from NBC studios and the Today show. You are a few blocks from Time Square, Central Park and 5th Ave. The subway is on 42nd street which opens up Manhattan, Brooklyn, and Queens to you. Eats: on 46th street just through the park is 2 Bros Pizza. The absolute best pizza in NY. 2 cheese slices and pop $1.99. Breakfast check out Pick a Bagel on 8th and 53rd. They have the best breakfast sandwich on awesome bagels. Enjoy NY!

Perfect location for transportation around the city. Nearby restaurants and fun partof town. Don't miss the lovely outside sitting area on the tenth floor. Beds comfortableand shower is super. Rooms were clean. Recommend.

My recent stay with you was not very good at all. The high point for the hotel is your staff, they seemed very professional and pleasent to me when I spoke to them about the issues my wife and I encountered. The person at the front desk when we were checking out took care of our transportation to the airport. It was a very nice gesture. Now for the bad, as I have been made aware there were AC issues with the hotel. We were impacted and were very uncomfortable at night as our room was 80+ degrees. We moved rooms and the AC was not working in that room either. The AC was also broken in the gym. The TV was not working in our room as well and there was no wet bar in the second room we stayed in (room 2004) and the refrigerator was not working. It was hard to rest during my visit as I was laying in bed literally sweating.

I originally arrived at this hotel for five nights with friends, and then also had family meet up with us. The first room we had was four friends in one room with two double beds. We had no problem with space and the bathroom was lovely and large. However due to one friend becoming ill two of us got our own room and that was fantastic as well. The staff were so accommodating and so helpful when I approached them asking for another room. They bent over backwards to accommodate me and it was very much appreciated. My sisters were also very happy with their room. The beds were comfortable, no outside noise was heard and the room size was generous. The location of this hotel was also great. Only a block or two from Times Square, with some great eateries and convenience stores nearby. When I visit New York again I will definitely, 100% be staying at this hotel again - I will not stay anywhere else.

My husband and I booked a room for 2 nights at Cassa 45th for our first visit to New York City. It was in a great location - just 3 blocks away from Times Square and Bryant Park. Minutes away from Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, Subway stations in 2 directions, and easy to stop in food stops (Pret a Manger, Starbucks, NYC eateries) and bars/pubs. We arrived early and the concierge took our bags for storage until our room was ready. Check-in was super easy when we went back and we stayed in a room on the 20th floor. I liked this hotel because there were only 5-6 rooms/floor and the elevators were super fast. It is definitely a "no frills" hotel - no breakfast or amenities (gym only) but it was perfect for our stay. The room (king bed) was small, but very clean and very comfortable for us. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely consider staying here again!

Very good experience. Excellent location between 6th and 5th avenue. Clean and comfort room. The Staff was very kind and helpful.My only complain is that there was no minibar at my room. Many breakfast options near the hotel. I extremely recommend

We arrived late and very tired, expecting the +4 star accommodations that we though we were looking and paying for . Instead, we were greeted by a room that was 54F and freezing ( verified by the attending house engineer, and which took 2hrs to fix!!), a shower that would not drain the water on the floor ( actually backing up the previous filth ), and the management that didn't want to relocate us to a different room. As well, the internet was not working well at all, even though that was one of the amenities that we requested at booking.

Outstanding location, at 45th and 6th Avenue. Next to Pret-a -Manger and 1/2 block from Potbelly Sandwiches. Service was good, and if you have tickets to Broadway, then this is a place to be. Had 1 day of air conditioner out, but response overall was good.

The hotel is very nice, comfortable, staff are pleasent, location is excellent and a price is fine for the New York and for that location. Room is big enougth and very clean, interier is basic, but good enought.

Had a very nice stay here, for 6 nights in June (work + weekend). The rooms are nice and comfortable, larger than your New York average. no noise from street level. Loved the location being close to Bryant Park. The people are also very nice. Really enjoyed the stay and will consider again if coming back to NYCA few things to be aware of:- only 2 elevators for a 40+ floor building, and the staff use them for servicing rooms... so be patient with the elevator- wifi is patchy and keeps dropping- during weekend, the room cleaning is in the late afternoon

The Cassa Hotel is well worth a visit. The staff are friendly, helpful and welcoming. The rooms are cleran and beds comfortable. Its not the best for dining but there is a restaurant there which is good and Pret A manger down the road for breakfast / lunch

This is a perfect spot for a trip to the theater district. Staff service is excellent from check in to check out. The rooms are quiet and comfortable. We slept great! They recognized our rewards club membership and had welcome gifts for us.

My Wife and I stayed here for a week and the hotel was in an ideal location. Just down from "Times Square" but still very quiet, The Staff were very helpful, friendly and efficient. The room was quite small but clean. Only problems we had were that the smoke alarm had an intermittent fault which, despite trying, the maintenance didn't manage to fix, the air conditioning was a bit noisy and one of the 2 lifts broke down mid week and still had not been sorted by the time we left. This meant that you had to wait a long time to get up and down from your room. I would also have liked to have seen tea/coffee facilities in the room as going up and down to the reception to get a drink was a pain.

Very clean hotel in the heart of Manhattan, if you are looking to stay 4-5 blocks from times square this is perfect for you. Subway accessible, close to museums, tons of restaurants, central park (like a 10 block walk- 15 min)

The hotel is just a couple of block from both Bryant park and Times Sq .. but the property is little run down and rooms are small .. floors above 27 are residential so guests may have to wait a long time for elevators .. During my stay one of the elevators was broken and the one that was working was being shared with Construction and maintenance crew.
user_name:
Varun G
Bedminster, NJ, United States

review_body: The room I was given was worn down, broken furniture, very few power outlets, bad design, not cleaned properly in the bathroom. Elevator was broken during the entire start leaving only one to service 20+ floors, thus long waiting. Construction outside and multi-tasking at check in made it a bad experience, very far from any Radisson standard I have experienced prior to this. Cannot recommend it at all. Value for money is lousy.

Excellent location, friendly and informative staff good clean rooms. Short walk to broadway and subway. Close to 6th and 5th Avenue for shopping also good outdoor plaza across the road and a short walk to Bryant oark

We chose Cassa due to its proximity to the Walter Kerr Theatre. We used points for one free night and paid for the second night. They had to re-key us for the second night, as they hadn’t set us up for two consecutive nights in the same room, until we pressed for it. Desk personnel were very professional. At $265 per night we thought we’d experience a bit nicer lobby, a doorman or bell to help with bags in and out of the hotel, or even a few amenities like a restroom in the lobby (instead it was a second elevator ride to the 10th floor, which was shabby). There’s no bar (the adjacent Butter was closed for private events). The elevator system was probably the most frustrating aspect: only 1 elevator working for our visit for ALL hotel guests AND the housekeeping and maintenance staff. Slowed us down considerably. Beds and pillows were quite comfy, and the bathroom clean, and fresh. As a points member we received two free bottles of water. Bottled water after that is $4 each. When we booked and saw this room goes for as high as $600 we thought this would be a swanky boutique hotel. It’s nothing special, even at $235.

I booked this room for a business trip to NYC and brought my wife along. We enjoyed the stay here, overall. It was very close to where I needed to be and very close to other places of interest in Mid-town. The staff were courteous and pleasant. The bellman went above and beyond to accommodate our needs both when arriving too early to check-in and when departing much later than check-out.There were a few cons that are worth mentioning. The restaurant in the downstairs of the hotel is extremely overpriced for what you get. The pillows in the room were flat and saggy. Not comfortable at all. We asked for some more pillows, and they were fairly prompt in bringing them and allowing us to choose, but it still wasn't very comfortable. The heater was also a bit dusty, which was not fun for my allergies.However, it was a nice stay for the week we were there, and the helpfulness of the staff made it very memorable for us.
user_name:
Tim M
Grants Pass, Oregon, United States

review_body: Stayed one night for a show, and had a good deal on Travelzoo ($277 for a king room inc. taxes). We were warmly greeted and checked in by Omar, who introduced us to his co-workers Krystal and Cesar. Unlike many places where you feel like employees are going through the motions robotically these folks were real people! They apologized in advance and at the end of the stay for one of the elevators being out of order which did cause delays getting to the room but not down from it.Omar acknowledged that we had requested a hypoallergenic room and in fact I think he was the one who answered the phone when I called to request it. I have not had good experiences with Radisson brand in the past and was worried that this would get lost in the shuffle of a big chain notation and especially through a third party booking, but he made it happen. The room was standard NYC sizing- but the bathroom was really big with nice bath products, lots of counter space and rain shower. Bed was a bit too soft for my personal taste, but it was comfortable and we slept well. The sheets were crisp and not scratchy. Also there was a big umbrella in the closet, this is a nice touch. Usually you have to ask for one and hope one is available if it rains. Fortunately we didn't need to use it.No noise during the night. I had fully intended to check out the gym...but you know how that goes ha! Near a subway stop if needed and a stone's throw from all of the theaters. Fruited water in the lobby made up for the $4/bottle in room (editorial comment --come on hotels- please get real on this- I just wrote a GLOWING review of another hotel and complimentary water had a lot to do with it!)Parking was in a self park lot around the corner- voucher for $40, we had compared via SpotHero and the hotel pricing was actually the least expensive. No problems or issues with using the voucher. A nice place to stay for one or two nights in the Times Square area.

The staff was very welcoming and helpful. The room was very clean and simply decorated. There is a free breakfast which was typical free hotel breakfast food. Ample supply and several choices. We also went to the bar for the wine hour. We were only given one small glass of wine which was fine as we were on our way to a show. The location is close to restaurant row and Broadway shows. Not the greatest area but we felt safe walking at night. There is a lovely rooftop (no bar) and we took up a bottle of wine and enjoyed the views of Empire State Buidling.

Just come back from a 5 night stay at this hotel. The positives are it’s in a great location, has nice helpful friendly staff, clean rooms and room rates that are reasonable for NYC. The negatives are that the Standard and Queen bedrooms are on the lower floors with no views. They are small and dark, but if like us you aren’t spending much time in the room, not a major problem. What is a problem, is that there is no space to even hang a shirt properly in the tiny cupboard provided as a closet. Not ideal, but I would still recommend this hotel for anyone staying in NYC, but to choose a King bedroom on the higher floors, which we where informed by staff, have bigger rooms and much more closet space. Also on checking out, the hotel receptionist kindly offered to arrange our a private car to JFK with a company with which they have an agreement. He said it would be a flat fee of $75 payable to the driver, which included Toll Fees and Tip. Unfortunately on arrival at JFK, the driver said it would be $75 PLUS $9.50 Toll Charges. I don’t know if the hotel is aware of this extra charge?I would probably have taken the ride anyway, but it would have been nice to know beforehand. Otherwise a nice hotel and we had a great time in New York.

I am not sure how this hotel got 4 stars....definitely not up to 4 star par. The lounge is nonexistent and the staff is not accommodating at all. Make sure you are not at all early bc they will definitely not let you check in....and after staying three nights don’t even think about asking for an hour late checkout...not gonna happen. It’s almost as if we should be thanking them for staying there. Crazy. Last and not least they overcharged me at checkout by $165... and still tried to tell me they were right. I had enough at this point and just called upper management to get it corrected. The staff needs a customer service conference. Deeply disappointed in the stay to say the least.

I’ve stayed here before, it’s on our company’s preferred list (price and proximity to NY office). The rooms are clean and adequate, no problem with that. The issue is that there are only two elevators to serve the hotel rooms and residential units, so there are always delays. And this time, upon checking in yesterday, I saw that one of the elevators is out of commission. Not good. But going from bad to worse, when I back to go up to my room today, the second elevator was out of commission and they couldn’t get it running. There did offer to let me walk the 16 flights up to my room. Now I may be a picky customer, but this is just insane. And it also seems unsafe. It’s just not worth whatever money I may be saving my company or my client.

very nice room--we had a king bed which was super comfy. everything new and modern. staff was super accommodating and friendly. my only complaint is there's no fridge in the room, so we had to throw out our leftovers.

I would qualify this as a upscale limited service hotel for USA standards. The hotel & staff are good enough to make your stay enjoyable. But unfortunately, one of the 2 elevators was out of order during our stay. This caused serious delays. Very frustrating...During these times the staff might think about other ways to “recover” service. Not just an apology. Nowadays, just having a good location doesn’t make the hotel great! To be improved.

A friend and I had a great stay. The hotel was wonderful, clean, luxury spa bathroom, great view, nice staff. I wanted to try out the fitness center but I had no time . The 10th floor outdoor terrace was really nice too.

Central manhattan hotel, close to most attractions either by foot or subway. Recommend Ellen’s Stardust Diner long line but worth the wait. Gallaghers Steak house bit pricy but well worth it. The hotel is a block from Times Square 10 mins to the Rockefeller Centre 15 mins to the Empire State/Maceys/Flatiron and 20 mins to Central Park. Nice modern rooms with large bathroom, a fridge and a safe. You can ride the Air train to Jamaica station for 5 bucks then the E train into Manhattan for 2.75 rather than 60 or 70 bucks for a cab or Uber. Takes about 45 mins.

I stayed two weeks in the hotel, in junior suite. I found all staff of the hotel that I came in contact with very friendly and helpful. Overall it was great value for money. Location of the hotel excellent. Room was clean, all the time during my stay I found everything that was needed. Just to be aware, there is another Cassa hotel, named Cassa Times Square, do not make mistake by mixing these two. These are not of the same kind. It is not the same chain and my experience in the other one was quite opposite. It was so bad that I had to depart early.

My family stayed here for 5 nites (with 2rooms)and it was a perfect stay. The location is perfect for playing tourist. Three blocks to Times Square and about the same distance to the train.Rooms were like most NYC hotels in that they are a little small but very nice. This is a well built hotel. I hardly heard any noise outside. Also, loved the overhead showers and the comfortable a-c in the room. The Cassa has fast elevators and I mean fast!! I spent little time waiting on elevators while I was there.They have a nice fitness room on the 10th floor with 2 elipticals, 2 treadmills, a bike and lots of weight equipment. Very nice facility.But most of all the best thing about this hotel is their culture of service. From the time I checked in to checkout the help from the doorman to the front desk to the housekeeping couldn't have been nicer. You can't go wrong staying at the Cassa Hotel. Also, If you want a great reasonably priced breakfast place go the Red Dragon right around the block. About a 5 min walk. Great service, good food and reasonable prices. Really enjoyed that place. There are other deli type places on 45th street that you can have breakfast that are good but if you want full service and reasonable prices the Red Dragon was great.

The hotel is in the heart of Manhattan; the location could not be better for tourists/sightseeing. Times Square and Rockefeller Center are minutes away. The lobby is tiny but stylish, and the rooms are updated and very comfortable. The front-desk staff members were helpful and friendly. On all fronts, this is a top-notch place to stay.

Hotel Cassa is Optimally Awesome! Nice location, clean and stylishly convenient rooms and an awesome shower. Primary objective of the trip was to take our little one to enjoy NY city for the weekend and he really enjoyed the stay. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting NY city and wanting to spend and enjoy in and around Time Square and Manhattan. Clean Hotel. Clean Rooms. Excellent Shower!

I know this is a bit unorthodox but I felt the need to write a review of my experiences thus far prior to staying. We will be coming in on Saturday 5/26 and staying two nights. I first spoke with Edlira Kuka the Sales Coordinator and explained that we were coming in and that my son has never been to NYC and that I wanted to request a room on the highest floor possible. Edlira carefully explained all of my options with the utmost professional decorum without all of the pushy up-selling. I have worked in this industry for several years and Edlira has certainly checked off all of the boxes for GREAT customer care. A few days later I again reached out to Edlira regarding the best parking options. Again she explained to me that they do not have parking there but they do have a partnership with a garage around the corner. Turns out the rates were much cheaper than I anticipated for NYC!! We are very much looking forward to this getaway and I couldn't be happier with the professionalism exhibited thus far by Cassa Hotel. Because of this initial experience I am positive our stay will be great. I will be back next week with the review of our stay.Jason Winner

Hotel is in walking distance from Times Square, Central Park, the Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden, New York Public Library and MOMA. The staff is friendly and welcomingRooms are clean, well appointed and a decent size. I would definitely go back to Cassa Hotel

Does not meet expectations as described. There were many, but here are a few:1. expectation were higher (over promise with photos descriptions, and under deliver)2. air condition did not work properly3. TV did not work properly, I called the engineer and he could not fix it either (The TV was huge, but no HD to view on it, none of the HD channels came in as HD... blurry)4. shower was terrible, leaking on the floor, and you needed a ladder to get in and out5. water bottle for $4? that is crazy! why do you try to rip off your customers? even if you buy the water at Costco (which you don't - you get it even cheaper) a bottle would cost around 15 cents, to charge $4 is disgusting!!!

Just returned from a few days stay in NYC at the Cassa hotel, a perfect spot - close to Times Square but none of the noise! The welcome on arrival from reception was wonderful, really helpful and friendly. Shown to our rooms on the 5th floor which while there was no view, were clean, well appointed and a decent size for a room in NYC. The bathroom was really nice and the shower was perfect, having pret next door was great for a quick snack and there was free coffee in reception. I would definitely return to this hotel, really good value for money and service.

My wife and I stayed here overnight in a king room to see Dear Even Hanson at the Musicbox Theatre. From our first encounter with Felecia at the front desk until check out we couldn’t have been happier with this hotel. The staff were friendly and welcoming, and the room was clean, stylish, and comfortable. We were given choice of a lower floor (14) or higher (27). We chose 27 and enjoyed a nice view of surrounding buildings and rooftop gardens. The view from the lower floors may only afford views of walls depending on your floor. The bed was perfect and we slept great. There was a safe and a small refrigerator in the room which were handy. We called down to the front desk for an iron and ironing board, as well as extra blanket and pillows and received them within minutes. The pillows on the bed were very soft so the front desk offered foam pillows which were more firm. The hotel is about 150’ from the corner of 6th Ave and an easy walk to Times Square and the Theatre District. Highly recommend Cassa 45th St. This will be our new go to hotel in NYC.

Went to NY on a short girls trip with my daughters and best friend. We had two rooms at the hotel. My daughter’s and I stayed in a double room. Now, I do agree with most of the past reviews. The beds are double beds and not queen, so it is very tight when 2 people are sleeping in the same bed. The room was clean and the bathroom was big enough for all of us. There was plenty of storage for all our bags. The room was spacious and we were able to move around without feeling cramped.The hotel’s greatest assets are its location and staff. It is located about a block from Times Square. It is about 15 blocks away from Central Park and 11 blocks from Macy’s, the Empire State Building and Madison Square Garden. We were able to walk to all those places and the New York Public Library without any problems. The hotel staff was fantastic. From check-in to check-out they were always concerned with our stay. They gave us advise on places to eat, even where to buy extra luggage on our check out day due to our over shopping. The area surrounding the hotel is full of little eateries, so you don’t have to eat in pricey Times Square. We also felt very safe walking around after midnight but if you do want to eat around that time most places are closed.We had a lovely stay at the Cassa Hotel and would definitely go back.

When we arrived we were met with a smile and help with our luggage. The rooms were very clean and had plenty of toiletries. The rooms are also very quite and nice and dark at night.The umbrellas in the rooms came in very useful during our stay.We made use of the free coffee and water in reception, however if you want a bottle of water nip downstairs to Pret as it's $4 for the one in your room.

This hotel has a great location, with many attracions right outside the door, Times Square is only 2-3 minutes walk away and Empire state building and Macy`s 10 minutes walk from the hotel. It is also several places to have breakfast almost outside the frontdoor, and dinner aswell. The staff are very friendly, and our room was taken good care of.

The Cassa Hotel is very well located near Times Squaire. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. CheckIn was very professionell and a warm welcome. The room was nice and clean, the bathroom was very nice and clean as well.The hotel offers also a shuttle service to the airport in a big van, even cheaper than a taxi.

The hotel has a great location, Times Square is 2 blocks away. Many restaurants around the hotel to go and eat. The concierges were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are small and a little fuddy duddy and dark. Our room looked onto other buildings .

Overall good stay and Jonathan on reception was very helpful. Good location in mid town near to much of the areas we wanted to be in! An issue with left luggage...bag mislaid put a damper on the experience as did the first member of staff when we were leaving who dealt with it very poorly. Found eventually after we had left and therefore still waiting on it being sent to the UK.

This is the second time to stay at Cassa. We loved the location. So close to Times Square and tons of restaurants. Easy access to Broadway for tickets and shows. We will definitely choose this hotel again.

I stayed here on a long weekend to see some Broadway shows. The hotel is at a great location, just a few blocks from Times Square and the Theater District. The room is clean and nicely decorated with a modern feel. There are lots of convenient electrical outlets for recharging. The bed was low to the ground, but comfortable. The rainfall shower was definitely an upgrade over typical hotel showerheads--although the no-step entry into the shower meant that the bathroom floor got wet every time I took a shower. They should fix that. The bathroom sink faucet (good pressure, lots of fast hot water) also had a tendency to blast right out of the sink and onto the countertop with only medium pressure. There was supposed to be a safe in the room, but there was none in mine. Also, there was a non-working mini-fridge in my room. My biggest complaint would be the lack of a comfortable chair of any kind beyond the desk chair. There was ample floor space for one. There was nowhere to watch the TV from except the bed. But these are very minor points--I had a good stay here.The staff at the front desk was very friendly--even the doorman. I would absolutely stay here again if the price was right.

I have experienced a very enjoyable journey when I stayed at Cassa. Members of the crew are very kind and gentle. Room is very satisfatory and internet service worked very well when needed, even though the permission of just 2 devices in the network

Loved our view of the little park across the street. Centrally located and near Times Square. Clean with modern bathroom. Full size beds were small to share. Friendly, helpful, efficient staff. Staff was helpful in holding our luggage after we checked out so that we could enjoy the remainder of our day in Manhattan. Would definitely stay here again!

First of all big thanks to Adam and Krystle for making our stay so comfortable - they couldn't do enough for us. Room was clean and comfortableShame they don't offer breakfast but Pret is right next door and a superb diner just round the corner.If you want access to all New York has to offer this is the place to stay- walk to times square- jump on a tour bus (greyline are great) or use the subway - just pack in as much of this wonderfully mad city as you can.----And for a break from the madness jump on the Staten Island ferry ( its Free!!) and have a day out on Staten Island. Travel a little way inland and see the America that is so familiar from all those TV shows and films - Great five days in the big apple

This is my 4th time at this hotel. Before Radisson it was a Viceroy hotel, and not much has changed between the management change, for which, I am pleased to report. Yes, the continental breakfast and afternoon snacks have been removed, and I understand the decision.I love reading other reviews to see what exactly is being said, and what the complaints are about. Me, funny enough, I have none. The hotel fulfilled its duty to provide me with an excellent place to sleep. My room was, in my view, rather larger for NYC (1402). Yes, the bed was only a full size, but I was more than comfortable. The bathroom was large and I liked that the glass shower wall really kept the water in and not on the bathroom floor. It would have been nice had the maid left my towel on the rack as I asked, but all was fresh.I do think the closet is rather small, and maybe an option would be for the hotel to add a shelf into the old mini-bar space at the desk, this would give much needed folded clothing space.All in all, I really like this hotel, and most likely will be with them in September when I return for work. Location is excellent and easy. Coming from Newark by bus, is so convenient, 3 blocks to Bryant Park with the subway there as well. Convenience is the name of the game, and this hotel has it in spades.

The location of this hotel makes walking to sites easy. The staff is incredibly helpful & friendly. The room was clean & comfortable. The closet had enough hangers for both my & my husband's clothing. I love the idea of having pump containers for the body soap, shampoo, conditioner, & body lotion. It's a bit more environmentally friendly for sure!

The Cassa Hotel is a wonderful boutique hotel located just a few blocks away from Times Square. My husband and I were traveling with our daughter and they upgraded us to a Junior Suite at no extra cost. The hotel was very accommodating and all of our needs were met. Our room was very spacious and clean. I can't wait to come back and stay again!

I stayed here in February. It is in a fantastic location near times square. The hotel has everything you need for a trip to New York.It is competitively priced for this grade.The room was a little small but was very comfortable. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The wifi was a little difficult to set up but once in it was very good.As most hotels in New York it is high rise so if you are nervous about high rise.it's not for you.I did not have any breakfast or meals at the hotel but there is a highly recommended restaurant on the ground floor.Overall I would recommend for a short stay as it's location and value for money are tops.

Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in early March in a Deluxe King & would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat! Having been to NY twice previously and staying at another hotel, Im glad we decided to try something different. Albeit rooms were "cosy" they were modern, clean and well maintained. Wonderful shower & shower head, just what you needed after a day in the bitter cold elements that we experienced....Great walking distance to uptown & downtown subways, Time Square, Central Park etc etc all the "must do" places. Cafe Manhattan across the road is a terrific little spot to get your brekky & coffee before a big day sight seeing. All staff on reception were friendly & helpful, regardless of the time of day or night. I would definatly stay here again the next time im in The Big Apple :-)

We arrived very tired into the Cassa but the staff were brilliant. The hotel is a 4 min walk from Times square. Room is an ok size with a very comfortable bed, gorgeous shower (Amazing Roil Shampoo...try it!!), very clean and enough space for what we needed. It is so central at a great price. Would recommend to anyone going to NYC.

We stayed here for 4 nights in March and had a wonderful time. The room was very well appointed (we had an exec king), and very clean. Beautiful bathroom with lovely walk in shower. The staff were all extremely helpful and could not do enough for you. Great stay!

Stayed for 5 nights in this hotel Staff where friendly & helpful. The room was big compared to other New York hotels and at a better price. The Shower was amazing! Hot and never wanted to get out once you was in. It is located 2 blocks from times square, 20 second walk down the street you will find “Cafe Manhattan” this is a store but also does great breakfasts to order. You can dine in or take to go, Which we found convenient as ours days are packed with sightseeing. Also good to fill the fridge in your room with drinks for throughout the night or in the morning. We was i room 1602 right outside the lift and we was not disturbed by people using it. we had a view of other building at the back of the hotel which we didnt not mind as we was never in it much and got no street noise of a morning. Great hotel and will be staying here again if returning to New York. P.S the Subway is the quickest way to travel around New York. Do not get the hop on hop off bus, i would advise getting a rail card. Its much faster as the hop on hop off is always stuck in traffic or stopping to pick people up.

A short subway ride and walk from Penn Station. Arrived late in the evening to be met by very pleasant staff -- and the pleasant surprise of an upgrade to a nice suite. Largest hotel room we've had in NYC. Noon check-out the next day made for a leisurely morning.

Location - Location is a 5 minute walk to the Broadway theaters, 2 minutes to Times Square, and 2 minutes to Rockefeller Center -- which is to say, perfect. Hotel - Its a small hotel with two fast elevators. I can't begin to say what a difference that makes to your overall experience. We frequent NYC and waiting a long time for the hotel elevators is just a fact of life -- except at this gem of a hotel. None of our vacation time was wasted waiting for the elevators! Room was slightly larger than NYC average, beautifully laid out, and exquisitely clean. Loved the gorgeous rain shower. Rooms were absolutely silent - no street noise, no noise from other rooms. There wasn't a great view from our 5th floor window (just another building) but it wasn't at all a bad view either. With arthritis, comfy beds are a must and this was the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept on. Staff - The staff is incredibly warm, professional, and eager to help. They went above and beyond, one and all. Every time I walked through the doors of the hotel I would think, "I'm so glad we gave this place a try!". Its small so there chances of checking in early are a little low and indeed, we had to wait until after 3 to check in. That said, they happily stored our luggage and made sure we had access to very large bathrooms to change clothes before heading out on the town. The hotel doors don't lock at night (at least not before 11 pm) and you don''t need a key card to use the elevators. That said, I always felt safe with multiple staff at the doors. Dining - There is a Starbucks and a Pret A Manger on the block if you want a familiar something for breakfast. If you want to be a bit more adventurous, there is a restaurant for every taste and every budget within a 5 minute walk. There is no room service. I really hope to make this our go-to NYC hotel. I loved it!

This hotel is 5min walk from Times Sq and even closer to 5th Ave in the opposite direction. A number of other locations of note are close by. A huge amount of restaurants and food outlets nearby.Rooms are a good size but not huge (small being the norm for NY). When we got into our room we received a phonecall from reception to ask if we were happy with our room (a nice touch). There were a couple of things we fed back that we wanted (coffee machine and robes - these were not in the room due to the hotel's environmental policy but available on request) and they arrived within about 5min (great service!)One morning I had a really sore ankle. I called reception and they send up a bag of ice which helped me a lot as well as offering further help.Rooms were nicely cleaned and tidied each day.A hotel I would recommend and would stay at again.

We arrived around 12:30 pm and were sadly advised that rooms weren't ready yet. We sat in the lobby until 3 PM, normal check-in time, and the room was finally ready. We've arrived early at many New York hotels and were able to check in earlier than 3pm. There was no attempt made to ready the room while we waited. I find it hard to believe that not one room could be ready a little earlier when, miraculously, all of them are ready at the same time. That was pretty disappointing. There didn't seem to be much of an attempt to get us in as soon as possible. So far, not impressed with the customer service or the lobby. Time will tell. Well, after 3 nights at the hotel, my opinion of the staff did not change, and there was nowhere in the hotel to relax outside the room. The lobby was dreary and drafty and not at all welcoming. The room however, was lovely. Clean, updated and very nice shower and bathroom. It was disappointing that there are no drawers for your clothes, just a few hangers and very small cubby holes. The rooms were quiet and the elevators were fast. Overall, it's a good place for cleanliness and quiet but it's not a warm or welcoming facility.
