The front desk staff was wonderful, very friendly and helpful. They set us up in a king room in the corner so there would be plenty of room for a rollaway bed. The room was a decent size and was quiet. Very happy, would stay there again for sure.

This was a great hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful with whatever we needed. The room was very spacious considering it was in NYC and the location was fantastic!! We didn’t try the restaurant but I heard from someone else staying there that it was good.

Our family took another vacation to enjoy the big apple and this time we stayed with the CASSA hotel near Time Square. Every aspect of our stay was wonderful, Thank you! We especially would like to share how pleasant Anthony and Lytesha were at the complementary breakfast buffet. They both need to be commended for their hard work and pleasant attitude! When so many guests wait until the last minute to come to the buffet and literally overwhelming the 1-2 staff members hustling to keep everything full and fresh it was disappointing to see a male supervisor openly speaking to them in-front of guests (ourselves), that another guest complained who arrived after the end time. Anthony and Lyteshia you are doing an amazing job and would hire you in a heart-beat to work in our hotel! Don't let those delinquent guests or in-fact your grumpy supervisor ruin your pleasant attitude and dedication to your job! Thank you! To the grumpy supervisor... you should lead by example, not by harsh criticism when you could have easily seen how many guests arrived late if you had been there to support your team at such a critical time instead of publicly reprimanding them in front of guests. I hope you re-evaluate your approach with these words of constructive criticism. I only wish I knew your name to address you directly. Felix the Bellman is also to be commended as he greeted our family immediately upon parking to unload our luggage with a bell cart. He patiently loaded up our numerous bags and delivered them to our room. Each time we traversed the lobby, Felix was there with a smile and a fresh apple to take as a snack. Thank you!Michael at the front desk was very courteous to our needs and promptly saw to our special request needed in our room without delay and also greeted us each time we came through the lobby. Thank you!The ladies at the front desk when we checked out, Ashely and Diana saw to it that we had some cool bottles of water and ice to fill our cooler for the road trip home. Thank you!The maids rotated and I apologize I did not get your names, but thank you for making sure that our room needs were met with as many fresh towels and supplies as needed.We found the hotel to be very clean and well designed. Despite our room facing a construction project, the room was completely silent from the sounds of the city with the windows closed. The location is perfect to walk to many of the locations we were headed to, including Time Square, Hells Kitchen, The Garment District and even public transportation station just a block away with indoor quick food dining. We enjoyed the sunsets from the roof terrace daily and spent many memorable moments out there enjoying the view. We will most definitely be back!

I travel frequently to nyc for work. I’ve stayed at the Cassa a few times and it is solid. Rooms are clean, modern, and of a good size. WiFi can be patchy. Reception staff are down to earth and helpful. The fitness centre is on the small side. Unfortunately no coffee machine / kettle in the room The restaurant downstairs “Butter” is great - the perfect escape after a busy day.

Location, location,1 block from 5th Ave, 2 blocks from Time Square. Staff was very friendly and helped us out in various occasions. Had a car to and from the airport right on time (extra cost). Good recommendations for eating. Bed and pillows were great. (no room service, but many places around). Not noisy at all. Small hotel so people go out of their way to help.

The location is good and staff was friendly. The room was quite small with a semi comfortable bed and very uncomfortable pillows. Bathroom was good with outstanding water pressure. They have some old cooler type mini bar contraption that is useless for keeping food cold. Not sure why they don't invest in a real mini refrigerator, if they did I would give it a better rating. The rooms are noisy, you will hear every sound from outside your door and every siren and horn from the street. Ear plugs are a necessity. Don't drink the 2 water bottles they have in the room or it will cost you 4.00 each. Go to CVS a block away and buy a gallon for 1.49. The wifi worked fine as did the heater/AC unit. I am not sure I would return here again but if the price was reasonable and they added mini refrigerators to the rooms I probably would.

The Cassa Hotel is in a great location in Midtown near the theaters, restaurants, shopping, tourist attractions, and a short walk to Central Park! The service was friendly and the hotel was very clean! We upgraded to a larger room and it was adequate for a weekend stay. The bed was comfortable and we had a small sitting area with a couch and a huge bathroom!! We received free waters and apples upon our arrival. They also serve free coffee in the lobby in the mornings. The only negatives are that our room could have used some more light, an iron, and the lobby is so small there really isn't a relaxing space to read other than in your room. A great place to stay for a weekend in NYC!

This is far from a Boutique hotel. Decor is very out dated. From the minute I stepped out of the elevator, I knew it was not what I was expecting from the pictures. Carpets were old, the room was very brown. I would recommend you bring ear plugs with u as the walls are very thin. You can hear the elevators working and you can hear conversations going on in the hallway and room beside you. It is a very compact room, the double bed is more like a big single bed. Staff leaves a 500ml bottle of water in the room and will charge you $4 if you take it. No tea or coffee in the room. The hotel is centrally located between 5th and 6th, and only 2 blocks from Times Square. Staff are lovely and helpful. I would only recommend staying here if you do not plan to spend much time in the hotel room, you bring ear plugs and if you grab a good deal due to great location, otherwise avoid.

It was a nice hotel. I stayed there for 2 nights. The location was fantastic. The room was clean, quite and in a good size. the staff we're helpful and really friendly. The check in and out was so quick and smooth. I recommend it

The rooms are clean and properly set up to feel spacious enough for NYC, not to mention right next to Times Square. Even though it is under new management, I was happy to see the familiar faces of those I had previously met the last time I stayed here. Once again I am pleased to say the staff is professional, courteous, attentive and goes above and beyond for the guest. I highly recommend this property and look forward to my next visit as I will be staying here.

Our king suite seemed rather small, but was so carefully designed to make good use of the space that it was OK. I was cashing in some Club Carlson points, so it’s hard to comment on the value factor. I liked the bathroom, which had nice lighting, a great bathtub, and double sinks. There was decent counter space (of course, there can never be enough). Two nice, fluffy bathrobes, and a decent hairdryer. The decor was spare and modern, which is not my thing, but at least it was clean and inoffensive. The location was quite convenient, especially to the Belasco Theater. Also, it’s very near our favorite watering hole at the Algonquin bar. Be aware that there is essentially no lobby, and at least during our stay, no room service (perhaps this will change).

Cassa Hotel NY is in a great location, nearby Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, Bryant Park and more. The hotel is well priced. Rooms are average size for NYC, clean and comfortable. Service was excellent although the wifi in the room was extremely slow and we had difficulty signing into it. Highly recommend Cassa Hotel NY for a weekend stay. We'll be back for sure.

‘Wonderful’➖ Not that I can think of any.➕ Hotel was located just a few mins from the Times Square and 5th Ave. there were loads of restaurants nearby so thats a plus point for me. The hotel was well kept and rooms were clean. The staff was super helpful and nice during our stay.

We arrived to New York at 6:00am (way too early to check in) but we decided to stop by the hotel to leave our bags. We knew we were a close walk to Times Square so as we were about to leave (15 mins after arriving to the hotel), we were told that they had a room that they could move us to. This made the start to our trip amazing. They had also upgraded our room because that was the only one available at the time we had arrived. Room was large, clean & comfortable. After our two night stay, we had checked out and then decided to stay an extra night. When we called, the manager quickly found us a room and gave us an amazing rate for a room double the size. When we arrived back they brought us our luggage to the room. The staff is beyond amazing and I would recommend this hotel to anyone! It is also in a perfect location.

Staff was wonderful. Room was great. The location was perfect. No problems at all. Loved being so close to everything. The hotel was extremely clean. I love walking around New York City to see the sights.

Lovely hotel with a great central base for exploring. Easy walking distance to Times Square and also only ever a few minutes away from a Subway stop taking you all over the City. Rooms are well furnished and roomy by NYC standards and WIFI was great for sending those enviable pictures to loved ones back home!Staff onsite were very pleasant and helpful, with one chap kindly arranging for us to move rooms at 5am after an issue with some noisy pipes by our room. The hotel bar was a letdown, we found the atmosphere quite pretencious and on one night we weren't allowed to sit in a booth with drinks because it was food only...there was literally about 11 empty booths at that point and about 6 other customers in the bar. Weird.That aside, we enjoyed a great stay with Cassa and would definetly consider staying at this property in the future.

We absolutely loved this hotel. Quick check in, amazing location. Our room and bathroom were very good in size, cleaning, comfort, safety, facilities and amenities. We stayed for only two nights but could easily have stayed more. Next time we will book a king size room. Also, we would have loved a coffee machine in the room, which I don´t know if they offer in upper rooms. Very very good.

I arrived and was greeted by doorman Felix and Host Michael. Throughout my entire stay they were both welcoming and helpful. Michael has a wonderful personality and deserves a raise in my opinion. We received a letter from management welcoming us with a bottle of wine which was a surprise. The room was spacious and they have a roof top access to view the city. My husband booked the room so I don’t know if that is customary or an upgrade. Overall I really enjoyed my stay.

Very clean, elegant, excellent customer service and very well located. There is a good gym onsite, a lovely restaurant, and close to all subways and Central Park. I have stayed there may times. Every time they exceed my expectations.

Me and my husband booked this very last minute and got a good price for a standard room, upon check in we was offered a upgrade at a reasonable price, we did decline as we don’t spend much time in our hotel room but it was a good offer! The room was perfect for our short stay, very comfortable bed, powerful shower and high quality amenities. Each morning coffee was complimentary in the lobby which we did take advantage of, staff were very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again! Hairdryer, safe and iron/board is included in the room too.

An exceptional hotel in the heart of midtown manhattan. Reasonably priced, comfortable, clean and incredible service. My new go to in the big apple!! Butter, the attached restaurant, is a 5 star experience with lovely ambience.

What makes this hotel is the location. You can walk to times square in 5 minutes, Bryant Park in 10 and the Empire State Building in 20. Everything is so near it's great. Lovely little Italian across the road that served great pizza! (Resette i think it was called). The shuttle from the airport dropped us off about 10 mins walk away which was fine. The best bar we found was only a 20 min walk away also- 230-Fifth. It has incredible views and happy hour is 4pm-7pm monday to friday. The hotel itself was nice. The room was plenty big enough and nice and quiet. Fantastic big & powerful shower. The only downside was the lack of wardrobes- there was only small shelf space and some drawers, nowhere to hang long dresses or skirts. Well worth staying at if you want to be close to all the amazing attractions in New York without the room being noisy!

They gave me a room with two beds on a high floor with a chocolate covered marshmallo, water bottles and a hand written note. It also had a rain shower head with great water pressure. Overall a good experience

I'm always weary when a cab driver in a city known for hotels hasn't heard of a centrally located hotel. Same goes for the Manhattan hotel shuttle service. Luckily I had the address handy or who knows where I might've wound up.Very pleasant front desk staff in the minuscule lobby offered to take care of multiple things but didn't do so in an overly organized manner if at all. I was informed that a coffee machine could be had in my room on request, it was never delivered.Same went for my transport back to the airport: a written note was made but no information was left in the system. Luckily a van arrived when I needed it, but without confirmation and driving through parts of Queens that weren't fantastic, I wasn't exactly impressed.As mentioned by others, the layout of the room wasn't phenomenal. A desk with a single uncomfortable chair was right in front of the TV. The bed is the only other piece of furniture in the place, it faced the desk and TV. Either a foot away from the TV on a chair or trying to sit comfortably in bed at a more reasonable distance. The view out of the window was of the back of an equally tall building, but doubt that improves much anywhere in Manhattan.The bed was exceedingly comfortable and gave a great night's sleep. The bathroom was clean and modern. No dresser to speak of and just enough space in the closet for things for a few nights. An umbrella provided would've been useful had it been the rainy season. Mini-bar was empty and it appeared as though there was a second place for one in the desk which was left as a vacant space. Safe wasn't large enough for storing a larger laptop. Wifi was OK but without security. No parking. Building doubles as a residence.Location and cost per night for Manhattan made it worthwhile, but with the number of options available in NYC, I'll be trying somewhere else next time for the little things.

I am disappointed but this rather new hotel...The room looked tired even with a great bathroom!My major issue is the size of room!!!It s silly small.The hotel is more pricy than The Millenium or the Club Quarters but I would definitely opt for these last two.I don t think I would go back...

Our room on the 15th floor was quiet on Saturday night. (According to my Fitbit, I got much, much more deep sleep than I usually do.) The staff was super friendly and helped us figure out parking, which can be a daunting experience. Felicia, the receptionist, was so genuine and helpful as was the valet, who helped us understand our parking options. Coffee and tea in the lobby in the morning was a much appreciated touch.

We stayed here for 5 nights in September and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The location was amazing - within 5 minutes walking distance from Times Square, and about 2 minutes walk from Fifth Avenue, so perfect for tourists. The beds were extremely comfortable, and the staff were very helpful.The only minor downside was that the bathroom was quite small, so you couldn't really stand at the sink with the door open.

Stayed at the Cassa for 4 nights and it was a mediocre experience. Started off by booking a Full room and was upgraded to a Queen room on the 6th floor facing the back with an extremely poor view. The highlight of the low-level room was super hot water very fast although this was overshadowed by the extremely loud sounds from outside, including emergency vehicles, trash collectors, and construction all throughout the evening...Informed the front desk of the anomalies and was upgraded to the 21st floor in a King room that was super quiet. Despite being a corner room, only parts of the corner featured a window...it was mainly a hoax...On the 21st floor, hot water took a long time, think 5-10 minutes so it was best to turn on the hot water, hang out, and then jump into the shower. Wifi was decent and free. Requested a wake-up call for 3 mornings and only received 2...good thing I have an alarm on my phone......the thought process of the seating area and TV just didn't make sense. You can either watch TV from bed, or enjoy the radiation and smell of the TV by working in front of the TV and having maybe 1-3 inches to smell/breathe the TV...awkward......oh...and the heater was quite loud too...

I had to extend my stay in NYC and there was a last minute offer in the hotel. It was a great experience. Small hotel for NYC standars and that is amazing. Front house team recognize you, very polite, super friendly, you feel at home. The room is nice, great bathroom, good size. A super nice 4 star hotel that I would definetely recommend.

Good, clean hotel! Rooms on the small side but to be expected in NYC. Perfect location and only a couple of blocks from Times Square and Central Park. Staff couldn’t have been more helpful and the service back to airport was worth the extra $10!

I stayed at the Cassa Hotel for a family function just before Christmas. Room was clean, modern and very quiet. Staff was extremely friendly and professional. Gym was clean and functional. The location can’t be beat as it’s in Midtown and the price was a good value given the time of year. If you need a quiet, clean place to stay at a decent price, then the Cassa Hotel fits the bill.

We stayed at the Cassa hotel 45th street for 5 nights in December. Upon our arrival we were surprisingly told that we had been complimentary upgraded. When we entered our room there was a birthday card for my wife as we were there celebrating her 30th birthday. The hotel is in a great location and the rooms are brilliant. Beds extremely comfortable. The staff are courteous and professional. Would most definitely look this hotel up again next time we visit NYC

Great location, nice hotel. Terrible customer service ( housekeeping).Came back on Sat at 3:15 and room had not been service. Ran into a housekeeping guy who called and could not find out who was to take care of room. He suggested we wait on 10th floor, because it would be warmer. Caught elevator with housekeeping mgr Mary, who was discussing our room 2307, when we told her it was our room she asked if we had forgotten to take of the do not disturb sign. We told her no sign was on the door. She finally sent someone to service it; 45 mins later room was ready for us

A friend and I recently stayed at Cassa, and had a wonderful time. The location on 45th St. is so convenient to many activities that most tourists do. Great for the theater district. The hotel has an excellent staff---very courteous, friendly, customer-oriented, and helpful. Our room was very clean and had a surprisingly big bathroom. The bedroom area was not big, but it worked. There was no dresser to put clothes in for a longer stay, and the refrigerator was not working. The Butter Restaurant connected to the hotel served a great breakfast buffet every day. I would definitely consider staying here on my next visit.

We stayed for a week at the Cassa. We had perfect amount of space for a family. Was clean and comfortable. Close by all attractions but quiet enough in the room. Staff were extremely friendly and we would highly recommend to stay here.

This hotel was amazing for the price immaculately clean the towels were changed every day as was the bedding. The staff from reception to the cleaners were all pleasant and polite very friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone the location is amazing central for everything. would definitely book this hotel again

To the attention of "Mr. Mark" the General Manager:I had to cancel my reservation at the Grand Hyatt due to this upcoming winter storm. I rescheduled my trip for a later arrival and choose your hotel. After booking it I called to ask several questions. Your employee Tenzin answered my called. He was patient, kind and professional. My Godson's father is the former GM of the Grand Hyatt in DC and always said that he received many more complaints for a mistake than compliments for a job well done. I want to compliment you on having such a good representative of your hotel as Tenzin! If he is typical of the caliber of employee you have on staff - then we are in for a treat while being your guest!See you on the 10th of January.

2 Day NYC trip with daughters. The hotel was very close to Time Square and several very good restaurants. Uncle Paul's Pizza was great. The hotel staff were very friendly. We had a queen room (a little on the small side) but I think typical for NY hotel. There was hot coffee in the lobby, which was a plus.

Today is only my 3rd day here and I just wanted to say this hotel is AMAZING !!! Its beautiful & very clean. The staff here are the best!! I am deathly afraid of elevators and I’m a smoker, so every time I need to smoke, I just call downstairs and they send someone to escort me down & back up in the elevator NO MATTER WHAT TIME OF DAY IT IS!!! THEY ARE ALL SO FRIENDLY & VERY SWEET. THEY GO BEYOND OUT OF THIER WAY TO MAKE SURE THAT NOT ONLY AM I OK, BUT MY FAMILY AS WELL. I look forward to another week here and I will be writing another great review after I leave. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND STAYING HERE AT THE BEAUTIFUL CASSA HOTEL

Very busy at check in yet Jonathon and Jermaine made us feel like valued clients. All of the staff and front desk associates were amazing . Jermaine checked my wife and I in. He was a total professional and was patient during our barrage of touristy questions that he has likely answered thousands of times before. Jonathon helped us get checked in as well. We were made to feel like old friends. The rooms are not huge ...there are likely 6 to 8 rooms on each floor. Our room was perfect upon entry. Clean and modern. A safe, ironing board and hair dryer were all present in the room as well as a bouquet of 12 long stem roses for my wife. We asked one gentleman where we could get a good slice. He gave us two options that he preferred. We went with his first choice and it was awesome.Sorry to not remember all names but EVERY Cassa employee that we came into contact during our December stay were 5-star!We will be back.

My bf and I visited NYC for a short Christmas eve trip and booked our room on HotelTonight for a great price. Service was great and location was perfect. However, be forewarned: The standard room only comes with a full (extremely soft/no support) bed and you must pay extra for a queen bed. The walls were extremely thin and it felt like the guest next door to our room was literally inside our room whenever she spoke or moved around in her room. Also, we left our hotel room at 1230pm and returned at 530pm and our room had not been cleaned. We called to get the room cleaned but they arrived while we were still in the room and said they could not come back later. We were only there for one night so we basically never received room service during our stay.

Booked with six months in advanced for a very good price. The location of the hotel is excellent, within walking distance to tourist attractions in Mahanttan. Clean room, a bit outdated, very nice large bathroom, excellent service.

The Cassa hotel is a good hotel in a great location.... All of the staff are very friendly from the minute you check in till the minute you check out.. The rooms are a good size and very clean.. The hotel is just off 5th ave and is only a One minute walk from Times Square..

We had such a fantastic stay in Cassa! The hotel is beautiful throughout and the rooms are stylish and comfy including eg a large powerful shower/hairdryer/large screen tv with multiple channels! Great location near times square and walking distance to everywhere we needed. As lots of the sights are spreadout theres obviously alot of walking/subway but locations still great. Staff were amazing so friendly whether it was 8am or 11pm, always there to say hello. One evening we had been out all day and felt exhausted and didnt want to go back out, Cassa were extremely helpful in providing a local takeaway menu that delivered and they were happy for us to have this in our room! Thankyou for being fab!

This hotel is such a gem. The ideal location for anywhere in the city. Walk to Times Square, Broadway, the shops on 7th Avenue. If you want to pick up the subway; that is also nearby. Easy cab access from JFK or you can utilize the hotels car service. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff is professional and helpful. We had breakfast included in our package each morning which really was a nice spread.

The hotel is located in the heart of Manhattan, short ways to Times Square, Library, Grand Central etc.The rooms are spacious, which is nice. However, in my opinion carpeted floors are not appropriate anymore. The lobby is tiny, we arrived as a group with luggage for a 2 weeks stay and did not all fit in there, it was often overcrowded.It is not special but ok.

This hotel was fantastically placed for a tourist trip to New York City. It is only a block away from Times Square. It's on the same street as the United Nations, and just 5 streets from Radio City Music Hall. The Hotel is extremely comfortable. The rooms are furnished with a fridge (extremely useful!) while there are no Tea/Coffee making facilities in the rooms there is free Tea & Coffee available in the foyer. The Hotel even supply a free to use umbrella!The Hotel left us a pair of cupcakes and a nice card to help us celebrate our wedding anniversary - a very nice touch.On leaving they were able to arrange a car that took us directly to the airport which arrived on time and was a flat rate.  Overall an excellent experience in New York!

This hotel is in a brilliant location. Only two blocks from Grand Central it's ideally located in the heart of Manhattan just a couple blocks from Times Square/Rockefeller Center etc. The reception staff were extremely welcoming, friendly and helpful throughout. Our room on the 16th floor was perfectly equipped although charging for bottled water was slightly disappointing. The hotel has two lifts which are super fast although on a couple of occasions housekeeping seemed to take priority of their use rather than paying guests so we had to wait. Breakfast is available in the restaurant downstairs for an extra $25 per person. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on the quality/value for money of the food but you're not short on options to eat out in this city!The couple of slight niggles wouldn't put us off staying here again and we would definitely recommend this hotel.

Very nice hotel in the middle of NY, nice staff, very good cleaning, restaurant quite expensive, so go and visit a diner, but very nice hotel:-) Placed on 45th strreet, everything is in walking distance. I will stay there the next time I visit NY

I recently stayed at the Cassa Hotel and overall had a great experience. This was my first trip to NYC so I wasn't sure exactly where to stay but this location was great for a first timer. It offers close walking proximity to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Broadway, 5th ave shopping, Central Park and most importantly several subway stations to get all over the city. The staff at Cassa was extremely accommodating with holding our bags when we arrived early in the morning and left late at night, and upgraded us from a double bed to a king bed. They have a coffee/tea station in the lobby which was always fully stocked no matter the time of day. The room was large and the bed was comfortable. We never tried the onsite restaurant or fitness center but they both looked nice! We also utilized their car service back to the airport as it was cheaper than a lyft/uber was for that time of day. On the downside there was no dresser in the room, I like to unpack my suitcase in hotels when there for several days and was not able to do that. There was also no extra blankets or pillows in the room and we had to call several times to have them delivered. The bathroom is big, bright and beautiful but the shower has a stupid design where water just goes all over the floor. The bathroom door handle also came off when I closed the door and had my friend not been in the room to let me out I would have been trapped in there until house keeping came the next day (note to self, bring phone in the bathroom). All in all it was a great stay at Cassa and I would 100% stay there again if I were to stay in the same area. Beware that the area is tourist central - I will likely look for more "local" areas on my next stay.

Fantastic hotel in excellent location. Polite, helpful staff and very clean rooms. Tea and coffee making facilities are at reception so I'll take my own little kettle next time for my morning cuppa lol. Absolutely wonderful stay. Will definitely return!

We have just returned from a stay at the Cassa Hotel which was a pre-Christmas trip for myself and my daughter, and had a wonderful stay. The hotel is in an excellent location - close to Times Square, the Rockefeller Centre and Bryant Park - with excellent transport links to the Subway. Our room was spacious and clean, with a large bathroom and plenty of windows and natural light. The breakfast had a nice selection of hot and cold food, as well as pastries and fruit which set us up well each day.All of the staff were very friendly in particular Jonathan and Krystal on the front desk who went out of their way to be helpful and accommodating which was very much appreciated. We hope to visit again soon and would recommend the hotel to others.

Our floor smelled like smoke immediately after getting off the elevator. The smell was strong in the hallways and also creeped into our room. The worst part was that we had barely warm water for showers in the morning. This is not good on a snowy day below 30 degrees. The room was small but that wasn't a big deal to us. Location is good. Staff is good. Bed is good, Room was quiet.

My husband and I went to New York and stayed at this hotel. It was in midtown manhattan and close to all the popular sights. The room is not bad, with king size bed and the bathroom was quite big. I requested for a coffee machine prior to checking in and it was already there when we arrived. It’s a boutique hotel and in New York so I think it was better than I expected.

Staying at the Aria I figured I’d try this place because it’s in the same building. I also assumed because it was in the Aria it would be good however I was wrong.Probably the worst breakfast I’ve had on my three week trip to the states.Poached eggs were so watery they came in a small bowl, when I tired to get them out they popped mixing the yolk with the water in the bottom. Their version of sourdough bread wasn’t anything like any sourdough I’ve previously had. It was more like regular bread.Their coffee wasn’t great either. All in all I wouldn’t recommend this place.The only reason they get two stars is because of the friendly staff, location and cleanliness.

We stayed here the first week of December as a party of 6 with 3 rooms booked. On arrival we were checked in rapidly and given our room keys; the rooms were a decent size for NYC standards. The beds were comfortable, the room temperature was perfect and the shower great. Even though the rooms were near the lift, with it being a boutique hotel it was very quiet, no noise at all. There is no business area to print off your boarding passes, however the front desk are happy to do this for you. All in all a brilliant stay! Thank you :)

Stayed here for 10 nights during our trip to New York. Had been searching online for a while and found this hotel by pure chance. What a bit of luck it turned out to be! Located a few blocks from Times Square and 5th Avenue right on the corner, Rockefeller Centre is also a few blocks away it couldn't have been in a better location. The room was a great size with a massive modern bathroom, only downside was the wardrobe space, for 2 of us staying there we had to keep a lot of stuff in our cases but only a minor inconvenience as an iron and ironing board is in the wardrobe along with a safe and a small fridge. Nice big TV with a huge choice of channels and we were able to watch the late NBA and NFL games after a long day of sightseeing. The staff were nice and friendly always speaking to you as you passed through reception. Nice and quiet with little or no noise from street level. Fantastic hotel and will definitely be staying here the next time we are in New York, will also be recommending this hotel to any family or friends that are looking for a place in New York as it was a brilliant price and the location couldn't have been better. Honestly can't recommend it enough!

Felt like a valued guest, from my per-arrival phone call to order a pack-n-play to the moment we checked-in. Service was wonderful and attentive to our family of four. Pack-n-Play was clean, roll-away bed perfect for my tall 8 1/2 year old, shower was terrific and the location couldn't be better to enjoy Christmas time in the City. Parking was around the corner, but a breeze. Thank you James, Lavar, Patrick and Jonathan for your kind and enjoyable treatment of us during our stay! Hotel restaurant better for date night than with kids, but Connelly Pub right up the street was perfect for a cozy lunch.

This hotel is located just off 5th avenue and only a couple of blocks from times square, Bryant park, rockafeller, grand central. The location is perfect because it's just a nice step away from the chaos of times square but close enough to do all the touristy stuff. The staff are lovely, friendly, welcoming and helpful. Rooms were clean and a decent size with a huge tv and great shower. There is an iron and ironing board in the room with kettles available on request. There is also free tea and coffee in the mornings and evenings. The only negative thing I could say is the lack of storage for clothes in terms of wardrobes and drawers it's very limited. As we were there ten days we had to leave lot in in our suitcase. To be honest this was a minor issue.

I LOVED this hotel and cannot day enough great things about it. I booked it on Expedia at 3am while having a horrible experience at another hotel. I walked into my room and there was Christmas music playing, the room was modern, clean, homey and slick! You also can’t beat the location it’s perfect between Times Square and midtown. The staff was also amazing. I highly recommend this hotel and can’t wait for a longer stay here.

We stayed her between 2nd December and 7th December. Check in was quick and Jonathan was really helpful, providing a map and asking if we needed any help.Room was small with very little storage space, however, perfect as we hardly spent any time there so we didn't need anything bigger, Bathroom was lovely and clean, great shower. Beds maid and rooms cleaned daily. We asked for Coffee and Tea in our room which was topped up daily. Used the driver to get us back to the airport. He was fantastic. Really busy traffic and it took us nearly 2 hours but he still got us there and didn't ask for anything extra. Flat fee of $75. Had this of been a hello cab they charge more for peak times and traffic. Ask Adam or Jonathan and they book him for you. Celebrated a birthday while there and we came back to cake pops which was a lovely treat. Coffee and tea served in the morning so you can get a drink to go. Great location. Walking distance to everything you need. Highly recommend and will be going back next time we are in NYC. Thank you Adam & Jonathan for making our stay so great. :)

We stayed here for 5 nights recently on a trip to New York. The hotel was lovely and very clean. Our room was specious with a large comfy bed and the bathroom was a good size with a great shower. The staff were always really friendly and offered good recommendations when asked. The location was ideal, just around the corner from Bryant Park.I would happily stay here again.

My first time of travelling alone in New York, so this hotel was chosen very carefully. I felt safe at all times, location was superb. The room was much larger than I expected. Front desk staff were extremely helpful and anything I asked for was delivered immediately. I can't recommend this hotel enough and will certainly be booking again next year.

I can’t say enough good things about this little gem. The location is awesome. The room was clean and modern. Comfortable bed and pillows. The bath was beautiful. Great, strong water pressure in shower and lots of counter space. It’s a no frills kinda place but perfect for my needs as a solo traveler. Amazingly quiet for a busy street. The staff were super friendly, helpful and attentive. The only reason I didn’t give five stars was due to a weird smell of gas in the hallway that kinda seemed in at times but I got used to it.

Just got back from a 4 night / 5 day break in New York and it was our first time in New York / USA. We booked a deluxe double room. E-mailed hotel beforehand and got a speedy response. Hotel is easy to find from subways and a perfect location a few couple of blocks from Times Square. Smooth check in - make sure you remember your card as they just put a small amount hold in case any damage which is pretty standard. Room was perfect for what we wanted - a really comfortable bed for resting after busy days sight seeing. We had fresh sheets & towels every day. Shower was a nice power shower. Good choice of films/TV channels for when we did pop back to the room before going back out. Air con / Heating in room - definitely needed for the cold November nights!! Upon check out stored our luggage for the day and organised a comfortable car to take us to the airport which I must say our driver was perfect after getting stuck in horrendous traffic which he said was almost his record for being the worst! So thank you driver!! And when you go back to collect your luggage you have access to toilets and a bit of space to sort your cases and I got changed ready for the journey ahead. We've told family and friends about this hotel and we are already planning on coming back next year!Thank you Cassa Hotel for making our first trip to New York so great! :)

On 45th Street just east of 6th Avenue, the hotel is well situated for the theater district, Bryant Park, not too far from Rockefeller Center; but just far enough from Times Square to avoid the noise and crowds. Of course, being close to Times Square means it's close to subway access for a large number of lines going nearly anywhere in New York. Fantastically comfortable room, on 17th floor high above the street noise and great blackout curtains made it very dark for excellent sleep. Staff is super friendly and helpful. If I have one slight complaint it is that the heating unit is quite noisy, but I quickly became accustomed to it.

We have just returned from our 5 night stay in New York city with Cassa hotel and we would 100% recommend and hopefully return again sometime soon. On arrival the staff in the lobby were very friendly and made check-in quick and straight froward. We even had the added bonus of being upgrade to a King Room for our anniversary. We were shown to our room (Unfortunately we didn't get the guys name) but he could not do enough for us, through out our whole stay, from opening doors for us, to taking our baggage to and from the storage facility at the end of our stay. Our room was very clean on arrival and was cleaned everyday of our stay. The room is well equipped with toiletries, range of towels, hair dryer, slippers, robes, USB sockets and safe. The hotel also has a gym and roof top terrace, which would be great in the summer. The hotel is also based in a great location, a 2 minute walk to Times Square, close to metro stations, but also quite enough location not to disturb you at night. Plenty of shops, restaurants, quick eats and things to do within walking distance. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant (Located next door) for breakfast, but there was always water and fruit available in the lobby.

Had a wonderful 4 day stay at this hotel. The staff were incredibly friendly & helpful & the room was very nice with a comfortable bed. Would happily stay here again as close to a lot of attractions & easy to get those those that were further away.
user_name:
ianpI8587CQ
Weston super Mare, United Kingdom

review_body: Arrived on Monday evening to be greeted by Dre who was knowledgable and accommodating offering us coffee on the room. The room was clean and tidy with fresh towels daily. If you need any help during your stay ask Dre,who we have to say, answered any questions we asked. Would recommend this hotel which is prime location for most attractions and very comfortable. One criticism would be the carpets needs hoovering daily.

Great rooms and staff was incredibly helpful and friendly! :) Rooms were super clean and fresh. And staff really helped accommodating our special requests. Really loved our stay! Ask for Dre or John at the front desk- they're the best!

Great location. Quiet. Clean. Service is incredible. Dre at the front desk made me feel at home! I stay here every time I'm in New York City, which is almost every week. I have stayed in NYC at some of the best hotels. Which cost a lot more. They aren't worth it. The service isn't as good. They are not as quiet. So many many of the new hotels hardly have room to move from the bed to the bathroom. The bathroom, barely fits a shower and a toilet. There is a great restaurant in the lower floor. I can't say enough great things about Cassa.
user_name:
shariso
New York City, New York

review_body: Great hotel, great staff cracking location within walking distance of Time Square and most of the major places people like to visit.Staff were great.Rooms are large for NY Just a great hotel in the right place.

Hotel is in great location and only a block away from Times Square. All staff were very friendly and professional. Room & bathroom excellent and immaculate. We were on 17th floor to rear of hotel so any outside noise minimal. Bed was comfortable . Only small issue was lack of tea / coffee making facilities - on departure we heard receptionist mention these can be provided if requested, this never mentioned to ourselves. Only negative point was their failure to book our car to airport which was arranged that morning - only through action of doorman was a replacement pick up organised , albeit almost an hour late and which ultimately led to us making flight home with 15 mins to spare. Could have marked lower due to this failing but up until that point, the service had been superb.

Stayed at this hotel 10th-14th Nov and couldn’t fault it. Helped us with our bags on arrival, friendly and helpful staff every day always giving us any tips when we needed them. Room was spacious and clean and bed was very comfy. I will definately be going back to this hotel if I’m lucky enough to go back to New York in the future

The convenient location and helpful staff made our experience at the Cassa Hotel so enjoyable. The rooms were simple but very clean and quiet. The staff went above and beyond! We will surely be visiting them again soon!

The mattress was very uncomfortable and the pillows were mush. Called and got better pillows. Really unsettling was the $4 charge per no brand bottled water! This hotel was recommended by BDNY but will never stay there again . Staff was nice but bathroom and bed were terrible.

Really good hotel just needs better beds as mine wasn’t very comfortable. Mattress was quite hard and lumpy and the bed linen was quite thin. Very good hotel for location and the staff were absolutely fantastic.

Visited this hotel for our 25th wedding anniversary. This was our 1st time in New York & so pleased we chose this hotel. 5 minute walk to time square, lovely friendly helpful staff, would definitely stay here again. There’s a lovely Irish bar (Connelly’s) just a long the road to relax in after hard days sight seeing.

My daughter and I visited NYC and stayed in this brilliant hotel to celebrate our birthdays. What a great location, literally 2 mins to Times Square in one direction and 5th Avenue in the other. The room was big enough for the 2 of us, clean and warm, super large tv. Slight downside was the lack of wardrobe space, I guess Americans usually travel light. The bathroom was fabulous, what must be THE best shower ever in a hotel room. What really made the trip though were the staff! I can't compliment them enough, they sent a kettle up to our room with tea bags, milk etc and on my daughter's bday put a lovely card and cupcakes in our room. Their recommendations for food be it breakfast or dinner were spot on (wish we'd listened to them about Hard Rock Café - what a let down). We used their driver too, he was great, absolutely no problem, chatted away to us, pointed out landmarks etc, so we had no worries there. If we were to go back to NYC we'd go back there and have absolutely no hesitation in recommending to all

Nice size, quiet room with comfortable bed. The best part of this hotel was the amazing staff; helpful, friendly and really cared about the quality of my stay. Awesome location to Time Square, theatre and restaurants.

Me & my boyfriend stayed here for a week from 31st October 2017. Check in was super easy and the girl on the desk was really friendly and even offered to up us to a bigger room if we wanted free of charge. When we got to our room she also called us to check it was ok and offer if we need anything. Rooms are clean, modern and spacious with all the essentials. Free WIFI is a big bonus. Would 100% stay again.

Close to the Madison Square Garden and a block away from Time Square. The hotel is really well located and we were walking distance to everything. Room was comfy, clean and entertainment system was a plus. All room staff was helpful and made us feel like home. If you are looking to a well located hotel book with them. I will consider this place next time that's for sure.

We stayed at the Cassa for a week while doing all the touristy things. We did tonnes of research on finding places to stay, we were close to booking an air bnb due to the high cost of hotels in NY but our travel agent managed to get the Cassa at a good price (similar to air bnb) and we are so glad we stayed here. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was perfect size for a couple and the bathroom was also good size. The room and bathroom was clean and modern. I felt really comfortable staying there.The location is fantastic! You can walk to so many locations from here, time square is so close, madison square garden and broadway. Plenty of nearby bars and restaurants. Rockefeller centre, 5th avenue, empire state - all easy walking distance. We chose to use the subway a couple of times (e.g down to 9/11 memorial) while we were in NY and it is easy if you dont want to walk as far. We walked to central park, rode bikes around for a couple of hours and walked home - not far at all.The only downfall was when we left for the airport we used the hotel driver (dont know if they have multiple) but he was driving a black GMC. He was unfriendly, almost scary actually. We were quoted by the hotel that it would cost total $115 inc tips and taxes to get to the airport and that we would pay him on arrival to airport. They advised eftpos was an option with a $6 surcharge. We were happy to pay this as we only had scraps of USD leftover. The man didnt speak the whole way there and on arrival told us it was $120 cash plus tips. He wasnt interested in my explanation of what the hotel had told us especially about paying eftpos. He was just ripping us off. We luckily managed to scrounge together $120 plus some leftover coins for tips. He took the money and walked iff while spitting, clearly unhappy with not receiving more money. Wouldnt recommend using this driver at all. This was our only poor experience with the Cassa.

CASSA is located in the center of Manhattan, in a location close to the theater zone, several subway stations. Nice facilities. Lobby is small and reduced to the minimal necessary. Staff was very efficient and friendly during all the stay, Well maintained rooms, modern furniture and appliances. We did not take the breakfast option, but there are many options around (a Pret A Manger next door for instance).

We have just returned from our first trip to New York and stayed here. Prior to our arrival I emailed the hotel a couple of times and the response was excellent and all our requests met! On check in we were given a complimentary upgrade to our room as it was my birthday. Our room was fantastic. The bed was huge and very comfortable. We had requested a high floor and were on the 25th. There was virtually no noise from the busy streets below or anywhere else within the hotel. We requested a coffee machine in our room which was there for our arrival and restocked every day. The shower was great and the toiletries in the room were lovely too. We also had a large tv, fridge, safe and pretty much everything you need even and ironing board! The room was also immaculate and serviced every day. We didn’t need to ask the hotel staff to arrange anything for us but we asked for recommendations for food etc and they were excellent. The guys on the door were also very helpful and attentive especially when checking out, storing our bags and helping load the car. The lemon infused water served in the lobby was a lovely refreshing touch after a long day of sightseeing. I really have nothing negative to say about this hotel. I will definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone visiting New York in the future! Thank you Cassa for a great experience.

This is a great little boutique hotel in the heart of Times Square. Walking distance from it all but yet far away enough so that you are not dealing with crazy crowds at the front of the hotel. The staff will know you by name since this is a small hotel, and to us there is something nice and personal about this. Our room had a cool window in the restroom! Overall great room, and awesome location. Hope to go back some day!

We stayed 5 nights in this hotel in early Sept'17. Great location on West 45th St between 5th and 6th Avenues and only a couple of blocks from Times Square. The Executive King room was very quiet, of reasonable size, and the bed was very comfortable. Staff were always helpful and friendly. However the breakfast served in the hotel's 'Butter Restaurant' in the dimly lit lower ground floor was a 'SHOCKER'. The bread and pastries looked and tasted stale and the toaster took forever to toast. No choice of fruit juices - the 1st morning serve yourself orange juice from the plastic container in an ice bucket - the 2nd morning small cans of pineapple juice in the same ice bucket. Only 1 cereal and pour yourself milk from the carton. The food in the bain-maries (scrambled egg, sausages, bacon etc) was overcooked and barely warm. Coffee tasted as if it had been brewed over and over again. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay, but the breakfast needs an urgent overhaul/upgrade.

Great rooms but hotel room was a bit small for my taste... NO free WiFi but excellent location near Times Square! When we checked in we were moved to a different hotel 2 blocks away for a night because they were full. BUYER BEWARE! Other than that its excellent.

We were in NY four nights in October. This location was perfect for us; we were within easy walking distance to Time Square, Rockefeller, 5th Ave shopping, Central Park, Metropolitan Museum of Art, NY Public Library, subway stations, and restaurants/pubs. Our room was small but well designed so we had space to store everything and didn't feel cramped. The bathroom was large, relative to the room size; with a separate vanity table and bench, rain shower (with good water pressure!), backlit mirror, dimmable lighting, and nice products. Service at the front desk was friendly and they serve complimentary coffee in the morning. I would definitely stay here again if I got a good deal. We paid under $300/night which by the sounds of it, was a good price for this hotel and location.

Stayed here for 6 nights in October 2017 whilst visiting New York.Check in was smooth and efficient and we found the room and bed to be of adequate size and the bathroom (shower only) was of a reasonable standard.There was nowhere near enough storage in the room for our clothes but there was a large TV, a free safe and a small fridge.There was also a small 24 hour gym on the 10th floor which had two treadmills, a couple of cross trainers and some loose weights which I used several times.The front desk were very helpful with directions and printing tickets, and the location of the hotel being 5 minutes from Times Square and 2 minutes from Fifth Avenue was very good.The only real criticism I would have is that the hotel doesn't have it's own bar or catering but as you are just round the corner from the Red Flame diner and many Irish bars that wasn't a problem.If the price is okay I would recommend this hotel.

we stayed in room 2202, the room was clean smart and very comfortable, the bed was the the comfiest hotel bed i,ve ever slept in!!.the staff were extremely helpful and friendly, gave some great advice and tips for our visit.staying here you will be two blocks or 5mins walk from times square.i will be definitely be stopping here again

I stayed for 3 nights. A single room cost $1000. Room was ok that’s all I can say. No coffee making facilities in room and a rather pointless iPod dock unless you have an iPhone 4. Good location and quiet but expected more for that price. Staff were anonymous. Each morning there was coffee downstairs but for this price expected more. Disappointing.

After reading alot of horror stories about some hotels in nyc, im glad we booked in at the Cassa. The rooms were decent size, nout too big but as exepected with nyc hotels. Bed was very comfy, bathroom facilities were great, tv was big with a wide range of channels and there is a free safe ans fridge to use.All of the staff seemed pleasant and professional and were happy to help. We arrived 2 hours earlier than check in but they allowed us to use the 10th floor facilities to get changed after a long flight and leave our cases at the hotel to go for a small explore.We didnt use the breakfast facilities but then we were happy to grab quick food from local starbucks...after all there is alot of things to see in nyc and time is of the essence.Compared to other hotel reviews the room we stayed in on the 7th floor was sound proofed well. Not much noise from the street so you are sure to get a good nights sleep. My only criticism would be no free water top ups in room. They leave 2 bottles in there at a rip off $4 + taxes. You can walk for 30 seconds out the hotel and find bottles for $1.50 so i dont understand the logic. There are also no tea making facilities in the room, instead they keep this only in the lobby...not a massive issue but one for brits to be aware of. Overall a good quality hotel in a great central location. Perfect for using as a base for all the sightseeing!

This was my first time staying at this hotel and I would easily come back. The staff is super helpful, friendly and willing to help - something that is always appreciated when being away from home. The location is incredibly convenient as it is in Midtown and very close to Times Square. Very close to subway stations to really get you anywhere that you need. Lastly, the rooms were very clean and well maintained - yay! I also couldn't believe how quiet it was (23rd floor). I would highly recommend staying here and will definitely be back. Thanks for making this a great stay!

Very well appointed and clean Hotel. Centrally located to Manhattan and Times Square. We also were able to walk to the Broadway show of our choice! The hotel room was very spacious and quiet (definitely a plus). The ac was very efficient and were were always comfortable here. We have found a favorite when visiting NY and certainly will be back again!

We chose this boutique hotel for its location, rating and overall value. We were delighted with the accommodation when we checked in and found it to be ideally situated, adjacent to Times Square in Midtown Manhattan, and close to the location I needed for a business meeting. The room was surprisingly spacious (by NYC standards), modern and well-appointed, meticulously clean and VERY quiet. The desk staff and bellmen were very friendly and helpful and were excellent ambassadors of this hotel and the Viceroy Hotel Group. We will definitely search out this hotel again on our next trip to the city and highly recommend it to others.

We stayed here one night to see a show on Broadway. Location is great. Rooms are clean, we were high up, 20th floor, to avoid street noise. It was quiet! However, no lobby, not a warm place. Just a place to lay your head.

Stayed at Cassa three nights beginning Sept 22. Room was lovely, clean, comfortable and had a great a/c for the unusual heat wave of the weekend. Front desk staff especially Stephanie were very courteous and helpful. Close to subway, theatres, restaurants, etc. Darley, the driver from the DR was adorable and a wonderful spokesman for the hotel.

Lovely hotel in a great location. 2 minute walk to time square a minute to 5th Av. Brilliant friendly staff. Room is a typically smallish New York hotel room but still nice. Bathroom was really nice and a good size too.100% I'd stay again

This hotel is more about the room, it does have a restaurant in the basement but it is very expensive and the food is too sophisticated for my boring palate. We had a room on the 4th floor facing the street and although you could hear the traffic it was unduly intrusive. The room itself was lovely, like a junior suite with s big double bed a sofa desk and very large bathroom. It is lucated about 10 minutes walk from times sq. this hotel is s little gem, we paid £160 per night for our suite and considering the size of our room and the central location thought it was fantastic value for money. We stayed st the paramount nearby 2 weeks earlier and were not impressed.

What a true gem this hotel is! Rooms are more then adequate as you are only there to sleep/rest. Plenty of places to eat nearby that will cater for all. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, and are very friendly. Ideally located - between 5th & 6th Ave - Times Square only a block and a half away, Radio City Music Hall, Grand Central Station are within easy walking distance. Most of the Broadway shows are close by as well, with most having tickets available on the day.

The staff were amazing; friendly and so helpful. There was a feeling that everyone in the hotel genuinely wanted to make our stay pleasant and stress free. Anything we needed was easily accommodated. The room was quiet and comfortable.

+ Excellent location for exploring New York. Close to all major attractions and local transportation+ Kind staff+ Room and bath was clean, quite and comfortable- WiFi connection is limited to two devices, only- Small room, but ok für just three nights

We stayed here for a week for our first visit to New York.The room was great. Very clean, bed was very comfortable, loved the power shower! It was of a good size and quiet too. We asked for - and received - a coffee machine and there was also coffee downstairs in the morning, which was very good.We only had the breakfast once at Butter, as this was part of the deal. It wasn't as bad as previous reviews, but it wasn't good enough for us to return.Location was also very good, just a couple of blocks from Times Square.We got mixed reactions with the staff. The women on the desk on our last night and the gentleman on the morning that we left, were all really nice. Unfortunately, I couldn't say that for others, who came across as quite indifferent. We were out most of the day, so this didn't impact on us too much.Despite that, I would stay in this hotel again. It's a comfortable, clean reasonably priced hotel in a great location.

Stayed here for five nights and would gladly return. All staff were very pleasant friendly and helpful . It's in a great position for Times Square and two subways . The room was bigger than the one we had at The Wellington last visit. Great shower and good sized bathroom .Look forward to a return

This hotel is is located very close to Time Square and Rockefeller centre and lots of good restaurants ,especially if you like to walk.staff is very friendly and the hotel is very clean.Easy access to the subways and good shopping.

We stayed at Cassa for 5 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay! It's in an amazing location, a couple of blocks from Times Square. The gentleman who works the desk at night/early morning is a credit to the hotel, was extremely friendly and accomodating when we checked in at 2am and out again at 5am. The room was clean, quiet and the bed extremely comfortable. The bathroom had lots of space with a nice, powerful shower and modern decor. The air con worked well and the TV was a good size. Definitely recommend the Cranberry Cafe deli on the next block for a quick bite, beers for the room etc. Will 100% recommend this hotel!

Cassa hotel is a warm and friendly hotel centrally located in the heart of the city just round the corner from Times Square staff are friendly and very helpful at the reception and really comfy beds and pillows which is a godsend when u have been walking your feet off room are a reasonable size clean and tidy with large shower if we decide to go again would definitely return.thankyou for a lovely stay

Had a wonderful stay. Large bright room with excellent bathroom facilities. Great location within easy walking distance of all the major attractions and easy to reach the statue of liberty. Plenty of eating places close by.

Hotel is situated in a great location a block from times square, 20 minute walk to empire state and roughly the same to the top of Broadway.hotel itself is clean and functional with friendly staff.Rooms are ok, bathroom was a very good size however not much hanging space, nice to have the fridge in the room Nice touch with coffee in the morning.Would I stop here again yes.

Clean and modern hotel near Bryant Park, Fifth Avenue and Rockfeller Center. Perfect starting point for your daily trip. The hotel room was spacious, cozy and clean (rarely you can find a clean hotel in NYC). Friendly staff. I loved this place. In my next trip to NYC, I will absolutely come back here. Hotel moderno e pulito vicino a Bryant Park, Fifth Avenue e Rockfeller Center. Perfetto punto di partenza. La stanza era spaziosa, carina e pulita (difficilmente si trova un hotel pulito a NYC). Staff molto cordiale. Mi è piaciuto molto questo hotel. Nel mio prossimo viaggio ci tornerò sicuramente.

You might miss the Cassa hotel as you walk along 45th street, but you'd be making a mistake. The hotel offers good value for the rate, has an incredibly warm and welcoming staff, and has comfortable rooms that are just fine for one or two travelers. It's very conveniently located, and even though it is just steps away from 6th Avenue, very little street noise was audible. I did not use the gym so I can't comment. They offer good coffee every morning and refreshing citrus infused cool water to refresh you in the afternoon. The staff is unfailingly kind and warm.

We booked a standard double and a deluxe double. On arrival we were told we had an upgrade to 2 deluxe doubles. In fact it appears we had a downgrade as to two singles. The rooms they gave us had a small double and matched the picture on their website of their single. We think they were overbooked and were shoving some of us in singles. We complained and they said they were double deluxe rooms blaming the company we booked with for booking us a double deluxe not a deluxe double!!! They said at first they couldn't change our room as they were full. They then said we could if we paid cash directly to them of $35/ dollars a night. Cheeky! Eventually we got our booking agent to sort it and got one better room but still had to put up with one single. The managers were unhelpful and lied. There is also no tea/ coffee in rooms, no lounge to relax in and no bar and no where to get breakfast that's part of the hotel Also watch out as we didn't realise there are 2 Cassa hotels in this area and the other one looks much nicer with fab roof top garden. So we were gutted to discover we were in the other one. This one is in a great location though

Arrived to a very nice welcome by reception staff. Stayed in the Cassa Suite which was huge. Hubby and I had the bedroom with a super comfy bed and our own tv. Our daughter was in the living area on a double sofa bed. Very clean with tonnes of storage space. Coffeemaker with coffee and milk provided. Did have to ask a couple of times for more coffee but that was sorted quickly. Bathroom was great and had a separate huge shower and bath. Lots of good towels and robes provided with high end toiletries. Very quiet suite with only one night where roadworks were very noisy down below and went on through the night but it is NYC.Breakfast in Butter was terrible and should be avoided just go to Pret A Manger next door. No cereals, cold eggs and bacon, stale croissant and very surly staff - not very friendly. The opposite to the hotel staff.Check out swift but as I used two cards to pay, not best pleased that there was a hold on both cards for a week which was ridiculous. Once paid, the hold should be released immediately. Very frustrating and for this reason I wouldn't return if this is the policy for Viceroy hotels. Taxi organised by the hotel was super with a great driver who got us to JFK on time.

Cassa hotel was a fabulous hotel and I would most definitely go back to stay there! The room was spotless. The staff were so friendly and helpful. It's a fantastic location, close to subway stations and a walk into Times Square! Amazing!

I don't usually leave reviews but this place deserves it, I've stayed here twice, once on business and another with my family and I must say I won't look anywhere else while in NYC, It's serviceable, clean, great location, great room size, and the hotel employees go out of their way to help in anything we need! Highly recommended for everyone.

Inner city hotel Manhattan so rooms are small but perfectly formed. Good bed, big TV, lots of plugs for charging plenty of electronic devices. Nice bathroom (shower only no bathtub). Drawers in the bathroom to put your stuff.The world's tiniest wardrobe though but it had a fridge which was wonderful given how hot it is in NY in July.Close to 3 different Metro stations and also several bus stops so really good location.The entrance to the hotel is quite small as is the lobby though there is coffee in the morning and some seating. Staff are really friendly and helpful. We are pretty low key low maintenance people so didn't need to interact with them but they were outgoing and it was a very nice touch.

We stayed 3 nights. Room was comfortable, quiet, and super clean. Staff was very friendly, felt like it was my home away from home. We stayed our last night at the W, and I definitely wish we had continued our stay at Cassa. The going rate to add a night to Cassa was Way to expensive.

The location of the hotel is good, about 5-6 mins walk from Times Square one way and Grand Central the other wayRoom was big and clean as was the bathroom but bit out dated.Some of the communal areas could do with a face lift as they are looking a bit tired, but too be honest when visiting New York you don't spend great amounts of time in the room!

Stayed for 2 nights and it was perfect. The room was plenty big for my friend and I and the staff was wonderful. Great location - easy to Times Square. Not inexpensive, it was high season, but worth it. I'd stay here again!

The staff at Cassa 45 went above and beyond to make our honeymoon memorable. They were so friendly and helpful and made our experience in New York amazing. The hotel is super close to times square but not so close that it's too noisy. Will definitely stay again when we visit New York!

Stayed here about 2 weeks ago and upon arriving I was warmly greeted by Felecia who was very helpful with my spur of the moment check-in. When I was ready to checkout I was assisted by James and Jonathan who's personalities truly make this hotel a familial environment! I'm definitely coming again! 5-Stars!!!

Within one block of Times Square -but just far enough away to be nice & quiet at night. Last time we stayed at the Edison right by Times Square @ it was extremely noisy outside as you would expect. Best of both worlds here. Staff extremely pleasant & helpful. Room small but clean with a good sized bathroom with excellent walk-in shower.

While clean and very quiet, the room was tiny, tiny, tiny and you got nothing with it. No breakfast, no lobby, no nothing. I think other hotels in the area might offer a better deal or at least a bigger room. This should be called a pod hotel.

There was only two of us, so the room was small, but it was clean and comfortable. Location was perfect for us as we were just sightseeing for a long weekend. Staff was friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

I dont usually stay in this part of town, so I wasnt super confident choosing Cassa. But I shouldnt have worried. It really was an excellent option.We got two good rooms at a reasonable price. Surprisingly good value, really.OUr room was very big, and had everything you really want - good comfortabe bed, no street noise, modern bathroom, good water pressure, CLEAN, etc etc. Really nothing I could fault.The staff were very helpful. On our last day we had a very late flight, and thought about extending one of the rooms so we had a place to shower, leave our stuff etc. The staff (Anthony, I think) handled the request with perfectly, and made us a really fair deal to extend one of the rooms for one more night. The staff also had a few good local tips, like the Red Flame diner around the corner.Location-wise it is in a good spot. Close enough to the midtown highlights, but ALSO close to the subway lines you need to go downtown.Great stay overall. Recommended.

We wanted a central location, with great reviews, value for money and good service. Cassa delivered.I chose the title "Great accommodation" for a reason. If you want all the ambience and services of a traditional hotel, such as a large lobby and multiple F&B outlets, then Cassa isn't for you. We were vacationing - enjoying all the tourist experiences of NYC and it was perfect. Location in Midtown, 5-10 minutes walk from Times Square, is excellent. We were 2 Adults and a 10 year old and the room size was fine. No room for a rollaway bed, but we worked it out in a Double Double. We were only in the room to escape the craziness of NYC and to sleep. There was no traffic noise on the twelfth floor. Beds were comfy with good linen. Bathroom was a fair size. The lobby staff were friendly, polite and helpful. We were very happy with our stay.

I visited this hotel with my partner in July 2017 for 6 nights and absolutely couldn't fault it! The location is fab, in walking distance from the Rockefeller Centre, Times Square and Grand Central train station, also very close to important metro lines which take you around NYC. The staff were very pleasant and there was complimentary ice cold water in the day and coffee/tea in the morning in the lobby which we benefited from. Housekeeping come every day and change towels/bedding, we had the option to ask for the bedding not to be changed everyday which we did. The decor in the rooms, bathrooms and lobby is so modern and appealing to the eye. Absolutely beautiful hotel with very pleasant staff, thank you!

I have been to Manhattan several times and this is probably one of the best rooms I have received at a more-than-reasonable price for New York. Room: Like most Manhattan hotel rooms it is fairly small, but still a little bigger than others I have stayed in. Beds are super comfortable with 4 pillows. There is a huge HD TV in the room along with a safe, mini-fridge and iron/ironing board. The bathroom is a decent size with an amazing shower featuring a rain-shower head and detachable spray wand. Loved the Roil brand shampoo, conditioner and shower gel. There is also a hair dryer in the room.Lobby and staff: The lobby is small, but you can get complimentary coffee in the morning and cold water with lemon in the afternoon and evening. There is a restaurant called "Butter" attached to the hotel but we never tried it.Staff was overall very friendly, but my only criticism of the hotel falls in this area. Though check-in time is 3 p.m, my room was not available until 3:40, which was a bit annoying since we had flown in that morning and had been walking around in 95-degree weather waiting for the room to come available. Luckily, my friend's room was available by 11:00 a.m. so we just stored luggage there. Staff was at least nice about it.Location: This is a fantastic location to explore Manhattan. Only 2 blocks away from Times Square and one block off 5th Avenue. You are a 5 minute walk (or less) to Rockefeller Center and less than a 10 minute walk to Central Park. Closest subway station is about a block away.

The room and the shower are small. There is a mini fridge but no bathrobes. It was quiet and the sheets were smooth. There's coffee in the lobby but you need to request a coffee maker and ice if you want it in your room. There's no ambiance, no lounge or bar. There's a restaurant below street level but I never checked it out. The location is good if you're going to a show or coming and going from Grand Central but it's not much to experience. It faces 45th street so there's not much of a view either.

I stayed there during the July 4th weekend. I was assigned a petite room on the 24th floor facing the south (so so view). It was a tiny room with a tiny bed and a tiny closet but according to my NYC-based friends, the room was apparently big already for NYC. The tiny bed was comfortable - I was there by myself so I had no problems with how tiny the bed was. It has a modern and adequate bathroom - glass doors and rain shower head. It also seemed like there was enough soundproofing because I didn't hear my neighbors at all. The location is great. Very central. Walking distance to the Rockefeller, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Times Square, Broadway, Grand Central, Penn Station, Empire State and the Central Park.The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful. The maintenance staff kept my room spotless and was very responsive. I was not able to try the only restaurant in the building though.
user_name:
NormanDF
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great Hotel. Staff are super welcoming. Rooms are lovely, huge by NY standards. One of the most comfortable beds I have ever stayed in. Location of hotel is brilliant. No complaints, would definitely stay here again.

We enjoyed our stay at the Cassa Hotel on Saturday eveningl. It was clean , neat and quiet especially at night. Centrally located! Felt like we were private guests! The staff was helpful and courteous. Will definitely return. Thank you for making my weekend so enjoyable!

The location of the hotel is great, and the Executive King Room is very nice. Breakfast was included in my rate, and was fine, but would not recommend paying extra for it. However, I have been here 2 days already and have had no housekeeping service. Yesterday I was out for most of the day, and when I got back around 3:30 it was not serviced, but eventually I put the "do not disturb" sign out so I could shower and get dressed for the evening. When I left again it was too late, as apparently they only work until 5. Today I was out all morning, stopped back in around 1, not serviced. On my way out a few minutes later I asked at the desk if it could be done before I would be back around 4:00, and they said no problem. Got back at 4:45, still not serviced, and apparently not going to get done before 5pm, so no service again for the second day in a row. Very disappointing service!!!

Cassa Hotel has a great location, between Times Square and Fifth Avenue and 5 minutes walking distance from Bryant Park. For a first time in NYC this was great. At check-in, the staff kindly upgraded us from a Queen Room to a King Room. The room had a good size, was very quiet and the mattress and pillows were very comfortable. The only downside is that I personally don't like carpeted floors. They don't look particularly hygienic and clean.The bathroom was big and spotless clean. The hotel staff was kind and helpful. The breakfast, included in the room rate, was at a restaurant in the basement of the hotel. It didn't have many options but it was a good start for the day. Contrary to the hotel staff, the restaurant staff was idle.

We got here tonight. It's very disappointing. Beds are just mattresses on cheap plywood that moves and is unstable. They have used oversize(king) sheets on double beds and literally stuff them under mattress. Bathroom is small and shower is behind the bathroom door. Very wired layout that you can not access the shower if you don't close the door completely. Sink is broken. Carpet has stains. AC is super noisy. Very unhelpful front desk. They don't even have map! They say they ran out! Rooms are definitely OVER priced. They have charged us $450 a night and I have booked this a month ago. We are very disappointed. I'm sure hotel has its own people write good reviews for it. Don't recommend this hotel.Don't get this hotel !!!!!!!!!

Great location. Close to Times Square and Central Park. Friendly staff. Clean rooms. Close to Starbucks, and Milk N' Honey cafe for breakfast. Nice deli next door for grabbing a quick bite. Walgreens is at the end of the block if you need anything.

Loved staying there, Fantastic location. Very easy access for the subway to other parts of NY. Room was clean we were on the 23rd floor. I would suggest staying on as higher level as possible so you do get the street noise as it never stops. 23rd floor was great we didn't hear any thing. Staff are lovely and very helpful. Close to cheap eats for breakfast, lunch and dinner. All over I would stay there again.

Be careful! If you're traveling by car, you have to know that there's absolutely no way you can park your car right in front of the hotel to take out your suitcases and check-in.
