Not even for 1 minute! Your car will get booted or towed- immediately. Unfortunately, this happened to us, since the check-in process took about 30 mins.Even though I kept walking out to check on my car, which was parked right in front of the hotel, I ended up with a boot on my car. Another big issue I faced - THE HOTEL charges you $150 for pets (NOT stated anywhere) which is more than I paid for the room itself, since I only booked ONE night.I made sure to ask BEFORE arrival, but I never got a response.I'm used to traveling with my dog and I've been pretty much all over the world with him, but I never had to pay MORE for him, than for the actual room. We had to wait forever for the manager and when he actually showed up, he took care of other hotel guests first, which prolonged the whole check-in process even more.All in all a very bad experience for my husband and I, since we had to pay $300 to get our car back and $150 for our little dog. It ended up being a very expensive trip. I would not recommend this hotel due to their unsatisfying customer service.

Check in was excellently handled by Felicia. She is a great asset to the hotel and by far the best receptionist we encountered on this trip, where we stayed in 14 hotels in total.The room was comfortable, good sleep quality, spotlessly clean, decent size for NY, good AC system. Very nice bathroom.Every single member of staff whom we encountered was extremely friendly.This review would have been a 5 except:1) On our sixth and final day, our room was overlooked by housekeeping and not cleaned and the towels were not replaced. Each time we rang reception we were just left on hold. We spoke to the manager when we were going out for dinner. When we came back the towels had been changed but nothing else, e.g. Bins not emptied, bed not dressed.2) Breakfast is catered by the restaurant "Butter". The restaurant staff, in stark contrast to the hotel staff, were the most unfriendly people we met on this trip. Breakfast was included in our room rate, but at $25 per person it would be very poor value.We would definitely return to the hotel, but on a room-only basis.

Stayed with another couple for our first trip to NYC. Rooms were a decent size, clean and the bed was very big (we're used to a double!). The location was great for us. All of the staff we spoke with were amazing, particularly two very handsome helpful chaps on reception! We'd definitely stay here again.

We have read a previous review where another reviewer complained about having been assigned a full size bed for 2 adults, and the reply from the hotel appeared to suggest that it would have assigned a bigger room instead. So we went ahead and book a room for 5 nights at Cassa through "Hotel Tonight". It clearly states that the room can accommodate 2 adults. Guess what? We just checked in and the concierge insisted that we could only get a full size bed (not even a queen size) through "Hotel Tonight", or pay $50 per night to upgrade to a room with bigger size bed. Very disappointed with both.

Friendly staff. Clean bathroom. Clean bed, but not so clean carpet. The ventilation fan is too noisy. Excellent location. Disappointing breakfast, sometimes not ready at opening hour. Sometimes things was missing. No cheese or ham, lots of sweet cakes.

We arrived an hour or so before check in but we were given a room straight away, check in was very quick and friendly. We had a standard double room which was nice and clean and although it was a bit small didn't matter as we weren't spending any time in it. The bathroom was nice and big with a good walk in shower. The hotel is in such a great location, we walked to everything we went to see and it was even walkable from the One World centre (via the High Line). This was our first time in New York and if/when we return we will be staying in this hotel.

Stayed in April with my wife, excellent location few minutes walk away from times square. Staff all very friendly and helpful, there was some confusion on arrival, turned out our room was double booked but the staff more than made up for it putting us in a standard room with an apology with drinks and chocolate a day later upgrading us to a executive room free of charge.. Top tip! Get breakfast included. Loads to choose from and delicious.

Stayed for 1 night. Location is good as it's near Times Square area. Good for 1 or 2 people but definitely not for family guests. Room is fairly small but it's clean.Front Desk people have been very helpful as they allowed me to check in earlier at 12 noon.

What can I say it was amazing, Okay the hotel room wasn't huge but what do you expect in new York. Service was second to none, every day we came home to compleatly new towels and the bed made. We normally throw our night wear around the bed but every day they were folded neatly at the end of the bed. Reception staff so friendly but not in your face at all just let you do your thing, Our check-in was done in 2 minutes quickest ever. The breakfast was lovely I have to say for an extra few dollers well worth it. Whoever complains about this hotel will not be happy anywhere

This is a very nice hotel and the staff are superb, cannot do enough for you, extra bathrobes, slippers, tea kettle and coffee machine provided within minutes.Loved our week here and would happily go back, the room and bed were a little small for 2 adults but that was not their fault, badly advised by Expedia so be careful to get a larger room if you are not just one person. we had just the standard room and it was a little cosy but not impossible.the location is within walking distance of Broadway, Empire state building and all the places you probably want to visit.

We recently stayed at this hotel and found the staff to be very helpful and the location to be very convenient to the many attractions of New York. There is a restaurant on site and a lot of others nearby.

A good location hotel closed to main attractions in Manhatton. Not bad room size and comfortable bed. Now the bad things. Very small and uncomfortable reception area. And very dark restaurant. Out of 5 nights that we have stayed, the room wasn't cleaned and ready even by 4.00 pm. On those 3 days, we have been forced to stay in the reception waiting for the room to be cleaned. We complained to the reception and were told ' sorry next time you come to NYC we make sure that room is cleaned in the morning' what a ridiculous answer !! We waited in the reception but nobody even informed us that the room had been cleaned. Not recommended hotel at all. Unfortunately, all the good things that we thought about this hotel about this hotel have gone down the drain. We are planning to come back to NYC in Dec this year but surely we are not going to stay in this hotel again.
user_location: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom
user_name:
Villa57
The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom

review_body: I love staying at this boutique hotel! It's out of the tourist areas but still close enough to walk to Times Square and theaters. When the rooms are on sale they are a great value and hard to beat. The bathroom is one of my favorite features. Big glass shower with waterfall shower head and electric lighted mirror that does steam up! Also the bathroom light is on a dimmer allowing it to be used as a night light.

Stayed at Cassa Hotel 45th Street last week for my in-laws’ 50th wedding anniversary trip. Enjoyed everything about this hotel. The staff was so accommodating & helpful. I would like to give a shout out to several of the staff for exceptional customer service. Since it was my in-law’s golden anniversary, we wanted to do something special for them. Before arrival, I inquired about having flowers or wine delivered to their room for a surprise. Felecia emailed me back promptly with several options & even followed up on her day off to let me know that everything was confirmed & provided her manager’s email address should I need further assistance. Felecia & Patrick also helped coordinate transportation from the airport to the hotel. Our driver Darly was very friendly & texted us to let us know where to meet him after picking up our luggage. He helped with our bags & offered us water on our way to the hotel. Once at the hotel everyone made us feel welcome. Felecia & team did a wonderful job decorating the room with rose petals & even included a bottle of wine & 2 wine glasses. It really made our parents feel special & set the tone for the rest of our stay. Regarding the rooms – Our parents had a Jr Suite which was pretty spacious. Nice sitting area with couch, coffee maker, fridge. Large bathroom with double vanity & nice shower/tub combo w/plenty of luxury bath products. They enjoyed their large comfortable bed & huge flat screened tv. We had a Deluxe room with Queen bed which was smaller than their Jr Suite, (did not have the additional room with couch), but just as nice. Nice big bathroom with rain showerhead. Bed & linens were very comfortable. The rooms were so quiet & comfy that all of us slept in each day. My partner enjoyed the use of the gym each morning. Each time we returned to the hotel, the staff would welcome us back & ask if we needed anything. The location was perfect. Conveniently close to the Times Square & subways, yet far enough away if you wanted to avoid all the chaos & people. Walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Grand Central, Bryant Park, etc. Checking out was simple & again they arranged our return transportation to the airport. Cesar was our driver & got us through traffic & at the airport in no time. Normally I don’t have much interaction when traveling. I usually just check in & check out. The staff at Cassa was very different. Very friendly, professional, accommodating & helpful each & every day. Thank you for making this special occasion even more special. I will recommend Cassa to all my friends!

Super comfy beds, very clean and modern rooms. Friendly staff. Location is excellent as only 5 mins walk from Times Square. Nothing too much trouble for staff. We had an executive king room, very spacious.

The best thing about this hotel is the location! It is 1 min away from Times Square. The size of the room is decent for NYC. We had a great deal with Expedia, so it was worth it, but I wouldn't have paid more than that.

Stayed with family for Christmas and New Year, 11 nights in total. Great location, an easy walk to all mid town attractions yet in relatively quiet street for mid Town. Yes the room is small but very comfortable. The bed, linen and pillows were high quality. Inside the room was quiet and dark, so we had great sleep.

We booked the most basic room here on a great deal we found via hotels.com. We were really surprised to find thay the room was a good size (unusual for New York) and really clean. The hotel is in a good location if you are wanting to stay in Midtown and only a 5 minute walk from the nearest subway. It's not the world's most exciting hotel but we liked it and would stay again. One thing thay really annoyed us though was the check-in staff trying to persuade us to use their car to go to the airport. To book their car was $75 from the hotel to JFK and they told us that a yellow cab was not a set price going to the airport and on a weekend would cost us around $100 + tip. This is a total lie. Yellow cabs have a set fare to and from the airport of $62 or $65 if they take the toll road. Im not saying don't use the hotel car but there was no need to lie to try and get business. Glad to say we got a yellow cab and had great service from them both ways.

Great service. These people made a routine business trip a much more enjoyable experience. Front desk was very courteous and helpful. Room was small ( it's nyc) but very nice, betty clean. Waking distance to everything times square. Great place.

We stayed for 3 nights and every membour of staff we met was superb, friendly and helpful. Other hotels need to stay here to learn customer serviceHard to point to one member in particular, from the one to lend use his metro card to Felecia who spent 45 mins on the phone persuading the cowboys of a transfer company to send the taxi we had orderedNext time we will get the hotel to organise the transportThank Cassa for helping to make a great trip

We stayed at the Cassa Hotel 45th Street for 5 nights in May/June. The hotel is in a great location (2 minute walk to Times Square and subway), but it does not suffer in terms of noise being so close to Time Square - we did not notice any noise that we were expecting to. The amenities were clean and tidy, the room was nice, and the staff were great. Special thank you to Adam and Felicia - you were both so wonderful and personable, and such beautiful people! Thanks for a great holiday :)

This was our third stay at Cassa 45th. It is close to theaters, superior restaurants, subway stations, and museums without being too noisy and busy. It has all the best of being in midtown Manhattan without the downsides. The rooms are quiet and comfortable and clean. The staff was pleasant and helpful.

The room was nice and big for NYC. You had to call down for a robe and a coffee maker, why not just assume we want them? The room was quite noisy which didn't bother me but my friends had a hard time sleeping in their room. Just walk to get breakfast the breakfast at Butter is simply awful. The front desk staff was always smiling and helpful. It was annoying to have a broken elevator for part of our stay with no eta.

the hotel is 5 minutes from times square / 10 minutes to central park on foot and perfectly situated for everything. The rooms are good city hotel size , really clean and the staff were very helpful. We had 3 nights here in May and the hotel was the perfect base for everything

I stayed 4 nights here. The staff all of them are very friendly and helpfull. I felt at home the hospitality was excellent. The hotel room was very very good, clean, modern and quiet. Breakfast was good. The location of hotel is great! Thanks for making my trip so great...Tulay Tutar

All prestations are very good. We stay 6 nights and we are very enjoy by this hotel (room, staf, breakfast, wifi and internet connexion...), you have many shops and restaurant near the hotel. 42St & Time Square Station is at 5/10mn walk.

I am perplexed by my experience based on the reviews. I checked into this hotel yesterday, having stayed at another hotel for the first part of our NYC stay and my inital impression based on Andrew the receptionist was favourable (he would be an excellent advocate for any establishment). I was not feeling very well and decided to have a sleep after checking in at 3pm: about 90mins later a man entered my room with a key card and on realising I was there, apologised and left; I reported this to the manager who informed me he would look into it and and allay my concerns (today) - I have heard nothing. Today after returning from a day out at 11.30pm (having left before 11.30am), I found my room had not been serviced and was begrudgingly offered fresh towels. Often on Tipadvisor, hotels negate any criscism under the the generic 'you should have complained whilst at the establishment'; as I am still staying at this particular hotel, I shall await their response with interest.

Wow! I was surprised with a birthday trip to New York which was amazing! Cassa Hotel is in a fantastic location. The room was very comfortable which is important after a long day of exploring New York and seeing all the near by sights. Cassa Hotel is part of a wonderful memory of mine. Thank you!

We stayed at the Cassa Hotel 45th St during a 7 day city break. The hotel is in a great location in the middle of midtown. It is within walking distance to a lot of attractions. Times Square/Theatre District is just a few minutes walk away, Central Park around 20 minutes, 5th Avenue, Grand Central, Rockefeller Plaza are all under 15 minute walks away. Even the Empire State building is within walking distance as are the Piers for the sightseeing boat cruises or Water Taxi. Anyway enough about the location, the hotel itself is smart and clean although the room was not that big. The bed was also just a Double rather than a Kingsize bed. That was the only gripe, besides this this hotel is highly recommended. Staff are friendly and polite, the rooms are cleaned daily in a timely manner. If you are a tourist looking to visit all the major attractions and want to be able to get to most of them by walking and saving your cash for other purposes then book this hotel. We got the New York Pass and we walked to all the activities besides Brooklyn Bridge, World Trade Centre and the Statue of Liberty but if you have the Hop on Hop off bus tour you can use that wisely to do those activities. If using NYC Pass then use the free Water Taxi for the World Trade Centre as this is the best way to get there. The hotel is also conveniently close to TKTS the theatre ticket booth in Times Square for discounted theatre tickets and the theatres are located close by as well. If you want to go to do some discounted shopping you can tske a bus to Jersey Gardens, which is a 45 minute bus away, tickets can be bought from the Port Authority Bus Terminal which is about 10 mins walk away. All in all, its a good hotel in an absolutely wonderful location.

I stayed here in march of this year, it was exactly what I was looking for during my 4 night stay:No one goes to New York to stay in their hotel room the whole time, I was looking for a clean, comfortable and convenient hotel. Cassa hotel was definitely this.On arrival and throughout the staff were very friendly and super helpful. when we asked for recommendations and when we asked for extra towels it was no trouble at all.It's central location allowed me to go out for the morning to explore and maybe to some shopping then return in the afternoon for a rest and to get ready for a busy night.I didn't use the gym or eat in the restaurant during my stay

We booked the Cassa through a travel zoo deal and we weren't disappointed. Location was ideal, 5 minute walk from Times Square and several subway stations within close proximity. On check in the staff were great and friendly and our room was bigger than we expected. There was limited room for unpacking your clothes but we made do, it's probably a hotel that's designed for short stay business travellers.Breakfast was limited and served in Butter the adjoining restaurant. Cassa doesn't have its own bar etc but to be honest it doesn't need it. For a fab location, decent price and excellent customer service I'd highly recommend the Cassa Hotel.

I stayed here during a one-night business trip and was very pleased with the central location and overall stay. The room itself was a bit tight, but the bathroom was surprisingly spacious and had nice fixtures. The staff were friendly and helpful as well. I would strongly consider staying here again if I have business in midtown.

I've stayed at the Cassa Hotel before, so I was surprised and disappointed that no longer does this hotel offer valet parking. If you are driving into New York City to stay at the Cassa, after checking in you'll have to drive to the end of 45th St, turn right and head to the car park on 46th St. The hotel does offer a discounted rate for overnight parking, but its a hassle to self park. Maybe I'm just spoilt at all the other hotels I stay in. Having got that gripe off my chest, the hotel itself is quite nice. Rooms are spacious and well appointed. The position of the hotel is perfect for 5th Avenue shopping, Broadway shows and all things midtown. Staff are super friendly and helpful. A good feature of the rooms is that mine had heavy curtains that when closed seem to mute the noise from the busy street below.

You couldn't ask for a much better location, right between Times Sq and Fifth Avenue, a short walk to the subway. The room was fairly spacious, clean and modern - perfect to rest up after a busy day exploring the city. The front desk staff were very helpful when called upon. They're all very knowledgeable about the city - particularly if you're looking for good food that's authentic New York, and not a chain restaurant.

Our first time to travel to New york so i want it to be centrally located,, very near to Times Square, Empire State Building & Central Park..etc. The hotel is so clean, comfy bed & soft pillow. Breakfast is in lower ground floor..cosy place. I will definately stay in this hotel again if im back in NYC. Staff are very helpful too.

The front staff is extra helpful and super friendly! Always smiling and really welcoming! Our room was super clean and the staff we encountered anywhere in the hotel were awesome. We had a petite room for 2. It was fine, my wife would have liked a like more area in the bathroom to put things, but we were both very happy. One elevator was broken but the staff apologized like crazy, but it was not a big deal. The location is perfect for theaters and attractions. We are walkers, but the walk from Penn Station was nice and we walked to the Flat-Iron District one day and to Central Park the next. In fact, we never needed transportation the entire trip. We stayed three nights hope to return soon!

My husband and I were very impressed by this hotel. Very well located, modern, clean, beautifully kept. The staff went out of their way to assist with providing directions, information and even organised our flight check in for when we left. They also organised an economical private transport back to the airport. Our room, a Junior Suite was spacious, well laid out and very comfortable. We will definitely use this hotel again.

They really go out of the way to make sure they can accommodate customer's request. One time we arrived in a very very horrible weather and they had everything taken care of. Nice recommendations for every request that we had. For us its more or less fuss free. We know what to expect, Nice sized rooms, clean rooms, Near everything, easy uber or train options, parking near by. WE know we will be comfortable, nice bed. So every time we go there, we just book there now.

Cassa on 45th made our stay in Manhattan an experience we won't forget. The hotel is located in a perfect location. Within walking distance of so many destinations, just a block away from Times Square and centered in the middle of everything! We would come back and stay anytime! The staff was incredible and Andrew was the best! We couldn't have asked for better. We stayed here for 4 days before a cruise and on our return visit, they even let us store our luggage before returning to the airport on our way home. Our flight didn't leave until that evening and we didn't want to spend the whole day at the airport. They were more than accommodating and even remembered us from our stay the week prior. This hotel is first class all the way! I can't say enough about what a great place this truly is! Thank you Cassa!

Stayed there Jan 2016 for about a week. The location was perfect, several subway stations around, bus stops, and just so central that you can walk and enjoy the city. room was minimal and not too big, as most NYC hotels are, but very comfy. soaps etc provided, several mirrors, nice TV/Music system. all rooms close to elevators. Breakfast was work it. lovely 24/7 staff.

First Class Hotel with great room and facilities within 5 minutes walking distance to Times Square and the Metro Station with access to the City. Reception staffs Felecia, James, Raymond and James are very welcoming, informative, humorous and helpful at all times. Definitely the place to stay for a trip to New York

Stayed here with friends for a 6 night stay in NYC. Had contacted the hotel to ask for a kettle in the room, and had good communication regarding, with them putting a coffee machine in for us. We had mistakenly booked a double instead of a queen, but they said they would put us down as a priority upgrade if they were overbooked, which did happen, which was great, although I wouldn't have liked to see the original booked room as this was small, but however was very comfortable and fairly quiet, meaning a good night's sleep. Bathroom and shower fine with complimentary toiletries. If we had one minor issue, it would have been that the hotel only had a small reception area with no comfortable sitting area or bar, but didn't really cause any problems. Staff were very friendly. Was located only a couple of minutes walk from Time Square and was very central to all the attractions in the north of Manhattan. Overall would recommend, and I would definitely stay here again.

Room: We booked an executive room with a king sized bed. The room was nicely decorated, with a phone, tv, toiletries, bathroom robe and slippers, good wifi. It had a coffee machine and fridge. It was just perfect for the trip. The shower was a rainfall shower head and was really great. The hotel was eco friendly also and only changed linens and towels if requested which is great. If you left the do not disturb out, they honestly wouldn't touch the room. Reception: The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. Very quick and easy check in and helped to check out and store our luggage for our last day. Recommended a good diner for breakfast around the corner and helped us to locate the nearest metro. Also the team helped us to book a cab to JFK airport which was a peace of mind. They provided a map on arrival of the area however there is a map on a leaflet on the table opposite the reception desk called the "Broadway" which is much better and more useful. As it has a good level of detail and subway details to navigate Manhattan. Location: The hotel is 5 minutes/1 block from Times Square, considering the distance it was absolutely perfect and yet it was nicely located that there was no noise from the streets in our room. The hotel is great, only things to improve on would be when providing instructions to guests it would be really helpful if they actually showed you on a map and drew the paths instead of verbally saying " turn left, turn right, walk 3 blocks, turn left" etc. It can be hard sometimes to grasp the directions especially if you ask for different places at the same time. It would be good to have two shower caps in the bathroom, although i'm sure if we had rang to ask for a second we would have received it. I would return to this hotel again and recommend it to for friends & family.

In spite of a full size bed for 2 (really?-don't they know Americans are over sized?!) the room was comfortable- especially for NYC.Location was great for theatre goers. Hotel was clean and quiet. Area was safe. Great staff - everyone was super friendly and helpful -particularly Felecia at the front desk. If you can get a discount rate it's a place to be.

It can be very very challenging to get a good nights sleep in the Big Apple. Cassa Hotel 45th Street once again delivered. I requested a quiet room on a higher floor- and was a bit surprised to be put on the 17 th floor. In the past I had been placed on higher floors. Not to worry--- room was perfect. Bed was super comfy , towels plush and the new bath products superb. The complimentary coffee in the morning is such a lovely gesture to guests. Front desk staff is always so welcoming and everyone is so friendly and makes you feel welcome each and every time you come back. I love this hotel!!!!! I will be back again soon!

As others mention, the hotel staff is top notch. Very kind, and accommodating. The location was prime. Felt safe at all times. Our room on the 15th floor was small and had NO DRESSER! I actually asked if we were just missing this, but the room service guy said no, none of the rooms had them. I know this is a BIG deal for some travelers. Had to live out of suitcases for 8 days. The room lighting is very bad. The bathroom is large with good light for make up, but NO FAN! Hot ladies need to bring a small fan...and by hot, you know I mean if you break into a sweat at any moment, you will need a fan. The a/c was tough to regulate. It was either too cold or off. Housekeeping was accommodating, but we often had to ask for extra mugs and coffee, which was always mad available to us. Since we were running most the time, this hotel was just fine. 2 adults to a room would be nice, our four was pushing it for double beds with no extra space.

The room was nice, but a little small. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The only downside was the valet parking. I had to wait too long when I checked in and when I checked out I had to wait almost an hour. The hotel staff was great, but the outside parking service was terrible. Did I say terrible enough times?!

First and foremost the hotel staff is friendly and deserves a kudos. Overall my impression of the hotel is it's basic and you can find a lot better in the same price point in the city. My guest room seems dingy and the heating/AC doesn't work. Woke up to 80 degrees of dry heat both nights. Last night there seems to be some construction in the room above mine that lasted for 30+ minutes around midnight. Location is convenient to Time Square.

Our room was on the 22nd floor and it was quite big for NY space. Super clean and even the bathroom had enough space to spread out a little. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. It's just off of Time Square so the bright lights and noise are minimal. Close to subway and Broadway shows!

The staff here are wonderful. Very helpful and friendly. They were only too happy to help with a few requests I had and did everything they could to make my stay there incredibly pleasant.The hotel is clean. The rooms are clean, quite large compared to standard NY sized hotel rooms.Great location. 5 minutes walk from Times Square/5th Av. So close to theatres, shopping, restaurants, tours, public transportation, Bryant Park, Grand Central Station, etc. Central Park is a short 10 min walk away. Many other iconic landmarks and much more all within walking distance.When I go back to New York, I will certainly be staying at Cassa Hotel.Note: Even though it is close to Times Square, you are not on top of it,which is great. Why? Because the room is quiet, you get get a good night's sleep and the lights from times sq aren't shining in your room al night!! Great hotel!! Highly recommended.

Had no complaints from the time we checked in to the time that we left. The front desk were very nice. Would definitely stay here again. Once we got to our room the front desk called to see how everything was. The bathroom was very large for a boutique hotel and the shower was great with hot water.

Would definitely recommend. Good central location. Friendly staff. Great breakfast although for 5 nights it got a touch repetitive. Rooms clean and modern. Staff double booked our room so we were downgraded for 2 nights but then upgraded for the remaining 3. Little apology gifts and note left for us which was sweet! Book this hotel guys you won't be disappointed!

Very nice place for a stay in New York. It is a 5 minutes walk to Times Square only. The staff is very nice and polite. The rooms are large. The bathrooms are well equipped. So I can only recommend this hotel!

Great location for theatres, shopping, restaurants, tours, public transportation, Times Square, Central Park and many iconic landmarks and much more all within walking distance. Staff very helpful in providing tourist information.

I am a regular reviewer on t adviser. Have been to NY two years ago and stayed At the Marriott marquis hotel and in my overall opinion that hotel excells, however , the staff at the cassa are amazingly friendly and give excellent care to the clients, especially Julio, Stephanie and Jonathon , the room maids do a great job

Just stayed for 5 days , never been to New York before.Hotel is in a great location just over a block from time square.Nice Irish bar across the road too.being overly picky perhaps more variety at breakfast otherwise spot on

Loved: Very friendly staff-- always noticed and greeted as we walked through. Again... helpful and welcoming staff! Comfy bed, linens and soft towels.Super clean and quite modern. Good blackout curtains for those morning sleep-ins.Absolutely perfect location for walking to the theater, yet quiet feeling block.Near 2 subway lines that will take you most anywhere, an amazing pizza spot (little italy across the street) shopping, Whole Foods (and their huge eat-in area with a view of the park) and Bryant Park. Super fast elevators (we were on the 24th floor)you can open the window for fresh air.... and when the window is closed, it very effectively blocks sounds.almost never heard neighbors even though the hotel was quite full.Less LoveRoom is fairly small... just room to walk around and sit at a little desk.Tiny closet with literally no place to hang long dresses unless you remove the ironing board stowed there.Giant shampoo/lotion containers (***they gross me out... why not make it so the cap can't be removed so we know it hasn't been tampered with??)Have to ask for everything... environmentally friendly, so they give you nothing unless you ask... at which point they happily do.... bathrobe, coffee maker, more than 1 large towel pp, etc.In this century and decade, we need outlets/chargers on both sides of a king bed! Our first room faced the back, which would normally be great for light sleepers as it is away from the traffic and horns. However, there is some sort of construction back there and we had to really insist that they move us to the front. I don't appreciate that one has to ask 4 times before being given a peaceful room-- especially when it's for 7 nights. Once moved, our stay was blissful!We had breakfast included and I don't count that in my rating. Breakfast was good, in that it had plenty of proteins (yogurt, bacon, eggs) but terrible in that they were almost always cold with no fire under the steamer. I really do appreciate a breakfast in the mornings so was super grateful for it, anyway. The pastries were quite good. (in fact, we had a reservation at another hotel, but switched to this one because of the breakfast.) I would love to stay again, but don't want to have to fight for a room that's quiet... so would have to think twice. But... this was a near-perfect stay at a comfy and perfectly located spot.

As a Christmas gift my husband surprised me with an over night stay at the Cassa Hotel for the first Saturday in April.Upon arrival, we met Julio who is a very personable, professional Valet. Julio was extremely knowledgeable about different sites and restaurants which he recommended to us. We arrived before check in time and our room was not ready. The young lady at the front desk was very accommodating & up graded our room. We went to lunch & were called that the room was ready still before the scheduled check in time.Our hotel room was very nice, clean and quiet. The bed and pillows extremely comfortable.The Cassa Hotel is upstairs from Butter Restaurant where we had an excellent dinner Saturday night. Coffee is self serve in the lobby in the morning.Andrew, Cassa's Manager inquired if we needed anything and was helpful with questions I had about the area.The Cassa is a very lovely Boutique Hotel with all of the amenities that we look for. In a City that has every type of lodging the Cassa will always be our choice because of the employees that run it. It is obvious that they truly enjoy making their guests comfortable.Our stay was only one night, but next time it will be longer.Thank you for making our night memorable. We will be back.Barbara & Nick Fallucca, So., NJ

We booked the hotel for our small NYC honeymoon stint. The hotel is very modern, in a perfect state and has very cozy rooms. Our room had a studio apartment character, yet with more luxury. Good sized hotel room, despite very central location, two blocks away from Time Square. Very friendly staff, amazing restaurant located in the ground floor/base and overall tidiness made this stay unforgettable.

I stayed at the hotel for 6 nights in mid April through Easter weekend. I found the hotel on Travelzoo at a great rate including breakfast. The breakfast in the BUTTER restaurant was great. Eggs, bacon, waffles, toast, croissants, donuts, yogurt, coffee, grapefruit juice, orange, etc. and it encouraged everyone to get up and out. The manager was very receptive to my FB messages and emails prior to my arrival. I enjoyed my stay, the location was great located between the 47th Rockefeller station and the 42nd Bryant Park stations, and not far from 42nd Street station too. The reception staff held our bags upon checkin and checkout so that we could explore without luggage. The lobby is small and some days there was water, other days there was hot chocolate, coffee in the morning with the WSJ. The location was close to fast food, a Whole Foods, and lots of sit down restaurants close by. We saw the Lion King which is on the same street, just a 5 minute walk away. Walgreens on the corner of 45th/7th for small incidentals. I did not request anything from housekeeping except I wrote a note requesting extra towels and I had a nightstand light that was not operable (it would just turn off and I could not get it to turn back on). There is no iron, bathrobes, coffee pot or mini-fridge - but they might have been available if I inquired? One side of the King bed had no electrical outlets and none in the wall either (at least visible). But the other side of the King did and also the desk area had outlets and USB outlet. Free internet access and it was fast. In the room, the windows open up about 5 inches, which was nice to get some fresh air and listen to the musicians/band playing lots of LTD, Michael Jackson, soulful R & B music on 6th Ave bet. 45 and 46. I heard them at least 2 nights and I was on the 21st floor facing 45th Street. The street noise was reasonable, more quiet on the weekends as opposed to Mon-Friday. The bed was very comfortable and the sheets soft. I had no problem falling asleep after the city wore me out. Anyway, I would definitely stay here again soon,

Staff were lovely and location was brilliant. The hotel was conveniently located to a range of theatres and restaurants as well as shopping on 5th Avenue. Only difficulty was the lack of gluten free options for breakfast and the carpet in the room was in need of cleaning.

Close to Broadway area and Times Square. Helpful staff. They give you print out of directions to wherever you're going. Clean. Quite small room and basic but cozy enough. Just a little hot during summer despite the aircon. Not easy to find the first time because of the one-way road. Wuite hard to get a cab. But walking distance yo Times Square.

Stayed here 26-29th march. Very comfortable room great bathroomExcellent wifi fantastic service Not best view but wasn't in the room for the viewsFree tea/coffee and fruit in the morning in reception areaFriendly staff great locationSpecial shout to Adam who helped with our luggage flagged taxi down and wouldn't take tipWould definitely recommend this hotel

We stayed at the Cassa for 11 nights and honestly there is nothing we could fault. Arrived at 2am in the morning only to realise I had booked for the following day, the front desk rang hotels nearby and organised a room for us so we weren't stranded- excellent service! The whole time we were there the staff were so friendly and welcoming. Rooms were really big in terms of New York standards we were really pleasantly surprised. The best thing about this is the location- 5 min walk to Times Square, 20 min walk to Central Park, 5 min walk to central station, rockerfeller etc or if you don't want to walk you've got many subways nearby! The have a great small little gym onsite and also have a sister gym that's huge about 5 mins walk away that you can use for free. We will definitely be returning to this hotel and it has been a highlight of our 6 month trip so far! Thanks all!

Thank you to the amazing front office managers, Osei and Andrew for making our daughter's short visit to NYC so memorable. Everything you provided was first rate, from the VIP treatment at check-in to the special amenity delivered to the room, Cassa really exceeded our expectations as they went above and beyond to make this an amazing birthday weekend!If you are visiting New York for a special occasion, Cassa is your perfect hotel!

I stay at the Cassa Hotel for business. the location is great and the rooms and service are always excellent. However, the staff this trip went above and beyond and deserve a shout out. I had a dental emergency in the middle of the night. Of course. I called the front desk and Patrick really stepped to help me find an emergency dentist. Everyone on the front desk was really knd and helpful. I'll be back!

Excellent situation, very warm and welcoming desk people. Quite peacefull room, no disagrement with neighbours or city traffic. Hotel is 3 min walk from Time Square, 8 min walk from bus station for airport. Perfect!

My girlfriend and I came to New York to look at schools in the area and as we had stayed at Viceroy Hotels in the past we were very excited to stay here. The room was nice and the bathroom was impeccable. The real star here though is the staff. The doorman and all of the staff were super polite and accommodating. Jonathan at the front desk was extremely helpful and super friendly. They were for the night before but we're still able to get us a room before normal check-in which was super helpful. I would not hesitate here to stay again.

Had a lovely stay here and the staff were very accommodating. The room was clean and a good size for New York in a fabulous location! The WiFi was good and I liked that a robe was supplied, I would definitely stay here again.

The hotel is in a brilliant location between 5th and 6th avenue. We could walk almost everywhere. The room was modern and clean. Tea and coffee facilities were put in our room on request. Safe, hairdryer and iron in the room. The staff were all lovely and very helpful with directions and luggage. Would stay again.

My wife and I travelled to NYC for the first time as an Anniversary Trip and to see Eric Clapton. So after doing a bunch of research on line, we chose the Cassa Hotel to stay. And we made the right choice!!Upon arriving, we were greeted by both Corey and Jon on the front desk. These guys know their stuff and were very helpful and pleasant to deal with the 5 days we were in NYC.Cassa is located right in the hub of everything. It is a 2 minute walk to Times Square, NBC building, Hells Kitchen area where there are tremendous choices to eat and to the Subway system.Our room was great. We booked room 601 which has a queen bed, a nice sized bathroom with a huge walk in shower and a quaint sized sitting area with a small refrigerator tucked into the bottom of the large desk/writing area. Also with us being up on the 6th floor. Our room was very quiet from all of the outside hustle and bustle.Our room was made up daily and we always had clean towels daily too.If you are new to NYC and want to stay where you are close to everything. Then I recommend that you make the Cassa your choice of hotel to stay. As it doesn't get much better than this!

The location is great, the staff is excellent. Comfortable executive room with lot's of space and good shower. The hotel is very clean and the bed and amenities very confortableIt was my first stay but I will certainly come back

The Cassa Hotel is located in the heart of Times Square on 45th street between 6th and 5th avenues. It is a very modern hotel with very clean and modern rooms. When we stayed there the entire bill for one night was only $150.00 which is amazing in mid-town. I would highly reccommend staying there when you visit NYC.
user_name:
Marc & Angelyn G
Kings Park, New York

review_body: We chose this hotel for its great location and great price on jetsetter.Breakfast was mediocre buffet that was set up in its restaurant Butter. I would never pay the $20 if we didn't have comp vouchers. Also the bar food and drinks were real expensive even for nyc however really pretty restaurant. Valet parking is tough due to busy 45th street and of course expensive. Room,bath products and hotel staff terrific.

I have stayed at this hotel for a week. Location is good, it is near Times Square and all subways lines are close by. It is clean hotel, a bit sober but still value forMoney. Speaking of money, I travel a lot to New York and this was the first time that the bed was too small for my length. I am over 6ft (193cm) so the hotel did upgrade me to a larger room with a larger bed. Still I had to pay for a couple of days but the rest of the week it was complimentary.Wifi is really good, staff is friendly, location is good. The only issue I had was they were still cleaning my room after I got back from the job. One advice though for the hotel, I don't know if the bar downstairs is part of the hotel, but make it more attractive / intuitive to go there. I found it as a dark area from I wasn't sure how to get there. I think the entrance is located near the elevators?Still, I highly recommend it for just staying and going outdoors a lot.

Spent a week here and have to say the staff were absolutely lovely, very courteous and polite. Room was a little on the small side but was cleaned to a very high standard, free safe and a massive LG TV on the wall with numerous channels. Bathroom was spacious and the shower was brilliant. Wifi was very good as well. The only thing lacking was a kettle as it would have been nice to have a coffee or tea in the room after a long day seeing the sights of this wonderful city. The hotel is situated in a brilliant location just off Times Square and I would thoroughly recommend staying here.

They say first impressions count. Stepping into the lobby of the Cassa Hotel after 16.5 hours on a plane, 1 hour in immigration/customs and a 45 minute taxi ride, my first impression was "What did I see on-line that made me want to stay here"?Then we met Adam, and nothing was too tasking or difficult. I can honestly say that Adam made the difference.The room we were allocated, 606 was great. We didn't go to Butter. We used Cassa as a base. The location was brilliant considering where we had to go and the shopping in the vicinity.Thank you Adam, for a wonderful stay and for being there when we needed you.

Felt compelled to write this review because there are many sub standard hotels in NYC and this is definitely not one of them. Booked our room thru Travelzoo, got a great price which included breakfast and I expected continental but was pleasantly surprised to find eggs and waffles. Room was modern and very very clean. Staff was courteous and friendly and went out of their way to assist you in any way. I had questions about shopping areas and one of the staff outlined a map for me! This hotel is 2 blocks from Times Square and very quiet. Cannot wait to stay there again!!! Five stars!!

The staff of the hotel was very friendly. Check in, check out, and all of our interactions were pleasant. The hallway on the 7th floor (where we stayed) smelled of orange peel. Not bad (and obviously a spray) but I was glad that the smell didn't infuse the room as well. The room was a good size, actually rather large for NYC but there isn't a lot of storage space. There was a small closet behind the front door that I overlooked at first. The bathroom was clean and had a hand held shower want in addition to the shower head which was very nice. I like fairly hot showers and the separation between almost hot enough and scalding (for me) was not easy to hit. Worth it for the effort though.Location was great, just a block away from times square, very convenient to many great restaurants and transportation. The hotel also supplied an umbrella, free unless you don't return it, which came in very handy during the snow/rain that we had on our second day.Only issues that we had were minor but may be important for others. The bed is low, very low. basically on a box spring on the ground (no frame, college student style) That doesn't mean it's not nice. It was very comfortable and very well done ( nice headboard/sheets). but if a person had issues getting up or down it could be a concern for them. Also I'm a tech guy so when I set my room to cool on the thermostat and lowered the temperature I was not expecting it to be 85 degrees in my room with the heat blasting when I came back a few hours later. This wasn't a problem because I just cracked a window and shut off the AC but it obviously wasn't working correctly. We tend to stay at different hotels each time we visit NYC (a few times a year) but I could happily revisit this hotel, the location, cleanliness, and attitudes of the employees all made for a pleasant experience.

Fantastic hotel for visiting the city of New York, room not too large but very cozy and clean. Everything went well. Position is just perfect and really close to many things to see in NY. Guys at the reception desk were very kind. One of the best hotel I have ever been.

Sleek, modern and attractive room that was very clean and comfortable with virtually no street noise. Every member of the staff was amazing and really went the extra mile to be kind and helpful. Within walking distance to 5th Avenue shopping and Times Square. The evening hot chocolate was a nice touch on a cold winter day. Request a coupon for reduced rate parking around the corner.

I stayed here in January while attending a conference a couple of blocks away. I travel to NYC at least twice a year, and had not stayed at this hotel before. The hotel is small, modern, and clean. My room size was normal for a NYC hotel, and WiFi was included. They have room service from Prett A Manger next door, and of course tons of places locally deliver. Staff was very friendly, and the bed comfy. I'd definitely stay here again. Great location for Times Square.

This hotel is the best ever! The location is close to everything, yet in the hotelroom its so quiet didnt hear any sound from outside or other rooms. It was perfect to relax after a day in the city. They have the best beds soo comfy we almost couldnt get out of them. The bathroom is amazing, big rainshower and a deep soaking tub. (stayed at the Junior Suite). Also the room was very spacious and extremely clean, the service was amazing. Would recommend to everyone to stay here and we will definitely come back.

I stayed here for four nights, during which time I realised that the room had it's annoying features - a very very small wardrobe, noisy air conditioning and a shower which flooded the bathroom every time it was used. But, I came to appreciate its really great location, right in the heart of town but still quite quiet at night (I was on the 4th floor and was not bothered by street noise). The staff were all really friendly, giving me early access to the room on the day of arrival which was much appreciated.I think the biggest let down was the food options - "Room service" is based on supplies from Pret A Manger next door, and I don't understand why anyone would take the delivery service when you might as well go downstairs and fetch it yourself - which is cheaper and gives you a wider choice. The other dining option is in "Butter", the inhouse restaurant in the basement. I only went here for breakfast but at $25 plus tax for a pretty poor offering (not even any breakfast cereals!) I only did it once. And, they don't like you to charge your room, so you have to take money or prepay for breakfast - which I would not do, preferring instead to go out.I'd come back because the rate was good, but perhaps try and upgrade the room as some of the reviews refer to suites that maybe are better.

Great location, room clean, everything worked. Lovely warm shower, helpful staff. Close to Times Square and in between 5th and 6th avenue. All big subway stations close by. No issues at all and couldnt fault it. Checked us in at lunchtime as we arrived early and our room was available. Kept our bags securely on the last day as our flight home wasnt till 8pm. Great hotel and would recommend it.
Very clean / great staff / great location & great value.Rooms are larger than boutique hotels, especially the bathroom!The staff is on it's game, the location is perfect to get anywhere in the city.

Hotel staff are so helpful pleasant excellent customer service.The hotel is in a very good location.Would recommend this hotelEverywhere is very clean The lifts go very fast so be aware if sensitive tummy.

Chose this hotel as part of an Expedia package and glad I did.Perfect location for visiting Times square and 5th avenue shopping if that's your thing.Grand central station,Rockefeller centre and theatres all within a ten minute walk.Pubs and restaurants close by.Staff very helpful and friendly.Free newspapers,fruit and coffee in the morning.Only downside was that I booked a private car to Newark airport with the receptionist and was quoted $95 including tolls and tip and the chance to pay on card.On arrival,the driver charges me $95 plus tip and I have to include taxes if I use my card.Advise you clarify this if using this service.But regarding the hotel,I'd have no hesitation using it again or recommending it,

My boyfriend and I try to do one or two long weekends in the City every year. We arrive late in the evening after catching the train in New Haven, CT after work. When we arrive, we were checked in quickly and up in our room in no time! Within minutes we were out the door and at Rockefeller to see the tree and the Saks 5th Ave Christmas display. It was an easy walk to Saks in one direction and to Bryant Park in the other. Sunday brunch at butter was amazing! The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that the walls are so thin, which I expect in a NYC hotel but our neighbors were ummm loud and I now know way more about them than I need to. We just laughed it off but I'm sure someone with their family wouldn't find it as funny.

Room was clean and staff was friendly and helpful. Felicia at the front desk had the most amazing recommendations for us in terms of what to see and do in New York City! There is no breakfast to speak of but there is are several restaurants on the street you can eat at. Location was PRIME! one block from Times Square and a few steps from 5th Avenue and the Rockefeller Center. I would stay at the hotel again and definitely recommend it fro location, cleanliness and great staff.

We stayed here for 1 night last night. We arrived early and expected to have to leave our luggage but John checked us right in, he was very nice and helpful. Adam at the front door was extremely helpful and nice helping us with our car. We had a deluxe king room which was very clean. room was a little small and I swear it isn't a king size bed but was comfortable and was fine for the night. Bathroom was very nice. Location is perfect and we walked everywhere. Would recommend this hotel.

I stayed at this hotel while visiting friends in New York and while working which meant I needed to be connected to a modem. The staff made sure that I had a modem in the room before I checked in - I was extremely grateful. The hotel does not have a business center they will however print things for you if you send it to them at the front desk. The cleaning staff was great and the rooms are cleaned well. There is also a cute balcony area on the 10th floor. The location is superb!!! If you need a modem I suggest booking room 2003. I am looking forward to booking again on my next visit.

Functional, comfortable and convenient mid-town. If you're just looking for somewhere to lay your head to rest that's clean and comfortable, this fits the bill. Room also surprisingly big for the rate and the city.

4.5 stars, really (if we had that option). My teen daughter and I stayed here the week between Christmas and New Year's. I found a great deal through the TravelZoo website, and even though I'd not heard of this hotel before, I decided to go ahead and book. I am so glad I did. The location was perfect...just a few blocks walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and a subway station. It gave us easy access to everything we wanted to do. I thought the room size was fine, especially for NYC. Beds were comfortable, and we were high up enough in the building that street noise wasn't an issue for us. The bathroom more than met my expectations from a size standpoint and also cleanliness. In fact, I was pleased with the cleanliness throughout the entire hotel. There was hot chocolate in the lobby every evening when we returned, which was greatly appreciated for the cold winter days. The lobby wasn't huge, but it was more than adequate every time we passed through. Front desk staff was hit and miss. The first clerk we encountered upon check in was efficient, but not friendly. In fact, he didn't look us in the eye once, which I thought was rude. Other staff encountered throughout our stay were much more amiable. The "Butter" restaurant is next door to the hotel, but otherwise there aren't any food options here. We chose to grab breakfast at the Pret a Manger next door every morning, and that was great for us (and convenient). All in all, this hotel was great and I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends.

Hi this hotel is only a block away from Times Square and it's ideal for exploring New York. Now if you are booking hotel for staying in dont book it however if you are not planning to stay in then hotel is nearly perfect. We was given small room which was ok however I didn't think towels were totally clean, as found black hair on one of mine. We did give the benefit of doubt thinking that room attendant might of had black hair and one got caught on towel. Bathroom was good size but no view. Staff was extremely friendly.

Room was small (but not very small), bed was small. Bathroom was large, or in my opinion ok size - it was not that big. Overall a ok hotel compare to many others in on Manhattan. Lokation is good, friendly and very helpful staff.

Just came home from an overnight trip to NYC. We saw a play and wanted to stay in the city. This hotel is books from Times Square. Had a deluxe king room. Large for NYC and very clean. Would love to stay here again.

Cassa is a friendly hotel, comfortable rooms with air-con, hot water, clean baths, cable LED TV and free wi-fi working well. There is a excellent restaurant inside - Butter. A few blocks from the hotel located at 45th Street, you can enjoy several icons of Manhattan architecture, including important skyscrapers such as the Rockfeller Center complex built during the era of Art Deco. Wonderful evenings at Bryant Park enjoying one of the city's busiest skating rinks, which is only 2 blocks from the hotel. Finally, I can not forget to comment on the friendly and helpful staff, particularly desk front Jonathan who with his daily kindness and excellent tips conquered us on this winter visit at the Big Apple. Breakfest is not included, but there are excellent options in the neighborhood, such as Pret a Manger on the right side.

I really liked to stay at Cassa NYC. Very good location and the hotel is small and charming. My only point is they do not have a breakfast. In cold winter times this is very importante for me but this not compromise our experience.

Central to Times Square, 5th Avenue, and many of the tourist attractions, so we were able to walk to lots of places. Central to the subway station as well. We booked an executive king room and it was a pretty good size by New York standards. The room was clean and nice, the bed comfy and the staff friendly and helpful. We didn't eat at the restaurant as we were too busy out and about exploring. No pool or hot tub which was a shame, and they don't do room service, but are almost next door to Pret a Porter for fresh food. Room was nice and quiet and the aircon toasty warm.

its prices are the perfect compromise between confort and quality service: it's few second s away from Times Square and 5th avenue is just around the corner; the staff is extremely kind and helpful. at any hour they are at your disposal for anything, restaurant suggestions or taxi reservations. They don't give you any straight time schedule: if you leave late the room, none would know at your door to remember the cleaning service. the room are spacious and well-fitted ( at Christmas time the ensuite radio is all about christmas jingles ).if you like or if you are tired, there is all a restaurant at the basement level.

We stayed from 12/29-12/31. Location and price were perfect. Breakfast was pretty good. Only complaint is that a gift card purchased for a family member went missing and it wasn't until we left that we realized it was taken out of the drawer we put it in. My husband went back to ask our maid who was already cleaning our room and she said she didn't see it. She was the same maid we saw each day of our stay.

We booked Cassa via travelzoo. Really good price for a top notch hotel. Right on the edge of the theatre district so just a short walk to all the theatres. But it is out of the chaos of Times Square. Modern, new, great bathroom, better than average sized rooms, and very helpful staff. Passed on the breakfast buffet offer but free coffee in lobby was nice. Will stay again for next theatre trip.

The location was great. Pricing was a good value. The room was clean. The bathroom was nice and bright. Good customer service. Decent sized room, considering it is NYC. Overall a great stay. Will definitely stay here again.

Breakfast was terrible (old banana's / hard bagels and prepacked muffins/cookies)My room smell bad when I came in but once I had opened the window for a few hours this was fine. I think the hotel is neutral. Spacious rooms, but nothing special.I was however a big shocked on the taxes. My booking was USD 493,- but incl the taxes I arrived to USD 729,-. Not sure if this is normal in NY but quite high!!

The Cassa Hotel was all around a great experience. The room was very comfortable and spacious. Excellent location near Grand Central, shopping, transit and restaurants. The restaurant next to the hotel, Butter, was also great and worth a visit. Would highly recommend to anyone coming to NYC!!!

First, I didn't let breakfast impact my hotel review since it's actually a separate restaurant (Butter). Breakfast was ok, but not worth paying for. We got it free as part of a package and it was fine and convenient for that, but I wouldn't pay for it.The rooms are good, the location is decent. If you want a hotel that has views of Times Square this isn't it. If you want something close to times square but away from the action and noise, this could be a good hotel for you.Service was good, we got a free upgrade since they had availability and were willing to give us free late check out if needed as well.

The hotel is in a fantastic location. A little disappointed at the start as when we arrived rooms Was not ready that was fine left our cases and went straight out was told to go back at 3,we arrived. Back and only one of our rooms was ready the other was waiting to be inspected after cleaning.... we then had to wait another 2 hours before the other room was ready. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable however the food was expensive so better to find a diner much cheaper. Overall had a great weekend

Great place to stay. Comfortable rooms, nice staff, and a great location. For the price (we had a travelzoo voucher), we felt very close to the action without being in the middle of all the madness of Times Square. Short walks or cab rides easily got us where we needed to be. The hotel has all the amenities you would want and a staff that aims to please. The room was fairly small but clean and bright and quiet. The only area that needs attention is the breakfast served at the Butter restaurant downstairs. The selection was limited and really not well presented or maintained. The attendant needs to pay a little more attention to the food and drink (cold coffee, no toaster one morning) and spend less time on his phone. Overall would recommend the hotel and we would return.

My wife, who often goes on business trips, stayed at the Cassa Hotel for 4 nights.She arrived to NY early morning after a long flight knowing she will not be able to check-in before noon. What a pleasant surprise she had when she arrived to the hotel at 7am met by Andrew who was so sympathetic and welcoming and arranged a room for her straight away - this is unique for a NY hotel - and Adam who helped her to her room to show her around. The staff was kind and helpful throughout the stay, The room, a Standard Single Room, small, but sufficient for one person: Very clean, modern decor, beautiful spotlessly clean bathroom, snow white beddings and towels, even a very soft bathrobe. Right in the center of NY within walking distance from anything, we shall definitly stay there again when visiting NY.

We enjoyed staying at this hotel greatly! It was in a central location (midtown), within walking distance to Times Square, Hell's Kitchen, Rockefeller Center, and so much more! The hotel itself was very pleasant-clean, comfortable, and relaxing. The decor was chic and modern, but not pretentious. The room was all we hoped for- comfortable bed, great shower, good sized bathroom, (small) closet, and refrigerator. The staff was welcoming and very accommodating, letting us check in a bit early. We also appreciated that they kept our bags secure (after we checked out) until it was time to for us depart. All in all, we were very pleased with our stay at Cassa and hope to return! Thank you to Jermaine and all the staff who assisted us.

We were there for one of the stages on our honeymoon last December and we will certainly be visiting again. Very central, clean and quiet. Top location with many landmarks just a few metres away. Highly recommended!

For our anniversary trip to the Big Apple, we stayed at this hotel smack dab in the middle of Manhattan. Checking in and out was fast and efficient, the room was clean and laid out nicely, and Times Square, the Theater District, Rockefeller Center, and even Trump Tower were within 10-15 minutes by foot. Access to the subway was also convenient, allowing us to visit Queens and Brooklyn with minimal exposure to the NYC winter.

What a fantastic time we had! The staff is amazing! Each and everyone were so helpful with suggestions and all our request! Great location, value, super clean! We have recommended this hotel to all our friends now.

We stayed here in November. The room was clean and spacious. We enjoyed the breakfast...better than average continental breakfast. Plenty of choices.Nice option for wine and cheese every afternoon.*** Belini ( like Martini) at the front desk was fabulous. SO friendly and helpful and always smiling! She walked us ALL the way up to the roof-top hot tub...and she was STILL smiling! After 13 floors! Thank you Belini! We hope to be up there again. Are you ready for another walk to the top?! :) All the staff at the front desk was exceptional. We were up to see a Broadway show and do some shopping. Great location for what we wanted to do!We hope to stay here again.Tom and Vickie from Delaware

The hotel was clean but we did not get the room that we reserved and paid for. We had a long day of sightseeing and came to the hotel around 9:30. When we got to the room, we had one double bed. We had reserved and paid for a double deluxe room with two double beds. My 16 year old granddaughter and I were so tired we just went to bed. It was very uncomfortable having two people in the one bed. In the morning I asked the front desk why we had not gotten the room we had reserved. He said that we had not reserved the room through the hotel but through a third party and therefore had to take whatever they gave us. I explained that we had paid for our reservation but they said I should have reserved through the hotel. When we got home I called TripAdvisor to let them know our reservation had not been honored. They told me I should have called that night. I explained we were exhausted and just wanted to sleep. They said there was nothing they could do. This experience will certainly make me hesitate to book through TripAdvisor again.

Hotel check in was very efficient. We were able to check in early which was appreciated after a long day of travel. Our departure flight wasn't until later in the evening and much later than check out. Upon check out, the hotel held our bag for us and called a car that was early and waiting when we were ready to leave. There's all sorts of food close by, and many things to see and do all within a short walking distance. Overall, a very good experience with no complaints at all. We made the right choice to stay at the Cassa Hotel on 45th.

Great hotel - one of the smaller ones, but a great place for a trip to NYC. The hotel staff were very friendly and willing to help us with all types of questions and queries. The room was quite big for NYC - simple but serviceable, and cleaned well every day. The morning tea/coffee & apples in the foyer were very appreciated as we headed out each day! Excellent location.

Recently stayed in the hotel which is a stones throw from Times Square! Very Central and easy to be at a number of the tourists attractions within a few minutes walk. (Times Square, rockafella, Empire State, grand central station, Central Park etc) rooms are fairly small but most are in NYC but the hotel was pretty quiet which was nice and you will need your sleep if you doing lots in the days. They have a pret. Coffee shop below and a bar called butter but tbh I preferred to go and find a proper American diner for breakfast which cost a lot less the two I would recommend are one is opposite the entrance of grand central station. The other is just before the Empire State Building entrance they offer an unlimited buffet for $15.. the hotel do offer free tea, coffee & hot chocolate through out the day in reception. Staff are really friendly and nice! They do charge a city tax on hotel rooms approximately 5.8%. If you are visiting NYC plan your days and it's very busy and you don't want to miss out on attractions. Definitely get a city pass which offers substantial discount on entrance to attractions though you will still have to queue in some instances. Highly recommend the one world trade centre if the weather is good by far the best experience of going up a sky scraper even though it doesn't have a outside observation deck. Rockafella is well organised the most disappointing for me was the Empire State queues very long and staff very rude, wouldn't go back here. Don't forget there are plenty of free things to do in NYC like Central Park, the museums yes that's correct you don't have to pay, there are disclaimers by the tills stating they recommend you pay $20 entry but all you need to do is give a donation !!!! Don't be fooled by them. The only museum you have to pay for it the 9/11 memorial but it's well worth it! Don't forgot to down load the apps for all these attractions and take head phones again to avoid extra costs! Visit hell kitchens, Greenwich market and walk the Chelsea highline! Food and drink is super expensive in NYC unless you head down by soho and little Italy. In mid town expect to pay $9 or 10 for a drink if not more. Use the subway great way to get around and very cheap!! Walk over Brooklyn bridge again free and one of the highlights and views of my visit! Ride on the Roosevelt tram across to Roosevelt island for $3 dollars great views !!!!! Visit down town the financial district, system island ferry has huge queues so may be best to get there early to avoid long waits. St Patrick's cathedral again stunning and free. Don't forgot to check out the hidden cocktail bars that take you back in time to prohibition era though you will pay $14 per cocktail. If you can visit MAdison sq garden for a basketball or ice hockey game great location and try a frenchy hot dog !!! NYC a great city but non stop take comfy trainers and a back pack for water and sandwiches to cut down the costs well until the pound recovers at least !!!!

Hotel has a great locality around Times Square area, a few blocks from 3 subway stationsRooms & bathrooms good size for NYC (in king deluxe room) Rooms are nice and modern, but nothing special The whole hotel has a dark lighting theme, which is not to everyone's tasteThe staff are just ok, they seem to lack the vibey friendly service that other hotels offer, you need to ask twice for anythingOverall a above average hotel in Manhattan, but missing the finishing touches

I stayed at this hotel for a few days on a mini holiday. I must say the location is very convenient. It is not in the middle of the chaos of Times Square, (which I was avoiding) but it is close enough walking distance. It is also very close to Grand Central Station should it be necessary to travel through there. It is near major subways that can be accessed by walking to 42nd street a few blocks away. Also in the area are many options on the same block for food (Subway, Pret a Manger, Dunkin Donuts, Starubucks) as well a 99 cent store across the street. The hotel does have a restaurant called Butter, but I did not have a chance to try it due to timing. So I found the nearby options great. They do offer complimentary tea in the morning, which I thought was really nice.My room as small (to be expected in NYC) but it was really cozy and it had a spacious shower! The beds were super comfortable, and there are toiletries and robes for convenience. The only strange thing about this hotel was the elevator. It was extremely dark. Almost pitch black to be honest. Something to note if you have a phobia with elevators.. I am unsure if perhaps it was being upgraded and I caught them in the midst of that? Other than that, this a great hotel with a lovely staff, and I would definitely stay again!
user_name:
Elle_travelstheworld
New York City, New York

review_body: Hotel was convenient, attractive, clean and comfortable. But the biggest positive came from the desk staff. To a person they are pleasant, helpful, friendly people. We reserved three rooms for the family. All of us were treated so well! Great hotel.....we will be back!

Cassa is really convenient to Times Square and most of the theaters. Plenty of great restaurants within easy walking distance. Our room was very quiet (26th floor), good size, comfy bed. Not a lot of storage for your clothes. Bath was quite acceptable. Did I say it was a convenient walk to almost anything you want to do? Also, staff were really nice and very helpful. Has a great gym, which I didn't use because I walked about 8 miles every day! Would I go back? Absolutely.

We booked this hotel months in advanced and assumed that we'd get a room that would accommodate 2 adults (i.e. a queen size or larger). When we arrived we were checked into a full size bedroom. What a shock and disappointment. How in the heck can two grown men fit in a full size bed? The hotel was full so we called Priceline and all they offered was a partial refund and we ended up paying $248 for one night that we didn't even stay. The Cassa hotel should not be doing business with Priceline if they aren't offering a room that fits two adult comfortably. The front desk didn't apologize, offer to fund us other accommodations, or generally care a damn about our dilemma. I will never use Pricelines name your own price option again and be warned that the Cassa Hotel thinks 2 adults can fit in a full size bed.

Great location, Good size rooms that are both comfortable and well designed. We stayed 4 nights and all 4 were street noise free. Will go back next visit. Great coffee in the morning and hot chocolate in the evenings. In the age of hotels Nickel and diming the free WiFi was appreciated.

Down an odd side street of hotels you can almost miss the Cassa. Our room was clean and nice. The staff attentive and helpful. It was pretty pricy for the area, but NYC in December. Restaurant attached was a bummer, happy concierge told us to walk up a block.

My husband and I couldn't be more pleased with our stay in the city at this hotel this past weekend. We stayed only 2 short nights but loved everything about the hotel. We will be back!A very special thanks to Adam and Osei for making our stay so nice and being so personable! They were both so friendly and great with our 6 year old daughter too! Thank you all!!!

Stayed almost a week with my wife in one of the suites. Acceptable size and average standard. Breakfast was unhealthy with very limited selection. A small gym open 24 hrs and had no problems with getting through the morning routine. Located next to Times Square and everything within walking distance. Average value for money.

We found this hotel through a great deal on TravelZoo and decided the location was ideal for our Christmas plans (Radio City, Rockefeller, Dept store windows). We arrived around 10a and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. Front desk staff checked us in; we had booked a Jr. Suite on TravelZoo for a really good rate & the front desk upgraded us at no charge to a 1 BR suite. Bell staff tagged our luggage to store while we left to sightsee. They took our cell# to call/text when our room would be ready that afternoon.We heard from the front desk mid-afternoon as we were headed back to get our room keys. The 1BR suite was incredibly spacious for a NYC hotel. So much closet space that we easily could have unpacked for a week's stay. The bathroom had a huge walk-in shower as well as a full tub with shower. Large vanity and full size bath/shampoo products. there were robes and slippers in the room as well as a full size umbrella to use during our stay with the option to purchase.The staff for our one night stay was incredibly friendly, polite & helpful. The location was ideal for anyone wanting to be near Times Square & the Theatre District but wants to stay away from the crowded streets & sidewalks that go with that area. We will definitely return to this hotel the next time we're in New York!!

Just returned from a 5 nights stay here.Location is great here like people have mentioned at the end of one street your at Times Square and the other end your on fifth avenue! Rooms are nice & clean. We stayed in a executive suite (not a great view) but I don't think your going to getting many great views from the hotel as its in the middle down a street. I did email hotel prior to are arrival asking for a higher floor but this didn't happen!!!!!As we payed more for the executive suite I thought at least the view would of been better! The beds are so comfy you defiantly get a good nights sleep here, nice & clean.Bathroom was lovely clean, modern and spaceious, only one bathrobe tho. We had a issue with our shower on our last day(luckily) we had no hot water! Rang reception was told they was a boiler issue and to wait 10 minutes, 20 minutes later warmed up a little but then the temperature kept changing to hot & cold. Apart from this the bathroom was one of the best bathrooms I've seen.Now for the staff!...Yes they are polite but in my opinion just can't be bothered with you. I've been to many hotels in my time and I'm so used to hi, bye, how are you, have you had a good day? Etc. None of that here at all! You check in (no welcome) it's a case of credit card and wait for your room.
