They even made us bring our own suit case to our room.Never acknowledge you when walking through hotel past reception staff, again what harm to 'hello' do.Check out again 'bye' no did you enjoy your stay no Thankyou for your stay, nothing.To me the hotel/staff are what make my holidays/vacations, this hotel just didn't do it for me.All thanks to the staff I sadly will not be returning to this hotel ( there much nicer in New York ) The hotel and location itself is great cannot fault this but the staff for me let this hotel down in my opinion.

The Cassa Hotel is located a five minutes walk from Times Square. The check in was dead easy & the staff was super friendly. The rooms - as per normal if you don't pay a lot of money for a bigger one - aren't too big. Big comfortable bathroom though. Rooms are very clean. Perfect location for a city trip to the Big Apple!

Well its a clean, comfortable hotel with a few minor issues. There are no snack/beverage machines in the building. You have to walk down the street to Duane Reade to buy stuff. Probably the first hotel ive been in without at least one. There wasnt a refrigerator in the room that was operating well..no problem because we didnt have anything to drink. Valet parking was $69. Add in a $10 tip and your looking at a big expense. I realize parking in ny is crazy, but for a guest thats ridiculous. For the price of the room i expected a little more. I would check out another hotel before coming back here. The staff was very friendly and helpful, however.

I love the location of this hotel. It's just a few minutes away to Times Square. When everybody is already tired, i walked by myself to Times Square and it's pretty safe. The lobby is small and there's a coffee station where you can help yourself. We had some trouble with our booking but the receptions were able to handled it well. Our room has two beds and i've found it comfortable and the bathroom is really nice. They don't have a coffee maker but you can request a kettle if you need hot water for your tea and as i've mentioned coffee is available in the lobby. There's also a small fridge. The only thing that bothers me here is the elevator's light. It's too dark and it kinda scares me especially at night if i'm with another people inside. The hotel lobby people were nice and always willing to help or give us guidance on how to get to places. Close to everything....pretty much walk from the hotel to Times Square, Rockefeller center, Grand central terminal and to the the museums, bryant park to name a few that I can remember. The subway is close as well.

Stayed four nights in this lovely hotel after stopping one dreadful night in the Roosevelt only fault with the stay was one receptionist was rude but every one else was lovely. The location is excellent. The rooms are quality with lovely bathrooms and free tea and coffee in the morning and hot chocolate in the afternoon in reception Can't recommend this hotel enough will use it again if I ever return to New York

Good hotel conveniently situated for 5th Avenue and Times Square - both just a short walk away. Room was a good size as was the shower room (large shower!). Only one bathrobe which seemed a bit strange. Room very quiet - no street noise. Free tea and coffee in the lobby in the morning and hot chocolate in the afternoon. No restaurant but Pret a manger next door good for breakfast! Would definitely stay there again.

As soon as we stepped through the Lobby entrance, we knew we would like this hotel. Staff were lovely and courteous (especially Felicia). Rooms beautifully clean. Free tea/coffee in Lobby in the mornings and free hot chocolate mid afternoon (very nice to come back to after getting absolutely soaking wet). Hotel central to walking around. Taxi available to get us back to airport (not free). Would definitely stay here again

Dec 1-3 2016, Lovely stay, clean room, great view, awesome shower, very near Times Square, Pret A Manger next door, concierge helpful, free hot choc in evening, coffee in am, gym and restaurant in house although did not use

We stayed in room 1804, high up so can't really hear traffic, just sirens from emergency cars. At first there was the noise from the fan in the room, but I got used to it. Location wise it is like 5 mins walk from times square, 15 from rockefeller, 15 mins from empire state building, we did walk a lot as we like to walk, but even the subway was 5 mins away walk, 10 min walk from grand central station. The only thing I would say about the hotel is that they didn't have a kettle in the room, they did offer tea and coffee in the lobby in the morning however. Also I think they changed the towels everyday even though we didn't leave it on the floor, could be a bit more environmentally friendly? Overall I would recommend staying there

We stayed here for 8 nights during Thanksgiving week! The hotel is very well located as a tourist you can do a lot on foot, time square, central park, empire state, Rockerfeller. We walked 20ft to see the Macys thanksgiving parade which was great fun! The room was clean and big, we had two double beds and still had space to move around! Our room was quite at night which is a plus. The bathroom was clean and modern. The only negative point about the room is the lighting, we found it very dark due to the dimmed lighting ( modern ambiance I suppose) wasn't very practical to find things in your case. We also had a problem with the water at our sink, no cold water at the cold water tap, unless you run the shower at the same time?!?! The hotel was very efficient and sent a technician twice but the problem was not solved! We had breakfast at "Butter" the restaurant in the hotel it was included in our room rate! It is very dark and rather depressing on a morning. The food: bagel, scones, waffles...was the same every day, no cereal, tasteless fruit and if you came at 9:30 there was nothing left to eat or no coffee. On Sunday we came at 8:00pm there was just bread and giant croissants, uncooked waffles, uncooked egg and burnt bacon! No coffee or tea bags, no butter! I complained but the answer was it is Sunday! Did we pay less on Sunday?? If you are not a big breakfast eater, you can pass on the breakfast here as the hotel nicely offers complementary coffee, tea and fruit on a morning! We have to make a special mention to all of the front desk staff who were extremely helpful, friendly, just doing an amazing job! Especially Sam and Jonathan who went out of their way to help! Thank you!

From the lobby you would not expect much however, the staff was incredibly helpful and accommodating. The rooms were lush, clean, comfortable and quiet. The morning coffee, hot chocolate and bubbly were divine. The location could not be better and I will return!

My wife and I recently spent a highly enjoyable if tiring 5 night break in Manhattan staying at this centrally located, stylish, modern and comfortable hotel. Our room was very well appointed and kept scrupulously clean. Our one minor complaint was in relation to what we initially thought was someone operating a pneumatic drill out in the street. It took us a day or so to realise the noise was coming from the pipe work in the hotel as it was only noticeable at times when residents would be using showers. This didn't however spoil our stay too much and the friendliness and helpfulness of the reception staff more than compensated. We would go back.

This is a difficult one for me to review because I have such mixed feelings. First, I'll start with the good. The room was fabulous! It was big (by New York standards), cozy, comfortable bed and bedding, great bathroom, window faced the street not an alley, full-length mirror and the layout was excellent...not like a normal hotel layout. I can't say enough about how much I loved the room itself!! But I also saw a friend's room which was much smaller and a typical hotel room layout so I know not all the rooms were like mine. The other great part about this hotel is the staff. Everyone was very nice, super helpful and made me feel welcome. The bad: The rooms on the elevator side unfortunately have to put up with hearing all the dings and the woman's voice saying "floor 7, going up"...etc, all night long. I was in a corner room, I wasn't even right across from the elevator! And since there are no long hall ways to get a room away from the elevator, you'll be near it unless you're on the other side from the elevator. Very few rooms per floor, so if you're on the elevator side, you'll hear it. It dings very loudly every time it stops on a floor and if it's on your floor, you WILL hear the woman's voice announce the floor and the direction it's going. If it's on the floor above or below, you still hear the ding. Now the reason I'm writing this is not to deter anyone from staying in this hotel because of it...but because I hope someone from Cassa is reading it and will TURN IT DOWN! There has a to be a volume setting on it. There is NO reason why you couldn't, it's not like someone in the elevator won't hear it and miss their floor! Just turn it down, it's ridiculously loud.A little about the neighborhood: If I wasn't there for the Thanksgiving parade, it wouldn't be my first choice of neighborhoods. It's right in the middle of the midtown Manhattan chaos. If you want to be near the shopping on 5th Ave, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, etc....then it's great. I just found it to be a little too crowded and crazy for my liking. But for tourists who want to be in the middle of everything, you'd like it if you don't mind the noise, the trash on the streets and the Halal food carts on every corner. And now for the Ugly. It's back to the elevators. They're horrific. Cassa....PLEASE update them. They're brown, dark boxes. Brown walls, brown carpet that looks like it from the 80's. It's all the same shade of dark brown. If this was a design decision, it's terrible. Luckily the rooms are gorgeous and very well designed and decorated...but the elevators don't fit in at all and are terribly ugly and uncomfortable!!Bottom line, great hotel because of the lovely rooms and wonderful staff, but the elevators all around need to be addressed. And if you're a light sleeper and don't like noise, you WILL hear a lot of noise through the night both from outside and from the elevators. Which I hope the hotel will try to change. My guess is because they don't sleep there, they have no idea how loud the dings and that woman's voice is!! Elevators aside, I had a wonderful stay and enjoyed my very cozy bed...which was my favorite part.

The front desk and room service was very efficient. I thought the room was a little small but very clean and quiet!! I would definitely stay there again. It is very centrally located to midtown. The bar was supposed to be open till 4am, but was closed at 11? and it was a Friday night, so we went across the street to the cock and bull.

Stayed the weekend with my daughter who ran her first full marathon. I also had my niece with us. We had a room with a king size bed and a roll away. The room was fantastic. We were on the 4th floor. Extremely spacious, clean and very quiet. The bed and pillows were unbelievable!!! The best sleep I've had in years. Even the roll away that my niece slept on was terrific!! The staff made us feel special from the moment we stepped foot into the hotel. Especially Kelvin. He met all of our requests and was so friendly, we felt we had known him for years. The hotel even had a personal congratulation letter written to my daughter upon her completion of the marathon and signed by the owner, along with a beautiful bottle of wine. What an amazing and thoughtful touch!! We will definitely stay here again, when we return for another visit to New York.

Loved the hotel and its location. Very clean, great helpful staff and superior housekeeping. Not too small and not too big. Close to so many attractions. We will definitely stay here again our next trip.

Stayed at Cassa for two nights while on a business trip. Very convenient location, modern and clean rooms, and a decent gym. Best of all was the service, and especially Jon at the front desk who went out of his way to help me arrange transportation from the city to Newark airport. Very good experience, and I would stay there again.Jonathan.

Stayed at Cassa 45 with my wife for a long weekend. Very friendly staff. Decent standard in rooms. Did not use any other services. First we got a room with a strange smell, and got a new room once we told the staff. The only really negative was the size of the bed. Being 6'2", my feet stuck out at the other side. And being two persons in this bed felt a little crowded, at least when trying to sleep. :DBoth rooms had the same sized beds. Estimate beds being approx W: 4'11" x B: 6'3".

Small and noisy. Deluxe Queen Room was misnomer. Bed was more full size than queen sized. I could hear street traffic day and night. HVAC was very loud turning on. Valet parking was very expensive and I still had to wait 20 minutes to get my car back. Staff was pleasant though. Will not return here.

We stayed here for 3 nights and must say, the rooms are good size, the staff very attentive and overall it was a good experience. Easy to get to everything near Time Square, theater district, restaurant row!

We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and found it to be in a great location, comfortable, with a friendly and helpful staff. The room (Executive King) was large with a comfortable bed, and nice appointments. It was in a great location, situated on 45th st. between 5th and 6th avenues, only a couple of blocks from Times Square and Rockefeller Center.

We stayed in the Casa for 6 days and loved it. The staff made us feel at home and were very helpful all the time. Position of this hotel was amazing. Anything we needed was no trouble. Will definately visit here again. Highly recommend.

We found this hotel via TripAdvisor and managed to save £500 from the regular hotels.com site. We stayed for 6 nights at the hotel and upon arrival we were early for our 3pm check in but the staff accommodated us and allowed us to access our room. Although the room was compact and the bed small, the room was clean, comfortable and in a great location. The staff helped us enormously by printing tickets that I forgot to do before we left with no issue or objection. There is a Pret A Manger next door and excellent amenities within short walking distances. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend anyone else to.

Great service upon check in and check out, great location and super comfortable beds! Within about 10 min you are at Times Square, Port Authority, Grand Central, Empire State, Rockefeller and so on. I would not hesitate to recommend it and I would definitely stay here again!

We stayed here for 5 nights at the start of our honeymoon and I don't think we could have booked a better place. It is literally 2 blocks from time square and central for virtually everything you could need in New York. We got the train from JFK airport and then walked to the hotel, much cheaper than a cab. Check in was efficient, the room was small (by UK standards) but quite generous by New York proportions! As the hotel is quite small there was never any problem with queuing for lifts or reception. The room was modern, clean and nice and quiet. When we first checked in, the safe didn't work, we phoned down to reception who arranged for a guy to come up and fix it straight away (who ended up replacing it), the only other minor issue was that the maid took the dressing gown out of the room on the 3rd day and didn't replace it. There is free coffee / water available in reception at various times which was an added bonus. We had booked to see the Knicks and our tickets came through on email at the last minute - reception were happy to print them out for us, which was great (god knows where we would have gone to do that otherwise!). Upon checkout we were offered a car to the airport for a set fee (something like $50), having been to New York before and experienced the pure terror of a yellow cab driver who thought he was in grand theft auto we happily accepted. It actually turned out to save us money as we were going to La Guardia (which is not a set fare with yellow cabs) we got stuck in some major traffic and ended up detouring - for no extra cost. I would definitely recommend this option if flying from La Guardia. All in all, I would happily stay here again in an instant, we booked majorly in advance (something like 11 months!) and got our stay for half price which was a steal. You can't go wrong at this hotel!

When I first arrived, I was greeted by such a warm Welcome. I felt so comfortable and began a conversation with the gentlemen like I knew them for years. They made sure that every part of my stay was perfect. I received my room key and took the rather quick elevator to the 11th floor. The floor was nice and quiet and you never heard slamming of doors like most hotels. I stayed in the One Bedroom Suite and it was so spacious and clean! The bathroom had two showers in it and a bathtub. The bed was comfortable, I actually got a good nights rest. I have absolutely no complaints, I enjoyed my stay. I highly recommend and will definitely be back.

Perfect location at the hear of the city. The staff is wonderful and very kind (& helpful!) The room design and cleaning standards are great. I would recommend, and will definitely return in my next stay!

Good shower, and bathroom.Good bed. Good room. All around great, and good service. Don't order any food or breakfast there though. Expensive and bad, took a bite and put it in the trash. ( apparently they don't have a kitchen so they bring it from a nearby to-go breakfast place ) just go out to eat somewhere near by.. you're on 45th street anyway.

Reception is very sterile and the rooms are as basic as it gets. Everything looks very out-of-date. Stayed in a hotel close to here during my last visit, similarly priced but a lot nicer. I would not recommend this hotel

Is a pleasure to write a review about one of the best hotels in NY.I highly recommend the CASSA hotel, the service, the people, close by every thing and very safe place to stay is my place in NY , i feel like in casa.thank you CASSA hotel for you attention and awesome service.see you next march 2017.

enjoyed my stay very much. good location, room was clean and had everything i needed(even a bathrobe!), large TV, view, staff was very friendly and helpfull,took care of everything i needed, over all great exprience

I had prebooked for nine nights travelling with my mother via booking.com. In the months and weeks prior to arrival I had emailed requesting two beds. I was quite concerned at no reply. On arrival I explained the situation to lendall and Jonathan and they bent over backwards to assist. The failed email reply was explained as the contact no longer worked there. I cannot fault the customer service. We were moved to a room with two queen beds after the first night. There was a $20 a night upgrade charge but I was more than happy with that small fee for such a big room improvement. The bathrooms were a great size with a huge shower and a great shower head. We were complimentary upgraded to high speed internet. There was free tea and coffee and fruit in the foyer every morning. A jug was brought to our room immediately upon request so we could make a cuppa at night. The hotel location is fantastic and very Central. It is right next door to a Pret a Manger where we ate breakfast for less than $10 for two most mornings. I cannot fault our stay there at all

This hotel has a great location between 5th and 6th Avenue midtown New York. The staff are all so nice and helpfull. The rooms are neat and tidy. The bathroom is quite big. The fitness room is not so big but is nice and clean.

Stayed for the 2nd time in Cassa last week .....fantastic hotel in a fantastic location, come out of the hotel and go to the left and in 2 mins your in Times Square, go to the right and in 2 mins your on 5th Avenue, rooms are an ok size we had a twin double and the size of the room was fine, brilliant bathroom and spotlessly clean. Staff at the Cassa are very friendly - every time you leave and enter they always have a nice smile and greeting for you. Used the car service to get to JFK airport - so much better than getting a yellow cab - forgot to ask if you can use this service to get to the hotel from the airport - would definitely use it. Would recommend this hotel, and hopefully we will be back to New York and have another stay in Cassa xx

מיקום מושלם, מלון מושלם !!! הכל במרחק הליכה. חדר מפנק יש הכל פן, מגהץ, אפילו מטרייה למזג האוויר ההפכפך. מאוד נקי, צוות מעולה צעיר וכל ההמלצות למסעדות ובילויים היו נהדרות. מומלץ בחום שידרג לנו את הטיול. Perfect location, Perfect hotel!!! All within walking distance.All have luxurious room, even umbrela to the fickle weather. Very clean, great young team and all recommendations for restaurants and entertainment were great. Highly recommended this hotel upgraded our trip.

I used this hotel for two nights in NY after a cruise before flying home to UK. It is perfectly located, the rooms are quite large enough (many reviews of NY hotels refer to small rooms). You can eat in the hotel but I didn't - so many eating places around. A young man on the front door called Sam is superb - takes luggage to the room and back, arranged taxi to the airport - far better idea than a yellow cab - it was pre-booked for a specific time. Sam is also a mine of information which he readily provides.Lifts operate like rockets. I was on 27th floor but never had to wait for a lift. Quality and cleanliness of room - perfect.

We were fortunate to stay at the Cassa Hotel on 45th Street. What was great about this hotel was its location so close to Times Square in between 5th and 6th Avenue everything in walking distance. The room size was fine and the staff very helpful in helping us as new visitors to New York to find our way. We were very green but learnt from staff how to get around and manage including the tipping such a strang thing for us.

We were staying in New York for 13 nights and were able to find a great deal with the Cassa. The location was good, close to Times Square without being right in the crazy hustle and bustle and a subway stop just a short distance away which was really convenient. Rooms are small, which is typical for NY, although the website wasn't clear on bed size to which I had to contact the hotel to confirm. Upon checking in we were concerned with the bed as it was a double, reception offered us the option to pay extra to upgrade the room which was kind but due to budget constraints we chose not too. Bathroom was large considering overall size of the room. Staff were lovely, especially James at front reception and Adam at the door. Always greeted us and were happy to answer any questions we had. James in particular went above and beyond our expectations, suggesting places to eat and visit. Hotel gym was quite average, we didn't use it as it wasn't very inviting. Overall was a good stay if you're on a budget and want a decent location.

This lovely modern hotel is conveniently located on 45th St between 5th Avenue and Times Sq. We stayed on a room only basis however there is a Pret A Manger next door and the hotel provides free tea & coffee in the morning (plus an apple if you're good).We didn't try the restaurant as it was a bit pricey. There are plenty of places to eat nearby (I loved the Chinese noodle place along the street on the same side as the hotel).There is also a gym which we didn't have time to use either.Free wifi is available which worked well. Would only recommend this for a short stay as the room we had was on the small side and the wardrobe was minuscule. On the plus side the shower was excellent.The nearest subway station is Bryant Park and is only a very short walk away (pop into the New York public library and see the original Winnie the Pooh).

This is the second time I´ve stayed at the Cassa Hotel, and it was better than the first time. The front desk personnel was very nice, we arrived early and they were very helpful giving us a ready room. Upgraded our internet at no cost, not that the basic was bad, but its always good to go faster. As always the location was perfect, near enough to be anywhere in a very short walk, but without the noise and the crowds in the hotel door.There was always a cup of cofee in the morning in the lobby and a lot of restaurants nearby.The room a little on the small side but enough for our needs, very clean and with enough outlets to charge all our electronic equipment.Again very good hotel. It would be nice if they had breakfast included but it´s NYC.

Have stayed at the Cassa several times recently for work trips in NYC. It really works perfect. It is on the list of several of my company preferred hotels in NYC. It is within a several minute walk to where I need to be, plus you can easily get to anywhere you want to go in NYC with uber or the metro. Nice to get some greenery views at Bryant Park. The rooms and bathrooms are clean and nice sized for NYC. There is no room service really (though they do have an arrangement with Pret nearby for limited hours and there is a restaurant), but I like to eat out in NYC anyway and there are plenty of quick/late night eats nearby if needed. The gym is small but functional, fine enough to use quickly in the AM or late PM. So all in all I really enjoy my stays there for work and plan to stay there again several times in upcoming months!

A modest entrance on 45th St. hides this nice, well located hotel. Rooms are clean, functional, but small (probably the standard in NYC). Major attractions are within walking distance, the location is surely the best feature of the hotel.

The hotel is very centrally located, 1 block from Broadway & Times Square and a couple of blocks walking distance from the Newark Airport Express bus stopsWe felt very safe walking back to the hotel at night from Times Square The lobby area isn’t that big, but it does have a seated area as well as tea & coffee in the mornings and water in the afternoonsCheck in was very smooth and we had a room up on the 15th FloorA friend of ours had left a package at the hotel for us a day or so before our arrival and this was waiting in the room when we entered which was nice serviceThe room wasn’t a large room with not much space at either side of the bed, but it had a little extra room at the bottom where the table, chair & TV was locatedThe bathroom was at the side of the bed and was a nice size with large sink and shower with good water pressure. There was also a robe and hairdryer provided.The bed was a good size double and was nice and comfyThere was an iron & ironing board in the room but our iron didn’t work and when we said one was brought up very quicklyWifi was free in the hotel and worked pretty wellWe didn’t eat breakfast or dinner at the hotel but there are a couple of deli’s and sandwich places nearby that do breakfast There is no separate bar in the hotel but there is an English pub just down the street to grab a night cap inWe didn’t have much interaction with any staff members, just the person at check-in and the Bellhop – he was very friendly and eager and was disappointed when he saw we didn’t have much luggageOverall we had a lovely relaxing time in the hotel and you definitely can’t beat the location

Stayed here for a week. The staff we dealt with were friendly and pleasant. The room was spacious and comfortable. Cleaned every day. Only 5 min walk from Times Square and15 min from Central Park. Only complaint was we were given tokens for free bubbly. Each time we went, we were only offered red or white wine.

Stayed here on honeymoon. We were upgraded on arrival and had a partial view of Times Square. Room was clean and sufficient space for the two of us plus we had two large cases as well. Bed was comfy and the shower was great. The location was great plenty of local deli in vicinity for breakfast and picking up snacks, close to Times Square and subway stations. Wifi in the hotel was great and the water/tea/coffee in reception was a lovely touch.We didn't use the restaurant on site so can't comment on that. Would def recommend and stay here again

The location of this hotel is literally perfect, you may easily walk to Times Square, Fifth Avenue, Central Park, even Empire State Building and many other great places. There is lots of restaurants and shops around the corner. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are modern and clean, with free Wifi.The room rates are medium-to-high level but still ok based on the very good location.

Hotel is few blocks to Broadway and Times Square. But not where actions are during the day especially in the evening. If you want a little away from Times Square and okay to walk a few blocks about 10 minutes, then you may choose this. But it seems it doesn't have the usual hotel amenities and there are better and cheaper hotels around. Staff at the reception are helpful though. They print out directions to places. But for its price I think there could be better hotels. Room and CR are fine, they are clean.

We had a wonderful enjoyable time at the Cassa Hotel! It is beautiful, comfortable and conveniently located! The staff were amazing and treated us so nice - they went above and beyond to make sure our needs were met and we had an enjoyable stay! We didn't want to leave! We look forward to our next stay here. We are already recommending the Cassa Hotel to our friends. Located in downtown Manhattan - within walking distance to many sites and parks to sit and relax. This was the perfect location for us!
user_name:
Kristie M
Carlsbad, New Mexico, United States

review_body: The front desk people were very kind. Hotel lobby had industrial / modern feel, but was not cold (as is often the case). Elevators likewise had that feel. But, the room was clean, relatively spacious for NYC and modern. I was a little bit concerned since one person's review stated that there were bedbugs in their room at this hotel. Thankfully, there was not a trace of bedbugs in the room that I had. I will stay here again.

Stayed here in November 2015. Staff were very friendly - we had a helicopter trip to book and the guy at reception did all the speaking for us on the phone and even booked it for us he only asked us the time and date! The guys who were in reception were very friendly would always speak to us as we came in or went out and gave us tips on where too go on an evening, also helped with our bags and ordered our taxi & took our bags to the taxi. Hotel is in a very good location 5 minutes left and you're in Times Square, 5 minutes right and you're on 5th Avenue. No tea/coffee facilities in room but there is in reception where you can also get the daily newspaper. Room was a good size and bed was very comfy. Bathroom has good lighting and very spacious. Would definitely return to this hotel and recommend to friends!

Had a two night stay at this boutique hotel in the city. The location is prime and within walking distance to all the places I had on my itinerary. The concierge staff was very polite, professional and helpful in providing information on how to navigate the city via the Metro and even went above and beyond in offering help and support. They are certainly an asset to the company.The room was not very big but when staying in New York, 99% of my time is spent outdoors and not in the room so it served its purpose well in providing a nice, clean safe place to sleep.I would definitely stay here again the next time I return to NY.

This hotel went beyond my expectations. Our first trip to NYC was a huge treat and this hotel made it possible. We got an unexpected upgrade when we first checked in. Our room had an iron and ironing board, a safe, a refrigerator and a nice King size bed. I loved the shower head and the toiletry products by Neil George. We had a view of the street below and surrounding buildings and could even see the NBC peacock on top of the Comcast building. The staff was extremely attentive and saw to our every need. It is a boutique hotel and does not have a large lobby area nor a bar or restaurant. Butter is the adjoining restaurant but we never ate there. I would have liked a coffee maker in the room but they do serve coffee in the lobby starting at 6 am and they always have ice cold lemon water there. The location of this hotel cannot be beat. Right off of Times Square, walking distance to everywhere and our room was very quiet. We were provided a nice black Mercedes with a kind driver to take us back to the airport . We most definitely would stay at this hotel again.

Don't be hoodwinked. This hotel is situated at Times Square and isn't the Time Square hotel!! No roof top bar, two towels for a family, no tea or coffee in the room, and room service is the staff going next door to Pret!! Had to ask for baby's bedding. Bath was dirty but other than that room was small but ok. Do feel mislead and let down as we were expecting a roof top bar and based on what we paid it is a bit of a rip off!! Staff are nice. We have until Sat here and certainly wouldn't book here again. DON'T GET TRICKED when booking!! Why wouldn't the hotel located at Times Square be called Times Square ?? And the one NOT at Times be called Times Square??? This hotel is more along the lines of a Holiday Inn Express and NOT a four star hotel!!!

I stayed four nights in an executive king room at the Cassa Hotel.It is in a good location on 45th St, with many restaurants and shops nearby. Close enough to Times Square to be readily accessible, but far enough away to escape the crowds.I have stayed at a number of hotels in mid town Manhattan and they all seem to be a similarly average standard, generally smallish rooms with worn decor. My room at the Cassa Hotel was different, having newer furnishings in a large room.I would recommend this hotel and will stay there again myself.

Stay four night in a twin double room. Was a tad smaller than I expected but adequate , bed was on the short side but comfortable. The room service was very good, room and bathroom clean. Love the showers ! People at the check-in desk were always friendly, anytime we left or returned. Location is as good as it gets for mid-town visitation.

I stayed in the 402 and the room was very small but very well equipped. However, my room had the view to a patio where there is a bar and one of the nights it was very load until very late. Also I could hear everything from the other room. . the breakfast option inside the hotel was in the basement, a 25 used buffet that offered a limited options, bottled juice, powder eggs and bread. It was very bad and expensive for 25 usd. The only thing I liked about the hotel was the location, the good service from the staff and the room service options.

The hotel staff was very helpful without being over bearing from the second we stepped out of the car. The room was nice and the bathroom was clean. The location is great as it is close to everything. We had an awesome stay in New York and will stay here on our next visit.

I stayed here for what was supposed to be a 3 night girls weekend with my teenage daughter. After our arrival flight was cancelled, we missed the first night of our prepaid reservation. (lesson learned, never again will I prepay!) Once we arrived at the Cassa and explained our situation, the gentleman checking us in didn't offer up any empathy. He handed us a key card and pointed to the elevator. The elevator was so dark it was hard to read our room number in there. We found our Executive king room to be smaller than expected but comfortable. It was very quiet and the showers are great. It was the details that got us. The door stop in the bathroom was laying on the ground leaving an exposed hole in the wall. The walls are covered in scuff marks and are in desperate need of a paint job. One afternoon after our room was serviced, housekeeping left a roll of toilet paper just thrown on the bathroom floor. Our trash was not emptied the other day of our stay. The biggest issue I had were these small bugs that we found on the bathroom counter. There were only a few so we didn't think it was a huge deal until we got home and brought them with us in our luggage. We both had bug bites all over us for the better part of a week. I however, did not speak up while at the hotel so I can't entirely fault them for this. In hindsight I should have asked to switch rooms. So while we did find some positives in our stay such as the location, the quiet rooms, and aside from our initial contact with the front desk we found the rest of the staff to be very friendly, the devil is in the details and they missed the mark for us.

The hotel was fine - clean bathroom and comfortable bed, and the staff were very friendly. The only reason I'm marking it average is that the carpet was stained/perhaps could have been replaced and to me it seemed a little tired. The best part about the hotel was that it was very central in the location I wanted.

Recently enjoyed a 4 night stay at the Cassa Hotel. Great location and couldn't fault the standard of accommodation (executive room) and service. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. Really made to feel welcome. They even delivered a 25 th wedding anniversary cake and personal note. Nice touch. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Great location close to Times Square and Fifth Avenue. Nice room with such a comfortable bed - essential after a hard day sightseeing. Staff on the reception desk were super friendly and helpful. Didn't try the restaurant but lots of eating places nearby

We arrived as a party of four at the Cassa Hotel for a three night stay late evening on Thursday 1 September after a long delay trying to get into LaGuardia due to weather. Two rooms had been booked on Hotels.com. Be aware that there is another hotel with a similar name – this review covers the one on located on West 45th StreetThe sole check-in receptionist was businesslike and efficient but appeared rather cold...no smile, no small talk and no real welcome to the hotel. Certainly he didn’t give a great initial impression which was disappointing, particularly as it doesn't gel with previous reviews. Must have been an off night!However, the two queen bed rooms were fine, if as others have said before, a little on the small side. Both were of a contemporary style and reasonably well equipped – a comfortable bed, great TV, built-in USB plugs at side of bed, safe, iron and ironing board – but most importantly it was clean and well maintained. There were no tea making facilities in the room although coffee was provided in the reception area every morning. Bathroom was also a good size with a powerful shower. There was no view from either of the rooms – except of other office buildings as you might expect although this did give some privacy at night - and there was nowhere at all to store our cases. The reception area is quite small with a small seating area and, apart from the hotel restaurant, there is no other public area or bar in which to linger.Air con in the room was a bit noisy during the night – but not as noisy as leaving the windows open. We were located at the rear of the building (not street side) as where the huge air con fans so even though we were on the 7th floor we still had to keep the windows closed if we wanted to sleep.No breakfast was included in the rate – but there are many good options in the vicinity. Pret is literally next door and there are several restaurants across the street (O’Lunney’s was of particularly good value and had a good choice of menu) offering decent food day and night. Where the hotel really excelled was in its location – literally one block and just far enough away from the mayhem that is Times Square and within reasonable strolling distance from 5th Avenue shops, Radio City and the other sites of midtown.On checkout we enquired about travel options to Newark – reception advised that they could provide a hotel car service for $95 all in, which given we were a party of four seemed a reasonable cost. However final payment ended up being $110 as a credit card surcharge was added which wasn’t notified when we booked. That was disappointing, particularly as I had asked about using the credit card..Overall the stay was fine but I have to say it was not exceptional. It’s a pleasant enough hotel in a reasonably quiet area but still close enough to the action. While I would consider staying again its worth remembering there are many other accommodation options in the area which could be just as good if not better.

There's not a great deal more I can add to what has already been said - other than if you're looking for a hotel in a great location with excellent staff this is the place for you. Situated between Times Sq & 5th Ave it's pretty central to everything in mid town Manhattan .The reception staff , with a special mention of Felicia , are very helpful & friendly. Anything you ask for is done straight away & with a smile. Free tea & coffee in reception every morning , however as we were staying for a week we were given coffee machine/ kettle in our room. Do be warned though - the queen deluxe rooms are very small with little storage space. This is fine if you're there a night or 2 but would suggest upgrading to a king size room for a longer stay.

We stayed 3 nights at the Cassa in a deluxe king room. The room was a good size, the bed and pillows very comfortable. The bathroom featured a large shower with rainforest showerhead. we arrived at 9am and were pleasantly surprised to be told our rooms were ready..a real bonus as we'd awoken at 3am that morning. The staff were pleasant, engaging and seemed always ready to provide tips and suggestions to make our stay more enjoyable. There was always a pleasant greeting when you returned to the hotel. There is a Pret a Manger next door which we used every morning for breakfast and would highly recommend as well

My boyfriend and I went to Cassa this labour day weekend to celebrate our second anniversary. The hotel itself is situated in the heart of the madness, steps from Times Square. When we arrived I had confirmed for the 3rd time that we had upgraded our bed size because from reading reviews they were extremely small and we wanted to avoid this issue. Unfortunately nobody made a note in our file despite calling twice months ahead of time. That being said, the staff were very accommodating and compassionate, and were able to move us to another upgraded room the next day , as they were fully booked that night, and also provided us with cookies, chocolates, complimentary breakfast, and a lovely note telling us to enjoy our stay and have a happy anniversary. I thought this was a very sweet touch. Whatever questions we had or things needed were provided to us promptly. Parking is expensive but we were also given a $10 voucher towards it. Felicia and jermaine were specifically outstanding to us during our stay. The rooms are very small and if you are sleeping with someone else in bed it is worth upgrading as it is about the size of a twin bed for the standard rooms. There is no fridge but ice buckets can be provided. Overall this is a good hotel if you want to be in the heart of midtown and friendly staff. Thanks Cassa for the great customer service.

Had a spectacular stay at the Cassa Hotel. Check in was smooth and we had a great room on the 26th floor. We were in New York for our 5th anniversary and were presented with complimentary drinks at the adjacent restaurant, and a very tasty (and huge) cookie. Issues with the WiFi were resolved right away, and any time we needed something (be it ice or new water glasses) they were quick to provide them. Every staff member was helpful and pleasant. Great location too for visiting the city- close to the subway and main tourist spots.

Location is really amazing if you are going to NYC for the first time. Staff are really helpfull and friendly. Rates are a little bit expensive. Do not book with breakfast because the only thing you can eat is cold scrambled eggs and a croissant like a rock. :) AC is very good and rooms are so clean and comfortable.

This was my 3rd trip to New York and I suppose like many people do, I struggle when it comes to choosing which hotel to stay in as there are so many! But after reading reviews I thought this hotel sounded like the right place for me. Well my thoughts were confirmed when I arrived, every member of staff was helpful, friendly and nothing ever seemed too much for them. I love how they greet you everytime you walk through the doors.The hotel has an excellent location, it is literally half an avenue walk to Times Square and 5th Avenue depending on if you go left or right. My room was extremely clean and cosy. It was quite small, but it's New York and most rooms are quite compact because we are in a massive city filled with a lot of buildings after all! Excellent value for money and I for sure definitely know this will be the hotel I'll be staying in during my next New York trip! :)

Stayed here for just over a week over Christmas and new years, hotel itself was okay - nothing special however the location was great. My room was a bit small, looked a lot better in the pictures. Hotel was quite costly for what you are getting but maybe it was just the time of year I went. When we checked in and got to the room, found the safe wasn't even attached to anything so you could of literally picked it up and walked away with it. Staff were great, very friendly. Breakfast was included with my room, so unable to comment on that.I probably wouldn't stay here again unless it was for a night or two at max and I was able to get the room very cheap.

The staff on arrival was very rude, The room was small and they said they only had a standard room with a double bed. Not what we booked! I would not stay here again, there are better hotels in the city

This is a hidden gem in NYC. A quiet and luxurious spot. I can't believe that I have not found this place sooner. The staff are helpful, wonderful and efficient. The rooms are clean,comfortable and luxurious. We stayed here for 1 night to see a show. We were able to check in an also leave our bag at the front desk. The staff efficiently took all the necessary info from us to check in, so that we could just pick up our key when we got back. We did not even have to ask for our bag, it was already in the room when we got back. I love this place-you can walk everywhere..and there is even a hotel car service on standby that can take you places and set rates to area airports. This is a first..I have never seen this at a hotel before. The room was really quiet and the bed was very comfortable. The shower was very luxurious.On the 10th floor, there is a terrace--there tables and chairs--you can sit there and have something to eat or have drinks. Other perks- valet parking, free WIFI, a gym, you can also order breakfast---comes from Pret a manger a few doors down--delicious! What more can I say? It was a great stay and I can't wait to go back!

Stayed at Cassa Hotel on 45th Street for three nights. I had a deluxe room which was quite spacious and very clean. I'm used to very small rooms when staying in New York, so that was definitely a plus. The front desk staff was very friendly and checking in and out was easy. The only annoying thing was that the A/C stopped working. I let them know and they sent someone to fix it, but it broke again during the night. Couldn't be bothered to let them know again since I was leaving the next day anyway. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend and I would stay there again.

first time in NYC, stayed for 6 nights here after searching for the best value for money for days. very clean and comfortable hotel with a great location - both in the city center and peaceful at the same time. we loved the staff - everyone is very friendly and helpful (special thanks to Felicia at the reception!)

Fab hotel in a central location within walking distance to the main attractions. Staff were really friendly and helpful. The rooms are modern and spacious for New York. Would definitely recommend this property.

It's a really nice hotel with comfortable accommodations in a lively, but quiet area. Room was small which is expected in NYC, and the bed was smaller than expected, but still comfortable. Very nice, spacious, & clean bathroom. Would stay again!
user_name:
SDtravel24
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed in the Cassa in August for 5 days for my boyfriends 30th birthday.I would highly recommend this hotel for its fab location and fab customer service.This hotel you are pretty much central to it all. Minute walk to time square just down the street, about a 5 minute walk or to either empire state, rockafella and central park.If you want to see the view of the city i would say go to Top of the Rock at Rockafella plaza. Dont get me wrong i absolutely loved the empire state building but the view at the rockafella is just something else. We also hired bikes to cycle around central park, cost us for 2 people $54 for 3 hours, fab way to get around the park. 6.2 mile trek around the whole thing. There are plently of people trying to sell you the rentals, we finally gave in at the entrance to central park and was worth it. We did all the touristy things as you can imagine, 9/11 memorial, empire state, rockafella, central park, baseball game, times square, statue of liberty. You really do have to do them all to get the best new york experienceOne thing i will say is be careful on the taxis, we flew into Newark airport from London. The taxi ride from Newark to New york was $45 which included the toll charges, however the taxi ride back from New york to Newark airport cost us $110 which included tolls. So leave yourselves nearly $200 airport transfer charges

Thanks Cassa,Great hotel we were more than happy with our two week stay. The hotel personnel, especially the front of hotel were very helpful, charming and lovely and made us feel quite special. The room was of a high standard, clean and refreshed daily to perfection.Very highly recommended, within a few strides of Times Square, theatres and great restaurants. What more could we have asked for. Thank you Cassa staff for making our stay in NYC so memorable and enjoyable. You really are the Momma Cass(a)Anne & Mick Manders :o)

Very good hotel if you want a good balance of price and quality in a very good location - 5 min walking from Bryant Square with lots of restaurants and cafes nearby. Subway is also close, just 2 blocks down the street. Personnel is very attentive, I spent a great week.

The hotel is also an apartment building so it doesn't have the usual hotel services .i arrived early but was welcomed warmly by reception staff. Given a small room on eleventh floor. The hallways could be updated but the rooms are nice especially the bathroom which was roomy. Comfortable beds and nice sheets. Free coffee in the morning and in very convenient location. I'd recommend it if you get a good deal.

Convenient location, great prices, & excellent customer service. The staff was the most kind, friendly, and trustworthy interaction I've had anywhere in NYC. Love it! I've been to NYC mutiple times and typically stay in different hotels but I would definitely return to this one.

We stayed here in May to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary, we had an executive King room on the 5th floor, it was a lovely size and a view of Times Square from the shower!! Just a beautiful room in a lovely hotel, the staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful, the porter and doorman must get special mention, some lovely places to eat nearby and location was perfect, would definitely go back

Please note that this review is for the location on 45th street. Apparently there are 2 Cassa hotels (i.e. this Cassa doesn't have a hot tub and doesn't give free breakfast but the other does so be mindful that some reviewers may accidentally write a review for the wrong location).Location - Amazing. About a 3minute walk to Times Square; 3minute walk to the subway station that will take you to the main tourist spots and a lot of restaurants on the street you can go to for all your meals if you wish! Service - Amazing as well. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived (we got in early around 10am) but they allowed us to go to the gym area to freshen up, use the washrooms etc. and held our bags which we felt was safe. The only thing is is that they don't provide free water in the rooms. You have to pay $4 USD a bottle. Thankfully we had brought our own water bottles and you can refill them in the gym. (Code required from front desk). So make sure to bring your bottles for free...you will need the water throughout the day as it was scorching hot when we went in August! One night we arrived back at our room at midnight to find our AC wasn't working. We called the front desk and someone was up immediately, changed the filter and within 20mins it was back up and running. Rooms - my first time in NYC so don't know what other hotels are like, but it had enough space for what we needed and was clean, modern and well kept. Food - didn't eat here so can't say but in the mornings there were apples, tea and coffee in the lobby. Between 5-6 they have free champagne (wasn't around for it but I'm sure it's good!) and in the afternoon-evening they have lemon water in the lobby as well. Our itinerary (if you're interested)We were here for 4 full days and tried to see/do as much as possible as it was our first time. Here is what we did and hopefully this will give you an idea of what's feasible!Day 1: Getting to the hotel - from Laguardia airport, you can take the Q70 bus, get off at Roosevelt Avenue (about a 10-15minute bus ride) and then hop on the subway. I believe it was the F. You can get off at Bryant Park or Rockefellar Ctr. They are both about a 3-5minute walk to the hotel...the hotel has easy access to the B, D, F and M trains. Note - a taxi would cost about $50 for this one way trip. For our whole trip, we spent about $55 on the metro. Amazing and faster then a car. We spent the majority of the day roaming about Times Square, had breakfast/lunch there and walked down the Theatre district, watched some street performers and just took in the city. We did this from 10-3pm and then had plans to meet up with family.Day 2:Took the subway to South Ferry Station where you can get on the Staten Island Ferry (For FREE) and see the Statue of Liberty. You're not SUPER close to it but close enough to see the face/head etc. The ferry comes every 30mins. People will lie to you on weekends to try to get you to pay for the tour...they tell you it comes every 2 hours but we went and checked and realized they were just trying to get a sale so please be a smart tourist and dont believe what is said. Do your research. We then walked through Wall Street, saw the Raging bull (iconic bull for the stock market) and then walked on the Brooklyn bridge from Manhattan to Brooklyn. There is a beautiful waterfront park when you get to Brooklyn that you can chill out at for however long. Take a blanket! We then hopped on a subway from Brooklyn back to our hotel. We had dinner reservations at Toloache (mexican) and well-rated on TripAdvisor so we tried it out. AMAZING!! It was very busy so make reservations. We then went to the Aladdin show on Broadway. WOW. Best money I've spent in a long time! After the show, we explored Times square at night (so many lights!) Day 3:Got an early start. Walked 25mins to breakfast at Penelope's (well rated on Trip Advisor) - a small mom and pop place. Again, very good. Pricey but good. On our walk there, we saw the Empire State building. Then we took a subway to One World Trade Centre, the memorial and we went to the museum and spent about 3.5-4 hours there. Could have spent more time there but we got hungry! It was a great experience. Note that on Tuesdays, the entry is free from 5-7pm but it will be busy. We paid $24 a person for entry. Perhaps you can find coupons on line. We didn't search. Then we took the subway to grand central station to see it (pretty nice!) and then walked up 5th avenue (lots of expensive stores) to Central Park where we hung out for a bit. We then did Rockafellar Centre (grabbed food truck food for dinner and sat in the Rock plaza to eat) and then got tickets for Top of the Rock. Note - you will want to buy tickets in advance. We went at 9pm and the next available time was for 10:25pm. Not bad, but dont expect to go there, buy tickets and go straight up. We thought the night view was amazing. Day 4:We booked 2 free tours (google "Free tours by Foot") of Soho, Little Italy and Chinatown and Greenwich Village. Each were 2 hours long. Soho was at 10-12 and Greenwich was 2-4. They are close to eachother, so there is enough time for lunch in between and you can walk from one village to the next. We ate at Piccolo Cucina (Italian) based on TripAdvisor reviews and it was amazing! If you're a Friends fan (the show), the Greenwich village tour will take you Monica/Rachel's apartment. So the tours are free, but you pay what you want at the end of it. People seemed to be giving $10/person but it's really up to you. An inexpensive way to see the city and get a good bang for your buck. The company has other tours as well. Then we went to a baseball game (Toronto Vs. New York). Again, super easy to get to the Bronx to the Yankee Stadium. Then ended back at Times square to hang out. So, a busy packed trip but saw a lot! We are a 28 year old couple with no kids! If you have any questions about costs, timings of activities or anything at all, let me know and I will be happy to help!

A very nice and modern Hotel, in the center of NYC - This Hotel has an excelent service and friendly and helpful staff. We apreciate this stay the final three days of our trip. The rooms are exactly as all the pictures show - so no further comments about.

Stayed here during our NYC city break. Lovely little hotel close to Times Square yet on a fairly quiet side road. Loved the coffee and fruit in the morning which set us up for our early starts. Would definitely stay here again when next visiting this fabulous city.

When I have business trips to NYC, I almost invariably stay at Cassa because it is right opposite the corporation I work for around the business district with access to a wide variety of shops and eating places. The service has been very good and I have no reason to look anywhere else. Rooms are medium-sized, clean and tastefully decorated. As in most NYC hotels, you do not really a view and if you are not staying long, you just want a quiet, comfortable room with sufficient space. I would use them again (after this third time staying there).

Great location - steps to Broadway shows & 5th Avenue but on a relatively quiet street. Staff very helpful and welcoming. Room very comfortable/bathroom good size. Would definitely stay here again. Free coffee/tea/fruits/iced water a nice touch.

First, this is a great boutique hotel close to the theater district without being right in the thick of the crowd. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed, the staff helpful. Because I stayed here two years ago, when I knew I was going to return to NYC for four nights in the summer of 2016, I checked availability. When TripAdvisor advertised a special rate, I checked out the options carefully...and I do mean carefully. I saw the different room sizes, the bed options, etc., and double checked that I had selected a room with two beds. HOWEVER, when I checked in, the hotel said that the confirmation number I had was not theirs and the room I had been assigned was a single double bed. Even though my printout said DELUXE DOUBLE they insisted that I had a STANDARD room with one double bed. They worked with us and shifted things around so that at least three of the four nights I was in a room with two beds, though the last night my traveling companion and I were moved to a room with only one bed. PLUS the hotel charged me an upgrade fee that came to almost $200 for the four nights. I don't think this is rare....because on more than one occasion as I was entering or exiting the hotel, I heard the front desk explaining to people that the room they thought they booked wasn't the one they were given but could have for an upgrade fee. Who's going to turn that down? You're in NYC tired from traveling without any other place to go...so either the hotel is deliberately scamming customers or there is a serious lack of communication between the hotel and the booking agencies who work with them, such as Booking.com and TripAdvisor. I love the hotel....it is quiet and comfortable and safe and convenient, so I hope they sort out the issue so that customers aren't caught off guard like I was.

Brilliant location, still close to all the lights and sites of Times Square but far enough away to be out of the chaos. Walking distance to Empire State Building and Central Park and everything in between. The room was very large , which is quite a luxury in New York City. Nice big modern bathroom. No problems with checkin or checkout and the restaurant downstairs looked nice and busy although we didn't eat there. I would have no problems in recommending this hotel to anyone, and will definitely look at staying here the next time we visit New York City.

Stayed in Jr suite room 405 for 4 nights. Staff were friendly, polite & helpful. Room was nice size with King bed & separate seating area. 55" tv on wall. Mini frig & blow dryer provided. Mattress was comfy, dark drapes and no outside noise so we slept very well. No view but we didn't care about that. Bathroom was spacious with double vanity & rainhead shower. Location is 45th and 6th which is perfect for walking everywhere. Nearest metro is 42nd (5 min walk). We have always stayed at Bryant park hotel on prev trips but it was booked up for our dates do we tried Cassa. I cannot say enough good things about it & it's definitely where we will stay on future NYC trips.

Great location just off Times Square - if that's your thing. No problem finding it at all.I was in a room on the 4th floor - surprisingly spacious for a New York hotel; comfortable, clean, with a very modern bathroom. As others have noted, not a lot of external light, but I would emphasise the fact that the ugliness of the light well is disguised much better here than in many other New York hotels. Front desk team superb - really friendly and helpful

Hotel staff was friendly, helpful and gave us honest advice and opinions. The room was clean, comfortable and had everything you could possibly need. Bathroom and bed was great! Didn't hear any street noise felt completely safe walking to and from the hotel during all times of day and night. Would highly recommend this hotel.

great location, but still little hard to find...just couple blocks to time square.good restaurant and staff.room are nice, but quite small. nothing bad to say.Faraway from airport but hotel helps with transportation and so on.like booking tickets to Broadway musical.

We booked up at a great price and were impressed with the reviews. We were not disappointed at all. Great location! Small lobby, but well presented and lovely kind and attentive staff. Room was basic, but perfect for what we needed and paid for. it was clean and the bathroom was particularly nice. One small nag was that you could hear your adjacent rooms air con motor and walls were pretty thin (we could hear the lift announce it was on our level each time) but these really are totally minor points. There was also no hotel bar, so if this is something you look for, then just be aware. However, because of the great location you are a stone throw away from bars. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay, would certainly recommend, and if were to make it back to NYC and want to stay in the same area, would look to book again. Thanks for a great stay

Centrally located close to Times Square. The hotel is nice however it is sparse. The room was small which is not unusuak in NYC but we felt the room lacked storage and light. I visited with my cousins for 4 nights. We had two rooms and when I made the reservation 6 weeks in advance I requested a coffee maker for each room. The coffee makers were in the room when we arrived *they only provide coffee pods the first night). On the second day, the coffee maker was removed from my cousins room by housekeeping and when I called reception to let them know the coffee maker was gone their answer was "well, probably another guest requested one and we took it". Customer service has room for improvement but overall is was fine.

I enjoyed my first visit to the Cassa hotel, the rooms have a stylish minimalist look & is very very comfortable. The gym is easily accessible. The complimentary fruit & beverage area is always on the ready & very fresh & delicious. The staff was friendly. Doorman Chris knows the lay of the land & is always a helping hand. They have the friendliest front desk ever. Concierge Heidy checked us in & was always willing to help us with anything we needed. The hotel is in the middle of the city so it's very easy to get around. Hope to visit soon.

Worst hotel experience ever! My dad and I were staying there and we had reserved a room with 2 beds since May 2016 and when we went in July 2016, they gave us an 'executive room'-if executive means 'one full bed' and they did not want to change the room. Bed had roaches. No entertainment areas, very bad staff, I could keep on going.. I expected a better looking hotel- I mean, it looks fancy from photos but a total trash inside. Do not come here! Waste of money.

This hotel is centrally located; close to the theatre district, Bryant Park, Grand Central Terminal, and just a short taxi ride or long walk to Penn Station, Herald Square, and museums. Our room was spacious, quiet, well appointed, and clean. Temperature controls worked well and the room had a small refrigerator. Bathroom was modern, functional, and well-lit. Taxis were readily available and the hotel is close to subways. Front desk was efficient. Would definitely return.

I stayed at the Cassa for two nights. The staff was very pleasant and helpful, the room and bathroom were extremely clean. It was a simple room, bed, two nightstands, desk, flat screen TV. There is no refrigerator or mini bar. I was a solo traveler and didn't have much in the way of clothes, which was a good thing, since there was no dresser; instead a wardrobe that housed a safe and four small drawers along with a place to hang your clothes. The bed was extremely comfortable, as was the temperature in the room. The shower was amazing. It had a rain shower and also a hand held wand attached to the wall. I enjoyed my stay here and will definitely stay here again.

Frankly, I wish I could keep this place to myself. Artfully designed, well located, reasonably priced. Most notable was the room design, the best I've encountered. Someone know how to make small spaces work: a handy shelf-table under the TV, wide enough to hold keys, jewelry, a paper or magazine -- very convenient. Then there was the bathroom, with a little built in vanity with DRAWERS. Insane, wish I had it at home! Staff very friendly, rooms quiet (mine overlooked the garden bar), and best is that location. Near subway and buses. Did not dine there.
user_name:
PigsFly
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights for the first part of our honeymoon. On arrival, hotel staff were friendly and so helpful. This continued throughout the whole of our stay. We received some of the best customer service we have ever experienced at this hotel. Staff went out of their way to say hello and to ensure you had an enjoyable visit. Hotel is in a great location. We were easily able to walk to local subway stations including grand central. We were also able to walk to the Rockefeller centre and the Empire State Building in 10 minutes. The hotel is right by Broadway so perfect location to see a show. Lots of lovely restaurants close by. Our room was larger than expected, clean and very nicely decorated. The bathroom was lovely! Maid came in and made the bed and changed the towels everyday. Overall, we could not fault this hotel and when we return to New York one day we will definitely be staying here.

When we arrived, the staff were so attentive actually got us into our room so much earlier than we ever would have expected and it was such a blessing. Check in and and check out was a breeze. Our room was very clean, spacious and comfortable. We loved the stereo which was already playing music for us when we opened our door. Bathroom very modern and spacious too. Loved the location which is far enough away from the crazy over populated Times Square and close enough to the great shopping on 5th Ave. actually right smack dab in the middle of both which is perfect !! We would definitely stay here again, Thanks Cassa !!!

We stayed in New York for 6 nights in June and the Cassa hotel was everything we expected and more! Perfectly located just off Times square.Our room was perfect in every detail. A nice comfy bed with adequate space, air conditioning was a must and very welcome after a long day visiting all the sites as it was very hot. Good bathroom with excellent power shower. There was free wifi which is always good to se being offer and a free room safe. The hotel staff were very professional and always offering great advice on places to visit and avoid.We plan on returning to New York next year and we will definitely be booking the Cassa Hotel again!

Located very close to the times square, its a gem of a hotel in NYC. The staff was courteous, the location impeccable and the service was exceptional. The staff was more than happy to accommodate all my requests for additional amenities including a coffee maker immediately upon calling.Though my request for an extension in the checkout time was denied, i don't blame them as it was a peak season from 1st - 3rd July.The staff had accidentally left one of my baggages behind while checking me out. However, the manager was exceptionally courteous in admitting the mistake and immediately shipped the baggage through overnight delivery to my residence.Thanks for a great vacation in the states.

This is a very nice hotel in a great location with very friendly and helpful staff. I would definitely stay here again on another trip to New York City.* Location: This is a great location if you want to walk to places as: Central Park, Broadway, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, etc. You are also on more of a secondary street as main thoroughfare which may be of interest to some. * Rooms: Rooms are well laid out which makes their smaller size, as is typical for New York City, not an issue. Bed was very comfortable. Bathrooms are clean with a modern look.Staff: The staff was very helpful and friendly. We, for example, arrived arrived early and were allowed to right to our room. They were also always helpful if you needed a suggestion.Water & Fruit: There is water and fruit available by the front desk which is a nice touch.

Just returned from an awesome visit to NYC the first week of July with my 16-year-old daughter (her first visit to NYC). We had an amazing time, and Cassa Hotel was our oasis in a busy and bustling city. The room was large by New York standards (two double beds), and exceptionally clean. The bathroom was spotless and very large as well. We especially appreciated the warm and welcoming front desk staff who always took time to give us tips, advice, and to ask us about our day. Appreciated the fresh coffee and apples each morning, and especially enjoyed the iced lemon water each afternoon upon our return from treking around the city in the heat. The room was incredibly quiet... could hardly believe we were in the heart of Manhattan. No street noise whatsoever. Would HIGHLY recommend Cassa Hotel to all our friends.

I put 4 stars instead of 5 because the room's lighting is dark. The lamps are not bright enough for reading and working at night. Otherwise, everything else is good. Crews are polite and nice. Provided water in the lobby and coffee, tea in the morning.

We visited cassa the week just gone and we really enjoyed our stay. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, there was always some one to greet you when you came in to the hotel.The rooms were nice, lovely bathroom with great facilities. The beds aren't massive but they are fine, we knew before we arrived what we'd paid for so we weren't expecting a huge king size bed. We slept perfectly well every night.The location is the real highlight of the hotel, it's perfectly situated to get to most of the tourist sites on foot. Times Square is only a few streets down. The only reason I haven't rated excellent is due to the bar area in the hotel, we went up a few times and there wasn't much going on up there, no bar or access to the outside area. It would have been nice to be able to chill out and have a drink in the hotel. ( I've noticed it mentioned the area opens at 5pm below but no one made us aware of this)Fantastic stay and we would comeBack again!

Wow! Wow! Wow!What a find this was our third visit to NYC and booked this hotel which was a great find to say the least, a real Gem hidden away on 45th Street.Rooms are very clean, bed was ever so comfy, empty mini bar fridge in the room was great to have for drinks and snacks to stay chilled.2 minutes’ walk to Times Square and 5th Avenue. Perfect location to get anywhere as in the heart of the city.Plenty of places to eat or drink right on the doorstep and several local shops within seconds from the hotel for take outs for the room if needed.Hotel was very quiet we were on the 16th floor and although there was traffic on the road throughout the day if the window is shut......you don't hear anything!!!! Great double glazing! Rooms were cleaned every day! And housekeeping always helpful for extra towels and such like!....you don't always get this in other hotels in NYCFREE Tea, Coffee and fruit in the lobby each morning which was nice.The Staff at this hotel are some of the finest I have ever come across in all my travels and certainly the very best I've known in all my trips to NYC, very polite and helpful and very knowledgably on what's on and where to be all day long! so helpful, Everyone always had a smile and always had the time for you, this is not always the case in other hotels, especially in NYC....Big thanks to all the staff but a special shout out for Felecia, Osei, James, Jonathan, Adam and a huge shout out for the two 'main men' at the front of the hotel Julio & Sam (you guys Rock!)We had a ball at the hotel, will be back for sure, thanks to you all for looking after us so well!John & Gill

Stayed here for a city break and to celebrate my 30th birthday. Staff were friendly and welcoming from the start, offering us a better room when hearing it was my bday and then sent chocs on the day. The location was perfect, 5 min walk from times sq but far enough away from the noise to be able to sleep. The room was comfortable, a tad on the small side but more than enough room for a couple, bathroom was impressive, large shower! Free tea and freeh coffee available in the lobby at certain times throughout the day. Would reccomend and would definitely return. Great value for money!

The good: Nice clean room. Bed was very comfortable for delux queen. Small room but typical for a boutique hotel. Gest services we polite and helpful.The Bad: There was no ice bucket in the room, we had to request one. Also, The garden and rooftop bars were closed due to weather? The whole weekend was nice. If the price is right, I would stay there again.

Going to NYC for a quick weekend getaway I found this hotel simply using google maps. Wanted to stay in the area. Service, especially the front desk was phenomenal. Room a bit on the small side, but perfect for our weekend needs. Clean and comfortable. Did not use any particular services, but had a very pleasant stay. Felicia at the front desk was beyond helpful.

This was a comfortable hotel close to many great places in Manhattan. A short walk to the subways and helpful staff. I would definitely recommend this hotel as a good value and we would visit the hotel again.

I generally try and be positive with any review but not possible with this one!Booked this hotel in Oct 15 for 5 night stay in Jun 16, covering our anniversary and son's birthday. Although payment was not required at time of booking, I called the hotel directly to arrange payment to have it taken care of there and then, and at that time anyone i spoke to or emailed was exceptionally friendly and polite.On arrival our room wasn't ready but we may have been slightly early so this wasn't an issue, they took our luggage and we went out for a while and on returning they had taken our luggage up to room, they had given us room 24 on floor 6, nice touch as our anniversary was 24/6.Unfortunately it was downhill from there.Despite this being a room booked for 3 people, 2 adults and a 12 year old, clearly stated at time of booking and also during my discussions directly with the hotel staff back in October, we had one queen size bed. Having visited NY several times previously, being given a queen room has never been a problem as we have always had a single bed added for our son.Not at the Cassa. I queried this at front desk and the receptionist called his manageress, then suggested I could have a roll-away bed for our son for an extra $35/night! How kind, letting me pay for a bed for the third person in our group, after having booked and paid for 3 people already?!?!?Needless to say I declined this generous offer and the manageress duly appeared to discuss further.The nice lady again asked if i wanted to have the roll-away at the stated price and as I declined she then offered to cancel my booking!Yes, at around 6pm on the day of arriving in NY she was telling me she could cancel my booking and I could leave the hotel. Not sure if anyone you know reserves a second hotel when going on holiday but I certainly don't, so her ultimatum was pay up extra or find another hotel there and then.I spoke to my wife and she agreed that we would not be paying and would rather leave than deal with this manageress and her unbelievably rude demeanour. By this time I was getting extremely aggravated, been up for about 22 hours, a long flight from the UK and then this, and she wonders why I'm raising my voice?!?When I paid back in October I paid using my debit card which is instant transfer from cash funds in my bank. I told her I would like the same method used for refund and would expect an instant transfer to my account as she refused to issue a cash refund, I explained I would need this done immediately to allow me to find and book another hotel. Yup, you've guessed, not possible! She would authorise a refund but not guarantee it would reach my account immediately.By this time another more senior "manager" appeared, I assume that's who he was because I wasn't introduced. He confirmed that a refund had been issued and showed me a receipt, I in turn showed him my online bank account, confirming NO payment received, not their problem was the response.
