I believe it was at this point the manageress realised my wife was filming the whole episode on her phone, and as my wife and I had stepped away from reception to discuss our options regarding another hotel, she had words with the other manager.He then offered to discuss further as they did not want us to leave the hotel, I told him quite clearly that all she had offered was pay up or leave, which did not sound like "please stay" or "let us try and resolve this". Amazing what a camera can do.He then changed his tune and offered to let us re-book and waive the extra charge, in my opinion this option should have been discussed at the outset. My son made the choice for us, clearly stating that he did not wish to stay in a hotel where the staff treat guests in the manner they were. Luckily we were able to find another hotel not too far and although it was more expensive, and we also paid extra charges for booking by credit card, it was worth every penny to get out of the Cassa.Numerous visits to NY and by far the worst experience in any hotel we have stayed in. I have always been impressed by the way American hotel staff go out of their way to be polite and helpful no matter what you ask for, but this hotel is the exception by some distance. Never again would I even consider this hotel and would advise anyone thinking about it, find another place where the manager actually listens to your concerns and doesn't try and throw you out for complaining!

There are lots of positives with this hotel. Excellent, friendly service, free and efficient wifi, very clean, nice lobby decor, great location, fast elevators, high quality television (with directv service), a feeling of safety, and at least when I stayed, a very reasonable price (through priceline's express deal feature). The downside is both the room and the bed are very small -- those are the only aspects that keep it from five stars.

I stayed at Cassa for two nights. After 4 years I chose this hotel again and it was again a very good expirience. Perfect location (it might be a bit difficult to find this property though as there is a little sign only), very comfortable room (please ask to be located at the upper floor as you might be lucky and have a nice view) & bed, clean and quite large bathroom. There is a coffee, water and fruits at the reception in the morning. Very helpful staff too. I enjoyed my stay at Cassa and probably I will be back. Just one note, I forgot to take my jacket with me when leaving New York, I sent few emails but unfortunately have not received any answer back - a bit disappointing.

This is a very tall Manhattan hotel with just a few rooms on each floor, which gives it a boutique designation despite its height. The staff is very friendly. We spent a two-day weekend there to celebrate our anniversary. Even though we live less than two hours away, we enjoy the thrill of spending overnight in "the city." We were able to get a reasonable price, by Manhattan standards, by using an online travel service. We opted for an Executive King room with breakfast included. The spacious room on the 21st floor was modern and clean with an excellent shower and a nice view of the city. No vista of Central Park or the landmark skyline buildings, but still an urban view of many edifices. The location of the hotel is excellent, on 45th Street between 5th and 6th Avenues, placing it right between Times Square and Rockefeller Center. Finding the entrance to the hotel is a little tricky, since there is no prominent sign -- look for the Butter Restaurant. The included breakfast was adequate, especially since our effective rate was $15 each, instead of the added charge of $25 for non-breakfast reservations. It was served buffet style, and included oatmeal, waffles, scrambled eggs and bacon, along with coffee, juices, and some assorted breads. By the way, there is a Pret A Manger right next store so getting breakfast on your own is not a problem. All-in-all it was an excellent stay and we hope to return next time we want to spend a few nights in "the city."

Service and assistance from beginning to end was amazing and efficient. I stayed in the junior suite which was quite a bit more room than I expected for a New York city stay. A pleasant and worthwhile choice. Perfect location, in the heart of everything you need and don't need but want. I will certainly stay here again in the future.

Staff was very friendly and room very spacious , excellent bed! I Thank that there is missing a coffea maker in the Room. My executive king room was perfect for us. The bathroom very confortable. We love it

Booked this hotel as my original choice (The Gotham) wasn't available. However I was happy with this alternative as location was very central and staffs were friendly. Loved the complementary coffee/tea and apple in the morning. Bed was comfortable and bathroom spacious by NY standard. Requested for an electric kettle and one was delivered to my room. Booked the car service from hotel to JFK but car didn't turn up as Obama was in town and the entire midtown was stuck in traffic jam. Luckily the bellboy went out of his way to get us an yellow cab and we managed to get to the airport on time! The only negatives I could think of were perhaps the dim lighting in the room and the noise from the road early in the morning. Otherwise it was a great stay and I would come back to the Cassa when I am back to NY in the future.

We really enjoyed our stay here! It seemed to be within walking distance of nearly everywhere we wanted to be.The room was clean and spacious. The staff were really helpful and friendly! Beds were comfortable, I seriously could go on! We will certainly book here again if we come back!!

Friendly staff. Spatious accommodation. No breakfast but free coffee and fruit in lobby and diner round the corner.Very centrally located between 5th and 6th avenues with times sq very close by.Shower was excellent. We enjoyed using the 10th floor outdoor terrace which allowed good views up and down the st to see times sq.

After facing some last minute changes I had to rebook a room in NY during the last minute, found a good deal with Cassa 45th and took it with little to no research due the last minute circusmtances. To my suprise it turns out the Hotel actually delivered on so many fronts, first of all check in was efficient and receptionists were professional, courteous and caring. The room was more spacious for what you get in NY, it was clean and comfortable, also there were two windows in my room no view but plenty of light coming in, which is important to me, the last thing you want is to be holed up in a dark, dingy stuffy room in NY. Bathroom was recently renovated with the shower particularity amazing! house keeping was efficient but I did note that sheets weren't changed in around four to five days. now the best aspect of this place is its location, it is a seven minute leisurely walk to the times square and Broadway theaters, since the hotel is located right infront the avenues of Americas, the road is pretty safe, wide and busy but not as hectic as it is in times square, which gives you a nice reprieve from the craziness. Bryant park is a short walk away and access to Rockefeller center and 5th avenue is also quite convenient. Subway access is immediate and direct, the location can't be faulted. now there is one stark negative and that is the Hotel's breakfast arrangements with the attached restaurant Butter, buffet choice is very limited, poor and repetitive, service is cold and akward. since there aren't alot of people you basically dine in a empty restaurant and are made to feel like you are a nuisance to whoever is in charge of the morning shift. therefore, I would urge anybody booking to avoid breakfast as it is of no value and choices around you are far richer.however this didn't dampen my overall enjoyment of the hotel and with a good deal this is a pretty great place to set up camp in New York.

This hotel is walking distance to theatres on Broadway, without being in the middle of Times Square. As a solo female traveller, this is important. Felt very safe walking at night after seeing a play. Staff were fantastic. Close to subway and shopping. Rooms were small but very modern with new furnishing. The shower was amazing. My new favourite hotel in NYC.

The reception area quite dark but the staff made up for that.Fantastic staff and location. Room very clean, and the most comfortable bed I’ve ever slept in on holiday. Safe at no extra cost along with a fridge. We stayed on 27th floor and could see Times Square from the spacious bathroom. Ironing board/iron /hairdryer and radio provided in the room along with free wi-fi.- there is a charge for "faster" internet but the free was fine for our needs.The location is very central but also very quiet. Lifts extremely fast. Didn’t eat at Buttery – bit expensive but deli further down the road was fine for breakfast and the Pret a Manager next door.Free tea/coffee offered in the lobby every morning and water in the afternoon . Be aware if you have a late flight there is no courtesy room to have a shower. There are two restrooms on the 10th floor – air conditioned area – Only paper towels. They do keep your luggage.This was our first trip to New York and we couldn’t have chosen a better hotel for our stay.Thank you for your hospitality.Stayed in May 2016

The hotel is smack in the middle of midtown and close to the Radio city hall. The awning of the hotel is in WIP so it can be hard to find but i hear from the staff they are going to fix that. Great staff, nice rooms, free wifi, nice bathrooms and they have Direct TV. There is a really nice restaurant at the basement level of this hotel called Butter and they also have a bar at the back of the lobby. The hotel could use a small general store where you can pick up snacks, coke, etc.

Placed at 45th street, between 5th and 6th, in the strategic core of the city, has nice, clean, silent large rooms with clean and capable bathroom. Nice toilet soaps and towels. Breakfast served in the basement restaurant with poor choice and not generally included. Nice terrace at the 10th floor perfect for drinks and breakfast but inexplicably not used for that purpose.

No complaints about the location, halfway between 5th Ave. and Times Square and couple blocks north of Bryant Park. Presence on street as with many of the boutique hotels in NYC is minimal with the attached restaurant Butters, getting a much higher billing and presence. We booked through an internet booking site and went for the low price posted. Little did we know that the low price room, of which I believe there are many at this hotel, is a fairly small room with, hold on, a small bed. My wife, travelling with me, and I are not big people by any means (Asian sized to put in a nutshell) and we could not see ourselves getting a decent night's sleep packed into that bed. So buyer beware. We complained that we'd never seen such a small bed in a hotel room in N. America, Europe yes where the rooms are even smaller, but that's expected, not in the US! When taken the matter to the front desk soon after we saw the room, the hotel did help us out to our satisfaction. But we should not have to go through this.Who ever made the executive decision to order those small beds made the wrong decision as this does not endear the hotel's clients to the hotel for future visits. Perhaps they thought most clients using this size of room would be a single person as it's definitely not a two person room and the hotel should make that known if they know there will be two occupants.Otherwise the hotel is pretty straight forward. Modern though minimal black lobby (why are so many boutique hotels going this route? An Architect myself, the idea is great if it is handled well, but not many do including Cassa Hotel.)Minimal closet space, bathroom was adequate though some of the silver leaf on the illuminated vanity mirror was coming off - don't see that much.And the hotel name is the same as another unrelated hotel on 9th Avenue. Surely one of the two parties should have avoided this problem which will no doubt lead to upset customers.

I booked this hotel based on reviews and price. The hotel was very clean and the rooms and bathroom were of a very good size. I took my parents with me and we were given rooms on different floors. I did not query this at the time but should have done. I found the lifts and passage way to the rooms very dark. I decided to pay extra to have breakfast included to make it easier for my parents. Breakfast is served in the restaurant called Butters which is in the basement. Again there was hardly any light. We were usually the only 4 people there. Although the breakfast tasted fine it was repetitive and limited in choice. I am not sure if I could have eaten for less in an outside cafe so overall it served its purpose. The location is excellent. Times Square and 5th Avenue was very close by. It was very easy to walk around from the hotel. Overall I had a very good stay.

Great hotel in a great location on 45th street just east of 6th Avenue. Well appointed rooms with excellent bedding including some of the best mattresses I've ever slept on.Price is fantastic considering the hotel quality, service and location.Only downside is no pay movies, or in room minibar.Overall a solid 4 star hotel at 3 star prices. Go and stay you won't be disappointed!

Fantastic staff and location made our 2 week stay SO awesome! All the staff were extremely friendly, helpful and knowledgeable and couldn't do enough for us. Clean room, comfortable bed, gorgeous bathroom and shower made the wife very happy! The location is so central but remarkably quiet, we couldn't have been happier! Many thanks again to all.

I stayed here for 3 nights (4 days) through work this past week. I cannot say enough about how helpful the staff were, how clean my room was, how I was never interrupted by noise, how centrally located this hotel is. A special shout out to Tara who has the best personality of all of the ladies at the front desk! I feel like I don't need to elaborate on this hotel and can simply say - book this hotel and you won't be disappointed.

We came for a Mother's day Family Gathering from all over Canada.Grandma, Teens and Pre -Teens and we had a fabulous stay.We are frequent travellers and I have to say this hotel has the fastest elevators ever and the best showers.Everything was a hidden gem.From the best sofa bed, to thoughtfully laid out cabinetry to spacious bathroom to the best beds and linens.We stayed in a Junior King suite and it slept 3 comfortably and my sister stayed in a double double with her pre -teens.The Junior suite had a separate sitting area and the bedroom window opened.The location was within walking distance to all the sites yet far enough away from the noise of Time Square. We didn't even use the subway although it was close by.Bus terminal us 10min walk. Along with Time Square, Rockefeller, Fifth Ave, Empire State Building, and more.As aside,they set out nice umbrellas in the lobby for us to use when rain was in the forecast.I would highly recommend this hotel- Jr King suite.Clean. Spacious in all the right places and efficient.Stayed in lots of different places in Manhattan and this has to be one of the very best.Thanks Cassa 45 !

The lobby staff was great, very attentive and assisted with parking as the usual Casa parking facility was full. This is a small hotel, a little cramped from the lobby to the hallways but the rooms is standard size-ish, maybe a little on the smaller side but the decorators did well with the furniture to maximize the space. The invested in the bathrooms though, they were great. The hotel is not next to a park or a major landmark and is in the middle of the block so the view are not great from the hotel room. The staff was quick to full room request such as a new iron, and provided good food recommendations in the area. I would stay again.

We were nervous booking a hotel in NYC at such a reasonable price because you never really know what you're going to get and other hotels in the same price range looked very questionable. We picked this hotel because the reviews were positive and the location was exactly what we were looking for. The room was clean and surprisingly spacious. The king bed was comfortable although the pillows were a little soft for my taste. I can't really speak about the view so much but let's face it, it's in the city....you'll see buildings. The shower was great. Our room had a rainfall shower head, the pressure was excellent and we never ran out of hot water. There is no ice machine at the hotel but if you call the front desk, they'll deliver a bucket of ice to you immediately. The fridge in the room (you may have to call and request one) is small but big enough to hold some soda or water. They have breakfast buffet available at an additional charge. It's actually provided by the restaurant next door. The hotel also has car service to the airport. For $55 (tax and tip included), you can easily schedule a ride to the airport. We weren't coming in from the airport so I'm not sure if they provide airport pick-up as well.The staff at the hotel was amazing. They were very courteous and responded quickly to anything we needed. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and cannot wait for a return visit!

Great location, clean rooms, friendly staff, but it's just lacking that little something to make it truly special. Some amenities, even small ones, would be nice. My first stay there was a continental breakfast but this most recent stay that was not the case. A colleague and I tried to find space to sit and work, and that proved difficult as well with no real lobby area of common space. On both visits the wifi strength was also less than desirable. All that said, I'd likely stay again if the price was right as it's a good value or a funky and unique property.

Lovely hotel in an excellent position for everything. Staff were all really nice and extremely helpful. We had a split stay, taking in 3 days in Washington during the week, the Cassa stored a case for us while we were away at no extra cost and both the hotel rooms we stayed in were very clean and furnished lovely. We were very happy with our stay and would definitely recommend and use again ourselves.

The Cassa hotel on the 45ft is very well located. 5 min walking from Time square, 15 from the Empire and Central Park, 2 fron Park Avenue. The staff is friendly and always available to give indications or solve an issue. We did not try the restaurant and the breakfast, a little too expensive, but in line with the prices of Manhattan. This is anyway not a problem because all around the hotel it is full of places where to have a traditional and not American breakfast for reasonable price (i.e. The Red Flame on the 44th). Furthermore in the reception during the morning is available tee and coffee for free. We recommend to ask for a room to a high floor, because the traffic in NYC never stops. Our room was also big with a large shower. The wifi was free unlimited and with a very good signal and speed.

So before you book, make sure that it's the correct Cassa Hotel; it turns out that there are two and you might see the same pictures for both online. I, for one, am not a rookie but should've definitely done a little more research. I booked it last minute as a weekend getaway. It turns out that this one doesn't have a jacuzzi on the rooftop as I expected...major letdown but rather than that...Great location which is a major plus and the staff was amazing, as well as friendly (none of that New York attitude you might expect). I really, really appreciated them letting us borrow a nice umbrella when it was pouring outside. Rooms were very spacious and had very comfy beds. So yeah, if you can score a good price here and not going just to stay in the rooms, it is a good place to stay for its prime location.

The hotel is on 45th West between 5th and 6th avenue. I had a standard room on the 11th floor. The room was nice and clean with a very big bathroom. The TV had full HD channels via Direct TV. There was a Pret a Manger right below the hotel and you can order breakfast from it via room service menu directly. The hotel also had a gym that I didn't use. The room had a fridge and a locker. The Butter restaurant had a full bar and good lunch and dinner menu. There was also a Starbucks and loads of restaurants and cafes around so never short of eating options. Iron and Coffee maker was not there in the room but house keeping did deliver the iron when I asked for it. There was coffee at the reception area. Overall it's a good place to stay and I will certainly recommend it to all business travelers.

My husband and I are enjoying a four night stay at the Cassa. We are regular visitors to this wonderful city and have stayed here a couple times before. The location is excellent, close to everything. The rooms are spacious, very clean and the beds are comfy. The shower is lovely, my only complaint is lack of counter space and towel rack in the bathroom. There is a Pret de Manger cafe next door with yummy warm treats and great oatmeal for breakfast! This is a great place to stay in New York City.

This is the best experience in New York City, very good service, nice room, good customer service and complementary wine and cheese. Near to all nyc attractions and best of all very competitive prices. Definitely the best place to stay in the big apple.
user_name:
relaxeatdrink
New York City, New York

review_body: I have been in nyc for many times.. stayed in many places... in my opinion, this is the best hotel. The guys from the front desk were very attentive. They solved all my problems. It is a very brand new hotel. Very comfortable and clean. Quiet... it is near Bryant Park and Times Square... and you can't listen noise.They keep my bags at no charge... The only thing that I didn't like was the breakfast that was not so good.. there was just one option of bread (one cold and stiff bagel).

Our room was over a bar below that was very noisy and we did have to complain a few times so this did spoil the stay a little especially when you have been sightseeing all day and you just want to sleep when you get back to your room. Hotel was basic in facilities as we couldn't even get breakfast when we arrived but it was very centrally located, for our short stay and what we paid it was okay but probably not one I will go back to again

This place is near all my favorite restaurants in midtown and I love staying here any night I know I am going out in the city. I live in Jersey so anytime I want to splurge and have a fun night out, this is the best place- so central to everything.
user_name:
Colleen H
New York City, New York

review_body: Newly renovated hotel, nice location, decent sized room. Surprisingly huge bathroom. Loved the rain shower. Nice mattress. Courteous staff... what else does one need. The entrance looked shady so I was about to walkaway and cancel my reservation. But the guy at the door convinced me to go upstairs to the reservation (due to renovation). I did and glad I found a place in the middle of everything and still away from noise.

Great spacious room on the 12th floor. street noise is not noticable when windows are closed. nice refreshments at lobby. affordable rate due to a short lived sale.Lobby is not very big. friendly and helpful staff.

this is a hotel I would visit again - the rooms are tiny but newly renovated which is a plus. The bathroom is surprisingly big though. they have nice touches like free coffee and tea in the morning at the foyer and hot chocolate and cookies in the afternoon. Staff are friendly and there is an excellent restaurant, Butter on the premises.Just one caveat- we got a good rate but were staggered to find out that it did not include housekeeping - so no cleaning and fresh towels! Must check your rate!

Spent four nights at the Cassa Hotel in April whilst in NY for business. The experience from start to finish was great. Excellent service at the front desk. Room was small but well equipped and clean. The hotel is well located. Rate was good. I wont hesitate to return when next back in New York.

Great place to stay loved the service the area was great and very close to everything. 2 blocks from time square. Walking distance to central park, Empire state building and grand central station. Overall great stay and I will deff be back.

My daughter took me on a trip to NYC to see Hamilton on Broadway so we were looking for a hotel close to the theatre. We came across the Cassa Hotel and I'm so glad we did! This hotel is in the heart of Time Square. The rooms were beautiful! The amenities were top notch. But honestly the staff was our favorite part! They were so friendly and helpful and truly paid attention to all our needs. We actually missed them when we left! 100% recommend this hotel and we will not stay anywhere else when visiting NYC!

Couple stayed 3 nights at this convenient hotel 2 blocks from Times Square. The staff was friendly, and the room was clean and comfortable. There is a fine restaurant below the lobby which is also worth trying.Free wi-fi would be an improvement. We recommend this place.

This place is a little jewel. The rooms are larger than most in NY, and the location is fantastic. It's a no frills spot, but the restaurant next door (Butter) is quite good. What makes this place so special is their guest services. They are miles above other hotels. The front desk is warm, inviting and helpful. I had to ask what sort of training they went through and learned that there isn't anything special that they all just enjoy interacting with guests. I'd highly recommend this for business and tourist alike.

I have just spent my fourth stay in this hotel. I usually go to NYC every April. Prices of this hotel are really reasonable for Manhattan. Excellent location. It is between fifth and sixth avenue. Next to a Pret-a-Manger (always need to give taxi drivers this info so that they find the hotel). Really quiet and super comfortable beds. Staff are very friendly and helpful. I needed an iron and it was delivered to me right away. They do not have a coffee maker in the room but the coffee in the lobby is really warm and good. Really excellent place. I am almost sorry to write this review! Don´t want the place to become too popular...

A lovely hotel in a great area. Front of house staff were excellent, our rooms werent ready when we arrived after stated check in time and they kindly gave our group free wifi for our 4 day stay. The room was of a good size with a large bedroom. Coffee was served in reception in the morning and during the afternoon this was replaced with hot chocolate. There were several coffee shops in the same street so very handy for breakfast. The hotel also offered Butters restaurant, we didnt use this but it looked lovely and was always busy. Would definitely stay here again

From the moment I walked in this hotel I know I was onto a winner.......The staff were friendly and helpful and made me feel very welcome and I was placed in one of their very roomy suites. By NY standards this was a palace, with a good sized living room, large bedroom and bathroom and big TVs in each room. I was on the 11th floor facing the street, but there was basically no street noise, which makes this room even more impressive! The location is about as good as you can get for midtown, with access to Times Square, Bryant Park and Herald Square and the subway within a short walk, while avoiding the pain being right in the thick of it.The only downside of this hotel is the lack of room service (apart from limited service from the deli close by)Even with a bunch of good hotels within a short distance, this is a great choice and I will definitely stay here again. Excellent!

Very happy with the hotel, Great location only a 5 minute walk from Times square and main subway lines and staff very friendly on the few times we had to use them, would definitely stay here again should i go back.

Perfectly located, but at the same time away from the busy Time Square. Very friendly staff. The rooms were spacious and clean. We did not experience any inconviniences with the renovation. Will absolutely reccomend it anyone visiting New York.

We spent a month in this apartment on the 42nd floor. The view is absolutely breathtaking night and day. The staff are exceptionally helpful and polite!Tha place is spotless, very confortable beds, kitchen well equipped. The location is very good, 3 minutes from Time Square, from Bryant Park, from metro stops. Lots of bars, restaurants around, very close to the Theatre District and 10 minutes from Central Park.

I had some minor trouble to find it but no big issue. This hotel is very good. The staff, room, breakfast were very good. The water in the lobby is free of charge. But it's not so suprising in NY. Wifi fast but check your bill. Wifi was added to mine although it shoudn't be. But quickly resolved with the receptionist.

This hotel is in a fantastic location. Central for most peoples top places to visit, 15 minutes walk from Central Park, 2 minutes from Times Sq., 10 minutes from Top of the Rock. Staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are to a great standard. They don't have their own bar but there is one down stairs. That said there are plenty of places to go for a drink or meal within a few minutes stroll.

We had a fantastic stay at the Cassa Hotel 45th street in April. Although the lobby was being renovated the staff were very accomodating and welcoming on our arrival especially Lendel who dealt with all our needs. We had a lovely large and very clean room and the location was perfect for our first trip to New York. A special mention to Sam the bellman who went out his way to make us feel welcome. He even waited for our transfer taxi in the pouring rain and came up to get us on its arrival. He then took us to the taxi under the cover of his umbrella. 5 star service and a credit to the company. Thank you and we hopefully will have the opportunity to visit again.

I just got back from a trip to NYC with my mom and daughter. We stayed one night at the Cassa Hotel and we were very impressed. The room was very clean, the beds were comfortable and we had no complaints. What really put our experience over the edge was the staff at the hotel. Everyone we had interaction with was so friendly and helpful. They didn't have the room we requested available due to an issue but they were able to get us an even better setup than what we had reserved. They answered any questions we had and were so friendly to my 4-year old daughter. I would absolutely stay here again. Your staff is amazing which is what really makes for a great guest experience!

From the moment we arrived to the moment we left the staff were so polite attentive and genuinely helpful. We were upgraded at no extra cost and had a lovely card and chocolates left in our room as it was for a special birthday. Not only was there free tea and coffee in the morning but they also provided a coffee maker at no extra charge. The room was clean and tidy and the pillows were the most comfortable I have ever slept on. The hotel is close to all the major attractions, so all in all a brilliant first time in New York. Thank you cassa !!

Highly recommend this hotel .....very pleased with hotel staff, room and location very close to Times Square as well as walking distance so many things! Brett and all the staff at front desk very pleasant and helpful with recommendations of places to eat (The Red Flame diner around corner). Room was a executive King ....nice and comfortable. Went with friends ...their room next to ours but a nice feature keyed exterior door to hall so you could close that and leave your doors open would be great for families with children. Would definitely stay again .......a real gem of a luxury hotel (find a deal thru trip advisor making it that much better)!
user_name:
Earl and Ginger W
Westminster, Maryland

review_body: the room was small ,but perfect for one and quiet. Convenient location to Times Square and 5th avenue. There is no coffee maker in the room, but they serve coffee and tea in the lobby during morning hours. The staff is very helpful. I will be back!

We where really pleased with this hotel, the room was very confortable, very quite, we had nice views to the street. All new and very clean. The staff is extremely helpful, and the hotel is one street to Times Sqaure and two to Rokefeller Centre. 5 minutes to the metro. Near all, you can also walk 10 minutes to the Empire State. Nothing bad to say about it.

I stayed here 5 nights for business and had a great time. The hotel is well located, two blocks from Times Square between 5th and 6th avenue. The hotel is small and tall, the rooms are good but New York sized. The beds are comfortable. Views depend on what side you look at. Would recommend it to everyone.

This hotel has a very good location. Close to a station, close to Times Square and 5th Avenue. The Hotel is very modern. The attendants are very attentive. The room is good for a couple with two large luggages. The apartment are very small, but is very, very comfortable. The apartments have a well furnished, the bathroom is excellent and cleanliness is also excellent.It was a great stay.

We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights during April. Our room was much bigger than expected. It was lovely and clean and we loved the free tea and coffee in the morning. The location is great and the staff are just so helpful. We would definitely recommend.

Good and clean room. The hotel close to Times Square and to 42th subway station that can take you almost everywhere. The front desk staff are very friendly especially Jonathan! He is an asset to the hotel. He was so kind , friendly, and willing to help. He is the main reason that I'll come back to this hotel and I'll recommend it to others. He made out of staying in Cassa hotel a one to remember!

This is my third stay at in new York, all at different hotels. The Cassa hotel is by far the best hotel I've stayed in yet. The concierge team were polite and professional and always happy to help. Our room was on the fourth floor but this had no impact on sleeping conditions as i didn't hear a peep from the road below. The room was spacious and bathroom was also a decent size. The shower was also amazing! The fitness room on the 10th floor was excellent and keeps you ticking over nicely and makes you feel a little bit better about all the amazing new York food you're consuming.One downside which wasn't really an issue i'm just being fussy is that we booked the hotel through hotels.com. when booking there was no mention that it was special low cost deal which meant we would have no room maintenance, i.e fresh towels and have the room tidied and bed made.This wasn't a big deal really as my wife does all that stuff anyway probably better than the maid would but hey ho sometimes these are nice luxuries to have. A few areas of improvement for me is that as I am a Brit i love my Tea, the hotel only offers a complimentary tea and coffee service in the morning. However if i had asked in the evening i'm sure they probably would've been happy to help. I would recommend it if the tea and coffee service was available throughout the day.Complimentary wifi was also included which was a nice bonus however at times it was quite slow so you wont be able to stream movies etc but it served the purpose if you just wanted to check whats-app or Facebook.Upon checking out again the concierge team were excellent, we had a late flight so we needed to leave our bags at the hotel. they did this free of charge which was nice as other hotels have charged me for this service.I will definitely be returning to the hotel. its location was about a 5 minute walk from times square but secluded from the mad rush of the tourists! Hopefully when i return there will be more tea!

I stayed hear late last year while I was visiting friends, it was a last minute thing and it looked the best deal. Got a junior suite for a very reasonable price for New York. Stayed for 5 days and enjoyed my time here, The front desk people were very friendly and helpful as to the best way to get to specific attractions. The room was very large not just for New York standards but just overall large which was very nice to have to finish off my visit and it had a nice apartment feel to it instead of a hotel which is usually busy and cluttered. Great location near Times Square, Empire State and shopping. Overall I had a great stay and would stay hear again if I didn't want to experience a different neighbourhood in the city and wanted to stay central.

We loved staying at the Cassa 45 Street! This modern hotel is in a perfect location - ideal for both walking and using the subway. The rooms are very comfortable and the contemporary bathroom is surprisingly spacious. We spent six nights at the hotel and enjoyed the warm and personal welcome from the staff making us feel at home. The free coffee, tea and apples in the lobby in the mornings and hot chocolate in the afternoon was an added bonus. We'll be back!

Stayed for 4 nights with my wife. Check in was smooth and greeted with a warm smile. Room was spacious with the most comfortable bed, just what's needed after a day of exploring NYC. Great location just off Times Square. Rooms are so well insulated,couldn't hear any street noise at all. All staff polite and smiley. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Hotel left chocolates and Card for my wife which was a really nice touch. Thank you

I travel for work and "live" in hotels basically and this hotel is great. I have stayed in many hotels in NYC but now only stay here when coming to Manhattan. Rooms are large for NYC and very quiet. Most NYC rooms, you hear the TV in room next to you and the person above you walking around, not here. Decent gym and very friendly staff that remembers your name. Close to Central Park and Times Square. I always enjoy coming back to the Cassa after a long day.

This hotel is great, it's extremely close to everything lovely clean rooms, and super helpful staff who cannot do enough for you.I checked in late night/early morning so worried that this may have been an issue, I phoned ahead and Patrick at the desk said this would be fine. When I arrived, check-in was nice and smooth. Patrick was great and gave me directions as to where I could grab some food at that crazy time of the morning.I didn't have much more interaction given that I was working an awful lot however I was always enthusiastically greeted as I entered and left the Hotel.I had a large spacious room, there were no Iron or tea making facilities in the room however this was immediately remedied by calling reception.I had a late flight home however I checked out at 12pm and was able to store my baggage which was amazing and allowed for more shopping.I would 100% stay here again!

I stayed at the Cassa about 4 years ago when it was very new and had sort of forgotten about it. The signage is small and discreet. I'm so glad I re-discovered this gem! Rooms are so quiet and comfortable. The location can't be beat. And the bathroom -- pure luxury. This is now my go-to hotel when I'm traveling in NY for business.

Efficient friendly checkin. Room exactly what you need in NewYork. Clean, warm and a great comfy bed.Some might complain about the size but we both felt it was adequate, after all, how much time DO u spend in your room?The free tea, coffee, hot chocolate and fruit in reception, were very welcome. Great access to all the hot spots. Would highly recommend this Hotel.

Rooms are quiet and could use an update (especially the carpet) and overall more light (why do design hotels often aim for low lights), bathrooms was nice and modern ´though.WLAN was quite slow. Breakfast and its selection in the adjoining building was overall a joke: no service (there was really no one there) and low-quality scrambled egg, bagel (no toaster which would have been great) and coffee were not good.Gym is small, but okay (could use a mat for exercises like Yoga or situps).As for all hotels in this area/location in NYC rooms are quite pricey, this is why I am mentioning these things. Always look for bargains/special offers.Service/concierge (Jonathan) were great, thanks again.

We checked in Sunday morning. The staff at the reception desk were extra friendly, very nice. We felt very welcomed. They gave us all the information we needed. The rooms were nice and very clean. I sprained my ankle on Monday night and asked if they had an ice machine to get ice. The gentleman offered to bring up an ice pack for me.... they ran out of ice packs so they brought up a bucket of ice which I was very thankful for, however their kindness did not stop there....to my surprise they went to the store and came back with brand new packs of ice packs and brought that to my room as well. I couldn't have been more appreciative. Thanks again to everyone! Now back to the hotel, the location is amazing, steps away from Time Square. Overall it's one of my best experiences in New York, will definately return and recommend to friends and family. Thank you for an amazing stay!

The location was excellent, just what we wanted. The bed was comfortable and the room had a large bathroom and great shower. Iron, ironing board, extra bath robe were all supplied quickly when requested.However there was no storage space beyond a narrow hanging rail in the wardrobe. We arrived with clothes for a 6 day trip. My daughter unpacked onto the floor, I unpacked onto the desk. There was no downstairs entrance/reception due to refurbishment which apparently had been ongoing since February but no-one communicated to us until we arrived to what looked like a derelict building. The seedy side entrance and narrow corridors were far from the 'boutique' experience described on the hotel website - it felt like we were entering a block of residential flats.We were checked in at approx 11 pm and given no printed receipt or acknowledgement and told that we had to authorise a 75$ a day security 'deposit' which would be returned on check out (assuming no damage or charges - for what?). That was 450$ for our 6 day stay! I received no satisfactory explanation for this requirement, again not communicated prior to arrival, despite asking twice to see a manager ("no-one available"). On check out, after asking again, I was given a print out which refers to Additional Charges without actually specifically mentioning 75$.There was no hotel bar - the restaurant bar closed at 10.30 with the restaurant. No mini bar (although an empty one was placed in the wardrobe using up valuable storage space) and no room service. No TV instructions, no hotel directory with local sights, hotel facilities etc etc (just a pamphlet), and the room, although large, was very dingy although apparently recently revitalised.

Stayed at Cassa for 6 nights to visit New York and celebrate my partners 50th birthday. Requested good view and quiet location and they met both requests. Room was Executive King and was fab. Bed - huge and very comfortable. Room service came every day and made bed, clean towels etc which was a lovely surprise as only expected maybe every other day. Staff were amazing. They sent a card and gift to our room my partner's birthday which we thought was lovely. Hotel location was the best, being approx 20 meters from 6th Ave, and Times Square being on 7th Ave - one block walk and just right distance away from noise located in that area. Subway stations close by although we walked everywhere first 3 days (recommend metro card for unlimited use). Sound of taxis honking horns take some getting used to when out and about but we had best time ever !

During our visit the reception area was undergoing complete restoration and was relocated on the 11th floor, this had no effect on us as all the hotel staff made our visit as comfortable as could be.The bar/restaurant in the basement was of a high standard as the prices reflect, but this was usual for the area.The hotel is situated between 5th & 6th Avenues, and only a stones throw from Times Square. We were able to walk quite easily to Central Park and different metro stations are easily accessible for going further afield ( downtown, Brooklyn etc).All in all this was a great base from which to explore Manhatten, and would stay again if ever in the area.

Very close to Times Square. Extremely comfortable to rest after a long day in NYC. Staff friendly and ready to help. Very silent and with excellent beds. Roomy bathrooms. Very good time/value in midtown NY.

First class hotel in a brilliant location for theaters ,restaurants , and shops and the staff are so polite and friendly really made our stay in New York so pleasant.Our stay was so enjoyable we're considering returning later in the year it was that good.

We loved the location. The rooms was quite modern, the bed was great. The elevators can be busy sometimes but hey we are in NYC ! The concierge was very helpful. Will return to this hotel next time for sure!

Stay at Cassa as often as I can when in NYC for business/pleasure....always a great time and so close to everything. Awesome staff, great rooms and amenities. Restaurant downstairs a huge +, will definitely be back!
user_name:
Kiel B
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at the Cassa Hotel around Thanksgiving last year. Having never been to New York before, we wanted a hotel in a central location where we could explore most local attractions on foot, and this certainly delivered!The hotel is just around the corner from Times Square - far enough away to not be too noisy, but only about a five minute walk from the hotel. There are also loads of subway stations nearby - the station at Times Square can take you to most of the tourist attractions quickly and easily! It's also about a 15-20 minute walk from Central Park too, which makes the location even more ideal.The room itself was fantastic - we were upgraded to a Super King size room with super fast wifi. The bed was honestly the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in (but maybe that was because of all the walking!). There is also a large power shower in the bathroom, along with hairdryer, dressing gown, slippers, and shower gel and shampoo. The room also has a large screen TV which is perfect when you need to relax after a long day!They also offer take-out coffee for free in reception each morning!The staff are really friendly and will do anything they can to help - the hotel porter spent about 20 minutes trying to flag us down a taxi to Newark airport on our departure (tip: if you're heading to Newark in rush hour, book in advance as not many are willing to take you that far in rush hour!)We actually got engaged while we were in New York, and the hotel surprised us with a congratulations card, box of handmade chocolates and some fizzy water in the room which was a really lovely touch!Overall, we highly recommend staying here - it's the perfect location for exploring New York and really good value for money if you book early!

My husband and I recently stayed here over the Easter weekend for 5 days / 4 nights. As many reviews have mentioned they are currently renovating the entrance but that doesn't affect your stay, we were greater at the door by a smiling face and warm welcome. From there on in everything was excellent. Staff can't do enough to make you feel welcome, always smiling and happy. The room was a good size for NYC and the bathroom was amazing, large walk in shower, trendy and modern fittings. The only small complaint I have was slight lack of storage space but for 5 days we made it work. One of the biggest things I noticed was that the hotel's sound proofing is without doubt the best I have ever experienced in any hotel I've stayed in. We never heard any noice at all, and our room was just across from the stairs and the elevator. ...truly amazing ! The hotel is located in the perfect location to walk to most of NYCs hilights, great restaurants and bars all within short walking distance . It really couldn't get much better. If we come back to the city again this would be my choice of hotel in a heartbeat. Highly recommended

This is a good hotel, large size rooms, in a prime location. But their "free WIFI" has a very slow internet connection in order to encourage you to buy the "premium" in 15$ or so. I didn't like it. Also, they had what looks like as a false-positive fire alarm in 7AM and we all waked up. All in all, a good hotel, but could be better.

When we arrived, there was some confusion as to how to get in the hotel entrance. There was a sign stuck in the door with an arrow pointing to the restaurant 'butter' located underneath the hotel but initially we felt a bit panicked as it looked shut down. We found some staff when we entered to show us the temporary reception as the real lobby was being refurbished. There is usually staff outside, so they are making an effort to help you and direct you, but it was confusing initially as we'd missed them. It's almost complete now, so you probably won't have this issue. The staff were very friendly and helpful.Free tea and coffe every morning in the reception on floor 11. Free wifi too.hot chocolate and cookies at 3.30 each day I think. The room was clean and adequate. Great shower, but no bath. Views of street. No that noisy, as Windows kept most of the sound out. We were on floor 6. Huge telly in room, but limited programmes, not that you go to NYC to watch telly anyway! The restaurant/bar 'butter' looked lovely, but be warned, a wine and a small spirit cost just under $40!! Total rip off. Needless to say, we couldn't afford nice evenings drinking in the bar here. We found other bars that were reasonable. The best part of staying at the cassa, was the really, kind, friendly and helpful staff. All of them were great with no exception. Nothing is too much for them. They even intervened to help us when we are having trouble with the transfer company who collected and dropped us at the hotel. The concierge called Expedia to help us out. They gave us advice, maps and insider info to help us enjoy our hols. We really felt well looked after. There is a great diner down the road called the flame red diner-turn left out the front door onto 6th avenue, then left again on to 44th street. Great prices, not overly touristy and totally yummy. Also pret a manger on 45th street who do porridge, hot breakfast wraps etc. Overall, great hotel, pity about refurb, but nothing major, and staff more than made up for this.

My partner and I stayed for 5 nights and were in New York to get married. The hotel staff were amazing, answered all questions and queries we had before arriving and gave us exceptional service during our stay. Our room was even upgraded! The hotel itself is great, smart, clean, decorated well and the location was perfect for us as first time visitors. We will definitely stay again and will be recommending the hotel to family and friends too. We didn't want to leave!

Absolute gem of a hotel. Perfect location, Times Square and Rockefeller Centre are just a few minutes walking distance. We had a room on the 27th floor, large comfy bed, large bathroom with huge walk in shower overlooking Times Square, toiletries, huge TV, very clean and spacious. All the staff are lovely, very helpful and accommodating, never pass by you without saying hello. The lobby is under renovation at the moment but never caused us any problems and there was no noise. Perfect stay, we will definitely return to this hotel next NYC trip!!

I knew construction was going on before I booked, but reviews convinced me this was the place for me, especially when I saw that it was located close to one of my favorite places to grab lunch: Cranberry Deli. Who cares about a little inconvenience when you are on a "quiet" street and within walking distance to the theater district and so many other attractions, not to mention a fairly competitive rate? I have to say that the Junior Suite (room 505 with a comfy roll-away)) more than met expectations for my husband, adult daughter, and me. It was so quiet that we thought we were the only people on the hall until we finally heard the maid outside of the room one day. We NEVER heard street noise either (room faced inner courtyard so no "view") when we were in the room which was basically from about 11:30pm - 10:30 am. So, a nice CLEAN, QUIET, and adequately sized room in a terrific location---Some have complained about room size and closet space--geez people-- Cassa offers any size room you could want---pick the right one for you and don't complain! Also we had a mini refrigerator and Keurig coffee maker. We asked for ice and towels on two separate occasions and both were promptly delivered. NEVER A PROBLEM WITH ELEVATORS during our 3 night stay. What else could you want? Oh yeah, helpful and friendly staff: Sam, Jonathan, Jason, Nixon, Lynelle, Patrick and others (who unfortunately I cannot name) were all SUPER, despite the inconvenience of construction and check-in/check-out, etc. I have stayed at the Marriott Marquis, Milford, Shelburne and Fitzpatrick Manhattan on Lexington Ave and the staff at Cassa were the best! Hope to make a return visit one day to see the new lobby AND visit with the friendly staff.

Booked this hotel for celebration of our 20th anniversary.On arrivel it was a bit confusing because the entrence was under reconstruction. Had some worries about how it would be. Went up to the temporay reception and got a good reception. Friendly and happy staff. Got our room and it was clean and fresh. A bit small but that i already knew.Will proberly do a revisit to this hotel. It was close to all things we wanted to see. Regards!/CB

We were in for a romantic weekend in NYC, taking in a couple of shows and heading to a wedding. I found Cassa on booking.com, and it was very reasonably priced for a king-sized bed. Once we arrive, we almost missed it--the lobby is being redone, so the entrance is somewhat utilitarian--you enter via the staff entrance, head down a back hall, and take the elevators to the 11th floor where the temporary lobby is set up. There was a bellman at the door to guide us initially, otherwise we would never have found it.The current lobby was a converted room. The staff was very helpful, and checked us in promptly (and gave us some restaurant advice). There is a lounge with always-on coffee and tea.We went up to our room, which was very clean. There was plenty of storage space, and the bathroom was excellent-sized with a view of Times Square. The shower was very large, with a large shower head and decent pressure and water and the whole bathroom was very clean, with nice amenities. The TV was fine, and we were able to access wifi. If I had a complaint (and I don't know if we were in a particular corner), but the building had a lot of internal noises during the night. It did not keep me from sleeping, but you could hear intermittent sounds. We had a very pleasant time--very centrally located, a short walk to all our activities, a friendly staff and a clean room, all at a very good value.

Me and my boyfriend have just returned from our first trip to New York staying in the Cassa, not a bad word to say about the place! The staff were so lovely, friendly and extremely helpful! Our room was also lovely, bed was SO comfortable, bathroom was clean, lush shower!! Location was incredible! In between 5th avenue and times square, perfect! Had the most amazing time in the city, will definitely be back to stay at Cassa! Thank you for an amazing stay!

Where to start...? For avoidance of doubt, I don't blame the staff as they were generally very courteous during our stay - over accommodating, not exactly, but then again it's not a 5* property on Columbus Circle, but I've had more genuine (authentic/caring) service at less rated hotels. They really should hand you a hard hat and map when you check-in, that is after you wind through two elevators and a staircase and end up in a makeshift check-in suite. The disclaimer about the construction in the lobby impairs your stay more than the management will claim to admit. The room, well, underwhelming and a bit of an afterthought is likely the best way to encapsulate the atmosphere. A standalone armoire is jammed between the column and the window, which can barely hold enough garments for one person for a three night stay. The carpet has an obnoxious pattern which reminds me of a midrange hotel room in Vegas - which as we know is more about hiding stains then embracing a design motif. Is the room clean, yes, more or less - but I've stayed at three star properties which are cleaner and better maintained. The room is a bit worn down. The USB jacks are dusty, the electric outlets on desk had broken jack covers, and the room just felt a bit raked over. The bed, in general, not bad for a good night sleep. Clean crisp starched linens - definitely not Frette, likely 300 thread count. They don't use a full duvet cover, so the super thin down comforter, likely less fill than the lightest puffer coat you own, has a tendency to come undone during the night. In fact, my comforter had dried blood stains from a prior guest; however, in all fairness the housekeeping promptly gave me a new, clean, comforter. Housekeeping, only praises - room was tidy and clean every night we returned. My only complaint was the room did show many signs of wear that needed more than a bottle of Windex to resolve. If the room followed the decor of the bathroom it would be a much better "room". Except for the cheap frames that encased the basin, the bathroom, shower, and toilet were a pleasant match of expectations. The bath amenities could be better, like the cheaper, yet comfortable towels. You feel the cheapness and the corner-cutting, but you don't let it bother your because the bathroom is bright, white, clean and the shower head rains water which puts you the sleep after a long day. Butter restaurant - One morning we decided to wind down the stairs into the dark basement - no host, very few people, and a self serve bar with granola (probably leftovers from some dinner dessert) and a carafe of coffee. We immediately left, said glad we didn't pay for breakfast, and had an excellent bagel and coffee from the kosher joint next store. The restaurant is drab, cold, and a bit cavern like. I can't comment on the food because we didn't even get to a host to seat us. The gym. Don't even bother using the five, cheap, home quality cardio machines - head straight to Equinox (which is free) and only a few blocks away. In summary, this is definitely no Viceroy. In fact, I think the company should split it off from their brand - in my view does more to hurt than to help. They management understates the impact of the construction. I'd rate this a 3.9 on a good day. It's NYC, others hotels strive harder for experience, guest, and decor. Putting an orchid by the entry to security lobby (which is the main entry of the hotel for now) doesn't negate the other flaws. If I didn't pay such a reasonably rate I'd be perturbed. Needless to say, please save the canned reply that was my last stay at this Cassa.

We have just retuned from a brilliant 5 night stay at the Cassa hotel. The hotel is modern, clean and does the job for a short stay. We felt extremely welcomed by the reception staff and they couldn't help enough with any enquiries regarding maps, directions and recommendations etc. It is a short walk from times square but when you get into the hotel you feel as if you've left it behind and it is very quiet once in your room. We were on floor 7 looking on to the road and still wasn't disturbed by any street noise and I slept really well for the duration of the trip. The lobby was under construction but that caused us no disruption and there was always someone on the door to assist or direct you. The hotel also offered complimentary tea/coffee and snacks in the reception, the free wifi worked perfectly whenever we used it, and the t.v offered a wide range of channels. I would most definitely stay here again if I am to visit New York and will be recommending it to friends.

I stayed here as I needed a place very close to my office (44th street) as it was a day after snow storm this January (Hotel is on 45th street + Avenues of America)....Now a bit about hotel: Really liked the vibe, front desk was really helpful. I got a room on the back side (Yeah you don't get lucky with street view everytime), room was a little tiny (New York duhh....)but layout was really nice, bed was comfortable. Bathroom didn't have a bath tum but a shower (though a nice one)... Only 2 issues I had with the hotel. 1. I hoped this price would have included Breakfast or reduce breakfast price. 2. Hotel is a non-smoking property but there was smell of cigarette smoke coming in my room for a few hours (I guess someone next room might be smoking).

Great location close to all the site's,do up grade to a better room as standard rooms have very small beds,unfortunately while we were there through the hotel foyer was being refurbished but the staff were excellent good hotel tea coffee and hot chocolate as well as delicious apples and cookies as it was room only

Our second visit to Cassa Hotel was quite a different experience. On the plus side, we got a better (larger Executive King room) which was very nice. On the downside, the hotel has an ongoing entrance and lobby construction (remodel) so the check-in is at a temporary space on the 10th floor. We also had to use a service entrance. Getting in and out required changing an elevator. Other than that, it was a nice stay. We like the modern and clean design of the room and the bathroom. Closet space is a bit small but it was OK for our short stay. Check-in was smooth although we witnessed an unhappy customer who was loudly expressed his displeasure for not having a room adjacent to his travel companion's. NYC has a lot of mid-tier hotels that do a good job. Cassa is one of the better ones. We'll be back to see and experience the nice new lobby once it is done.
user_name:
CliveNYC
West New York, New Jersey

review_body: The Cassa Hotel is ideally located to explore New York. Our room was large, comfortable and very quiet, despite the busy road outside. The reception and security staff were friendly and helpful and the room was very well maintained throughout our visit. The hotel was undergoing renovation of the front entrance during our visit and I look forward to returning again in the future to see the updated Cassa Hotel. Loved the coffee and cookies in reception!

I was really excited to stay here, having spent ages picking it out and emailing the staff to make sure everything was perfect. Then we arrived to find the lobby out of order and a maze of corridors, various elevators and a stair well have to be traversed every time you want to go anywhere. This was pretty frustrating, however the really disappointing bit was that this wasn't communicated before we booked. It wouldn't have put me off, but it would've annoyed me a lot less to know beforehand and be expecting it.The room itself was nice, the beds are great and the shower is lovely, however for our first two days we didn't receive any housekeeping, no fresh towels, nothing. In the end we had to go to the front desk just to get towels and the bin emptied. The guy there acted like it must have been done and we were just imagining it, but 20 minutes later, housekeeping arrived at 7pm and demanded to come in and wash the bathroom even though we were in the room and trying to take a nap. After that, we always returned to a freshly cleaned room but it was a bit disappointing to have to go through all of the above to get a basic and expected service. Otherwise, the location is fantastic and the rooms were nice and quiet.

I stayed here in February 2016, for four nights. As earlier reviews indicated, there is construction work happening at the hotel, which I wasn't aware of. Was very surprised and more than a little bit worried when we arrived and were escorted through a service entrance instead of a grand hotel lobby. Reception has temporarily relocated and we were assured that no construction noise could be heard in the rooms. This proved to be the case - we enjoyed four blissfully quiet nights in our king size room on the 23rd floor. The room was well-appointed, the bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom itself was bigger than some hotel rooms I've stayed in elsewhere in New York! We didn't have a great view but that was OK. The hotel is very well located, closer to 6th Avenue than 5th with a good number of restaurants and coffee shops nearby. We found the staff to be friendly and accommodating. Minor gripes were that our fridge wasn't really cold and the requested coffee-maker never materialised but despite this, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and would stay here again in a heartbeat!

I visited in March, 2016, when the lobby was under construction, so we had to enter through the service entrance, take an elevator to the 11th floor to check in, then take a different elevator down to our room. Construction should be over by the end of March, according to the hotel staff.Room was comfortable, but, although the site we made the reservation through promised a "city view" we were on the 6th floor, in the back, without much of a view of anything. Not really important, since we were not there to spend time in the room.Be prepared for limited closet space and drawer space for unpacking. But, the hotel is clean, comfortable and safe. Probably cannot do much better for the cost.

Really lovely hotel in a perfect location. One block from Times Square, which was under a minutes walk and a couple of streets from the Rockerfeller. Perfect if you want to be very close but not on top of the hustle and bustle. Rooms were clean and beautifully decorated, with all amenities you need including a hairdryer, shampoo, robe and a safe. Beware, there is a $6 charge for the bottles of water in the room!! No tea and coffee facilities in the room, but they did bring a tray when we asked and restocked it daily. Free and fast wifi in the room was a bonus! We found the reception staff to be quite rude and unhelpful, but we didn't come into contact with them often so it didn't bother us. The hotel is in the middle of a refurbishment, which we were not advised about prior to arrival and so we had to use a gloomy side staff door from the street, there is a make shift reception in one of the suites on the 11th floor and you have to get 2 separate lifts to get to the ground floor!! We would return for the location alone, and hope the staff had been given some customer service training!!

Great location. The junior suite s large and beautiful with an amazing bathroom. The "executive" room is quite nice as well. Every single person working there is super friendly and accommodating. One of my favorites in NYC!
user_name:
rocksinurhead
West New York, New Jersey

review_body: This hotel was a gem: spacious (by NYC standards, at least), well-appointed rooms, very friendly and helpful staff, excellent location. I'm eager to see what the renovated lobby looks like upon completion; will definitely be back.

We were there during a lobby rebuild, good, friendly and helpful staff. the rooms are not so large, good and comfortable bed no tea or coffee facilities, slow service for delivery help to room, could be due to lobby/elevator rebuild. room 2401 had a noisy air conditioner.The lobby, street access and room aren't as flamboyant as their internet impressions, great location and access for Broadway and Bryant's park areas.

The Cassa Hotel was a great experience for us. Perfectly located. Clean room/bathrooms. Nice staff.We stayed in the junior suite / 6th floor. Spacious for a NY hotel room. Value-for-money ratio was very fair. We would totally recommend this hotel to our family and friends.

We have been staying at this hotel for 3 nights in the first days of March. Unfortunately the lobby of the hotel was closed due to some renovation and we had to use a service entrance, including some issue while using the elevators due again to the ongoing renovation. Apart from this the hotel services and rooms were really good and clean. Included breakfast was a bit poor but sufficient for our needs, and all personnel always gentle and professional as you would expect.Position is perfect just a few steps from Times Square, and once renovation is ended I would definitely recommend this hotel.

My first impression of the hotel was not good as it was late at night, and I couldn't find the receiption area. They were remodeling the front entrance, and I entered through the Butter (a dining restaurant) door adjacent to the Cassa sign and walked haphazardly. In fact, there is a nondescript black door next to the Butter door, which leads directly to the Cassa elevators. It was confusing but upon the check-in, everyone was very friendly.I booked via hotwire for a good rate, but as such I didn't get any of their normal website rooms. And the guy was well versed. We got a standard size room, which he mentioned was slightly bigger than normal with a full-size bed. The full-size bed was small as expected but we adapted, and the room was small as well, but made use of the space. Everything was there, and no problems with the room itself. It had a nonexistent view of a nearby building. So the room was standard, and they need to clean the dust off of the top bedframe area. However, the rate is good but most of all the location is great. It's right at the midpoint, walkable distance to almost everything. Closest subway is south, where Bryant Park is (for ice skating needs until 3/6). East is the Grand Central Terminal. West is Times Square. North is the Rockefellar Center and Top of the Rock Observation. Northeast is 5th avenue and around a 20 min walk to the Northwest end of Central Park. So everything was pretty much walkable, as long as you are prepared to do so.Wifi was free, but at times slow. Parking, I read up was around $60 for valet. On 44th st, there is an Edison Parkfast, which I believe have much lower rates for February (within 5 minutes walk). And for load off and dropping, they have a small area, but since it's in a high traffic area, may be hard to drive around. So 100% do not suggest driving here whatsoever, took 20 minutes just to move 0.5 miles.So despite those slight faults, the service stood out. They didn't have ice, so they delivered it up. They didn't have a business center, so they printed it for us, just had to email them. And every single hotel staff was friendly. So that was a star to even out the minus star of the room.

If you didn’t know you were in Manhattan, the friendly service could be mistaken for southern charm. Extremely friendly and helpful staff in a perfect location. Outstanding value with efficient and clean rooms triangulated by Times Square, Grand Central and Rockefeller Center. Restaurants and bodegas nearby as are buses and subways. Hotel entrance is non ostentatious but definitely worth finding. Great stay!

The bed is Really smallNot what you expect for 4 star hotel as advertised. There is renovation, and instead of lobby the guests are invited to a side door and sign in in a converted room floor .I tried to contact the reception but they were not able to help.

I didn't receive the full experience at the Cassa hotel as it was under construction. However, service was wonderful. Adam brought us to our room and was extremely friendly and knowledgeable. the makeshift lounge was small and did offer hot chocolate in the afternoon and coffee in the morning. The room was very contemporary-- tiled shower with rain shower head. In fact, bathroom was rather large for a NYC hotel. King sized bed was comfortable and the plasma television was well situated and had lots of channels to pick from. Room also had built in closet, a minibar, and a nice desk with charging station. The nightstand also had Usb charging ports. The location of hotel was only a block away from Times Square. Really enjoyed my stay and looking forward to seeing the hotel's finished lobby.

The hotel room was very nice and I loved the 'rain' shower head in the bathroom. The front desk was always friendly, smiling, and helpful. Couldn't say enough about them, they were great. The location is close to Times Square and Grand Central = perfect for walking.

My husband and I were a little worried when we first walked up to the Cassa as their lobby is being renovated and we had to enter via an emplyee entrance. The lobby is temporarily located on the 11th floor in a hotel room. Once we checked in however, our doubts were erased. The staff are warm, friendly and helpful. The room was large, clean and smartly decorated. The bed, linens and pillow were very comfortable. The shower was fantastic with subway tile, glass doors, rainshower head and plenty of hot water. The towels and robe were fluffy and soft! Other amenities we enjoyed were the large screen t.v., in room safe and refrigerator. A few things I thought they could improve upon were the lack of magnifying mirror in the bathroom, ice bucket, iron, and no electrical outlets near the bed. Most of the things I mentioned probably would be available with a phone call, but for the few days we were there, I didn't bother. All in all a beautiful hotel at a great price.

We went to NYC to watch shows and this hotel was a 10 minute walk to most theaters. It also is close the shops along 5th Ave., St. Patrick's Cathedral, Radio City and others. They don't charge as much as the 5 star hotels, but I must say that their service is even better. They even serve complimentary coffee/tea/apples at the lobby in the morning and hot chocolate in the afternoon. Cassa will be my home when I visit NYC again.

I recently stayed at the Cassa for 4 nights including during the January blizzard. The hotel is in a perfect location and easy walking distance to many major attractions in the city including Times square and Rockfeller Center. The staff was friendly and helpful. The junior suite was large, comfortable and very clean and the common areas although small were well appointed. I highly recommend this hotel!

Stayed at the cassa for a week and from start to finish it was perfect ! Jonathan and Adam made our check in seamless and they were both so friendly and happy to help every time we saw them during our stay ! The hotels location is perfect, it was out first time to the city so for us being so close to times square and subway links was perfect! The room was clean and spacious, view wasn't great but we only slept there so it wasn't an issue ! Great price and great location and great staff

The King size bed was wonderful, and the shower just plain amazing! Our only issue was, due to the corner windows, that it was really cold! (Yes, it was January.) We loved the location, and thoroughly enjoyed the coffee in the mornings as well as everyone on the front desk staff.

This hotel is tucked away on 45th street, about 2 blocks from Times Square. The staff goes out of their way to help. The rooms are bright; the beds are comfortable and the entire hotel is clean. There was hot chocolate in the lobby when you get back in the afternoon or after a play.

Stayed here for a few nights earlier this month in a junior suite, and had an excellent time. The hotel is in a great location for Times Square and Broadway theatres, and close to subway stations. Our room was clean and smart, and the bathroom was probably the largest I've ever encountered in a New York hotel room. (Terrific monsoon shower, and good bathroom products too.) The bed was spacious, and very comfortable.The hotel has free wifi which was adequate for most things, and they also had free coffee/tea in the lobby in the mornings (and hot chocolate in the afternoons.) I thought it was a bit weird that there was no iron/ironing board in the room, as there was clearly a space intended for these in the wardrobe.The hotel does seem to have some sort of issues with credit cards and checking-in (see other people's reviews for their experiences.) We thought we had booked a non-refundable room when we booked the hotel a few months ago (during a sale), but it turned out that no payment had been taken at the time of booking - instead the money was taken whilst we were there, which ended up costing us more, because the exchange rate was less favourable than at the time we made the booking.

Can't recommend this hotel more highly. The location is absolutely perfect for anyone looking to explore the Times Square area. The room itself was incredibly clean and inviting and I honestly can't speak more highly of the staff.From the warm greeting to waves when we left for the show, the staff was wonderful and welcoming. I also have to just highly praise their housekeeping staff, doorman who helped get us a cab and especially the front desk for overnighting (in near-professional packaging!) an item I had left in the room.Highly recommend!

We stayed here for pur honeymoon.The position is perfect becuase it's 45th street and 5min far from times square, empire state building, bryan park and only 15 minute by walk to reach central park and one world tower.The receptionists are very polite and help us suggesting what to visit and how to reach the monuments.The room was not to big but very polite, the same the Wc. the only one problem was that one of the 2 lifts was out of service.we will surely come back here !Lucia & Filippo (italy)

Really comfortable rooms with very friendly staff who were attentive and extremely helpful. The location is perfect, one block from Times Square and Broadway, a short walk to Rockefeller Center, Central Park, 5th Avenue Shopping, Madison Square Garden and lots more. Didn't want to leave.

My partner and I stayed here from December 19 to January 2. The rooms here were great with huge beds, big bathrooms with a great shower, great views, right next to a subway and staff were very helpful for directions. Literally only one block away from Times Square and close to some great cafes and restaurants (good light breakfast at Bluestone Lane and delicious Italian across the road at Ninos 46). If I am in Manhattan again I would stay here as this hotel ticked all the boxes for a great stay!

Great place to stay to explore the city, location is perfect for walking to most places and using the subway. Free wifi that works well, rooms spacious and clean. Breakfast is available $25pp and their is a Pret is next door. Free tea and coffee available in the lobby in the mornings. Staff were friendly and helpful especially Jonathan, very knowledgeable, he was a great help navigating us around the city. Concierge booked our one world trade centre experience and put it through our door for us promptly. Thanks for a comfortable stay.

Stayed here for 4 nights just before christmas and found this a charming and stylish hotel, the perfect place to explore NYC Staff very friendly and helpful , clean and spacious rooms and the bonus of free wifi

My boyfriend and I traveled to NY the week before Christmas and stayed at Cassa due to it's location near Times Square and great reviews, and we were not disappointed! Upon arrival, we were greeted warmly by the doorman and front desk members and they quickly got us to our room. We stayed in a king size room and it was spacious and roomy with a great view.
