The bathroom was nice and clean and the shower was amazing! There was virtually no street noise with the window closed, but we cracked the window a bit to let the cool air and sounds of New York in! The bed was incredibly comfortable, which was needed after walking around town all day! The room also had full DirecTV which was a pleasant change to the generic hotel cable you usually get. I read some people were upset with a lack of a coffee maker in the room, but there was fresh coffee in the lobby every morning and a Starbucks just down the street. This hotel was the perfect place to crash after exploring NYC all day and I would highly recommend it! My only suggestion is that Cassa build a hotel in one of the quieter neighborhoods to the south, away from the hustle and bustle, as another option for a place to stay! Thanks Cassa for an amazing stay!

I loved this hotel and would absolutely stay there again. Staff was welcoming and friendly from the moment we walked in, and while the rooms were small, they were clean and cozy. The location is perfect as well. My new go-to hotel in NYC!

We stayed there for Christmas and new years eve (10 days). First of all the service, it was amazing, we ordered tons of stuff in Amazon before we got there (some of them were HUGE boxes) and not only they had everything there but also they didn't charge us any extra cost for saving it those days. Secondly the location, couldn't be better! walking distance from 5th avenue and Rocketfeller center, close to many supermarkets and subway stations. The room itself was very clean and wasn't so small, it didn't have a fridge but we asked for it and in less than 5 minutes we got it (again, very nice service). We didn't have breakfast there 'cause it was 25 dollars per person so we preferred to buy some stuff at the supermarket and keep them on the fridge. They had free WiFi and it was very god too. The only thing that we didn't like so much was a little noise we had on the bathroom, I think it was because of some of the pipes, it sounded like a water leaking; we asked in reception if they could go see it but apparently they couldn't do anything about it, once we closed the bathroom door the sound didn't bothered us at all, but that was just a little thing, we'd totally stay there again and I'd totally recommend it, we had an awesome stay.

We had a fabulous experience at the Cassa Hotel. For me, it was a fantastic location - a couple of blocks from Times Square, 5 or 6 blocks from Rockefeller Center, a dozen blocks from Madison Square Garden - yet 45th street is a relatively quiet street. So we got the best of all worlds. The room was a good size - especially for New York. The bed, while low, was comfortable, and the room was clean. Wifi was free and fast, the room came with a flat screen, wall mounted television, and was reasonably priced. A very nice experience.

We thought having a king size bed would ensure a good room, wrong. The place is suppose to be a 4 star hotel but it lacks some of the important amenities. Staff was rude however the concierge was friendly and helpful. Room was tiny with dim light and shower was weak and won't stop dripping. The air conditioner wasn't working properly and noisy. The wardrobe can only fits 2 coats. The 4 nights experience resembles a cubby house alike with a very expensive price tag. At first I thought it's NYC, as I stayed in other 4 stars hotel in NYC and read more on the review I realized that it simply wasn't true so i decided to write this review. So beware, of location is all you care about then it's great here.

Stayed at the Cassa for my Husbands 60th and New Year we cannot find one negative thing to say, staff go out of there way to assist you in every way they can nothing is too much trouble even at 5am when your having problems with transport or booking a table for dinner on New Years Eve.Location is perfect you are in walking distance to the big tourist attractions and those further afield a cab is no where near as expensive as LondonWe will defiantly return and advise anyone going to New York stay at the Cassa you will not be disappointed

Stylish and comfortable boutique hotel with exceptionally kind staff. Immaculate rooms and luxurious baths. Thoughtful details everywhere including an interesting selection of books. There was a mix up with my reservation which was not the hotel's fault but the staff went out of their way to remedy the situation. I'm delighted and grateful...and so staying here again.

A nice place to stay: good location, friendly and neat. The parking garage suggestion: Parking you SUV/Car as Cassa Hotel suggested/ associated to avoid high parking rate. It will be nice to book the next trip with Cassa Hotel on New Year Eve.

First time in NYC. We booked Cassa on the reviews from TripAdvisor and we are glad we did. The location is great. Walking distance to everything. We had a minor air condition issue in our room, but we were moved right away with no problem. Rooms were very clean. The staff was superior! Everyone was very nice and accommodating. We will make this our go to place when we come back to visit.

From the minute front door was opened, staff was welcoming and professional. Suite was immaculate and bathroom well appointed. Adjoining restaurant located at lower level was very New York Great location steps from theater district
user_location: Denali National Park and Preserve, Alaska
user_name:
joanberger48
Denali National Park and Preserve, Alaska

review_body: Loved this hotel with my wife and family. We went to Santa con and saw a few plays. The location, staff and room was perfect and if possible I hope to stay here again in the future. There are several places to eat nearby, times square right down the way, my favorite irish bars are only a half a block down. Just loved this place.

The Cassa was in just a perfect spot for seeing NYC. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful which was handy when we had any questions. It is 100 metres to Times Square and easy walk to subway stations and other attractions. Well worth staying at.

I have stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and it was super! i knew that i will arrive early and asked in advanced (email) for an early check in; I got an answer (as usual in this cases) that they have put a note for that. when I arrived at 6:30am they happily let me check in to my room. The hotel and the room are very clean and tide with all of the essentials. The free WiFi in the room is sufficient. Staff is very nice, attentive and helpful. The location is great! I walked everywhere (though a subway is close by). It's close enough to all of the Fuzz but very quiet. It was nice and surprising that they had both a Christmas tree and a Menorah at the lobby.

We stayed for 4 nights. Everything was great, the room was comfy and clean very modern and well equipped. Complimentary coffee and lemon water every morning. The staff provided us with we needed and what we asked for, free wi-fi, great view. Excellent value for the money!
user_name:
Marija M
Bitola, Republic of North Macedonia

review_body: We stayed at the Cassa for 5 days over thanksgiving.We had a junior suite which was still very small. Bed was comfy enough but the noise! The heating was noisy, and we were on the 4 th floor so we overlooked the generators for the downstairs restaurant that made a lot of noise. Would have been nice to have a view also.Location good but would not stay here again

Stayed 3 nights. Great location close to everything. Very clean. Staff was polite and accomodating. Super comfortable Bed!!! less 1 star because of the room size. But I still highly recommend this place.

We recently returned from a four night stay at the Cassa. The hotel is lovely - clean, modern and comfortable. Our room was a decent enough size (by NYC standards anyway!) and pretty quiet considering it looked out onto the road. Complimentary tea and coffee is provided in reception every morning, and the staff were very friendly. Cassa really is in the perfect location - just a few minutes walk from Times Square, Fifth Avenue, and pretty much everywhere else you could wish to be close to! But, at the same time, it's in a relatively quiet, safe area - you don't feel like you're stuck in the midst of the touristy madness that is Times Square! The cost of our stay was very reasonable, again by NYC standards. This was our third trip to NYC and Cassa is by far the best place we've stayed. We will definitely be back!

Great place! Very friendly staff! In the heart of New York! Perfect rooms, spacious with perfect views! So impressed! A very clean room with every possible amenity offered. We will be back soon for sure!!!!

I stayed there for one night on December 19 to celebrate my grand daughters 16 birthday. We live near the city so rarely stay there overnight but this was a special occasion. We were greeted warmly when we checked in and Germaine gave my grand daughter a high five wishing her a happy birthday. We were on the 19th floor and noticed that one of only two elevators (40 stories) was working. We were told we were upgraded but room was small with absolutely no comfortable seating aside from the bed. View great , linens lovely, no mini fridge. We had our day planned and headed to elevators which never came. Called front desk to discover both were broken! As I have a bad knee going down 19 flights was not an option. No on demand or movies ( 3 free ones not anything we'd watch) . We hadn't had lunch and with no mini fridge I called and someone actually went and got us cheese sandwiches and brought them up. We lost precious time and boarded elevator with trepidation.. Went to MoMA, dinner and On Your Feet ( terrific by the way) came back to hotel to discover at 10:30 both elevators again not working ! We are sent to 10 th floor " lounge" via an elevator that only goes to the 10th to a room that looks like a school classroom with no comfortable seating or charm. Everyone is tired . They keep popping up and telling us they are working on it. People are writing on twitter and Facebook and insisting they won't pay. Finally they come and reluctantly I get in the elevator terrified it will stop with us in it and we go to bed late. In the morning under m door is the bill fir the full $350 plus ! Breakfast buffet included when we went down at 10:30 was a few dried scrambled eggs and scraps of bacon. They were to close at 10:30 which on a Sunday morning is absurd. I go to the front desk with my bill and basically say " you are kidding right ?" He reduces it by half and I just want out so I leaveHere's what should have happened. They should have gotten drinks from somewhere nearby and brought them to all of us waiting in that grim " lounge". No one should have been charged anything for that night and the Bill under the door should have stated that with deepest apologies. Clearly management was hedging their bets hoping people would just pay. The staff was lovely but unprepared to deal with this nightmare and it was handled unprofessionally and I'm guessing the directives were not the staffs choosing. I wouldn't return or recommend Cassa

we have been there for a week early december, liked the room was a junior suite enough space to walk around and a small sofa corner, wardrobe was not really big enough for two people clothes for a week in any case we had a safe and bathroom was big enough so we were satisfied overall.receptionists are super friendly and helpful,i have been in NYC several times and so far this is the hotel i liked the most, the breakfast is unfortunately very expensive and in fact horrible, poor choice of anything and a guy sitting there as helpful and enthusiastic as a piece of wood, we went there only once then started going on other side of the road to cafe manhattan which for the same money lets you have 100 times more choice and quality.

Stayed here in December for 5 nights. Hotel was clean and warm, staff were friendly and polite. Decent size room & very nice bathroom. Best thing about the hotel is the location, 2 minute walk from Times Square but far enough away not to be noisy. Loads of things to do within easy walking distance. Hotel lobby is as others have described - a little bit small and a bit dimly lit, but not a problem as you are only passing through

This hotel whilst small has very modern facilities, beds big enough and comfortable enough to get a good nights sleep with modern furnishings incl a 55" LG flatscreen tv a separate radio which can accommodate an iPod, desk and fridge. The room has individually controlled aircon which works well, the standard wifi in the room was find for myself and my wife when using at the same time,bathroom excellent with nice deep sinks and separate shower with rain shower head, the only issue is the clothes hanging space (free safe in wardrobe) which was very small but you get by. All the staff were very friendly, polite and more than willing to help if you required it. I believe the hotel had a restaurant which we did not use.This hotel was ideally located for us as 3 minute walk to times sqr and a 5 minute walk to Saks. I would highly recommend this hotel and would happily stay again if and when we visit NYC.

Excellent "no frills" midtown hotel. Larger than average rooms, new decor, free wifi, no in-room coffeemaker, but free coffee in lobby. Fast and pleasant service. Very good value for money (paid $220/night when comparable nearby hotels were ~$300. Incredibly quiet for a midtown hotel - actually got a "siren-free" good night's sleep.

its a good option, good location bought i don`t like the hotel the rooms are small and there is now common areas, the elevators are quick bought there is not enough for the trafficthe lobby its really small

Stayed here for 4 nights in early December. We had a single room which only had a double bed, but I was aware of this when booking. The room was surprisingly big. The bathroom looked new and the shower was great. Small fridge in the room as well as a robe and slippers. Only complaint is that the sheets were miles too big for the bed. It seems they put queen or king sized sheets on the double bed and they dragged on the floor on both sides once you untucked the sheets to get in bed. The staff was superb and I will definitely stay here again.

From the outset, this Hotel stood out as knowing what it is about. The greeting at check in was cordial but professional. The room was small, but efficient and comfortable. The staff interactions were all pleasant -- this is a solid midtown hotel with great staff.The room I stayed in was small, but with the amenities expected. Housekeeping were able to provide toiletries I had failed to pack, and the bed was comfortable. The television showed basic DirecTV with HBO , which sufficed.If I had a complaint, it would be that the room service menu was probably not what I would look for, but it would do in a pinch.

Upon arrival we were greeted pleasantly and happily by the staff who told us all about the hotel and it's amenities. Getting to the room was a welcome relief after the long flight so we were glad it was clean and beautifully made up.We were in room 1801 which was in a corner of the hotel. We had no noise from the stairwell or nearby elevator but I was woken up one night by some neighbours enjoying the hotel a little too much. The view wasn't exactly beautiful and there was no roof terrace although there is a balcony on floor ten.Location wise this is a corker. Only a few blocks from Times Square in one direction and Grand Central in the other. Bryant Park is also very nearby (as is the HBO Store) which at this festive time of year had a wonderful market as well as ice skating. Bryant Park also had free wi-fi!Overall a smashing hotel with courteous staff, any request we had was dealt with quickly and efficiently. The safe wouldn't work and we needed an iron, one call to the front desk and within minutes we had what we needed. Highly recommended.

Great staff, and a nice, clean room. Clean lobby, elevators, and hallways. Rooftop patio had great views, and it was really nice up there. Coffee, tea, water, fresh fruit every day in the lobby. Always greeted with a friendly, smiling front desk staff person. The Doormen were helpful with our bags, our dogs, and knowledgeable of what's in the area (best places to park, where to get a quick bite to eat, etc). Shower drain was slow - that is the only gripe, of which it wasn't too big of a deal. We were able to leave our dogs as long as they were crated.

Cassa Hotel is perfectly located in Midtown Manhattan. Literally blocks from Rockefeller Center and Time Square. Only 11 blocks to Macy's. Rooms are a bit small, but for the money you can't beat it. The minute you walk into the Hotels lobby you are greated by the staff. If you are as lucky as my wife, son and daughter-in-law and I was, you will be greated by Jonathan at the front desk and Adam, ready, willing and able to help you however he can. Hard to believe Adam has only been with company for a short 3 months. The man is a pro and deserves high praise and hopefully a promotion! Special shout out to Sam. Sam was also available to help however he could. No doubt that when my travels take me to NYC, the Cassa Hotel will be where I stay!

We stayed, my BF and I, at the Cassa 45th hotel for six wonderful nights. The location is great, just 3 min walk from Times Square, Bryant Park, 10 min (easy walking) from Port Authority station, and really, pretty much the best location if you're into central Manhattan. The hotel itself is perfect for NYC. Rooms not that big, but could easily fit two people (and four suitcases....), shower is great, flat screen tv with all channels, and the small things like the little box in the shower with complimentary make-your-life-easier treats.Room was spotless, and was cleaned everyday.But the highlight is of course, the staff. Great people, always welcoming and friendly, ready to assist in whatever (from booking the air port shuttle, to restaurants recommendations..). Gives the hotel a great thumbup in choosing the right people. (Hi Ron Robinson! :-), hope you'll get your 'alexa' soon..) )Enjoy your stay!

Me and my boyfriend visited this hotel in November on the Black Friday weekend. The hotel is a 5 minutie walk to Times Square, from our room on the 22nd floor (2204) we could see Times Square from our bathroom window. It's got a modern interior, gorgeous bathrooms and well made rooms. Free wifi, receptionists always asking if you're okay, they can also grab a taxi for you, there's a porter that carries your cases but expects a tip so be careful! Free tea and coffee in the morning downstairs, free gym access. Restaurants a bit pricey but there's a cheap good quality diner round the corner. It's a sophisticated hotel, well designed, friendly staff and in a perfect location. Would highly recommend!

This was a good hotel, especially for NYC. The location was excellent, and it was immaculate. I thought the room was a decent size for NYC, and despite being over the street and across from elevator (double whammy) it was very quiet. It had nice modern decor, free wifi and a super comfortable bed. I thought it was a nice place to lay my head for a night on a business trip and would return if I had meetings in the area.

A super hotel close to Time Square and Rockefeller Center. The rooms are relatively big for New York. The interior is modern and the TV is even for US circumstances huge. The people at the reception were very helpful.

Stayed for five nights and had nothing to fault. Excellent location. The room was small so choose a bigger room if you have a lot of luggage. Requests for hypoallergenic pillows were met - staff was excellent throughout. Free coffee every morning at the lobby. Seamless check in and out. Will even sign parcels for you.

Have stayed at this hotel twice -- it is very near our NY office -- excellent choice for Mid-Town business hotel or casual vacation hotel. Small lobby lounge -- small but nice restaurant. Only limitation -- is the wait for elevators -- sometimes an issue if one happens to be out of service - which has happened on multiple occasions. It should not be lost on anyone -- that the Cassa, a Viceroy hotel -- is really a fine hotel - with really comfortable rooms larger than some of the other locations within a few blocks of the Cassa - and - is considerably less expensive than the Sofitel which is directly next door to the Cassa. Kudos to Viceroy for a great, comfortable, well priced hotel in an outstanding mid-town location. Out standing value for Money.

I waited the room for more than 5 hours. The receptionists said that check in would be ready at 12 o' clock but then they said that the room wasn't ready yet and I waited again. The worst part is the unfriendly person that works there that sit beside the receptionist (offering something). She knew that I sat on the chair beside her but then she pulled my chair only to put her bag. But, overall the room is fantastic.

I have stayed at several different hotels in NYC, and this hotel is now my favorite. I arrived in NYC for the marathon and had forgotten my wallet at home. I was pretty anxious, but the staff was so incredibly kind and helpful that I was quickly put at ease. My room was beautiful, extremely comfortable, and relatively quiet for a NYC hotel. I was traveling with a friend who stayed at a different hotel. After she checked in at her hotel - room rate was similar, she expressed regret that she didn't book at Cassa Hotel. Will definitely book this hotel again when I return to NYC.

I stayed in the Cassa hotel after reading all the positive reviews and I must say - I was not disappointed!! The location of the hotel is just a few minutes from Times Square, fantastic! But still quite enough to sleep comfortably at night. The rooms are cute and small, and extremely clean (I'm very picky about this, but they really were impeccably clean!). The service is great! The staff is really helpful with anything you might need and they are very friendly! They stored our luggage (free of charge!) when we arrived before our check-in and also the day we left, as our flight was not until 8pm. Overall, we were very happy and satisfied with the hotel and service, definitely staying here on our next New York visit!!

The Cassa hotel is located in a great location, just nearby the busiest and one of the most popular locations in Manhattan - The times square. It's very easy to navigate at this location, even for a first timer.The room was very clean and had a cosy feeling, the WiFi speed is great and the hot water in the shower came out almost instantly.As a matter of fact, I had only good words for this boutique hotel, until I realised that they charged me $6 for a small bottle of water that was located on the table (not in the mini bar) inside the room.Apparently, the amount was written on the bottle in the thinnest letters and this felt like taking advantage of the visitors...If you charge your visitors $6 for a 400ml sized bottle of water, then you should make sure that they will notice its disproportionate pricing.

Arrived at night after a very long flight and the check-in process was quick and flawless. The location near Time Square couldn't be more appropriate. The room was clean and modern. Delicious complementary coffe in the morning.

Stayed 8 nights and had a wonderful time in the Big Apple.No, the hotel isn't big and flashy, with all the trimmings of the big chains. But what is does have is terrific location, comfortable rooms (not as small as some reviews may lead you to believe) and most of all, a brilliant group of staff, skilled at providing excellent, caring customer service.A couple of examples :1. We had tickets to some sporting events that we needed to print. Not an issue, simply email to the front desk and pick up on the way out, with an "enjoy the the game" comment as we went. This followed by a "how was the game?", "hope you enjoyed the night" on the way back in.2. We had a few laughs over the "view" (a glimpse of Times Square from our shower recess!"). Genuine humour and smiles all around.This type of attitude was evident everywhere and really went a long way to making our stay memorable and fun.Quick tip - you don't get breakfast, but don't be alarmed. There are loads of food options around within only a minute or two, so just grab one of the hotel's complimentary coffee or hot chocolate and an apple on the way out the door and you'll be fine.All up, Cassa is one hotel I can highly recommend.

My partner and I, just got back from New York. The hotel is very clean to a high standard. The beds are very comfortable which is perfect because of all the walking through the day. The Hotel location was Excellent 5 mins from Time Square and 15 min walk to Central Park. The staff were professional, friendly, polite, very very helpful and very welcoming. If you are planning a stay at the Cassa Hotel you won't be disappointed PERFECT!! When we return to New York we will stay in this hotel again. 5 stars. Rachel and Lee Carberry

Overall we had a great stay at The Cassa. Though the room was small and the storage was inadequate (compared to another NY hotel we'd stayed at), this hotel was great still! Friendly and knowledgable staff, nothing was too hard including the complimentary late check-out! Comfy beds and furniture, great selection of tv channels, great location.
user_name:
Tui0200
Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea

review_body: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Cassa Hotel. The property is convenient to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Broadway shows. The hotel clean and quiet. We stayed in a junior suite which is much larger than many of the rooms in the city that we have stayed in before. We would definitely choose this hotel again.

We have just returned from New York staying st The Cassa.This hotel is in a perfect location, 5 mins walk from Times Square, 5 mins walk from 5th Ave, 15 mins from Empire State 20 mins Central Park, 15 mins grand central terminal. 10 mins from Times Square 42nd street subway which takes you in one line the number 1 train to south ferry battery park and it costs #2.75 each one way cheap as chips. You can get the same line a few stops earlier to chambers street and then walk 10 mins maxto Ground zero. There is a line to world trade centre but this is a further subway from the hotel.You just buy one metro card, my hubby went through passed the card back to me then I went through, they tell you to do this at the station. The hotel told us directions for the subway and the front desk where so helpful saved us money and time.Ok so the sightseeing. In my opinion the Top of the Rock is fab for views over New York at night, you go to 3 different levels so big tip if you want to do some night time selfies with Empire State in the background level 3 you don't have any railings so can get good pic.Empire State we did fast track excellent to avoid queues.Intrepid sea air and space museum we booked a Concorde tour it's 50 mins and well worth it.Ground zero you must go in the museum so sad but worth walking round to see what they have done to preserve some of the old building and belongings.Battery park - we couldn't get crown tickets these have to be booked 3 months in advance however we did pedestal tickets not worth it, you can get good photos from the ferry, make sure you are on the right hand side of the ferry top deck as it leaves port.Ellis island brilliant to walk around.All our tickets we booked on line before we went.We also had tickets for Wicked on Broadway fabulous show, loved it. Theatre was new and lovely.Bubba Gump, Times Square we went twice service excellent and if you buy certain drinks they give you a glass to take home which is great.Great Irish restaurants 5 mins from hotel, Connollys excellent food and service.Alcohol in New York is very expensive in bars, more than London prices.Taxi to and from the airport is one set price which is handy, just then decide what tip to give.Hotel will call a taxi for you when you leave, they also store your bags secure. Rooms in hotel clean and quite spacious too, bathroom had huge rainfall shower, there is a fridge in your room, if you want a kettle ask them at reception no problem, we made a cup of tea every morning which was nice. They will give you tea bags too.Breakfast we ate out, fabulous place Red Flame diner - out of hotel turn left on the corner turn left passed Wells Fargo and Duanes, next corner turn left its about 2 doors down on your left you can get cereal toast full cooked breakfast muffins pancakes etc melon strawberries, basically as light or heavy a breakfast. They also give you tap water and you can drink water in New York without getting a dodgy belly which I didn't know quite handy!Hotel reception staff can not do enough to help they even checked us in online for our flights home. Very friendly staff happy to give directions and they told us about the subway, so easy to use.I loved Times Square and the location of hotel is excellent just minutes on foot.Shopping if they have sales is good value otherwise we found some things more expensive so make sure you work it out in STG before you buy. Feel free to ask me any questions happy to help.Will definitely return to The Cassa without hesitation.

Central location in midtown Manhattan. Easy walking distance from Grand Central, minutes walk from 5th ave, Times Square & the theatre district. Friendly efficient staff. Reasonably sized room for NYC & clean. Overall very happy with the Cassa hotel & would definitely stay there again.

Cassa is a decent hotel in a great location. But there were a bunch of small things that really stole the comfort from my stay. First, I expect an iron and ironing board in the room (there wasn't one), but when I called down for one, it took 30 minutes for them to bring it to me (frustrating for a business traveler w a schedule to keep). Additionally, I expected a queen size bed, what I got was full size. At 6'2", my feet were hanging off the end of the bed. Room service after 7 pm doesn't exist either (FYI); plan accordingly. On a positive note, the hotel bath/shower was great and clean.

Recently stayed at this property for the Hotel Experience Show. Great price for a location so close to time square. Good sound proofing so not a lot of street noise in the room. Extremely comfortable beds. Big enough bottles of shampoo and conditioner in the shower to last for more than one wash. Free wifi was a great surprise. Beware rooms and beds both felt pretty small. If you are trying to put more than two people in a room it will be very cramped. Only two minor complaints. Elevators are a bit slow. The other was something you'll see anywhere in the city. The employees never seem to have enough time to actually help you, conversations are short and to the point, and usually interrupted by phone calls.

So close to Times Square it really was perfect location. The front desk were always very helpful and sorted a taxi back to the airport for us no bother.The room was big for NY City; clean, modern and a great sized bathroom, very good value.Coffee served in the lobby each morning and we grabbed breakfast over the road each morning (turn right out the hotel and about 6 shops down) there's Cafe Manhattan serving bagels and buffet.Would definitely recommend!

Excellent location, quiet enough outside hotel but less than 5 minutes walk from Times Square, Bryant Park, Subway etc. Reception staff very friendly and helpful. Queen Deluxe room was of a good size, bed very comfy and bath / shower were great. Really nice TV in the room which was a nice bonus, although when you're in NYC you won't be spending much time in there!Would not hesitate to stay again, already looking forward to next time.

We were visiting NYC for the weekend from Montreal and everything about the Cassa was perfect for our stay. The location is awesome, we took the bus from Montreal and Port Authority is an easy 10 minute walk away and Broadway and Times Square is literally up the street. There's also several cafes and restaurants, including Starbucks and Chipotle right on the same block. The staff are super down to earth, friendly and helpful (shout out to Ron and Adam). When I booked the room I mentioned it was my boyfriend's birthday and our second night the hotel surprised us with a hand written card and miniature cakes! The room was great, the bed was sooooo comfortable and we loved the shower and added touch of the slippers and bath robes. We were on the 24th floor and we could see a corner of times square from our window. On our last day we had brunch at Butter which i was super excited about given that celebrity chef Alex Guarneschelli is head chef. She wasn't there unfortunately but the food was awesome and we got free champagne for my boyfriend's birthday. I had the french toast and he had the omelet and for dessert we shared the strawberry beignets (which were heavenly). The restaurant is a little pricey but definitely worth trying for at least one meal. I will 100 percent be staying with Cassa the next time I'm in the city! LOVE LOVE LOVE

- I stayed for 2 nights. - The room was clean and of an adequate size. - The staff was courteous all around. - No noise from outside or the inside (although on busy street). - The location is FANTASTIC! 5 minute walk to Times Square and to Rockfeller Center, very close to the Subway.Lots of all-budget eating options nearby. - For that rate, I would expect a breakfast to be included.

I stayed at this hotel while in town for business mixed with pleasure. The location was great and in walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, Bryant Park and a 24-hour drug/convenience store. The room was clean, bed comfy and the complimentary slippers were actually really comfortable. The staff were all very accommodating, at one point even going out of their way to locate a box for me to use to ship books home that I had picked up in my travels. Another thing worth mentioning, I locked myself out of my room one morning when I went down to the lobby to get coffee. Rather than just taking my word for it (that I was who I said I was) and sending me back up to the room with a new key card, they had a hotel security officer (plain clothed) escort me to my room to check my ID. I say this because I was pleasantly surprised by their thoroughness and appreciated their concern for guests' safety. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it to anyone that wants to be close but not too-close to areas of interest.

A great stay at this hotel. Wonderfully helpful staff. Nice rooms and lovely bathroom. Nice touches like bathrobes. Bed rather small and not much storage space for clothes though. Would definitely stay again. Restaurant eye wateringly pricey. Location very convenient.

Excellent location in heart of Manhattan, modern, clean, and comfortable room and bathroom. Very helpful staff taking care of all your requests. Nice little touches like free coffee in the morning and hot chocolate in the afternoon at reception.

I stayed in this hotel last month I had the most amazing time. I. Came for a special birthday and was greeted with some delicious chocolates and birthday card when I arrived into our room. Staff are so friendly, helpful and so accommodating I really could not ask for more. The Rooms are lovely and clean and the bed was the most comfy bed I have ever slept in. It is in the most perfect location less than a 5 min walk to time square. I will 100% be returning next year I really could not rate this hotel enough. Fantastic value for money. Thank you cassa for making our stay amazing.

My wife and I spent a really good week in New York this october, we stayed at Cassa Hotel, a very well located hotel, just two blocks away from the midtown movement but without the all the noise. The location is excellent 5 minute walk to the theater, or to a restaurant, and if you want to go fifth avenue also very close. A 15 minute walk to central park or another five to Rockefeller center. The room is very comfortable, a queen bed a big tv, a nice bathroom and enough space to move around, been in in hotels with smaller rooms and this one is really comfy has all the space you could need for a couple, the personnel very nice and attentive, it doesn´t include breakfast but there is coffee in the reception, and just outside many places to buy a nice a not too expensive breakfast. Only problem one of the elevators wasn´t working and that meant delays when getting to and from the room, but I don´t thin this is something that always happen so I still would strongly recommend Cassa Hotel the location is extraordinary.

Stayed in the Cassa hotel at the beginning of November for 4 nights, what a great hotel, fantastic location... 2 mins from Times Square..... 1st time to NY (already planning our next visit)....it was amazing. Room was great, fab bathroom, cleaned daily, cannot say anything bad about this hotel. The staff were so helpful and friendly, thank you for printing out our tickets for the Empire State Building and for printing our Boarding passes. Everything about NY was amazing. Will definitely be returning to the Cassa Hotel.

We spent 8 Nights at the Cassa in October, and I do not have one complaint!!Safina was an amazing help organising our reservation, and the rest of the staff we encountered during our stay (I'm so sorry I cannot remember names) were just as helpful and welcoming.... nothing was too much trouble!Yes it is a smaller boutique hotel, so you forgo things like a big lobby, bar, room service, etc, but that did not both us one bit.The rooms are not huge, but none are in New York. We had enough space for what we needed, the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was great (especially the shower) and we had our own fridge, which you don't see a lot in hotels. The location could not be better.... you can see the lights from Times Square when you walk out the front of the Hotel. It's a short walk to Rockerfeller & Grand Central, Bryant Park, and very easy access to subway stations.There is so much just in that block, we found a great little bar, a Pizza Place, Starbucks and a Duane Reade, which was soo convenient.All in all, I would highly recommend the Cassa to anyone visiting New York!!

We had a wonderful three night stay at this hotel in October, 2015. I truly can't find anything to complain about. Only one elevator was in service, but it didn't really impact our stay. The staff were fabulous (special shout out to Lendel who helped me plan a few things for my Hubby's birthday and didn't seem to mind my many questions :). The location of this hotel was perfect. Close to everything. We easily walked to Central Park, Top of the Rock and Grand Central (great food court for breakfast and people watching by the way).

The Cassa Hotel is a conveniently located option right near Times Square and the Rockefeller Center area. It's a combined residence and room rental property that gives you a good choice if you get a great rate on one of the booking sites. It was clean and comfortable with nice linens and helpful staff. One drawback, being an older space that was most likely bought and converted, the room still has an older-style heating and cooling system next to the room doorway. So every time it kicked on and off it made a loud rattling noise that sounded as if someone were shaking the hotel door (a very unnerving way to be jolted awake throughout the night). In addition, some of the service crew were in the hallway having a fairly loud conversation about their shift hours at 3:45 in the morning; again, not a great way to be woken up. Overall, an average stay that suited an overnight business need, but not very restful and nothing out of the ordinary.
user_name:
Gregory M
Tinton Falls, New Jersey

review_body: Stayed at the Cassa Hotel for three nights while working in NYC. We originally were booked at a different hotel and switched to Cassa last minute because of a better deal. Thank goodness we did! This hotel is beautiful and the service is outstanding!The rooms were very spacious for NYC. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds I'd ever slept on. There isn't much of a lobby but it didn't matter. The staff was extremely courteous and friendly and they made our stay unforgettable. Great location - you were two blocks from Time's Square but for some reason it didn't feel like it. You felt like you were in a quiet neighborhood but you could walk a few minutes and be in the heart of the city. I would stay here again without hesitation. Great job Cassa!

Nice hotel in the middle of everything. Friendly staff, rooms good (yet no feeling of luxury) and overall very good experience. Business area (for work, etc) not so attractive and limited dining. However, everything you need within 2-10 minutes.

Most New York hotel rooms are notoriously small and the cassa hotel is no exception. however, it's more than the room that is small. the bathroom is small although the walk-in shower is quite nice. the closet is tiny, extremely tiny. no place to hang up more than a couple of pairs of pants. the room itself is very stylish and very, very quiet. they must have done some soundproofing job. great tv which is on directv, a real plus in nyc. but there are little irritating things. there is no ice machine, however just call down to the front desk and they will bring a bucket of ice right up. there's two bottles of fancy cassa water waiting for you when you walk in but there's a catch. $6 a bottle, something they don't tell you. there a safe that's easy to operate. no computer to print out your boarding pass but they will happily do it for you at the front desk. I was in nyc during the world series and the nyc marathon but still got a good deal from priceline. it's location is superb. 3 blocks from times square, less than a block from fifth avenue and two blocks from the subway which will take you to citi field, home of the national league champion mets. two halal trucks are close by, corner of 6th ave. and 44th street. gyro for $4.00 and other great combos for $6.00. ate lunch there four times. great, great deal. was there during the world series and the nyc marathon and would gladly stay there again but only at the one-third off rate I got from priceline.
user_name:
doug m
Winston Salem, North Carolina

review_body: This hotel was a pleasant surprise: great location, nice room, very friendly and helpful staff - absolutely lovely. Also, it has a nice restaurant in the basement - where I did not eat but had a fabulous cocktail. I would recommend it, especially when it comes at such great rate as 195 USD taxes included.

We love staying near Hell's Kitchen and Broadway in New York and came across the Cassa having been shocked at hotel prices and our awful Aus exchange rate! The Cassa was a real find - quiet, great not too small a room and brilliant staff. The location did not disappoint. Special thanks to Rony, Melissa and Felix for making our stay so great. Highly recommend

Nice hotel in great midtown location. found it through priceline gave us a good prize and was one of the lowest rates around. Hotel it self appeared new has a restaurant downstairs that we didnt try. staff was friendly and upper floors room was clean quiet, comfortable and felt safe. building also has residential upper floors. my only gripe was that only one elevator was working and it was a little annoying having got wait the every time we used it during our 3 day stay. not a big concern overall we were satisfied staying there.

We are from Tennessee and the Cassa provided us with down home southern kindness. The whole staff went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed . The doorman even made sure we have a luxury van to deliver us to the airport on the morning we left. The room was kept spotlessly clean. They had fruit and coffee each morning and lemonade and tea throughout the day. The front desk was the BEST experience I have ever received at a hotel. Go Cassa don't change a thing!!!!!!

We stayed for a week at the Cassa hotel-fabulously friendly reception staff to greet you then we were shown our room. Good size for three of us, fantastically clean & comfortable beds-marvellous for a good nights sleep after walking miles! Fantastic shower & bathroom-nice toiletries & towels changed daily. No road noise from outside. Hotel is in a fantastic location, close to Bryant Park, Times Square etc.Doormen were exceptionally friendly too and helpful with directions. Would definately stay there again

We came down from Saratoga to see a show and stayed at Cassa for the first time. The staff was wonderful, the room was clean and well appointed and you location is perfect - theaters and restaurants are steps away. We will be back!!

So I have just returned from a 3 night vacation to New York with my sister in law, staying at the Cassa hotel 45th street. Having never been before I took a chance on this small boutique hotel as the location seemed exactly what we wanted. First time we entered the hotel we were greeted by the evening staff who couldn't of been any more helpful, our bags were brought up to the room and check in was simple and straight forward. Before visiting the hotel I had emailed to ask about the option of coffee making facilities in the hotel, I received an email within the hour explaining there was in the lobby but I could have one put into the room for arrival, as promised it was in the room with a choice of coffee, however this was not replenished throughout our stay.The room was big enough for two people, decor was clean and bathroom lovely and clean, with a gorgeous overhead power shower. Throughout our stay whether asking for directions or just passing while entering or exiting the hotel the staff were always polite friendly and asked if we needed anything. The location of this hotel is perfect for tourists, 10 min walk into Times Square, same the other way for grand central station and same to rocker fella centre. As you leave the hotel if you take a right and walk about 2 mins you are on 5th avenue - the best street in Manhattan for shopping. We walked from 34th to 59th so the distance between blocks is short. Lots of bars, restaurants and coffee shops around and a wonderful pizza place right across the street.Looking to return to New York next year and will 100% stay here again.

Great location within minutes of Time Square. Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Free coffee and tea in reception. No breakfast but plenty of places to eat nearby. Subway station is block over.

Stay here 2 to 3 times each year for business. Rooms can be very small, but the Junior Suite solved that problem. Great Location close to Times Square. Has always been quiet, clean, desk staff is always there and helpful. Have not eaten at the restaurant.

Excellent location.Nice,clean and confortable room.Friendly and cooperative staff.I will use this hotel when I return to NYC again.They should improve the waiting area.I stayed for two nights and I really enjoyed it.

We stayed here for one night, before we sailed on our cruise. Although the bed was a tad small, the room was very clean and nicely decorated. The staff was very friendly. The location couldn't be better...walking distance to Time Square, theaters and Central Park! To boot, we got a great rate. Would stay there again.

Check in took rather longer than expected..no the best first impression after a long journey. The elevators are a joke..one out of service and the other takes ages to arrive. Rooms are clean although very dark indeed, couldnt find anything in our suitcases it was that bad and only one light between the 2 beds. Bathrooms are very good though and well lit. breakfast the first day was appalling which is in the restaurant Butter under the hotel.. stale bagels, no coffee, no tea, no bacon and no pastries left..think someone complained because much better from then on but they were constantly running of plates, coffee etc and due to the limited staff this took too long to resolve.

We stayed at The Cassa Hotel for 5 nights and couldn't have been more pleased. The location being just a block or two from Times Square kept you close enough to the action, but far enough away to get some peace and quiet. Rooms are spacious, well appointed, very clean, and very nice. The staff was outstanding! Particularly Jonathan. He was so helpful and friendly. Anything we asked for they took care of. Would definitely stay hear again.

First time here and will definately return next time we're in NYC!! Extremely friendly welcome by the staff, perfect clean modern room! Only spent two nights but definately enjoyed our stay! On checkout we even had our bags carried for us to get a cab on street - outstanding customer service and all done with a smile! Thank you!

My flight got cancelled so was scrambling to find a hotel the front desk people where great and helpful. The room was very nice and very clean. Bed was very comfortable. my stay was very pleasant. I would stay here again!

Stayed 5 nights at the Cassa with friends for my wife's birthday. All the staff are really helpful and will put themselves out for you if you need assistance - James in particular. The room we stayed in was large for a major city and included a desk and fridge. The bathroom was also well proportioned with an excellent rain shower. The only downside was the lack of any real meaningful hanging space in the small wardrobe - but not a bug problem. The hotel is ideally placed for Times Square and Broadway shows being only a 5 - 10 minute walk away and 5th Avenue just at the end if the block. Overall a great stay in a very good hotel in a fantastic location (plenty of Irish bars close by serving good beer and huge portions of food). Would definitely come back. Thanks to all the staff at the Cassa.

My husband had never been to New York. This was a great time to show him a few of the sights there. The hotel was in easy walking distance to Broadway and Times Square. The staff was helpful and friendly. We were very satisfied with our accommodations.

Helpful, friendly, informative staff. Hotel was spotless. Rooms comfortable With lovely white bed linen, comfy mattress and amazing feather and down pillow.Lovely clean towels. Bathrobes and slippers and good quality toiletries provided.9 mins walk from Rockefeller centre, 5 from Times Square, and 10 from 5th Avenue,Tiffanys etc. Breakfast was adequate. But you we not informed about breakfast tea and coffee and apples, in reception and afternoon hot chocolate too, but all on display as you enter reception, a great idea. A big thank you to hotel manager for the a lovely surprise of a bottle of champagne for our anniversary. Also our relatives had a lovely bottle of wine and chocolates for her 60th Birthday. Amazing stay lovely New York will stay there again. Thank you to all staff members.

Stayed for 4 nights. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Rooms were very clean with great facilities, including the most comfortable bed. Minutes from Times square. Will stay there again. Bars and restaurants on 45th St. Of a very high quality. Overall a great location for a base to visit all local sights.

hotel in very heart of the city, times square just a block down lovely big rooms spotlessly clean  and lovely comfortable bed which was huge , staff polite and helpful made us feel very welcome esp big guy on door. give us tips and directions and judging by reviews they are always keen to know what you think fresh filter coffee in reception to welcome you back or hot chocolate when its cold all in all l would recommend and stay again

I spent 3 nights in this hotel. It was very clean and new. The staff was nice and helpful. Wifi works well. The view from the room (16th floor) was not as nice as I expected though... When I made my reservation I was told I would have a room with a view of the city, which was not the case. Despite that, I highly recommend Cassa Hotel for your stay in NYC.

I stayed 18 nights at Cassa Hotel on 45th Street and I do not have a single complaint for all of the 18 nights. The reception staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful, and made me feel very welcome throughout my stay. The location is excellent - Broadway is only a 5-10 minutes walk away, and despite being only minutes away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square, it is still relatively peaceful and tranquil. I was able to also jog to Central Park and back relatively easily from the hotel. I usually don't leave reviews unless I am very impressed with the service, so Cassa has impressed me sufficiently for me to make this effort. Great service and thank you so much!

We stayed at the Cassa 45th Street for our first trip to NYC. The hotel is in an ideal location, very central and great for accessing all of the tourist spots either on foot or by subway. The rooms are a good size - plenty of room by NYC standards and the bathroom was also great. The staff make this hotel extra special, they gave us such a warm welcome when we arrived and were very attentive. We had a very special trip with both my boyfriend's 30th and our engagement, and on both occasions we were given a lovely bottle of bubbly and some cakes on his birthday, little touches like this make it stand out. I would recommend it to anybody visiting NYC. Well done everyone! X

The Cassa on 45th is an outstanding hotel near everything you want to see in Manhattan. A short walk will take you to Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral, the Theater District and more. The staff were quick with check-in and very courteous anytime we entered or exited the hotel. I notified the hotel that we were celebrating our 20th anniversary before we arrived. Our room had chilled prosecco and a hand-written card upon our arrival. Although the room is small by most standards, it was just right for NYC. It was immaculately clean upon arrival and every day that we stayed. The bed was very comfortable and the TV had a crisp picture. The bathroom was spa quality with the contemporary fixtures and toiletry products. It was spotless every single day. The housekeeping staff at Cassa on 45th is also top notch. We asked for an iron and ironing board to be sent to our room and it was delivered immediately. The fruit water in the afternoons was a refreshing treat as well as the hot coffee offered in the lobby each morning. Pret A Porter, right next door, was the perfect spot for a quick, affordable breakfast before hitting the city. We would definitely stay at Cassa on 45th the next time we visit New York City. We can also recommend Uber for transportation to and from the airport. For in-town travel, the subway is the way to go!

Cassa is a great place to stay. The staff is friendly and efficient. They were quick to seek to help and do anything that was necessary to ensure a great visit. Terrific staff and location. Rooms were exceptional.

Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Really friendly & welcoming staff. As we were on honeymoon we had a bottle of bubbly waiting on us in our room which was a nice surprise. Room was nice, clean and modern. Close to Times Square which is what we wanted. Room cleaned daily. Complimentary tea/coffee. Staff were very helpful and we would happily recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC.

If you want enjoy NYC from a perfect, convenient location... Stay here. A few steps away from Times Square, 5th and 6th avenues, 10 minutes by feet to Central Park or Empire State Building, but quiet and silent in the nights. Staff friendly efficient, rooms clean and comfortable; one only suggestion: don't take water bottles in your room you can get them for much less in the delis around the hotel

This hotel is ideal for a stay in NYC. Even if located a few steps from Times Square, 5th Avenue and Avenida de las Americas, it's very quite. Beside the location staff is friendly and efficient, rooms are clean and comfortable. You can enjoy their garden bar in the afternoon, all around you can find restaurants and pubs to eat good cheeseburger or fish and chips. If you want to get breakfast even very early you have a lot of choice nearby or in walking distance.

Am not sure if Cassa is truly a 4-star hotel. Location is superb. Not all receptionists are as friendly as they should be - I was welcomed at check in by a receptionist reading emails and then checking us in - shouldnt the guest infront of you take priority, I wonder? Another female receptionist on duty Monday 14th Sept was exceptionally cold and impatient. However, Berett and Jermaine were really good. Wifi is horrendous. Coffee/tea should be made available in the room esp for a 4-star hotel (at least it were available in the lobby in the morning). No computers to check in for flights etc. what the hotel shines in location, it lacks in detail. Incidentals deposit is $75 A NIGHT and not for the whole stay, pls be aware. Yes, the rooms are small but it was clean and it served my holiday purpose. I may be back however I don't think Cassa would be my first choice.

I spent 2 nights at the Cassa in relation to business, and was totally ok. The people in the reception were nice and gave good advice. Room was ok size for a NY hotel. If I am to say what made me not fall in love with the hotel, was it could actually been even a bit more clean. Also I really like to be able to make myself a cup of coffee in the morning in the room. So the devil lays in the details I guess.

The facility was very nice. The desk clerks very gracious and helpful. The concierge extremely knowledgeable and also quite helpful. Location is near a major bus and subway station which is great for getting around however that location is a healthy walk to Time Square and Broadway - where much of NY action is. We are walkers so it worked for us nicely. The price savings compared to comparable hotels closer to Time Square were significant - enough to feed us daily and then some.

Cassa Hotel on 45th St, between 5th Ave & 6th Ave, is definitely a winner. This hotel is in a great location. It’s a few blocks from Time Square, a very short walk to Bryant Park, so close to subways and right down the street from shopping on 5th Ave. These are just a few examples of the locale.  When we visit NYC we don’t spend much time in the room but I want a comfortable, clean, quiet place to sleep. Cassa 45 met or exceeded all these expectations. The room is small like most NYC hotel rooms but the room we were in, for 5 nights, was designed to give you room to move around with ease and not be cramped. The room and bathroom are modern, very clean and quiet.  I saved the best for last. The staff is outstanding. I was truly impressed by the courteousness of every staff person I encountered. They were also very helpful by offering us assistance with directions and recommending lovely restaurants. Cassa on 45th St should be proud of the people that they have chosen to represent their hotel. I will definitely return.
Stayed here for a few nights for a business trip I was on 27th floor room was very nice,staff helpful my only disappointment was the lack of a mini bar /fridge.The rest of the facilities were good!!!

The location and staff at Cassa hotel really make the difference. It is a small hotel with lovely rooms. You expect NYC hotel rooms to be small, as this one was, but not uncomfortably so. The bed was nice and very comfortable. The bathroom roomy and modern. My husband and I travelled to NYC for just two nights. The staff were attentive and helpful. The room rate was reasonable (by NYC standards). We will come back.

Location was great, just few blocks from Times square. Room was clean and nicely decorated. Nothing special though.Just around the corner there is Red Flame diner, where you can get breakfast at reasonable price.

We stayed in Cassa hotel for the second part of our trip to NYC. It completely and entirely met our expectations: the staff was extremely nice, the atmosphere of the hotel is young and welcoming, the room is super clean & modern and the bathroom is huge. The free Wi-Fi is the icing on the cake. The hotel is very well situated, we did everything by foot: Times Square, 5th Avenue, Central Park. We definitely recommend it to everyone who appreciate the quality rest after long walks in the city that never sleeps:)
user_name:
Tatiana526
French Riviera - Cote d'Azur, France

review_body: Cassa Hotel, between 45th & 6th, is very conveniently located. Rooms are basic - I expected a little more - with nice TV and wifi services. The absence of a lobby, a breathing area at the entrance, is understandable given the location but I missed it anyway. Indicated for a short stay, especially on business.

I stayed in Cassa hotel for just one night but it was enough to appreciate the quality of the hotel. The stuff was very helpfull. They helped us to carry the luggage until we catch a cab at the corner of the street. The room is huge, very confortable. It is located 2 blocks away from Times Sq.

We only stayed at this hotel for one night before catching a flight back home - our experience was second to none.The staff are absolutely incredible and went out of their way to assist us with baggage storage and an earlier check in.The hotel is centrally located on W 45th Street - between Ave of the America's and 5th Ave - this is right in the heart of Midtown. Far enough from Times Square to have no noise and the street itself goes quiet at night.We loved the terrace on the 10th floor - great views for Midtown.Our room was on the 19th floor - large with a large bed, large TV and large bathroom - you get the idea. For New York, there is no lack of space at this hotel.We did not do breakfast or visit the restaurant, so I cannot comment on those.Across the street there is a place called 'Jack's' - this is a big and relatively cheap shop to get your hands on nearly anything - from food to gifts. We were happy to buy most of our NYC gifts here to take home to family and friends.Fab hotel and we would love to stay here again.

This hotel was perfect for us. It is just minutes away from Times Square and 5th avenue, 15 mins to Central Park and 15 mins to the Hudson piers to get boats to lower Manhattan, 10 mins to the Empire State and 5 mins to top of the rock. Everything we wanted to do was in walking distance! We were on the 27th floor and the room was clean and well maintained, the beds are very comfy. I would have liked coffee facilities in the room but you do get free coffee in the lobby every morning. The staff were very helpful and friendly, I would stay here again

I arrived late on the 2nd of August 2015.Checkin was pretty fast and the bell boy was very helpful.When we got to the room we found to our dismay that the room was so small so we went back to the reception to find out if we could get a bigger room at a cost.They told us there were no rooms available but could sell us an additional room which I declined.How could I leave a 14 year old in a room alone?The next morning we tried to have a breakfast just before 10,and had a shock with was was available.We both had a croissant which was really tasteless.Our second day,we were awoken by a noise eary morning.Next to our room,they had started doing some work,and this lasted all morning.We went back to the reception and the lady was very nice and apologized.She even sent to the room some chocolates and wrote a handwritten apology.We will not really go back.

We were very impressed with the location of the hotel and cleanliness of our room! Only blocks away from Times Square and walking distance to shopping and ton so restaurants! Will definitely stay again on our next trip to NYC!

This was my first time visiting New York, and I'm happy that I spent it at the Cassa. I traveled with my aunt, my cousin and his friend. We only stayed for a few days, but we definitely made the most out of it. The hotel had a clean, fresh design and the location couldn't have been any better. We were very pleased with the staff, but there was one staff member that stood out in particular. His name is Edgar and he was beyond helpful. He worked at the front desk, and he was one of the first employees that we interacted with. He is tall, handsome and has a great beard. He provided us with the best service possible, and made sure that we had the best food New York had to offer. He mastered the art between being professional, and carrying the warmth that made us feel at home. People like Edgar kill the "New Yorkers are rude"-rumor, by a wide margin. We will definitely be back!

Stayed at the Cassa as part of our summer holiday. We had a brilliant stay as the staff were very helpful and welcoming. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Only issue was breakfast. For the price there was little choice and breakfast area was a little gloomy. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

This hotel was more like a European hotel than what one usually finds in the U.S. It is a combination of a hotel and residential units. The hotel was very pleasant, a quiet escape from the intensity of the city. The lobby is quite small, but the staff was always very helpful. Wi-Fi was free in the room, something that is somewhat hard to find in NY.

Stayed here for a few days and was very impressed! Great location! Staff were all super friendly, professional and were heaps of help in recommending local places to eat, subway advice etc. Resonably priced for NYC, too. Big thumbs up.

I cannot recommend this hotel enough. Brilliant location, within walking distance to many attractions including Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Terminal, Byrant Park, Macys etc. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful especially Sam who helped us with our heavy bags and who also arranged transport to the airport after we checked out. Complimentary tea and coffee in the morning and infused water in the afternoon was a lovely touch and much needed! Rooms were a reasonable size and very clean. Would definitely stay here again.

nice room very comercial area tones of restaurants, and good places for breakfast, clean rooms, it's a housing building,very nice staff i had to mentioned Jasmine Chastine, Adil A., Lendel David the manager very nice.the staff very nice people. is may second time there i will back.thank you CASSA
The location is in excellent distance to TimeSquare and 5th Ave.Very friendly and helpful staff.Comfortabel, very clean rooms. Always been cleaned up.Quite place to stay in a city that never sleeps.

Had a good 3 night stay. While they bill themselves as a boutique hotel, it's really a mix of hotel floors with corporate housing/extended stay floors, which I think is about 50/50. The rooms are very small, but the property is extremely clean and floors are whisper quiet. Location/General Upkeep: 4/5 - Good midtown location near eats, theaters, subway stations. The lobby is very narrow and you must walk through the small check-in line area to access the elevator bay. It was crowded when I checked in at 4pm on a weekday with one desk agent working. It was about a 15 minutes from the time I walked in the door until I was in my room. Staff Attentiveness: 4/5 - Bellhop was great hailing cabs, assisting with luggage, but because there aren't a large volume of guests (I assume) so sometimes the front desk was unmanned or the service line, when called from the room, went unanswered. Could've been a fluke during my stay, but I didn't get the sense that the amount of desk staff was adequate. Room Appointments:4/5 - The beds and bedside are very low to the ground, and the room was very small - I was alone but would've been super tight with a partner simply because the space for a second suitcase just isn't there. The bathroom was a good size when compared to the proportion of the room - shower had good pressure. I never saw or heard another person on my floor - it was very quiet. Ancillary Services: 5/5 - Housekeeping was consistent, there's a fancy restaurant kind of below the lobby (you can oversee it through a glass partition by the elevators bays) which was great but very pricey. Elevators: 2/5 - There were only 2 elevators and during my stay one was down for maintenance. This resulted in housekeeping/room service/hotel staff competing for elevator time with hotel guests and the longer-term residents. It was definitely slow at times, but they should have another way to divert the operational traffic in such an instance, as perhaps the service elevator (guessing there is one) was down as well.

Stayed here for the Ball drop in Times Square. Hotel was adequate - comfortable bed, nice shower. Location was perfectly located for sightseers but not for the Ball drop. Lobby was very minimal. Great restaurant located below the hotel, unfortunately closed when we visited. Service was not consistent - some good service and another time not helpful at all - generally the staff inform the guests of the hotels amenities - but due to the lack of staff during the festive time, we were not informed.One criticism is that we had to wait for ages for our luggage to be taken to our room - based on point above.But nevertheless, good experience.

We love this nice little boutique hotel. Great location, literally in the heart of Manhattan. The room was a pretty good size compared to other Manhattan hotels. The staff was so friendly and accommodating. We want to say a special thanks to Lendel David from the front desk who was very helpful and efficient and always had a smile on his face :)

Stayed here for a work training session. Good location in midtown, close to where the training was held. The lobby is very minimalist, but check in was quick and friendly enough. The room was a decent size with a comfortable bed. The bathroom was large with a good shower and nice toiletries. As noted above, I was traveling for work and the room didn't have an iron or ironing board. Not a major problem, I was heading out to meet some colleagues for drinks and when I was leaving I told the front desk I needed an iron in my room and gave them my room number. When returned to my room later - no iron or board. I called the front desk and asked for an iron and ironing board, their response: "when do you need it?" That didn't really seem acceptable to me given that I had already asked for it a few hours ago. I would have given the Cassa 4 stars if they didn't screw that up.

This was a good find in New York City. Location is good with easy access to shopping on 5th Ave and minutes from Times Square.The staff are friendly and rooms are quite spacious for Manhattan.The only minor things, as I was traveling for work, was that the free internet seemed very slow for USA connection and the room did not have enough lights for working.Otherwise, a good stay and would recommend.

our apartment on the 44th floor is large, clean and modern. It has 2 bedrooms and 2 en suites with plenty space for a family of 4. The staff at reception are always very friendly and helpful. We would recommend staying here.

We stayed for 15 nights at Cassa Hotel. It was our second time in New York, but the first in this hotel. We were my wife, my one year old daughter and I. We can only say that the entire stay was wonderful. The location could not be better, right in Midtown, just one block from Times Square but on a relatively quiet street (45 west).The staff were always attentive to detail and willing to give recommendations on attractions in the city. In addition, always they greeted us with a smile and a warm greeting. Special mention for Jasmine, who from day one bothered to remember our names and make us feel at home.About the room: we were pleasantly surprised, it was more spacious than we thought, according to the parameters of Manhattan. It was really quit dispite the central location of the Hotel. They put a crib for our baby which was very convenient. All the impeccably furnished and immaculate daily housekeeping. Free WiFi included.As for breakfast, although we did not have it included, every day they afforded free coffee and tea in the reception, which was great.Definitely we recommend this Hotel to our friends, family and the whole community of TirpAdvisor for staying here.

I stayed two nights at the Cassa for a business trip and it was A-MAZING! From check in to check out the service was impeccable. The rooms are quaint and gorgeous. I love the decor and ambience. The staff was super friendly and helpful; and I used the Concierge alot. They recommended great places to eat (which were all yummy). Can't wait to visit again.

This hotel was ideal for our 1st visit to New York. It was extremely clean, sheets and towels changed every day and it was warm and comfortable. It had everything we needed for a City Break. 5/6 minute walk to Times Square so close enough for everything. We would certainly stay there again.

Passing by on the street, you could easily mistake the hotel for a nice, modern apartment building. Small lobby. Set back from the street. Restaurant has greater street profile that the hotel. But the hotel does the trick for those looking for a well-appointed, quiet, and modern room in the center of it all. It's just as easy to get uptown as downtown and to go east or west. And the bonus is that it's set back enough off of Times Square that you don't feel the madness that is that part of town. My king-sized room appeared to be a little smaller than other NYC hotels but the enormous walk-in shower with a powerful rain shower head made up for it. I felt more like I was staying in a quiet and private modern designer apartment building than a hotel. And that was a good thing. Staff was always attentive and friendly -- again due to the size it was impossible to get lost in the crowd. Another good thing. All in all a great place to stay in NYC.

I have stayed 2 nights at the hotel in april 2015. I arrived at 2:45 Pm and room was not ready. The lobby was still under construction and there were cables every where. Room was tinybsuitable for 1 adult only. However bathroom and room were clean and the hotel conviently located close to time'square and the 5th avenue. Room was very calm and therr is a very nice deli close by

From the time we entered the hotel we were very pleased, hotel was visually appealing and very clean. The staff was extremely pleasant and accommodating. We were checked in by Edgar and Alicia and they were very helpful and knowledgeable and made our stay Great. Our room was not ready when we arrived but Edgar and Alicia immediately rectified the situation and there was no delay in service. The room was great ,small but clean the beds were comfortable, the bathroom was really nice. When leaving the hotel someone was always there to asks if we needed directions or info on places to eat etc.. One of the front staff Sam was also there with information and to see if we needed anything, he promptly hailed us a cab and made sure we were situated. We were checked out by Edgar who once again was very helpful and directed us to the correct location to catch our bus home, we really appreciated his help because we thought we were supposed to return to where we were dropped off which was not the case. Overall our experience was GREAT due to the wonderful staff and comfortable accommodations.
user_name:
Shima03
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This modern hideaway in the middle of town was a great value for a comfortable and well appointed, modern room. The queen bed was very comfortable, the room cleanly designed and the shower had excellent water pressure. The bus from Newark Airport stops two blocks from here, and guests are steps away from all that NY has to offer. Although the room was smaller than what you might find in another city, the size was fine (same as at many other hotels) and did not feel in any way claustrophobic. My room faced an inner courtyard which I requested to ensure quiet. I will definitely stay here again! Thanks also to the friendly staff for making me feel welcomed. As a GHA member I got free wifi and a good rate--sign up for that!

Our executive room was a reasonably priced and adequate in size and appointments. The wifi worked very well and was included. All the staff were excellent. Apollo who greeted us in the lobby went our of his way to help us. One of our better experiences in New York and we will go back.

Visited the Cassa on west 45th street for a week in July after a friend recommended it.We felt really welcome in the hotel and the staff were always on reception to talk and help with directions and any other info we required.We stayed in room 1406 and were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room. The bed was massive and very very comfortable with the room being spotlessly cleaned every single day.Great location bang in the centre of Manhattan and pretty close to the subway.Butter, the restaurant below is very very good if a little bit expensive. (try the Capitava pasta!!)5 star review and would recommend to anyone.

This boutique hotel is centrally located, and very close to Times Square and Bryant Park. We arrived very early in the morning, tired and freezing, and were immediately greeted by exceptional front desk staff who were quick to point out that we could enjoy a free cup of tea or coffee anytime at the lobby to warm up. Service was fast, polite and fuss free. The rooms were small but very clean. I loved the bright and stylish minimalistic bathroom. Bed was soft and comfortable. Breakfast was free. This hotel exceeded my expectations. I would definitely stay here again, for business or for a holiday.

This hotel was very comfortable. The staff was courteous and helpful. The location was great for theater goers or others with mid-town destinations. You wouldn't know this hotel was there unless you were looking for the specific address, which I see as a plus.

We stayed at the Cassa Hotel Thursday through Sunday. We arrived Thursday morning and were pleased with the option of storing your luggage prior to check in. We also utilized this service after we checked out, so that we could spend more time in the city before our flight Sunday night. The hotel is nice with a pleasant staff. Everything is in walking distance to the hotel, but far enough that it's not noisy at night. I recommend Cafe 45 down the street for breakfast. I had one incident with the elevator, and the staff was quick to take action and remedy the situation. Another couple went with us, and the only issue they're having now is they received a charge for $510.00 on their credit card (not pending- it cleared). When they called the hotel, the person answering pointed to Expedia, but it says Cassa - not Expedia. Expedia also verified it was not them as their charges begin with a series of numbers. They have had to dispute the charge since the hotel would not research, and it takes up to 10 days. The hotel stated they only saw the $75 dollar for incidentals which should have gone away. Unfortunately, I think they'll be hesitant to go back.

We stayed at the Cassa in late spring. We find its location very convenient to the theater district (our destination) but just far enough away that its position is surprisingly quiet. The lobby is vanishingly small - I think there were a total of just 2 guest chairs in the lobby. However, the front desk staff was friendly and professional. The rooms are quite small, but this is par for the course in manhattan. We had a fridge, but no minibar. Our only complaint about the room was that the HVAC was intolerably noisy.
