My boyfriend and I stayed at the Cassa for a long weekend and we couldn't have been happier with the hotel. Upon arrival, we were greeted by an amazing staff, who was so nice and helpful. We were there celebrating my birthday, and after coming back to the hotel after a Friday night out, we were happily surprised to find a bottle of champagne along with a note from the hotel, wishing me a happy birthday. Every day the hotel staff was friendly, and helped us with any questions we had about the area.The only two things that were minor issues was that one of the elevators were out, so the elevator took a very long time to reach floors. At most, we waited about seven minutes for the elevator to come to our floor. The only other thing was that the breakfast buffet, was not worth the $15.50 they charge, as the options are very limited, and more like a continental breakfast than a buffet. It consisted of bagels, muffins, eggs, bacon, and small waffles. Also while having breakfast, they were doing some minor constructing in the restaurant, and were using a loud saw, so most people didn't stay down long to finish their meal, so in the end I paid $15.50 for a bagel. Other than the breakfast and elevator, the hotel is great! I would stay again, as the location is perfect and close to all major attractions.

I love to stay very close to Time Square and this location was amazing, just 1 large block and half of a small block away. The hotel was very quiet, had a fantastic air conditioning system was fantastic and quiet, and the bathroom was large with a phenomenally large shower with good water pressure. The only improvement would be the lobby which is small. I understand that the lobby is going to be redone in the near future. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay.

Stayed at Cassa 45th street for 3 days from July 5 to July 8 in a Deluxe King room with my fiancée. We got the 15th floor.Pros:(+) The room is small but its the standard for this location. Everything was clean and properly cleaned everyday during our leaves. The bed is very soft and comfortable and the pillows are also very soft. Maybe too soft since my fiancée was complaining she was drowning in the pillows because your head sinks in them very deep. The bathroom shows slight signs of wear but nothing unpleasant to the eye. Also no street noise at all.(+) The staff was always smiling and helpful.(+) The breakfast buffet from 7AM to 11AM is very useful to start your day if 15,50 USD per person does not scare you. Its slightly pricy but thats NYC standard. The menu is : bagels of various types, raisin muffins, raisin scones, apples/oranges, mashed eggs, belgian waffles and bacon, orange juice and milk.(++) Location! Close to Times Square and 5th avenue. You will not have enough of 3 days to visit everything thats within 15 minutes of walking from the hotel.Cons :(-) As far our room was concerned, the -city view- advertised was a view to the bland brick wall of the building behind the hotel. (-) The lobby is just painted concrete with 2 desks and a table for coffee. Its very minimalist.(-) 6$ USD for a water bottle.(-) AC system hidden by a simple metal cover. Makes humming noises and water drop noises that breaks the otherwise noiseless room ambiance.Useful tips:-- 1 minute away from Cassa there is a Duane Reade drugstore open 24 hours for any late night cravings like a sandwich or a coke.-- CAREFUL with the 2 bottles of water that are in your room when you arrive. Its 6 USD if you open one. The price is on top of the cap so its not obvious.

Was in NYC for work, this hotel was in a great location from where we needed to be each day in Mid-Town.While I wanted to love this hotel, I ended up liking it a lot and appreciating a few of the nice features.> Bed & Bathroom, specifically the beautiful walk-in shower = LOVED> Size of room - smaller than average in my opinion, and I have stayed in a number of NYC hotels> Elevators were fast. Things that were meh..> No lobby. No place to meet when we were trying to go out or even work. I ended up finding the work space on the 10th floor which was nice, but the chairs were terrible. Note to Cassa: No one wants to sit in waffle, metaly chairs without a cushion. They were awful and hurt your legs and butt...> Water was available downstairs but half the time it was empty> Butter while amazing in all foody ways, the lounge closed way too early and made it impossible for an after dinner drink. You would think that there'd be enough pull from the hotel to keep it open later.Overall, it was a good stay and enjoyed my time there.
user_name:
ValerieS775
North Andover, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: Mother/daughter ( age 18) trip. First time at Cassa Hotel in NYC. Excellent location. Friendly staff. Very quiet at night. Clean room. Comfortable king bed. Nice bathroom larger than most NYC bathrooms. Easy access to theaters, Rockefeller Center, 5th Ave shopping, Bryant Park and Times Square. Overall very satisfied and will return.

This hotel is in a great location which is in the heart of NYC. The hotel rooms were more spacious than we thought they would be and the bathroom was great. The rooms were very clean and the staff friendly. The only thing we did not like was not having access to a microwave.

Great hotel, location is brilliant for Times Square, room was excellent but small, although had a desk for me to work at, and wifi that actually had good download speeds. Bathroom was very clean with lots of towels, hairdryer, and provisions. Bed was very low to ground and a double size, but was exceptionally comfy. Butter restaurant is in the basement and is expensive but food looks great - I didn't eat there as had other dinner plans. Reception staff are excellent and attentive. Reception area is small though with little seating. There is no hotel bar and the only available refreshments are coffee and tea served in paper cups from flasks in reception - perfectly acceptable but no frills. Outside the hotel there is a local supermarket at Duane Reades and a Pret a Manger, plus lots of good bars and restaurants nearby. On the whole, a clean and well run hotel, with no frills, but with good rooms.
user_name:
James S
Carluke, Scotland, United Kingdom

review_body: Stayed at the Cassa for 6 nights! It was amazing! The room and bathroom were huge!! Everything was immaculately clean! Giant TV, with lots of channels, super comfortable bed+pillows! The shower was enormous with a large rainfall type shower head+separate handheld. ALL staff were super friendly! Every employee we came across in the lobby, elevator, hallway, greeted us with a friendly hello, asking how we were enjoying our day. ALWAYS got a hi and bye any time we entered or left the building! Got a quick response to any thing we needed! Hotel is located in a perfect spot, easy walk anywhere, but very quiet too! Lots of places to eat up and down the street! We absolutely loved this hotel, and will be staying here again for sure!!

Our stay at The Cassa was short and sweet - 2 days only and we weren't at the hotel much but it has all the amenities you need in a great central location close to Times Square. We booked as it is part of the Viceroy hotel which is a very reputable brand. It was more on the simple side - not a lot of bells and whistles but it's perfect for a quick stay.

The location of this hotel is only a few short avenues from many Broadway theaters, Times Square, and other Mid-town attractions. Also just a block or two to subway lines, while not the best for getting around the city, do connect within a few stops to lines that do.The hotel room was quite nice, modern, clean and very quiet even though my room faced 45 th Street. When checking in I asked for a higher floor and the clerk said the hotel was built to keep out street noise. (This certainly was not always the case with noise in the hallway outside my room.). The only thing a bit odd was the cold water in the bathroom. I've stayed in hotels where I had to run the hot water to get hot water. In this hotel I had to run the cold water to get cold water, otherwise it is as very warm. Not at all a big deal- other than a waste of water. Across the street from the hotel is a plaza with lots of chairs and tables. During the week there are many food trucks parked on 46 th street and choices are varied. Two mornings I got some coffee and read the paper there and it was most pleasant.

Perfect getaway to NYC with a girlfriend! Can't wait to go back with my husband. Our room was just perfect, on the 21st floor, a little view, modern, new, pristine, gorgeous bathroom, super comfortable bed/pillows, and quiet. Location was great...we walked to great restaurants, museums, and theatre; no need for subway, bus, or cabs. I got a great room rate, and everyone at the front desk/reception were very nice, helpful, and friendly. Oh, and free wifi!

Nice hotel, but maybe not luxury as it is rated in some sites. I would rate it 3-star. The gym at the hotel is 3 blocks away and the stocked mini-bar is nowhere. Iron and iron-board is not in the room as advertised - you have to order it!

Excellent location, very friendly, helpful and courteous staff. Decent size room which was very clean. Don't let the size of the lobby fool you. The complimentary beverages were appreciated, especially the fruity water in the afternoon after a hot summer day. Free Wifi, large TV. But did I tell you it was in a great location.

Pros:- Very hip and modern, lots of personality in the décor.- My room was very clean. Everything looked brand new. - Well suited for business travel--desk and lots of easily accessible outlets.- Located very close to Times Square (and Bryant Park, one of my favorite places)- Staff was very friendly.- I love the stall shower with no tub! Really, more business hotels should do this. Tubs are gross and who uses them other than families with kids (which this hotel is definitely not geared towards).Cons:- Rooms are small and I think they only have double beds. As a solo traveler this was fine, but if I were traveling with my husband, this would never have worked for us. - Fitness center debacle: The hotel doesn't have a fitness center, so they have contracted with Equinox Gym, a couple of blocks away, for guests to use. Which would be okay--not great, but okay--except that there is a hotel directory in your room that says the fitness center is on tenth floor. There is a little sticker on the inside of your keycard holder that mentions the Equinox but 1) it doesn't say anything about the fitness center on the 10th floor no longer being available, it sounds the Equinox is an extra alternative and 2) who looks in the keycard holder for information about the fitness center? That's what the hotel directory is for. So the note in the keycard holder is basically just an out for the staff to say you were told about the fitness center when you wake up an hour early to work out and realize that you really needed to wake up an hour and 20 minutes early and now aren't going to be able work out or go back to sleep. That's the sort of thing that gets your TripAdvisor review downgraded by at least a point.- The hotel doesn't really have any sort of lobby to speak of. I had to make a phone call after I checked out and normally this is something I would do from a quiet spot in the hotel lobby, but not at this hotel.- The restaurant in the hotel is very hip and trendy and popular. Which you would think would be a positive but what it means is that, as a solo traveler, you are going to have to find someplace else to eat (and if you aren't a solo traveler, I'm not sure this is the hotel for you). Likewise if you just want to have a glass of wine at the end of a long day of travel/meetings.

Fab hotel, fab location, fab staff!Lovely modern hotel based two blocks from Times Square (a five minute walk). Lovely caring staff including excellent maid service. Amenities are available on request such as parking, ironing board and iron, coffee maker etc, the rooms are a tad small but quite typical for NYC, I would have no hesitation staying here again.

I lived in the studio (37th floor) of hotel for half a year. The staff is communicative and helpfull. The location is excellent. The rooms are beautiful. The facilities are new, stylish and modern. I enjoyed the partnership with Equinox. Great time.

We just stayed for the weekend to see some shows and enjoy the sights and you can't beat the location, service and room quality. The staff were friendly and efficient. The room was spotless and quiet. The elevator was VERY fast. Price was $218 for Friday night; $245 for Saturday.

The location and staff were stellar. The room was updated and nice (fabulous shower). The only thing to remember about this hotel is that customers who use bidding sites to book the hotel get only tiny little rooms with one double bed. We upgraded for $100 and our room was nice. Just glad I called in advance to verify the room we were assigned.

The hotel has great service. I was suppose to receive a complimentary upgrade but it was all booked up according to staff. The toilet got clogged and I waited almost 2 hours for the engineer to fix, but because of delay they gave a complimentary breakfast. Bottle of water in room is $6 each! Too bad the the fridge did not have alcoholic drinks. Accidental deposit is good price! Room is decent looking. The only cosmetic product I liked was the lotion but shampoo and both bar and liquid soap have a very neutral smell, which is good if you do not want smell other than your perfume. Great food for sure!

Staff is so friendly and helpful, location is amazing right in the middle of everything so close Jasmine worked behind the counter and she was the best very welcoming. Overall loved it will recommend to my friends who travel.

Ideally situated near Broadway shows, great staff service, modern and clean. Perfect if you want to be near the theaters and Hells Kitchen. A little pricey, but not wildly so. Industrial decor, but not depressingly so. This is a good bet if you don't mind paying a little more for a sure thing.
user_name:
schulzwh
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The reception area is very compact with an industrial look to it but the personnel is efficient, helpful and friendly. The rooms are very small but clean and one is not in New York to stay in your room. The bed is softer than I would like but comfortable enough. Great stay!

We took the TripAdvisor Special rate, and we're very pleased with the savings off of other discount rates offered by both booking agencies and the hotel website.Great room, clean, quiet with excellent front desk service! Excellent robes, towels, and TV. Internet service can be slow at times. Coffee in the morning and Wall Street Journal available for all.Whether business or travel, great location ! Don't miss it!

We have visited NYC many times and only ever returned to a hotel once as we like to stay around Manhattan. We chose Cassa Hotel as we know the area extremely well it is located between 5th & 6th Avenue, there are various coffee shops, drug stores & even a discount store in the surrounding area. The hotel itself has both bedroom's and private residence's. Upon check in we were greeted with a very warm welcome, our room was ready even though we had arrived slightly before check in. The rooms are tastefully decorated & spotlessly clean, and actually a very good size for NYC! In the room there was a safe, a fridge for guests to store their own drink's /food's, huge dressing mirror, enormous television and the most comfortable bed with amazing pillows. The bathroom had ample amounts of towels, including dressing gowns and a nice selection of toiletries should you need them and again was spotless clean. The rooms are serviced on a daily basis and look immaculate for your return. We had several packages sent to the hotel which they were more than happy to accept for us. On a rainy day the hotel had enough umbrella's for all guests to head out into the city. The reception team greeted you every time you entered or left the hotel, it truly felt like we were part of the furniture in no time. We didn't eat in the restaurant as we often ate late, however, it always has a buzz about it and from what I could see was reasonably priced for the area the hotel is in. We truly have nothing but praise for the hotel and the staff, from the door man who ran into the busy Manhattan streets at anytime to hail you a cab to the charming chamber maids who always took time to say hello everyone TRULY makes you feel welcome. We cannot thank the staff enough for their help and ensuring that we had a truly memorable trip for our 10th Anniversary. Thank you guys we will be back!!!

Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Cassa and Residences Hotel. What a fantastic location and comfortable hotel the beds and pillows were heavenly. It is a few minutes walk to Time Square and perfectly located to be able to walk to most other attractions. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Jonathan and all the reception staff couldn't do enough for you and Sam who helped us get a taxi on a very rainy evening never gave up until he had flagged one down, think he would have laid down in the road if he had to. We will definitely be returning to this hotel.Stayed June 2015, travelled with friends.

Preferred the small property. Quick check in, very friendly staff, especially the doorman. Surprised by the dim lighting in the lobby area. There was a private event so the restaurant was closed which did not affect me. Plenty of amenities nearby. I was in town for work and a running race at Central Park. Great location. Walked or ran everywhere I needed to go. Only negative was lack of counter space in bathroom (modern decor). Would stay again and recommend.

Just back this morning from a fabulous 4 night stay at Cassa Hotel. The hotel is very well positioned midtown, very close to Times Square and the Broadway theatres. Accommodation was very good, good standard of rooms and amenities. Beds, bedding and pillows were beyond comfortable. But what made it was the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Jonathan and all other reception staff couldn't do enough for us, and many thanks to Sam for helping us so much with our luggage. This is a hotel to return to definitely! !! Made our stay ab fab! !

I choose this hotel based on the pictures on its site, I was not disappointed as it was exactly as I expected The front desk help as well as all others encountered were totally friendly and professional, Thank you ( Vilma,Andrea,Alton,Felix,Adranna) they greeted me by name and made me feel like family a difficult fete when staying alone in NYC, absolutely the best service I've ever encountered. My stay was for 5 nights and I hated to leave. This was the cleanest hotel I ever encountered, It was so nice to come home to, whatever they use to clean is so fresh smelling. The continental breakfast was a nice way to start the day and the Hershey Kisses were a perfect way to end it. I look forward to my next stay.PS The lights in the safes are awesome.

With Cassa being so reasonably priced for the area, I was not sure what to expect. The location was perfect. It is just a short walk from Times Square. The staff were beyond friendly and kind. They welcomed us with genuine smiles and even checked us in several hours earlier than our check-in time since space was available. The process took less than 5 minutes. Our room was clean and beautiful. We fell in love with the large shower and rainfall shower head. The bathrobes are always a nice luxurious touch. The bed and pillows were dreamy! We did not feel like we were in the city because everything was so quiet!! On Saturday night we returned from our show and dinner and were surprised with birthday champagne on ice from hotel management. To say I was touched is putting it mildly. I was exuberant and this gesture really made our weekend. I was instantly on Facebook and text messages telling everyone how amazing Cassa Hotel is! We will only stay here on any future trips. Only word of warning is I did the pre-pay on their site but they do not charge your card until you get there. I used my debit card and they put on a hold of $75 for incidentals that I have not got back yet.

If you want to be in the heart of it all in NYC this is a great place to go...clean rooms...EXTREMELY friendly staff and a great interior decor make this a fun hotel to stay in. A great stay...would stay again.
user_name:
tmalley2177
Syracuse, New York, United States

review_body: Spent the night at Cassa for a work function and it was very nice. The front desk was very nice, inviting and helpful. The room was great. My wife loved the Robes. Bed was very comfortable and place was spotless. Bathroom and shower was very large for NYC.

Hotel is very new, completely refurbished. It's very modern. Staff was extremely friendly. Room is quiet even though close to Time Square. I travel extensively for business all year long and this is definitely a good quality/price. Will come back.

When I travel to New York City, Cassa Hotel is a sure bet for an outstanding hotel. The rooms are very well appointed in addition to being spotless and comfortable. The hotel staff is by far and away the nicest, most accommodating group of young kids in the city. You can't go wrong with Cassa Hotel.

I had business in the theater district, and this hotel was perfectly located. I was able to walk to all my meetings - never even had to use subway or a cab! And it was just 3 blocks from the Broadway shows I chose to see, near tons of restaurants, just three blocks from Bryant Park. (Butter downstairs in the hotel is a terrific restaurant.) It was not hard to walk to MoMA or the Chelsea flea market either. My room was large by NYC standards, with a rain head shower, comfortable bed, and large windows. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Nice little fitness center on 10th floor with free weights, aerobic machines, and a universal machine. Complimentary coffee in the lobby each morning. Wifi is free and worked pretty well - one evening it went in and out, but most of the time is was fine. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat - I had a great time.

Cassa Hotel is another "hipster" hotel in the lineage of the type of design inaugurated by Ian Schrager. From the perspective of the young adventure traveler, rooms are sleek, modern and cool. But from the perspective of a seasoned traveler, they're sparse, under-furnished and inspired by IKEA. Even upgraded rooms have one chair, no dresser, no iron, and limited size. Even more: the hotel has no lobby or common areas to reader or entertain guests. In the end, it's just another basic hotel in midtown Manhattan-- overly priced by normal standards. The hotel has multiple residence floors, and is well-managed, clean and secure. It's location is central and easily accessible by taxi, foot, subway or walking. But in the end, you wonder what exactly you're paying for.

ALLwas perfect: location, value-for-your-money-in-New York, service, clean, everything. I can certainly recommend this hotel. Take it from a new yorker myself! Around the corner from Times Square, yet on a quiet street. Nice restaurants on the same block too. Don't miss the second-hand bookshop right across the street or the cuban restaurant a bit further down the street too. Excellent!

Claim to be boutique hotels somehow seems to absolve many Manhattan hotels for using cheap plastic furniture, lesser quality room items and poor design. However, The Cassa truly is a high quality boutique hotel with high quality appointments. Although a typically smaller New York City room, it was set up so well that it had more usable space than many much larger rooms, so I had no want or need for more space. Excellent quality throughout its minimalist, tastefully done design. Great bathroom, quality accoutrements and bathrobes. Large windows for natural light and (rooftop, in my case) Manhattan views, if so desired. Great staff, all friendly and helpful, despite “cool” appearance that often is harbinger of bad attitudes. Part of building is condos also. This is a great find. Easy walk to Grand Central Station and various mid-town points, that easily costs double or triple other places nearby.

Location is great with Broadway, 5th Ave, Times Sq etc just a few minutes walk away. Rooms not super luxurious and a little dark but clean and nice enough. My room was on the 26th floor so no outside noise issues. No breakfast served here but there are plenty of places just a few yards away so not really an issue. My one beef is with the internet which was sooooo slooooowwww I stopped using it in the end. Play a video on Youtube? Forget it. I asked if they could maybe restart the local router but it didn't make any difference. This was more than made up for though, by the bed. Oh My God. One of the comfiest beds I've ever slept in. If I'm honest, there could be a dozen gripes and complaints, it wouldn't matter. The bed and the night's sleep it gave me would make me go back there for sure.

We stayed here back in November and found it to be a handy, pleasant place to stay.The room was a good size and we were not bombarded with traffic noise (I believe we were on the 4th floor). I found the staff to be consistently smiley and helpful throughout.The location is very convenient for most major attractions and served as an excellent base for our trip.
user_name:
Katie_and_Andrew2010
Newcastle and Gateshead, United Kingdom

review_body: This quiet little hotel is in a good location midway between Central Park and the Empire State Building, and between Times Square and Grand Central Terminal. It's a couple of short blocks from the red/orange subway lines and a couple of long blocks from the blue lines. It's sort of a hole in the wall without a regular lobby, but there are a couple of chairs near the front desk that will do in a pinch.My room was very quiet -- hardly any outside noise can be heard. I never heard any noises from other rooms, only the occasional very faint ding of the elevator down the hall. The air conditioning worked well and was easy to control and fairly quiet. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean, except for what I've noted below.The small room was mostly filled by the king bed and a small desk with an office chair. There were nightstands on each side of the bed with working lights. There was an electrical outlet on one side of the bed, but it did not work. The electrical outlets on the desk worked. The bathroom was a comfortable size with an excellent, roomy shower. The closet was a small but adequate cupboard.One afternoon I returned to the room about 4:30 p.m. (after being out most of the day) and the maid had just begun cleaning the room. Ugh. I had to go outside and walk around while she finished, and then she didn't clean the shower, perhaps because I had interrupted her and she felt hurried. I was there three nights and the maid never did replace depleted soaps or shampoos, etc.The room had a good-sized TV -- and a radio with an iPhone/iPod connection, but the connector is for an older generation iPhone 4. The free wifi worked well.All of the staff with whom I had personal interaction were very helpful and friendly. The only marks against the Cassa in my opinion are the so-so maid service and the non-working electrical outlet beside the bed.

Amazing location between the 5th and 6th avenues. Rooms were clean. Bed was comfortable. No big noice, even if you are in NY. Pleasant people and hot coffee for free every morning. Not a 5 because of the cost of breakfast and because of the overall cost; again, you are in NY!

Great location, friendly staff, complementary internet, very helpful concierge service, not very flexible on late checkouts! Max was one complementary hour any thing more than that would be charged for, half a day for two hours more and full day there after.The hotel has only two elevators, which is a bit of wait to get one. moreover, the hotel has no real looby! By the way rooms are nice but are small in size.

I was disappointed with everything about this hotel other than the location, which is fantastic. You are a stone's throw from Times Square and the street is quiet, so you will sleep well. Service was below average. Don't expect helps with your bags as you're checking in or an efficient check-in process; I just didn't feel welcomed or adequately helped. Hoping to enjoy room service? Not here. The room was nice and a decent size, but lacked character and a soul. The same can be said of the lobby. Overall, this was a forgettable stay in a forgettable hotel with few memorable, distinguishing attributes....Very disappointing, given the expectations.

My fiancé and I stayed at the hotel from Friday April 24th thru Monday April 27th. We had a great stay. Our room on the 22nd floor was cozy. The room is small, however, we had no issue with the room size. It was very clean and comfortable. The room had a safe and a small refrigerator. The bed was extremely comfortable and we slept great. The staff also provided us with a coffee pot and coffee daily so we could have coffee in the room. It was quiet - even with the window open. The bathroom was very clean and a nice size. The glass shower was roomy and had a rain shower head - which we loved. It also had a hair dryer. The staff was very friendly and helpful at every interaction. The location of the hotel was perfect - close to Times Square and also Grand Central Station. For a quick trip this hotel is perfect! We would definitely stay there again!

First, let me begin by saying that I review every hotel I stay at and it takes a lot to not get at least 4 stars from me. My sister and I stayed here this past weekend for a graduation trip. The room was clean, bathroom was clean......no complaints there. The lobby is a little drab, but who really cares about hanging out in the lobby of the hotel. Now, when you get on the elevators, the lights are extremely dim. Almost to the extent of being in the dark. Very odd. One week prior to arrival I emailed the hotel to ask about a pre-arrival bottle of champagne to have in the room to kick off our little girls trip. I was emailed back by Jasmine, who said of course that could be done and included a form for me to fill out which item I would like. She also needed a copy of my ID and debit card. I promptly filled out everything, made copies and sent back to her. I heard nothing back.....nothing. I emailed her several times and still nothing. Upon arrival, I did not want to say anything at the desk, hoping the champagne would be in the room. I was wrong. Needless to say I was disappointed. I sent her an email and asked for my information to be shredded. This did not ruin our trip, as I never mentioned it to my sister, however, I always believe that customer service is key and they did not deliver.

Nice and clean rooms, friendly staff, good location, big rooms, breakfast is ok for NY, the only thing is that there is not enought space for every costumer in the dining room and they use plastik cutlery and plates what is not very ecological!

Booked the hotel last second during Tribeca Film Festival. Price was decent comparing to other properties. Room was clean but tiny. Lobby area was my least favorite, doesn't look welcoming, no room to sit (there's one little table by the main entrace but that's about it). Room didn't have an iron, very strange. If hotel claims to be a boutique hotel this a definite miss. Can agree with other reviewers about sleep quality- it was very quite. Overall I will say that it's a good hotel for solo/business travelers. Close to Park Ave and other attractions.
user_name:
Slavyana S
New York City, New York

review_body: My family and I shared a 2 bed room. It was quite small, but there was enough space for 4 adults and their respective luggage bags to be laid out on the floor. The rooms and bathrooms were great--the double beds were comfy. Despite its location, it was surprisingly quiet in the night.

The Cassa is nothing short of fantastic. I booked this through Booking.com. I wasn't really sure what to expect. The rate was great and that's what sold me on it. I had a little trouble finding the hotel because of construction that was going on in front of it. It also doesn't look like a typical hotel entrance. I was told when booking that the lobby was under going renovations.I arrived earlier than expected in New York. I decided I would drop off my bag at the hotel. I arrived at Cassa around 11:30am and was told that my room was ready if I wanted to check in. So I did. What a great room. A large queen size bed. The bed was firm but not hard and had lots of pillows. I like lots of pillows. Bathroom was very modern, very clean and had a huge walk in shower. WiFi is free. If you needed more bandwidth then what Cassa provided you could buy more. I just needed it for my cell phone so I didn't bother. The hotel is in an excellent location. About a 5 minute walk to Times Square and theaters. Rockefeller Center is another five minutes or so away as well. Close to all sorts of restaurants as well.Easy to check out. I also liked the fact I could store my bag at the hotel while I walked around New York after I checked out. They didn't charge me anything for it either. I have to say I really really liked this place. I highly recommend this hotel you won't be disappointed.
user_name:
jasindc
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My husband, son & I spent 2 nights in a junior suite last week. This is a very new hotel, so new in fact that they do not have a liquor licence yet! They did recommend a bar directly across the road and a place that we could buy a bottle of wine to drink in their rooftop bar. The rooms are small but adequate. The White Company toiletries are a nice touch. The hotel is very central, we were 15 minutes walk from the circle line cruise and 2 minutes from the subway station at port authority. The complimentary breakfast was nice although the queues were long - perhaps a larger, faster toaster is required.. The fixtures are slightly cheap and this may result in a deterioration of the room quality as time passes. The air conditioning unit was also extremely noisy!Overall we enjoyed our stay,

We just got back from our 35th anniversary getaway at Cassa 45- what a wonderful experience. Room was clean and quiet and the bathroom was clean and the shower was excellent. The front desk staff especially Karina were so friendly, helpful and nice that we felt like real VIPs. Couldn't ask for anything more. Hopefully we will be back

I live in New York, but sometimes you just got to get away from the apartment and the kids so I took my wife out and booked a night at Cassa. Like most New Yorkers, we don't spend much time around Times Square. Unless you're going to a Broadway show, other neighborhoods have better things to do. But we do recognize it as a convenient hub for tourists. That said, Cassa is in an ideal location. The rooms are modern, clean, and inviting. And quiet! I never heard the traffic. Great service too. Waking up the next morning and walking up an empty Fifth Avenue past Rockefeller Center, St. Pat's, and sitting outside the plaza with a breakfast sandwich was a sublime way to rediscover our city.
user_name:
Postgray23
New York City, New York

review_body: Great Hotel for a quick shopping trip to New York. Great value with very helpful staff.Located great for Time Square and Broadway and short walk to Public Transport to the rest of NY or even NJ.Would definitely use this hotel again the next time I am in New York.

I stayed here for three nights in April of 2015. The location is great if you want to be Midtown. Personally I prefer the Village or Chelsea, so this location is not ideal for me, but a good deal on booking.com made me want to try this hotel anyway.I had requested a quiet room located as high up in the building as possible. My room was on the 21st floor, which is only halfway to the top of this tall structure, but it was high enough for me, and more importantly, the room was very quiet. That in combination with a heavenly bed meant I slept like a baby. The room was big enough for one person and kept nice and clean though some of the furniture looked a little worn. The waterfall shower in the bathroom was divine. Wifi was free but on the weak side. Closet space was limited but sufficient for one person for such a short stay. Elevators are fast but ridiculously dark (you almost need a flashlight to see which button to press) and make an annoying beeping sound for each floor they pass that can be heard from your room.The so called fitness room on the 10th floor has very limited equipment and looked messy and cluttered, which is why I chose not to make use of it. The terrace on the same floor was closed, unclear why. Breakfast is USD22 and did not look worth the price, a very small buffet in the restaurant in the basement, so I did not try that.As far as customer service and staff attitude go the bellboy was the only staff member who made the smallest attempt of being friendly, smiling etc - the rest of the staff in the small and somewhat cluttered lobby seemed aloof and disinterested. Not a smile, not a "thank you for staying with us" upon check-out, nothing. They seemed to be mostly preoccupied talking among themselves rather than focusing on the guests that they are there to provide service to.All in all a decent but not great and somewhat impersonal hotel with some improvement to do as far as service and certain details go, but which will work fine for a short stay if you want to be Midtown.

It was great in the hotel. All was really nice and clean! :) And Felix, ha Felix was really nice and also a good tour-guy. He show us nice places and take care of us!The Roof of the Hotel was amazing with a nice see of Newyork. Dankeschön

This was a place that I just tripped on. It was a hidden gem for NYC. From the girls at the desk (one of the young ladies complimented me every day about how great I liked in my suit) to the bellman. Then there was Luis who came up to clean my room because it was forgotten. He was incredible. He had a great attitude and was very complete. The room though small were modern and clean.

The hotel was really nice and clean. Very helpfull and friendly staff. Location!!! Thats the world :) great! It was our first tine in NYC. Short stay,but we could walk everywhere, so could explore a lot of the city. The price is very good too. Breakfast included. Great! Highly recomend!

I found this hotel on Expedia, it was very affordable an had great reviews already. The rooms are modern and very clean. The staff is very friendly and the location is great!! We will be back for sure. Many places to eat nearby and close to lots of attractions!

I very much enjoyed this hotel - very clean and well maintained. Rooms smallish but quiet and very comfortable. Ideal location for touring the city. Staff very friendly and helpful with suggestions and routes.

I normally don't write reviews,but considering that fact that I always come here for opinions ,I should start writing them. The only complaint I really had was the lobby, it wasn't really decorated nor lively but the staff is phenomenal. I forgot the names of everyone so forgive me if my description is off. I was first greeted by a very cute front desk man who draws , he remembered my name as soon as he checked me in and every time he saw me he greeted me by my last name.My room was magnificent , I had the executive king room with a view , and my shower was to die for , very clean and the bed was sooo comfortable . The housekeeping lady always placed me shoes where I kept them if one was out of place and if she wasn't sure of throwing away something when she saw me she asked.The location in my opinion was prime, one direction was Times Square which was 3-4 minutes away the other direction 5th avenue . Since all I do is shop it was PERFECT.The entire staff was helpful, when my reservation got messed up from me booking with a third party the really pretty lady with long curly hair and glasses fixed everything.Privacy is important to them and comfort which is an excellent thing.Oh one more thing ...I had no clue breakfast was served there no one told me but there were places near by so that wasn't an issue and when I added an extra night they didn't tell me the tax so I was under the impression the price they told me was what was being charged but it's ok I had the money to spend.I love this hotel , will definitely be back.

5 minutes away from Time Square. Clean and simple design, efficient and courteous front desk. Breakfast wasn’t included and we didn’t try the on-premise restaurant. This is not the best neighborhood to have brunch (we chose the West Village which has many appealing choices –see review on Tartine). Rooms and bathrooms are on the smaller side (common in NYC I believe), clean, functional. The bed is supposed to be queen sized, but appeared small; if you’re considered tall, it will be short…We made our choice based on the combination of location, reasonable rate offered and great reviews. Our experience corresponded to our expectations.

Came to New York in March for the first time. This hotel was just incredible..! Location is perfect and around 2 minutes from the hustle and bustle of Times Square, few minutes to the shopping on 5th Avenue and close to all the main tourist attractions. We booked a deluxe room which was a good size with a really comfy bed, massive TV and new Ipod Dock. The bathroom was huge with a lovely walk in shower! We told the hotel it was our anniversary and they put a bottle of bubbly and a little note to mark the occasion, such a nice touch!The concierge was so helpful, when we wanted to go to Ground Zero she drew us a map of the subways, told us how much it would be and what to expect really. They were really helpful in arranging shows, and organising trips. On our last day they extended our check out time slightly and also held our bags free of charge! We went out and did some shopping came back then dropped it off with our cases and went back out again with no problems. All staff are so friendly and helpful, always said hello and gave a smile! Would 100% recommend this hotel and we definitely will be back!

I stayed here on business in October for 4 nights. It is tucked away with a very small entrance and reception. The rooms are a good size and well equipped. Work was underway when I stayed so no dining room or lounges. The basement restaurant is good but you need to book. Free coffee in takeout cups at breakfast is the only little extra touch. I wouldn't stay again.

My wife and i chose this hotel for our first ever trip to New York, based mainly on the central location than anything else. After our five nights here we were very glad we chose here, having thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The downsides? There is very little in the way of a hotel lobby or lounge, so if you are looking for the sort of hotel to relax and enjoy the amenities of a lobby/cafe sort of area, then this probably isnt the hotel for you. Other downside was the small size of the room, though to be fair we actually booked the smallest sized room to keep costs down, so only really have ourselves to blame. The room was fine for a single occupier, but if travelling as a couple I would definitely suggest going for a larger room!Upsides? Room was tastefully decorated and nice and modern. There was a huge TV, very nice bathroom with walk in shower, and a good ipod dock system. The location was absolutely perfect for exploring midtown and beyond on foot. It's a busy and potentially noisy area, but up on the 21st floor where our room was we were pretty well insulated from all the hustle and bustle of Time Square/Theatre District. Finally, the biggest upside was the quality of the service. From the check in process to getting us a taxi on our return to the airport and everything in between, the staff were falling over themselves to help us out. Every member of staff we came across was great, but special mention goes to Lendel (I think that was his name?!) who checked us in. He even provided us with a free bottle of prosecco for no reason other than it was our first night in New York!Overall the hotel exceeded expectations, and i would recommend to anyone looking for a central base from which to explore Manhattan.

My wife and I came to New York for her 30th birthday to see New York again. We stayed previously on 43rd & 3rd Avenue which proved a great hotel but a little further away from Times Square than we wanted. We arrived at JFK and got the NYC Aiport Bus Service from the taxi rank which dropped us at Port Authority - from there was a 10 minute walk with luggage to the hotel. Really we could have got off at Times Square but I don't think the walk would have been any different. It's a good idea to learn a little about how the streets & Avenue's work in NYC before making the journey - streets are in ascending order from South to North. Avenue's are in ascending order from East to West so it's really easy to find yourself and get to where you need to be.Hotel Cassa is well located, only two blocks east of Times Square on quite a quiet street. Nearby there is a couple of coffee houses, and many restaurants. Everything for us have been within walking distance, including 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Centre (a must see as we didn't go a few years ago), Empire State Building. The subway is also only a 10 minute walk to help you get downtown / Brooklyn Bridge if you don't want to take the walk.We've had a deluxe room while being here - the bathroom is spacious (although the door is wide and so you can't swing it past the sink). Our room has a large King Size bed, a 42" TV with all channels & fridge. No iron unfortunately but we didn't ask if one was available from the front desk so I've been in T Shirts all week. We had breakfast included in our room and is available from 'Butter' restaurant downstairs which is your typical american breakfast.All in all, a great trip, complimented by the hotel and it's great location. WiFi provided in room for free (just make sure your package includes it - otherwise it's $15 per day).

I did not enjoy my vaccation there Thalía treat AND the food the room they were not what i expected at all i real y think i Wendy yo the wrong hotel I would prefer the cassa at 39th streetFriends have recomended me that one better

Arrived to a great and friendly welcome. Room compact but well designed and bed comfortable. Very quiet for its location, which is unusual in NYC. I much prefer this to the bigger chains, particularly in New York. Very competitive, so great value too.

Great location for anything Midtown. Block over from Times Square so you will be able to sleep at night. Room was very quiet and clean. Bed was very comfortable. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Plenty of restaurants and activities within walking distance from the hotel.

I stay here quite often for business. Excellent location, close to Times Square / Central Park. Very friendly, helpful staff. Rooms are small as should be expected for NYC but always clean and very well maintained. Excellent restaurant! Love this place and will continue to stay here on future business trips.

We stayed here for 4 nights last week on our first trip to NYC. I was initially quite disappointed as I emailed the hotel several weeks before I travelled to ask for a quiet room as I was travelling with my mother for her birthday and received no response. Check in was perfunctory and my first impressions were coloured by this. However, the room itself was lovely if on the small side. In particular the lack of wardrobe space for coats/dresses was an issue. The bathroom was nice and the room was very clean. Wifi was free and consistent. The bellboy came up with our luggage and he was really nice - he gave us some advice on the local area and he was really helpful throughout our stay as were the other staff on the front desk (aside from the first day). The location was fabulous, walking distance to most of the main attractions and close to the subway. The room was on the 6th floor and overlooked the street and it was pretty noisy at night with refuse trucks and taxi horns. The heating was very noisy too but it heated the room up fabulously. Compared with similar properties in London or Paris the hotel was of a really high standard and the room was pleasant.I doubt I will return to NYC but I would recommend the hotel to others.

My husband and I enjoyed this hotel. Centrally located, the size is as expected for NYC (small but not too cramped). We didn't go to NYC to stay in the room so that was fine. :) Good service by the front desk. (stayed in 2012)

Great location in a quite area and close to all main attractions.Rooms are nice and comfortable and very clean (daily replacement of sheets and towels)Refrigerator and safe in the room.Free hot drinks in the morning and afternoon. Choice of daily newspapers for free, such as Wall Street Journal and New York Times.Staff is extremely available, helpful and kind!We really recommend it and New York is magic!

Staff very helpful and always friendly. Great bedding, which is very important. Location was just 2 blocks from Time SQ.Everything was clean and looked new. Front desk/lobby area is not large. Overall, I'd stay here again.

This hotel is in a very convenient location to everything. If you only plan to sleep and shower here this is the place for you. It is very clean. However, if you want to relax the room is small and cramped with no comfortable chair. The weather was not conducive to being outside much in February, so I found the room very claustrophobic. If you have a bad back you should know that the bed is the only convenient place to sit. Also there is no instruction book about hotel amenities in the room. Working of the TV and room temp is a bit challenging.

I stayed in this hotel for my 2nd trip to NYC. The first time I came to NYC I stayed in the Wellington Hotel in the middle of summer and their A/C stopped working - so I figured I would give this hotel a shot.It has a perfect location. It is very close to a couple of different subway stations. You can get just about anywhere via the subway in a matter of minutes (I would recommend downloading a subway app on your phone - it tells you all the different train routes and times, and the apps are usually free). Also, this hotel is only a couple of blocks from Rockefeller Center (which has public bathrooms downstairs - unlike many places around there). As an added bonus, there is a Duane Reed store right around the corner (the northeast's version of Walgreens or CVS). That makes it very easy to go grab some beer or snacks to keep in your hotel room.The room itself was pretty small. It wasn't tiny, but still small. There was still enough room to put your bags and belongings, but you just have to make sure that you are organized about how you put your things. I'm sometimes pretty messy, which made it harder. But if you don't just throw your stuff in there, there's plenty of room to walk around and hang out. My fiancee and I had plenty of room to "pre-drink," listen to music on the ipod dock, and hang out before going out for a night on the town.The bed was extremely comfortable. Almost too comfortable, especially when you're drained from a full day of walking around New York. Make sure you set an alarm in the morning if you don't want to risk sleeping in and wasting part of your day. The bathroom was pretty nice. The best part was the glass walk-in shower with really good water pressure. #1 important thing: get out of the hotel and explore the thousands of restaurants and shops that are nearby. Also, don't just hang around Times Square. Get a subway pass and ride unlimited rides all over the city (they are like $30 for a weeks pass). There are several places around the city that offer rooftop, outdoor bars that provide a wonderful view of the city. I love reading reviews on here of people complaining about the most trivial things. Don't go to New York City if you are wanting to just sit in your hotel and whine the whole time about how the cleaning staff didn't come up and clean up the mess that YOU made the night before. Your hotel in New York should serve its purpose as an adequate place to sleep after you spent all day out exploring the city. Don't spend all day in the hotel and get over yourselves complainers!

Stayed here the week of 2/2 and it was fabulous. I stayed the previous two weeks in a different hotel on the same street. Cassa's rooms were much bigger and I loved the modern decor. Bathrooms also nice sized with a good size shower and ledges to keep bath products. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Only (slight) negative was I tried to go to the adjoining restaurant a few times to get a cocktail, but the place was packed. Seemed like a very popular restaurant and I'm sure if I had a reservation it wouldn't have been a problem. However, there were numerous places right out the door to get food and drink. Also, there are two delis on the street to get cokes and snacks at night, and a duane read around the corner. I will for sure stay here again.

We stayed here for our summer trip to New York and it was in the perfect location! The room was small but lovely. The staff were very friendly and they even had a birthday cake sent up to me on my special day. We both enjoyed staying in this wonderful hotel and would certainly go back.

Never hired an apartment in NYC but so glad we did - we ended up with a 2 bed condo on the 40th floor with views of the Chrysler building and Times Square.The bedrooms were large but the living space was so big ( a real luxury for NYC and great for hanging around with the kids in after a long day out sightseeing and shopping.Would highly recommend the apartments. Didn't really use the hotel, but the staff on reception were very friendly and helpful.Thanks
user_name:
Adrian-Dilenardo
Burley in Wharfedale, United Kingdom

review_body: We stayed at Cassa for 2 nights before a cruise. We had requested upgrade if available. We had arrived early and they checked our bags while we walked to Times Square only 2 blocks away and had lunch. When we came back room wasn't ready so they gave us an upgrade of the upgrade at no additional cost. The front desk staff was always friendly and helpful for any questions on the hotel or local attractions and restaurants. Location is great and just walking distance from so many attractions. Would definitely stay here again.

We got a good price but were not told some rooms were under renovation. The work went on from 8 something to five something. It wasn't too bad and we were out most of those hours so it wasn't a big deal but it would have been nice to know before we booked it on their website. The room was clean but did need updating. The staff was excellent without exception. They don't have a business center but you can email the boarding passes to them and they can print them. As noted in other reviews the location is excellent. It is close to both buses and subways. There are coffee shops, a drug store and a good diner within a block.

We stayed at the Cassa three nights including New Year's eve. We had never been to NYC and do not travel much. As the planner I was a bit nervous. However, from the time I booked everything went smoothly. My conversations with the staff ahead of our travels and once we arrived were top notch. Reception assisted with finding restaurants big and small, with confirming our reservations, and letting us view a couple of rooms before deciding which one to stay in. They were professional, relaxed and friendly all at the same time.They would have helped us get to some of the live tv recording studios if we had known to ask and helped us get to the fireworks in Central Park for New Year's eve.Room was stylish. The beds were great, including the rollaway! Amenities fine. Bathroom clean and in great repair. No problem with street noise - we were on the 17th floor.And of course the location right off Times Square is superb.

Stayed at Cassa at Christmas time. The location is a block away from the bustle of Times Square. It is nice to be close to the action yet far enough away to get some much needed rest after enjoying the sights. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and we were able to get an early check-in. Our room was not on the street and higher up, so maybe it was quieter than other reviewers. They have coffee in the lobby in the mornings. The rooms are clean and the bed was comfortable The restaurant below has a buffet breakfast (overpriced in my opinion) but, hey, it's New York, you can walk down the street and get amazing food. They do need instructions on how to use the remote to the TV (Hint: you have to hold down the "input" button to bring up the TV inputs and select HDMI) Took us a while to figure it out. We have been to New York many times and I would definitely stay here again. Save cab fare. You can walk from Penn Station or Grand Central to the hotel, and from the hotel, you can stroll up 5th avenue to Rockefeller Center.

Stayed for 5 nights in January. Very good central location to see New York from. Room was a good size and with enough storage and somewhere to put cases. Good size bathroom with dual rainfall and hand held shower heads, hot water and good pressure. Bed was extremely comfortable. Reception/concierge pleasant and helpful. The only negatives were that there was no information in the room (about the hotel, the city or how the TV/aircon etc. worked) and no hooks anywhere to hang coats etc. One day we were there it poured with rain all day and we came back to the hotel with soaked outerwear but there was nowhere to hang it to dry. Also no hooks in bathroom to hang the complementary dressing gown or wash bag). Overall exactly what we required for this trip and would recommend to others/stay here again.

Stayed at the Cassa hotel over the Christmas / New year period found the hotel to be in a great location , however rooms are very small and I mean very small and in my opinion it is highly overpriced ! Staff were extremely friendly and helpful with any request we had

Stayed at Cassa over Christmas holiday and couldn't have been more pleased. The staff was exceptionally accommodating and very friendly with offers of suggested sights, umbrellas, restaurants and more. Room was ready when we arrived and we were upgrades, without even asking. Hot chocolate in the lobby when we arrived on a cold and wet afternoon and coffee in the morning. Very nice touches. The location is ideal. Easy walking distance to all major sights and shopping. Highly recommend.

I had the chance to stay at Cassa hotel for two days this October. it is really well located. Rooms are supreme and really nice. But without a view to the city. during the time I was there, the hotel was under renovation therefore no breakfast was served. Overall, great place, really nice rooms

Good stay clean and quiet room very helpful staff good location. Near Times Square, etc and all the goings on in the area . We were there over New Years holiday and had a great time. Hotel staff was great giving good directions advice on subways or car service Restaurants they gave us were great. Would absolutely stay there again.

Just returned home from a week in New York City. The hotel was everything we could have asked for. The room was big with a huge TV and amazing bathroom (I never wanted to get out of the shower). The bed was very comfortable and the bedding was changed throughout our stay along with fresh towels.  The service was personal and everyone was friendly and welcoming. We arrived to our room to find a birthday message and bottle of fizz which was much appreciated after a long flight And a great start to out week. The hotel itself is situated just 2 blocks away from Times Square, New York Library and Grand Central Station which made it easy for us to explore all the sites. They have restaurant below called Butter which has amazing food and service which we took full advantage of during our New Year's Eve meal. Overall, Cassa made our experience in New York a memorable and comfortable one. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Also, the price was very competitive and you definitely get what you pay for and more! Thanks to all the staff who made our stay so enjoyable. I hope to return to the big city soon :)

We stayed the week between Christmas and new year. We had a warm welcome from the reception staff who were friendly and helpful. I didn't find that with all the reception staff. However, the manager quickly resolved an issue we had and was very accommodating. We had a room on the 20th floor, which was an upgrade to the room we booked. The room was spacious, really comfortable bed and large tv. The bathroom was also spacious, nice (but exceptionally noisy) shower and good range of toiletries. There is a hairdryer in the room. Coffee was available daily in the lobby. Iron was available on request. It would be nice if those facilities were available in the rooms. The restaurant looked really good but we didn't try it. The hotel is so well placed for Times Square and transport around the city. I would recommend this hotel.

The hotel itself is nothing special to write home about.Friendly enough. Warm enough. Concierge very helpful etc etc . However the location is amazing. Turn left out your hotel you are on 5th avenue turn right and you are bang on times square. We walked to central park one day and it was not too far either. We are not walking enthusiasts either. Macys parade we didnt bother to see as we couldnt get near enough to it and it was blooming freezing. Better to keep walking and see the sights.

Lovely hotel just off 5th Avenue and one block from Times Square. Staff were friendly and really helpful. Paid to upgrade to a queen room from a single, as although the single had a full size double bed, it was a little small overall for two of us (the website said this to be fair). Overall no complaints at all and would recommend this hotel.

We rented a residence front the HomeAway site to stay in the residences over New Years. While check in was at 3 pm, it wasn't ready when we arrived at 4:30. The front desk staff was nice about it and made the necessary calls to help us get the rental company and get us in the rental. The 2 BR 2 bath condo was very clean but is showing some wear. It was perfect for our needs. Just a block off of Times Square in the heart of Manhattan. The only thing I would say is that there was no lobby and no way to get bottled water or even a soda. There are plenty of places nearby, but with most of them closed on NYD, it is worth mentioning. Again, the front desk staff was very friendly and willing to help with suggestions or directions.

Overall, I have mixed feelings about the hotel. If you can get a good price, I would recommend this hotel even though we had a less than perfect stay. The location is great for tourists. It was our first time in New York, so the central location worked in our favor. Next time, we will find a less busy location away from the chaos.We got a great price on a Junior Suite through a Cyber Monday deal. The room was spacious. The bathroom was also large with double sinks and a bathtub. The bed was comfortable. There was a lack of storage space for clothes. We had to leave most items in our suitcases. We spent a lot of time in our room at the beginning of the trip due to illness, so we appreciated the space and comfortable bed.The lobby is small with just a front desk and a few chairs, so if you are looking for a gathering place, you will not find it here. The elevators were fast and we never had to wait for one. There was a room for a business center on the 10th floor but it must have been under construction during our stay because the room was empty.Unfortunately, we ran into some problems. On our third night, I was woken up by a very loud vibrating noise that sounded like someone was buffing/sanding the floor above us. It was 2am and the noise continued. It was really loud. I called down to the front desk and they sent a maintenance man up within 10 minutes. Within those 10 minutes, we figured out it was the heating system, which was confusing to us since we had been in the room for three days and never heard this noise. The maintenance man confirmed it was the heating system. His solution was "it's not very cold outside, so you should just turn off the heat." This was his solution? Just turn off the heat?!?!? He had no explanation as to why we didn't hear this noise before. It is still a mystery. There was no follow-up from the front desk regarding this problem.We also didn't receive housekeeping services for two days. The first time, we assumed it was our own fault since we spent time in our room watching a football game during the prime cleaning time and kept up our "Do Not Disturb" sign. That was fine with us. But we returned to our room the next day in the early evening, and it was still not cleaned. After two days, this was not acceptable. We got ready for dinner and then talked to the front desk on our way out. They almost made it seem like it was our fault. Basically, "well why didn't you let us know after the first time?". Sorry, but housekeeping is a basic service at a hotel, so this is not our fault! We went to dinner and came back to an uncleaned room with stack of new towels (all dirty towels still on the floor of the bathroom). Later, we received a letter from the hotel slipped under our door with a voucher for breakfast the next morning. (Do not pay for this breakfast. It is a small selection of foods. Not worth the price). A gross breakfast did not make up for the problems we encountered.On a positive note, we had a drink at the bar in Butter (restaurant downstairs). It is a beautiful space. The bartender was very friendly, and the drinks were enjoyable.Neighborhood recommendations: Pizza from Little Italy Pizza across the street from the hotel was really good! We did happy hour at a bar called Point Break down the street. Friendly bartenders and cheap drink prices. There is a Duane Reade(Walgreens) right around the corner on 6th for supplies. Their prices were cheaper than other stores in the area.

Stayed for 4 days before Christmas. I had stayed at a huge chain hotel a few minutes from Cassa last year for work which was terrible compared to Cassa. The rooms are lovely and spotlessly clean. Shower is huge. Staff are so nice and helpful. It is in a great location with a convenient walk to major sights and subways. Would absolutely stay here again.

Stayed 5 nights over the Xmas period. Other than a slight hiccup with our laundry we had a fantastic time. Special thanks to Sam (doorman) and Tiffani (front desk) both were exceptionally helpful with all our needs and wants. They are a credit to the Cassa Hotel!

We actually stayed at the Residence Suites, which is in some way part of the Cassa Hotel. The staff of the Cassa don't manage the suites, but they do service the guests who stay there (still not clear on the relationship there). My 3 children and I stayed for a long post-Christmas weekend and this was by far the best staff I've ever encountered while traveling. They were friendly and helpful - even patiently explained how to use the subway! - and went out of their way to make us feel welcome and comfortable. The location was great, our 2 BR, 2 Bath suite could not have been a more perfect space for us, but the staff at the Cassa is something special. Great job! Would definitely recommend and wouldn't even think of staying anywhere else on our next trip..

I stayed here with my sister over Christmas weekend. We booked through Priceline Express for a fair price. The hotel is well located between 5th and 6th Avenues, about a 10 minute walk from Times Square and with plenty of food choices nearby. It is one of the new, very tall, very skinny side street Manhattan hotels - something like 50 stories. Our room on the 11th floor was available before check-in time on Christmas Day. The front desk staff was efficient and very friendly; they smiled and said hello when we left and when we returned. They can be quite busy at peak hours. The size of our room was okay, especially for New York. The bathroom was huge with a large rainfall shower. However, some of this space might be used better in the room itself, which had one small closet and little drawer space - we had to leave both of our suitcases in the room, one on the folding stand that is stored in the closet (the closet isn't big enough to hold the stand once it's unfolded) and the other on the small desk that also holds the phone. The bed was very comfortable but note that our standard room had only a full size, not a queen. The staff will provide a rollaway if you need it. The hotel restaurant (Butter - separately reviewed) was not reliable, and I predict it won't last.- in fact, the word "Alex" appears under its name on the outdoor window. Checkout was quick, and the bell service held our luggage with a smile.
user_name:
GaNavy
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We spent 8 nights at Cassa over the Christmas period and were so glad we chose it. The rooms were lovely. Position was ideal - short walk to so many locations including the Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue, subway stations etc. The staff were the best we've encountered on our month long trip around the states. Every time we left/returned to the hotel we were greeted/wished a good day. They were incredibly friendly and helpful. Lendel at the front desk was wonderful - when we told him we were headed to LA he looked up our accommodation for us and gave us some excellent advice about the area we were staying in and what to do etc. We can't speak highly enough of the staff - they made our stay really comfortable and enjoyable.

My wife and I recently stayed at the Cassa for 5 nights just before Christmas. We were very pleased with the hotel and its staff and highly recommend it.The location could not be any better for all attractions in the mid town area. The only time we had to take transit was to visit the 911 memorial and the upper Westside - Harlam.

The location of Cassa can't be beat. In the heart of midtown this place is surrounded by theaters, restaurants and other popular destinations. Anything not in walking distance is only a short trip away on the subway. The location is perfect to stage a NYC sightseeing tour.The rooms were very nice as well. From ours we couldn't normal hear traffic on the street below and could only hear other guests in the main hallway outside our door. Rooms were very clean with a modern (yet functional) style to them.It was also reasonably priced especially with the multi-day package they offered online. The per day price wound up being at the bottom of the scale of what we were expecting to pay in midtown so we weren't expecting much; what we got turned out to be a great value.

I booked 3 rooms for myself, friends and family for a quick 2 night stay at Cassa Hotel. I travel to NY 2 to 3 times a year and know how crazy and intense things can be during the holiday season but the Cassa staff were calm, lovely and just wonderful people. I've stayed in dozens of hotels over the years when I visit Manhattan and I have to say this hotel is on the top of my list from now on. The rooms are on the small side but not tiny. Spotless and classy. Love the empty fridge to store our own wine and goodies. Nothing but positives and everyone in my party agreed!

Our first visit in New York we stayed at the cassa hotel, perfect location for site seeing !! Ie ; Empire State Building , Rockefeller , Times Square. We would recommend this hotel 100% to anyone who is looking for a hotel to stay in New York. The rooms are immaculate and if your visiting around Christmas theirs a iPod docking station playing Christmas songs as we arrived which was a real special touch for us. Brilliant staff , location , restaurant everything !! Thankyou for making it even more enjoyable for us ! The Steel family

You cannot beat the location of this hotel - right next to Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue shopping, and a short walk to Times Square. Also right next to a subway station. The hotel rooms are a decent size for Manhattan; the beds are VERY COMFORTABLE; and everything is clean. The shower is great - good pressure; steady temperature. There really is no lobby for drinks/lounging/meeting. However, they do provide complimentary coffee in the mornings (which is a tad weak, but will hold you over until you go to Bouchon or Blue Bottle, which are 2 blocks away in Rockefeller Center). Overall, great experience - great stay and a great location. Would definitely go back.

I recently stayed 3 nights at Cassa on a recent business trip. The size of the room, the graciousness of the staff, and the fact it as quiet were all unexpected surprises that mean I will not hesitate to return!.

The hotel was in a convenient area to Rockefeller center & Times Square. The room was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel offered complimentary breakfast that was very good. I would recommend this hotel if you are visiting NYC
user_name:
Joy C
Smoaks, South Carolina, United States

review_body: One reason we loved this hotel was for the view from the shower. Very cool. Also, we got the best sleep. It is so near Times Square but it is very quiet. The bed was comfy. The room was small but laid out so well it didn't matter. The decor was modern and clean. But being a fan of great architecture my favorite part of the hotel is the stunning exterior.

I stayed there on a girls trip Dec 13-15th, we were there just to see the holiday lights and everything Christmas ( I had never been at x-mas)....we had 2 rooms.. from the moment we checked in the staff was friendly and helpful. The location was PERFECT ! ...a block away from TImes Square, 3 blocks to Bryant park... a few more blocks to Rockefeller center.... The Library was also just few blocks away. I heard Central Park is 10 blocks away , we started the walk and then decided to do the double decker bus tour. Lots of bars /restaurants near by. all price ranges. The room isn't huge.. but we were not in it much. For 2 girls the bathroom counter space could of been bigger. The shower and beds were WoNDERFUL. I might be the only person to complain that the hotel room was too quiet..LOL... Kudos to Edgar the bell man, he was also friendly and helpful with catching a cab at 530p to Penn station ( and any other questions we had). ALL the staff was very helpful. I would go back to this hotel on all future trips to the city. Location Location location.... perfect perfect perfect ....

Very nice hotel with a great location. The staff was very helpful and friendly and gave excellent recommendations for whatever we asked. For a noisy NY we could not hear a thing on the 11th floor, very quiet. When leaving one of the staff went to 6th St to hail 2 cabs for us, can't ask for any better service. This is our place to stay next time

Nice hotel with clean rooms. Receptionist and assistent guys are friendly and helpfull. Just for breakfast is the assortment not so huge. Anyway you are in the center of Manhatten and the hotel is very recommendable. Next time we go back to NY we will stay again at this place.

The best thing about this hotel is the staff, they are just so friendly and helpful from giving directions, confirming our trips and making restaurant recommendations and reservations. Our room was ready on arrival before the designated check-in and we were given a later check-out with no issues at all. With our flight being at 21.40 this was really helpful. Complementary tea/coffee in the mornings and the room was spotless & a decent size. No view but that didn't bother us as we weren't in the hotel during daylight hours. Brilliant location overall with a nice Irish pub just down the road :) Amazing hotel which contributed greatly to our amazing holiday, would definitely recommend with no hesitation.
user_name:
Theresa F
Caldicot, Wales, United Kingdom

review_body: I stayed with my fiancée for a long weekend in December and from booking we got nothing other than a five star service. The concierge team booked the extras i required such as a car from the hotel, bottle of bubbly with chocolate strawberries for the room on arrival, a map to get around with on arrival. All at fair prices, on arrival checked in and we got a complimentary upgrade and the door staff who took our bags to the room offered some insights on places to go. The staff knew it was my fiancées birthday so rose petals were on the bed which was a really nice touch. The hotel has complimentry coffee in a morning so just grab a cup on your travels, there is a restaurant downstairs butter which on this occasion we did not try but the menu and setting look out of this world. The room was spacious and the bathroom was lovely there was a fridge and safe to use and a huge tv and iPod docking station. I can't say enough good things about this hotel and more so the staff would we return in a heartbeat should you stay hell yeah.

I spent there two days. Cassa hotel is a nice place but when I was there it was under construction so apart from the room which was really big and nice, the hotel wasn't able to provide any other amenities. But the experience was really positive. People working there really helpful and I really recommend this place if it is for a short 3-4 days stay in NY

I went to NYC with my husband and decided to stay at Cassa Hotel because of the location and the reviews that I read.I was a little dissapointed with the hotel but I was really impressed by the staff .The staff is the best part of the hotel ,they are very polite ,kind and helped us a lot during our stay. From the doorman ,the front desk,the concierge and housekeeping they were all great.The hotel has a few problems in my opinion: the rooms are very , very small and the lobby isnt a nice place to be , its very dark, without natural elements like flowers, wood, etcIt isnt a welcoming place .I m not sure if I will stay at Cassa again and the main reason is the hotel appearance.

The Cassa Hotel is so convenient to Times Square, Broadway theatres, Rockefeller Center, and the shops along Fifth Avenue! All are within easy walking distance. The room was pretty, but a tad small. The bathroom was spacious and lovely. They even provided lush white terrycloth robes for us, as well as bedroom slippers. The staff members were friendly and helpful, and the hot beverages in the lobby were perfect for blustery winter days! There weren't a lot of rooms on each floor, so that made for an extremely quiet stay!
user_name:
Rose H
North Augusta, South Carolina

review_body: You can't beat the location of this hotel. Within walking distance to everything - Broadway, Rockefeller Center, Central Park... The room was beautiful and a decent size for NYC. The service was outstanding.

The Cassa is in a superb location for exploring Manhattan. Within walking distance are the Theater District/Times Square, MOMA, and the Rockefeller Center. The room was very quiet and very clean, the bed excellent. The staff members were cheerful and helpful. A nice perk was hot chocolate in the lobby on cold days. We could store our bags after checkout and before we had to leave for the airport, which allowed for extra sightseeing. The in-room fridge was handy for cooling drinks.
