The room came with an umbrella, which was handy. Size was a bit of an issue, but not enough to reduce the rating. We hadn't realized how small 240 square feet would be. The bed takes up most of the room. As is turns out, we spent little time in the room other than to sleep, so the small size wasn't a problem. We would not recommend the rooms if you plan to hang out in them for any length of time. The room has a built-in closet for hanging clothes, but very little drawer space. There's a built in desk, but it's not really big enough to work at other than on a laptop. The room lacked a coffee maker. Guests get their coffee (for free) at a station in the lobby. The only real downside to the room was the shower, the temperature of which was inconsistent. Frequently, the hot water petered out. The lights by the bed shine their light mostly down, so if you are the type who likes to read before going to sleep, we recommend bringing a small light of your own.

We just stayed 3 nights at the Cassa. Great location just blocks from times square, fifth ave, short walk to moma, new york public library, grand central terminal. In the chaos that is new york, the hotel was a nice quiet escape. Our room was located on the 18th floor and quiet as could be. The room was spacious enough for two of us and our bags, the bathroom was incredibly large considering the size of the room. Rooms, common space, and bathrooms were very clean and kept that way at all times. Decor was modern and simple. WIFI was included and actually worked unlike many hotels. The staff was overwhelmingly nice and accommodating. We had an issue with our heat and when i opened our door, there happened to be a staff on the floor and I enquired about the thermostat and he immediately called and got someone to look at it. We asked for a corkscrew for some wine and immediately someone came up to the room to drop it off. Couldn't have asked for more attentive service. At checkin they warned us about some noise but it only lasted an hour or so and then not to be heard again the rest of our stay. Would gladly stay there again...

Just stayed here one week. Paid extra for junior suite which meant bigger room with extra seating and a great bathroom with a bath. Staff all helpful, all very clean and room very quiet. Situation fabulous and good local places for breakfast if you want something cheaper than hotel. Try Cafe Manhattan. Only minor criticism is that even with lights all on the room was a bit dark. Coffee machine in room excellent.

Loved this hotel! First, the staff are incredible. They were very friendly and helpful from the time we arrived. The rooms were very nice - clean, comfortable and attractive. The location is probably the best part about it. A couple blocks off of Times Square so you don't have the noise but you can walk to so many places - Rockefeller Center, Macy's, St. Patrick's etc.

We stayed here recently on our honeymoon. The hotel was very clean,modern and a perfect location. The staff were always friendly and more than willing to help. The rooms were lovely and very clean. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Recently stayed here for 4 nights. Hotel is fantastic, it has a perfect location within walking distance of Broadway, Times Square, Grand Central, Empire State and many more.The hotel is really clean, the rooms are great and come with everything you could want and more. They are cleaned everydayThe staff couldn't be anymore helpful and friendly. From the baggage guys to the reception and to the cleaners they are all great and go out of their way to help

Went in to city to visit friends staying in midtown over weekend. We usually do not stay in midtown, but wanted to be near our friends. We got in around 1030 and there was a room ready for us to drop our bags, freshen up and hit the town. Check-in was fast, efficient. Both Jose and Jonathan were very welcoming and helpful. The room was clean, updated, and of a decent size for NYC standards. I would definitely recommend to anyone who desires to stay in midtown (centrally located). Next time I would like to checkout the restaurant Butter. Looks inviting!

I stayed at Cassa on two different occassions in the past month. The staff was wonderful! On my second trip, they welcomed me back by name....was a unexpected surprise considering how many people must have stayed at the hotel between my visits. I look forward to returning to Cassa soon.

Just got back from a 3 night stay at the Cassa 7-10 November, and simply WOW!! The hotel is ideally located just 5min from both Times Square and the Rockerfella. The hotel it self is very clean and well maintained. The maids do a great job. The Hotel provides free tea and coffee in the lobby daily which is appreciated before you set off on your days site seeing. Would we stop there again DEFINITELY.

My friends and I have just returned from a fantastic long weekend in NYC where we stayed at the excellently located Cassa Hotel.The staff are very friendly and welcoming and the rooms are so comfortable, the hotel is located just a 5 minute walk from Time Square and could not be any more convenient for sight seeing and shopping.The restaurant below "Butter" is a nice place to sit and have breakfast tooI cannot recommend this hotel enough, if you like a boutique style hotel with a personal touch this is the hotel for you

Yes the rooms are small, even the junior suite, but I think that's the norm for the city. And since we didn't spend a lot of time in the room, it was perfect for us. Front desk was awesome...very helpful, very friendly, very professional. Bellman stored our luggage before check-in and again after check-out until we were ready to leave. He then took us up to 6th Ave to get a cab because 45th St. was busy and we needed to get to the airport. Room was clean, bed was comfy, bathroom was surprisingly large. We had all the extras...everything we needed. We'll be back next time!
user_name:
Tim H
Tega Cay, South Carolina

review_body: Clean, stylish hotel hidden in the center of Midtown. Front desk personnel were extremely kind, helpful and friendly. Room was small (normal for NYC) but well appointed. Bathroom was spacious. And it was quiet! Breakfast (included) was a nice buffet of hot and cold items. Fast elevators. Easy walk to theatre district, Times Square, subway, etc. I would happily stay here again. It would have been nice to get a complimentary bottle of water in the room each day, though. I have come to expect that at most nicer hotels.

More of a tourist hotel than a business hotel. The room was small and the desk was barely large enough for a laptop. If I was working with documents, it would have been impossible. Closet hanging space is non-existent for coats/dresses. Bathroom is large and nice. The room was nice; decor is try modern. The front desk people were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Convenient to Times Square and Grand Central Station.

Just love it everything! Location, service, the room, great bed, great shower. We could go walking everywhere to tmies square, broadway, fifth avenue. A starbucks half block away from the hotel. In the same street of Dishes a great restaurant with great sanduiches. Only good things to say about it! I can ' t wait to come back!

This was a real find - excellent location in mid-town, so easy to get anywhere. Close to 5th Ave & shopping - also to theatre district. Arriving late on a Saturday night after a long flight, they were more than happy to send a kettle & tea-bags to my room. Over-looked 45th Ave - no noise due to double glazing- windows can be opened. Only downsides - no room service, but then lots of options nearby; room is designed for very tall people - everything is up high incl aircon controls. Guessing worked! Would stay there again.

If you have offices in midtown and need to visit on business, or if you are a tourist who wants to be within a stones throw of Times Square, Grand Central etc but with none of the associated traffic and noise, then Cassa 45th is pretty perfect. 45th Street and 6th isn't much to write home about in terms of eateries and bars, but it's quiet and well situated to get you to most of the things first time tourists in New York will want; Madison Avenue, Times Square, Rockerfeller Plaza, Grand Central.The rooms are a decent size by NY standards, the bathrooms well equipped and very clean, and the bed was pretty comfortable too. I didn't check out the bar/restaurant there (called Butter I think) but it seemed pretty ram-out around rush hour which is either a reflection of its location or quality. Or both.Given its proximity to my companies offices, I would stay again, but Midtown is not my preferred location in NY. That's just personal preference though, and no reflection on what is a very good property, at a decent price.

Lovely hotel with great location and wonderful hospitality. I normally don't choose a modern boutique hotel for many focus on style rather than service, this one has done well in both. Cassa is just one block from Times Square and a few minutes walk to 5th Ave, on the quiet part of 45th St.. The hotel is near to many theaters, a few blocks from Bryant Park with a number of good cafes. There is a Pret a Manger almost next door and a drug store a few minutes walk. There is even a lovely garden to sit and relax next to the opposite building. A special note to nostalgists, there is a large old store which sells everything from Halloween costumes and candies to pots and pans and socks, towels, etc. at the opposite side of the street!The rooms are relatively small, probably NYC standard, but very well decorated, clean and efficient. The bathroom in the Queen room has an extra space with mirror away from the sink area for convenience of hair and makeup, love it. The easy chair with its foot rest was great to sit & relax by the end of a long day.The room lighting maybe a little dim as most are task lights, but not a problem. Never have to wait long for the elevators, 4 in total. The only problem was we heard some noises from the street up to our 7th floor room, later found out the window could not be closed properly, fortunately it is a relatively quiet area, we forgot to tell the staffs. Later when I moved to a single room at the back, all was nice and quiet.Service is great, both the Front desk staffs and the porters are very friendly. We felt very welcome during our stay. Special thanks to Adil, the young porter, who not only helped with the luggage but also enthusiastically help me to avoid the traffic at the front of the hotel at rush hour upon check-out.I had very good price for the queen room(about $300/night), but with the single which I booked much later- I find it quite expensive (almost $400), but then it evened out. A great NYC stay.

We stayed here for five nights as my husband was running the New York Marathon. Fantastic hotel ina great central location. The hotel was very quiet at night and you could not hear the sirens. The bed was very comfy and the bathroom spotlessly clean. Would definitely stay here again. We only had one small problem and that was we turned up at 2.30pm and we were told that the room would not be ready til 3. Not a problem we just went down the road and had a coffee in Starbucks and came back at 3. Room still not ready and the receptionist said she would check on it and we were told to wait in reception. At 4 pm this was no longer a joke...we had been up since 4 am uk time. My husband made a fuss and they found us other rooms that were ready. Why they could not have done this in the first place I don't know. Kinda of ate into our first afternoon which we were going to spend on bikes in Central Park. I know this seems a bit petty but when you have travelled so far, to then sit and wait for 1 1/2hours ........

Lovely hotel with a wonderful staff! Everyone was very accommodating tried their best to make sure our stay was pleasant. Very close to everything in midtown. Short walk to the subway. Had no problem with noise. Only complaint would be the beer garden. We tried to have a drink at 5:30 on a friday afternoon and it was closed. I am unsure why but it looked like it would have been a great place to get a drink before heading out. Would still highly recommend.

Really spacious rooms for NY standards, bed and pillows are as expected from a boutique hotel (excellent). I stayed on the 23rd floor and it was really quiet even late during the transit hour. The receptionists were very friendly and eager to help on everything. The restaurant downstairs was really good for drinks and dinner but nothing impressive for breakfast. I'll definitely come back on my next trip.

I left the booking of this hotel to my brother-in-law, who had been to NYC before. He did a good job with this one. It wasn't cheap for our 5 night stay, it is Manhattan after all, but it was pretty reasonable for a hotel that could hardly have been more central. Everything you could have wanted was close by. On West 45th Street between 5th and 6th Avenue, it was a 5 minute walk to Times Square, 10 minutes to the Empire State Building and Rockefeller Centre, 10 minutes to the theatre where we saw Cabaret. 5th Avenue and its classy shops is literally round the corner. The longest walk we did was to Central Park, and that was only 12 blocks,We only took the subway once, to the Brooklyn Bridge and the Supreme Court (my wife loves the show Law and Order and wanted photos of her standing on the famous steps!) and that was more a matter of time saving than distance.The hotel itself is fairly small and so are the standard rooms, although they are nicely appointed and realistically you won't be wanting to do much more than sleep there anyway. Every member of staff we met was really polite, and couldn't do enough for you.The block itself has restaurants, bars, shops, delis and diners. Our favourite breakfast place was Cafe Manhattan over the road ($3 for an egg and bacon roll, $5 for a breakfast burrito), favourite pizza place was Little Italy, again just over the road ($3 to $4 for a huge slice of pizza, $6 for an excellent calzone and $4 for a glass of wine when it is upwards of $8 elsewhere)., The bar we kept going back to was Point Break which is about 100 yards right out of the hotel. Happy Hour is 5 till 7 when draft beer is $4 compared to the usual $7 or $8, although naturally it is heaving from 4:55 to 7:15pm. I wouldn't recommend the 'British' pub The Cock and Bull. The staff were pretty rude, and I got my $5.50 change from a $24.50 bill slammed onto the bar without the barman even looking at me because I had the nerve to wait for the change (we'd been advised a dollar a drink was the norm so in this case $3). I should add that, without exception, the staff who served us in other bars, restaurants etc during our trip were friendly and welcoming. The patrons too, come to that.We didn't use the Cassa restaurant (Butters), but the prices were comparable to other meals we had during our trip. I was outside waiting for the rest of the group one night and looking at the menu when a middle-aged couple came out and told me they had just enjoyed a fantastic meal and urged me to try it. Next time maybe.There was a terrace on floor 10 that only we seemed to use. It overlooks a busy street and faces a big office building, so don't expect privacy, but it was a nice spot to sit and relax.The only negative for me was that even residents could not get a drink in the Cassa bar after 11pm. We tried once, after returning to the hotel at 11:05pm after a long and tiring day and wanting a drink or two before bed, to be told that they had cashed up and couldn't help us. The City That Never Sleeps?I'd have no hesitation in booking The Cassa again if we can ever afford to go back to New York.Good hotel, great location, fantastic city.

This was our second trip to New York and our first was at the Marriott Marquis, Times Square so this hotel had to live up to that experience!It did not let us down!The room was clean, quiet and of ample size for New York! The staff were friendly and always pleased to see you. Check in and out was efficient and the complimentary tea/coffee every morning was a nice touch!The on site restaurant looked nice however we didn't find the time to visit.I requested a high room with a city view and this request was honoured!Overall I this was a great hotel for the price and when we return I will definitely look to stay here again! Mark, Daventry, England.

Visit NYC for our Honeymoon and choose this hotel for the reviews on Tripadvisor.We where very satisfied, geat location, good service and clean rooms. Rooms are not that big, but are good enough. Some can find it a bit expensive but for us, I think it was a great value for the type of hotel in Manhattan.I wouldn't recommed it for families with kids, It's more for couples or friends travelling together.

Just back from my first trip to NYC and the Cassa hotel which is in a great location,it is easy walking to 5th street shopping,Central park,Times Square,Broadway and Empire State to name all but a few.Hotel room is a bit on the small side but what I can gather is most hotel rooms in NYC are small, it's clean and staff are very friendly and helpful,beds are very comfortable.We had no breakfast in the hotel but walked around the corner to 44th street every day to a typical American diner (think it was called red dragon or something similar next to the Sofitel hotel) for a great and cheap breakfast.

Staff is the best in the city. Especially fond of Earnest. He should be made head of customer service. His people skills, kindness, thoughtfulness, sincerity are unparalleled. He's my top reason for keep going back to this hotel. The other staff is also really unusually courteous and nice. The location is the best. I love this place and will always be my go-to for my business travel.

Stayed for 2 nights and were warmly greeted at reception. Check in was quick and efficient and we were directed to our room, 2106. Room itself was of a reasonable size with a very nice bathroom and a nice comfortable large bed. TV had a mind of it's own (was one of those smart TV's which only served to make me feel stupid!) but overall a very nice hotel with great staff.

Our room was not prepared as specified, front desk personel were rude and had no clue what was going on. Would never stay here again. I'm required to fill 200 characters of space but I have nothing further to say. I would just like to leave a comment and hope that other people learn from our mistakes.

My 1st trip to NYC was wonderful, but my stay at Cassa Hotel 45th st was the best! Right in the middle of everything and within walking distance of most of the things that attracted me to this beautiful city. Thank you Cassa Hotel fot the fabulous room and pleasant doormen !!

Great location, very friendly and helpful staff. We were there recently for three nights for our 25 th wedding anniversary . It was lovely, the room was clean, comfortable with a great view from the bathroom towards time square. It was a short walk to 5th avenue. There are some great resturants and coffee shops for breakfast near by and the hotel has a good resturant too. Thank you to the staff for being great, we had a lovely bottle of fizz in our room and a card for our anniversary which was lovely, we would definitely book again

Here is my plus-minus review as usual.+ location. right between 5 and 6 avenue+ friendly stuff+ fast check-in+ clean and quite+ big bathroom+ loft - In room # 603 should be picture or poster on the wall... I suppose. Instead of just some hooks. I think this free space should be decorated somehow- My credit card was charged by a hotel for a 3 times. It was deposit for staying in Hotel and it would be ok if I knew about such deposit style during check-in. All hotels before Cassa charged my credit card once and total amount for 1 day staying. That's all. In general Cassa is a great Hotel. Recommend.

We had a hard time spotting the hotel as we walked along 45th street. We had to turn around and come back up the street to see the CASSA sign painted on the wall next to the entrance. The room was small as most NYC hotel rooms, but the bathroom was roomier than expected. I was thrilled to see an outlet on the nightstand for my C-PAP machine. It was not nice not having to hunt for an outlet. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Our room did not have a 'view'. The room met our needs for the weekend trip.

Cassa is a luxurious hotel in a great location: just a block from Times Square. Our room was small, but almost all rooms in NYC are. The fittings and bathroom were very nice, but the HVAC unit was about a foot away from the bed. We had to turn it off at night so it wouldn't blow on us all night. Also, the lighting in the room was very dim. Even the reading lights at each side of the bed were quite dim. One recommendation: the bedding contains down. If you are allergies to down let them know and they will change them out for you.

This hotel's location was perfect: blocks from Times Square, theater district, Central Park & Rockefeller Center. It's in the heart of mid-town, yet tucked away like a quiet oasis. The bed was so comfortable, it was hard to get up in the morning. Room was so dark in the morning due to the dark curtains, it was too easy to sleep in!! TV was almost too big. Loved it! Highly recommend! Would definitely stay again!

This boutique hotel was perfect!! It was close enough to the action, yet far from the craziness of Time Square. The room was very spacious (by NYC standards) modern and chic. Pillows were great and the bed was super comfortable. The service was incredible. We checked in around 10 am and gave us our room right away. We asked for an upgrade and it was granted. They allowed a late checkout upon request. We asked for extra pillows and towels and got everything we asked for. The bellman even took our bags to the room when we decided to have a drink at Butter. I have talked up this hotel and recommended it to our friends. It was the perfect place to stay and I would stay here again in a NY minute!

I stayed at Cassa for 5 days and really enjoyed my stay. People at front desk are always friendly, it is in an excellent location. The rooms are a little small, but crispy clean. Big bathroom and big shower. Big TV and radio. Very silent. Wifi worked perfectly well and breakfast at Butter restaurant was very good. What can I say? Location, locate, location. Also, plenty of little restaurants nearby.

Beautiful and comfortable - we loved staying at Cassa and highly recommend it for your next visit to New York City. We walked to the theatre district, Times Square, restaurants, and it's close to a Metro Station, as well. They had delicious coffee set up in the lobby in the AM, and fruit tea greeted us at the end of the day. The staff was friendly and helpful. And we were pleasantly surprised at how quiet the room was (not much outside noise could be heard).

Slightly off the beaten path, Cassa is a tucked-gem offering: 1) show-off sheik accommodations, 2) unparalleled customer-service and 3) the award winning Butter restaurant. When done retreating, you are within a block of Times Square. Perfect venue if luxury and location are your top priorities.

First time in New York and we picked this hotel without knowing anything about it. We had a pleasant surprise. The hotel was really great with lovely helpful staff. Was sorry we had only booked for a two day stay after our cruise would have loved to have stayed longer.Would tell all my friends to try it. We will definitely be back.

Lovely hotel in an excellent location. The rooms were chic, clean and the electronics impressive. We were there celebrating our engagement and a birthday and were greeted with champagne and a personal letter from the hotel. The staff was excellent and might be the best service we have encountered at a hotel. We had a wonderful time at Cassa and give it our best recommendation

We stayed at the Cassa hotel recently as the first stop on a four week trip. When we arrived we were greeted with a smile from the door man who assisted us with our bags. Check in was smooth and seamless. The check in staff always greet you with a welcome and can't offer enough assistance. They made a point off saying that they were all born and bred in New York and that they wanted us to feel like family, not just visitors. Was a nice touch. The hotel was undergoing a refurb But this didn't impact our stay in any way. We booked a standard room which was actually a really decent size. Plenty of room for two adults with bags. Likewise, the bathroom was beautiful and newly renovated. Only criticism would be the size of the bed. It was really quite small for two adults. If you have the option, book a higher room type if it means getting a bigger bed! Overall, location is great only a block or two from the subway and Times Square. I'd definitely stay here again and I would recommend hands down. The boutique nature of this hotel teamed with the excellent service we received really did make our stay in New York extremely enjoyable.

good price and great location. it's a clean hotel that is affordable in mid town. Butter restaurant downstairs is really good. I'd recommend this to any business or tourist wanting a great location. Staff are exceptional and so polite and helpful. Not always the same in other establishments, and places even much higher priced. Give them a tip. They don't act like they expect it, but definitely act like it's appreciated.

I like this hotel a lot. It's in a great location. I walk to a lot of popular places. Rockefeller, Broadway venues, Times square, Radio City Music Hall, etc. And it's also near the subway. The room is an adequate size for a New York Hotel, it's clean, the bathroom have the spa vibe, bed is very comfy, big tv, adequate size safe (it was big enough to place my laptop. My issue is the light in the room, no problem in the bathroom, but if there are two girls sharing the room that will be a problem. The lights in the elevator is also an issue, can barely see the numbers to push. Also there is no coffee maker in the room. Not liking to go down to get a coffee when I am not totally awake yet. Outside noise is not an issue but the noise in the hallway is. I can hear people talking outside and one time I even woke up because somebody was laughing so hard. But all the issues I can handle and will stay here again. Also want to mention that they are renovating but during my stay this weekend it was not an issue.

This was the best hotel experience I've ever had. I don't often stay at nicer places like this one, but this was a special occasion. I informed the hotel that it was my partner and I's anniversary and requested a high level room with a view. Not only did we get a wonderful view on the 23rd floor, but when we came back to the room the first night, they had surprised us with a complimentary bottle of prosecco and macaroons! What a treat! The staff was also so friendly. Every time we walked in, they greeted us with smiles and warm hellos. I really appreciated this place and am excited to return.

Loved this hotel! Rooms are luxuries and boutique. It's located perfectly in New York City, close to Times Square but far enough away to avoid crazy tourists. Short walk to Macy's, Victoria secrets etc. I would stay again!

AWSOME hotel! Great location, close enough to get the New York experience and far enough to not feel the hustle and bustle of Time Square. The staff was amazing, very knowledgeable of the city and attractions. Very friendly and professional! Room was beautiful, comfy and chic, loved everything about the hotel, I'd definitely book here again! Definitely a must go to!

Good size room, jr. Suite. Very nice service. Downside no coffee maker in room, although they did have tea. Free coffee in lobby. Very comfortable beds and great products (shampoo etc) in room. Would stay again.

Great place to stay in nyc..Short stroll from times square but far enough away at the same time..Safe area at all times night and day..Staff more than helpfulRooms small..but I gather the same is for all.hotels in new york..clean and comfortable room though..Would stay here again..Didn't try the restaurant here as there are cheaper and a massive variety of options around..

We had an awesome stay at Cassa Hotel, the building is brand new and modern, which is rare in NYC. Even though our view was to an office building we appreciated the big glass windows with a lot of natural light, we were even able to see the snow falling from our bed. The bathroom was big with a very nice and spacious walk in shower. Super clean room, friendly staff ! Really good location, walking distance to Times Square and Rockefeller Center.
user_name:
JuliaSupa
Deerfield Beach, Florida, United States

review_body: I have stayed at the Cassa Hotel several times over the past few years and decided to finally post a review. My most recent stay was this Sept 2014. The Cassa is a great find in Midtown. It is a boutique style hotel centrally located on 45th between 5th & 6th, which makes walking to the shops on 5th Ave or to Times Square very easy.The hotel has an intimate and unassuming lobby which I love but if you are looking for a grand, bustling lobby area this is not the place. The staff are some of the most friendly, professional and accommodating that I have come across at any hotel! The rooms are contemporary in design and a decent size for New York. Not as small as some other boutique hotels but not huge either. They definitely have all of the amenities of a high caliber hotel. There were doing some renovations and updates during my last stay in September however they did not affect my stay in any way. I like the fact that they maintain the hotel! My one negative comment would be the hallways - they are a bit dark and not so attractive but they were re-painting them and the hotel has so many other good features that it really does not matter.If you are looking for a great boutique hotel in midtown Manhattan for a very competitive price this is your place. I will be returning again on my next visit.

Stayed 1 night prior to leaving for Italy. Room is small but comfortable. Bathroom is modern and good size relative to the room. There was renovation work being done on a lower floor so one of the elevators was in use for this. Door man and cocierge were very helpful with directions and flagging a cab to take us to JFK. Best thing about this hotel is location - a few blocks from Times Square and 5th Ave. A short walk to Rockefeller Center and St. Patrick's. Will stay again.

Stayed in April 2014. The hotel is nice and clean. Quite pricey but in New York, our experience is truly you get what you pay for. Five minute walk to time square, location is great, walkable to most locations, plenty of places to eat. Staff was very friendly and very helpful. Would recommend if not choosing to stay in the centre of time square but still want to be close enough to the action. About a 45 min drive to JFK. Cab ride is about $60 flat rate. Would highly recommend taking this option rather than the airport shuttle if there is more than one of you. No free wifi in rooms but can access free wifi on level 10.

We were there for our honeymoon and had a wonderful stay! The room was quiet, spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable. Fantastic bathroom facilities with an awesome shower! The room did not have a fantastic view, just the buildings opposite, but there was a great view of Times Square from the shower believe it or not!Reception staff were friendly and helpful and the concierge helped us to organise some activities. We found the location perfectly central to all the things we wanted to see in our first visit to NYC. Close to Times Square but far enough that it was never terribly noisy or crowded. If you want to stay near Times Square, I would definitely recommend the Cassa.

Cassa Hotel has spectacular customer service. The whole staff is friendly. The rooms are very nice and clean. Lastly the location is central to everything. I highly recommend this hotel. I've stayed here twice now. I've been to many other hotels in the Times Square area and cassa tops them all.

I stayed here for 5 days last May. The location is fantastic, a couple of minutes from Times Square. The room, although small, was very nice, the staff were friendly and helpful suggesting restaurants for us to try. Would definitely stay here again.

Lovely hotel situated in the perfect location. 2 minutes from time square but plenty going on round about. Staff were very welcoming,pleasant and happy to help at all times. Room was a little on the small side but tastefully decorated and well equipped. Overall myself and my family had a great trip and would deffinitely recommend the cassa to others.
user_name:
Sammy W
Perth, Scotland, United Kingdom

review_body: I do want to say that I am in the hospitality business, and travel a lot, so I can be more critical than most other guests. I stayed here on a recommendation in April for meeting at the St Regis and LOVED it. It is little hideaway. Wonderful small lobby and an incredible amazing friendly staff from housekeepers, front desk, and the bellman. I was tired when I arrived, and asked the bellman for like a small pub in the area, and he recommended the "Cock and Bull" just a couple blocks down the street towards 5th. It was so good I went back again. I was on business so long days. I understand they are redoing the Cassa lobby and I will soon find out as I am staying there again next week for 6 nights. Everything was perfect in my room. Nice little working area for my computer, bed was fantastic. Bathrooms are small but you expect this in New York. Elevators worked great. They do have a restaurant on the lower level and I did try to get in one night but a long wait and it was noisy definitely a happening place. Location is great - I walked to 5th to catch my taxi's. I could go over to Broadway if I wanted to, and this location is a quieter street. The entry to the hotel is subdued but with friendly and informative bell staff greeting you. I walked to Grand Central Station, very accessible. I learned that this is one of Viceroy's new Urban Hotel brand and that they are developing more of them. I highly recommend Cassa and I will give an update after my stay next week. It truly is a little gem. Oh yes, loved my complimentary coffee every morning in the lobby.

when in NYC we always stay at the Cassa Hotel. we like the location (close no Times Square), the staff is very helpful and the rooms are good. this time we had a executive room with kingsize bed. for NYC a really big room with a nice bathroom. I thing the owner has changed since our last visit, but the hotel hasn't. clean and nice. for the first time the internet was complementary, which I find great and for this kind of hotel normal. you can also have a faster internet / wifi for 15$ day. we'll come back for sure.

My husband and I just returned from a long weekend in NYC and a stay at Cassa Hotel. We did lots of research on hotels, and finally decided on this one because of the location and positive reviews here on Tripadvisor. We were thrilled with the location---within quick walking distance to main attractions like Times Square, theaters, Rockerfeller Plaza, etc., but also far enough from the maddening crowds that we weren't bothered by the street noise. So, if location is important, this hotel is perfect! We were very pleased with our room. For NYC, we found it to be spacious (we had an executive king, upgraded from a standard queen), great flat screen TV built in, nice bathroom and big shower, closet space, comfortable bed with good linens, and "leather" (not sure) chairs and ottoman. The only slight negative was that the hotel is in the process of renovating some floors. The renovation didn't bother us a bit but the art work was missing from our room which left it a bit empty looking. The elevators were fast and easy to call. No waiting at all! The most positive aspect of this hotel is what others here have been raving about: They have an AMAZING STAFF!!! Every person we came in contact with was friendly, helpful, and efficient to the max. Two examples: Upon arrival and after checking us in quickly, the desk clerk personally introduced us to the concierge which I thought was a nice touch. Also, when we asked one evening how to get to the upstairs bar for Butter the restaurant, he left his busy desk to personally escort us to the bar. I travel extensively for business, and this might be the best consistently great service I've ever experienced! High marks all the way around for Cassa!

My husband and I stayed here together (he was on business, I did tourist-y crap) & we both really liked the hotel. The front-desk staff were excellent & they always had some tasty-smelling fruit-infused drink in the lobby. It's not very showy from the street, but the rooms were a decent size for the price in NYC. Other than a restaurant in the hotel there aren't any other food options. That said, the hotel is very close to Times Square (& subway station), a pharmacy, Magnolia Bakery, Park Italian Gourmet & other eateries/pastry shops.I would recommend showering at night- lots of hot water & water pressure. When my husband would shower in the morning, there was often a loud banging sound (?pipes) & lower pressure.

Loved this hotel! definitely our preferred destination in Manhattan - close to Times Square, Theatre District, Fifth Avenue shopping and more!Front desk staff was amazing! - always friendly and helpful, greeted us by name everytime we went past the desk.The room was very comfortable and clean

This is a great experience . It only has a small reception area but staff are excellent and soon make you welcome . Room was nice and cosy and well appointed. I had a 19th floor executive room .The hotel is very well situated and the things I wanted were very handy Great stay

While the Cassa hotel offers rather small rooms (which is absolutely normal for NY), the rooms are very comfortable, very clean, and the bathrooms are great. The Cassa hotel is near Times Square and most NY sights are within walking distance.However, the best part of the hotel is the AMAZING staff. Unfortunately, I forgot our receptionists' name (could have been Tiffany, but I am not sure) but she was great. It's a rare occurence for hotel staff to be this friendly while also being extremely professional. They gave us a bigger room as soon as it was available (we didn't even have to ask for it!) and even made sure we didn't forget anything (I forgot an item of clothing in the first room which was brought to me in the evening as soon as we got back from our trip). Housekeeping was also very nice and diligent. I absolutely recommend the Cassa hotel!

Modern, not so small room for NYC. Just one block from 5th Av and two blocks from Times Square. When traveling to NYC, most hotels are old or very expensive, Cassa hotel has a very good balance between what you get for what you pay.

First, the back story. My wife and I had booked a room at the Cassa through bookit.com and we were thrilled to find out that we got a great deal on a newly renovated room so close to Times Square. After walking from Penn Station with our luggage in tow taking several wrong turns (new in town and all that) we arrived at the Cassa Hotel on W45th. To our dismay we discovered, with very little help from the concierge desk, that there is in fact another Cassa Hotel and Residences on 9th Ave, corner of W39th! The young man and young woman at the concierge desk claimed to know next to nothing about the 9th Ave location and acted like we were pulling teeth just to give out the address. We asked politely if they could provide us with the phone number but the young woman was too busy paying for her Chinese food delivery and the young man was just too much of a snob to look at us. We finally found our way to the 9th Ave location where we were treated with courtesy and respect. Bottom line, the 45th St Cassa hotel is staffed with elitist snobs and not worth the time. If you want to get treated like you are a welcome guest I highly recommend the 9th Ave location and avoid 45th altogether!

First time in New York and stayed here for 5 nights. The checkin staff made us feel right at home with their very warm and friendly attitude.Got an upgrade to an Executive room on the 24th floor. This is a bigger room than the standard room. Having traveled quite a bit, I had expected the Executive room to be a much bigger room but as this is New York where space is at a premium, it was big by NY standards. In any case the room was more than comfortable, the bed supportive, large bathroom with toilet - rain showerhead too.I can not get over how genuinely polite, helpful and friendly all the staff were. It is a credit to management and staff.This hotel in midtown Manhatten is in the Diamond district and is very central to many major attractions like the Rockefeller building (Top of the Rock), Time Square, Bryant park, Saks 5th avenue etc Very safe to walk around this area at night.There are several good eateries either next door or across the road such as Prete a Manger (great croissants) or Little Italy that sells great pizza whole or by the slice. Highly recommended.

The Cassa is a decent boutique hotel in the heart of Manhattan, two blocks from Time Square yet out of the crowd.Rooms are not spacious, yet modern and nicely designed. The shower is great, and so is the mattress. Service is friendly and efficient. The lack of a lobby is felt, when you need to meet a guest.Two issues had a negative impact on my latest stay: The desk in my "executive" room was tiny and the chair did not allow me to really work. Beauty is not the only criteria...The Cassa took off the art in some rooms - including mine -- leaving the wall empty with just holes. In a letter by teh hotel management he claimed they will "soon change the artwork and freshen the look". However, why should a guest care about the future look of a room he would not stay in? After all, if art is not required -- then why bother refreshing it? Else, if art is essential (my opinion), it is inadequate to host a guest in a room without art on the walls!!

First time in NYC and certainly was not disappointed. Jonathan at the desk made sure our check in was effortless, thank you. Our room was nice and cozy and very clean.Hotel is placed very close to all public transportation which made it very easy for our planned visits. Next time I'm in the city, I know where I'm staying...Cassa Hotel on West 45th street. Thank you

I typically avoid midtown Manhattan when planning any leisure activities but chose this hotel while planning a special event. It was a last minute choice and I think I got very lucky. It is in great location, especially if you're in town doing business in Midtown East or if you are in town as a tourist. The hotel is about 2-3 blocks from the theater district and close to some great restaurants and shopping so this jaded local actually felt a little like a spoiled tourist for a change. The room we got was a standard double but was much larger then I had expected. The front door actually opens all the way without hitting a bed, a desk or my shins! The room decor is pleasing, modern and clean. The carpet and wood accents give it a nice warm feel against the crisp white linens and clinical bathroom. As a note, I enjoy clinical when it comes to bathrooms so this is a good thing! The bath is very clean and the rain shower adds a luxurious touch.The only things I found wrong were that there was no shelf in the shower to rest your products, so practice your juggling before you arrive. Also, there was was no art over our bed. There were holes and it looks like there was supposed to be but alas, someone must have forgot to hang it. Despite this, I enjoyed my stay. It's a cute hotel with genuine service and in a great location.
user_name:
anthonydaniell
New York City, New York

review_body: The room was clean and comfortable. Especially like the modern bathroom. I found the staff to be very pleasant and helpful. I stayed here on a business trip, but I would return on a couple's trip with my husband. I booked through Hotel Tonight and had no trouble checking in.

I booked this hotel on Hotwire and was impressed enough that I will consider it on future trips. The location is excellent for theater trips. The lobby is a little stark, but the front desk staff was excellent. Our queen room was decorated in a contemporary style, and was an OK size for New York. The bed was small and would be uncomfortable for tall or large folks- it was fine for us, and comfortable. There were a couple of bolts sticking out from the wall over the bed- obviously a picture had been removed. I figured this was our punishment for booking on Hotwire, and I didn't care :-) as the contemporary decor was otherwise attractive and in excellent condition. The bathroom was large, with a great shower. Everything was spotless and the room smelled very fresh- no lingering odors of any kind. There was no coffeemaker, but coffee was available in the lobby in the mornings, and there is a good coffee shop next door. Elevators were speedy. All in all an excellent boutique hotel for travelers looking for location, value and an updated decor.

I've never written a Trip Advisor review about a hotel before as I have never felt the need to share my experience as much as I do at this particular moment. We were in New York as part of a family vacation, and were booked into two junior suites at the Cassa hotel for 4 nights (rooms 405 and 406).First off, getting our two cars handed off for valet parking was a hassle in itself. The process was disorganized, the staff outside (although courteous and polite) misplaced our valet ticket which caused some issues at the check-in desk, however we were told that the matter would be sorted and that a replacement valet ticket would be sent up to our room. We excused the matter, as it was quite understandable; this stuff is bound to happen when valet receives hotel guests at the side of a busy road. The replacement valet ticket was not sent up to our room, no big deal, we picked it up on our way out for dinner about 3 hours after we had checked in.When making the reservation, we were told that booking junior suites rather than the deluxe or executive rooms would mean that we would have sufficient living area for two adults and one child per room. Boy were we duped. The room was so cramped that not even the minimalist contemporary design concept could distract from the fact that it was the size of a shoe box, the closet space was barely large enough to accommodate the wardrobe of a Barbie doll much less three people, and there was no room for a roll-away bed meaning that someone would have to sleep on the couch. In addition to that, the lighting was so abhorrent, I would even go far enough to say it was non-existent. Aside from two very dim hanging lights from either side of the bed (which by the way look like lampshades hung from floss by a kindergartner- but hey, I guess it's a design choice), and a desk lamp, the room was virtually a cave. There was no natural light entering the room either, as our view was an enclosed terrace with a bar/seating area (which was very noisy at night), several aircon units on a rooftop, and a wall. The bathroom (which had no lock) however, had great lighting, but this posed as an issue due to the contrast between the darkness of the room (especially with all the lights off at night) and the brightness of the bathroom, which could really make your eyes ache.To add to that, the tv was three quarters the size of the bed which seemed quite ridiculous given the fact that there was barely a foot of floorspace between it and the bed. Priorities need to be rethought, to be frank. A 50-inch tv seems to be an extraneous amenity when there's barely any lighting, and no complimentary beverages of any kind. There were two bottles of Fiji by the bed ($6 each, seriously?), a Keurig with a single mug, some tea bags, and an empty fridge.The AC worked well, but was pretty loud and kept me up past 1:30 in the morning as I couldn't block out the noise. The wall outlets were in the most inconvenient of places, the ones in the desk were embedded into it so that you could not fit an adapter onto them in order to use cables that did not fit onto US sockets, which is a bummer if you're traveling internationally. There were no outlets by the bedside, and one of the sockets by the couch did not work. To be honest, I was quite shocked with my experience at Cassa Hotel as the majority of the reviews I had looked at on tripadvisor prior to booking my stay were glowing and full of encouragements. So I came back onto the website and changed my search settings to show the worst reviews first rather than have them sorted by date. To add to my initial shock, I learnt that some of the issues have persisted since 2010 (the lighting and AC noises in particular), and that in addition to my gripes, there were several complaints from reviewers stating that staff was rude. Although I did not personally experience impolite staff, reading through the replies that management had left on previous negative reviews made me cringe. It seemed to me that rather than apologizing for their misgivings, management would constantly attempt to defend the hotel and its so called quirks. The only thing worse than management that cannot accept criticism, is management that responds to criticism in a snobby and arrogant manner. At some point reviewers were called "petty" and "juvenile" by management which doesn't seem like an appropriate response from a supposedly 4-star hotel. This almost discouraged me from writing a negative review, but here I am expressing my disappointment. Cassa hotel is definitely not worth its exuberant cost (we paid a rate of $411 per night including tax), and I would not recommend it to anyone. Its only perk is its location, as it provided a quick escape into the city and away from the cramped and dimly lit rooms.

I booked my room via hotel tonight which i normally don't do and i won't do it again. The room in the casa hotel i got was extremely small, not cosy at all. There was no nice atmosphere in the room and i didn't like the service at the front desk at all. Maybe i would have gotten a better service if i booked not via Hotel Tonight but anyway i won't be back.

We enjoyed a night at the Cassa Hotel for a special anniversary and also enjoyed the Butter Restaurant! Both were fantastic and contributed to a fun weekend. The location is amazing. We were close to everything, including Times Square, without being in the middle of it all. We could walk anywhere in the greatest city in the world from this central location. The accommodations were clean and comfortable. Our room overlooked a very cute courtyard as part of the Butter Restaurant so it felt like we were in a small city when we looked out the window but there we were in the heart of New York. The rooms are definitely on the smaller side but not too bad and the bathrooms made up for it with a spacious area and up-to-date and trendy fixtures and overall design. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They called the room 10 minutes after I checked in to see how everything was and when I arrived to the hotel they actually offered an early check in. They really cared about our comfort there and everyone was proactive in trying to anticipate our needs without being pushy about it. Just an outstanding staff all around. They should all be commended for making this such a great experience. We don't usually stay at the hotel restaurant but planned it this way because we really wanted to experience Butter. It was a great restaurant. The space was comfortable and trendy without being over the top. We were seated at a large comfortable booth in the center of the restaurant and just loved the location. The waitstaff was incredibly helpful and accommodating. Overall a great time. Even with the name Butter we found healthy choices (except for that amazing and delicious beignet! wow!). We look forward to returning to the hotel and restaurant and highly recommend both.

Our stay at the Cassa was wonderful. It started with a welcome by the lovely front desk worker. She went out of her way to accommodate us. We had just come in from a cruise and got to the hotel much earlier than our check in time. She let me know that the valet is 24 hours and helped me stretch out some time with on street parking while we went for breakfast. Our room was ready much earlier than we had requested at reservation, so we were able to check in early and rest. Room was clean, modern and good size. Bed was very comfortable and bathroom was spacious and well appointed (great shower!). In the weeks prior, the concierge communicated with me to inquire about our needs during the stay. This was very helpful in offering some wonderful recommendations for dining. Room was great and the staff made the stay even better. Will definitely stay here again.

We went to Manhattan for a long weekend stayed here two nights. The location is walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, shopping and Central Park. This hotel is beautiful! The room we had was perfect for my husband and I. Construction was going on outside but we didn't hear a thing. We were so pleased with the beauty of our room and great location that we will definitely stay here again. Staff was so accommodating and helpful. Love the Neil George products so much had to buy some to take home for myself and gifts.

After looking at so many various hotel reviews, I chose Cassa. I got a great rate online but it put us in a room with a double bed. I was wary of that but was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't as small as people have said. It was perfect for me and my daughter. I can't say enough about the bed. It was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in (including my own). The pillows were perfect! After a loooong NYC day, we loved coming back to the room to take a glorious rain shower. The shower is fantastic and the Neil George bath soaps are to die for!!! Housekeeping was superb! When you walk into the lobby, it smells like a spa. So relaxing! I read a review that someone commented of the cute doormen. Yes, they are very easy on the eyes, attentive and welcoming. We were on the 6th floor and there wasn't a NYC view but I didn't care about that. It was quiet and a great place to chill after a long day of sightseeing. It's close to EVERYTHING!!! The subway is a few blocks away and there is a market around the corner to get food and drinks for decent prices. Because if it's central location, its convenient for stopping back in to drop of souvenirs instead of carrying them all day. I will never stay anywhere other than Cassa if I get to visit NYC again. My only regret is that I couldn't take that awesome bed and pillows home with me. Thank you Cassa!

My son booked four nights at this hotel for us as a birthday present for my husband and what a great choice he made. The hotel is in a really great location, a short walk from Times Square, 5th Avenue, Broadway and other famous sights. The rooms are very clean and comfortable with modern decor and free wifi in the room. I can't comment on the hotel's restaurant, Butter, because we didn't eat there but I can tell you that complimentary tea and coffee is available in the lobby until 11.30am every day, which we took advantage of before each exhausting day's sightseeing! As for the staff, well I can't praise them enough. I'd forgotten my adaptor and they lent me one to use during our stay and they also made a wonderful gesture towards my son to make his gift to us even more special. Thanks to all the staff who were always courteous and greeted you with a smile which, to my mind, makes all the difference. And, while I'm at it, thanks too to our wonderful son!

This was a five night stay, with a Standard Room (as booked through Expedia) on the 26th Floor.We were very pleased with the location of the hotel; with just a short walk to Times Square, the Rockefeller building, Empire State and main shopping streets - this was ideally situated for us. Despite our room being on the street side, this is not a busy road and we found it very quiet at night (though being so far away from the road will definitely have helped!).The room was larger than we expected, with a Queen sized bed, two chairs, large flatscreen television, small fridge, safe, iron and board, hairdryer, lovely clean white towels and a gorgeous looking white cube-shaped radio. The storage space for clothing is limited, though there were plenty of hangars. Decorated in shades of cream and green, this presented as a lovely modern room. The clean and contemporary tiled bathroom contained a large shower (with great temperatures that didn't falter), sink with mixer tap and British 'water saving' style of toilet. The only negative I can pick out here is that as the hotel has chosen white enamel style bathroom accessories, these had a fair few chips out of the edges (bound to happen when in contact with stone and hard materials) which detracted ever-so-slightly from the overall finish.The staff we encountered here were friendly, polite and seemed happy to please. We had a slight problem with the keycard access to our room - though on the way to reception to ask for help, we met the maintenance man. We didn't even make it to the reception as he came straight back up to the 26th floor with us and tested the cards out. It seems the readers can be a bit fussy - Make sure to press your keycard to the right hand side of the reader on pulling it out! On leaving the hotel we were able to store our suitcase (at no extra charge) whilst we explored one last time before setting off for the airport.Given the very reasonable room price, we felt this modern, clean and friendly hotel was great value for money. I'd happily recommend it.

We came into the city for a quick getaway and selected this hotel since it was a VIP Access hotel through Expedia +Gold. We're very happy with the choice, the location is perfect, the hotel staff was very inviting and the lobby area is quite unique. Of course, being a midtown hotel, the space is at a premium but they used it well. We were happy to get a free upgrade to a King Deluxe room upon check-in as a +Gold member because we were a little nervous at the size of the smaller rooms. The room was very clean and well appointed, other than a half empty bottle of root beer hiding in the mini fridge, and a seemingly missing painting above the bed (room 2401).We'll definitely be looking at the Cassa when we return to the city in November.

We stayed at Cassa for one night for a quick NY getaway. The room was nice and clean and I loved that they had a walk-in shower with glass doors instead of a bathtub with shower curtain. It definitely made the bathroom feel much larger. Bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows and very convenient to the theaters. We ate at Butter which was great - I think the only downfall was that one of the concierge booked us for brunch at a French restaurant and they really didn't have brunch. I think she just needed more experience or something.

Room 606, super noisy. I wear eye plugs so I made it through the 5 nights I stayed. Probably should have complained the first night. Everything else fine, except the painting that was supposed to be over my bed was an empty space with holes on the wall. Otherwise clean and pleasant staff.

i was alone in this hotel for 6 daysit was great!!!!!the location, the staff (espaicially jamal)i will return to this hoteli come to nyc every yearthe one problem is that the bad is small for 2 people

The Cassa Hotel and Residences on 45th street in New York City is a hidden gem with friendly, stellar service and a feeling of home and safety away from home in a classy environment. We found this hotel online in 2012 because the price was amazing for what we could get (big room, quality linens, it looked very clean in the pictures, and it had all the amenities you expect from a good hotel) and it was about a block and a half away from Times Square, so a safe walk home after shows. Well the hotel was and is AMAZING so much so that we did not consider any other property on our most recent stay in July 2014. I have stayed in many hotels in NYC and the Cassa Hotel by far surpasses them all in comfort (great AC and plush beds) for the price and location. Safe area between 5th and 6th avenues and steps away from Rockafeller Center, Grand Central Station, New York Public Libray, shopping, Bryant Park, etc etc. and there are great restaurants in the neighborhood and one connected to the hotel! There are only 8 rooms per floor - it is as quiet as can be - you don't even know there is anyone else there and hardly any traffic noise at all in the rooms. CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN. Unbelievably clean and the staff is so friendly. They greeted us BY NAME every morning as we left and welcomed us back upon all our returns throughout our stay. The wonderful iced tea in the afternoon and great coffee in the morning in the lobby is an added bonus. Their packages online are very reasonable and they are very good communicating with you about your upcoming stay. Again, I would not look anywhere else WHEN TRAVELLING TO NYC and I hope they continue to keep up their quality as this is a home away from home for me and my friends when we travel to the big apple.

I am so used to NYC hotels under $400/night being the size of postage stamps that I wasn't prepared for my room at the Cassa. It was spacious and well appointed, and even had a bathroom big enough for a double sink and a deep soak bathtub. Add a bathrobe, in-room coffee service and a lovely selection of teas, and I think I've found my next go-to hotel in Manhattan. About $300/night just off 5th in midtown, and by NY standards, a good value.

I book in this hotel Twice , very nice rooms , quite and comfortable , The staff very helpful , it's near by most of the seen sights , next the hotel the coffee shop where you can have daily fresh food and drinks. walking distance to Time squire , and most of the broadway shows is around the hotel 4 to 5 minutes walking . i forgot to mentioned the bathroom very clean and stylish . book here you will not regret.

We've just returned from our first trip to New York. We were upgraded to a king sized room which was a nice surprise. The room was small but the size did not impact our stay at all. We had room all around our bed with a small desk and decent sized closet. The hotel had complimentary wifi which worked very well. Our room didn't have a bath tub which was not a problem for us but could be for others. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable! We also loved how quiet it was Iin our room. The staff are super friendly and very helpful! The hotel is located in a great location. It's on a quiet street, close but not too close to Times Square, nicely located near the theatres. Our only wish was for a gym in the hotel. They do have an arrangement with a gym near by which we didn't use so can't review. Thanks to the staff for their evening greeting when coming home at night!

In brief: Very clean, friendly & trendy hotel.The Rooms: Very small - even by NY standards, queen sized bed and one side didn't have a bed side locker as the wardrobe came wight up to the side of the bed (they don't show that one on the website :) I did fear this would be the case and inquired about an upgrade prior to arrival which was not referenced at all- Overall spotlessly clean and superb shower, much needed after a days exploring the city! Public areas: there is none unfortunately, the lobby is pretty much the only public area and this was really felt considering the size of the rooms. Somewhere to have a coffee and check emails other than the room would made the Cassa a lot more comfortable. Would I Return? Yes, more than likely, the central location more that compensates for the slight negatives of the property.

Stayed for 5 nights at Cassa Hotel and we could not ask for a better experience. The room is very nice and modern; the bed... Super comfy! But what's best of all is the location... Only 2 blocks from Times Square! Highly recommended!

We stayed at the Cassa hotel this past May for several days. Our goal was to find the most affordable yet modern hotel near Times Square. In this regard I feel that Cassa is a great value. With limited time it was important that we be close to the action (tourist action anyway). The hotel is one and a half blocks east and two blocks north of Times Square. Even with the long city blocks in Manhattan, the walk doesn’t seem long at all because of how much action there is in that area. The service was on par with an establishment of this price point and location. The room was well appointed, clean, modern, and comfortable. While the room was very small, the bathroom was bright and spacious. Unfortunately I can’t recall our room number but it was an interior facing room. Our view was of the backs of other buildings and the patio of the restaurant below, which is located in the basement of the hotel. In general, some pros, cons, and observations:- The window does not open all the way. The photo attached shows the widest it will open.- The 10th floor lounge opens into an adjoining terrace that overlooks W. 45th Street. We never used it for anything but it appears to be a relaxing space. There is also a restroom available on that floor.- There is a Pret A Manger next door which offers coffees, juices, sandwiches, and breakfast items at good quality and prices, a welcome relief from the high prices in that part of town. The hotel does not include breakfast with the room nor do they offer one for a charge so being next to a Pret A Manger was a big benefit.- Other pro’s: rainfall shower, large TV, quiet rooms.

The Cassa Hotel is always a pleasurable stay. For years I looked for a convenient but affordable, clean but spacious (for NY) hotel for my trips into the city for work. I like to stay in the heart of the city since my clients are in walking distance or a short cab ride, and then I'm also in walking distance to Time Square for dinners and entertainment at night. I've stayed at numerous locations near Time Square which can get pricy because of the tourists. However the Cassa Hotel is always affordable and offers the same amenities as all the surrounding hotels. If you've been to NY you know that space is a luxury when it comes to hotel rooms, and you're usually playing chess with your room door opening onto the desk chair or worse your bed. At Cassa I've never had an issue, from their smallest of rooms to their more spacious suites, they have found an effective yet cozy way to make each room inviting. Just note, the Cassa Hotel is a boutique hotel, meaning it's a smaller hotel without a spacious lobby for get-togethers or working lunches. The upper half of the hotel are 'owned' condos that can be rented out should you be coming with a larger family. The lobby consists of a few chairs and the check in counter, however the hotel features an amazing restaurant that opened in the last year, Butter. I believe one of the Food Network Stars is the chef, if you watch the show. Being that it's a boutique hotel, there is no room service (well none that I know of) however they have several personal items should you forget your toothpaste etc. The rooms have a small fridge, so I always buy some extra drinks and/or snacks to munch on. I'm of the belief that if you're in the city you should get dressed, walk outside and find yourself a meal since there is so much to experience, so the room service has never been an issue to me. I will definitely continue to stay at the Cassa Hotel for each of my upcoming trips for business, as well as my personal ones too. The staff is friendly and accommodating, and I couldn't imagine wanting to stay anywhere else!

Stayed here on business in July 2014.I arrived around 11.30pm on a stormy night (post a significant flight delay) along with a co-worker to be told by the ever-smiling reception host that the hotel had given our rooms away. Rooms that had been confirmed and pre-paid for by us, over a week ago. The only option, said the receptionist, was to double up with my co-traveller in a room with 2 double beds, which the hotel had saved out of the goodness of their hearts. Also, the obligatory: "we hardly ever do an overbooking" story followed. Well, you have overbooked 100% of the times I have used your hotel, so the other stats weren't really relevant to me...so the rest of the apology was just jabber.The receptionist also made it clear that if we chose not to take this option it would take over an hour to find alternate accommodations at another hotel, and it was going to be a difficult endeavor given the lateness of the hour and the stormy weather (several flights in and out of NYC had been cancelled that evening). I would have imagined that the hotel would at least have an option ready, in the eventuality of us showing up but the bets had obviously been placed at their end on a no-show on our part.We were told we would be refunded the amount for the 2nd room that they weren't giving us...wow, imagine that...you aren't going to charge me for a service you don't provide me...thank you so much for your considerate behavior.Any how, we chose the only room available given early morning meetings. The room itself was large and comfortable. The bed was also comfortable, although the aircon vent (could not be adjusted) blew directly on my head all night and left me with a cold the next day. The bathroom, especially the shower, was large and nicely done up in cream tiles and stone. Oh Cassa, how I wished you hadn't overbooked, cause there is some real promise here.In the morning we received a hesitant note from the manager inviting us for breakfast at their restaurant...we did partake, but the pickings were meager at best...a few muffins, some juice, some fruit...I have had better, pretty much everywhere else I have stayed. Overall, a disappointing experience...especially when the facilities are so good. Our travel agent wrangled some other freebies out of management later, but I could really care less. Note to potential hotel guests: make sure you check in early, else you may not get a room at all.

We just stayed for a night in Cassa.Room is really small and bed smaller for 2 people. But it was neat & clean. Bathroom was spacious with satisfactory amenities and of course with a single bathrobe for 2 people... ;) ....Staff of Cassa is really nice and helpful. We really liked their hospitality.The location of hotel is just perfect. Even if its in bustling area of Manhattan, you wont listen all that chaos in your room. One negative thing is that, room doesn't have any view at all. We were on 14th floor with a view of a building right next door.Times square, Rockfellar center and all major sightseeing are at walking distance.Overall...its a nice hotel & I'll be definitely recommending it.

I love, love, loved my stay at the Cassa. I originally booked for a week, however my flight was delayed, so I arrived there a day late and was immediately upgraded. The staff were friendly and welcoming and I always got a hello as I entered and left the hotel The hotel is close to Times Square, but far enough away to avoid the crowds. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and will recommend it to anyone looking for a more "personal" hotel.

We stayed here for 2 nights with some friends. Unfortunately we had some problems. Our key cards were reset several times as they would never work and our A/C was broken. It was over 90F and very humid in New York that week! Had to move to a different room temporarily when we returned to our room after 1:00am because of the A/C. We were reassured that it would be fixed in the morning but the maintenance workers did not get to it until the afternoon and then it still didn't work. So we moved all of our things to yet a 3rd room. The key cards and the A/C worked just fine it that room. There were a lot of apologies but nothing was done for us until late afternoon on the second day.On another note, our friends had no issues with their room. Location was perfect for access to Times Square and theatres. This is a smaller boutique style hotel.

I stayed at this hotel the end of June. It was a last minute trip and this happened to be one of the cheapest hotel in Times Square area. The location of the hotel is perfect. It's on a quiet street but only a couple of blocks from times square. An easy 10 min or less walk. The hotel is very clean. PROS:-Location- hotel super clean -Front desk very welcoming and professional-room was right by the elevator but we didn't hear the elevator or people coming in and out.-Modern design- There is a restaurant with a cute outdoor patio-Bathrobe lol-Hotel can keep your luggage free of charge after you check out (tipping is always welcome)CONS:-The view was very bad. our view was a building right next door.- My friend and I booked a double bed because all the queen bedrooms were sold out. Big mistake!! the bed was very small. it was not enough space for two. I'm 5'8 and my legs were hanging off the bed at times. pillows were not comfortable.-The guy outside who is in charge of getting taxis for hotel guess. We told him we were going to catch our train back home and instead of getting us a cab, he started having a conversation with another employee. it wasn't a work related conversation by the way. after standing there for a good 8 min, we decided to try to stop a cab ourselves, once he saw that, he stopped his conversation and got us a cab. I thought that was very rude especially that he knew we were going to catch a train.Overall, I would recommend this hotel.
user_name:
Diachel
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Cassa Hotel for 8 nights at the beginning of July.We really enjoyed the hotel which is very well located (couple of blocks of Time Square and Central Park). The location is also ideal for shopping as well as for the night life. You will basically be in the center of all the best attractions in New York.The rooms are big, well designed, and always clean.But above all, the Cassa's Team was fantastic. They were always available to answer all our request , and they took the time on almost a daily basis to recommend us the best attraction in the city. Cassa Hotel is the place to go while staying in NYC!!!

The cassa hotel was exactly what we needed after a lengthy flight from Australia. The room was immaculate and the bathroom was spotless. We were staying as part of our honeymoon and they offered us free wifi for the length of our stay which was nice of them. Room was quiet, and we had a restful sleep. It was like there was no one else staying at the hotel.Location was perfect, two blocks from times square. There is a little deli not far where we got breakfast and a few other groceries. Staff were helpful, and friendly. Would stay again no question.

We stayed here July 4th weekend and were very pleased! The location was fantastic (only a few blocks from Times Square, Broadway & 5th Avenue)! The staff were always smiling and friendly! The room we stayed in was cleand but quite small. But hat didn't bother us since we only used to room to sleep and/or change clothes between activities. The bed was SO comfortable, we slept great!! My only issue was that the mini bar was only and empty fridge. We usually use the mini bar when we stay in hotels, so that was a bit disappointing. However, it wasn't a deal breaker. We had a room in the back of the building (1103) that faced other buildings which meant it was quiet, except for our neighbors being quite noisy (which wasn't the hotel's fault). I highly recommend staying here!!

Was here with my wife for 7 nights, first week of July. Clean, neat, unbeatable location, great staff, reasonable prices, great value for your money. Will stay there again. Just the right place for Manhattan visit.

We spent 7 nights here and were very happy. It is a very friendly hotel with staff always greeting you on return, helping with transport advice, information on where to dine etc. Our room was spacious and well equipped. The only downside we found was there was no tea/coffee making facility or wi-fi in the room although they were available on the 10th floor with tea & coffee till 11am (this was changed to the lobby while we were there due to renovation taking place on the 10th). However we did have a bar fridge which we needed. Location is fantastic and we walked nearly everywhere. Will definitely recommend it to friends and family.

I've stayed here twice in the past year and would do so again, despite the tiny rooms (even by NYC standards). The hotel is very conveniently located and has a great staff--very friendly and helpful. Rooms were very clean and comfortable--just really small. If I were traveling with someone, I'd stay somewhere else just to have a little more space.

Stayed here 4 nights in late May - part business, part pleasure. Location is great, only a few blocks in any direction to Grand Central, Metro stops, and Times Square. Rooms are nice and typical sizes for this part of Manhattan. Our room was on the back side of the hotel, which is very quiet - except for the evening when a private event in the courtyard below reverberated up the sides of the surrounding properties and made it hard to even talk in our room - with the windows closed! Front Desk staff was very understanding and worked with the event person to lower the volume to a much more acceptable level. Plenty of nearby choices for breakfast (including perennial favorite, the Red Flame Diner) and lunch. A special "thanks" to the bellman, who really made a special effort to get us a cab on a Sunday afternoon when surrounding streets were blocked for a parade.

I did a lot of research on where to stay for my first ever trip to NYC. I have to say, I was really happy that I chose Cassa Hotel. It is very close to the Times Square action, without being loud and noisy. The room had great blackout curtains so when we went to bed there was no light coming in from the street. It is within walking distance of many major destinations. We walked to Top of the Rock, Times Square, Central Park, 5th avenue is half a block away. Lots of great shopping, food and sights all around. The room was clean and the air conditioning worked. Wifi IS FREE. The only reason to pay would be if you wanted extra fast wifi for sending large emails etc. The bathrooms are really nice, its not often that I feel comfortable with bare feet in a hotel bathroom. The guy at the front door was awesome, he got us a cab and watched our luggage while we grabbed breakfast on the day we checked out. All in all, a great place to stay.

Staff were extremely commendable. Always with a smile, helpful, and they actually bothered to remember my name, have parcels sent up to my room as and when they see me along the corridors or at the lobby - v impressive for Americans, i have to say. The doorman is ALWAYS there to greet us every morning, open the doors, smile and wish us a great day (for 2 mths, mind you). I am from the service industry and i can tell when service is from the heart. And i'm very happy to say the staff at Cassa are so precious! Location is perfect! 2 streets away from Rockefeller Centre (subway stn), 3 streets away from Bryant Park(another subway stn).
