One avenue away from Times Square - so you're literally living in times square, but just a lot more peaceful. If you're travelling out during the weekends, Port Authority is within walking distance (2 av, 3 streets away), and so is Penn Station - your link to the airports via train. If travelling from EWR, there is a bus service from the corner of bryant park as well. Very, very convenient.Cleanliness is impeccable. My only gripe is the free coffee & tea during breakfast. Maybe it's my fault for always heading down so late (10-11am), but it is at that timing when either the coffee or tea is empty. :( But it's not a big problem, there are many Starbucks outlets around the corner.Oh and just one more thing: Room 34B - the bed is SO damaged. Every little toss or turn you make, the bed squeaks! Time for a change! Everything else is in the room is perfect! Amenities are more than enough for a very comfortable stay. Spacious room, good & working showers, washing machine, TV, microwave, etc.

We stayed at The Cassa Hotel for our honeymoon in April 2014. We arrived and were immediately greeted by someone to take our cases. The reception staff were more then helpful and were quick to check us in to our room. We stayed on the 17th floor which was ok by us. We didn't have much of a view but we didn't spend enough time in the room to contemplate needing a view. The rooms were clean and tidy and we had an ipod dock and a big tv which is always a plus.Cassa Hotel is a couple of blocks away from time Square (Less then 5min walk) and within walking distance of central park, 5th avenue and the Hudson river. The perfect location really. We found that booking the Lincoln Town cabs were better then the Yellow taxi's. Reception also let us call them from their phone. They have a lovely restaurant on sight and free wifi on the 10th floor.Overall, we were completely satisfied with the price we paid for the hotel and we would defiantly stay there again.

Cassa is a hidden gem. This is my second stay at this hotel in three years and among my best hotel experiences in NYC. By NYC standards, the room size is above average. The hotel and room are well appointed with clean, updated facilities. The hotel is an avenue away from Times Square, so perfect location to enjoy it, but not be in the thick of it. There was one hiccup with our stay that was resolved by hotel staff with care and contrition. Very little street noise. There are some noises within the room that I think are plumbing or HVAC related, so light sleepers might want to bring ear plugs. I see these as minor points compared to so many positives. We'll be back next year.

I am truly impressed with my stay at the Cassa Hotel. I greatly appreciate the excellent customer service and fantastic location. I felt like a special guest in my upgraded room and appreciated the microwave added to my room for my dietary needs, I have Celiac Disease and needed an option to prepare Gluten Free foods.I am already planning my next visit to NYC and will happily stay at the Cassa hotel again.Thank you VERY much for a wonderful experience!

My wife and I have both been going to NYC yearly for the past 7 years. Stayed here at Cassa for our Honeymoon, and we gave it a 10/10. Absolutely loved everything about it, from the amazing customer service to the cleanliness of the bathroom! Everything worked, everything was clean, no complaints at all. We are definitely staying here next time we come to visit! Thanks Cassa NYC!!!

We have just returned from a 6 night stay at the Cassa, Hotel and found the stay to be very comfortable and convenient. The location is superb for central Manhattan, literally minutes from Times square and Bryant park and the metro stops. The Room was very well air conditioned and was serviced every day, so was very comfortable to return to at the end of a hot and sticky New York June day. I would have liked tea and coffee facilities in the room, but there was free tea and coffee in the lobby before 11 am each morning. its also steps away from Pret a manger and Duane read who do hot drinks, we were at the back of the hotel, so no view but it was quiet with no road noise and this was perfect for me. great price on expedia with flights included.

I stayed here for a few nights due to late nights at work. Try to get a room away from 45th street as it is really noisy. The continental breakfast is really basic and my corporate rate included WIFI (I cannot believe that hotels still charge for that). Very happy with the staff allowing me to check out a day early due to my plans changing at the last minute!

Hotel is nice, staff friendly. Had a minor hiccup when checking in due to our hotel was already paid prior to getting there and once we check in was charged again. It was resolved quickly by there accounting department as they realized the mistake was made. I give all credit to accountant that realized the mistake was made, front desk clerks (morning) had no idea what to do. clueless. Rooms very clean, but small not something that I am use to. The bed are very comfortable. Each time we left for the day housekeeping cleaned the room as well as brought clean linens. That is what I call excellent customer service. The room always smelled so fresh. I love that. Would like to give a big big thank you to Emilo for just being so pleasant and personable. That goes along way when your visiting and have never been to New York before.
user_name:
Tiffany C
Houston, Texas, United States

review_body: A contemporary hotel in Times Square, not too big what makes you feel warm, a bit like home in such a huge city, in a not too busy street. The room was quite big, modern and comfortable. The service very good too. I have enjoyed my staying there and I would come back again for sure.

We stayed there 10 nights and the hotel has great position. Staff friendly and helpful, the room was really nice and clean and for the new york standard big. If i go to the nyc again I will stay at this hotel. Lovely place.

Being an extra block from Times Square made this hotel quieter and the street was not so hectic. The Jr.suite was worth the few extra dollars. It had one of the largest bathrooms I have had in a NYC hotel. The bed and bedding were top notch and the room nice and cool. The desk staff was very friendly and helpful. I booked through hotel.com. Hope I can find the same deal for my next trip.

Amazing location, ideal base to get out and about in New York. The staff were so friendly and helpful. Nothing was ever too much. The rooms were lovely and clean, nicely done too.The free wifi on the 10th floor was great too. A lovely area too, you could sit out and watch and listen to the world go by.

I stayed at the Cassa for one night and then returned a week later for 2 nights. The hotel is in a great position, very close to Times Square and a nice walk from Central Park. I was catching a bus from the Port Authority and it was possible to walk the few blocks with my bags easily. The rooms are lovely and I was upgraded to a queen room on the second visit which was even nicer. All the staff are very friendly and helpful. I will definitely return.

From the moment I arrived at Cassa, I felt like I'd entered into a sanctuary in the middle of the world's city. Luxury, comfort, and location; three must haves for me when staying abroad. The hotel staff went out of their way every day to accommodate my needs. From helping me navigate the labyrinth that is the NYC subway system to making sure I didn't forget an umbrella when leaving for dinner and a show. Of course eating at Cassa is a treat as well, the restaurant was comfortable and reasonably priced, and they don't hesitate to bring their culinary "A" game every day. Whenever I'm in Midtown Manhattan I will have a home away from home @ Cassa. I'm headed out to SF soon and am looking forward to staying at Hotel Zetta, which I'm sure is great too!

My friend from out of town came to stay with me and wanted a true NYC experience. The location of Cassa was ideal for our adventures in the city and Butter was EPIC- I can still taste the scallops. The room itself was spacious luxurious and the shower was lovely. I hope to stay again soon and will be telling my friends about this place.
user_name:
Colleen H
New York City, New York

review_body: My wife and I were in NYC for our anniversary celebrating with a great dinner and a Broadway Play. I made and cancelled several hotel reservations until I came across Cassa. The location was perfect as our dining venue was at the same address and the theater was only 2 blocks away. Our room was small but functional. The bathroom was larger than most we have encountered in NYC and the shower was wonderful. The bed appeared to be soft but once we got in to sleep, it was very comfortable. There were many small things that would keep me from staying here again beginning with pre arrival. I completed the information requested in the pre arrival email questionnaire. I was asked for my arrival time even though an early check in in was not guaranteed. I agreed to accept and pay for any upgrade that was available thi8nking it would get us a room sooner. Despite this, our room was not available until after 3 PM and no upgrades were offered. In that same pre arrival questionnaire, it asked if we were celebrating any special occasions. I remarked that we were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. I would have expected, at least, a Happy Anniversary greeting as we checked in. During our stay not one word was mentioned of our special day. When we were finally able to get into a room, there was an envelope under our door with my name on it. Inside was a coupon to use for Continental Breakfast. Unfortunately, we stayed on a Saturday evening and the breakfast was not available on Sunday. I don't know why they bothered to give us the coupon. The windows in the room were so filthy on the outside, one could barely see out of them. I should have kept my reservation at the Marriott Marquis at the same rate.

I was traveling for business and got a great rate here. Rooms were small but tastefully decorated. Guest service was outstanding! This is extremely convenient when visiting the Midtown/Times Square Region.
user_name:
David G
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I've been to nyc plenty of times and this by far is the best place to stay at. Price is mediocre and staff is very friendly. The rooms itself is bigger than most hotels in nyc. I recommend it to everyone.

First off, this is a fantastic hotel. Very well maintained, nice finishings, great bathroom/shower, very comfortable bed, and a great location (just 2 blocks away from Times Square, a couple of blocks to 5th avenue, a 10 min walk to Rockefeller, etc... very central!).The staff was very friendly, and the housekeeping service was excellent. Our room was a bit small (which was my one complaint about the room), although, I'm sure they have larger rooms and a higher price point. The internet is not free of charge (and it's a bit expensive on a daily basis), however, they do offer free internet in the lounge. Overall, very pleased with our experience, and would not only recommend to others, but would also stay again.

We stayed at the CASSA residence for 5 nights whilst in New York for our wedding. From walking in the staff were extremely helpful. The atmosphere was professional and relaxing. We got to our room on 36th floor and the view was stunning and the room was great!Had a great stay here, we will be back! The location is perfect.

It's tough to find a hotel in NYC that offers both value (quite reasonable considering the hotel's up-market qualities & unbeatable location) AND comfort (not just the amenities, but the reassurance you get knowing that the staff is not only extremely helpful but also has your best interests at heart). I highly recommend the CASSA HOTEL not only for it's value but for the ease and comfort provided by the excellent staff.

I was looking for a room in New York City, last minute and unaware that it was graduation weekend along with the aids walk(which is why rooms were scarce) . So as I was searching the web, The Cassa showed up and I took a chance. Boy was I surprised at what I found. When I say hidden gem, I mean a diamond in the rough. I arrived early but the room I booked was not available, but the gentleman at the desk I believe his name was John assured me that the room they were giving me was a better room for my inconvenience which ranks high in my expectations of a hotel and customer service. I left my bags and went into the city to enjoy my day. When I arrived back it was a slight mix up ,not with the hotel but with a guest not checking out but I waited only a few minutes and was given the key to my room. When I walked in, I was wowed by the fantastic and spacious Jr suite. The Ll shaped couch and king sized bed was a great look. The bathroom was large with a double vanity and sink along with a bathrobe. The next morning I went downstairs and they have fresh coffee brewed and you can order breakfast from a local restaurant that delivers to the hotel and you can either eat in the room or in the lounge on the 10th floor . Before I go how can I not speak nothing but high regards for Amy the concierge. I spoke with her about my requests and she relied back in a timely manner and was able to meet all my requests. Please stop by to see her for any of your needs. If I'm asked would I return, I would say read my review and ignore anything negative from other because I didn't experience any drastic issue. See you again Cassa Hotel.

The location could hardily have been more perfect - a few strides from Avenue of the Americas and several minutes' walk from Times Square.First experiences were splendid too: With only a couple of emails from me Jacob, one of the concierges, arranged my wife's birthday dinner in a restaurant overlooking Central Park (Robert at the Museum of Art & Design - highly recommended). For that he deserved a bouquet!You shouldn't spend much time in your room in a city as exciting as New York but ours (though termed a junior suite) was on the cramped side and strangely shaped - slim with dim lighting which made the tiny lounge more or less useless because it was hard to see anything in it. The fridge did not seem to have been plugged in and was empty. The coffee maker was good once we got the hang of it. The bathroom was first class, spacious, with a handheld shower and bath, and decent toiletries.We were told the hotel's restaurant, Butter, would be opening for breakfast and other times but it was not available when we were there. For breakfast we found a marvellous cafe (Dunhills) a couple of hundred yards away across 6th Avenue which served an array of gorgeous goodies.

Special thanks for manager Sara and Securite manager Vasil. Their works fits high service in hotel buissness. It it really wonderfull to receive back something what you lost. Sara found in the room where I stoped, my documents and 1000 euro . She send it to security office. Vasil security manager found a way how to send it to me to Ukraine. Now I have everything at me.Thank for cassa hotel team very much and special for Sara and Vasil.

We stayed here for three nights to attend a wedding. From the get go, the service was excellent. No question went unanswered. The king sized bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in and the shower...SWOON!! It was a large rain shower! The water pressure was good and the bath products smelled delicious. The bride and groom hosted a cocktail party at the hotel for over a hundred people and the staff was awesome as was the food. The hotel location was great as we were able to walk to Times Square, Central Park and lots of bars and restaurants.And don't miss the watermelon/mint cocktail downstairs at Butter - it's like summer in a glass!

We had a wonderful stay at the Cassa Hotel. The hotel location was very convenient to Midtown activities. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very helpful and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the midtown area. Thanks for a wonderful stay!

Visited NYC last week on business. Prices and availability at most of the larger hotels were either unreasonable or not available, so based on prior reviews, I tried Cassa. This is a boutique hotel well located in mid-town - near the tourism action on Times Square as well as businesses on 5th, 6th or Madison Avenues.It's easy to miss the hotel from the street since it has a relatively discrete street presence and small lobby. I had a junior suite which was large compared to the typical hotel room in NY, although not the most efficient use of space (sitting area is between bed and bath room in a completely dark part of the suite). The room was pleasant and quiet even though I was on the 5th floor. As is common in NY, the room was quite dark because of the shadowing of surrounding buildings if you are not staying on a high floor. Wifi worked well and was complimentary with my rate. Not a lot of common areas to "hang out" given that the lobby is small, there is no in-hotel bar/restaurant although there is a lounge without food/drink service on the 10th floor. I did not try room service. There are plenty of restaurant options at various price points in the immediate area.Everything in the room was in working order and there is complimentary in-room coffee. The decor and hallways could use a little refresh, but certainly not a significant detraction. Front desk service was okay - not particularly engaging, empathetic or attentive. Always seem to be side conversations going on and a wait despite 2-3 staff.Overall, a nice choice in Manhattan and certainly more enjoyable than a large, chain hotel.

Excellent location, close to shopping area, restaurant and tourist locations. Rooms very clean and roomy to be a boutique hotel. Service was very polite and answers all our questions and needs. Free coffee in the lobby was perfect to start the day.

Had the pleasure of staying at the Cassa Hotel this past weekend while in NYC for a wedding reception. This was my second stay at Cassa and they continue to hit all the high marks expected at a boutique hotel in midtown. The rooms are spacious, quiet and the beds are perfect. The staff really do go out of their way to be helpful and accommodating in the most personal way. The hotel restaurant, Butter, opened since my last visit and it feels like a woodsy escape from the concrete jungle outside. We didn't eat but had a few cocktails at the bar, try the vodka drink with the watermelon ice cubes! Cassa is my new favorite place to stay in the city. Check it out!

We came to New York for our daughter's wedding and the Cassa Hotel was booked for us by our son-in-law. It was an excellent choice. Our room was on the 21stfloor with views of the surrounding skyscrapers. There were two fast lifts to get up there and we never had to wait more than a minute or two. We had an executive room, which was very spacious and comfortable and when we arrived there were two bottles of water and a plate of delicious chocolates waiting for us. We had put in a request for a kettle and that was waiting for us too. The bed was very comfortable and we slept very well. The air con was very efficient, so we were never too hot or too cold. The television was huge with a great many channels and I really appreciated the i-pod dock as I usually carry mine around with me on holiday. The bathroom was very luxurious with a fantastic rainforest shower which was simple to use and there was a plug-in hair dryer. Everything was spotless!On a lower floor there was a lovely lounge with sofas, tables and chairs and an outside terrace.The service was terrific - we mentioned at reception that there were no hooks on the bathroom door for our bathrobes and the handyman came up immediately and put on two hooks and also fixed my bedside light switch. When we accidentally locked ourselves out of the safe someone came immediately and sorted it out. The fridge was also much appreciated!My only complaint was that a few more drawers would have been useful as we were there for 10 days and had a lot of clothes with us for the wedding, but I understand that normally people wouldn't be staying for such a long time so the drawers would have been perfectly adequate.The location was very central and it was simple to get to places such as the Top of the Rock and the Rockefeller Plaza on foot. The subway was quite handy.Everyone who worked at the hotel was polite, helpful and friendly and I would love to stay there again.

Perfect location. Great staff. Great value. I recommend Cassa 100%.Perfect stay in NYC. Butter restaurant next door is great. Will definitely come back again and stay here. Great midtown location very easy access to GCS.

I want to start this review by saying we LOVE boutique hotels. We were very excited about visiting this hotel, as it was a change for us (had always stayed at the Blakely in past visits to NYC). Unfortunately, we were not impressed. The front desk staff seemed overwhelmed, but not because they were over-busy. The rooms were small and virtually NO CLOSET SPACE to speak of. We understand packing light, but this was a bit ridiculous! Sleeping quality was not as hoped, either. When in NYC, we need a good night's sleep for all of the adventures of the day. Breakfast was expensive and not anything to write home about. Staff didn't love their jobs up in the breakfast area, either. We also had a work meeting here. That went better, and they delivered lunch to us twice. Won't return.

I went here on business and found the hotel through TripAdvisor. Overall, it was a good value. The rooms are very clean, but are small and are designed for one person. I had nowhere to fit my suitcase after I unpacked and the closet would not have held all the clothes, if I would have been with someone else. That said, it was modern and the bathroom was clean and not cramped at all. The staff is friendly and helpful. I would imagine setting up meetings here with suites would be a good experience. It is located in midtown and is a convenient walking distance from Times Square, the New York Public Library, and Grand Central Station. If you bring a car, I would recommend pre-booking on the NYC parking website. The Cassa Hotel has valet service, but it is $60 plus tax per day. I paid $164 all in for four days in public parking one block away from the hotel.I would go again, but consider getting a suite if I am not alone.

This is a great place to stay when the prices are right. The rooms are nice although the headboards really need to be dusted more often they have those tufted backs that catch dirt. The restaurant butter is good. However no room service. that said - the maitre de goes OUT OF HIS WAY to help you if you need. I forgot his name but a great guy. Jamal at the front desk is a real gentleman and always looking to help in any way. The bathrooms are nice. if the price is under 259 its a no brainer.

We loved our stay at the Cassa Hotel! We'd never been to NYC before and were concerned about choosing the right location, but this hotel was perfect! We felt very safe and close to everything we could need, but still not in the middle of the stress and chaos of Times Square (we were *so glad* we didn't book something in the middle of Times Square!). It only took us about five-ten minutes to walk to all of the Broadway shows we could ever desire, and we were close to Rockefeller Square and tons of restaurants and attractions. It was an easy walk over to Central Park too.As far as the hotel itself - beautiful, quiet, CLEAN (yes!), and really well appointed! We had no complaints. Well done, Cassa Hotel - we will be back!

The location is great....few meters only from the 5th Avenue and Broadway shows.The room was super clean and modern.Plus of that, you can access to the famous Equinox gym club located on 43rd Street for free. Wifi price in the room too expensive ( $15/day)I enjoyed my stay in this hotel. Thanks

We just came back from a great trip to the Big Apple and absolutely loved our hotel. The rooms are modern, specially the bathroom. The location is excellent close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Hall, etc. The service was great, Jonathan was very vitreous and helpful. The bed was very comfortable. We will definitely will come back.

Based on the fact that this was a Viceroy hotel, the location and photos, I was excited to stay at this hotel for a night when they offered a last minute low rate. I was really disappointed, the room was soooooo small, dark, the carpet was really old and the walls were paper thin. The best part was the location. Had I paid the normal rate, I would have felt scammed.

Wonderful staff, convenient location and good room. We had an upgrade for free to a room on 20th floor with a huge bed and walk in shower. All staff were knowledgeable and friendly. Nothing was an inconvenience. First room given was small and the second room was bigger with better views. Located on 6th ave, good restaurants near, close to Times Square and subway too. I'd go back in a heartbeat!

On Honeymoon earlier this month my wife and I booked into the Cassa as we had stated here previously and we loved it. As it was a last minute booking we were assigned an apartment rather than a room, which we accepted. There was no safe in the apartment and it was basic at best. To top it off the rooms were never serviced and when we reported this to reception they said the apartments were "different" and a service charge applied to service the room. Staff were unhelpful, unfriendly and unsympathetic in this regard. At $500 a night this is not acceptable. So for the 4 nights we stayed there we had no clean towels, no fresh linen on the bed, no top up of toiletries and the plug in the tiny bath didn't open fully so it took hours for the water to drain when taking a bath/shower. Best advice I could give others is to stay elsewhere as the service and standard of the accommodation was substandard, especially considering the price payed. Disappointed. Ruined our Honeymoon. We certainly won't be back or recommend this establishment.

Stayed for a week with my daughter for her 21st birthday. Fab place. The rooms are fairly small but very clean and the staff were all fantastic. Great location, 2 minutes from Times Square. We didnt use the restaurant but heard good things about it. We took a kettle and tea and coffee with us but they serve coffee in the lobby each morning. Only thing it lacks is a bar but everything is so close that doesnt matter. If you are on the right floor high up you can access the free wifi otherwise its quite expensive, but we could so it wasnt a problem. If we returned to NY we would stay again.

First off, we had stayed in this building last April in a rented apartment. The apartment was a bit of a disaster, but the staff of the hotel were extremely helpful, friendly and fantastic. So, we decided to stay in the hotel itself, and were somewhat happy with our experience.The room and the bathroom were great, as was the bed - very comfortable. The problem was the heating/ac. It would come on, and just grow louder and louder then quiet down only to begin again loudly. We are used to the hums of systems, but this became rather obnoxious and woke us up. We finally shut it off at 2 am and opened the window (yes and amazingly it was quieter outside). This was mentioned at checkout the next morning and they will look into it.The other issue is with communication. When we checked out at 10:30, we said we would be back between 2:30-3:00 to take a shower at the fitness center the hotel has a relationship with. Well, the fitness center closes at 3:00, this could have been communicated when we mentioned this. We thought we would have a shower after being out all day (nice mid-70s) and before boarding our overnight flight back to Europe. It was rather ackward when we returned and told the fitness center had closed and we could not shower. Now how much easier could it have been to tell us this at 10:30 in the morning before we left. Anyway, we used the sink in the lounge area, not much fun.I give this a Very Good because I am basing this review on the room itself, NYC small but nice. Great view out of the 27th Floor. Great to have internet access in the Lounge for free. Also nice to have free coffee/tea in the morning. Great products in the rather generous bathroom. Bed was comfortable. The porter was FANTASTIC, I really wish I could remember his name...he was the only one who really understood our dilemna about showering and was rather sympathetic and apologetic...thank you.Would we stay here again, not so sure. The prices of hotels in NYC are outrageous, and so this maies choosing the right hotel rather difficult, considering the minor irritants paying as much as one does they no longer seem so minor.

We stayed with another couple in an apartment on the 40+ floor for two nights. We had two bedrooms and a spacious dining and sitting area with free wifi, plus some great views. If you are traveling with others this is a great option. We also stayed in one of the hotel rooms for one night. It had a small bedroom with a small bathroom and a very soft bed. The room was clean, but I would rate it a little less than average Hotel overall - friendly and helpful staff- great location- restaurant was closed for renovation- only one elevator was working during two days of our stay. I feel there should have been a greater sense of urgency in remedying this as the wait could be up to 5 minutes.

After hours of hotel research, this is the hotel I chose for my teenage daughter and I. It was very modern with an upscale appeal. Each time you come and go, you are greeted by a friendly doorman. The receptionists were very cordial as well. It rained a few days while we were there, and they had complimentary umbrellas to use - very appreciated. One thing I was worried about booking my hotel was area/feeling safe. I never felt unsafe, even walking back to the hotel at night. Location was great, it is just between Times Square and 5th Ave. Whichever direction you choose, there are sights to see. My daughter and I walked everywhere without thinking "ugh, this is way too far." We walked all around Times Square, to a Broadway show, to the subway (which was also not scary or uncomfortable), and we even walked to Central Park for a Good Morning America concert. It was a little far, but not too bad. I will definitely stay here again should I return to NYC for a visit!

Our flight arrived early, and they were able to accommodate an early check in at 9:00 am! Their customer service was great and the room was clean and comfortable! The location was also great, right around the corner from 6th avenue!

We had a fantastic stay at this hotel, the hotel is very modern and the rooms are a very good size. Location is excellent and it is walking distance from several subway stations. The staff were very friendly.

This place is ideally situated near Times Square. It is ably managed by the very helpful and friendly Patrick And crew. The rooms are small, but modern, clean and have everything you need. As with everything it's not cheap, but it's pretty good value for money.

I was in NY for business and couldn't pick a better hotel. The rooms are very well appointed, nothing close to the holes in the walls they sell in NYC as guestrooms, and extremely clean! No matter if you are there for business or leisure, the hotel is 10min away to were you are going and a few blocks away from Time Square, Bryant Park and Grand Central station.What truly makes the difference though, is the staff. You will never have to repeat something twice, they are on top of their game and on top of your needs...and that will change your experience in a city like NY!

This hotel is really modern and sleek, in a great location, has very good sized rooms and all for a fantastic price for NYC. The staff were all really nice and really made you feel welcomed too. I'd definitely stay here again!

This is the first time I stayed here and I liked the fact it was close to everything. There wasn't a restaurant yet, but construction would be finished by now. I liked the room size and service, it's quiet considering it's in the middle of the city.

I stayed for two nights in early April and this is such a great hotel if you are in town for business travel. Great location, nice rooms, and friendly staff. And I love coffee in lobby for a cup en route to airport!

I stayed for a week at Cassa, a cool boutique property which was fortuitously centrally located and convenient to getting around the city by any means of transportation, and I used them all. This winter was one where the bitter cold and snow really made location king. Close to Grand Central and easy walking to Times Square and even walkable to The Javits Center, or car and easy cab hailing it made getting around full of options.Restaurant options galore and as I was there during Restaurant Week, it was a perfect place starting with Butter in the lobby.Viceroy hotels all have a unique vibe and Cassa also lived up to its brand. The rooms were very compact in this mixed hotel/residential building. Being freezing there was a lot of boots and heavy clothing and cruise cabin like closets but for the most part it surprisingly worked. Stylistically and esthetically the rooms are high on design. The bathroom was sleek with a thoughtful magazine selection. The huge walk in shower was bigger than the closets! It did lack any cubbies to put soap or shampoo except on the floor however.The staff are all great from bellman to concierge. I used the business room often as it and the lovely public/breakfast (not included) room were the main places for free wifi.The bright patio would be a huge bonus in better weather.

This was my first stay at Cassa Hotel. The location was perfect as it was close to the theater district, Times Square and shopping. There are also many wonderful restaurants within walking distance. The best part about my stay here was the service that I received from the staff. They could not do enough for you and were always friendly and professional. The room was a nice size and was very clean. The beds were so comfortable that I overslept! The room was surprisingly quiet. I will definitely choose this hotel on my next trip to NYC.

The Cassa Hotel was over the top in terms of exceeding my expectations.Finding a "decent" hotel in NYC can be a real challenge.The Cassa Hotel offered a nice, clean room, attentive staff, and good value.Instead of getting lost in some chain hotel with compromises left and right, Cassa delivered more than I expected.The night clerk (3am on a Friday!) was incredibly helpful in helping us make room arrangements, including a follow up call once we were in the room to inquire if there was too much noise (there was some temporary night construction outside) but the noise level was fine and we slept well.The bed was extremely comfortable, and the room was plenty big enough - especially for NYC.I'd stay there again in a heartbeat. Perfect location - close to Times Sq., but not close enough to hear the noise. Convenient to just about everything.

I've got to say this was a great find, the staff were really helpful & what a great location plus value for money. If it had any faults the bed was on the small side but easily forgiven! I would definitely return here again, well done.
user_name:
JulieC715
Minster on Sea, United Kingdom

review_body: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights at the Cassa in March. It was our first time at this hotel (but not NY) and we were not disappointed! We booked through Quikbook.It was exceptionally clean, felt very comfortable and although we couldn't have WIFI in the room, it's available on the 10th floor and this was fine for us. The location was great and we found places for breakfast within a short walking distance.We did want to eat in Butter to celebrate my husband's birthday but were unable to get a table, which was a great shame! Another time may be!We did notice noise from the lifts from inside the room which was irritating and were disturbed by some very noisy guests at 2am one night! I appreciate that this is not the fault of the hotel however!Overall, we had a really great trip to New York and The Cassa Hotel and I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

Travelled to NYC for the first time with my wife in March and had a terrific time. Cassa was an excellent choice, clean, friendly, superbly located for Times Square, Broadway, transport links. Staff were very helpful, hotel was very clean. Lounge great for wifi - even better when rolled out FOC soon. Happy to recommend!

My husband & I stayed at The Cassa from 1st-6th April on our honeymoon. Staying at this hotel was the best decision we made! Upon check in we were upgraded and given a free bottle of prosecco. All the staff were lovely & greeted us every time we came in & out of the hotel. The room was small, but bigger than most NY hotel rooms. We had a suite and it had just enough floor space.The location however is what makes this hotel a winner. It's 2 blocks from Times Square, 1 block from fifth Avenue, close to Rockefeller Centre etc, but also far enough detached that it wasn't in the middle everything. We ate at the restaurant below the hotel called Butter one night, which was lovely & seemed very popular. The hotel doesn't have complimentary Wifi in the rooms, but the 10th floor has a lounge which you can go to get free wifi. It would have been nice to have it, but it was not an inconvenience in the most part. You can have it in your room, but for $15 per 24 hours. The lounge often had nobody in it and had a nice outside balcony to sit on, so for the sake of the cost we didn't bother. I would recommend the Cassa & we will certainly be staying again on our next trip. Thank you for making our honeymoon so special!

A great location and friendly staff. Lounge where there is free wifi and the complimentary coffee were good.Room was clean and tidy if a little small. There isn't a lot of space for clothes and no drawer space.The price of the water in the roomis way too high, there is a 24hr shop 1 min walk away.Wifi should be free in rooms but this seems typical of city hotels in USA.Good base for first time in New York.

I've stayed at the Cassa a few times and every time, it has not let me down. The staff is terrific and always very friendly. The property is very nice and the rooms are excellent. Always clean! I love the bed -- it's soooo comfortable. I especially like that I can adjust the room temperature to my liking. Okay, there might have been an issue with the water temperature adjustment in the shower, but it was minor. I will be back!!! Bert
user_name:
Bert R
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The Cassa Hotel New York is a "Gem". Great location, very short walk to Times Square and Broadway shows. The room was large, bright, and the beds were the most comfortable I've ever slept on. The staff went out of their way make us feel right at home, they were very professional, friendly and accommodating. We will definately be back!

Perfect for a 5 day break in NYC.Room was good size as a deluxe.Basement restaurant good for drinks or food as a destination in itself but not cheap.Not having complimentary WIFI in the room annoys me but this seems to be a US city thing, much like "resort fees".Overral very good, and got a great deal.

Since I last reviewed the Cassa NY, it's only improved! With the addition of the restaurant Butter, there is a world class restaurant and bar in the hotel, which makes a great difference. Personal attention from the staff is a hallmark here. Special thanks to hotel General Manager Troy Pade, the classiest hotel manager in New York City, and special shout outs to Tiffany and Jonathan at the front desk for making me feel like Cassa NY is indeed Mi Cassa!It is still the most perfect place to stay in NYC as it's location, while central is on a quiet street just close enough to Broadway theaters and phenomenal restaurants and just far enough from the maddening throngs of people. A Quiet oasis in the middle of a bustling city! I love this hotel!

Cassa hotel is a great destination in a prime location on the Island Of Manhattan. I travel to the city four times a year and wouldn't think about staying elsewhere. The staff is top-notch and I am always thoroughly impressed by their pleasant disposition and overall professionalism. The location is another major perk of this establishment. It seems like everything on Manhattan is within a 30 minute walk, and I have always saved money staying at Cassa due to the centralized location of the hotel. Finally, the hotel itself is also very nice. The room is always in pristine condition, and the they are always more spacious than what I expected from a NY hotel. From top to bottom, I would rate Cassa 5/5! .

Just had 6 nights at the hotel cassa , what a perfect location for all sights and shopping . The staff are very helpful the rooms are very comfortable with every thing you need. Iron , hair dryer , products in bathroom and full mirror . Couldn't have asked for more

Me and my friend stayed at the Cassa last week for 5 nights.....everything about our stay here was perfect! The staff are all so lovely and cheerful and will do anything to help you, the rooms are spotless and the maid service second to none! There is free wi fi in the lounge on floor ten or you can get it in your room for 15 dollars for 24 hours. Toiletries are all provided In your room and there is a decent hair dryer. There is no coffee or tea in the rooms but complimentary coffee and tea is served in the morning in the lobby from 7 till 11. There is a Coffee place right next to the hotel anyway so it doesn't matter. The restaurant 'butter' which is on the basement floor is fab - very classy, great lighting and sophisticated atmosphere. The hotel is just so perfectly located....minutes from the hustle of Times Square and because it's midtown you are equal distance from all the attractions that New York has to offer (which are plentiful!)! Beds and pillows (there were 2 pillows each which is fab) are so comfy! Great radio thing next to bed, shower superb. Free safe in the room as well, and big flat screen tele. Only tiny tiny thing which was a drawback was the lighting in the room wasn't very bright, two tiny pendant lights next to the bed, no central pendant light.....was only a problem for when we wanted to peruse all our bargains in better lighting!! Do book the Cassa, you won't regret it - it's the best! We are saving to go back in March 2016 for my friends 40th (we were there celebrating my 40th). We will return for St. Patricks day though cause I think that would be a lot of fun! Thanks Cassa for the best time ever in perfect surroundings xxx ps....the doormen are all hot!

My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel from 3rd march for 5 nighfs and I was so pleased with the whole experience! We were recommended this hotel by our travel agents as it was my 30th birthday and we wanted to celebrate in style.....and celebrate in style we did!! We were on the 24th floor, had a small room and not much of a view but this was explained to us when we arrived as the rooms get smaller the higher you go, but this really didnt bother us as the room was perfect anyway, shower was amazing, bed was comfortable and tv worked only thing that I would say could be a bit better is the lighting in the room as it was a bit dull! The hotel is lovely and clean and a pleasure to be in. On our second day, we had a lovely surprise when we got back to our room, a lovely of champagne sent to our room with a card of congratulations as we had just got engaged in central park (so romantic but so cold) so thanks jamal!!! All of the staff were polite, friendly and so very helpful so I cant single out operson as they were all amazing!! Will definately stay in this hotel if I ever get back to NYC, location is perfect for everything to be honest, only time we had to get a cab was when we did our helicopter tour, we walked to central park, empire state, rockefeller, times square, grand central, madison square garden and a girls favourite...... bloomingdales!!! A definate recommendation for NYC and cant wait to get back there and relive my romantic proposal ♥♥ :))))

Great hotel, location is excellent. Rooms are stylish, spacious, clean, comfy bed, large screen TV, lovely rain shower in bathroom.Friendly and helpful staff. The restaurant BUTTER is in the hotel and it was exceptional. This was my second stay at Cassa and I plan to stay there again in the near future.

Although you would never know that the Cassa Hotel NYC was affiliated to the Viceroy Hotel and Resort Family, The Cassa NYC went beyond the high luxury standards of every hotel that I have stayed at while visiting the Big Apple. Growing up on the east coast, my expectations of a smaller sized room went away when I opened my guestroom door for the first time at the Cassa. The staff from their General Manager down to the front door staff made me feel like I was travelling first class for my entire stay. It is the perfect blend of location, modern guestroom amenities including the softest towels in the history of hotels. I'll be back with my entire family to Cassa NYC on my next adventure back to the east coast.

My stay at Casa got off to a rocky start. Street construction made it nearly impossible to reach the entrance of the hotel. This was frustrating because I spent nearly 45 minutes trying to get close enough to the hotel without having to walk far. However, the manager on staff, Jamal, was extremely accommodating and helpful. He apologized for the situation and helped me have a wonderful and enjoyable stay. I'm definitely staying here again!

Great hotel & great location only approx 200 mtrs from Times Square. Stayed there for 7 nights from the 24th Feb 2014. Clean, tidy and efficient. We only had a standard room but it was well furnished, large TV on the wall, hair dryer, iron & fridge all in room. Also easy to get get to from Penn Station, which again is only a 10/15 minute walk. Flew into Newark, Airtran to NJ Transit Station, then train to Penn Station (Manhattan), cost $12.50 per person, better than $80.00 for a cab. Will stay there again on our next visit to NYC.

I took my girlfriend to see Matilda on broadway and stayed at Cassa hotel NYC. This hotel is great due to the clean and modern look it has. The price was very good for a night in the city so you can't go wrong. The room isn't huge but is more then you need to feel comfortable. It has a nice size bathroom and shower and everything has a real clean look. They have a restaurant called Butter attached that looks real nice. I went around the corner to Duane Reade they have everything you need for cheap. The location couldn't get any better cause its about 2 blocks from Times Square and 3 blocks from the theater district.

This hotel is a European boutique hotel. If your looking for spacious lobby, large rooms, and lobby bar, this is not your hotel. It's European style, new modern but very skimpy. Staff we're very nice. Room was very small. The restaurant named Butter, was excellent located beneath the hotel. Good location.

Agree with most of the other reviewers. The location is superior (although the cabbie had a tough time finding it!). Very central to so much. And clean....yes! Immaculate. I was a bit worried it might be loud as the corridors are small and the rooms are close together, but it was very quiet. The view was non existent, but I get that not every side can have a good view. And while the room was pretty small (and I had a jr suite), the bathroom was quite large by comparison. Even the toiletry products are mega sized! And the staff were extremely friends, which is always great. The cons were minor, but given the price of the room, are worth mentioning. Wifi is expensive ($15/day) and was useless for my entire stay. I had better luck with the free wifi on the lounge floor, but not much. The $15/day breakfast is not worth it at all - not with so many other places two or three steps away. Oh, and the room needed more light! Even with every lamp turned on, these old eyes had a hard time seeing. And I agree that the price of water in the room is ridiculous when paying over $300 a night. It's always fun to stay some place new and funky, but I'd check rates before staying again.

For a newer hotel, it was kind of unremarkable. Still, clean and okay for a stay in midtown. I don't have much else to add but TripAdvisor insists I fill this space with a 200-character minimum, so, now I have accomplished that.
user_name:
maxjeffjen1
New York City, New York

review_body: I'm currently staying my last night in this wonderful hotel and it is a shame to have to go.Staff are so friendly and polite and rooms are kept immaculate by the cleaning staff.It is central to most top attractions and everything is literally 5 minutes away.A must stay!!!

The front desk reception staff is very friendly. After a brief wait while my room was inspected, I was able to move in. The room was small but very well laid out and extremely clean. The bathroom was likewise clean and attractive. Two comments about the bathroom. The hot water is dangerously hot and could scald you if not careful. The shower has no rack or shelf for soap or shampoo.The hotel offers a continental breakfast on the top floor for $15. It is a barebones breakfast buffet, no better than the complimentary one in a budget motel. Also, the attendant in the breakfast room was somewhat unpleasant.I would recommend the Cassa to someone looking for a clean boutique hotel in a convenient location. My advice would be to skip the continental breakfast and find a nice deli nearby.

Stayed at the Cassa Hotel this past weekend. The staff is welcoming and very accomodating! They allowed me the check-in early AND they upgraded my room because it was my birthday weekend! They even brought up pastries and a bottle of Voss water. The hotel is spectacular. Very clean, modern and inviting. The location, cleanliness of the room and bathroom, and hospitality of the staff is why I would return to Cassa Hotel!Thanks again Cassa Hotel for the Birthday to remember!

One of the best Check-in I've had. Very helpful and polite gentlemen and ladies at the front desk. Fair Price and very nice rooms. Breakfast was ok, I would not say no to a greater variety though. Location is great as it is only 3 minutes walk from times square. All in all, a nice hotel in NY city for which you will not regret your booking.

Travelled as a couple for 3 nights in NYC..typical sightseeing-y shopping trip..Highlights:- Cleanliness/style - hotel was spotless. No dust/mould/cracks in the wall/peeling wallpaper etc. Immaculate condition and a modern, clean style.- LOCATION, couldn't have picked better. >5 mins walk to nearest subway, 5th avenue, rockerfeller centre, times square etc- Service; countless tips and free maps were given to us by the concierge, and we were lent umbrellas and a bag for our going out shoes when it was tipping with rainCould be improved:- $6 for water seemed a bit harsh when the room was over $300 dollars per night (likewise £15 for continental breakfast)- $15 per night for WiFi...although this is free in the lounge on the 10th floor

The people at the hotel were really nice & very accommodating!! The room was a nice size and very clean. The location is great for theater going or strolling down 5th ave. I would stay there again!! The restaurant "Butter" which is in the hotel is a nice place to have a drink. The restaurant is warm & friendly!

First time visitors to New York. Not knowing what to expect and being previously warned about the star ratings in New York, we were pleasantly surprised that we genuinely got ourselves a true 4 star hotel. Upon our very late arrival the greeting was exceptional and check in was prompt. We did get an upgrade because we asked nicely and the room was a very good size, tastefully decorated and a very modern bathroom. For those going to New York in winter the heating is fantastic. The breakfast room is basic, but the ambiance is good. WiFi works very well everywhere in the hotel. Price is good considering location, quality and service. Wont be giving a 10 today, because there is always room for improvement. Highly recommended. We extended our 7 day booking to 12 nights partly because we were so happy with the hotel. Concierge was super helpful and the doormen truly went out of their way. Make sure you visit "Butter" under the hotel. One of the superior restaurants of New York. My petty criticisms include no coffee making facility's in the room and WiFi should be complimentary for everyone. Cant wait to go again. Very highly recommended. Thank you once again.

Stayed at Cassa Hotel at the beginning of December 2013. The room was expensive but the location of the hotel set very close to Time Square was perfect and the staff very helpful and friendly so it was worth it. Overall I would say the hotel was basic, the bedroom wasn't fancy but it had everything we needed. Their was no bar and no restaurant for breakfast only a buffet each morning but I suppose the beauty of NYC is the huge number of breakfast deli's, bars and pubs on every corner!!! We would recommend and definitely stay again.

I have stayed at Cassa Hotel twice and both times have been great! It is greatly located and close to shopping. The restaurant "Butter" is amazing! Can't wait til they start serving breakfast. Great overall experience and the price is just right.

My wife and I spent 5 nights here during the freezing conditions at the start of the year. This was counteracted by the warm reception we had by all the staff. It was our anniversary and they kindly upgraded us to a wonderful suite with a bottle of French wine and Belgian Chocolates to celebrate. The room was comfy and the shower had an amazing view of Time Square. Due to the adverse weather conditions we found Internet access helped us to find great restaurants close by (thanks to the Trip Advisor App) and check what was working or not. Overall the place is fantastically located on the edge of Time Square. There is a snazzy looking Restaurant with an interesting menu. Very comfortable stay.

Stayed there last week for the week. I've tried the NY Palace and the Parker Meridien etc etc. and this is the one I shall return to. Simple but modern. Down to earth but spotless. Straight forward but cosy. Class act, friendly staff, cracking location. See you again soon.
user_name:
UK L
New York City, New York

review_body: Cassa Hotel exceeded our expectations! Our reservations through Expedia were seamless and we arrived to a well-appointed room - modern and very clean with all the extras. The hotel is "tall" so you have only a few neighbors on each floor. It felt like our own small apartment in Midtown. Location is perfect and Front Desk exceptional. Breaksfast was not included, but there are several coffee and breakfast options nearby. Overall a VERY good value for a great central Midtown location.

10:30 PM, 5 degrees out and the wind is howling down from the Arctic. Grand Central Station is…packed with commuters, all standing, waiting for trains that had stopped running hours earlier. No way home, and no relief in sight: "equipment issues." Doesn't this only happen in airports?A quick TripAdvisor search, a phone call to Cassa, bent into the wind. Two blocks to get to them, a sprint. Eyes frozen, slush lakes at the curb. We spot the hotel's doors. In!We were greeted by name. Our room was ready. It was sleek, well thought out, silent, warm. Dove into a hot shower. Hot water from above, from the sides. Gradually thawed out.Elapsed time, Grand Central to Cassa relief: 5 minutes. Only in New York.Everything you'd want in a city hotel. Great staff: friendly, efficient. Perfect location. We'll be back.
user_name:
WorldSki
New York City, New York

review_body: I was very impressed with the customer service from the front desk . The representative gave me individual attention was extremely helpful. Great location. I would definitely return just for the service ly

My partner and I stayed at the Cassa for the first time in January. We visit NYC a few times a year and I was attending a work conference and I did not want to stay in the Disneyland Hyatt! We are HUGE fans of the Viceroy Hotel's- having hosted my 50th birthday at the one in Palm Springs. Again, expectations on my part. This is a great hotel- fantastic location and attentive staff. Unfortunately, I had expectations that weren't true or possible. No coffee in the rooms, no room service, no " lounge" or bar available, no ice except for calling the front desk. Not huge things but my expectation was more. Coffee is available for $4.00 on the 10th floor during their continental breakfast. However, " to go" cups were never available- so in the very cold ( I'm from LA)- I had to get dressed to go out of the hotel to get coffee- spoiled I guess, but again expectations. Wi-Fi is a whole different issue which I believe the hotel is addressing but it isn't convenient. Coming home from my conference I wanted a glass of wine- which becomes very difficult because the restaurant in the hotel ( very nice restaurant) isn't set up where you can order a drink and take it to your room. So, would I stay here again, yes. Now that I know what to expect- my recommendation for the hotel is to consider making coffee available, especially during the winter in some form other than the 10th floor and if that isn't possible- it should be comp'd and to go cups available.

My 2nd time staying at the Cassa for a family trip for 5 days. Ideally located between 5th Ave. and 6th Ave, which is a short walk to Times Square. Got a great rate during their Cyber Monday sale in November for my December stay. Staff was excellent, especially in handling the water crisis that happen on one late evening. Kudos to Tiffany, Sasha, and Jamal who always greeted us by name and provided smiles and support. Kudos to Alicia who handle the critical water crisis at night by herself. And Jonathan and Emilio who provided excellent bellman support and provided logistical support in and outside of the Cassa. I really appreciated the team atmosphere and detailed customer support, which is what my interest is in for Customer and Quality Management. How the Cassa team handled the water crisis is what impressed me, so Cassa is given an excellent rating for making a major problem seem minor for its hotel guest who were affected.Mr. Smith

The choise couldn't be better!!!! Wonderful experience... Great position!!!! I found many gentle and helpful guys!!!! The room to the 20th floor was fantastic with a special view. The bathroom was very clean with a very large shower. VERY VERY POSITIVE FEEDBACK... I'll come back as soon as possible!!!!! This location is fantastic.

My wife, my daughter and I stayed in Cassa Hotel during 3 nights in New Year. The most remarkable thing: Location is really amazing if you want to stay at Times Square area. The hotel is located to only one block and a half of 45th st and 7th Av (that is exactly the heart of Times Square). Some positive points: We received an upgrade from the triple room to a junior suite in the 6th floor. The sleeping quality (bed, pillows…) is almost perfect except for the annoying noise of the heater. The bathroom is big, modern and the shower is really great. I want to mention some members of the staff who had been remarkably helpful and kind: Hector (Maintenance) and Miguel (front door).The negative ones: Free wifi is only available at Floor #10. When you pay more than $550 a night you expect a service above standard. Rooms are small as you expect in Manhattan. The reception area is too small (we arrived early and the only option was waiting for the check in time at floor#10). Nobody seemed to do any additional effort to accelerate the check in process: we arrived in the hotel at 8AM and we had to wait till 3PM exactly to get our room. There are not almost other amenities for guests in the hotel.We are going to consider this hotel in our next visit to NYC

My girlfriend and I have been doing extensive traveling in Asia and the United States. We stayed here for 4 nights while in New York. I had a excellent stay here as did my girlfriend, this was our first time In New York and the staff did a great job to make us feel welcome. A special thanks to the maid, Sarah, who offered me excellent travel tips and good restaurant recommendations. I wish I could remember her last name so I could recommend her a raise. She really went over the top with her service.I love the location of this hotel as I can easily walk to Times Square and this is very close to broadway where my girlfriend and I had our pictures taken and enjoyed performances. The location is a very good thing.The room for us was perfect our king room was just absolutely perfect for our needs I must say. The shower worked good the tv was in a particuarly good position for us to lay down together cuddle and watch. We also enjoyed the view. So far New York City has been the most thrilling place for us to visit and to be honest this hotel is a big reason why it was a great visit. Will be coming back here on next trip to New York City.

Stayed at the Cassa Hotel 12-29-13 til 1-07-2014 the location was great, but they nickel and dime you to death. No ice machines, every time you want ice you have to call the front desk and get someone to bring it to your room.

I know i am writing a review for this hotel late, but i wanted to share what our wonderful experience. my wife and I were recommended to stayed at the hotel while we were in nyc. Usually we don't stay at boutique hotels, but large chains. This hotel was a nice surprise. Everyone greeted you everyday all throughout the hotel since we were there several days, the staff would recognized us. The hotel has a nice viceroy touch. The rooms are very updated and nice, typical size for a new York room. The location is also very convenient, and great restaurant as well. Id go back next time I was in nyc.

Stayed here the weekend before NYE. Staff was overwhelmed by the New Year's crowd. Check-in: slow process, long wait time. We were told our room was ready, but the housekeeping manager was still inspecting our room when we walked in.Rooms: Standard room - nice, clean, good size, comfortable bed. Bathroom is larger than expected. THERE WAS NO HOT WATERKing room - 100 times nicer than the standard room...and there was hot water.Staff: Friendly, but there should have been more of a presence considering the influx of guests for the NYE bash. There was ONE person handling bags.Location: a few blocks from Times Square, good if you want to do tourist-y stuff. Close to Broadway, Bryant Park, etc.Overall: pretty nice hotel, but I was underwhelmed. I got a good deal through a 3rd party website, but I would NOT pay face value to stay here. I travel to NYC 2-3 times p/yr, and I doubt I will be returning to the Cassa hotel.

In November my husband and I stayed at the Cassa Hotel New York. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was perfect. Just about the right sized room you would expect in NYC. Another plus....LOCATION. Just a short walk to 30 rock, times square and shopping on 5th ave. I would stay at this location in a heart beat.

Stayed here with my partner for 5 nights over New Year. Perfect location for exploring NYC. Everything is close by, Times Square, Grand Central Station, 5th Avenue shops all just round the corner. Hotel is new, modern, comfortable and clean. Room was small as expected for central Manhattan but the bed was lovely and comfortable. The TV was as big as the bed! Bathroom was great with a powerful shower, complimentary toiletries and bath-robe. The complimentaty umbrella came in handy when it was raining one day. Hotel staff could not do enough to help us, they were great. If you need a car booking or directions to anywhere they were so helpful. There is a fantastic restaurant/bar downstairs from the Hotel called 'Butter'. Although not owned by the hotel it is a perfect pit-stop before or after a day of sightseeing and the WiFi is free in there which makes up for the fact the the Hotel charges a daily rate to use WiFi which is the only thing I can find to fault this hotel. I would recommend Cassa for anyone who wants a perfect location to visit Manhattan. Can't wait to go back.

While the room was small, this is par for the course in Manhattan, especially Midtown. What it lacked in space it more than made up for in style, comfort, and a little slice of luxury. The bathroom was huge, which was an unexpected treat. It would have been great if the wardrobe had room to hang stuff or store shoes/coats. Everything felt very new, and the bed was very very comfy! I spent a whole day in it after running around town for three days. One thing - the restaurant was closed for remodel, and there was no room service while we were there, which was unfortunate. But on the plus side, front desk staff was extremely accommodating and helpful, and more than happy to help answer questions or make suggestions. They also managed to get us a very reasonable rate when our other accommodations fell through and we ended up staying all four nights there. So that's a big win. Competitive prices and comfort really are everything to me, and Cassa succeeded.

I stayed at the Cassa Hotel in New York on December 27 and 28 with my 9 year old granddaughter. Upon arrival in New York, the hotel was ready for check in. The room was beautiful. While there, I had a few questions and the front desk was more than accommodating. The doorman never failed to greet me and help if necessary. The location was also very convenient and walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, as well as Rockerfeller Center. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

I chose this Hotel for a Girls Weekend with my bestie. I visited the hotel when it first opened, to view their furnished apts and fell in love. Our room was OUTSTANDING. The most comfortable bed with crisp linens. Massive bathroom with plush towels and bathrobes. My friend, who is a germaphobe, was blown away. And we ended our weekend with lovely breakfast in their rooftop lounge. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be back.
user_name:
CheapeatsInc
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. Our room was clean and comfortable. Our only issue was that the person who came up to make our sofa bed did not know how to do it and insisted it wasn't a sofa bed. My 8 year-old showed him how it worked. All in all, a lovely hotel - we will definitely visit again!

Trendy little boutique hotel, with a fantastic location just off Times Square. Rooms were modern and very comfortable, Clean and large bathroom. Staff were very friendly and helpful during our stay. Would definitely use again.

Wonderful hotel, great staff and good location! The room was clean and tidy and housekeeping were brilliant. The breakfast was good, if a little expensive at $20 per person. Would certainly visit again.

It is the third time we choose the Cassa Hotel. Once again we were treated very well, from beginning to end of our trip the staff was very kind and helpful and did everything to make us feel comfortable and relaxed. We would like to highlight Tiffany and Gabriel at the front desk, for the care and dedication they had with us on our stay. The room is very spacious and perfectly clean, moreover the hotel's location is perfect, close to all the best attractions in New York. We had two wonderful weeks and we will definitely choose the Cassa Hotel on our next trip.

I stay in Cassa Hotel with my wife for honeymoon.The hotel is really beautiful and in a perfect position to visit New York.I really recommend that hotel, the quality is really high.The room are beautiful and clean with all the amenities you need. Around the hotel there are good place to eat.I will come for sure with my wife in that hotel next time I visit New York.

We got this hotel as a "secret" Hotwire deal... And what a steal!!!! The hotel is beautiful, with a modern feel! We arrived at noon and were greeted by Jamal & Roger. We just wanted to drop off our bags (check in was at 3:00) and they insisted to check if a room was available. It was available and they upgraded us to a queen room with a couch! The bathroom was very nice, large tub, and waterfall shower head. Very clean, huge tv, large room for NYC. It was a 7 minute walk (straight shot from 45th street exit) from grand central.Really enjoyed this hotel, and would reccomend it highly!

Frankly, we were a bit disappointed in the room for the price we paid. It was a junior suite, and had a nice big sofa (that we never used), and tiny closet that couldn't hold anything longer than a shirt, an itty-bitty desk that would not be comfortable if you had to do a lot of work, and no view. HOWEVER - the bathroom was wonderful! Giant, with double sinks and long counter (amen!). Great location - close to Times Square, Theater District, Rockefeller & Radio City.I was not a fan of the shower/tub. The shower was one of those rain showers - I don't like those. There was a wand (excellent pressure) and the tub was deep - good if you have kids, but impossible if you have any mobility issues. It also had one of those glass doors that only covers the front half.Pros: Great selection of teas, nice bed, clean, giant bathroom. Friendly front desk staff.Con: Tiny desk, tub/shower (see above), no view.

Tiny room but well equipped EXCEPT......plugs are not near the bed????!!Not high class.....but clean and efficient. Bathroom is tiles, no make up mirror but clean and proper. The windows open, that's a plus. Nice restaurant in the basement level.

We are frequent visitors to NYC and have stayed in many hotels over the years. This was our first stay at Cassa. It is a great example of an upscale boutique hotel. Typical of this type of lodging, the standard room was not large, but certainly was adequate. It was immaculately clean and very well furnished. The interior designer definitely knew how to make the space appealing and comfortable. The bathroom was very nicely done and very clean. The staff was very accommodating and friendly.Not only would we recommend Cassa, we just booked another night's stay. Given the increasingly inflated prices for NYC hotel rooms, this property is a great value..

I just came off a trip to one of the greatest cities in the world. As a first time traveler to NYC and hearing so much about it, its reasonable to say that I had big expectations.The city really is larger than life and I can honestly say I love NY.As for the Cassa hotel, it was average. Nothing remarkable or spectacular. The front staff was friendly and the location was perfect, but the accommodations were, in my opinion, average. With so many visitors to NYC, who may not have a US cell phone subscriber and need to be online, I find it rather pathetic that there is no WiFi in the lobby or rooms. Instead, you have to go to the tenth floor to do your business. Secondly, for the cost of staying there a welcome or exit water would be nice as would be a complimentary continental breakfast, as many other places offer.Bottom line, the location is perfect, staff was nice, but the hotel was no big deal and the rooms were ridiculously small. Suffice to stay, I will examine other hotels in NYC next time.

Nice, clean hotel in a great location. Perfect for a vacation or business stay in Manhattan. The room was a good size for NYC. I stayed in a queen room and was pleased with the amount of floor space. The room and bathroom were clean. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. I definitely will stay here again and highly recommend it.

Great front desk staff - very helpful. quiet, clean and comfy room. awesome bed, slept like a baby. Location is very convenient if you are going to see shows, shopping and tourist areas.The restaurant, butter is just spectacular, very convenient.

Prefect location, tight between 6th and 5th ave. I stayed there for a month, its just a block away from TImes square. There are lot of eating joints at walking distance from the hotel. Hotel is very clean, staff is very very friendly. Definately will stay here again.

Great location, clean spacious rooms, very comfortable beds and a great hot shower. The location was perfect. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Overall, absolutely nothing negative to say. If you are looking for a low maintenance, affordable, comfortable, clean hotel in a great location, this is the place for you.

Great hotel right between 6th and 5th Ave. Staff friendly and helpful . Rooms clean and well furnished but small . Definately would stop here again, right in the heart of midtown Manhattan right near loads of great bars and restaurants but avoid restaurants in Times Square !

I lived in at the Cassa Hotel for 10 nights and it was perfect for me and my group.We were in NYC for work and the Cassa Hotel made me feel at home. Friendly staff, ready to serve us with any of our needs. I had to pleasure to stay in one of the Suites and it became my home for the 10 days. Clean, big enough for our meetings, Keurig coffee machine always stocked, a great experience overall.And 2 blocks from Times Square, can't beat that!!I will definitely come back to Cassa Hotel for my next trip to NYC.

Me, my girlfriend and our baby had the pleasure to stay at Cassa two times (July 2012 and then once again in July 2013). If you are looking for an hotel just a minute walk from Times Square, with clean rooms, nice and modern forniture (wonderful bathrooms!), exquisite customer service, well... just go directly to Cassa Hotel!! It's a little bit expensive but it worths more than other hotels at the same price level in the area. Looking forward to coming to Cassa hotel a third time!

Stayed here for four days ,staff make this hotel all very courteous and very helpful Hotel itself is nice roomy and clean Only downside is no bar/restaurant that would be a big benefit for this hotel Deffo recommend and will stay here again as perfect location for all sights and transport etc

The rooms were fine - pretty unremarkable for NYC. Small but nice and well appointed. The showers, however, were fantastic. There were only two drawbacks - internet in your room is $10 per 24 hours (I think it should be free) and the towels were pretty scratchy. The mattress and sheets were nice though. The location was convenient and the people were nice. I would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
redandpinkmatch
New York City, New York

review_body: Booked it via hotwire (3.5 star) and got a pleasant surprise! 3 star price for a 4 star service.Location is great near Time Sq (but far enough to ger calmer).Room was great: spacious (more than Ny average), very well appointed and kept, very clean. Bathroom was great as well. had a confy king size bed. Overall, modern and new.Service at check in counter was very courteous and effective.I will certainly come back as this is a great value for your money.

The location of this hotel is excellent being only a short stroll to Times Square. However it is also a very quiet hotel and we did not hear any other guests during our stay. It was good to have the location but at the same time be able to escape from the noise so easily. There are also plenty of nearby cafes and pubs for breakfast, lunch or a drink.The rooms are not huge but certainly big enough and as I assume would be the case for most when in New York we did not spend too much time in the room. The bathroom was also of a very high quality.I had mentioned on booking that we were staying for my wifes birthday. As a result on check in they wished her Happy Birthday and on returning to our room later there was a card and 4 huge cup cakes! All staff are very friendly and helpful.

Stayed here to finish our holiday of a lifetime and we were not disappointed, great hotel, fantastic location, small rooms but very nice, staff were friendly, don't bother with payin for wifi just go tot he 10th floor and get it for free. Only 1 complaint. It was our anniversary and they decorated our room with roses and champagne, which was fantastic but then asked for money for the service when we checked out, which I thought was a little rude. Otherwise great stay and will return

A big fan of Hotel Tonight for discovering new gems of the city, I was really happy to discover Cassa. I generally avoid the times square area at all costs, and it remains an annoying location, as access to great small coffee shops and hidden restaurant finds do not exist in this neighborhood. The great thing about Cassa, though is that once inside, you do not feel as though you are in the theater/times square districts. The Lounge, with free wifi is a great place to get work done. The staff at the front desk were super friendly and accommodating and checked in on me shortly after arrival to see that everything was good with the room. Small, but not as cramped as some, was beautifully appointed and comfortable. A small annoyance is the lack of outlets by the bed. The bed linens were fresh and crisp and nice. The towels a bit too lightweight. Continental breakfast was ok, staff very nice, but the Balthazaar baguette and pastry I chose was stale and definitely not fresh this morning. A hard swallow for the $20. That was the only drawback, but otherwise great. I will book again.

The service by the staff at the front desk was amazing and knowledgable about the surroundings. The process of checking in went very smoothly,although their fitness center wasn't open yet we were given a complimentary fitness card to a gym nearby. Truthfully,If i had 4 thumbs I'd gave them 4 thumbs up!!

I was greeted so fast by the staff it was a very pleasant experience. I was able to check in early hassle free and after I checked out I still toured the city for the day leaving my car and luggage safely checked in with the staff. It was very sound proof you didn't even know there were other guests except who you saw on the elevator. I can not say enough about the staff. THEY ARE FABULOUS!!!!

I booked this hotel after weeks of searching and reading the historic Trip Advisor reviews. The hotel is in an excellent location. Our room was upgraded on arrival, and we received a complementary bottle of wine. Our bags had been lost by the airline, which was very stressful. The hotel staff left essential toiletries in the room with a lovely note- what more could you ask for! All the hotel staff were very friendly when you came in contact with them. Our room was a good size, the bathroom was very clean and modern. The lounge on the 10th was a nice area to relax, with free wifi.To sum it up, excellent hotel, excellent location and excellent staff!
user_location: Newcastle upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom
user_name:
Jamesc282013
Newcastle upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom

review_body: We booked this cracking hotel for our first anniversary, super location, rooms are a good size and very comfortable, what really made it was the staff who are so friendly and helpful. I accept the lack of bar / restaurant was a surprise however NY is all about being out and about so this did not cause a problem, lounge on 10th floor with free wifi is very pleasant. Would definitely stay again.

I just got back from a 3 day NYC trip. I was showing my Grandmother NY for the first time on her 80th birthday.
