The Cassa was perfectly located to all of the transportation and sites we wanted to see and the staff was incredibly helpful. Our room was two double beds and had a street side view. The bathroom was a little plain but had a fantastic high end shower and great lighting for putting on make up. The beds were very comfortable and the iPod docking station was a nice touch. The GM wrote us a personalized note and send a bottle of wine for her birthday celebration weekend. I would stay here time and time again. It was a great experience!

Cassa Hotel is down the block from our NY office, so we use it for work a lot. In addition to being so convenient to work, you can walk 20 minutes or so to Penn Station if you are leaving at rush hour and there are no taxis. There are plenty of restaurants around and the guys at the front desk are great about helping you find options and then asking what you thought when you get back.The rooms are small, especially the queen room, but for one business traveler it is plenty. I was surprised by how large the shower and bathroom were, though - quite pleasantly. The internet was a little slow, which is frustrating when you pay $15 for it. One night I was too tired to go out and ordered delivery and the hotel was great about calling and confirming I was expecting a delivery before sending them up. Overall great staff and great location. Beds are ok. Bathrooms are nice and clean and bright. Wish there were blackout shades or no gaps between the drapes.
user_name:
Cynthia S
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I happened to stumble upon this hotel via an app on my phone. The location was amazing and the price was great for a night in NYC. We were close to restaurants, transportation, and shopping. The staff was very friendly and the check-in and out process was extremely easy. The room and bed was small, but very clean, comfortable and modern. I would consider staying here again.

We were disappointed. Aside being very well located (close to everything.. restaurants, theaters, transportation etc) BUT there's nothing else. No service, the rooms are small and the bed very tight for 2, (1,40m)!!! The personal are kind but not helpful. Price/Quality = TOO expensive
user_name:
Thais B
Brussels, Région De Bruxelles-Capitale, Belgium

review_body: Great boutique hotel in the heart of the city. Close to everything including transportation. Updated and clean. Typical NY size rooms, but big enough. Great bathroom. Awesome staff and very friendly. The hotel is small enough to where the staff gets to know you by name and make it a more personal experience.

Great location on 45th between Fifth and Sixth, close to shopping, subway trains, 10 min walk to Grand Central Station, 7 min walk to MOMA. Hotel room and bathroom were small, but clean and very quiet, extremely comfy bed and pillows, nice linens, large TV, bathroom with rain head shower BUT it is the staff who make this hotel experience so very pleasant - greet you by name, always have a smile and an answer to any question, even the staff you might meet on the elevator smile and say hello - really a nice NY hotel experience.

My wife and I stayed one night as I was running the NYC Marathon the next day. Everything about the hotel was great: the location, the modern decor, the friendliness of the staff, and the cleanliness. It's located within two blocks of Times Square. The room and bathroom were beautiful. It was also nice to have access to the 10th floor lounge. When we return to NYC, we'll definitely check the Cassa first for availability.

My wife and I stayed at the Cassa 30th Oct to 3rd Nov, we were upgraded on arrival which got our holiday off to a great start, through-out our stay this momento was maintained due to the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff, every member of the Cassa seemed genuinely pleased to see you from the Reception staff, the guys on the door and the housekeeping staff you meet in the corridors and lifts.Our room was clean modern and comfortable, the location of the hotel is second to none and the service is exceptional, a car to the airport was organised for us at reasonable cost and advice given on places to see and things to do, in short the Cassa is a fabulous place to stay.

This is a boutique hotel at an excellent location (5 min walk from times square and in the heart of 5th Avenue). Clean, beautiful design, friendly staff. My only comment would be the size of the rooms. Once you start shopping in NY, you do not stop easily. Thus a bigger room would be my only request when I visit Cassa again. Other than that, the bathroom was modern, spacious and spotless and everything else of grade "A" !!!

I chose this hotel mostly because it was just down the street from the Lyceum Theatre, as we were seeing "A Night With Janis Joplin." But our experience in this hotel was outstanding! The staff is very friendly, fun, and extremely helpful! Nice, comfortable room, Huge TV, luxurious bed. Clean, well arranged. Had room service breakfast, and it was prompt and well prepared. If I come back to NYC, I will stay here.

From the moment we walked in Tiffany was a pleasant face we saw everyday! This is a great place to stay, the staff made it even better. Miguel, Jonathan, Tiffany....just to name a few. I traveled with a group of 11, we all stayed at the hotel. Everything was premium, the rooms, amenities and service. I did have to wait over 30 mins for toiletries to be replenished but that's all we waited for. Great location, near all the train lines. Staff was knowledgeable of surrounding area and if they weren't, they looked it up on their computer within seconds. Thank you to The Cassa Hotel staff for making our stay so pleasant. We will be back!

My wife and i celebrated 16 yr Anniv in NYC, and with and amazing staff, great location and fun hip decor Cassa was the place to stay....they have a dinning facility opening this month i believe, but the 10th floor bar/patio was perfect for a quick bite or cocktail,,,the short time we where there. We will be back.

Eric was on the front desk and politely checked us in. Supplied us with all the touring information that we required. The rooms were more than large enough with a very spacious bathroom. Overall the accommodation was very comfortable. Both staff and hotel were perfect.

We stayed at Cassa Hotel (in an apartment) for a month and found the location to be very convenient, located at West 45th Street and 6th Avenue. Subways are close by, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and Fifth Avenue are in walking distance. From our room, we had fantastic views of Manhattan to the south, east and west. The best part, though, was the super staff! Everyone was very caring, friendly, helpful, and made us feel truly "at home". We would highly recommend staying there.

Typically when I visit NYC, I stay with family and friends. This time, I had a friend (NY 1st timer) traveling with me, so we decided to stay in a hotel. Cassa was perfect in so many ways! This little gem on 45th Street is a great location. We were able to get all over town in a breeze - walking, by cab, or subway. It was never a hassle to stop back at the hotel in the middle of the day.Its chic, understated, and intimate nature, actually felt more like I was staying at my little NYC apartment with fantastic doormen. In fact, this is probably the most quiet "apartment" I have ever been in in NYC! The staff was genuine and nice, and always wiling to help out. No forced service standards here - great service comes naturally to these folks. Rooms were nicely appointed with everything you might need. I would have liked some drawers and a bigger closet, but whatever - we managed. Rooms are not as small as people indicate - they are a nice size room for NYC standards, and have everything you need. Comfortable beds (and I am a picky one when it comes to hotel beds!), clean bathrooms, good lighting, plenty of outlets, perfectly placed TV, and did I say quiet??? The restaurant was not yet opened when we were there, but I cannot wait to return and check it out. It looks amazing. We did enjoy room service for breakfast, and it was so good, I am still thinking about it weeks later. Not your typical run of the mill, overpriced, room service. I'm not saying it was inexpensive, but it was so good we didnt even bat an eye when we got the total. We got what we paid for and was very much in line with a good breakfast in NYC. Check it out if you are looking for a home away from home while in NYC!

I used Hotel Tonight to book my stays here, which consisted of 3 different stays over the corse of 9 days (in a row). The service was great and everyone was really nice and genuine. 2 of my stays were upgraded to king deluxe rooms and the other was a the standard room. The king bed was nice, but I was also really happy with the standard. If you're a solo traveler, it's perfect. The rooms are really clean, the rain showers are awesome and spacious and I'll always check with Cassa before I book any other hotel in NY.This was the best bang for my buck in NY over the course of my last 6 months here. All stays in hotels or airbnb's.

The Cassa is located on W 45 Street, between 5th and 6th Avenue, absolutely perfect for exploring NY on foot. The hotel is perfectly ok, but not extraordinary in any respect. The rooms are small, though. We had booked what they called a Queen Suite, which turned out be a room with just enough walking space around the bed, but nothing more. But, the bed was good, the bath room perfect. We had breakfast in the hotel the first morning, but chose a restaurant close by for the rest of our stay. The breakfast menu was ok and quite good. But the only waiter was responsible for breakfast rooms service as well, poor guy. The staff was very friendly and helpful. So, will we stay at Cassa on our next trip to NY? Probably!

We stayed in this hotel for one night with our son and daughter in law in 2 separate rooms .I selected this hotel for reviews on TA.The hotel is modern, with very helpful , pleasant and friendly staff.It is located on 45 th St between 5 th and 6 th avenue, so an excellent location, close to 5 th Ave the Theatre district, Times Square , Grnad Cntral station and numerous restaurants.By NY standards it is good value. Breakfast is. NOt included on the rate, plus there are various city taxes to add on.We didn't have the breakfast at the hotel, but it smelled good. There is a bar on the 10 th floor with an outside terrace.The room was good and the bed was so comfortable.WIFI is available on the 10 th floor, but not in rooms. That is the only thing they could improve upon.I would definitely stay here again.

I stayed here about a week ago for a little weekend getaway in NYC. The rooms were well decorated and pretty spacious for a hotel in midtown. However, tbe gentleman that "assisted" us (I think his name was Pete or Paul) at the front desk was a complete mess. I asked several questions about valet parking, shows, room types, and restaurants near by and it seemed to me that he was clueless about what he was saying. He seemed very rude and kind of "too good" to be answering all of my silly questions. Aside from the one gentleman, everyone else was friendly and sweet. Housekeeping service was great as well as the bell staff. I would not mnind possibly coming back.

Had a great stay at the Cassa which was close to the two Broadway theatres we'd booked ,infact the Cassa was in the same street as one of them about three blocks down. Walking and getting around was easy. Tiffany at check in found us a room that was available as we were very early having just got off a cruise ship (about 9am). She also arranged for our request for a two bed room as we are friends travelling together. we were extremely grateful for this plus the early check-in.Eric (hope I've got the name correct) was extremely knowledgeable and helpful about places to visit. On the day we left we stored our luggage and he asked us what we were going to do. When we told him some last minute shopping he replied in a flash Victoria's Secret is having a 20% off sale today. I found this very funny as I am a Senior Lady and VS is not my style, but I could have wanted to shop for a younger family member. Full credit to Eric.The hotel has a boutique feel about it although we were on a high floor so there must have been lots of rooms. They are undergoing refurbishment of the restaurant but you'd never know as it has no negative impact on guests. I believe the restaurant on floor 10 is temporary.The free WiFi was appreciated to check on things back home. A very pleasant stay at the Cassa.Sandra (Brisbane, Australia)

This hotel is perfectly located to the center of everything Times Square has to offer. The amenities were very nice. The hotel room was clean and spacious (at least by NY standards). The hotel staff were extremely nice and accommodating. Free Wi-Fi was included in the stay which is a nice bonus. There were only a couple of things I could suggest to improve the stay. The bathroom (although a very nice size) did not have any hooks for clothing/bath robes and the shower did not have any shelf on which to place the toiletries. There is just something about placing the toiletries on the floor of the shower that was somewhat gross. Also, when we first arrived, the room was extremely fragrant with some type of air freshener. It was overwhelming at first. By the 2nd day, the air freshener smell had dissipated. I do highly recommend this hotel.

Cassa is a quiet respite in the middle of Midtown. Modern rooms, quiet and peaceful only two blocks from Times Square. Not a full service hotel, but the rooms are modern and comfortable, and the staff is excellent and accommodating. I will definitely stay at Cassa on my next trip to Midtown.

Stayed for a week and totally loved it, felt welcome and the staff responded to all our requests helpfully and professionally. The room as accommodating, the bed was comfortable and the outside noise was blocked out.Location was fantastic being so close to Times Square and Central Park.
user_name:
Justin B
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: I was traveling with my 7 year old son - we were just visiting the city for the weekend. From check-in to check-out our experience was awesome! We were upgraded to a corner suite when we arrived and the room was perfect! Staff was very friendly and the location could not have been better! Cannot wait to book my next stay at the Cassa!

Stayed here for two nights - was upgraded to a bigger room and actually had a decent view. Staff was super nice and friendly. Shower was amazing - rain shower head is to die for. My only con was that the walls are a little thin and I could hear the couple next to me, um, enjoying their stay in the city at 4am... :P I'd definitely stay here again.

We had booked our stay at Cassa on priceline for the Columbus Day weekend. we got a fair rate $250 / night for a hotel close to times square but far enough away you don't get the crowds or the noise. So the positive - location was great, room was clean and the flat screen was good. For the most part service was ok. The couple of issues that were disappointing were we checked in we were given a room with only a double bed. Now I am over 6' tall and would have had my legs hang over the end so we requested another room. Then once in the room we noticed bottle water was $6 each, while ok but I have stayed at 4 stars before that had free bottled water. 2nd, we had used valet parking at $60/day + tax and because of the Columbus day parade the street was closed in front of the hotel. Now we had asked will we be ok to get out? they said you will be fine if you leave by 9..we left at 8am and no we could not leave from the hotel but had to walk to get our car. What made it worse was 15 mins (while I was paying my bill I was told the concierge would help with bags (but instead) I was just shown where the garage was located from the hotel and we had to walk carrying everything (2 blocks). A little disappointing to be sure.

I have stayed at several different hotels in NYC. This was a good experience. Our room was very small but comfortable and nicely furnished. The location was great. Close to Time Square but far enough away from the noise and crowds. The front desk and doormen were wonderful. Everyone made use feel like we were VIP's. This time I travelled with my daughter and we were able to easily access public transit to do our exploring and felt safe walking alone at night. One small inconvenience was that the lovely shower did not have a ledge to rest your soap or shampoo. I did love the two showerheads .. one rain, and one hand held. The lobby is tiny but no one spends a lot of time there so that was not an issue. There was no place to dine in the hotel but plenty of options very close by. The front desk are happy to make recommendations for you. Overall, a very nice little boutique hotel. I would be happy to stay there again.

I felt that the Cassa Hotel offered the best hospitality. The front desk was very helpful, knowledgable, and ensured that we were well inforned regarding tours and transportation. This was the best service I have seen in a long time. The hotel was perfectly located and I enjoyed everything about it.

While the rooms are on the small side(typical for NYC) the location is great.Just a few blocks to Times Square but far enough to avoid the crowds.I stayed in room 1504 which had no view as it Watson the backside of the building but that assure a quiet nights sleep, which can be difficult to find in some NYC hotels.Very nice staff, modern clean room and a great rate made this hotel an easy recommendation.The only negative was that one of the two elevators was out of service for most of our stay which caused some long( 4-5 minutes) waits but was not a big problem for us.

Location:Located midtown and close by Times Square. It is about 5-7 minute walk to a subway station. For travellers, it is as good as it can be. There is a Starbucks not to far from it. In addition, there are many restaurants around as well as fast food places including McDonalds and Pret A Manger. A celebrity chef is about to open a restaurant by the hotel, which will give more dining options. Though I had a Metro card, I walked to most places during my entire 4/5 days in NYC. Common Area: There are a few chairs for you to sit on and not much else. The space is very compact. It has somewhat of a cramped feeling to it. Esthetically, it is pretty modern and sparse. There is a terrace (dining area) on the upper floor. I did not check that out so cannot say much. I don’t believe there are other amenities such as a gym etc.Room:I had the standard room. Understandably, it was very small, but functional and manageable. My friend and I are pretty compact and therefore we did fine. But for those who are six feet+ and well nourished, it could be very cramped. Closet is small and there is not a whole lot of space for storage. There is a desk, chair, reading chair, TV, and safe box. All works well, functional, and purposeful. The bathroom is really small, though functional. It takes an effort to be able to use the bathroom without bumping into things or knock things over. No complaint just wish there would be a little bit more of space. Service:Definitely a forte of this place. What lacks in space is made up for by the service I received. There is a doorman in front helping you with taxi and directions. Checking in was quick and pleasant. Local map was happily given when I requested one. Stephanie was particularly helpful with restaurant recommendations. She was my main source of restaurant info. I did not consult guidebooks or yelp. Her recommendations were spot on. Recommendation: This hotel is a good fit for those who want good service, comfort but willing to forgo certain amenities such as a gym or in-house bar. This place offers very good value. I definitely would recommend to friends or stay here in the future.

Cassa is a great find in NYC. The location is perfect. The staff is incredibly friendly - always a smile and a hello! The Doormen could not be sweeter. One waited with me for 15 minutes while searching for my car. The room was lovely - not too small, nice desk, beautiful bathroom - LOVED the shower, comfy bed, tastefully decorated. I'm in New York monthly for business and this is definitely my new home. What a wonderful find!

Perfectly located hotel, in the heart of the action, but the place itself is very quiet, clean and professional. Room was large with a nice bathroom, good toiletries etc. Nice design but not too over the top. Decent breakfast with a great terrace.

We arrived quite late and the staff were more than welcoming. The staff are so friendly and couldn't do enough for us. Loved the room.Very Clean, bed was so comfortable and the maid came every day too. We got engaged while we were in NYC and the staff gave us a free bottle of champagne delivered to our room. The position for the hotel is a 5 mins walk from times square and would highly recommend it to anyone going their. Loved every minute of our stay and thank you so much.

We stayed at The Cassa hotel from Sept 18-26th 2013 as a couple. We highly recommend the a Cassa and our stay here was perfect! During check-in we experienced some problems which were solely down to my bank and this was very stressful as the journey to Cassa had taken us 11 hours from Ireland. Luckily Henry was on hand to help with the check in which really made things a lot better as he was able to get in touch with my banking company from the hotels phone. We were upgraded to an executive room on arrival and the view from the room on the 22nd floor was great! Throughout our entire stay the staff were extremely polite and helpful. On several different occasions Eric, Gabriel and Henry all helped us with directions and told us which subway train we needed to get. Tenth floor terrace was nice at night and the member of staff who was here was really nice! The location of this hotel was great as we were only two blocks from Times Square nearly everything was within walking distance. We will definitely stay at the Cassa again in the future!

Excellent place for business. Pleasant rooms , clean, noiseless and with tons of sleep quality.friendly and supportive staff providing added value in key questions such as where to eat, how to go there, etc.great location since all in walking distance.

Location - perfect mid-town hideaway between 5th and 6thFront Desk Staff - could not be friendlier or more accommodatingBell Staff - always a warm greeting and goodbyeHotel Size - perfect for a personalized touchOutdoor Patio - yes...they have one on the 10th floor...enjoy a cocktail or two during your stayWould I Stay There Again? - in a New York second

Was treated to an enjoyable and relaxing experience at the Cassa in NY City. My wife and I had booked the tail-end of her work trip for a two-night stay in Manhattan, and were unsure of where to stay. We are pretty low-maintenance travelers, and value location above all else, followed by noise level, room size, bathroom amenities, and decor. We chose the Cassa based on the high reviews on Trip Advisor and looking back on our stay, the hotel delivered on all fronts.First off Troy, the General Mgr, was extremely helpful in answering my questions prior to my stay and treating my wife and I like valued guests. The staff too was impeccable with our check-in, answering questions, and any request that we had, in particular Tiffany, Eric, and Henry. The location of the Cassa is right in the heart of mid-town, close to Grand Central Station and just north of Times Square. Bryant Park is the closest subway stop, which is a 5-8min walk away, and Grand Central about 10min walk. Mid-town is pretty crowded, but the Cassa is tucked-away between 5th and 6th and is a nice escape from the craziness.We were in a Grand Deluxe size room and were pleased with the size (given NY standards). Nice little desk and lounge chair helped make it seem bigger than just a studio room with a king size bed. The bathroom is by far the highlight when it comes to the room, a modern, clean layout with the topper being the rainfall shower...the wife absolutely loved it. Also to be noted in the room was the flat screen TV with nice cable options, a bose-like sound system, and a mini-fridge where you could store a bottle water or two alongside the usual pay-to-eat items.Big plus about our room (on the 16th floor) and the Cassa in general, was how quiet it was. Very little street noise and never really heard from any of our neighbors above or adjacent to us. This is key, I'm a light sleeper and any type of noise in the night will wake and keep me up. I slept like a baby at the Cassa.Heard some negatives reviews about the elevators but they were prompt most every time we called them. Overall I would highly recommend the Cassa if you're looking for a classy, easy stay while you're in NYC. You'll be treated like an esteem guest and you'll feel rested (from a good night's sleep), clean (from the shower), and ready to take on city!

It is located close to Times Square with the benefit of all facilities around (restaurants, theaters, shopping areas, Central Park,...) . We have been staying here for a week in a very quiet and very comfortable room. We really enjoyed to stay there for a visit of New York. We hope to come back in New York and at the same hotel.

I stayed at this hotel while on business and found it to be a great location for navigating the city. Just off Time Square it had lots of places to eat around it. The staff were loverly and welcoming and very helpful. The rooms were compact but nicely appointed. I'd happily stay here again as it was excellent value for money.

This hotel is located just down the way from Times Square, Broadway and all the shopping areas. The room is nice and modern. The staff is impeccable. Very helpful and eager to serve. The lounge is under construction but there was no noise. It's going to be beautiful and a great place to hang. Would totally recommend this hotel!!! Great rate as well!!!

I'm in the city regularly for business. My usual places were booked so stayed here. Really loved it. Will be my first choice in future stays. Clean, comfortable and great location. Restaurant will be opening which will be a plus.

Cassa was perfect for our long wkend in NYC. First, the Times Square location cant be beat. The rooms are sophisticated and peaceful--a great retreat from the nonstop of the city. The service is the best I've ever experienced. The front desk staff, valet, housekeeping--every contact was personal, professional and welcoming. Add helpful and knowledgable and you begin to get the idea. As a tourist in NYC (even though an experienced traveler ) staying at Cassa gave a security or peace of mind: every need was met; every question answered. Enough! We really liked the place!

This was my first trip to New York in my life and the staff at Cassa made this an unforgettable trip. This hotel not only met our expectations but went beyond our expectations. The locations was great. The staff Karina, Stephanie ,Alicia and Gregory were the best staff I have encountered in all my travels. Not only were they friendly, but they ever so quick to help us find a great place to eat and fun places to see. Although the weekend was short and I am back to work now I have not stopped talking to anyone who will listen at my job about what a great hotel this was. I definitely will make Cassa my New York Hotel.Thank you again Susan and Anthony

My husband and I stayed here very recently on our honeymoon. The room was clean and comfortable and we enjoyed the hotel's location as it was in close proximity to many attractions and the subway. What impressed us even more was the attentiveness from the front desk management. We did have an issue but the front desk manager took care of things instantly and went above and beyond to ensure that the issue was rectified and we were satisfied. We appreciated her swift response and attention to detail. We would gladly stay there again on a future trip to NYC!

We stay at Cassa Hotel for 6 night at then end of August 2013. The Hotel is a boutique hotel with all the facilities that you need for your stay in Times Square! The reception is small but the staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms was very nice, good size room for Times Square Hotel..We had a Grand Deluxe room at the 16th floor, with all the amenities you need, big bathroom and great shower cabinet. Fast check in and fast check out. The business centre at the 10th floor it was great, small but they have free wifi, free access for check in for your flight and print your boarding pass. Also on the same floor there is a lounge place again with free wifi. The area is very nice, safe and clean..5 minutes walking distance from the Times Square, 5 minutes walking distance from 5th Avenue and a Starbucks coffee shop(for breakfast). At the corner in 6th Avenue you can find a "Pharmacy-supermarket" for cheaper water and snacks.

We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights (over Thanksgiving) and it was absolutely perfect. The rooms are big, there is plenty of space to move around and store your clothes and the beds are lovely. The shower is also amazing! The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is perfect. So close to everything and easy to walk everywhere. Empire State and Macys in 15 minutes, Times Square in 5 minutes, Central Park in 20 minutes.The other positive was that the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade went right near our hotel so we could either stand on the balcony and watch it or nip outside and watch with the rest of the crowds.New York is an amazing city (and we're not keen on cities!) but we will definitely be returning soon and without doubt will chose to stay in the Cassa again and would recommend anyone to stay here. Our friends are there right now following our recommendation. We are very jealous but hope they enjoy it was much as we do!

I still dream about their comfy beds. Do not fear the location - I worried that it would be noisy as it's right in Midtown and I'm a light sleeper - I'm not sure what kind of insulation they have on the windows, but as soon as you're in your room you'll forget how hectic is is outside your window.From the moment we checked in, to the moment we left (3 nights), every staff member we interacted with (and there were quite a few) was upbeat, kind, and extraordinarily helpful. We left weeks ago, but I still remember Stephanie, Roger, Halka, and Patrick very well. Stephanie was seriously amazing. She mapped out directions to a bar in Brooklyn (complete with printing out the detailed google map of the neighbourhood and advice to avoid a train that is "the worst"), recommended the yummiest affordable brunch one day and snagged us reservations at a restaurant with incredibly short notice the next day. She even emailed me afterwards to make sure we got there ok - who does that?!We briefly checked out the lounge on the 10th floor and used the free wifi there to check into our flights, and the front desk happily printed our boarding passes and called us a black car for the airport (we asked for a cab, but she advised the black cars were actually cheaper to Newark - great tip!). There was a cute little patio on the 10th floor and drinks for purchase. We went at happy hour and it was affordable for the area (though if you'd like to drink in your room, there is a Duane Reade right around the corner which sells beer which is half the price of TImes Square liquor stores. Front desk brought up ice very quickly).I booked two rooms here for 3 nights and the Cassa made me look like a rock star to my spouse and the other couple. If only they had known how affordable it was! What a hidden gem - I won't stay anywhere else in NY.

I will first say that I like nearly everything about Cassa. The staff is incredibly nice and accommodating. The room is spacious especially by New York standards. The bathroom is large, bright and clean and the shower is wonderful. I was located on the inner block so the view was nothing to write home about, but it was quiet. My big issue was with the extremely soft bed; the softest I have ever slept on. The bed appeared to only have a mattress and a thick and soft upper pad and it made my back bend significantly. I ended up sleeping on the floor as it was more comfortable. As much as I like the rest of the hotel, I would never consider Cassa again because of the bed.
user_name:
joseph a
New York City, New York

review_body: The Cassa Hotel NYC is in a great location. Located a couple blocks off Times Square & a few blocks south of Rockefeller Center, it is central to most everything. The staff is the friendliest, helpful hotel staff I have had the pleasure of meeting. They all bent over backwards with anything we needed. They sent a bottle of wine up to our room since my husband told them it was my birthday. Very quiet hotel (except for the Brazilian Festival that was a block away at 8:00 a.m. on Sunday morning! but that wasn't hotel's fault). Regular rooms are small, but that is to be expected in NYC. The bed is very comfy. No bathtub but shower is quite large. A/C worked great too...as we like to keep our room like an icebox! :)

I have been wanting to stay at Cassa since its opening and finally got the chance - worth the wait!Check in was quick, efficient and friendly! Elevators are fast - room convieniently right off the elevator. Room is small, no question, but well layed out and bathroom was roomy, (almost more important) the only quirk was no shelf in the shower for stuff. Bed was very comfy, room was spotless, and air conditioner was quiet. There is a room safe, as well! Had breakfast on the 10th floor terrace - fabulous view and staff - very friendly and helpful without being obtrusive.Can't wait to return!

New hotel that is reasonably priced in an excellent location. Stayed for both business and family. Clean. Excellent renovations. Hoping the gym and resteraunt which are slated to open in the fall are as good as the rest of the hotel. They do allow you to work out around the corner at a local health club which worked out perfect. Or you are only 12 short blocks to the park for a run!

The Cassa Hotel New York was more than we expected. From the front desk to Stephanie, our favorite concierge, to the housekeeping department who were unusually quick but thorough and we only saw ours one day out of five. They do appreciate tips! The room, while small, was excellent. Only 3 drawbacks: Call front desk for ice. Coffee makers in the suites, only. And no grab bar in the shower. The room was dark and quiet at night, large flat screen TV, great bedding, ipod dock, wonderful bathroom. No pool and the only food right now is on the 10th floor.Breakfast was perfect either in the lounge or on the terrace. Same with afternoon small plates and drinks. Restaurant opening soon. If you need a great location for the Theatre, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, the Cassa Hotel should be for you!!

Wow, this is a nice hotel. The front door staff and reception staff are superb! I was in & out of the hotel several times over 2 days in late August, and just noticed how kind and helpful the staff were. From the receptionists rushing to help me with my luggage to the doorman to everyone I encountered. Much more helpful than the staff at the hotel I WAS staying at 10 blocks directly north. The room my friend stayed in was absolutely lovely, clean and nicely furnished. The public areas were clean and well maintained. Next time, I will stay here!

Every moment of our stay with the Cassa Hotel New York was incredible. We had the best location, just 1.5 blocks east of Times Square and the Broadway Theaters, just a few blocks south of Rockefeller Center, and only a 1/2 block from 5th Avenue, the finest shopping district in the world. The doorman, the concierge, and the hotel desk clerks all went out of their way to help us, or just to offer a friendly smile after a long day in the city. This hotel is first class, all the way. Our room was immaculate, housekeeping was prompt and consistent, our bedding and pillows were pristine and comfortable, and we felt we were in an oasis away from the hustle and bustle of the city. It is important to mention that in a city full of noise, you could almost hear a pin drop in our room. It was that quiet and peaceful. Also - You must visit the 10th floor terrace lounge and enjoy some fine wine while taking in the city view. If you are looking for an excellent hotel with an unbeatable location, stay at the Cassa!

Such a wonderful stay. Very clean hotel and rooms. Nice-size bathroom with large shower. Big TV set. Super friendly service; front desk was amazing in helping us find great restaurants. Perfect location! Short walk to Time Square. Highly recommend it!

We stayed at the Cassa for 5 nights and found it to be an excellent hotelThe Staff were always very courteous and we found Eric to be exceptionalOur only concern was the smallish room and no tea/coffe making facilities,so take your own kettle and cups etc. The room and bathroom where very clean thoughThere are two nice Dellis opposite for breakfast and free WiFi next door at the Pret.The hotel is in a superb position and handy for all the sightseeing you need.On this point we arranged for a Big Apple Greeter to show us around. This was anabsolutely fantastic experience. It's free, one to one and well worth it, but booka month in advance.We flew into Newark so if you are using a taxi expect $90 fare, road tolls included.So if you need a central hotel in New York this is worth a try

I come often to NYC and comparing the Cassa hotel with others i consider it the best , a 5 star level in my opinion ,Very friendly staff, modern rooms, rooms were very promptly clean. , extraordinary house keeping service

I like going to boutique hotels for the service. Cassa Hotel delivered on so many levels - clean rooms, great service and location. I would recommend this to both business and casual travelers. The only disadvantage was that it didn't have WiFi in the room, only on one floor lounge. The hotel appeared to be recently renovated so the room amenities were well done.

My lady took me to New York for a few days for my 50th! how lucky am I?????We stayed at the Cassa. Nice place, very modern. very small, but I think most of new York hotel rooms are. Staff not the MOST knowledgeable, but make up for it smiles, effort and attitude. They did everything they could to assist us with our requests, which were numerous and challenging at times. it is located near times square and lots of restaurants. 6th and 45th. I would stay here again if you want to be at that end of the city.

This hotel was recommended personally by our next door neighbours who stayed in March.If you want all singing dancing hotel, not for you. If you want a spacious, clean and quiet room in a clean and friendly hotel then look no further. Just spent 5 nights at Cassa Hotel and cannot fault it in any way.On arrival first impression is deceptive. Only lobby entrance on ground floor. But after rapid friendly check-in rooms are very much a pleasant surprise. Soundproofing excellent with heating/aircon in room. Large comfortable bed. Large screen TV although with everything to do in New York we hardly watched. Clock radio/alarm/ipod player in room. Large bathroom with good size shower. Always hot water.There were not many hangers in the wardrobe, but one telephone call to reception had more to the room within minutes.Towels and bedlinen changed as you require, daily if necessary.Location is excellent, midway between uptown and downtown, short walks to Times square and 5th Avenue, walking distance to Central Park, Grand Central Terminus, Macy's store, Empire State and Rockefeller Centre and many other sights. Breakfast room on 10th floor with free wi-fi, but many cafes and bars around for traditional American Breakfast. If you need wi-fi ask about inclusive package for room.Staff extremely friendly and helpful, supply of maps and information always available. Door porter always there to help with bags, and even open door.We booked the room online, and communication was rapid and excellent.Thank you all at Cassa for making our stay even more enjoyable, it is possible we will be back in New York in December and we will not be looking at any other hotels.

Everything was great. Eric and Stephanie at front desk are really friendly and professional. Stay at Times Squares is the good idea. The carpet in the room could be change for a new one but the size of the TV, the quality of the towel and the big shower are just great. The location of the hotel is just perfect to live the life in Times Squares. No problem with the parking, the valet will do everything for you.

I loved my stay at Cassa Hotel, the staff was friendly, personable, helpful and really helped me with navigating through times square. it was a good central location between downtown and uptown. I was happy with the size of the room, the quality of the towels, pillows and bed.While there is no wifi in the rooms, it was fine to go to the 10th floor, and see the view. and be in a different space. Lovely staff, made me comfortable.

We stayed for 4 nights in this hotel and have just come back to Ireland. Firstly the hotel itself. Rooms were kept extremely clean, cleaners were in on a daily basis. Good quality TV's with 50 odd channels to choose from & extrememly clean and modern bathroom with a walk in shower. No issues with lifts etc, didnt have to wait on these for long at all. We were on level 27 and there was some good views from our room. Obviously being so high up meant noise from the street was not an issue. There is a very nice bar on the 10th floor with a terrace looking out on to the main street, was lovely to come back from a long days walking to relax here and have a drink. Location wise, this is ideal for Times Square, 5th avenue shopping, Theatre district, Diamond district, walkable distance to Port authority bus station for anyone looking to go to Jersey Gardens for shopping.This is pretty much all we were looking for from our hotel in New York. However, what we weren''t expecting was the absolute top class quality of the staff in this hotel. Any question we had was answered quickly with maps, directions, times of buses all printed out for us without having to ask. Taxi's were hailed for us at any time by the door staff. The Concierge's took the time out to go through different diners / restaurants to eat at close by, booked our tickets to go to Ground Zero, advised us on the best times to visit Empire State building to miss the queues etc. More importantly, they took the time out to get to know us, we never felt rushed at the desk and always felt like appreciated guests. I would like to take this opportunity to thank Tiffany, Patrick, Alishe, Gabriel & the rest of the staff at this hotel. If we are lucky enough to go back to New York, there is no doubt we will be staying at the Cassa. Exceptional experience!!

We stayed just 3 nights but it was exceptional. The bathroom was clean (a must for me) and the room was spacious and clean too.We absolutely loved it. And the location was great too! Minutes walk to Times Square!!Great stay! Our GO-TO hotel for New York!

Hotel was located well if you want to stay near to Times Square. (I will not prefer to stay at that region as it is very crowded at night especially). The staff are very smiling face and helpful. We stayed 5 nights as a couple and satisfied with the service. Hotel has free WiFi in lobby but not in rooms. Rooms are clean and tidied up properly every day.

We rented this hotel based on other reviews that we had read and I have to say that the friendliness and service offered by the hotel is second to none. We were upgraded for free to a deluxe room even though we booked a standard room. The location is only a few blocks from time square. At night you will sleep like a baby as the rooms are very soundproof and the street traffic is not heard from your room.

This is a great hotel to stay at while in NYC. The entire staff (front desk team, bellmen, maintenance, restaurant, etc.) is incredibly friendly and polite. They will remember your name and always ask if you need anything. They seem to be there for you and not the job. The level of service is TOPS!!! And if you have the good fortune of being checked in by Tiffany, you will be impressed to the highest. She is AMAZING!!The rooms are quiet, nicely appointed, modern and very clean. The bathroom is very large by NYC standards and is very clean. As this is a boutique hotel, it was nice not to be bumping into a lot guests coming or going. So it added to feeling safe.There is a restaurant on site but I didn't get a chance to use it except going to borrow a spoon to eat some ice-cream with my daughter . There is good reason why the hotel is called Cassa. It felt like "mi casa". So when it was time to leave i didn't want to.

This was our first time to NYC and we were pleasantly surprised with the Cassa Hotel. It is a few blocks from most of the major attractions and grand central station so the only cabs we took were to and from the airport. The room was very nice with a great shower! Every staff member was so pleasant from the people at the door, to the front desk staff, to the maintenance staff. If you have any questions about where to go and what to see be sure to contact Eric (concierge). He was outstanding! I emailed him a few days before the trip and he outlined what we could do each day given the weather conditions for that day. When we arrived he had the itinerary along with a map of what we would do each day ready for us. As it was my birthday, we had a special surprise waiting for us. What a treat! The only disappointment was having to pay for internet in the room although the free wifi in the lounge was good enough for us. Hopefully we will be back soon to the Cassa hotel.

This is the best value for those who want 5-star without the price tag. So close to Broadway! It's an intimate boutique hotel but big on comfort. Great beds, quiet rooms and super clean. The staff is the friendliest I've ever encountered on numerous trips to NYC.
user_name:
Susan M
Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States

review_body: The service by the front desk team was impecabble, especially byTiffany! Her personality is truly amazing! I felt like I had known her my entire life! This hotel has the perfect location for travellers who want to explore the middle of timesquare without having to worry about catching cabs! I stayed for two nights with friends and we all had an amazing time. Definitely we'll be back!

I decided on a last minute trip to NYC and was looking for a hotel for one night in Midtown. I found the Cassa Hotel listed on several travel sites, so I went to the hotel's webpage and got a great price. I arrived at the hotel mid-morning and the staff was very friendly and helpful. They checked my bag and said they would text me when my room was ready so I could get out to enjoy the city right away. The hotel was only a few blocks from all the great tourist attractions in Midtown. I can't wait until I return!

Unfortunately we forgot some stuff at the Hotel,We have requested a friend who wass passing by New York to pick it up and she had to wait more than 40 min, without receiving any follow up.We were in New York again this weekend and we went to the hotel. Without bothering with the details (previous emails, confirmations, calls, change of reference, and so on) we have lost more than one hour. At the end with the warning that we would have stayed at the reception until they took us the bag, we have been eventually been able to obtain back our belongings.Totally unprofessional.By the way I went to the toilet (which is at the 10th floor !!) there was an unpleaseant smell of cooked meet (possibly the bacon at the the breakfest) and the bothroom was not kept properly.With all other hotels, I would choose this a second time.

The hotel had a perfect location when visiting New York, right in the middle between Times Square and 5th Avenue, with everything a tourist like us from Norway is interested in such as Rockefeller Center, MoMa, Central Park, shopping, etc. etc. in close walking distance.On top of that we met a very serviceminded attitude from everybody in the hotel all the 4 days we stayed there.We give our full rcommendation to Cassa Hotel New York, and are sure to come bach here our next time in New York. By then the restaurant will also be open. Looks nice!

Stayed for one night to just get some away from home, but still close to home, and what a time it was. All the staff was very helpful and my room was very clean, even had that new home smell, which I love. Was very comfortable overall and would recommend to any body who would like to stay at a place where they would really like to relax and take their mind of things.

I've stayed at Cassa many times and have had great service from the friendly and personable staff, clean rooms from the wonderful maid service, and excellent help from the front desk and doorman. This is a very clean and updated boutique hotel in a great location. I'm talking a few minutes walk from great shopping, restaraunts, and shows. I've stayed at several other hotels in NYC for comparison and can truthfully say this is definitely top quality. The price is very reasonable too for midtown Manhattan.

Excellent place to stay. The hotel is as clean as any that we've ever stayed in. The front desk, doormen and other staff are always friendly, welcoming and helpful. Add in a great location where you are 3 minutes to Times Square or 5th Avenue and a nice and quiet, comfortable sleep and you get extreme value at the Cassa Hotel and Residences. The rooms are a nice size for a room in New York City and truely feels like a home away from home.This was our second visit to the hotel and NYC in the last year, as we came back to get married in Central Park. We chose the Cassa as the hotel to come back to and recommended it to our entire wedding party. We stayed 11 nights and wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else. My wife and I will be back next year to celebrate our first anniversay with NYC and the staff at Cassa!

I ve stayed at Cassa Hotel for only 2 nights, I'll have to start by mentioning the great location of this hotel just minutes away from Times Square, the hotel reception is very welcoming, helpful and welcomed the newly wed couple with an upgrade to the presidential suite as soon as they new it was our honeymoon.The suite was more than elegant and luxurious, everything seemed perfect.The only thing that would prevent me from going back to Cassa is that its too expensive, i paid more than a 1000 bucks for a 2 night stay.. bottom line is if you can afford it, go for Cassa!

Love the Customer Service, Perfect location in "Time Square". The Rooms are spacious, clean and very contemporary. This recently been my second stay here at "Cassa Hotel New York" I chose to stay here for a work related visit to NYC and also traveled with the President of the company that I work for. I knew that I could trust that the price would be very fair as well as the service would be outstanding ...... and it was once again very satisfactory. We had a driver pick us up from the airport and drop us off, front door with greeter right there to take all of our luggage. When we left is was just the same service repeated. As I have future travels for either work or pleasure. "Cassa Hotel New York" is my place of choice. Thank you all for the outstanding service that is continuously provided, daily and with a smile. So much appreciated. Gina Spillari-Todd

Great location, I stayed for three days from aug 2 - aug 5. I paid average $ 160 per night. Great bargain , right in the centre of the city. Room was room. Size was a little smaller. But I am not coming to New York to spend time in the room. The staffs are professional and good manner. Make it simple. For $160. Worth every single penny.

Friendly, efficient, welcoming with clean well appointed rooms. Situated conveniently between 5th and 6th Avenues, close to great shops and restaurants, I can thoroughly recommend this boutique hotel to tourists and business men alike.

Nice place to lay your head in such a busy town. Fantastic customer service from all, especially Stephanie the Concierge. Like the 10th floor Lounge with free wifi, views and nice places to sit. Fast elevators and good housekeeping. Doorman always had smile. Stayed 3 nights

We stayed at the Cassa hotel for four nights and loved it!The hotel is located in the middle of Manhatten close to Times Square anf 5th avenue, meaning we could walk to most sights. The stay was a birthday gift from my girlfriend and when the staff was told that we got a free upgrade for our room, a complementary bottle of sparkling wine and a birthday present. The staff at the hotel, especially the doormen and the front desk staff, provided us with a great experience.The room was also great, though not the largest. Soft bed, large bathroom and clean.We loved it and will definitely come back on our next visit to NY!

It’s New York and you’re supposed to get tiny rooms there. Hotels are overpriced from what I heard. So when I found this hotel at a “reasonable” price (compared to NY hotels that is), I booked it straight away.I have to admit, when I reached the lobby, I thought to myself that maybe I made a mistake. Don’t let the lobby fool you. Yes it’s small but staff are very helpful. The rooms may be small but was in great condition and the bed/pillows were one of the best I have ever tried. They were better than Marriott hotels (which are great in their own right). I didn’t get the breakfast so can’t comment on that, but the staff and rooms were great. Location of the hotel is perfect. Few minutes walk from Times Square, few minutes from 5th avenue and Grand Central station. It’s exactly where you want to be in Manhattan. A definite thumbs up and would certainly stay in the hotel again.

I visited NYC with my mum in June for 18 nights and stayed with the Cassa Hotel and we couldn't have been happier with our decision! The location is incredible with a short walking distance to Times Square, Fifth avenue, Central Park, the Empire State building and easy access to many subway lines. The room was immaculate with a spacious bathroom - a rarity in NYC! Not to mention the exceptional service and friendliness we were met with everyday from every staff member we came into contact with. It was so refreshing to have a hotel we could truly call 'home' during our time there and definitely hope to stay at the Cassa again!

This was our first time to New York and we knew we wanted to stay close to Times Square. I was with my wife and two daughters. We were there in the middle of June and had a great experience. This hotel was a few blocks from the action and was very clean and nice. The staff was always smiling and was very approachable. We saw the play Annie which was walking distance away. It was a great show. We had an awesome weekend! Our thanks to the Cassa Hotel. We would recommend to family and friends.

It's a beautiful hotel, clean, very nice staff and an excellent location in Manhattan (near Times Square, theaters, lot of clothing stores, subway stations and restaurants).An inconvenience for me was no free internet and no gym available.Anyway, when I come back to new york I will stay in Cassa again.
user_location: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
user_name:
Jaqueline C
Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

review_body: I stayed here for only one night but wish I had stayed longer. The entrance to the hotel is tiny and one could easily miss it walking by- however it is so close to time square (about 100metre walk) passing y restaurants and pubs on the way. I stayed on the 15th floor and the room was gorgeous- especially the bathroom and amenities!! All the staff were extremely helpful and friendly!! The 10th floor terrace is very nice unfortunately the fitness centre was closed ( they did offer free passes to a nearby gym) overall highly recommend this hotel!!

What a great find - the Cassa Hotel was just what we needed for our 5 night stay in NYC! The staff is friendly; Eric (one of the concierges) worked some magic for us and helped us secure tickets to Pippin at a 'fairly' reasonable rate. His restaurant recommendations were just great. And he helped me find a walk in clinic to help me with a very sore throat. The room was very clean and quiet. The location is just superb -- within walking distance of attractions, subways, fine restaurants, etc. Thanks Cassa - you made NYC so very enjoyable for us!

My husband and I needed a night away, so we got a babysitter and booked a room at the Cassa based on the fabulous reviews and extremely reasonable rate we found on HotelTonight. Margarita generously upgraded us for free to a king executive room, which was just lovely -- clean, spacious, tastefully decorated, so comfortable, great view. Did I mention the plush bathrobes? When Stephanie finished checking us in, she asked if we liked wine or Prosecco. Love this place! They really nailed all the special touches for us.We went out for dinner and a movie -- there are so many restaurants and activities within walking distance -- and returned to find a bottle of Prosecco chilling in ice and a plate of French macarons. Wow! We had enough bubbly left over in the morning to start the day with mimosas with OJ from the restaurant. It was a wonderful experience and we can't wait to come back! Thanks to everyone from Cassa for making it a very special night out for us.

Weekend getaway, perfect location, wonderful, friendly staff. Especially the doorman, who gave us great advise on getting 'Book of Morman' tickets.Our room was large, king size bed, clean, beautiful washroom. We would definitely stay here again.

So pleased we chose the Cassa for our 4 night stay in July! When staying in NY I always try to book the nearest central Manhattan hotel within our price range. I spent a loooong time checking out prices and reviews before committing our cash, and to be honest it was slightly more expensive than other choices on our list, but it was worth it. We arrived at the desk to be greeted by a wonderfully smiley and helpful staff, and we left with to a speedy, no hassle, check out! Everything inbetween was great! Clean, modern, comfortable room. Fantastic bathroom, with a wonderful monsoon shower unit. The 10th floor lounge is great to stop at before heading out for the evening to use the free wifi, and enjoy a couple of cheeky beers during happy hour! ...and of course the location is perfect, one block from Times Square! What more do you need???

From the moment we arrived, we felt special! We got an instant upgrade to a Junior Suite - which obviously got the holiday of to a great start. It was beautiful. Perfect situation, I would say about a 3 minute walk to Times Square, so you really are in the heart of NYC. Staff were so helpful, we found everywhere in NY were the same. So friendly, and everyone willing to make your holiday or break special. It was my 21st birthday, so they made lots of fuss. If I stayed again, which I hope I do (once I've saved up!) I would definitely book a junior suite room. Although the view out of the window wasn't very good, I can easily look past that. We got up around 6am and had a bath and watched Tv till 8 - just so that we could take advantage of the room as we were out all day and evening. Such a splendid boutique hotel! They even arranged very reasonably priced transfer to JFK airport too! Simply Amazing.

Great location near all the key shopping, theaters and attractions midtown has to offer. This is a small hotel with fantastic rooms - comfortable bed, huge shower and bathroom. The front desk staff were very friendly and happy to suggest multiple resteraunt options in the local area. The gym was closed for construction, but the hotel had secured access to a fantastic local gym free of charge for all guests. We did not use the terrace lounge or eat on-site. Highly recommend this boutique hotel if you are iooking for an alternative to the larger chain establishments.

I stayed at the Cassa Hotel early April 2013 on a solo trip to New York. I found this hotel to be Chic inside. The room was great and I had a street view from my window. It was quiet, clean with a comfy bed and had a huge flat screen TV. The bathroom was large and modern and there was a full length mirror near the door. It also came equipped with ironing board and mini bar fridge. I didn't have free wifi in my room, but only had to go to the 10th floor lounge area for free wifi. Location was excellent too, as it was an easy walk to Time Square, especially at night if you wanted to catch a Broadway Show. Staff were very friendly and helpful and always smiling!

We stayed at Cassa from 26th june to 5th july 2013.So glad we chose this hotel.Great location, right in the heart of New york!Great choice of food and shopping in the area...and of course, its right next to Times Square!!! The staff is super friendly.Although it was the busiest time of the year, but they always took time to greet you and advice you on how to make the best of your trip.Very chic clean rooms.You can borrow hotel umbrellas for free which was very handy as it was raining most days.Overall a very comfortable and exciting stay.Definitely gonna return :)
user_name:
naureenm
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Stayed at cassa hotel July 4 to 8th 2013.... Had the best experience with this hotel. The hotel is in a great location ( 5 Mintue walk to time square) the staff were super friendly, helpful with suggestions for food and activities. There was a sense from the staff that they wanted to ensure the visit was the best it could be. Our room was comfortable and provided everything we needed for two people. The bed was super comfortable with great pillows. We were able to leave our luggage for the day which was a added benefit at no cost. The hotel provided a car service to the airport which was great and a fixed rate I would encourage anyone to use this hotel !!

My husband and I were in New York to celebrate our anniversary and stayed at the Cassa Hotel again. As others have noted, the location is perfect. The hotel is within walking distance of Time Square, great shopping, fabulous restaurants and underground transportation. There are many places to stay in New York, but my husband and I choose the Cassa Hotel because it has great specials, very polite and helpful staff, and has clean, modern and spacious (by New York standards) rooms. This trip we stayed on the 21st floor. The hotel staff acknowledged our anniversary and my birthday with a beautiful bouquet of flowers, a bottle of wine and a very thoughtful hand written note. This is just one example of the warm and friendly service and attention to detail that we have received when we stay at the hotel. The hotel staff also held a parcel for us that we had delivered to the hotel before we arrived. We come to New York at least once a year and highly recommend the Cassa Hotel for leisure or business.

I stayed at Cassa Hotel from 27 to 30 Jun 2013. This is an excellent hotel which I highly recommend.I arrived from Asia exhausted, after a 24-hr flight, around 10:30am and the hotel staff kindly allowed me to check in immediately without surcharge. I informed her that I needed small notes for tipping and was so surprised when she immediately went out of her way to break a $20 note into $1 bills for me.Couple of days later, when I asked the concierge for tips on things to see and do she was so gracious to ensure her recommendations did not compromise my sense of personal safety.There were many other examples of the excellent service I received. Every encounter was pleasant, sincere, prompt and friendly. The small touches made a big difference for me and I got the feeling that they genuinely wanted to help their guests feel special.My room on the 5th floor was spotlessly clean and the bed very comfortable. Air conditioning was perfect and no street noise at all. Wifi connectivity at the 10th floor restaurant was great.The location of the hotel was superb: right next to 5th Avenue for all my shopping. When the shopping bags got heavy I simply went back to the hotel, put the bags away and set out again - no need to carry them around whole day. What a bonus! I also discovered the hotel is just one block from Times Square and easily accessible by foot to many other tourist attractions. Access to taxis and the subway is also very easy.Overall, I had a very positive experience with Cassa Hotel. I am happy to provide this review and would not hesitate to recommend it to my friends.

I absolutely adore this place. Clean, modern, efficient and luxurious! The food & beverage offerings were excellent at the 10th floor cafe not to metion a beautiful view of the skyline. We were so well cared for and in a great, central location. Staff is friendly, happy and hospitable. I can't wait to return! Tip: Monday thru Friday offers a great Happy Hour to ease the nerves of a busy day of sightseeing or work!

My wife and I have stayed at the Cassa Hotel 3 times now together and I just completed my 4th stay for a quick business trip. I noticed that this hotel just works for me. The rooms are clean, comfortable and well appointed updated. They have a great upper floor restaurant and balcony that has free Wi-Fi, and the staff is as friendly and professional as anywhere we have stayed. I like the location. There are ample quick places to grab food that are not total junk, and cabs are generally easy to get and the trains are not miles away. The Cassa works....very nicely!!

Just spent 4 days at Cassa Hotel and had a great time. Great value and the location was ideal - close to Times Square - but far enough away from the crowds and chaos. I stayed her for business and then extended for the weekend for pleasure - so it worked for me. Nice, new bathrooms (with some fancy Neil George products), the beds were comfortable and perfect. No noise ever from outside (which is normally my biggest complaint from NYC hotels).Highly recommend and I'll be back.

At first, This is an excellent choice of location! At only 5 minutes from Time Square, between 5th and 6th Avenues. The hotel is very quiet and peaceful. The staff, though dressed in black are very, very friendly and pleasant. Everyone is smiling and friendly, always available.We got a room on the 5th floor. The hotel is located between the 5th and 10th floor, the building that was recently built. On the 10th floor there is a beautifull garden of the hotel with a restaurant. It is all well designed with lots of white flowers. The room, at first glance, was a very small, but perfectly arranged and clean.My impression is that in NY not need a huge room for a time out abroad.Very comfortable bed linen, bed perfectly clean and modern design, all you need for a good holiday. Very comfortable bed linen, bed perfectly clean and modern design, all you need for a good holiday. In room wifi works great, I'm very pleased. Connector for iPad, music, plasma TV, mini-bar is filled with great drinks. Evriting is very nice.The room was vary cute. We stayed for 8 days. Every day, changing linens and towels. The room was cleaned twice a day. I have no objection.The bathroom is spacious, great. With two large mirrors, hair dryers. Everything needed for a bath, Shampoo, Soap and conditionar. Amazingly clean and tidy. Every day they consumed supplements to shampoos. Quite correctly.Shower is large and spacious. It has a shower with a massager. There was always hot water. Towels are changed every day. Everything was very clean and tidy. The corridor was a spacious, so there was plenty of storage space for shopping. Lovely large mirror gave the depth, lighting in the room perfectly. In a small cabinet was a safe, ironing board, clothes shelves. It's minimal but sufficient.General impression given the location and the price was great. The choice of this hotel will bring you much joy for decent money, so it's a good choice. Everyone staying at the hotel I want a good time.

I stayed here for the second time and it reaffirmed my opinion that this is the best hotel to stay in New York. The hotel is near perfect and apart from the unnecessarily expensive Wi-Fi cost I really can't think of any complaints. The staff are all very nice, helpful and genuinely seem like they are there to make your stay more magical. The rooms are typically New York small but spotless and well catered. Cassa very kindly upgraded me to a suite this visit and wow what a nice surprise - the suite was huge with a beautiful big bathroom - definitely worth considering if you want to treat yourself. Some people may bemoan the lack of restaurant but it personally didn't bother me because it's New York and the options are limitless. I see they are in the middle of constructing a restaurant and I'm sure it will make this place more appealing to some. Overall this is one of my favorite hotels from all my travels around the world and I can't recommend it enough

I booked a last minute trip to NYC to celebrate our Wedding Anniversary. The entire hotel staff had stunning customer service. Everyone greeted us with a friendly hello. Emilio made sure our stay was excellent he went the extra mile with his customer service. Our air conditioning unit was not working the first night, it was fixed but the next morning it stopped working again. Emilio moved our luggage for us and went to the front desk to tell them of our problem. I honestly was just expecting them to fix it while we were gone exploring the city, but instead they upgraded our room. Granted please keep in mind this is New York ....... You are not getting a penthouse as your room. We were very pleased and shocked both Henry and Emilio went the extra mile. Thanks guys!!! As for location it was great!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 5 minute walk to the following: subway, Top of the Rock, Central Park, Times Square, Grand Central Station. On another note, the rain showers in every room are amazing! I would definitely come back again for the following reasons: customer service and location!

The hotel is very neat and clean, it's very well situated near Times square and it's just a few blocks form Central park! Also it has a really nice lounge with good breakfast and Wi-Fi. But the most remarkable thing was the staff/concierge-service! They were so friendly and helpful (Especially Eric and Stephanie) and really made our stay worthwhile! We are definitely going back!

Yes, like everyone says - amazing location. Hooray. There are plenty of excellent hotels in locations just as good.I found the room minimal to the point of uncomfortable. It had the bed and a bathroom. Nice bed, nice bathroom but nothing special and nothing more than that. No extra space whatsoever in the room. We had to walk to the nearby starbucks to get hot water for tea (so, yes, we did just buy stuff at starbucks).The hotel did not seem to have any amenities. The front desk area was tiny and cold. Five steps to the elevator. That was it.The hallways were hideous. It felt like I was getting off the elevator in a 1970s apartment building.What about the service? No, really, that's my question - what service? There was an unfriendly robot to check us in and that was it. No problems with anyone but just absolutely nothing positive about it.Ultimately it was purely a place to stay. I jumped ship to the Sheraton on my last night in the cit. Finally - a hotel with a normal lobby, room amenities and overall comfort level.I do not recommend the Cassa and will never stay there again.

The hotel just opened when we went so we got a great deal. It was worth it! Great location, friendly service, nice room. The ventilation was loud though and there was construction outside. Overall, the location was exactly what we were looking for as we were running in the marathon.

This hotel is close to everything. My husband was in New York for business, so I was exploring the city with my 2 young children. The staff was very friendly, had great suggestions for restaurants, things to do with kids,etc. Hotel is only 2 blocks from Times Square, just far enough to avoid the crowds. Walking distance to Empire State Building, Rockfeller Center...loved the hotel, would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
Carina F
Plantation, Florida, United States

review_body: we were very impressed with this very central hotel . firstly the staff are very friendly & helpful every day a welcoming hello & good night. Our room was a great size for new york & extremely comfortable bed.

My family and I stayed in an apartment, not in the hotel rooms.The apartment was awesome, with a seperate king size bedroom for my husband and I. The main lounge had a great kitchen and two murphy beds for our sons. Quite a spacious apartment by New York Standards. The concierge were fantastic, providing great assistance in recommending restaurants, obtaining cheap broadway tickets, arranging transport and giving general advice. The location is awesome, a couple of blocks to Times Square and a Starbucks right opposite.

First time in NY. We chose it via booking website. We saw lot of good advices and decided to go there. First of all, location is very noisy... just beside time square. Every night plenty of garbages in the street. It really stinkson the way to the hotel by night. The room was very small even though big tv screen. the bar....mhmhmh there is no real bar but kind of cafetaria... not at the level of a 4 stars hotel. No free wifi, 15 USD per day... come on, we re in the 21st century! finally, but nevertheless, TOO EXPENSIVE , we paid 1200 USD for 5 nights... breakfast not even included...

First off, the staff here is probably the nicest I've come across in the city. I travel to New York very frequently for work, and stay here whenever possible largely because of them, polite and responsive yet not intrusive. The location is just enough outside of Times Square to avoid the crowds when you want, but convenient to dinner, 5th Ave shopping, shows and beautiful Bryant Park...really anywhere you want go either by foot/car/cab/or subway. With its great location I was even able to get to trendy Williamsburg in 15 minutes.This was the perfect place for me to stay for work during the week and then for my wife to come visit over the weekend. The room has a desk large enough to get work done, and beds and closet space to accommodate the both of us. It has a cute terrace on the 10th floor that is a great escape if you want to grab a glass of wine or just get some air, and the hotel is small enough that it is easy in easy out when you want to get out on the town. All in all, a great place to stay regardless of your reason for being in New York. Definitely give the place a look next time you come to NYC.

Me & my wife have enjoyed a lot our stay (4 nights ) at "Cassa".All the staff was very helpful for everything (restaurant reservations, money change, taxis,...)The room was very clean, quiet and with enough space (compared to many other hotels in New york city).The location is perfect, one block from times square.We will go back in the future.

When I'm planning a trip to NY, the first thing I do is check the bedbug registry since the problem is so rampant there. Cassa had no sightings reported, so I proceeded to book this modern hotel near Times Square, where I had a conference. Check in is at 3, and I arrived at 4 and expected to go right to my room. I had to wait. I waited in the 10th floor lounge, which has an outdoor balcony and a bar. That helped assuage my frustration. And the the manager came to get me and offered me free wifi and to comp my drink...The room itself was very clean, had nice furnishings and a super comfy bed, had nice amenities, and was facing the back, which meant a quiet night's stay. So I slept great. Overall, I'd go back if I needed to be in that area. Two items of note: there's no coffeemaker in the room, which I think should be a standard in any hotel room. And the bed was a full size, which is fine for me, but I could have never fit with another person, or if I were bigger.

we stayed in this hotel on our honeymoon august 2012 and it was spectacular.amazing service at the check in, they even carried our bags up. Such polite staff I havnt seen for a while.. Also the best thing was we had a bottle of wine waiting upstairs in our room.Great location as well within walking distance to times square and lots of Taxis waiting if required.

I had never heard of Cassa Hotel until it popped up as an option on one of my biz trips. I was blown away upon checking in...not only due to the fabulous, central location, but also the warmth of the staff, and then, the very modern design and inviting rooms. My only concern is that too many people are going to start discovering what a gem it was and it will be that much harder to get a reservation!

The problem with working as a trainer who teaches people to provide a superior customer experience is that you become hypersensitive. If you get poor service, it really rubs you wrong because your standards are just set higher.On the other hand, when you have a great experience it is like drinking an ice cold glass of water on a 100 degree day. Refreshing. That describes my stay at Cassa. Though I travel a lot for business, this was my first trip to New York City. I tried Cassa based on a referral from a friend and it was a home run. The location is unbeatable. Just down from Times Square and the Theater District. I got a king size bed and the room size was fine. A little on the small size, but who spends much time in the room when you have so much going on outside your door? I did probably spend too much time in the shower, but it was huge as was the showerhead, which did a great job of washing travel grime off. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. One night it was raining hard and they politely asked if I wanted to borrow an umbrella before heading out. Great touch. I found Cassa to be a great value and a great experience.

After weeks of researching hotels in a good location we finally decided to stay at Cassa, and what a great choice we made!!!Cassa is central to a lot of New York's central tourist attractions, with fifth avenue, times square, broadway and the Rockefeller Centre all within 5-10 minute walk!Staff at Cassa are also great they cant do enough to help! The beds are also amazing, you won't have a bad night sleep here! My only negative comment would be the rooms are a little small, but they are plenty big enough for most travellers looking to spend time in New York.Don't hesitate to book Cassa today, you will enjoy your stay, have a great night sleep, whilst being in the middle of all the great things to do in New York

This hotel is in a great location, My girl and I only had 4 nights in New York, so we were trying to fit in as much as possible, constantly on the go and this hotel was perfect for us. We didn't spend that much time in there other than to sleep but the only complaint is the $15.00 Per DAY charge for accessing wireless internet, this is just disappointing.. other than that it was great. Room was clean, staff were very friendly and helpful and i'd recommend this hotel highly!
