My partner and I stayed at the Cassa Hotel in April this year, upon arrival we were told our room had been upgraded which is always lovely after a long flight from Scotland and a 3 hour queue to get through customs at JFK , The room was lovely, beautifully decorated, a decent size, clean, big comfy bed, pillows weren't the most comfortable though. All the staff were friendly and helpful, and the location was perfect for sightseeing. Only thing I disliked was having to pay for internet access especially at $15 a day but saying that I would definitely recommend this hotel :)

The Cassa hotel is brand new and very nice. The location is near Times Square. For tourists and people needing a hotel in the business district you cannot go wrong. Room was nicely appointed and very comfortable. Good value for a nice hotel.
user_name:
Nate501
New York City, New York

review_body: the cassa hotel was one of the most pleasant experience i've had. beginning with the front door ,front desk rooms ,and maid service i couldn't have been happier. everybody was so kind and helpful in every possible way. the location is convenient to everything you would want in manhattan. rooms were spacious, clean ,and quiet. after this experience i would be hard pressed to stay anywhere else

We've just returned from spending our wedding anniversary in New York and stayed at the Cassa. From the moment we arrived, all the staff were very attentive and helpful. We received a room upgrade and a bottle of wine in our room. The room was spacious and very quiet (we were on the 17th floor). Upon checking in we were asked if we wanted a recommendation for dinner and as we had travelled for most of the day and were tired, we took the receptionist up on the offer and as a result ate at a lovely diner around the corner (Red Flame).The terrace was great and the waiter was also really friendly. It was lovely to spend a couple of hours up there.The room was really clean and the bathroom was spacious (the shower was huge and very powerful!).We would specifically like to thank Eric and we were sorry not to have been able to thank him in person during our stay.

I visit NYC every couple of months and generally stay midtown-ish. This was my second stay at Cassa, and whilst I want to make this my preferred hotel due to location, sadly will need to pass for the following reasons:Tiny desk, which is not suitable for working at allHotels of this type do nowadays offer complimentary internet (sofitel next door)No room service, and breakfast room always has a strong smellLighting not adequateHaving said that, it's very clean and service is very friendly!

My Wife and I had a quick trip to Manhattan planned and opted to stay at Cassa.The hotel itself is pretty basic but was fine for our needs. As with most NY hotels, the room was small but the bed was excellent and the linens comfortable and fresh. The bathroom was clean and bright.The room was on the back side of the building, so it was nice and quiet. We heard no noise from either outside or from the adjacent rooms.Only downsides were; a tabletop ironing board and charging for WiFi in the room (free on the 10th floor lounge).The staff were very, very hospitable and friendly.I'll stay here again if/when I head back to Manhattan.

Cassa Hotel was the perfect hotel for my boyfriend and I. It was clean and modern. The location was great and the staff was super friendly! I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

What a terrific find! Centrally located to everywhere you would ever need to go in Manhattan, and if you need to stray a bit further, the subways are all within a few blocks.I have to say, even the most basic room is terrific, and very well laid out. Seemed much bigger than comparable rooms in NYC. The beds are absolutely the best beds of any hotel I've ever stayed in, including The Ritz and Four Seasons!The staff couldn't be more attentive and were polite, friendly and more than accommodating, without feeling fake or overdone. One staff member that stood out above all others, was Abraham at the front desk... He was always cheery and very helpful with whatever we needed. He knew our name after the first night, and always made sure to say hello, and call us by name. It's really a toss up whether the best part of our stay was the bed or Abraham. Who am I kidding? The bed wins, but only by a hair!!! I wish there were higher ratings I could give for both!!!Thank you to the entire staff at Cassa... We'll definitely be back!!!!

We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The rooms were quiet, clean and well appointed. The beds were comfortable. The staff was helpful and attentive. My only disappointment was the lack of free wifi in the rooms, you have to pay a daily rate or go to the terrace for free access. The terrace servers for breakfast were not super attentive, so make sure you are not in a rush or give them notice if you are. Overall though, the hotel was super convenient and we had a pleasant stay.

I had the pleasure of staying at the Cassa Hotel last week. I travel to NY for business quite frequently and the Cassa Hotel caught my eye for the stylish rooms and the great rate for the mid-town location. I was pleasantly surprised by how much larger they were compared to some of the postings. If you travel to NY at all you know that real estate is at a premium, so having a room with more than 100 square feet is luxury. Even tho their rooms state that their smallest is 125 sq ft, i felt as tho the room was much larger. I stayed in a standard room with a full size bed. There was plenty of room to walk around and a great bathroom and shower. The furniture is modern and built for the space so it makes the room feel much larger. I've stayed in several hotels in the area and I've had a hard time walking around some of the beds and even getting in the door with my one suitcase let alone walk without bumping into something. This was a breath of fresh air. I also loved the fact that I had a bit of a view on the 25th floor. Usually any hotel in mid-town looks at another wall of a building or has no view at all.I was also surprised at how quiet the rooms were. I didn't hear any traffic noise or neighbor noise. I was not awaken in the middle of the night by the sound of the plumbing in the walls, and the cleaning staff were so quiet you didn't know they were working on the floors. They do have an onsite restaurant that will be functional in the near future called Butter. I look forward to returning to this hotel and sampling the food :)

One if the loveliest says in NYC.Easy central location. Impeccable service.Great rates.Modern atmosphere and knowledgable staff.NYC is a Mecca of Shopping, Nightlife,Theater, and museums. This place is perfectly located.GM Troy Pade is just the most amazing human being! Will be back !!!

I was not sure of what to expect of the Cassa Hotel, as i had been recommended other hotels in the area, that friends had stayed at before but when i looked it up online, i immediately liked it. My only reservation about booking a hotel online was, if my request for a "low floor" would be accepted. I cannot go in lifts, so the prospect of having been given a high floor, would have completely ruined my vacation. Thankfully, i had no problems at all...as soon as we arrived at the hotel, the reception staff greeted us warmly and explained everything to us. We checked in and i explained that i had requested a low floor, which turned out to be a 2nd floor with only one flight of stairs to go up! I also requested extra pillows which were delivered immediately. When we got to our room, we were pleasantly surprised as we had been warned, that New York hotel rooms were very small - ours was just right with a great bathroom and windows facing the street, a big tv and lovely air condition, which kept the room cool (as we got really warm weather whilst in NY) a very well stocked mini bar and even our own iron and hair dryer! Everything was great. The house keeping was excellent and was always done very early in the morning which was nice. The location of the hotel itself is fantastic! Everything to be seen in NY, is in walking distance literally. Your in the Theatre district and Times Square in less than 5 minutes! Surrounded by shops, bars and restaurants, there's nothing you can't find near the hotel. I can't stop recommending Cassa Hotel to my friends..the only negative i can say (which is not really the hotel's fault) is the pillows are too soft for me..i was using 4 at a time to sleep but that's just me coz i like been propped up! The reception staff and doormen i think, are the best asset the hotel has - everyone so friendly and helpful, they even printed out for me our return flight boarding passes! When i next travel to NY, i will definately be staying in Cassa Hotel and if possible in room 408 again!

I booked this on Hotels Tonightat noon on Sat. not knowing what to expect, but wanting an"Adventure". What a surprisewhen I found myself on 45th right near the theatre district and right off 5th for shopping ,and a stone's throw to the subway. Great restaurants overon 44th.This is a boutique hotel-no long corridors to rooms- modern and immaculate,and VERY quiet. Wonderful staff-nice touches ,like large umbrellas to use(needed as it was teeming on Monday). They stored our luggage carefully all day Mon.until checkout . Pret a Mangerright next door-best blueberrymuffins ever and wonderfulsalads, sandwiches etc. andtheir leftover food goes to greatcauses at the end of the day.A gem at a wonderful price !

I personally dont think this place was good value for money. Its suppose tobe a four star hotel and yet a basic thing such as putting a do not disturb sign on the door still resulted in room service knocking on our door. The double bed was small to say the least. Myself and my girlfriend stayed here for four nights and yet the room was laid out for single occupancy. We had to request for two bath robes, had to request for more shower gel (this wasnt automatically replemished), we were given four hangers for our clothes and had to request for more. This in my opinion was not four star. The one day that we wanted to use the outdoor terrace because it was sunny we couldnt as the staff were having a party and yet there was plenty of room for us - again another example of not putting the customer first.The only positive id give this place is its location - right in the heart of the hustle and bustle of NYC.

We stayed only one night in this hotel, I was happy that I did not book it for more than one night. The room was very small no space to store the luggaue and the closet is very small just to hang one shirt and one trousure. no shelves. Very loude A/C. The Bathroom is cold could not control the temperatue of the water during shower because of the sepatae control for the hot/cold water. The bed is two small for two persons sharing the room.The locataion is 10 minutes walk to Times Square. Too expensive for the room size provided.

My fiancé and I stayed at the Cassa Hotel last month and had a very unpleasant experience. I had an important business meeting the morning after we checked into the hotel. That morning I ironed my shirt with the iron and ironing board provided by the hotel. To my horror, I realized the iron/board had rust, which transferred to my shirt. The concierge, Eric, did quickly step in to get the shirt cleaned (Eric was extremely helpful in booking restaurants and other entertainment during our stay- thank you Eric!). Unfortunately not all stains were removed and I did not realize this until the middle of my meeting, which was very embarrassing. When we discussed this with the manager he was extremely unsympathetic and even accused me of lying about the origin of the stain (even though I provided the hotel with the iron and ironing board which both showed rust). We requested replacement of the shirt or a credit to the room for the amount of the shirt but the manager refused to accept responsibility and assist us. In addition, the hotel experienced problems with their elevators during the first two days of our stay. Our room was on the 26th floor. With only one working elevator, we waited 5-10 minutes each time we needed to use the elevator, and each ride lasted another 5-10 minutes as we stopped on several floors to pick up other guests who had been waiting several minutes. This may not seem like much, but we each used the elevators about 10 times a day, which really adds up to a lot of time wasted. As small business owners ourselves, my fiancé and I understand the importance of quality customer service. It is disappointing to see this lacking, especially in the hospitality industry…an industry that is supposed to be “hospitable” by its very nature and name. We realize accidents happen and would have been happy to forgive the hotel had they admitted fault and accepted responsibility. Something as simple as an apology and $100 room credit would have gone a long way for Cassa Hotel. Instead, they lost two customers.

Every aspect of our recent Memorial Day visit to the Cassa Hotel was superb. The staff and facilities made our vacation exceptional. The modern decor, the spotless rooms and upbeat atmosphere succeeded in fulfilling all of our wishes. I would highly recommend this hotel as a premier property when visiting the Big Apple, especially the proximity to all the Broadway theaters.Sharon, Miami, Florida

We just stayed at the Cassa Hotel. Super property, fantastic staff and great location for the theatre district or general midtown. The staff was super helpful. We were upgraded to a king room. The rooms are very well appointed, reasonably sized for a NYC hotel, great bathroom with a huge shower, and nice toiletries. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Very small rooms. Wardrobe so small that U can put their 1 jacket max. No other storage for your staff. U have to put your things on chair, luggage & bed.Small bathroom with only shower.No real breakfast - just a la carte. Be ready to pay $40-60 for itNo lobby-bar or place to meet.Booked it for 9 nights in NY moved after 2 nights to Crowne Plaza & were happy.

Clean and spacious room. What we really appreciated was the excellent customer service! All the staff was extremely helpful and accomodating. Walking distance to Grand Central and close to many wonderful restaurants. The beds were very comfortable. Cassa Hotel exceeded our expectations! Special thanks to Eric at the front desk!

My sister and I stayed at Cassa NYC over memorial weekend. It was both of our first time in the city, and upon our arrival (which was quite early in the morning) we were greeted nicely by Eric at the front desk and he not only allowed us to check in early but upgraded our room from standard to king and then wrote a day to day guide of what to do on a map for us. This was so helpful!!! We can't say enough amazing things about all the staff. They recommended wonderful sights & restaurants and truly wanted us to have an amazing experience throughout our stay. The room was beautiful and spotlessly clean. I'm OCD about cleanliness and I didn't have a single issue! The bed was SO comfortable, which was nice after a super long day of walking. We not once heard any noise from the street below. This was just a wonderful escape to relax from a busy day in the city. Proximity to Times Square, the Subway system, and our Broadway show was unbeatable! We cannot wait to come back!! Thank you all at Cassa NYC so much for making our first trip to the Big Apple as comfortable, easy, exciting, and relaxing as possible!!!!

Great location!!! The hotel has a modern style and is very clean. Staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. The bar isn't anything fancy but it serves it's purpose. The bed was very comfortable and the room size was nice. The elevators are a little slow but everything else about the hotel was great.

Great location with 6 minute walk to Times Square. Staff was friendly and helpful. The room size was ok for a Deluxe room in NYC but pleasantly surprised at the size of bathroom. Long wait for elevator and breakfast.

Clean, clean, modern, updated, fabulous bath/shower, quiet lobby with very friendly staff. Good rates!! Room was comfortable and roomy for NYC, huge screen TV, comfy bed with crisp linens. 3 walkable blocks from Grand Central and convenient to subway. Close to good food and travel needs. Restaurnat on site, with sitting area and outdoor deck. Just enough amenities - everything that you could need for a long weekend in NYC.

Awesome location! Good size rooms and clean. close to everything between 5th and 6th!Customer service was not so helpful although concierge met and exceed our expectations! bfast really nice at the restaurant! long waiting time for the elevator.

In town for a number of business meetings, all within a 15 minute walk from Cassa. I stayed for five nights in a Deluxe room and found the accomodation perfect for a solo trip. The bedding was very comfortable, water pressure was strong in the shower, and I had enough closet space for several suits, shirts, and ties. Terrence, at the front desk, was a constant presence and always made sure I had what I needed to be succesful each day. Also, don't miss Xi'an Famous Foods just a few doors down, for some of the best noodles in town. Can't wait to come back!

I stayed at the Cassa hotel in May 2013 as part of a business trip and was extremely pleased with the service offered. Upon check-in the front desk attendant was able to make me a dinner reservation and was highly professional throughout.The room was a lot larger than most NYC hotels I have stayed in and the bathroom well equipped with a fantastic rainfall shower. The room was extremely modern and the bed very comfortable, I liked the large mirror situtated in the corner of the room.If I was to return to this area of NYC on business or pleasure I will definitely stay at the Hotel Cassa again. Fantastic location only a block to Times Square, Radio City and excellent value for money.

The hotel is convenient to the heart of NYC. The rooms are small but new and trendy. The staff is well trained and very friendly. No health club on the premises, but have a deal with the NYAC located near by. Small restaurant in the hotel with decent food.

My wife and I stayed at Cassa Hotel NYC for the first time this weekend. We were very disappointed with the smallness of our room, which Cassa identifies as its "Deluxe" room. The "Deluxe" room is about 10 feet by 10 feet and very claustrophobic.The majority of the front desk staff were courteous and professional and Eric gave it his best effort to address our disappointment with the smallness of our room, which cost nearly $300. a night, including tax. The "Deluxe" should be renamed the "Petite Deluxe," and Cassa should clearly indicate the square footage of their rooms, to avoid future customer surprises and disappointments. Our upgraded room (I believe is identified as the "Executive Deluxe") was a very comfortable size, which measured specifically 13 feet by 15 feet. Our room was clean, neat and comfortable.Cassa's proximity to the theatre district is very convenient.Considering that the Executive Deluxe room (with an approximate cost of about $350. including taxes) is the size we are use to when regularly visiting NYC, we will probably cost compare other nearby hotels prior to deciding whether to return to Cassa.I hope you find this review of benefit.
user_name:
m q
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We book our reservation through hotels.com without knowing anything about the CASSA hotel. We had a wonderful experience - it was a nice surprise. The hotel staff was very friendly; from the bellman to the maids. The rooms look as new and were very clean. Rooms have all modern amenities, including a large flat panel TV. Our room was on the small size, but in line with other boutique hotels we have stayed in NY and other large cities. The bathroom was very spacious and clean too. The location is great. The rooms are very quiet, although the hotel is very close to Times Square and in the Broadway theater district.We highly recommend it - a best buy - high value.

I had booked this hotel following Superstorm Sandy, and after making me wait 3 hours in an endless line, with a CONFIRMED reservation, they made an announcement that they had overbooked and were not taking any more guests. This is unacceptable under any circumstances, especially when there is an emergency. The manager along with all of the desk staff were unapologetic and awful. I will never stay here in the future, nor recommend it to others. Shame on you Cassa!
user_name:
alanak21
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location. Nice rooms. Management was great to work with. Nice stay for anyone that is looking to be at the heart of the city and close to Times Square. Quiet, clean, good value. Recommended. Will stay again.

When in New York nobody stays more than half the night in a hotel room. So it has to be quiet, clean, comfortable and in the middle. 45th Street between 5th and 6th Avenue certainly is in the middle. There you will find Cassa Hotel. You will also find that it is as quiet as you wish, if you stay from the 12th floor and up in a deluxe queen, clean and comfortable. The lobby is no extravaganza, but functional. You could wish an early breakfast on the terrazzo on 10th floor, but have to find it just outside the entrance on 45th or why not in Bryant Park. No Internet in the room is not what you expect from a hotel like this, which causes some irritation in the year 2013. The staff is very kind and professional, without any of those bad manners you sometimes find in New York. So there is a good chance that you will have a short, but nice sleep, in the city that stays awake only to be prepared, when you the next morning, at a short distance reach Central Park, New York Public Library or the Empire State Building.

This is a newer hotel (actually part of a residence/hotel combo) that sports nicely decorated rooms in the heart of midtown Manhattan. I stayed here about 3 weeks after Superstorm Sandy and I'm not sure if that was the reason why the staff seemed less than friendly or if was just the way they were.Upon arrival, I didn't get a warm or friendly greeting and actually felt more like the guy behind the desk (Henry?) was an intern from school who couldn't be bothered to do more than take my credit card and give me a room key. He didn't tell me anything about the hotel and barely pointed out where the elevators were so I was left to figure things out myself (not difficult since the terrace wasn't open then and there were no restaurant or exercise facilities there to my knowledge). Still, given the positioning of this hotel as "luxury boutique", I did expect more for my initial interaction.I paid extra for a larger room and it was worth it as the room was still tight with the 1 bed. Not super small like you may find at other comparable hotels (like the W) but still not as "large" as expected. The room was quieter than most you'll find in Manhattan----given the new construction that's to be expected----but I could still hear some sounds from the street below despite being high up. The hotel is next to/near the Sofitel but lacks a lobby or other facilities (room service/dining etc) so if you want that go next door. The TV wasn't working correctly when I visited as some of the local channels were inaccessible --- again, not a huge problem since I didn't come there to watch tv but it would've been nice to watch the football games while relaxing or getting ready to go out. All in all, this hotel has a few kinks to work out in both its service and amenities before I would consider calling it a luxury hotel but given the low price I paid (under $150/night) it was a great deal----anything more than that and I would reconsider staying there as there are plenty of other places located in this area that are better or just as good for the price.

The Hotel is located in one of the best places,closed to the corner of 5th Avenue on the 45th street..Actually you can easily access to the Times Square, 5th Avenue,Central Park by walking 10 minutes..Rooms are large enough, clean and well furnished. On the 10th floor , the terrace and the view is so nice..Hotel staff is very friendly,helpful and welcomes you.If you love boutique service ,I can recommend you Cassa Hotel NYC..

I stay at the Cassa when travelling on Business as my office is directly opposite. Its also a great location if you are visit NY for leisure. Its located in Midtown with lots of bars and restaurants and only 5-10min walk from Time Sq.The hotel altho a new build has a 'loft space' fell to it, lots for trendy concrete with modern furniture.Best of all the hotel bedrooms are a very good size for New York where space is at premium and often even the most expensive of hotels have tiny rooms. There is a desk area too in the room which is great if you need to work.The beds are huge and so so comfy......and pillows are the best!

Overall a great experience at a good value.A friend from NYC told us about this place. We booked because it was in a great location near all of the sightseeing we wanted to do and is reasonably priced. Our rooom was comparable to upper end chain hotels except it had a nice large walk-in shower (no tub) with a waterfall feature shower head and wand shower head. The front desk and concierge were excellent and we used them quite a lot for restaurant recommendations and they were spot on every time. Service with a smile!We had a decent view out of the 25th floor. Complementary fresh brewed fruit infused iced tea in the lobby. Room has terry cloth robes, hair dryer, iron, ironing board, minibar (no fridge), safe, and HDTV. It also had an alarm clock with iPod docking station, which I had some trouble figuring out. Make sure it is not displaying "A" if you don't want the alarm to wake you up.Closest subway stop is at 42nd Street.

This hotel was choosen because his location : it was a very good choice ! Therefore, we meet a very friendly staff, the room was perfect - although a small place for linen storage. No problem to sleep where as our room was located on the seventh floor, sided on the 45th street. The breakfast... not so expensive ! We recommend Cassa Hotel !

This is the second time I have stayed at the Cassa Hotel New York. The location is perfect for my business there and the staff is extremely friendly and courteous. Both times I felt like I was the first person staying in the room. Very clean with a modern style. I have recommended to my coworkers that this is a great place to stay.

I stayed at the Cassa Hotel near Times Square in New York City for two nights while on business. The hotel is relatively small, only ten floors, with not much of a lobby to speak of. I had booked an executive room but was upgraded to a junior suite. At the lower rate the Cassa is a good value compared to other nearby accommodations. My room was very comfortable with a king sized bed and a small desk in the sleeping area. There was an entry room with an easy chair and a small couch. The bathroom was generously sized with top end appointments. The staff were all very friendly and decidedly unlike typical New Yorkers. There is a breakfast area and lounge on the tenth floor but I did not visit it. The hotel is a very short walk from Times Square which makes it convenient to business as well as entertainment. There are a plethora of restaurants only a short distance away.

WOW! Henry at the front desk deserves a gold medal and a pay raise. The staff here was incredibly helpful and gracious after a Delta nightmare for my parent's 30th anniversary trip. After planning a trip for years and having Delta single-handedly ruin the first part of it and not willing to do ANYTHING about it - I can't tell you how thankful I am that this hotel made up for an otherwise terrible, heartbreaking day. Having lived in NYC for 4 years before, I called up this hotel (though I've never stayed here before) on behalf of my parents who were out-of-towners stranded last-minute, and told them my story. Henry gave me an upgrade on their room for half off and I booked right away thanks to his kindness. Then, I get a call from my father that there is a champagne bottle in the room for them! THAT IS CUSTOMER SERVICE - Delta, take a note. That little gesture made their day and I am forever grateful to Henry and Cassa. On top of that, I called the front desk to thank Henry myself, and found out that my parents had declined the upgraded room, but that the staff there gave them the room anyways at the standard rate. Literally brings tears to my eyes after a very painful day of dealing with horrible customer service for a very important trip. I will be sure to stay here next time I come to NYC.

We have been for 3 nights in Cassa Hotel in New York. Very nice, clean, very friendly stuff. Only the breakfast is not so super - too expensive. I prefer a simple american breakfast for small money. But that you can get around

Ours was a business trip enhanced by visiting our entrepreneur son and spending time with good friends. The Cassa Hotel was perfect. It had the charm of a boutique hotel in a central location. Breakfast is available, as well as tapas in the afternoon (a restaurant is under construction). Right across the street is the Cafe Manhattan with a fabulous buffet selection of fresh, hot and cold foods. Of course there are many restaurants in the area and you're quite close to Time Square and Rockefeller Center. The hotel staff were all very friendly, knowledgable, and accommodating. The rooms were clean and quiet. I would definitely recommend the Cassa Hotel to all NYC visitors!

This property is great. Very consistent. I stay here whenever I am in New York. The hotel is beautiful, very comfortable - great comfortable beds! very clean, modern, quite, nice size rooms. The staff on the entire property goes above and beyond. Top notch guest service every time. Very friendly staff.

Besides the horrendous service and attitude we received from the receptionist upon arrival, the hotel has BUGS!!!! I have uploaded a photo to trip advisor so you can view the bug yourself. I am pretty sure these are what are known as bed bugsWe arrived at the hotel at 1am. The room had been booked as a double bed and we were hoping the hotel would accommodate at 1am give us a king size. The receptionist offered an upgrade rate for $85, then dropped it to $55, then to $45. While i understand a hotel needs to make money, the guy had so much attitude there was no way I wanted to pay extra. He also claimed that the hotel had numerous at 1am trying to book king rooms at the hotel (yeah sure). We went to the room and within an hour found a bed bug crawling on the soft located in the bathroom. It was disgusting.Since it was 1am we just asked the hotel to compensate us for the unlean nature of the room. Of course the receptionist would not do that, and instead moved us to a king.While we appreciate (finally) being moved into a king room, I will never stay at this hotel again for fear of bug issues and attitude of the receptionist. In all honesty, the hotel had a lot of potentialy - it was convenient and the rooms were quite decent. Its unfortunate that such a rude receptionist and bugs ruined it.

walking distance to time square, fifth ave, cafes and trains. staff are nice and helpful. but room is really small and furnishing not quite there of a fashionable boutique hotel it markets itself to be. have been to nicer ones for that price. airconditioning is noisy and not very reliable, rooms are quiet but in the morning you can smell the breakfast cooking through the vents.reception area is really small, nothing to wow about. cafe/bistro still not ready. felt it was not worth the price i paid.

We enjoyed our stay at this smaller, boutique-style hotel. The location is terrific--close to theaters, restaurants and Times Square. Our room was an Executive Suite with a very comfortable king size bed, nice pillows and good linens. We were on the 21st floor and it was pretty quiet at night. Our room had a huge flat screen TV on the wall and nice terry cloth robes for lounging. There is a great deli just up the street called Manhattan Cafe that has an amazing selection of fresh salads and hot foods. The Cassa is adding a restaurant that will open this summer called BLT that should be a nice addition--sometimes we were tired from a day of sightseeing and would have enjoyed just having dinner at the hotel. For now, breakfast and afternoon tapas and cocktails are offered on the 10th floor lounge that has indoor seating and an outdoor balcony. The breakfasts were very high quality and reasonable for NYC. There is a charge for Wi-Fi in the room ($15/day) but free Wi-Fi available 24 hours on the 10th floor lounge. The best thing about the Cassa is its smaller size and personalized service. When we went by the front desk, the staff greeted us. Even housekeepers in the hallway would say hello and have a nice day. All of the staff is super friendly and helpful. We really felt welcomed and appreciated. There was even a hand-written note from the manager in our room when we arrived to welcome us. The concierges are knowledgable and answered a lot of questions we had about tours, plays and transportation.

The location is great on the 45th street , minutes to time square, staff are friendly , helpfull and smiling all the time.rooms are small, however all new york hotel rooms are small, i've stayed in this hotel for two times now and it is one of my prior choices visiting the city again

We recently stayed there for a bachelorette weekend and we could not have been happier with our stay. The staff was absolutely awesome, very friendly. Great location. The deck they have is awesome!!! The hotel was very clean throughout. I would recommend this hotel to anyone as we had such a great experience!!! I will go back next time in New York, if we are allowed back that is haha! Overall Awesome place to stay!!!

We did loads of research on which hotel to go for. We were staying for a week for a special birthday so needed to get this one right. Great choice.In between 5th and 6th Ave on 45th Street this is within short walks of 30 Rock, NBC, Times Square, Grand Central and Broadway. It's as central can be so that's big plus. It's also right next to a Subway station which means getting to other parts of Manhattan is easy too. So that's location - tick VG.We were given an upgrade on arrival and so had a nice enough room on the 12th floor (there are 44 plus penthouses). King size bed, nice shower based bathroom, big TV and radio with iPod dock. The room was quite dark but we asked for an extra standard lamp and that made all the difference. Just ask.To get back to the airport we asked for a car and they duly provided a lovely black, clean, comfortable, new Lincoln Town car. $89 flat fee to Newark.So we really rated this place and enjoyed our stay.

Great location. The staff was very friendly. Room was fine with a modern light bathroom. I liked the radio and the tv. The breakfast was good but I would rather eat somewhere else where they serve more of a healthy breakfast.

I stayed in Cassa for a few days. Before and after I stayed in other hotels so can compare. Cassa is definitely very good and better then more posh places. The central location is perfect. Times Square, theater district, MET, MOMA, Central Park, 5th Avenue, etc are in walkable distances. Numerous of cafe and restaurants are around. The rooms are big enough, all necessary equipment is on place. Local staff are perfect, helpful and friendly.

There is no other hotel in NYC, that has amazing rooms, is in a prime location near key restaurants, the shopping district, time square and the show district. Staff is incredible. Hotel is so clean you can eat off the floors! I would not recommend any other hotel. It maybe a boutique property, but it trumps any chain hotel in the city! You will not be disappointed. I saw a couple negative reviews, and out of all the times I have stayed at this property, I have never had a complaint. I have recommended friends and family, and they loved it, and can't wait to come back to stay at Cassa Hotel. Don't believe the negative hype from the few people on here, who must not know an incredible hotel, when they see one. Trust me!
user_name:
JETSETCRICKET247
New York City, New York

review_body: We have just returned to Australia after spending 5 nights in NYC and staying at The Cassa Hotel. We were upgraded upon arrival which was fabulous and we were very happy with the room. Very modern and clean, comfortable bed, great bathroom and flatscreen TV. Athough our room was facing the street it was surprisingly quiet. The location is great - a very easy walk to lots of attractions - times square, rockerfeller centre, Grand Central station, Central Park, 5th Ave, Madison Square Garden and many more. The staff were wonderful - friendly, welcoming and always had a smile. Eric was great and very knowledgeable - he helped us with what we wanted to see (along with suggesting other things) and how we needed to get there. The only negative is no free wifi in the rooms - but it is available at a charge per 24hours if you want it. You can also get free wifi access in the lounge on the 10th floor. All in all, we had a great stay and were very happy with our choice of hotel. We would definitely recommend it to others and would stay again if we were lucky enough to go back to NYC!

I have stayed at Cassa before. Their hotel staff is amazing!! This time I stayed in an executive room, and it was incredible! I have to say that I could not imagine staying anywhere else in the city. I am in NYC, so I do not need to stay at a hotel normally. When friends or family come into town, I most times make a point to stay over a couple nights, so I can show them around, and ultimately be closer to them.. The decor and style of the rooms is unmatched by any other hotel in NYC in my opinion. The rooms are not the size of a mini shoe closet. The 10th floor is phenomenal. A business center, lounging area-living room, and a bartender making cocktails! Who can beat this? The only thing that I didn't care for is the price of valet. $60 p/n is a little steep, especially when local car garages are $40 or $48 p/n. More courtesy pricing should be extended to your guests! Other than that..five out of five stars! Location is everything, and Cassa is near all restaurants, Broadway shows, Time Square and other major attractions!Cassa Hotel has a European feel about it. Its like a cross between that and a Beverly Hills/W.Hollywood CA experience!! I love...love...love Cassa Hotel! Opulence in the city that never sleeps!

I travel to NYC 3-4 times a year to do business meetings and see theater. I'm 49 years old and have grown tired of "modern" hotels that have a bed and just enough floor to walk around the bed. I'm also tired of hotels that are basically discos with rooms. For a while I've tried to say as far from Times Square as I could because of the throngs of people.I decided to stay at the Cassa as one of my friends just relocated from Los Angeles to work there. I feared it would be too close to Times Square and Broadway, but I went ahead and booked my stay for 10 days.All my concerns mysteriously disappeared the moment I walked in. I was greeted by an extremely courteous and knowledgeable staff. I was shown to a proper room, that actually had room to walk around in and a very nice bathroom (I'm still missing that shower).The location of the hotel was perfect. 46th Street heats up west of Broadway, but between 5th and 6th was a little bit of heaven. Not as busy as some other streets and I had no trouble getting cabs right outside of the hotel.A lot of my meetings were near the hotel, and of course, all the plays I saw, with the exception of one that was playing at Lincoln Center were in walking distance as were some of my favorite pre and post theater restaurants and bars. The location couldn't be more perfect.My room, beyond it's spaciousness was delightfully quiet. After a day of hustle and bustle, it was wonderfully relaxing to return to my quiet room and really relax.As my stay was a long one, I became friendly with the staff, and found that I had made some friends by the end of my stay. It's very nice to be greeted by name when you walk in. The Cassa NY is my new home away from home in NYC. I have no qualms about returning as my stay was as close to perfect as possible. My only problem was getting out of the confort of my bed on time to make my meetings. It's a lovely place with very nice people and perfect for both business or pleasure trip, single or families in a very convenient location.

À Great hotel, clean room, comfortable (soft) bed, superb shower and fantastic location. 5th afrond THE corner, 10minutes walk to times square. Great deli (cranberries) nearby. We enjoyed our stay and would love to come back!

As first timers to NYC this was the perfect place to stay. Cassa is centrally located with Star Bucks directly across the road for early morning breakfast on the run. The rooms were modern and the staff were really helpful.

Cassa hotel is in a great location literally in the heart of NY. The room was absolutely spotless, bed was comfy bathroom was spotless and very modern. The staff couldn't have been more polite and helpful. I was worried about the weight of my suitcase for my return flight but I needn't have been the staff at reception had some scales and weighed it. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on the food but the lounge was also spotless. I would definitely stay at Cassa again great value for money. Am planning a return trip next year to NY and will definitely book Cassa hotel again ! The only thing I would have liked is tea and coffee facilities in the room. There's nothing like a cuppa after a hard days shopping! The wi-fi isn't free in the rooms but if you go to the Lounge its free there. Can be a bit of a pain so we did buy a couple of days access. Would highly recommend Cassa to anyone I can't fault the staff they were fantastic!
user_name:
Caroline M
Coventry, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Great location, friendly staff, well appointed rooms. We were delighted with this hotel. Though the rooms were smaller than expected, we had everything we needed. The robes were soft and warm, the shower roomy and hot, and the bed one of the most comfortable I've known. The staff was very helpful with our car, finding a restaurant, and just about anything else we needed. We'll be returning to the Cassa Hotel.

I stayed at Cassa Hotel for a business trip and although it is considered a 3 star property, I found it to be great. Everything I needed, which was a comfortable place to sleep. The bathroom is well appointed and all spaces are well keep and clean.The location is great if you want to be near Time Square, Grand Central Station, Bryant Park, shopping and walking distance to Central Park. Keep in mind the services match a 3 star, so room service is only available for breakfast and currently the restaurant is under construction but should be open soon and actually looks like it is going to be quiet fun! For a fitness center, you'll use a club near by, which isn't a huge deal, just something to note. I think the highlight of Cassa is the staff, everyone at the front desk and concierge desk is FANTASTIC....helpful, smiling, knowledgeable!

On a whirlwind weekend visit to NYC we stayed at Cassa Hotel. Great midtown location, making it easy to get to Greenwich as well as the upper eastside - good accessibility to subways, Broadway, etc. Staff was superb - friendly, knowledgeable, eager to do everything possible to make sure your staff was perfect. Room was comfortable, stylish, well laid out with a wonderful bed and nice bathroom. Very quiet, too. Housekeeping was fast and efficient, and calls to the front desk were answered instantly, by staff who could answer any question. All in all - simply terrific!

I've stayed at the Cassa Hotel several times over the past year and each time the service only gets better! The staff are super courteous, kind, and helpful. The Concierge helped on several times with making dinner plans and recommendations on what to do and where to go. The facility is brand new and the cleaniness and modern decor are fabulous. I would highly recommend this hotel.

On a whirlwind weekend visit to NYC we stayed at Cassa Hotel. Great midtown location, making it easy to get to Greenwich as well as the upper eastside - good accessibility to subways, Broadway, etc. Staff was superb - friendly, knowledgeable, eager to do everything possible to make sure your staff was perfect. Room was comfortable, stylish, well laid out with a wonderful bed and nice bathroom. Very quiet, too. Housekeeping was fast and efficient, and calls to the front desk were answered instantly, by staff who could answer any question. All in all - simply terrific!

This was my 6th visit to New York and my first stay in the Cassa. The location of the hotel was excellent. A couple of minutes walk to 5th Avenue shopping and less than 5 minutes to the heart of Times Square. He staff were AMAZING!! Best part of the hotel. We received a vey warm welcome when checking in and then each and every time we entered and left the hotel. New York isn't always the friendliest city but this hotel was unique. A special mention for Ahraham at the front desk who made us feel right at home. The rooms are on the small side but this is a major city. We were in an Executive King room. I have stayed in bigger rooms in New York but they certainly weren't better because of this. The space was very well used, the bed was so comfortable after a long day in the city and the TV was huge. There was a huge double shower. The bathroom was small but perfect. I found the room to be very quiet despite being on the street. Wifi in the room was $15 per day. Free wifi would be an advantage but not a big deal. There was free wifi in the lounge but apart from that we didn't use any other hotel facilities. I would highly recommend the Cassa and will definitely return.

My daughter and I stood here as part of her 16th birthday celebration. The hotel was decorated very modern, but warm and inviting. The room and bathroom were spotless. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds I have slept in. The staff, expecially Arta and Stephanie, were awesome. They helped me with my dinner reservations, directions and even where to take my daughter to get her nose pierced. No request was too small. Also, the location is in the middle of everything, but when you return to the hotel, it is a welcome oasis. I would definately stay here on my next trip.

Great location, amazingly comfy beds, 10/10 shower!Only let down was paying for wifi and the size of the rooms. Would probably not stay again as there are other hotels that offer you more for the same or less price.
user_name:
Ellyse M
Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia

review_body: Stayed here in April 2013Excellent location (3 minutes from high end shopping on 5th Avenue and a 10 minute amble to Times Square)Excellent bed and pillowsExcellent staffThe only downside was the lack of cupboard/drawer space but that didn't spoil our stay.

When we arrived our room was upgraded so that we had a bigger bed. Check in was very easy and staff were very friendly. When we got up to the room we found that they had left a bottle of red wine for us and a card. My mum had been in touch with the hotel and asked them if they could do anything to make our stay special, hence the wine and upgraded room.The room was really clean. It wasnt huge, but it was big enough. The bed was huge. The bathroom was a good size with a large shower, which was always warm. There was shampoo, shower gel, conditioner, moisturiser and soap in the bathroom. These were replaced daily. The towels were replaced as often as you wanted as were the bathrobes. There was also a hairdryer in the room. The TV had plenty of channels and was. Good size. We had nice views from our room. We didnt use the bar other than for an hour or so on our last day when we were waiting for the taxi. It was really chilled out and calming, although i did almost have a heart attack when i paid $5 for a can of lemonade! It did have free wifi though.The location was great. Literally 5 minute walk from times square, 15minute walk to central park. There is a pret a manger next door and a starbucks down the road. Check out was at 12 and they kept our luggage for us in a secure place. As we would be traveling to the airport during rush hour, the hotel suggested we booked a taxi for $69, so we did. The taxi was waiting 15 minutes early for us and the hotel took our suitcases to the car for us. We were so glad we booked our taxi as traffic was busy and all other taxis were occupied! There are 2 things that could have made this hotel reach the 5/5 for us. The first being having a kettle and tea/coffee facilities in the room. The second thing is breakfast. I know they do offer breakfast in the hotel, but the choice was very limited - basically, it was posh breakfast when i wanted american pancakes!I would highly recommend this hotel and would definately return. You wont be disappointed! Thank you Cassa!

The rooms are nice, but small, very small. Everything is white.It is very clean. The desk was like a TV tray table.I was there for both business and pleasure. There is no lounge area nor the gym (not ready).But . . . the people/staff are extremely nice. With these people, just wish the hotel was better.I had some problem at the time of checkout.There was only 1 person at the front desk at 7:45 am.I had to be in a meeting by 8am.and need to have my invoice to change the credit card for the last couple of days (the difference between businss credit card and personal). The receptionist took longer than I need him to.And at the same time, while trying to get my bill fix, he reach to answer the phone.I was frustrated.It was only 1 incident and I don't want this to ruin the kindness of the others.All in all, the hotel is in central of everything. So, it is great for just sleeping.

My wife and I just spent a month in an apartment at the Cassa Hotel. The location at W45th and Avenue of the Americas (6th Avenue) is a perfect location a block from Times Square. Maybe three blocks from Grand Central Station and two blocks from two subway stations. It is easy access to all of the broadway theaters. Though the apartment wasn't managed by the hotel, the hotel staff could not have been more professional, helpful and friendly. Not only the front desk personnel but also the cleaning and maintenance staff always had a "good morning" or "good evening." There was a genuineness in their actions that made us feel good. They were ready to answer any question and provide informative advice. The clientele is very international, I'm sure it is attributable to the location. Restaurants are close in every direction, and shopping opportunities are unlimited as 5th Avenue is only a block away.I cannot speak to the hotel accommodations but the location provides easy access to the theater district without the chaos of Times Square. You consider the Cassa and experience its wonderful people and perfect location.

Great hotel in the heart of mid-town NYC. 2 minute walk to Rock Center, 5 minute walk to Time Square, and 15 minute walk to Central Park. Large clean rooms and I particularly like the large flat screen TV's. Most hotels in the area have much smaller TV's. There's no bath tubs in the bathroom, but the shower area is large. Very friendly front desk, always acknowledges you as you walk by. I travel to NYC often on business and always stay at the Cassa. I found it to be the best in the area after trying all the company preferred hotels.

We got there in March, very cold, I was happy to find an umbrella, so we didn't have to buy one for the days that had bad weather, Great location, the staff was really nice,very helpfu. You feel very comfortable, the rooms are spacious with every thing you need . We enjoyed every day we were there.

If you need a place to stay near Times Square but don't plan on spending much time there and money isn't a concern, Cassa is perfectly fine. But you can spend the same amount and stay in a less dated hotel with larger rooms and get a better night's sleep.I paid slightly more for an 'executive room' but I have no idea what that bought me - the room was tiny, and even on the 20th floor the noise from the street was overwhelming and I lived in the city for six years. The rooms are dark and poorly lit. Internet access is a $15/day surcharge as well.The restaurant is more of a lounge with a couple of overpriced but well presented options - an understandable choice given the tiny size of the kitchen and the proximity to real food nearby. The staff was very helpful and professional.If the rates were 20% lower I'd return if I didn't have to spend much time at the hotel. For what Cassa charges, you can do better, or spend only slightly more and stay at a luxury hotel.

This hotel was one of the better ones I have stayed in while in NYC. The location is great, the rooms were clean and roomy by NY standards and the price was not too bad. The bed was comfy and I did not hear any noise during the night. The bathroom was bigger too and modern- no bath tub but the shower head was the rain style one. Overall, I liked everything I saw during my stay and I would stay here again.

We stayed at Cassa for our anniversary and as a result were kindly upgraded on arrival to a better larger room (big for New York, though as should be the case in New York were hardly there anyway). The lobby area and room were clean and modern and the staff (from cleaners to doormen to lobby staff) were all friendly and courteous. The location is perfect for exploring Manhattan, located just off 6th Avenue in midtown, with Times Square a couple of blocks away. WiFi is free on the 10th floor terrace but chargeable in the room (the only downside as far as I was concerned). Just a note on the lotions/bath gels in the bathroom as commented on elsewhere - they are good quality - my wife and I used them all week - if in doubt though take your own!

I stayed at Cassa with my wife for a couple of days in a Deluxe Queen bedroom. THE GOOD:1- Location is great if you want to be in central Manhattan. Close to Times Square but away enough to be quiet, and also super close to 5th ave. 2 - Staff is very kind and attentive.3 - Room is clean and modern. Bathroom is comfortable and shower is perfect.NOT SO GOOD:1 - Room lighting!!! I understand the cosy intention but at night the room was really dark with the indirect lights only. Older people would have problems.2 - Room is quite small but for NY it is ok. 3 - WiFi and delivery packages are charged.

First impression/Atmosphere: This hotel provided me with a very ambient, urban and relaxing feeling. I love the music it played!The hotel smelled very nice as well. When we first walked in the hotel staff greet us and were all very helpful. Our flight had arrived earlier than expected and were hoping to do an early check in and without hesitation, "Tiffany," the receptionist at the desk advised us that she was able to check us in prior to the original 3:00pm check in time. It was great!Room:Once we got into our room, we noticed that the room was a little small but we were still very happy with it. It was clean and there seemed to be a very light fragrance in the room but it smelled nice. In the bathroom, it was very clean as well. Everything was fully stocked and neatly organized. Inside the shower, there was two shower heads. As for the bed, it was very comfortable and the linens were clean. There is also a small closest and a safe as well. Located on the wall in front of the bed, there is large flat screen TV. The lighting in the room was rather dim but it didn't brother us too much. Location: The location was great! Located in Midtown NYC and was only a few minute walk out to Times Square and Theater District. Amenities: There is a gym but we did not get to use it because we were constantly on the go. On the 10th floor, it is where you can get some breakfast however, it is not complimentary. The terrace is also on the 10th floor and it wasn't quite open as it is still very cold out. As well, free Wifi "Cassa lounge" is also located on the 10th floor. There is a password required for it but all we did was just ask the reception for it. If you were located close to the 10th floor, you could be able to pick up the signal but as we were on the 23rd, we were unable.Overall, we both liked this hotel and I do recommend this hotel as this hotel has superb service and has a great location.

We decided staying on a boutique Hotel so we could enjoy a different kind of service/room style. As we get there we got a room that was so small, so small that we couldn't even open our luggage. We kindly asked the reception to switch to a new, bigger room. The receptionist showed us a bigger room and told us that we had to wait for a day so we could change it. Next day, they moved our luggages during the afternoon and as we got back at night, we figured out that they moved us to a diferent room than the one they had shown us and the room was a little bit larger, but still tiny. We complained at the front desk again and they initially tried to make us accept that room, but we didn't. They told us that the hotel was full and that we had to wait another night to change. We accepted, against our will. The second room had the sheet and blanket full of stains of I don't know what. Next day, they moved us to a nice bigger and descent room. The front desk manager told us that the boutique hotels are like that: one room is different from another. I, as an architect and interior designer, told the manager that I had designed a boutique hotel in Brasil and I never had such a small room in my life. My advice to everyone that pretends to go to NY is to check room sizes before, cause normally people spend much time shopping in this city and those smaller rooms are awful for more then one luggage. We had four luggages. One of then we had to be open in the bathroom. Bathroom design were great, but the shower area didn't have a place to put shampoos and soaps. We had to put it on the floor. The shower makes big noises when you switch to a smaller shower. The second room stayed a while with no water as we switched from the main shower to the small one. Overall, as we changed our room, we loved the hotel. They were very kindly not to charge us for the bigger rooms.
user_name:
Gugaassuncao
New York City, New York

review_body: Amazing location 3 mins walk to time square, and all that NYC has to offer. Helpful & friendly staff, from the moment we checked in. My lovely boyfriend emailed the staff prior to our stay asking them to make our stay extra special they provided a personal note and a bottle of wine in the room which was a lovely surprise. Rooms are of a standard size and bathroom was nice with a make up table and stool. Vey comfy bed and no noise could be heard from outside. Which was good after long busy days in the big apple. There was a couple of marks on the bathroom wall but overall clean and a very pleasant stay. We left a note for the maids to provide a few more toiletries and they provided plenty with no fuss.Would have been nice to have free wifi access in the rooms but it is provided free of charge in the lounge. You can buy drink, food or just use the wifi. May also be a British thing but a kettle in the room would have been great! You do have an umbrella in the room which worked out well with the snow.We used the hotels car to get us to the airport, it was slightly more expensive then a cab but was sorted efficiently and we pre-booked to guarantee a car in rush hour in areas of trying to flag down a can. The car made life easier and glad we opted for this option. Have recommended this hotel already to friends and when we return we will be checking into the Cassa.

Clean small rooms in a great location. There was really nothing special about the room and I was not crazy about the dark color hallways - but the room was clean and in good condition. Front desk staff was pleasant and helpful.
user_name:
Happytravelinfamily
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a small modern boutique hotel, very well located, near Times Square and most of Brodway shows, in a walking distance. Near too from Grand Central, Moma and Rockfeller center. The room was confortable and cozi, but very small and we ( me and my husband) had no space for two luggages. Despite it, there was everything we needed , even a wine opener. The bathroom was very clean but I didnt like the smell of amenities. The staff was very helpful and kept some packages we'd bought online and had asked to deliver at the hotel. This service was charged in normal prices!The guest can use free wifi at thu lounge on 10th floor. The room wifi is charged but the speed is perfect! I really recomend the hotel!

The Cassa hotel is modern, really comfortable and spotlessly clean. It is in a great location for sight seeing with many subways near by and ESB, TOTR, and Times Square all within walking distance. The restaurant was not finished when we were there so I cannot comment on food but there are great delis and cafes on the street near by where you can get fruit salad, bagels, pancakes and coffee at very reasonable prices. It's where the New Yorkers grab their breakfast on the way to work so you know it's good and it's local, not a chain! There is also a street vendor right across the street who does excellent coffee that is even cheaper again - great for a quick fix when you are getting ready. Room wise - we stayed in an executive king, the beds are huge and really comfortable, lovely modern clean bathroom, no bath but a powerful shower, robes and good toiletries. The Ipod dock is great for charging your phone and listening to music, there's also a flat screen tv with a vast array of channels. We don't ask for much when we stay somewhere but the staff were always courteous and friendly. Overall would definitely recommend - especially if you get a good deal on Travelzoo as we did.

trying to evidence the design in the decor I can assure that it wasn't tottaly reached. The rooms are small and without light enough. When we change for a suite junior it was better. There atre no places to saty in the groundfloor and isn't oractical to go to the 10 th floor to stay with one sofa only . The location is very good . The staff is fantastic

We stayed here for 4 nights. The location is perfect. The staff were great and planned out our whole stay so that we didn't miss anything out on our short time in nyc. The rooms were spotless good size, bed was really comfy. I would defiantly recommend staying here.

Positives were again excellent location, welcoming staff on arrival, large enough bathroom and good rate via e-mail offer from the hotel.Negatives were barking dog in next room (although front desk immediately offered room change to two floors below, still a hassle) and awkward interactions upon leaving. We came back from breakfast at 12:15 to request valet retrieve our car and were told we were locked out of room. The front desk (now with a "get out attitude") did grudgingly remove the late charge from our two rooms. Check out is apparently exactly at twelve, despite being there at noon in the past and waiting in long line for elevator, check-out and car retrieval. Also, the street was blocked off for construction directly in front of the hotel, and they brought the car to the front, necessitating us back down the one way street with no direction from anyone in the hotel. The valet was also nowhere to be found upon arrival. Overall, a pleasant hotel at a good rate, but we've had better times at the Cassa and other hotels in the area.

We stayed in Cassa Hotel & Residences on our first trip to NY last November. We arrived around 3pm, the room was not ready. The staff at the front desk was rude and not welcoming. We left our luggage in reception and went for a walk around the area. They were supposed to call us as soon they had the room ready. After 4 hours and no phone call, (7pm) we went back to the hotel and learnt that the room WAS NOT READY. We were tired, had an 8 hours flight from UK and wanted to have a shower. The receptionist checked us in with the room NOT READY. The bed without linen, only one towel... Really????? Their excuse: we had problem with the linen company. Is that customer service? Obviously we were not happy. Due to the inconvenience the receptionist on shift gave us complimentary breakfast for the whole stay.Pros: the location of the hotel. Cons: The price-quality IS NOT WORTH IT. The bed and wardrobe are small. The breakfast is overpriced. The front desk staff is not friendly. Conclusion: We are not going to return again. So bad Cassa, so bad...

The traveler pictures attached to the reviews are spot on. I found the room impeccably clean, unbelievably quiet - I never heard anyone, just a few distant sounds of horns, the flat screen TV was so big I didn't even need my glasses!, the walk-in shower (no tub) was huge with both the rain shower head and a hand held device and lots of hot water, the beds were fine, a bit soft for my taste, but others will probably love them. The size of the room for a single business traveler is just fine. I think if it's two people traveling, my room might have been a bit small, even though it had two beds. And the big downside for someone staying several days - storage space; the closet was small and set up such that you hang your clothes at the top and then the frig, etc. is in the bottom (though I will say I think this is the first hotel I've been in that had an umbrella in the closet), and there's no dresser (there is a desk) or any place to store your suitcase. But I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to at least business travelers who only need a night or two. If you're a couple or family, you should check with the hotel on the room size before booking.

We stayed in the Cassa as part of a Big Birthday trip to NYC recently. We were upgraded upon arrival and found a lovely bottle of wine and a personal handwritten congratulatory note in our room the day of the Birthday. I had also asked the staff if they could help me to decorate the room with some ballooons, banners etc. to surprise my partner on his Birthday which they did to perfection and this was no problem at all! The room was very comfortable, with the bed also very comfortable and there was no shortage of really good quality toiletries each day. We availed of the free wi-fi in the Lounge and found all of the staff consistently really pleasant and they couldn't help enough. A nice touch would be to perhaps add a tea/coffee making facility as I felt this was missing (it may be more of a European thing) Renovations are currently taking place so there was limited scope to enjoy a drink in the evening but when the new restaurant opens and the renovations finish that will all be resolved. We really enjoyed our stay and would gladly stay at this hotel again-thanks for a really enjoyable stay!

We went here for 8 nights and it was our 4th time in NY. Great hotel and would definitily book here again. Espescialy for NY the rooms are spacious. The service is great and everybody is very frienly en helpful. In april they finish a beautiful space for breakfast en dinner. Also a place to sit outside. The location is very central en al lot of subwaystations are nearby.Recommend it!

The Cassa was fabulous, perfect location very central to everything, rooms lovely and clean, concierge could not be more helpful, breakfast was lovely on the one day we ate at the hotel, they also very kindly upgraded us to suites as the trip was for our sons 18th birthday and they left him chocolates and a very personal hand-written birthday card which was a nice touch - cannot recommend this hotel enough!

It was a great stay, easy check in and polite staff. The room was large by my previous NY standards the bathroom was shower only but was adequate. I would be happy to stay there again. The hotel is very conveniently located within walking distance to MoMa, Hells Kitchen, Grand Central Station and Times Square.

Very Clean rooms, perfect size for what you need, walking distance to everything, very helpful staff, comfortable beds, and an amazing shower (nonstop hot water)...What more do you need?? I looked for days for the perfect hotel for what we needed for a fun getaway... I was very happy and pleased with Cassa Hotel. I will be staying there again!

Cassa live up to it's name. It truly is like having a home in the City. I stayed for three nights in mid February. And I have to say - I absolutely loved it. Mostly bc I had the best nights of sleep I've ever had in the City. The reason is - the rooms are cozy and quiet. From the minute the bellman opened the door to my room I knew, this was it. The rooms are beautifully outfitted. Perfect size for NYC. My room was on the interior, not the street side. This enabled me to open the window at night to get a bit of fresh air without the noise of traffic. I woke up in the morning completely refreshed. Room service was attentive, timely and delicious. And when I called to get my car from the valet, it was brought up promptly. The location is great too. I would highly recommend Cassa to anyone looking for a home away from home in NYC.

just back from a 5 night stay at the Cassa Hotel. We were upgraded upon arrival which was great - lovely room with queen sized, comfy bed, Staff were extremely friendly and attentive. Great attention to detail and staff happy to check our flights - it snowed heavily at the end of our stay. The location was amazing - so close to Times Square, subway, etc., but very quiet at night. Would recommend this hotel to anyone holidaying in New York.

The hotel is centrally located. Though rooms are a bit small (which is the case for all hetels in NYC) we had a very comfortable stay. The stay can be termed as Amazing. The staff is friendly as well. We stayed 2 nights at the Hotel and didnt spend much time there, but had a fantabulous stay.

We stayed in this hotel when we went to New York in December. The hotel was amazing; fantastic location and the bedrooms were beautiful, warm and extremely clean. The staff were also amazing, they recommended places to go for breakfast and dinner, made reservations for us and always happy to help with any questions we had. We stayed in the Cassa for 5 nights and could have easily stayed longer, it was fantastic. When we visit New York again we will definitely be staying in this hotel again.

I stayed in the hotel for only a weekend however I was pleased by the staff and the entire atmosphere. The location was the best, just steps away from Time square and 5th Avenue. The room was nice and the staff was very friendly. Also I loved the chocolates from Hershey's that were in the mini bar ad well as the Starbucks coffee shop just across the street. Actually as far as Zi remember the two things i didn't like were the paid internet connection and the fact that the drinks were locked in the mini-bar so I had to call the reception desk in order to get this fixed. They explained that this was done because I had pre-paid for my stay in advance.

On the weekend of December 28th me and my fiancé spent the night in Manhattan. We got to the hotel before check in time, with the hopes of just leaving our bags so that we could go ice skating in Times Square. The receptionist helped us even further by telling us that he could get us into our room no problem. The room was gorgeous and the staff was fantastic. I would come here again!

We stayed at the Cassa Hotel this past weekend and it was fantastic. My wife and I have been going to NYC for the past 5 years and this is probably one of the best places we stayed. Great location, great price and the staff was friendly and curtious. We would definitely go back.

Stayed here in December for a week...Positives: location, very clean room, friendly staff, cute little breakfast roomNegatives: no coffee making facilities, very tiny desk (not suitable for work at all), expensive internet, not enough lighting in the room

Stayed in May. Nice room, comfortable and clean and great location close to subway, time square, international center of photography. We brought our bicycles for the Five Borough Bike Ride and left them with the front desk to store when needed. I would stay here again.

There are plusses and minuses. On the plus side: this hotel has a great location - 45th St and 6th Avenue. My room was clean and the bathroom was well-appointed. The bell staff, front desk clerks and waiters in the cafe were all very friendly and helpful. Plus - it was a great value.Minuses - rooms are very small. I had an "Executive King" room and there was barely room for the bed and a tiny desk in the room. The air conditioning was very loud - sounded like a garbage truck changing gears. The restaurant was closed at 9pm. I'd stay here again with my expectations properly managed, enjoying the locatoion and the money saved as compared to more expensive hotels in the area.

This hotel was in a great location and had great customer service. My one gripe with the hotel was its amenities. The lotion provided was TERRIBLE (it was a heavy smell of cupcake frosting). So sweet it gave me a headache. In all hotels my skin gets very dry so I was desperate. The lotion alone made me give it a 4 star rating instead of 5.

Terrific location - close to subways. Stayed 5 nights and room was upgraded. Very comfortable room and nice size for New York. Bathroom was quite nice. Staff were very friendly. Would definitely stay again.

I come and stay at the Cassa Hotel & Residences pretty frequently for business and thought it would be a good fit for my family. So, last minute when everyone wanted to go to NYC, I called and booked two connecting rooms, both with king beds. For NYC, it was a great value. The location was good, a block away from Times Square and the rooms were cozy with a great showers. One thing I would have liked to have seen in the room which wasn't there, was high definition channels, a channel guide, and on-demand on the TV. Overall, as always, my experience at the Cassa was pleasing.

My husband and I switched to this hotel at the last minute primarily because of the location. We were in New York to celebrate our "medicare" birthdays and had ticktes to some shows so this was an excellent location. The lobby was small but attractive. We were checked in by Henry who was nice enough to upgrade our room. He had a very pleasant personality. Henry also asked of our dinner plans and offered us some suggestions for dinner. We did have dinner at one of his recommended restaurants for which he made reservations for us. Also an excellent choice. Our room was very nicely decorated and looked very comfortable upon arrival. The bathroom was bright, clean, and well stocked with amenities. The bed was very inviting and the sheets were so very smooth and soft. We had breakfast twice in the Terrace and were not dissappointed. Although the prices were a little steep, the choices were each just a little bit different and very delicious. The young men who worked in the Terrace were pleasant and attentative. My husband said the coffee was some of the best. Kudos to the breakfast chef as he made some very tasty plates in a VERY small area. I would gladly return to this hotel.

Loved our recent stay at Cassa. The hotel is centrally locate close to Times Square with easy access to public transport. The rooms are a good size, for NYC, clean, and well maintained. Bathroom amenities are high end and front desk staff is extremely friendly. Look forward to our next stay at Cassa.

Loved everything about this hotel. Clean, friendly, close to subway and attractions, and the lobby smelled wonderful every time we walked in (I have to figure out how they did that). Also when I left my cell charger behind they mailed it right away. I will definitely stay again. Only thing I found lacking was the restaurant which didn't seem to be open when we went about 4:00 p.m. Also had to ask for a coffeepot, but when we did it arrived promptly.
user_name:
SheriY_13
Grand Ledge, Michigan, United States

review_body: A New Yorker by birth, I frequently visit NYC and try to stay in good, well-priced hotels when I am not staying with friends. A special room rate promotion, along with the good reviews on TA, attracted me to Cassa. The hotel has virtually no lobby, but there is a common area on the first floor that we did not use. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to an "executive suite"--which was even small by comparison to the regular rooms in, for example, Hampton Inn Times Square North. (Size may not be an issue for most people. Because I was sick with a cold during my visit, I spent a lot more time in the room that I normally would have!) The room was very clean with comfortable Frette sheets and very quiet. The hotel staff kindly let me borrow an electric kettle (no coffeemaker in the room), so that I could make myself tea...

Great location, rooms sufficient, although maybe would have liked a coffee machine, staff friendly. Would certainly stay there again. The location was perfect, especially for two seasoned shoppers, one with a great eye for a bargain.

I stayed at the Cassa Hotel this pass weekend to celebrate my birthday and I was beyond satisfied with the room. It was surprisingly big, bathroom was lovely and small living room area was beautiful!. Very satisfy with the upgrade we received upon our stay!.
user_name:
Viramos1
New York City, New York

review_body: Cassa was a great hotel, perfectly located and with every accouterment. As with any NYC hotel, our initial concern was for the size but the room was wonderfully large and comfortable. From check in to check out the entire experience was excellent and we could not have been more pleased. We brought a dog and the pet fee was very reasonable ($40) and the staff was very good with him. The default checkout was at noon which was very nice.

I travel to New York about once a year and I had never stayed at Cassa before but I decided to give it a try. What a great place! Clean, quiet and very friendly staff. Cassa is very close to the subway and many different restaurants. We walked to MOMA and Rockefellar Center and over to the theaters for a couple shows. Great location!

Stayed at the Cassa for New Year, excellent location for Times Square festivities. Clean,friendly well equipped rooms, breakfast facilities on floor 10 but wish there was tea/coffee facilities in room. Staff very helpful.

We had a fabulous stay at the Cassa Hotel during the New Year period. We arrived on the 29th December to experience NYE in Times Square and was not disappointed by the accommodation and friendly staff at the Cassa. The rooms were quite typical New York style (small but more than comfortable). We did not use the food service so cannot comment around this. Make sure you book a room higher up as sometimes it can get a bit noisy from the street but hey, you're in New York so make the most of it!

This hotel is very close to Times Square so it is great for shopping and sightseeing. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet.
