Wifi is only available in the lounge on the 10th floor and I found this to be extremely inconvenient. FInally, I was not happy with the manner of some of the front desk staff at the end of my stay. Despite the prime location, I would be hesitant about staying there again.

We were seeing a show during the week between Christmas and New Year, and searched for a hotel in the theater district that had good ratings and was within our price range. So grateful we found the Cassa. Ratings on this hotel are spot on. Room was a good size, linens were great, bathroom was incredibly clean with a large shower, TV was huge (though we didn't use it much), staff was personable and helpful. Location on W45 was great for us, since our theater was on W46. If you plan on seeing shows, it's perfect. Many theaters only a quick stroll away. Did not take advantage of valet parking, but there was a parking garage around the corner. I loved this hotel and will definitely be returning.

My wife and I stayed here one night in December (pre-Christmas) to celebrate a birthday. It was the perfect choice for dinner, a show and barhopping. - location is great - in midtown but not too hectic (off the main drag) with minimal street noise- clean rooms with new furnishings and fixtures, and surprisingly spacious for NYC- bed was incredibly comfortable (we had a king)- big flat screen that we didn't use but looked great - not overrun with tourists - incredibly good value because we got a bloomspot deal for about $270 (regular rate was $400)

My partner and I stayed here over the Christmas holidays. The location is ideal, however they stay could have been better, much better. The biggest issue was the front desk attitude. We found them most times to be condescending and uncooperative when we called about issues (soap not being refreshed by housekeeping, erroneous charges, TV not working, etc.). Additionally, the walls are paper thin! You can hear everything in the halls and adjoining rooms. Early in the a.m. I heard a cell phone vibrating and it was from the room NEXT door!Another disappointment was that parts of the hotel were under constrction, which was not indicated on their website. Therefore, no "24/7" fitness center, no restaurant, etc. All in all, location is great, but there are other, more professional boutique hotels in the area!

Location was excellent midway between 5th avenue and Times Square.Room Services were Very Good.Room size was BELOW Average. I booked an Executive Room for 6 nights and thought i'm going to find the spacious room that suits me and my wife BUT IT WAS A TOTAL DISAPPOINTMENT.Storage was TINY.There was no space for the 2nd or 3rd bag in our executive room.The biggest disappointment was the experience i had with one of the front Desk employee..When i first arrived to the hotel after a 14 hours trip and was shocked with the size of the Executive Room, I called the front desk and this guy answered me...I asked if this was really an executive room and he answered Yes..I asked for a bigger room and that i am willing to pay for it since i had the feeling i am looking for a favor..He said no availability!!..I asked for any suites in the hotel..He said: I JUST SAID NO AVAILABILITY..ISNT IT?!!!Final Conclusion : If you are looking for a location with a some how high price go to Cassa..Otherwise, Find another better ones, Believe me there are alot better Hotels with same price (check my other reviews).I am not coming again to Cassa and not Recommending it to my friends or family.

We did a family sisters trip to NYC to celebrate my sister's birthday. We rented 2 rooms for 5 nights. The location is great. The rooms are clean. The front staff has typical, expected NYC attitude. They never smile, and if you ask for something, they act like they are doing you a favor. There is no included breakfast, so we went to Duane Read around the corner to buy snacks and coffee/tea. The maidstaff was very nice and offered to bring us coffee makers and hot water kettles to both rooms. The front desk staff said there wouldn't be a charge, but that they don't always keep it in the room- guests must ask for it. The wifi comes with a charge, but there is free wifi on the 10th floor lounge. The bar at the 10th floor lounge closes at 9pm. On the 2nd night, the coffee glass carafe in my room fell to the ground and shattered because the handle was broken. I had hot boiling coffee all over my legs and luggage. The maids cleaned it up and were nice about it & replaced the coffee maker. But, when I asked the front desk for more coffee, cream, sugar, he was rude to me and said they don't provide that...and that the coffee maker was just something a previous resident left behind. Clearly they have miscommunication within their own staff/team. Also, the heater was broken and they didn't fix it until the 4th night. We were there Christmas weekend and it was very cold, so without the heater, it was very uncomfortable. Stay here if you get a good price and want to be near Times Square, but don't expect anything else.

Good central location, clean, tidy. Staff efficient, friendly and helpful. Booked a room and received a suite! Comfortable beds, clean room good facilities including an iron and an umbrella! Did not use room service.Will stay again. Thank you.

I recently stayed at this hotel in New York late November 2012. If you are looking for a smaller quiet boutique hotel in an amazing location then this place is for you. It is on West 45th Street between 5th and 6th Avenue and even though we were on the 4th floor we heard virtually zero street noise. Hotel is three blocks from Bryant Park, close to Macy's, Rockerfeller Sq, Time's sq. and Central park. Everything is close, especialy the Theatre's if you are in town to take in a show or two or five like we did.Rooms are small just like most hotels in NYC, but the bathrooms are much bigger then normal. Beds, pillows and linens are top notch and extremely comfortable. Hotel is very clean with out all the extra amenitites you pay extra for in a big chain hotel. We found a great deal on Hotels.com for this hotel. I would definitely stay in this hotel again. If you do not want to pay for Wifi in your room then next door is a Pret A Manger that has free Wifi.

i'd definitely book this place again. i do have to preface this by saying we booked this hotel because it was in a groupon/living social deal, so we weren't expecting much.it's small and if you blink, you'd miss the front entrance, BUT, they've got great service inside! we were pleasantly surprised by the overall service and cleanliness. the front desk is very attentive and accommodating. even the bell hop services that bring in your luggage - they recognized us right away that night when we returned and would say "welcome back." the rooms are tiny, but so are all rooms in ny - however, the bathrooms were a decent size! one sink, rain showerhead, nice toilet. great TV screens and everything was very clean. the best part was that it was about a block away from Bryant Park (ice skating) and a couple blocks from Time Square. we were even able to check our bags in before our check-in time so we could roam the city the day we arrived.they've also got a bedside speaker that plays your iPhone/iPod - it was great to be able to charge my iPhone right near my desk since normally hotels don't have open outlets by your nightstand.only negative i have to add is that the heater is LOUD. it's in the wall next to your bed and it rattles when it turns on. scared us a couple times and we thought it might even wake us up at night. it never did, however....probably because we explored the city until we were exhausted.

We have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Cassa and we were very impressed. The location is very close to Times Square, Broadway and Fifth Avenue and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We booked to stay in an Executive King Room and requested a high floor after reading Room Tips on here. Our Executive King Room was spacious, but any smaller I think would have been a bit too small. Even though we were on the 27th floor, we could still hear noise from the street below, this didn't cause us a problem as neither of us are light sleepers, if you are you might want to request higher than floor 27. The bathroom was clean and modern with toiletries provided. I wouldn't reccomend this hotel for a business trip as the desk is very small and you have to pay $10 a day for wifi. The wifi charge would be the only negative about the hotel, a hotel of this cost should have free wifi. All in all though would reccommend and certainly return

The location of this hotel is perfect for visiting Time Square, 5th Ave and Broadway! It is located at a quiet street between 5th and 6th Ave, two blocks from Time Square and 2 minutes walk to all the 5th Ave shops. The room is very small but sufficient. The decor is contemporary and the bathroom is huge with rain shower. If you want to venture out, subway station is only two block, 3 minutes from the hotel. Staff is very friendly and helpful. We booked the hotel via Hotwire for a standard room (didn't realize it only has a full size bed). I asked for King bed room and the staff is able to help us to switch to a King bed room. I'd definitely stay here again.

We were greeted by a friendly and informed staff. Elevator was wicked fast, rooms were clean and the bed was the most comfortable bed we've slept on, hotel speaking. Very, very quiet!!!! Staff recommended places to visit and how best to experience the culture of NYC. Want to especially point out the excellent staff, especially Henry and Eric. So informative and so very nice!!! The location of the hotel was also great! Walking distance of Times Square, Rockefeller Center, NBC studios. I will recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city!!!

I booked my trip to New York City in early November for a great weekend in NYC where I planned to propose to my girlfriend.. After looking over the numerous hotels in the area, I was drawn to the Cassa by its great reviews, modern styling, and the fact that the general manager replies to all reviews, a good sign that he cares about his establishment. Being in advertising, this is a good gesture to be in touch with clients, and I felt like this was the place we would stay after seeing that. I had emailed a week out asking the hotel for a few things, and they responded with more than I had ever imagined, and this hotel made my weekend.. They exceeded my requests and truly made my Fiancé’s weekend in NYC remarkable. I highly recommend staying at the Cassa. The staff care about you and take exceptionally good care of every one of their guests. From the valet/doorman, to the concierge staff, to the general manager, I thank you for an amazing weekend in NYC and an excellent stay at the Cassa. I will be a returning guest every time I come to the city, thanks to the amazing experience I had this weekend!

I lived in NYC for 3 years so I have a different perspective. This hotel is a great choice if you can land a deal on Travelzoo or something like that for between $150-$175. It's a great base location for tourist to see a lot, but still tucked away from times square enough to get some quiet. Great staff!
user_name:
rad79
New York City, New York

review_body: My wife and I stayed at Cassa in October during Hurricane Sandy. We are from Florida and were there celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. This was our first visit to NYC and we already had the trip booked, and being from Florida, we didn't think the storm was going to be that bad. It was!! The staff were very nice and helpful throughout our stay. They kept us informed during the storm and when our flight was cancelled they made sure we had accomodations. The queen bed was very comfortable and the room was kept very clean. This is a great location with Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, and many things to see and do within a few blocks. This was a very memorable trip and we ended up getting a rental car and driving back to Florida when our other flight was canceled. We had a great time and would recommend Cassa to anyone.

Firstly let me start by saying this hotel has really really friendly staff and the hotels location is fantastic. But my stay was soured by the false price I was quoted from booking.comand the photos of the room on this site did not match my room( and I was upgraded) I'm not sure how it works in the US but total does not mean TOTAL in America! I was quoted $993 for 3 nights bed only not even breakfast I took 3 nights Wifi at a good price of 10 dollars a day, but my final bill was way over my budget....in UK money I thought it was going to be £621 but my final bill was £737 no happy and when I asked the very friendly guy at reception about it he blamed it on the govement not the hotel, Granted the US tax most things but please please add this to the so called TOTAL bill no a cheaper price to get you in the door!!! If your Minted this place is fine but stay well clear if your on a budget! I pushed the boat out because I was there for my 40th Birthday but had to spend my birthday money paying the inflated bill.
user_name:
Paul D
St. Andrews, United Kingdom

review_body: We stayed at Cassa for a week in November 2012 for our honeymoon.We checked in to find our bathroom dirty with hairs in the shower, and on the floor. We complained to the front who changed us to another room - this was only help ever received.Front staff were extremely rude and never helpful. We were even called by a guy from the front who claimed he was management at 3am to speak about an overdue account - which they had already been paid for 4 months to arriving and even provided a paid receipt at time of checkin and via email.The front staff were always to busy gossiping about others - very unprofessional and nasty.There are a lot more Hotels within the area with so much more to offer and at a much cheaper rate, and by far friendlier staff. Concierge were great - front staff need training from them.Cassa put a hold on our credit card which exceeded $2500 - this was without our knowledge until tying to pay with this card. We spoke with the 'so called' front management guy who was very rude and not helpf at all - he had no idea what he was doing. I have tried contactin Managment via email and phone calls (5 emails and 6 phone calls) and they have never bothered to return my calls nor emails. - nor bothered to release the major funds they are still holding (over 3 weeks after our stay).This Hotel is the most unprofessional and unhelpful Hotel we have ever experienced.

I stayed the weekend of Thanksgiving. This is a nice, comfortable, modern hotel located close to Fifth Ave and Times Square. There are also lots of cool neighborhood restaurants and bars nearby. The staff was friendly and courteous. The room was fantastic, small but a good size compared to most NY hotels, and looked just like the pictures on the hotel website. Great, comfortable King size bed, nice big shower, flat screen TV with HBO and other pay cable channels and great Frette robes.Two complaints - Elevator was out one morning and that was inconvenient. Also, they should have free wireless internet. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!!

Hotel prices in NY during the first week of December were horrendous! But I stumbled upon this hotel and they offered a great rate over the phone. The room was fantastic (executive with king bed)! Tastefully furnished and everything in working order. It is what I would call a "low service" hotel.... There is only a small lounge/restaurant that serves breakfast and tapas/cocktails in the afternoon evening, and the lobby area is very small. No room service, no tea/coffee making facilities in the room.... But there is a 24 hour Duane Reed just around the corner and cafes and delis close by to eat at.Thoroughly recommended!!

We booked a juniorsuite for more than 500 $ a night expecting def. more than that. No restaurant, no bar, no lobby, no glasses for the drinks for the minibar (we asked for glasses and the frontdesk couldn't understand why we needed glasses - they never have been changed - we had to wash them up daily). The wall in the bathroom broke away because of the water running out... The aircond is extremly noisy. The only good thing is the location. Never again at cassa's, this is for sure.

dirty room, broken shower, non existing service, the worst boutique hotel i have ever stayed inthis place is an absolut no-go. next time i will book again one of the known chains. i am surprised that there no more bad comments

Stayed for 4 nights early december and just back,First impression of hotel was very good.Nice area,good cafes,bars near.Checkin was a very slow as was paying cash and receptionist did not know how to do same.So waited a long time to check in.Room was good size, bed was big(some reviews say small there not),very comfy beds,Room clean but some housekeeping and maintance issues,(small things)hole in door in bathroom(609room)paint cracking in walls,floor in bathroom had dust all arount the edge,did not change during stay.Only small issues.FOH staff very slow,on checkout had hotel car service ready to go to JFK and had to call down twice to reception and told some one would be up,Took another 20 mins and me going to door man to get help with bags. Overall small issues could be great if little things fixed.Used the lounge twice found it very stuffy,they could do so much more with it, make more a bar than a lounge area, great space and would be great in area as they have a terrace, would be a little gold mine as hotel has exterior of a hip hotel.Will return again next year,as issues where small and not a deal breaker.

Again, so close to Times Square, you are paying for location. That being said, I have stayed at quite a few hotels in that area and Cassa is BY FAR my favorite. I have stayed her numerous times for business. My standards for where I stay for business is far higher than when I stay somewhere for personalFirst, they are the biggest and cleanest rooms I have had in NYC....enough said right?The beds are super comfortable, staff friendly (for NYC) and helpful, and free wifi in your room. Again, since it is NYC, price flucuates greatly based upon demand....anywhere from the $200-$400 range for the same room. If you want this general NYC location, you would be hard to find another hotel that is better.

This hotel has a great location and is perfectly adequate for a short stay in NYC. I think the things that would move it from being average to above average are in process - namely, they need a better waiting area and a restaurant (being built).Our flight arrived early in the morning and we got to the hotel about 10:30. We are perfectly prepared to stow our bags and occupy ourselves until check in, if necessary, but I always check to see if per chance we can get in early. It's much appreciated if they can do it, but not expected. After the initial pre-check in, we occupied ourselves til about 1:30. Thought we'd check again to see if anything came open. No. OK, occupied ourselves some more, checked back about 2:30 (check in is at 3). Still nothing. OK. Asked if something would be ready by 3 (check in time) and was informed she wasn't sure as they had given some guests late checkout. I was getting crabby as I'd been up since 4 a.m. and walking around the city since 10:30, so I was prepared for a fight if our room wasn't ready at 3 as that's cutting into time I am paying for. Giving late checkouts is nice, but not at other guests' expense. We went next door to the Pret to wait the next half hour as the hotel has no comfortable lounge at the moment. They have a temporary lounge set up on the 10th floor (looks like an employee break room in reality) with no water on offer (they don't open til 4). In fact, there is nowhere on site to acquire a bottle of water at all except for the mini bar in the room. Checked back shortly after 3 and was informed by Arta that they had upgrated us from the Executive room to Grand Executive in order to get us in on time. Phew. That was very nice.As to the room, there wasn't really anything grand about it - I can't imagine the Executive being any smaller. The bathroom was of a decent size and had a nice shower with rain showerhead. Good quality shampoos and soaps, though I found the smell sickening (I think it was chocolate-scented? Just a personal dislike I have with that fragrance in bath products). otherwise, the room had all the basics - hair dryer, safe, closet with plenty of hangars, bath robes and mini bar if you care about it. The bed was very comfortable! Other than that, there was a small desk and chair and another small chair and footstool. Electrical outlets by the bed were non-existent, though there was one iPod docking station. Some people don't have iPhones and others have two - many of us use our clocks as alarm clocks or just want their phones charging on the nightstand, so having outlets accessible to guests is really a must-have in this day and age.As to the aesthetics of the hotel decor, I can see where some of the negative comments come in. While the primary color theme is white, it is often set against dark brown (at times worn). The effect ends up stark, yet dark and drepressing. The lobby furnishings are white, but the floor is dark-finished concrete and the halogen lights don't flood the area well. The hallways are dark brown carpeting, dark brown walls and dark brown doors - our floor at least looked a little worse for wear - the effect of all the dark brown was reminiscent of 70s wood paneling vs the rich look I think they were going for.Anyway, all the staff was friendly and our stay was fine. They just need to step up the amenities a bit.

This was my first trip to new york with my boyfriend and this hotel is perfectly located for tourists. Short walk to all major sight seeing locations. The staff was super helpful during our whole trip and even upgraded us to a bigger room when we arrived. We have reccomended this hotel to our family and friends. Im hoping we get to go back soon.

We spent a very enjoyable week in the Cassa Hotel, very well located to Time square and the Theatre district and many notable sight seeing attractions. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We were upgraded to an executive room on arrival and found the room to be a great deal more spacious than we expected in New York. It was clean and comfortable and very quiet considering its location in such a busy part of the city.we would gladly recommend it to any visitor. We would certainly stay there again.

Just returned from a 5 night stay at Cassa and all I can say is great things, the location is perfect one block away from Times Sq and near all the main Manhattan attractions. The room was excellent and extremely large really nicely decorated with a huge comfy bed and great bathroom with huge shower.The staff are simply excellent probably the best I have ever experienced, anything I wanted or asked for was taken care off in seconds. Eric and Stephanie just to single a few out are a big credit to this Hotel but really all the staff are friendly and helpful,Thankyou so much for looking after us and on my next trip to NYC there is only one place I want to stay Cassa!!We stayed in room 2708 a great room!!Many Thanks again the Halls!

My husband and I spent our week in Manhattan at the Cassa. The location is outstanding. We had planned to go to the Thanksgiving Day parade. The hotel was about 50 feet away from the parade route. The hotel is an easy walk to Times Square, Fifth Avenue, Broadway theaters, numerous subway lines and bus service to Newark, Kennedy and La Guardia airports.Our room was comfortable and clean with contemporary-modern decor. We actually started out on one room and then 3 days into our stay requested a different room. The reason was that someone was smoking and the cigarette smoke filled our room. The hotel is a non-smoking facility. They sent their security guards to ferret out the smoker. In the meantime, they agreed to change our room, which they did in about 20 minutes.The staff was friendly, polite and accommodating. We would definitely recommend the Cassa and would stay there again.

My wife and I have just returned to Gibraltar from a 5 day break in New York and stayed at the Cassa Hotel.The hotel is in a great location and is modern with excellent staff. Our room was clean and well furnished (bed was a bit small) and the bathroom was spotless with a huge walk-in shower. We were on the 17th floor at the rear of the building and heard no street/traffic noise at all. The only drawback we found was that there is no tea or coffee making facilities in the room, however there are plenty cafe's and deli's in and around this block. There is no bar in the hotel but work is going on to open a brasserie early next year I believe. Again though, there is a huge choice of bars and restaurants in close proximity, we used one just down 45th called the Perfect Pint for a few drinks most nights and it was excellent with a great atmosphere.I'd definitely recommend this hotel and would have no hesitation booking it again as we found all the staff very helpful and friendly. Everyone of them we came across took the time to talk to us when we were coming and going and hotels over here could learn a thing ot two about customer service from the Cassa. I wouldn't normally mention specific staff, but Patrick who checked us in was particularly helpful and Gabriel was always cheerful and friendly and nothing seemed too much trouble for these guys.

We stayed at this hotel recently for 4 nights and was amazed just how good the location was. The rooms were good and the hotel staff very friendly. Was very close to 5th avenue shops and many of the midtown and Central Park area tourist spots. The only time we did take the subway was to get down to the world trade centre site, but once down there we still walked everywhere. Overall would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to New York. Only 4 stars as onsite restuarant was still being built.

Yes, the rooms are small. It's New York, after all. But the location could not be better, the service was good, the room was clean, and ... well, the pipes on the 26th floor had an angry case of the growls. That's the technical term for excess air in water pipes that, when faucets are opened and closed, sounds like a Hilti drill in the wall behind the bed. OK, I should have mentioned this to the management before check-out, but the thought of plumbers probing pipes during Thanksgiving weekend was worse than the occasional noise. Which did not cause any lost sleep, so the bottom line on Cassa is that it's a convenient, clean, comfortable, but rather cramped hotel in midtown. The price was right, too, when booked on Priceline the Tuesday before Turkey Day.

Great Location. Checked in about 12:30 and room was ready. Bed was a full and a bit small for us so I called front desk to inquire about a room with a queen/king bed. About 3 hours later I returned from sightseeing and learned we were upgraded to a Jr. Suite. Rooms were both nice but suite had a king bed. Staff were all very nice and helpful. Rooms were simple but clean and comfortable. Price was right, i booked on priceline.

I am usually not one to post reviews, but I feel obligated to share my experience. I recently stayed here with a friend. I was actually using this experience to scope out a possible stay for one night with my girlfriend in mid-December. The location was great but was very disappointed with our stay. We arrived at our designated check-in time to find out that our room was not yet available. We just traveled for so long in a cramped bus and all we wanted to do was relax in our room for a bit. The front desk said we could leave our bags with them and come back in a bit.We went to a bar for about an hour before returning. Upon coming back we see that our bags were kind of still just loosely near the front desk; not rally being attended for. Anyone could have taken our bags! So after waiting an hour we were told our room was STILL not ready. How do they not prepare a room within an hour when someone is waiting?!We finally get to our room, to find out how SMALL it is. When we booked online, we did so based on the picture accompanying the reservation. We simply felt cheated and dooped. At night, when we were trying to sleep, there was this loud generator right on the other side of the wall where the bed was that just shook the bed all night long; the constant buzzing made it really hard to sleep.We asked about the noise and was simply told "We are not sure" - and that was that. We asked if we could possibly move to another room, was told they would look into it, and we never heard back!Luckily, we were only staying one night, so we just cut everything up as a loss. And just said - screw it - its not worth following up with. I was really hoping our stay was better. I am looking to stay in NYC for a night during the holiday season, and was hoping I could take the little lady somewhere I knew and stayed before, so that way there would be no surprised. Unfortunately, now, I am going to have to roll the dice on some place new.

The Cassa Hotel is conveniently located near Times Square on a quiet street. My husband and I were pleasantly surprised on the simplicity of the hotel. The room was very modern and clean, the bathroom was clean, good lighting and the rain shower was very nice. There were all the amenities - toiletries, bathrobes, hairdryer, nice closet, safe, ironing board and umbrella! The only thing missing was a coffee/tea facility - hope they add this in the future. The bed was very comfortable and made up with just the sheets and down comforter - thank goodness no bedspread. We are returning in December and look forward to our next stay.
user_name:
ItalianGirl729
New York City, New York

review_body: Just back from NYC and I just wanted to recommend this hotel.Head concierge Eric Salvidar organised our airport pick up and helped make everything perfect for our arrival so thanks Eric. We will be back soon.We booked a suite through an external agency at a very good price so shop around.

Perfect location, in the heart of the city, really close to Times Square, subway and numerous landmarks. Really friendly staff. We paid an upgrade for an executive room with a very comfortable king-size bed. The room was simply perfect: good size, clean, newly decorated, big flatscreen tv, iPod dock, small desk, etc. Almost no noise from the street or the airco. The bathroom had recently been refurbished, it was clean with all necessary equipment and had a great rain shower. Only one bad point in this hotel. Wi-Fi comes at 10$ a day per device, which we knew, but it is in-credibly slow!! There is free internet on the 10th floor, but there as well, internet is extremely slow (and the lounge horribly smells of baked bacon and eggs). You can pay an extra 5$ for faster internet, but 15$ a day per device in a 360$ per night room is unacceptable in 2012!Tip: every morning we went to the Prêt-à-Manger restaurant next door for (good!) breakfast and for free, high-speed internet.But if you don't mind the internet, this hotel is the perfect spot for your NY stay!

This hotel is close to theatres shops and restaurants. High floors are quiet rooms can be a little small but inNY you do not spend time in the room Will be better when the restaurant opens. Close to the subway stations for easy travel

Great location just a block from times square. Our room was clean & modern, small, but we expected that in NYC. Staff were friendly, welcoming & helpful. Our only complaint, they charged extra for wi-fi. After paying about $250/night, we felt this was petty. They wanted $10/day per device. With two cell phones & an iPad, it would have been $30/day for 7 days. Thankfully one of the front desk staff agreed to charge us just $10/day. There was also a lot of fooling around connecting to the wi-fi each time we used it. Overall, we'd recommend the hotel but ask about wi-fi charges when you book.

I only stayed here for one night with my boyfriend, but it was very relaxing. Amidst the hustle and bustle of Times Square, it was the perfect place to wind down at night. Very clean, and such a comfortable bed! We made the mistake of dragging two big suitcases (each) to get there, and even though it's less than a 10 minute walk from Times Square, it was definitely a workout. The staff were nice. The porter even arranged for us to take someone else's personal transportation when we were running late to the airport (taxis all have a switchover around 3-4pm so most won't take you somewhere far away unless you leave much earlier).

My girlfriend came in from out of town and due to Hurricane Sandy, my place was not ready for company. In a rush, I booked through Hotwire and got this hotel for 1 night. Before checking in I read the reviews on the hotel. I was hoping for the best and expecting the worst. I had a great experience. The front desk staff was polite and spoke every time they saw me in the lobby. The room was a nice size...I'm from NY...space is limited EVERYWHERE. I loved the decor. The location is great for sightseeing. I'm not sure what the price of a room if booked through the hotel but I would definitely recommend this hotel. I'm planning on making another reservation at this hotel for a romantic night in the city with my partner in the near future.

I stayed here for just under a week after Hurricane Sandy. The staff was great and I had no problems. I was really surprised how nice the hotel was for the price paid. The staff was very attentive and friendly. The only problem was that it seems that someone who was in my room changed the combination to my luggage while they were servicing the room. Other then this prank, I would highly recommend this hotel, but make sure after you open your locked luggage, you spin the dials so the jokester can not do this to you.

I stayed at this hotel because I could not travel to Louisville due to the hurricane Sandy. Just for one night and it was enough.The hotel is very moderne but so cold and indifferent! You come in and out and nobody notices you!The room is so cold and the bed so small that it is almost impossible that two normal persons can sleep on it!The location is good but there are so many options around with prices off the same range!

We booked this hotel for a long weekend in NY through Hotwire and highly recommend it. The location is great -- within easy walking distance of Bryant Park, Times Square, Fifth Ave., etc. yet the block that the hotel itself is on is relatively quiet. The rooms are extraordinarily small but this is the case for most NY hotels. The bed was fantastic -- even more comfortable than my bed at home, which I wouldn't have thought possible and the shower was great -- plenty of hot water and strong water pressure. (There was both a large "waterfall" showerhead and a hand-held one.) There were thick, fluffy Frette towel robes (which are on my wishlist now), a large high-def TV, and lovely, helpful staff. Everything was sparkling clean.Other reviewers have commented that the restaurant hasn't opened yet but this didn't bother us in the least since we like to venture out anyway. There were plenty of cafes within walking distance, including a Pret a Manger next door and a Starbucks on the next block. We will stay here again on our next visit to NY!

Went to NY for a weekend to visit friends. My buddy and I decided to share a room. We booked through hotwire, looking for a nice fun place that wasn't too expensive but in a good location. Ended up booking at Cassa and were really pleased. We booked a room with a double bed but ended up getting upgraded to a king bed, which was really nice. The room was very compact, NY-style, but lovely. Clean, simple, modern, and well-done. The staff were friendly, helpful, and genuine. The hotel is very streamlined - no grand entryway or lounging area, but who uses those anyway? A few blocks from Times Squar and Port Authority, close to the subway - I would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it!

The Cassa Hotel is a very good hotel. The interior is modern and tastefull. We loved the location, it is very close to Times Square. I wouldn't recommand it to people with little children. The hotel does not have a restaurant so you have to take your meals outside. That was maybe the only down side, it would be conveniant to be able to have breakfast in the hotel, but there are a lot alternatives next door. For business maybe not the best option but for pleasure great!We would certainly recommand this hotel to our friends!

Great location, comfortable and clean, Staff was very friendly and accommodating to my schedule. I was working nights and sleeping most of the day, but they still cleaned my room every evening. The rooms are small, but it's New York. It's not like you're going to spend a lot of time in your room. The only thing I didn't like was the lack of closets. It meant having to have my luggage out the whole time.

Got stranded at JFK during nor'easter and got a room at Cassa purely by chance. Very nice accommodations, great staff, reasonable price. Just a few blocks from Times Square, theaters and Rockefeller plaza. This is where I will stay when I come to the city in the future.

We stayed at this hotel for about a week at the end of September. All in all, it was a very nice hotel. Very clean and modern, just how we like it. We were placed in the 4th floor the first 2 days. I'm very sensitive to noise when sleeping. The first night, I was so tired I fell asleep even though I could hear music playing. The second night was a different case. I was hearing all sorts of music. I though since our room was adjacent to the building next door and not another room, we couldn't really ask them to turn down their music. It's fine if it's white noisy...but I could differentiate every song I heard. And to be honest, I did not recall any noisy building when walking back to the hotel after dinner. So, it was very strange....So, we called the front desk to request a change of room. The front desk asked if I would like to move one floor up. Since there's a limited number of the suite we booked. Here's where the conversation gets interesting...Front desk: "Would you like to move one floor up?"Me: "Well it seems like the noise is coming from the next building, so the issue would still be there... BTW, is there a club or bar next door, the music is so loud?"Front desk: "I'm sorry, what did you mean by a club...we are in a hotel building..."Me: "Well the music.... (I was so tired at the time I didn't want to dwell on the subject), anyway, I would like to move as far away from this room as possible."Front desk: "That's fine, but we do not have another suite. So that would mean downgrading to another room." ...And so we did (while paying for the same cost). After we packed, we went back downstairs to change keys and rooms. That's when I noticed the music was playing in the LOBBY. That's when I figured, the music that was keeping me up at night was not some invisible club or bar next door, but it was from the lobby! I would highly recommend the hotel to either turn down the music after hours, move the speakers away from the ceiling, or just get better sound proofing floor for those guests who are staying on the lower floors. At the end, we moved to a downgraded room on the other side of the building. And I was able to sleep peacefully for the next few remaining days. The hotel would definitely get one more star if it was not for what happened. But overall, everything else was nice. I would stay here again, book another room, and specifically ask for a hotel on the upper floor.

This was a fun boutique hotel with a bit of hipster 'tude, but Restoration Hardware-like furnishings. I might stay here again, but not for business.The good: Clean, ultramodern room with nice furnishings. Very comfortable bed. Large bathroom with great shower and fixtures. My room was very quiet, looking out on the back side of the hotel (no view to speak of, but hey, it's NYC). Location wasn't near anything major I was going to (except Little Brazil), so others' reviews can probably speak to this better. The breakfast room was empty when I showed up, but it overlooked the street, for a nicely lit "view."The not-as-good: Room was really tiny, as in the large bathroom was almost half its size. Mine was so small I had to turn sideways to slip into the bed. There was not a functional closet to speak of, so I had to hang my clothes on the back of the door. The desk was also half depth, which made for a less than comfortable work session with my laptop. It also was not well lit at all. Given that the furnishings were black, and the walls darker in color (which was nice, I'm not complaining), the room really could have used more lighting if you like things bright when you work. It was very expensive (but perhaps a touch reasonable for Manhattan at ~$350).
user_name:
BlueWindez
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This hotel has an excellent balance considering cost-benefit and also is extremely well positioned, only a few blocks from Time Square and 5th Ave.Also, I would like to mention and thank Michael Schneiser, that clearly exceeded my expectations on handling a difficult situation and made all the difference to me and my wife. Every time I return to New York, Cassa Hotel is the place I'll stay.
user_name:
Laurencio_Cara
São Paulo, São Paulo, Brazil

review_body: If there's a 0 star rating, I'd check it for this hotel.I booked a room here through hotwire.com during hurricane Sandy. I showed up at 11 AM at the hotel and was informed by the hotel staff that my room is not ready, and that I should check my luggage with the bell desk and come back at 3 PM for my room.I came back at 3 PM to wait in line for 2 hours for check in. After the long wait, I was told that my reservation was cancelled and that the best solution is for me to contact hotwire. I asked who cancelled my reservation, and the front desk person lied to me and said he didn't know. Turns out, the hotel cancelled my reservation because they were 60+ rooms overbooked. Instead of admitting to their mistake and informing their guests of the incident, they decided to lie and blame it on hotwire and myself instead. The front desk personnel was even threatening to call security on me because I was asking him questions that he couldn't answer. I was not the only case, they did this to many people who were in line with me on that same day.By the time I found out I couldn't get a room here, I tried searching for rooms at other hotels, but it was too late. All hotels in a 100 miles radius around NYC were booked. I was fortunate to have friends who I could stay with for the day. I'd hate to think of other guests who couldn't get a room and don't know anyone in NYC to find a place to rest for the night.Unprofessional, rude and poorly managed hotel. I'd not recommend for anyone to stay here. They lost me as a customer and I'll inform anyone I know to never give business to this hotel. Extremely disappointed!

I was looking for a room in midtown after hurricane Sandy crippled the NYC area. I stayed for 2 nights at the Cassa and my overall impression was great. Located near time square, walking distance to Bryant Park, shops along 5th Ave, Rock center as well as convenience to major subway lines. The room is a decent size for NYC hotel rooms, contemporary décor and very well maintain; large and clean bathroom with high end fixtures, good quality towels and generous toiletries. I believe this hotel is only less than 3 years old. The lounge on the 10th floor offers a large outdoor terrace overlooking 45th street, sitting area with a large screen TV and some small plates plus drinks (more like a mini café). I recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a lodging alternative in midtown Manhattan.
user_name:
Arch-Designer
New York City, New York

review_body: The good:Great location just a block from Times Square.Staff try hard and appreciate your businessRooms are small but surprisingly cosy and attractive - good lighting and decor, comfy bedThey make a big effort with the bathrooms - great shower,lighting, ambience, toiletries, towels, dressing gownsQuietThe Bad:The restaurant is still under constructionStill a tad priceyFoyer is cold and unwelcomingNo bar or convivial area to hang out

stayed here from the 11th-15th of october and had a great stay. the hotel is very clean even though it was going through some renovations in the main lobby. the staff were always very helpful and very friendly. the rooms were very nice (some say small but decent size for NYC). the location was great as it is very close to times sq and within walking distance to rockefeller center and great shopping. only issue i had with the hotel was that there was no restaurant and bar. the was an area where you could have breakfast that they converted into a makeshift bar in the afternoons. not really what i was looking for.overall, a great stay at the cassa, would definitely return during my next visit to NYC.

Good location, close to Times Square. Rooms were spacious with large flat panel TV, iPhone docking radio, bathroom tiled and nice but not flashy in any way. But cleaner left a rubber glove on the floor, didn't replace used glasses and the price was almost $370/night with taxes.

We arrived early in the day and were happy to find that our room was ready but had also been upgraded. Room was clean and spacious but a bath would have been a nice extra. Not to sound too pedantic but many hotel get the bed wrong. ours was extremely comfortable and pillows perfect. Sound proofing was also of a good standard (very important in NY). Hotel is well situated in 44th and close to everything - shops, 5th ave, Broadway, Rock, Times Square. The Tapas cafe in the hotel was a big let down and appears that while the hotel is intent on providing good room and good cleaning services and good front desk service it does not want to provide other facilities such as a bar and on site restaurant. Hopefully the advertised soon to open on site BLT Restaurant will deal with this shortcoming and give one a place where one can go to unwind or entertain a visitor at the end of the day. Service at the Tapas cafe was also not great and it appears that the hotel wants to stay away from providing these extras and drive guests to use the establishments on the streets of NY. If you have been provided with good referrals to restaurants and bars and other entertainment stick to them. The concierge referred us to alternatives which were found to be lacking and not as good as places we were referred to. Although keen to please, Im'e not sure that Eric the concierge has had enough experience and sufficiently connected. Having given some negatives...location is great, check out is quick, desk service is tops, cleaning is efficient, atmosphere is vibey, staff genuinely try hard to please. I don't believe it's a mistake to stay here.

It was a pleasant surprise! I was very pleased with Cassa's location, interior decor, the comfort of the mattress/pillows/beddings, the cleanliness and their customer service! The interior of my room was modern and designed to function and provide the spacious, elegant feel. I also like the vanity accessories they provided, good quality. The shower pressure was fantastic as well comparing to other boutique hotels in NYC. Everyone at the front desk was professional, friendly and helpful.I was slightly disappointed with their rooftop bar/lounge. It was like a cafeteria more than a real bar/lounge/restaurant. Their staff was very friendly and helpful answering my questions. I was informed that they are in the process of building a real bar/lounge/restaurant downstairs next to the lobby. I was also slightly disappointed with the severe corner wall and desk damage which is not pleasant to look at, but they covered it with the desk chair which made it a lot more pleasant for the eyes, but I can still see them when I sat at the desk. It would be nice if Cassa can place a work order to have that patched/fixed. It doesn't seem like a big nor a pricy job, but it would match the quality of everything else this hotel offers. Overall, my stay at Cassa was fabulous and would definitely stay here again next time I visit NYC. I highly recomend Casa Hotel if you are looking to experience boutique hotels in NYC.

We stayed at this hotel for a week. The staff is very friendly, Stephanie took a lot of time to help us book a musical and finally found us great seats. All the staff we met throughout the hotel were very friendly and thoughtful, for example they saw me walking towards the elevator and clicked the button for me. The room was small, no real view, but that's what's to be expected in NY. Very little space to hang up clothes, which was the only negative. The room was very clean though and the bathroom was good as well. Wifi at 10 dollars per day is expensive.The location is great, near Times Square on the one side, Fifth Avenue on the other side. I'll stay here again next time I'm in NY.

The hotel lobby is minimal. A desk, sofa and some lifts to take you to your room. What's important though are the people working there. Arta at reception was exceptional throughout. Not only were we kindly upgraded after a long transfer from the airport, later during our stay she helped make restaurant bookings and imparted helpful advice. Eloy and Kevin were very friendly and helpful with advice and local knowledge too. So were all the other staff there including housekeeping, but these are the ones that come to mind first and foremost Our room on the 21st floor was a superior deluxe with a king bed, sofa, dresser and chair. Street noise was hardly audible. View of building opposite was nothing special. But location of hotel is the key selling point. Two blocks from grand central, times square, Bryant park and 5min from the Rockefeller complex.The negatives are only a couple. The hotel wireless service is extremely expensive at $10 a day. The business centre services were at a cost. Minor points perhaps but I found myself hanging out at the coffee places nearby to get some tourist information, bookings done.On the whole, i would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again!

My wife and I just arrived home from vacation in New York from October 1st-8th. We found that with this being our first trip to the city it was difficult to choose from the multitude of accomodation options available. We couldn't be more thankful for having chosen the Cassa. The location is ideal within only a short walk of Time Square and only steps from access to the Subway. I am an avid runner and was easily able to take the subway to Central Park for daily jogs. Our room (King Bed) was of good size and very clean/modern. The building is in very good condition overall and elevators are fast/efficient. The staff is the real treasure of the hotel. Front desk personel was continually helpful in providing direction and advice in terms of enjoying the city in addition to continually offering assistance with any accomodation questions/thoughts we might wish to discuss. Really, we didn't have any questions as the hotel was exceptional. Will definitely recommend the hotel to others and will quite possibly return.

Wow.....just got back from NYC and the Cassa was great! We stayed here based on other reviews and were not disappointed at all. Upon our arrival we were upgraded to a king bedroom without even asking. The king bedroom was spacious and the bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. My husband loved the large flat screen TV and I loved the bath amenities which smelled fantastic! The room was modern, which we loved and the bathroom shower was great with the rain shower fixture. The staff at the Cassa was extremely friendly and helpful (kudos to Rodger) and helped us out with everything from show reservations, restaurant recommendations, and printing out our boarding passes before we checked out. The location of the hotel couldn't be better right in the heart of Midtown and within walking distance to all the sites. We will definitely stay at the Cassa Hotel on our next trip to NYC and would recommend it without hesitation to friends and family.

It was our first visit to New York and booked at the Cassa after reading all of the wonderful reviews. Location was key for us and the Cassa definately wons us over as far as the location and friendly staff. We book through expedia which on gives single beds and we desperately needed a room with double beds. Well thanks to Henry we was able to get an upgrade to room with a double bed..thanks alot Henry!!! The hotel is only a 5 min walk away from time square which was awesome, it has numerous resturants and bars on the street next to the hotel, it has a car services that will pick up or transport the guest to the airpoirt for around $70 (con: the driver droved very fast and had us all fearing for our lives when transporting us for our 6:00 a.m. flight). There is a starbucks with free wifi directly acrossed the street(con: the hotel doesnt have free wifi). The is breakfast on the 10th floor(con: the breakfast isnt complimentary). Pros: room where standard, very clean, bathroom was great, very great location and i would definately recommend friends and family to stay there!Cons: no free wifi, no complimentary breakfast, and the driver needs to slow down when transported guest.

Very close to everything, still you're in a more quiet street. Not bothered by any noise. Ok sized room. Everything fresh and clean. We got a good offer on our stay, not sure it's the best choice if you pay full price.

We booked the Cassa at the last minute and were very pleased that we did, the room is not massive, however it is a very good size for New York City accomodation. The bathroom was a very good size too and very modern. We loved the fact that our friends were next door and there was a little alcove between our two front doors that we could both use as "ours". Fantastic idea. The location is fabulous with many shops and cafes right outside the door. We loved this place and will be back when next visiting New York. Also the staff are fabulous and very knowledgeable, and especially loved Kevin, we stayed for 4 nights, all good.

My wife and I travelled to new York for a five night stay and found this hotel that was central to Manhattan Island. Until we got there we didn't realise how good the location was for all the sites. Blocks away from Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Empire State, so most things were within walking distance, and for those that don't mind walking you could easily walk up and into Cental Park. On arrival the staff were very friendly and helped us to the room, giving us advise on how to get around and offered to help if we needed any information on anything. The room itself was a standard room and felt it was a good size compared to similar priced hotels in other cities we'd visited. The bed was really comfortable and the shower was brilliant and did a great job reviving you after a day pounding the streets of NYC.I would definitely stay here again due to the staff and the location.If I had to find a fault, I'd say maybe that there weren't enough draws in the room to put things in, but this isn't exactly earth shattering or going to affect your stay.On departure ey let us store our bags whilst doing last minute shopping and allowed us some space to sort out our cases before leaving. They also gave us the options on getting to the airport including which subway station would make it the easiest route back.

This is one of those hotels that is a diamond in the rough. It is under construction and has been taken over by someone who knows what they are doing..hopefully. Our room a junior suite was on the 5th floor facing a building and looking the the AC so we asked for another and at $450 a night I was hopeful we would get one.... After a few hours we were upgraded to the Cassa Suite which was a wonderful huge room with nice views, The staff was very impressive and the cleaning staff did an amazing job folding the clothes and truly cleaning the entire room. GREAT job Cassa! This hotel should be rated in the top 30 and with the new owners this will be one of the best places to stay in Times square...get it while it is still affordable because it will get expensive!

Stayed here in September for our 2 week holiday in New York. Our room was spacious(delux), clean, modern and had a very comfortable king sized bed . We found ALL of the staff friendly, polite and extremely helpful (and this was everytime we had contact with them- whether it was seeking help from the desk staff/concierge, with the doorman on our way out or meeting cleaning staff in the lift). We were on the 33rd floor, then the 25th floor and encountered no problems with the lift. Location is close to Times Square, 5th Avenue, Bryant Park and several subway stations. Only negative is paying for the internet but still highly recommend this hotel!

Before I even book a room at this hotel I called several in the area just to get a feel of the area. I was advise no more regular room available but she would take off 10% for a grand deluxe. She was very helpful and patient with me and my question. The rooms yes small.(but come on this is NY) but beautiful free cable come on. Everyone from the door man, made service front desk was excellent and gracious. I got what a paid for. Well defiantly recommend and return again.

We had the 'pleasure' of staying at the Cassa Hotel beginning of October 2012. The location is very good, but the room was tiny, and even more was the bed. It was absolutely impossible to sleep in a bed by two which is smaller than a queen size (in fact only 140cm wide). I complained at the check-in but was told by a fairly rude receptionist, that either I like it or I leave it. In any case I have to pay for it. Although I asked for a king size or double bed with my reservation, I was told, that they were out of kingsize, since there were only a few available anyway. Considering the price of the hotel - $ 381.00 plus ~ $ 60.00 tax, in total 440.00 per night - it was a very unpleasant and sleepless stay. Not to mention the ugly view on a very dirty courtyard, and the smalles wardrobe I have ever seen. The aircondition was fairyl week, but noisy. To open in window into the courtyard was even noisier. I wonder how hot summers must feel in these rooms...The other suff, except the lady receptionist were friendly and helpful.I have been to NY at least 35 times in my life, but never experienced a bed like this....

Since the bullet points in my title have been covered in other reviews, I'll be brief. The standard size rooms are the size of a closet. And if you are traveling as a couple, and are taller or larger than a small child, you probably won't fit in the double bed (for $380/nt)Fortunately, we were able to upgrade for an extra $35 to a larger room.

My fiancé and I stayed in this hotel from Friday to Monday this past weekend. We booked through , (where we got a very reasonable rate) and then called the hotel to see if we could request a king sized bed and to be up on a higher floor. Both of our requests were met and we had a fantastic room on the 25th floor. The staff were great and when we told the concierge we were heading to TKTS to get some tickets for a show that night, he told us he could get us the same price and get it all done for us right there. He found us a Great price and Great seats! All staff were super courteous and very accommodating. The rooms are small, but the space is used very well. Beds are extremely comfortable. The bathroom is gorgeous and spacious. The a/c unit is beside the bed which tended to wake me up when it would start in the early morning, but by the second day I was used to it. I would highly recommend this hotel!Thank you very much for making sure we had a fabulous stay!

We stayed in Hotel Cassa in August 2012 and had nothing but a fantastic experience. The staff were the most welcoming we have come across from the door man, to the reception staff, to the cleaners. We were always welcomed with a smile, and questions of whether there was anything they could help us with etc. It was just a lovely warm hotel. The hotel itself was spotless. So clean! Our room had everything we needed with plenty of space and the incredible bed was definitely a highlight! The location was perfect (a block away from Timesquare) and we were able to get cabs directly from the front door. I highly recommend Hotel Cassa. Thank you for a great stay!!!

There is nothing more you could ask for in a Hotel in New York City! My Husband and I stayed in this Hotel 24th Sept 12 - 29th Sept 12. We were on our honeymoon in which the hotel upgraded our room for free and gave us a free bottle of wine of our choice upon arrival. The rooms were spacious with plently of room for your shopping, in which we did lots of. Rooms were cleaned daily to a good standard. Staff were very helpful in anything you need. Very short distance from Times Square and 5th Avenue. Within walking distance of the Empire State Buliding & Macey in which my Husband and I walk on numerous occassions. Would go back to this hotel again very happy with the service and room. The bed were amazing just what you need after a long day of shopping.

First, the Pros: Great location! Close to Times Square, yet not right on top of all the throngs of people. In addition:most (though not all) of the front desk people were very friendly and helpful. I would particularly like to mention Alicia, who went above and beyond to help me get to my departing transportation on time when my ticket wouldn't print at the business center. I also found the hotel, including my room, to be very clean, and the housekeeping services were very good as well. And, the design of the room was very sleek and appealing.Now, the Cons: as other people have mentioned, the size of the room. My room was SMALL. Yes, it's New York City, etc. etc., but I have stayed in bigger rooms in nyc. Perhaps I was also influenced by the not so lovely view from my window, which included looking over a roof with building materials (that said, the hotel can't do anything about what transpires around it). I also found the room lacking in some basic things: a way to make coffee or tea, some basic information about the hotel services, or even a 'do not disturb' sign I could hang on my door would've been nice (and would have prevented numerous knocks on the door from the housekeeping services).

This was my wife and I first trip to New York and we stayed at Cassandra hotel September 26- 30 , 2012. This had to be one of the best hotels I have stayed in and the service was great. It is one block away from Times Square and one block away from 5th ave. perfect location from everything. We had to have the best concierge in New York named Eric. He was absolutely wonderful and planned everyday for us and made New York a wonderful workable experience. Don't look any where else stay at this hotel. Billy and Sonya

I usually do not write reviews, quite honestly I expect good service so when I get it its no big deal. I booked on Hotwire, awesome rate. I took my 16 year old daughter to NYC for her bday. I had a question so the night before we were to arrive, I called Cassa. During my conversation I mentioned my daughters 16th bday. I had called to request a room with two doubles,I was unaware that Hotwire books the cheapest room and that two doubles would be much more costly. On the phone they understood my situation and saud they would upgrade for free to a King room. Both of us would be sleeping in the same bed but its a King, not as bad right? I also requested an early check in, around noon. On our arrival, Sept 28th 2012, around noon, I was greeted and recognized by the same young lady I had spoken to, she promptly wished my daughter a happy birthday, I was quite surprised and pleased, she then informed me that she had me upgraded to a double twin, wow, thats def something Hotwire wouldnt have done even though they said on the phone they would. We went up to our room, 1608 and it was simply beautiful, clean and large for a NYC room, after a few minutes I noticed a hand written bday card to my daughter and a platter of assorted nuts and treats also two bottles of water. The card had a personal hand written message to her wishing her a happy 16th amoung other things. During our three night stay the staff was above exceptional. I felt at home and they were more than willing to answer and help in any way possible. The room was cleaned spotless everyday. The shower is to die for and Im not sure how they manage to get the water pressure they do but it was like standing in a waterfall. The location is great as well, Starbucks accross the street,,,3 blocks from Times Square,,15 minute walk from Central Park, one block from the subway to take you anywhere. We were even able to watch Dexter Sunday night in our room because Showtime was included on our large flatscreen,,,This place is a hidden gem. GMF

Newer hotel with contemporary design, very clean and helpful staff. Good room size for midtown location and block away from Time Square. Hotel should consider adding a coffee machine to ever room so that morning coffee is not a bit of a hassle. Overall, could not ask for better stay.

Helpful staff, clean decent size room for NYC, great location w/amazing selection of activities and food nearby. Five perfect days in the center of the action. No fancy lobby or in house quality restaurant, but plenty of others nearby.

Awesome location, just a block and a half from Times Square, couldn't have been better for our pre cruise two day stay! The lobby is small and the room also on the small side. However I am told that is a normal size room in Midtown Manhattan! Not a lot of amenities, but the staff could not have been more helpful and accommodating!

I spent four days in this hotel with my boyfriend. The hotel is in a very good location. Our room was clean but very very tiny and a bit dark. The staff was helpful . At the time we went there were doing some work but from the reviews we read it seems that has been going for quite sometime. I will stay there again because it is very central...

I almost do not want to write this review because more people will know about this hidden gem. The hotel is fantastic, the staff is friendly and really helpful. Location is excellent! People have complained about room size, but i think they haven't been in European hotels. I was expecting a really tiny room, but it was just perfect, you do not go to NYC to stay in your room. If I could name a bad thing, it would be the lack of the name of the hotel on top of he entrance. I think I walked three times in front of the hotel before I found it. My husband did the same thing. Compliments to the staff, it was my first visit to New York and I cannot wait to go back and stay in the Cassa hotel.

Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in August. It is an excellent hotel for sightseeing in NY, just a few blocks from Times Square (but no noise) and easily walking distance from Grand Central Station. Lots of restaurants and bars near by. So hard to choose a hotel in NY as there are so many but I will defintely choose Cassa on my next visit. The staff could not do enough for you, Eric, the Concierge was so helpful, have never stayed in a hotel where the staff are so willing to be of assistance. A special thank you to Eric for his help during our stay. The rooms were spotless (I am not easily pleased) and a good size in comparison to other cities, lovely fluffy bathrobes and slippers. It was our anniversary and the bottle of wine sent to us was such a personal touch. Excellent hotel, could not fault anything, except having to leave!

Stayed at cassa hotel 70 west 45th street September 2012 great location unlike other hotels in manhattan this one has really nice modern rooms spotless everyday service minutes from everywhere book it was the bes site to get a really good price down side no bar , breakfast bland and expensive but just steps from Starbucks and times square so plenty of eating places connleys bar just half a block away and all night deli across the street loved this hotel and will most deffinlty stay here again

I never really write reviews at all but I had to do this since it was such an awesome hotel, I just wanted to do it a little justice since the bad reviews if you look at the date are from 2 YEARS ago when the hotel was brand new and under construction ( it still is and looks brand new by the way, a major plus compared to other hotels in the area where I saw complaints of mouses even, not gonna name names haha) to the point.. Hubby and I were here from september 1 to the 8th, we took a red-eye from phx so we were in NY by 6am got to the hotel expecting to leave our luggage only cause we knew our check-in was at 3 pm not a problem but we were greeted with not only a room ready for us but a little bit of an upgrade to a queen-sized bed (again not expecting that cause we know what we paid for on priceline and we're not that kind of entitled people wanting to get everything for a buck). I cannot stress enough the quality of staff they have, everybody I wish I remembered their names ( I just remember the two Erics) they were phenomenal from helping with where to go eat, where to go etc. We just mentioned we where there for my birthday and there it was a bottle of wine waiting for me on my birthday after a loong day it really was appreciated.The room overall is beautiful, great bed, great bathroom, great tv.. If there is a rainy day there will be umbrellas waiting for you at the entrance of the hotel.If I say the location is beyond belief awesome that's an understatement, walk 1 block to the left... TIMES SQUARE, and near-by subway station gets you everywhere or doormen in the hotel wont hesitate in getting you a cab. When I come back to New York (and I will, cause one week is not even enough to see everything there is to see in this amazing city) I will surely stay here again, sometimes is best to pay a little bit more to get the entire experience.Keep up the good work!

This hotel is brilliant - its is modern, clean, comfortable, in a great location and all the staff were really friendly and very helpful. We stayed here for a week at the start of August and couldnt fault this place our room was small but had everything we needed and was very nice. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and will hopefully be back!

This hotel rocks! Love it! Modern, sophisticated, wonderful ambience, great position and above all, the staff are fantastic! Health Club wasn't available due to refurbishment; an alternative was available around the corner, but we didn't use it, so can't comment.

Just everything is right; perfect location for me - midtown close to my customers and food; friendly/helpful staff without pretense, genuinely like to help and want you to enjoy your stay; great accommodations - still in great shape, comfortable, modern, all the technology you need.What more can I say? If the price is right, this is my choice in Manhattan.

Friends and I stayed at Cassa this past weekend. We were referred by our travel agent, Magellan Vacations. The beauty of that group is that every single agent you speak with has stayed in each of the hotels that they recommend--cutting down on surprises and dissapointments.We found the hotel to be convenient, luxurious (for NYC) and the staff to be outstanding. We went to the US Open, Book of Mormon, and our share of tours, dinners and drinking outings. We were pleased to be spoken to at every turn by the staff and "Welcomed Back" no matter what the hour.I've heard there are changes in store for Cassa--with the restaurant opening and the lobby being re-imagined. Hopefully it will all be positive.Highly recommend this hotel!

We stayed 11 nights at Cassa and we couldn't be happier. Our stay was great, the location couldn't be better - pretty close to Times Square, theatres and subway, but yet away from all the buzz and agitation. The rooms are well kept,clean and not small for NY standards.The staff were always hepful and polite, offering great recommendations for restaurants.We would definitely recommend and stay again at Cassa without a doubt.

The moment we arrived at the front desk, the staff were friendly, courteous and interested in what they could do to make our stay comfortable. They asked what brought us to New York and when we told them it was our 30th Anniversary, we were immediatly upgraded and a bottle of wine was sent to our room. We were referred to the concierge for any questions regarding Broadway shows, tours, etc. The concierge was extremely helpful and offered many suggestions for us to get the most from our first visit to New York. We actually booked two Broadway shows through him. Best of all was the location. Only two blocks from Times Square!
user_name:
Kathy R
Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, Canada

review_body: Three couples in our group stayed at the Cassa Hotel during the Labor Day weekend in connection with our annual trip to the US Open. The check in process became quite problematic because only the names of the men were on the reservation and the women arrived first while the men were at the tennis tournament. Because of the hotel's security policy, they could not check in until we were called by our wives and then had to separately call the hotel to vouch for our wives. This was extremely inconvenient and could be avoided if the hotel instituted a policy that asked for this kind of information at the time a reservation is made.The hotel itself is very conveniently located and a beautiful property, though a bit stark in decor. Much construction is underway, leading to a rough impression for guests. The rooms are beautifully decorated and very serviceable, though the Internet service is not advertised as free but can be obtained without charge; quite confusing.Staff could not be more friendly and helpful, including the always present doormen and other personnel. We always felt welcomed and well cared for.Despite the points noted above, I would stay at this hotel again, and would expect that my comments would be taken as helpful and addressed effectively.

We were so excited to celebrate our first anniversary in NYC and our stay at the Cassa was outstanding! The location couldn't be better - close to theatre, subway, buses and lots of food! The rooms were clean and well appointed. But ALL the staff were fantastic! Always very friendly and welcoming and so helpful. They always took the time to answer our endless questions, helped us arrange tickets and made wonderful recommendations for sights, subways and adventures. The card and wine for our anniversary was such a very special surprise. Thank you for a memorable celebration in NYC!

Stayed 6 nights at this hotel. New hotel, very friendly and helpful staff, everything within walking distance. The only thing that could be better was the size of the room. They are small, but well laid out.

i actually did not get banged by the bed or the furniture. my husband and i could move around the room without running into each other. there was actually a large chair for comfortable reading and relaxing.

We stayed at the Cassa for 7 nights last week on a mother/son US Open adventure. I picked the hotel because of the great location to subways and Times Square. It was perfect for our trips via subway to watch tennis and to experience Times Square and Rockafeller Center. Bryant Park and Grand Central subway stops were a short walk and we utilized both. 45th Street was closed on the day of our departure, Brazil Day parade, so our shuttle had to pick us up on 5th. The front desk helped with this change and Emilio walked down the block with our bags and stood with us until our shuttle came.(late!!) He was very personable and patient. Our room was small but had everything we needed and housekeeping did an excellent job. All of the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Well done.

We had an incredible stay, great experience. Rooms are comfortable (we were in the standard room and it was OK, not extra large but rommy enough), beds are amazing and bathroom is spotless, big and comfortable, with a great shower, a real pleasure after a long day out. Could say that location is the best of this hotel, but the real deal is THE STAFF and service, it's outstanding!! They are the ones that make your stay an unforgettable experience. Would definetly stay there again and recommend to others.

We stayed at the Cassa for 5 days last week for a mother/daughter shopping trip. We loved the hotel and the staff. Eric on the front desk was wonderful. He was so busy but always had time for us and helped us get great seats for 2 shows....Sister Act and Once. The room was very lovely, modern and clean. We were wonderfully located on 45th between 5th and 6th and walked everywhere. Can't wait to return!

The Cassa is the perfect hotel for a stay in NYC. Centrally located (on 45th Street between 5th & 6th Avenue) it's ideal for a long weekend of shopping & sight seeing.The staff were excellant - always available to help with friendly greetings. Housekeeping was top standard. Rooms were large for NYC (we were in Executive rooms) and bathrooms were large for NYC.The restaurant wasn't opened at the time of our visit, so used the 10th floor terrace for a few drinks before heading out. The lack of a restaurant may be seen as an issue for some, but shouldn't be - your in NYC and there are places a plenty to eat & drink

A fine example of a contemporary innovative North American hotel in an ideal location on 45th St just East of 6th Avenue. Spick and span, shining with glass and steel on the exterior, the interior provides accomadation to match, albeit on a somewhat small scale, that is to say the rooms are rather cramped although beautifully equipped and exemplary in their neatness and cleanliness. They are ideal for a single businessmen, less so for a couple, but the saving grace is the terrific amount of surfaces that can serve as shelf space that frame the room. It looks as if the hotel is in the midst of an extension program, although this does not disrupt current services. At $170 per night midweek, this is very good value, in fact hard to beat in this much sought-after part of New York, and access to bus and subway are painlessly close.

My wife and I were guests for three days, and found the accommodations to be very comfortable. And without exception all employees were extremely cordial and helpful. Reasonable walking distance to Times Square and the Theatre District. A healthy stroll enabled us to enjoy wonderful meals at establishments on 9th Ave. Friendly pubs nearby also. Will definitely return to Cassa, and highly recommend their services.

We returned to New York City after 40 years to celebrate our 40th anniversary and the Cassa Hotel presented us a surprise bottle of champagne. Our primary reason for the trip was to enjoy seeing some Broadway shows and we did. We were there 4 days and saw 5 shows! The Cassa Hotel was within walking distance to Times Square and many of the theaters. The staff was very personable and helpful in recommending places to go. Eric, the conceriage, was wonderful in selecting shows to see and helping get good tickets.
