Our room was comfortable and spacious for us, although the lighting could have been better and we missed having access to an ice machine. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. We would recommend this to others."

We stayed on a Monday night at the Cassa Hotel, checking in around 3 pm, in time for the afternoon tapas and drinks on the 10th floor (limited selection and not cheap but really delicious food. We had the large outside terrace, overlooking 46th St, to ourselves). We booked via Quikbook.com and were supposed to get the smallest, cheapest room, but were upgraded at the front desk to a slightly larger room for the same price, which was nice (still only a full-sized bed). The hotel hallways are decorated in a chic dark-chocolate brown, with our hotel room echoing that—dark wood, crisp white linens/duvet, nice-sized new bathroom, great TV and fancy clock radio. Most importantly the small room was great for sleeping—very dark and quiet and cool on a steamy August evening. The hotel falls into the Euro hotel category (midtown, small, basic, lots of tourists) but was perfect for our needs, just under $200 for the night. Very well located for the theater district, Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, and many subways.

I checked in last Thursday for 7 nights... 3 to go. Am here in Manhattan from overseas for a business trip, arrived early in the morning and my room was ready for me to my relief after a long-distance overnight flight. So far staff have been courteous and polite, Roger was very helpful when he checked me in, and the room is very comfortable, great bed, plenty of space for me and wouldn't be a problem if I was travelling with a partner. NYC hotel rooms are generally small but I was pleasantly surprised by the room size here. The bathroom is great - love the shower! Plenty of closet space - I managed to unpack my entire suitcase without a problem. I chose the location for convenience for work rather than anything else but it's very central in general, subway close by, Starbucks, restaurants etc. And yet despite the centrality the room itself is very quiet (a few times I wondered if I'm alone on this floor?!) and no traffic noise from the street. Not a great view but I'm not here for the view so that doesn't bother me.My only comment would be that for an Executive traveller (I didn't make my booking but think I'm in an executive room - 2204) although the docking stations and outlets are very convenient, the desk size could be larger. I'm working with a laptop and iPad plus business documents, and the desk is very small and along with an armchair doesn't allow for the most comfortable working situation. I worked on the 10th floor a few times as the chair height was more comfortable and I could spread myself around a little. Perhaps if the desk area could be extended below the television set it would help. Also a small drawer with stationery accessories would be helpful (stapler, paper clips etc).Also a little disappointed the fitness centre not open. There is a complimentary pass to a gym around the corner but after a long day it's a bit of a pain to shlep around the corner and then back again all red and sweaty :-)My husband stays here on his business trips and I'm happy to report my expectations were well met :-)

My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Cassa in early August 2012 based on our son's recommendation from an earlier trip. The hotel is very well located on a quiet street but with quck and easy access to Times SQ,, 5th AVE, and other tourist sites. As other reviewers note, the staff is very friendly and it is obvious that they are well trained. The hotel is in a newer building - the rooms are adequate size by NYC standards and nicely furnished. There are only 8 rooms to a floor. We found the room clean, quiet and comfortable. The lobby is tiny - there is a breakfast lounge on the 10th floor with a TV and comfortable furniture to take a break in. The breakfast was expensive and we ate at one of the deli's located a few doors down which was great. - lot's of restaurants close by. The hotel did not offer self service ice, which was our only negative. We did not like having to order ice to be brought up to the room when we wanted some. We found this hotel competitively priced on Book-It.

Stayed here two nights with our 3 teenage kids and had a very good time. We had 2 rooms next to each other so it worked ouot well. We used the hotle as a central spot to explore the city and it was perfect. Excellent restaurants, Broadway shows and Times Square very close by. The staff were exceptional...friendly, helpful and cheery. Starbucks across the street, but a 20 minute wait in the morning...Ugg! Nice little park next door, so it's a nice place to sit, sip and read. The beds were excellent and comfortable.

We stayed in the Cassa for four nights on our first trip to NYC because we decided to splash out on a really nice hotel. The staff are all very lovely and very helpful, especially the doormen. We were very luckily upgraded to another room on arrival as well!The rooms are stunning, while ours didn't have much of a view it was a very comfortable room. Our bed was super comfortable with a great size bathroom and shower. Location wise it's very easy to get to Times Square and you can catch the subway around from there or walk to the places you really want to see. The only dissapointing part of it was the breakfast, which cost something like $60 for a very average tasting eggs and sausage on a stale bread roll. Also, the internet was very expensive to use in the room! I'd recommend staying here, definitely, but don't eat your meals here as they're really expensive and you can get such good food in New York elsewhere. For more travel tips you can check out my blog, just type littlegreybox (all one word) into google!

Great central location, with starbucks across the street, drug store for cold drinks around the corner...We used the bar fridge for our own drinks. The front desk and doormen were more than happy to assist in any way and very friendly. We had one minor issue in the bathroom that was resolved immediately. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to NYC. The only downside if I had to think of one, was that the closets were small, so we kept our suitcases in the room out out of the way.

stayed at thd Cassa for 3 nights, the hotel had a superb locaion, 5 minutes from times square, and 10 mins from Grand central.The rooms are small, booked a "superior room" for myself,partner and 12 yr old son, the room and bed was too small so had to upgrade to a deluxe room where we had a king size bed, but the room wasn't that much bigger. The upgrade was quoted at $85 dollars a night, but eventually agreed $50 a night.The staff on front desk were very friendly, although the doormen, porters looked more like bouncers at a night club.Would use the hotel again, just on the location value, but check your rate and room size, superior dosen't mean that.

When we arrived 45th street was closed due to a street market ! We were a little upset but the Concerge, Eric, made us feel comfortable and cared for as we checked in...also Eric gave us great tour, theatre and restaurant suggestions!! Thanks to all....Rowen, Kevin and housekeeping, great job!

We stayed here three nights in August 2012. The staff were friendly and approachable, and the room was far nicer than we expected for such a central and well-priced location. Wardrobe hanging space is limited (as we expected for NY), but there's shelf space over the bed head and really it's very easy to keep your non-nice clothes in a suitcase. Everything was spotlessly clean, and the rooms are stylish. The bathrooms are lovely, with great showers. Our room (2402) was very quiet. It's a skinny hotel and there are very few rooms per floor. We didn't try out the breakfast/dining area on floor 10, but they're building a BLT outlet at the ground floor. There's a Pret a Manger next door and also round the corner on 6th Avenue, and a Starbucks right opposite. Duane Reade 24 hr supermarket is just 2 minutes' walk round the corner, and MacDonalds is just 5 minutes' walk away, on 6th Avenue. Wells Fargo Bank is almost next door, and Radio City Music Hall and Rockafeller Centre/subway station are 5 minutes' walk away. Times Square is 8-10 minutes' walk. Special mention for Eric the Conceiliege Manager, who was extremely helpful.

Several times a year we stay in midtown/times sq. to visit family but this was our first experience at the Cassa Hotel. We found a (weekend) deal on the Hotel Tonight app and booked 2 rooms, both of which were upgraded. Arta at the front desk was a pleasure, especially after a long trip. Helpful & kind with a smile, she accomodated our family early in the day and without hesitation. The beds were divine and the bathrooms were spotless. On our last day, Nari & Alicia were attentive to assist with our final arrangements. A 'welcome back' with a smile from Emilio at the door and offers for valet assistance was just the right touch. We will return to the Cassa Hotel.

NYC was our "highlight" in terms of desired locations for the honeymoon, and when we booked this new and "boutique" hotel, we didn't really know where it was or how good it is - it was our first time in NYC. We were absolutely blown away with the high level of service and attentiveness of the staff. After the disdain of our European hotels in Spain, France and Croatia, this was such a welcome change! The location is excellent for a tourist (and I assume business since it's in the middle of the business area) and the room was excellent. Both of us have travelled a lot for business and I have to highlight that the bed, pillows and quality of the linen was one of the best we've experienced!Cannot recommend highly enough and I know we will be back at this hotel.

We have stayed at many different hotels in New York. This was definately the best value for this great a room. We were so pleasantly surprised to get to our room which was large, extremely well appointed and located in the heart of the theater district. It is close to the subway line and certianly an easy walk to Grand Central Station and many of the New York museums. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. We interacted with at least five different people and each one was top notch.

I stayed at the Cassa on a recent overnight in New York for business. Though I hate the neighborhood for its noise, crowding, and dirtiness, it's really the most convenient place to be if you have business on the West Side. I was upgraded from a queen room (for which I paid $279+tax on Expedia) to a king room. Even the king room was quite small, with a half closet and a tiny work desk, so it's hard to imagine how tiny the queen room would be. My room would not have been comfortable for two people but it was perfectly fine for one. And the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was clean and nice.There does not seem to be free wireless in the guest rooms, though there is in the common rooms of the hotel. As I started to call the desk to ask about wireless I realized that I could use the free wireless of the Algonquin hotel, which is directly behind the Cassa, since my room was on the back of the hotel. And speaking of the room location, being on the back meant it was very quiet, and the height of the hotel compared to the buildings around it meant that it also had good natural light.I realize as I write this that I don't have anything terribly positive or negative to say about this hotel. It's hard to imagine raving about it, but it was quite comfortable, the staff was friendly, and sine I got a good rate, it was certainly worth it. In a neighborhood where you are paying for the location more than the room, I think this hotel is a good value.
user_name:
TripsPlease
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Recently stayed with Cassa New York, superb location, one block from Times square, excellent value for money,rooms gorgeously appointed, but the staff are what make this Hotel outstanding. So friendly, genuinely happy and eager to please. Knowledgeable, courteous and allround fantastic. Hotel is nearly completed with new brasserie due to open soon which will be a great bonus to have! Will definitley stay again!

Location - superb. 10-15 min walk to Times Square, 5th Ave. (shopping), Broadway shows. 25+ min walk to Central Park. 10 min walk to subway. Location couldn't have been better.Rooms - Small! We had 2 different rooms. The first room we had was super tiny. Just enough room to walk around the bed and so little room for storage, we had settled into putting our clothes on the bottom shelf in the bathroom vanity. (there was no room anywhere else, they should figure out some storage for guests who are there more than 1 night). We moved into a 2-double beds room (hubby and I) and ended up with a room about twice in size, #1708.Beds - very comfy. Major problem though. We booked a king bed and when we settled down to lay in bed in our first room, we realized the king was actually a queen. We had paid substantially more to specifically get a room with a king and not a queen, and when we called down to let them know the error, we ended up getting back-talk, and a very rude "manager" on the phone to us, telling us that we were wrong and that he wouldn't help us. After an hour's worth of having people in our room, and arguing, (tired from our long day this is the last thing you want to be doing), we told them we will be leaving tomorrow and staying somewhere else for our next 5 days of NYC. The Manager again with a rude tone told us "good luck finding somewhere else to stay!" My husband hung up on him. All we wanted was what we paid for, a king bed so that we would get a good night's sleep. We kept telling him this but no co-operation from him.I started to call (on cell phone) around for a room somewhere else, when the manager called our room and apologized and said he would give us one of the rooms that had 2 double beds. We were so relieved to know that at least if we can't get a king, we can get some sleep in 2 doubles.I was really expecting to have such a great stay here. I am so disappointed with how the staff handled this. All we wanted was our king bed like we had paid for.Minibar - they have a minibar and I asked if I could put milk in the minibar as I need my fibre in the mornings (cereal) and they even gave me a hard time about that saying it will cost me $30 just to take some things out of the fridge.. After some arguing they allowed me to do so without charging me.Amenities - a few doors down there is a pharmacy / convenience store, so super convenient.Other staff - wonderful, opening the doors for you, and setting up limo times etc. The fellow who moved us from room to room to room was super.Smoke - very strange, the hotel rooms almost always smelled of smoke. Every time we came back to our room, I could smell smoke but also something of an air freshener trying to cover it up.. We found it bizarre.. but didn't complain as we felt we could handle the smell and our priority was getting some sleep.On an aside, sites we would suggest seeing:9/11 memorial was our favourite stop, statue of liberty, (we saw both of these from the water taxi which was a great deal and we would do the water taxi again), a broadway show (go to TKTS which is in the middle of times square) and get your tickets the same day of the show for 40-50% off. Awesome! We saw The Best Man and it was great. Also you need to try dinner at Ruth's Chris, which was amazing. "The view" restaurant (with revolving floor) was overrated. The Empire State Building was great, going to the top. Soho was nice. Shopping on 5th Ave., a must. Central park is huge and a must see. The cabs sit in traffic a lot so you're better walking if you can handle it. We took the subway a couple of times, and they are very efficient but quite dirty. NYC is super fast paced, you need good walking shoes, there is a tonne to see and do.

I got a promotional price so it was a phenominal value. Great location, loved the decor and everything about this hotel. Very modern and clean. Loved that there were a variety of lighting options and the lights were on dimmers. The shower and bathroom was my favorite. It was light, bright and clean. The waterfall showerhead in the shower and lighted mirror (which didn't fog up) were impressive. I only stayed one night at the beginning and end of my trip so I didn't have to unpack. Storage was a little lacking but it wasn't an issue for me. I thought the room by New York standards was perfect. I've stayed in smaller spaces. The upgrade to a queen room was a unexpected perk. The one room was right by the elevator which I thought might be a problem, but I didn't hear a thing. There is a Starbucks right across the street which was convenient. Couldn't have asked for a nicer stay!

I stay for business in the area frequently and I have found Cassa to be the best value and stay overall. The staff was friendly AND extremely helpful, the room was clean and the largest room for the money in the area. Cassa will be my go to hotel the next time I need to stay in the area.I agree with other reviewers that the staff are REALLY great - friendly and helpful! You are not "just paying for the location" when you stay at Cassa, you are getting a nice hotel as well.

everything about my stay at this hotel was positive. My husband and I stayed for 6nights and will stay again! I work in customer service, so i have high expectations no matter where I go. Cassa Hotel did not disappoint. The staff were friendly and courtesous, always smiling and saying hello. They were informative and always had suggestions when asked for advice. Arta was who checked us in and she was just fantastic. So helpful and provided us with printouts of restaurants, nightclubs, directions etc. the room was always tidied nicely by the housekeeping staff and it was very clean to begin with. Great decor, very stylish and modern. I can't say enough good things, this hotel is highly recommended. Also it is very close to the subway system and walking distance to times square (however the rooms are extremely quiet!)

Everything about the Cassa Hotel and Residences is delightful. It is the PERFECT hotel in the PERFECT location for any NYC trip! Its chic, modern decor is eye catching and welcoming. The staff is AMAZING! In fact, I would even say that this is the best Hotel staff I have EVER encountered. I would be remiss not mention some of them by name. Gabriel, Eloy, and Arta were consummately professional and friendly in every experience I had with them. My wife and particularly enjoyed how much Eloy talked to us and got to know us, taking an active interest in all our of New York adventures. We stayed in 2107, one of their Executive (1 King Bed) rooms, and it was posh all around. The pillows, bed, and down comforter were perfect in every way. In fact, sleeping on my own bed again, I miss the one in NYC! The room also had individual A/C controls which was a very nice feature. The TV was nice. The bathroom and provided toiletries were divine. If you're worried about noise, you don't have much to fear. It is relatively quiet at the hotel. Our room faced W 45th Street, and once the sun goes down, that street gets pretty quiet, so all was well there. My wife and I look forward to staying at the Cassa again.

We stayed here for 6 days at the beginning of July. After reading hundreds of hotel reviews I still wasn't sure what the best location was to stay in during our first visit to New York. Opinions were divided between "close to Times Square" and "as far as possible from Times Square" I eventually chose the Cassa Hotel because of its location close to the Square and I have absolutely no regrets. It's a short walk away from Times Square but you are not distracted by the noise, hustle & bustle associated with Times Square. It's also very centrally located close to all the major retail and boutique shops and after having visited the other neighbourhoods of Manhattan, I'm still glad we chose Cassa.We had a basic King bedroom which was more than sufficient. The room was rather large by NY standards and extremely clean. The hotel offers free in its Terrace dining area and 24-hr business centre which was more than sufficient for our needs. I should also mention that we received great advice and assistance from the Concierge on duty – Eric.
user_location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
user_name:
Cameron B
Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights, July 2012. When searching for hotels and finding this one, we couldn't believe how nice it looked for the price. We kept checking reviews until our own visit and no one seemed to have a bad word to say about it.. Always a good sign!On arrival at approx 2pm, our room wasn't ready.. We were told it would be about an hour. No problem at all, they took our bags and we did a bit of shopping at Times Square which is just 2 blocks away. On our return we had been upgraded to an Executive Room on the 25th floor. The room was a great size, not just for New York, but generally, a generous size.. The beds are so comfortable too, which is always a potential issue, but not a problem in this case.The room (2505) was very tastefully decorated and was just perfect for us. The bathroom was beautiful, with a large walk in shower, fab lighting and beautiful fittings etc ( I would like it recreating at home when we change our bathroom!!) The staff are so helpful and really cant do enough for you. Easy to chat to and quick to assist with any questions/issues regarding the hotel facilities or whats out and about around the city.We didn't take breakfast in the hotel, but there is a great little diner across the road which we couldn't fault at all (Manhattan Cafe). There is also a Starbucks across the road which is very handy too when you need a caffeine fix!!We had a couple of days of rain during our visit and made use of the complimentary umbrellas made available to guests ( great touch!).On our last day, I really didn't want to leave.. There will be NO searching the next time we visit New York, as we've found all we need in Cassa!!We came back early from shopping/sightseeing one afternoon to have a drink in the bar, and that was the ONLY negative really.. There wasn't a lot of choice to drink (just consisted of a small table with a few bottles on), no crisps/nuts available (to buy or complimentary) and the tapas available was actually only a choice of two! Such a shame, as its such a great area, I feel so much more could be made of it.. There is also a business centre, where you are able to print off boarding passes for free should you need to, or pay as you go internet if you need to stay in touch with the rest of the world.. To summarise... Fab location.... Great Decor.... Helpful, professional staff... Kept very clean by housekeeping staff... Couldn't ask for moreWe will definitely return... I cant wait!

Stayed here for a quick business trip back in June. Hotel Lobby was very modern and almost too modern, its initial appearance does not exactly look lux or high end, just sterile and cold. The Hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful made some great recommendation for lunch. The room itself was very very small, yet was to be expected considering the area. The modern accouterments in the room were confusing to operate and kind of just awkwardly placed. View was of course bland, and not too picturesque, considering all I saw was an incredibly derelict building under construction. Bathroom was a lovely area where the lighting and attention to detail were clearly evident. Would have liked it if the rooftop or terrace they had would have been actually open after meetings. Decent Hotel, great staff, wonderful location. All, in all, pretty good.

This hotel is in a prime location. The pricing is great, for what you get. The rooms are very large, with a comfortable bed, nice bathroom with a beautiful shower, nice flat screen tv, an ipod dock - pretty much anything you would need during your stay. I was surprised at how quiet it was, especially being so close to Times Square. There are good restaurants in the area, everything is in walking distance, and the staff is amazing. I would definitely recommend to stay here to any of my family or friends!

I stayed in this hotel in June of this year. The hotel is located in the heart of mid-town, two o tree block close to subway stations and walking distance from times square and grand central station. The room is bigger than average Manhattan rooms and bath room is a plus. Room design is contemporary few elements but with great taste creating a very pleasant atmosphere and as mentioned before the bed is very comfortable. On the down side the desk / table is quite small and difficult to work if you are on a business trip and the sound dock station is not friendly to use. Staff is very kind and helpful. Breakfast is great, quality of the food and the service is amazing although an additional restaurant / bar is needed. In my next visit to NY definitely will consider this place to stay.

We got a great deal on this hotel, was everything we expected from the pictures and more. The staff definitely made top of the list in friendliness, helpfulness and overall welcoming attitude. They are on the right track with all the little details, umbrellas for rainy days, maps as well as advice on what to see, I especially liked the "welcome back" at the end of each excursion. The location couldn't be better, we walked to almost everything. The rooms were small (typical in NY) but very clean and luxurious. If we ever get back to NY we will stay here again and we don't usually say that, there being so many places to see. For great food try the Cock and Bull just down from the hotel. The staff are incredible topped only by the food. The owner came by the table to welcome us and thank us for coming. You have to try the Chicken Pot Pie, it's the best I've ever had. Make sure you're hungry, the portions are huge. Pairing this pub with the Cassa hotel will make for a fantastic stay.

This is a great location to work the city from. The hotel is new and so everything is fresh & clean. The staff is very nice and helpful. The bed is very comfy. The restaurant has not opened yet due to some ventilation issues but isn't really a problem since there are lots of good eats in the neighborhood and the drug store is right around the corner for water and treats. The terrace bar on the 10th floor is super and a nice space to relax even though there really isn't a view. It's a cool hideaway in a convenient part of Midtown.

I booked this hotel after finding it at a great rate on TravelZoo. I can't believe what an awesome hotel this is. I kept saying over and over "I can't believe we're staying at such a nice hotel!" I never expected to say in such luxe accomodations in expensive NYC. The hotel is posh and hip. The bathrooms are amazing and have the rainfall showerheads. The bath products supplied are very nice. The beds were really comfortable and the A/C was nice and cool after the hot summer days. The room had all the finishing touches you expect in an upscale place. The staff were always there with smiles or opening the door for us as we left. The location is top notch -- one block away from Times Square and within a short walk from Rockefeller Center and Central Park. I can't rave about this place enough!

We got an awesome deal from TravelZoo. Our first time in NY and were always greeted when we left the hotel and returned! If we had rate the staff from 1 to 10, we would say it was a 12! They have so much "Aloha" spirit! Extremely helpful and even gave us instructions to get to Peter Luger's via subway when not a single taxi would take us to Brooklyn at 4 in the afternoon! It's in a great location! Yes, the rooms are clean and minimalistic, but you don't need much when you're exploring this awesome city. Thank you Cassa NY for our BEST stay at a hotel! You guys ROCK!

Stayed here 3 nights when we went to see "Harvey" on Broadway. Hotel is in excellent location - only a few blocks or less from most theaters and TKTS booth is 1.5 block away. Our room was upgraded upon arrival - very clean, very large bathroom and shower. Had the best bed and pillows ever! Large LCD television. Do visit the 10th floor lounge. Wi-FI is free in the lounge, indoor or outdoor seating. Breakfast is served here. Try the Vanilla and Rum Brioche French Toast..to die for!! Airline boarding passes can be printed free in the business center. We got an excellent package with air when we booked at BookIt.

Got a GREAT rate from TravelZoo. Too hard to pass up. I travel to NY very often and this was the first time I stayed here. I will absolutely stay here again. Great location! Great staff! So convenient to everything.Yes, the room is small, but how often do you stay in your room when in this great city?!?I look forward to coming back to this hotel in the future.

My husband and I stayed at this very nice boutique hotel in the heart of Manhattan for three nights and we were very pleased. The staff make you feel very welcome from the moment you check in until you leave. Always welcoming us back at the end of our day and very helpful with information on NYC and hailing us a taxi (not easy on a Friday night at 6:30). As a travel agent I would recommend this hotel for it's cleanliness, friendliness, location and value. I will stay here again on my next visit to the city.

I got a deal on this hotel through Travelzoo. Had never been or heard of, but decided to try based on website. It was honestly the BEST place I've stayed at. Everything was excellent. Easy/speedy check in/out, friendly/helpful staff, room was right size & very modern/clean. Only a couple blocks from Times Square, so location was incredible. We have decided that when ever we travel to NYC, we will definitely be staying here. 100% recommend.
I had travel zoo coupon and booked this place, it's very nice and clean. The location is convenient too. Decent place to stay in NYC.

This has to be one of the best hotels we have stayed. Best staff ever. They didn't hesitate with valuable info on where to eat and how to get places. The room was great. Will definitely stay here again.

Cassa staff were the friendliest we have run across even at other boutique hotels such as the Distrikt. They were not just polite but extremely helpful and seemed genuinely friendly which is a small miracle for NY! We loved our entire stay but really can't say enough about how much of difference staff can make. Congrats to Cassa. Our room was very clean, well appointed and wonderfully quiet for the city. We stayed on the 17th floor in a queen room which offered a very large bath. Beds were comfortable and pillows great. The small things really stood out such as dimmers on the bathroom/hall lights that could double for nights lights and a great sounding radio/alarm that also offered dim lighting. We called for ice which was delivered promptly. We visited the small 10th floor lounge for breakfast and again were pleasantly surprised. The service was great and food very well prepared. We would definiately not hestiate to return and the location could not be better.

My husband and I stayed at the Cassa during our recent celebration of our 30th anniversary. We arrived three hours early and asked the front desk if they could hold our bags until check-in. The very friendly staff checked our reservation and generously checked us in to an upgraded room since we were celebrating, and they had a bottle of nice wine sent to the room. The room was nicely appointed and very comfortable. The bed and linens were great, and the shower was wonderful. We also enjoyed the other amenities in the room. As we came and went, we were always greeted by the very friendly and helpful doormen. We are grateful that the Cassa Hotel provided us such a fabulous stay in NYC for our special celebration. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

My wife and I stayed 6 nights in this hotel. The front desk employees were friendly; but cannot deliver. On our 3rd night, we noticed bad smell from the washroom. Informed the front desk the next morning and was told that they will send a technician to fix it. Came back in the evening and smell was still there. Informed the front desk and 15 minutes later a technician came. He told me there was a leak in the toilet bowl and he fixed it. The bad odour returned in the middle of the night.The next morning we requested to change room. Front desk staff agreed and asked us to pack our luggages and their staff will transfer our luggages to another room. We went out after.We came back in the evening and checked with front desk. What we were told was there was no arrangement for another room for us and our luggages were still in that smelly room.We got transfered to another room half hour later.I travelled around the world and this is the worst customer service I received. They smiled at you, they greeted you; but when something went wrong - they cannot fix for you.

This modern hotel is very conveniently located between Times Square and 5th avenue. Like most New York hotels the rooms are not overly spacious but this one was larger than average and it never felt cramped. The built in closet cabinet provided more than enough room to keep our things out of the way and the bathroom had a small counter and mirror opposite the sink providing extra space for toiletries. The shower was fantastic. The service was also first rate. Check in was quick and they cheerily provided us with directions to a few of the spots we wanted to visit. They asked if we were celebrating anything special and when we said we were, they sent a very nice bottle of wine to the room and a few days later, on Mother's Day, they were handing out roses. We've been to New York several times and this was definately one of our favoriites.
A great place to stay for our 3 night stay in NYC. The staff was superb and housekeeping exceptional. The park across from the hotel was perfect for our Starbucks.

A new, well-designed, and very comfortable hotel convenient to Theatres, Grand Central and numerous restaurants. Nice amenities. Staff was very responsive and helpful. A few blocks to Grand Central making it easy to get around. Bed was most comfortable and rooms are very quiet. Would definitely stay there again and am pleased to recommend.

Its hard to believe that this hotel is in its infancy when the quality of service and hospitality that they offer is up there with those in the business who have been at it for tens of years.Firstly its location, literally a five minute walk from Time Square, which in itself is fantastic. Coupled with the fact that all major subway routes run through Time Square means that you are situated in the ideal location to get anywhere in Manhattan within 30 minutes or so.Secondly the room. Spotless, spacious, with a shower big enough to hold a party in, and a TV large enough to put a cinema out of business, you simply couldn't ask for more. Room service looked after the room at least once a day, and the housekeepers did a fantastic job. After they had been the room looked just as clean and tidy as the day we checked in! Inside the room was of course the obligatory minibar, however included were use of a complementary travel adaptor and umbrella, a very nice touch.Thirdly and finally the staff, there are no words to put on paper how helpful and professional they were. Whether it was recommending a particular restaurant, or in my case giving me direction to the best vantage point to take photographs of the skyline, the staff were there. They even offered to flag down taxis on our behalf so that we could remain inside out of the rain.Overall, would I stay again, YES I WOULD. Checking out was a solum experience as I wasn't just leaving behind hotel staff, but new friends.

Can't rate this hotel highly enough. The staff are always very helpful and friendly (happily giving directions, tickets to a show or advice on the best form of transport to a certain area).It is a 1minute walk from times square and very central.The rooms are clean and very modern, bathrooms are really nice as well.Only criticism (very minor) is that there is no coffee in the room, but with a starbucks across the road and a pret a manger next door, coffee is near by.

We spent 3 nights at Cassa in June and we had a lovely experience. Everyone at the hotel was very nice from the front desk to the housekeeping to the engineer! The location was great for being near the theater district and times square. We were also very close to multiple subway lines. I was traveling with my son, husband, parents, and brother. The hotel was accommodating to all ages. The room was great. Everything was spotless including the bathroom. The shower seemed brand new with a rain shower head and sparkling glass doors (no icky shower curtains here.) We did think the towels could have been thicker and fluffier. The bed was super comfy and we slept great. We were on both the 24 and 15th floor and no issues with street noise. Our only issue was our AC. We were in NY during a heat wave and our AC broke twice. Frank the engineer came to our room immediately to work on it. It was fixed before we went to sleep and it was nice and cool, but when we woke up it was 82 degrees. We switched rooms that afternoon. We would definitely return to Cassa in the future.

We spent our honeymoon in NYC and were looking for a comfortable location. We choose Cassa Hotel because of the bigger rooms, design and location near to the 5th street. We are impressed: The rooms are very comfortable. The staff is always arund you to make sure that the stay is perfect. After we were checked in into a smaller room than we book via booking.com we recieved an ice cold bottle of prosecco and a room upgrade for the rest of the stay. Nice enought - but the communication of the staff was perfect (Yes - it's you, Henry). They made us feel like VIPs. We became aware that there is no better location for your NYC 'base camp'. Near to 5th street, Time square and many good locations to have breakfast (pret a manger or milk&honey)/dinner(bond45). For the next stay Cassa Hotel wil be our 1st choice.

We just spent an overnight stay At Cassa. What a delightful experience! We were celebrating our anniversary with a weekend trip to the Big Apple. First of all you can't beat the location. They are two blocks up from the heart of the theater area and two blocks to the subway. From the moment we entered the hotel we were impressed. There is not much of a lobby, but that didn't matter. At check in we were assisted by Eric.He exemplified great hospitality training. The room assigned us was not ready, but he found another room so we could check in. He then pleased and surprised us by asking if we prefer red or white wine and what time we would like it delivered to our room. He also assigned us a room that was larger than some of the other rooms in the hotel. The room was lovely with high quality lines and towels. It had a large flat screen TV and excellent sound system. The bath room was modern and elegant. Loved the shower! The room was nice and quite. Hope we can plan another weekend get away in the near future. This would be the place we would stay.

I booked this hotel purely on location and recommendations from TripAdvisor (and of course price). It was a great choice overall. The location can't be beat: 2 blocks from Times Square where all the action is without the noise of the area, and just a minute walk from 5th Avenue. The staff are very friendly (took time to guide us through maps and spots to eat) and helpful. I initially booked a Deluxe Queen Room but even though it was about 30 square meters the layout was not great and felt small. Plus it was at the back of the hotel which offered no view at all except some old buildings. I upgraded immediately to an Executive King Room, where the layout was much better, almost 40 square meters in area and positioned at the front of the hotel with great views for only 35 Dollars a day more. Well worth it. The hotel is newly renovated, bathrooms are very clean, bed was a very comfortable queen size.Although I am very happy with the hotel and I recommend it anyone, there were some issues with it:- There is negligible closet space with just a couple of hangers. They were quick to bring us more hangers but with two people in the room it gets tricky trying to fit your clothes in that small space.- They left only one small bottle of shampoo/body wash every day. For people like myself and my wife who like to take at least 2 showers each day, you quickly run out of the stuff.- There is wi-fi offered in the room for a fee and works great. However, it's better to sign up with the front desk for it and get an access code instead of trying to do yourself over their web interface. Insist on getting your access code, so that you can hook up all your devices with a single daily subscription. Some of the staff seemed unaware of this, and informed me that I needed a separate daily subscription for each of my devices. This is not true, and to their credit you can connect more than one device per subscription. Just ask for your access code.- The air-conditioning unit behind a panel on the wall was very noisy and we had to turn it off to be able to sleep.

Cassa Hotel is in a perfect location about 2 blocks from Times Square. My Deluxe King room was spacious and beautifully decorated. I'd rate the hotel a 5 if there was more storage space. There was no dresser and the only drawers were one small one on each bedside table and the closet was only about 3 feet wide. The hotel recently went through renovation and the restaurant isn't yet open, but there are numerous restaurants and bars within steps. I'd highly recommend this hotel for the location, service and room size and intend to stay again during my next visit.
user_name:
Gigi F
Naples, Florida, United States

review_body: I stayed at the Cassa with my wife over a long weekend. Since we were travelling separately, they were kind enough to allow her into the room before I reached the city. Service in general was very good at the hotel by all staff, who seemed genuinely interested in helping guests.The room was not large, but was comfortable and a fully appointed bathroom with appropriate tiletries. Street noise was barely audible on the 25th floor.The location, however, cannot be understated at the price we paid for the room. It is located in 45th Street in midtown Manhattan, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues, almos at the corner of Sixth Avenue. There are amenities everywhere around the hotel, whether it be shops, restaurants, pharmacies, or anything that one may need.

Stayed here in April for a week, and had 5* service. Had requested a room near the lounge as I was traveling with an infant, and wanted to be able to use a baby monitor to keep track of the infant while I was able to meet friends from NYC. The hotel wasn't able to meet the request, as there were no rooms in the price range, but was able to upgrade me to a suite so we could entertain in our room. This made a huge difference in our stay, and I would definitely choose this hotel again when traveling to NYC.

We found this gem online and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel has very few amenities, however the rooms are way above average for the price in NYC and the location, for theatre goers is excellent. My only complaint, and its a small one, is that the access to wireless is expensive and confusing. A word to the wise, if this is important - negotiate this into your rate if you can. The way the system is configured, you have to pay a fee for every device you want to hook up. The staff were very friendly and very helpful. I highly recommend this as an option to the big name hotels in the area. We'll be back.

My experience at the Cassa Hotel was amazing. I mean words almost can't describe my experience - I feel as though I have bragged about this hotel for weeks now but my experience was just that grand. From the time I arrived at almost 10:30pm I was greeted immediately by the doorman who assisted me with my bags and met me at the cab door with an umbrella. The ladies at the front desk checked me in rapidly and suggested places to eat that were still open, delivered, and what they specialized in. I accidentally left my phone in the cab - careless and rushing - and they tracked down the cab recovered my cellphone. That set the precedence for the remainder of my trip. My bedroom - although dimly lit like every boutique hotel in NYC - was a nice size with great features like the iPod alarm dock, flat screen and wifi. The bedding was amazing, it was exactly what I needed after a long day of walking city blocks and being in business meetings all day. It was fresh and rejuvenating. My room was quiet and relaxing had nice views of the city. The shower amenities were nice and I enjoyed the infinity shower with the option hand-held shower attachment. I mean I feel as though this hotel thought of everything - even when they didn't have a gym available due to renovations they offered guests an addition option for the gym a block away. I can honestly say that I can't wait to stay again - and believe me I will be back.
We spent 5 nights at the Cassa. I was very impressed with the hotel. Staff is friendly, the room was confortable and the location was the best. I will definitely come back.

Great stay at a very good hotel, the staff were excellent, all very friendly and helpful and made some excellent suggestions. Great location, clean rooms, finished to a high spec even if a tad small with little room for storage.

My husband and I just spent 4 wonderful nights at the Cassa and we hated to leave. Everything from the fact that our room was ready for us when we arrived at 9:30 am to the fact that the room was spotless made our stay almost perfect. The beds were amazing (the pillows a little too soft) and it was very quiet for relaxing after a long day exploring this awesome city. The staff was terrific, very helpful and friendly but not fake, they genuinely seemed to like their jobs and were happy to assist us. We visit NYC at least twice a year and this is by far the best location we have stayed, so close to everything. The only thing that could improve this hotel would be internet access (they charge $10.00 per day) and coffee in the rooms. We will return!

First of, I am reviewing the residential part of the hotel. It was for a 1 bedroom with king size bed and 2 queen size murphy beds in the living room. It was perfect for us as there were 4 in our group.The staff (from the concierge, the bell men, the door men) were helpful and courteous and always smiling. The place clean. The location is between 5th Ave where all the shops are and Times Square (2 blocks). We easily walked to Central Park (15 blocks). Everything is relatively close including the subways.We will definitely stay here again.

Upon checking in, the front desk staff noticed that we had a Pack N Play for our baby and immediately moved us at no extra charge to a bigger sized room, because she knew there wouldn't be space enough for it in our originally booked room (we were so thankful!). The room was clean, cool, and had view of the busy city below but was quiet. Bathroom was very clean and the spacious shower was wonderful. Bed was comfortably soft but firm enough for back support. When we had trouble turning off our A/C an engineer was promptly sent up to our room to show us how to operate it. Courteous staff throughout the entire stay and at check-out as well. We were also able to check-in early due to room availability. Excellent location. Everything we could ask for in a hotel and more! Will definitely want to stay here again for our next NYC trip.

I stayed here this weekend with my husband and parents-in-law and I loved it so much!First, it's in an excellent location. Perfect, really. Close to everything but not noisy. And, it's clean! From the lobby to our rooms, everything was clean and crisp. Modern, but not uppity modern. Just nice.The rooms are small, but the bathrooms and showers are nice and big, and the rooms really aren't lacking anything but size. Comfortable chairs, large TV, a bed so comfortable that the only way I could drag myself out of it was to think about getting in the shower. Large stall, great water pressure, and a giant shower head that felt like a simultaneous head and neck massage. Wasting water to take the longest shower ever never felt so good. If we had spent the whole weekend in the room, I would have been happy switching between napping and showering. The view was nothing fancy, and the AC really wasn't strong enough, but both of those thing were really so tiny in comparison to the awesomeness of everything else, I couldn't remove a star (or a circle!).And the staff! They were so nice and helpful, they really worked to make us all feel welcome and to help us however they could. Amazing. They were the nicest staff of any hotel I've ever stayed at in my entire life. I'm not exaggerating. There was one young woman (I wish I knew her name), who was there for most of our weekend and was just so nice I wanted to give her a hug. Everyone was great, really, and they all seemed genuinely nice and helpful, not fake.Next time I'm planning a trip to New York, I'll be checking this place first.Thank you Cassa!

Stayed for 3 nights this past May. The hotel is modern and nicely designed, which is a style I like. The room was a good size for NY, closet is small but it did not bother me were there for a few days only. Bathroom was very nice as it had a large rain shower with good water pressure, white in color, clean. Great soundproofing from the street, no noise.We had breakfast in the terrace which was actually very good considering the cramped kitchen area. Service was ok as the waiter was pleasent but dry, While I was there I saw that they were working on restaurant being built on the ground level of the street, shoyuld be very nice once it opened. Lastly, the location is excellent as it is close to everything. Overall is was great to arrive to your small cocoon after day in the citie's hustle. Thanks will be back.

I have reserved a standard room (queen bed) via Expedia, finding the weekly rate quite competitive vis-a-vis hotels located in the same area (10036) like Sofitel or Hilton. The room located on the 21st floor turned out to be pretty small: the queen bed was actually a mini-queen and the closet was really tiny, difficult to manage two medium size suitcases around. The bathroom was nice and clean (great shower) and surprisingly large considering the room.I was offered an upgrade to the deluxe queen room, king bed (located on the same floor) for a daily $105 (+taxes) rate and decided to accept as my wife and I were to stay for a full week. The new room was definitely more ample although the king bed was actually more like a (real) standard queen. The bathroom was exactly the same size as in the standard room and the closet was (again) super-tiny size, definitely not indicated for stays longer than 1 or 2 nights. Each and every room sports the same closets (super-tiny) size, they told me. The first 10 digital channels of the LCD TV were not working and I was told that in certain rooms they were out of order (offered another room change I said no, thank you!). Other than that the hotel was clean and confortable, very silent at night.

Stayed at Cassa last summer with my boyfriend after a lifetime of anticipating my first trip to New York City. I found this hotel for a great deal and by the photos and reviews, it seemed much better quality than others for the same price.What I loved most about this hotel was the reception desk and the people working at it. They accommodated our stay from start to finish- providing us with their advice on "must-see" places around the city as well as restaurants that New Yorkers enjoy.After doing plenty of research about New York and it's popular hotels, we realized that all hotels have small rooms. The rooms at Cassa are actually not THAT small, they are spacious and comfortable enough for two people, are modern and VERY clean. The rooms feature a nice sized TV, a cozy bed big enough for two, a decent sized washroom, a desk (which was helpful for charging laptops/cell phones) as well as an organized closet with a safe and mini fridge. The location of this hotel is perfect. Its about a 10 minute walk from Time Square, surrounded by stores and places to eat and there is a drug store right beside it. We were fortunate enough to visit during a weekend where they blocked off the street beside the hotel and food/gift vendors set up a marketplace- a really nice way to spend a morning.My experience with New York city was a great one and the accommodations at Cassa made it even better - hope to return very soon!

this hotel is very modern and located on 45th street between 5th and 6th avenues. it is within walking distance of penn station, broadway theaters, restaurant. the leather furniture is butter soft, the beds are comfortable, the bathroom is well equipped. the staff is very friendly. they had a special and the rooms weren't super expensive.

Stayed here for one night. Very comfortable room. Excellent room amenities and a nice breakfast in the morning. Not super cheap (where in NYC is?) but definitely a hotel I would re-book and return to.

I stayed at this hotel with my girlfriend last summer. The location is great (one block away from time square). It does not get to loud at night where you can hear everything like you would if you were staying right at time square. The service provided at this hotel was also great, especially Eric and his recommendations. Overall, we had a pleasant 4 night stay at this hotel. Added plus, Duane Reade is right around the corner, if you need an snacks or drinks in your room. Can't say one bad thing about this hotel. The rooms are pretty big for New York standards. Highly recommended and will return.

Fab location , very central and within walking distance to Times Square, Central park,Rockefeller and other tourist sites. We booked executive room. Very clean ,massive extremely comfy bed and huge shower ! Room was lovely and quiet. Concierge ,Eric,was really helpful and helped us with bookings and planning our outings. All staff very pleasant and helpful- from front desk and doormen. Breakfast expensive and was not really impressed with the room which doubled up as bar at night, however excellent diners etc very close. Missed having tea and coffee facilities in bedroom - plenty of room to have same but did not spoil our stay. Lovely touch to have complimentary wine and handwritten notes sent to our room not once but twice ( we were celebrating special occasion) I would go back and stay again and would certainly recommend. New York is expensive and this boutique hotel is not bad price wise comparedG to some. We had a super stay.

I stayed here for one night for my 5 year anniversary recently. The staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating as soon as I came for check-in. They upgraded our room from a deluxe Queen to a King Executive suite, which was so awesome. The room itself was really clean and spacious. They have a great digital radio where you can set music up or dock an iPod. The concierge service was superb! Ask for Eric. He had chocolate covered strawberries and white wine sent up for us for our anniversary which was such a nice touch. Overall, it was an amazing stay and I would highly recommend.
user_name:
Cece128
New York City, New York

review_body: We (family of 4) spent four nights in the hotel during last Summer. The hotel is located centrally, Penn station is just 10 minutes away. The hotel has been renewed recently (2010), the rooms are a bit too small. The service is okay. During our stay one elevator was out of service for more than one day, causing quite a lot of chaos and discontent among the guests.
We had a ball during our four day visit. Staff was exceptional and the room was perfect. Highly recommended.

This is a new boutique hotel on 45th Street near 6th Avenue, very convenient to Times Square but just far enough from all the craziness, with easy access to mass transit and a Starbucks across the street. The lobby is contemporary & minimalist, with a big red reception desk, behind which stands a small army of genuinely friendly, helpful staff. I stayed two nights, and my room was on the 20th floor. While small, it was quiet, lovely and clean, with big windows and a large flatscreen. Some minor irritations: It was hard to scan through all the channels on the TV without resorting to individual selection, and wifi is not free (daily fee of $10 for basic service, $15 for better). The bed was comfortable though soft, and the shower head was of the the big round raining variety. There is supposedly a restaurant suitable for breakfast on the 10th floor, but I didn't stop there. Also, a basement restaurant, visible from the lobby, is currently under construction. All in all, I found this a really nice place to stay.

Small hotel with friendly staff and atmosphere.Room rather small but good looking. More nice/modern than practical. Clean.I liked the bed very much, soft but firm. In the middle of Manhattan, but quiet nights, insulation seems ok.
Good location, near subways, shopping, theaters, restaurants, and in the middle of everywhere. Been staying here for 2 years now, just wish they would finish construction.

We booked the hotel via Hotwire and couldn't be happier! We were there for three nights in a room that was an absolutely perfect base for exploring the city. It's only a couple of blocks from Times Square and 5th Ave so it was great to walk around exploring. Despite complaints we saw about the room size, we were in one of the supposedly "small" rooms in a double bed and we were absolutely fine! We're a normal sized couple and had no problem at all in the room! The hotel was funky and modern and the staff were all super lovely!

We stayed 4 nights in NYC last October for a memorable citytrip. Spent days to find the best hotel at the best fair, many was already full and I finally picked the Cassa that I had already preselected.The hotel looks incredibly sexy with great design and furnitures. The room was reeeaaaally small, a bit too small for more than 2 nights. The bed was great, firm enough with comfy pillows. The views was nice too over the roofs of New York. The bathroom was excellent with nice toileteries, taking a shower with great view on buildings and streets, with Time Square lights, great !The location is just perfect if you choose Midtown. On 42th street, you are just a few steps from Time Square, 6th Avenue, the Park. We did walk down to the river the first day but we finally found the neighbourhood not so cool to find some great new-yorkers restaurant. So it was basically a cab ride every night to find more interesting spots down in the South.The food at the breakfast was really tasty and appealing but it was clearly not enough : 1 drink, 1 dish, no extra breads or opened choices.. After 1 try, we opted for some bakeries such as "au bon pain" where you can order some bagels, muffins, donuts, large variety of coffees or teas, and with the whole nyc atmosphere in the early mornings.On the other downside, we had to wait hours for the check-in after an 8h-flight, no special treatment nor upgrades, too bad! Finally, the bill was big, really big. We could have found some descent boutique hotel for half the price.

Perfect spot for visiting midtown. Stayed here while in town to see Phillip Seymour Hoffman's excellent portrayal of Willy Loman in "Death of a Salesman". Hotel is right in the theater district, has clean, well furnished rooms, and attentive, good natured staff. Only flaw I can think of concerns the bathroom fixtures: shower controls were far from intuitive, and both shower and sink had problems draining (bathroom sink was cast in an aesthetically pleasing square design that unfortunately seemed to cause water to back up while we brushed our teeth). Room was small but typical for midtown. Didn't use the TV but it looked like a nice model; large flat screen. Radio was wonderful in terms of sound and design.
hotel was nics, very good, clean, save, quite, comfortable bed, helpful front disk, small rooms and price expensive but its ok for nyc i highly recommend it and will stay there again.

I just finished a two night stay at the Cassa hotel, and, as my review title states, I had a good but not great experience.The hotel is located just off 6th Ave on 45 which puts it in a spectacular area for visitors and access to transportation. The building is new and modern in style and as its name suggests, contains both a hotel and condominium.The small, modern lobby sets the tone for the hotel in style and setup. The fixtures are modern, but things are snug. With luggage trolleys and a few guests, it could get crowded quickly. The staff I dealt with all seemed friendly, but the fact they are doing double-duty for the building residents means they have a slightly different vibe than a traditional, dedicated hotel staff. I didn't need much assistance, and my interactions were all good.Up in the rooms, in my case 1403, it was the same situation: modern, snug and just missing a little something I can't put my finger on. The rooms are small. Pretty well-designed in the sleeping area, but the lack of storage is glaring. I had one small overnight bag and I still had some difficulties. I can't imagine what the guests I saw with gigantic rolling suitcases did with them and their contents. The bed was a full-size bed, which was ok for me, but a couple might feel cramped. Bedding was good. The maid does like to come early, so put out the Do Not Disturb sign if you are not an early bird!The bathroom was sleek and clean. It too did not have much in the way of storage. Solo travelers would be fine (unless you were a woman with a lot of makeup you wanted to set out), but again, couples would find it challenging. I liked the spacious glass rainforest shower and modern sink. It was kept immaculately.So, all in all, everything here was good, clean and completely adequate. As long as you are comfortable with the scaled-down design, you will like the room. Staff were also pleasant. But for me, there was something slightly off about the property. I would certainly stay there again, but otherwise didn't have any particularly warm final impressions of the property.

This is absolutely my new favorite hotel in NYC. The location is phenomenal--a block from Times Square, 2 blocks from Rockefeller Plaza, a block from 5th Avenue. There are delicious restaurants on every surrounding street. Every hotel staff member was friendly, helpful, and pleasant. The rooms are wonderful--extremely comfortable bedding, and a shower that can only be described as luxurious. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Spent 4 nights during Spring Break. Just off Time Square -- great location -- and a decent price. The king sized bed still allowed for plenty of room to walk around and was very comfortable. The front-desk staff was very friendly and knowledgable about the area. The housekeeping was a bit unorganized -- but responsive to our concerns (ie: don't come at 9:30am -- so we learned to put out our "do not disturb" sign when we went to bed.) Overall good place! All reasonably priced hotels in Time Square are small -- but this was workable. Would definitely return here and recommend it to others.

My husband and I spent two nights at the Cassa Hotel. With taxes, we paid $425 per night. Unfortunately, the hotel was not worth even half that. This is the first negative review we have ever written about any hotel. We woke up each morning to vibration and whistling from the plumbing. It was so loud that it woke my husband up while wearing earplugs. He talked to the front desk staff four times. We were told twice that the problem was fixed and twice that we would be moved to another room. Unfortunately, neither one happened.The staff was very friendly, but they don't provide good customer service. If there are no problems, it's a nice place to stay. If there are problems, however, you will leave frustrated and angry like we did that we paid a lot more than the hotel was worth.One other thing to note: there was no dresser in our room. With two adults and an infant, that was a challenge. So if you need a dresser, you better go somewhere else.We will never stay at the Cassa Hotel again.

As most of the people, I also booked through hotwire. Big mistake.The hotel is in a great location, but I think there are better places.There´s no room to hang anything. My feet were hanging out of the bed.There was no complimentary water, or cofee machine in the room. (which in all the hotels I´ve stayed in the past few years offered that). That´s something you expect in a four star hotel.Also, there were weird noises. Driiling noise from who knows where early in the morning. Baby crying at 6 am.The 10th floor which they say it´s the breaksfast room, is very small and it looks out of place.The restaurant in still going through renovation.Good things:The staff were great. Very friendly and helpfull. And the bathroom is big.The room was very clean. and all the linens seemed new.The location is perfect. You´re in the middle of everything.I just think they should change the beds of the stardard room, or make it a single room. they shouldn´t sell that for a couple.

The Cassa Hotel is more of a residence. While the front desk and bellboy were friendly, the hotel offers limited business services and little in public space. There is no lobby to speak of and the rooms are so small as to barely accommodate two physically fit adults. Even a small child would make the stay unbearable.The hotel is placed near Times Square, an area that caters mostly to visitors and has little to offer for real New Yorkers. Since our business engagements were in the area, the hotel was convenient. But I wouldn't recommend the location to anyone who wishes to taste the real New York.All in all, the price we paid - $148 through a Hot Wire deal -- was acceptable for a hotel of such facilities in this location.

this hotel is perfect for the tourist who wants to be in the middle of the shopping heart of NYC and also be in the middle of the Musicals . You will be right in Times Square At the front desk the people are really nice and helpful.the view from the window is in general really nice as up as u getting your room.The room size is quite nice, nice and modern decoration, rooms really quiet ( wich was really important for me ) a nice bathroom with a big shower I will come again for sure :-)

On a recent business trip to NYC I had the pleasure of staying at Cassa Hotel. What a lovely super modern truly comfortable experience! Great location (I took in Spiderman at the Foxwood Theatre just 2 blocks away!). I was greeted with a smile and then offered a room upgrade! I'm in the city several times a year and rate the Cassa as my all time favorite. Stay here, you will be just as pleased.

Great location near central park, clean very modern rooms, walking distance to broadway and times square. Plenty of nearby subway stations. Best part was the service. Eric, their Concierge went above and beyond the call of duty for us with everything from our room size, to last minute dinner plans. Will not hesitate to stay there again!

We have just returned from a long weekend in New York.We stayed at the Cassa which is ideally located for all major sights.So near to Times Square,you can walk there in 5 minutes.We were given a free upgrade without asking!The room was very good and the bed really comfortable.Everywhere in the hotel is very clean.The most impressive thing about the hotel is the staff.Those working on the front desk are exceptional.Very friendly and helpful and will go out of their way to do anything for you.Alicia,Alby,Nick and particularly Eric are great.Eric can get tickets for anything!We went to a Knicks game and it was one of the highlights of our trip.Will definitely be back again.
Helpful and nice staff, clean, contemporary... Good service, needs breakfast buffet. Electrical cabinet is still roaring as stated in other previous reviews.

The Cassa is a perfectly located boutique hotel on 45th, near Avenue of the Americas. Our room was clean, but way too small for two persons and had limited drawers for storage of clothes. Still, if all you want is a terrifically located hotel with lots of surrounding restaurants, shopping, subway access, this is the place for you.
Location, price, staff and cleanness of room was just all excellent.

Stayed here with my daughter for a "girls weekend", and we thoroughly enjoyed the Cassa. The staff was professional, friendly and accommodating. The rooms were large by NYC standards, clean, and very comfortable and the location is excellent. I would definitely stay here again.

-It's not a real hotel / more a mix of condos and hotel. Almost no amenities;-The first day, we came back at 6pm and our room was not done. If you want the room cleaned, you have to put a sign on your door. Nobody told us when we checked in;-The design of the top of the bathub (stone) brings the water all over the place in the wc;-It is still in construction in some areas. The Monday morning: we were awake by drills at 7am...;-The room are not well finished. We were able to see plywood at the top the cabinetery in the entrance;-The bed was good and clean;-Location is great if you want to be in the Theater district.

We booked this hotel through Expedia as part of a package deal. The rooms were quiet, the beds were comfy, and the staff were nice and helpful. Our flight was delayed and they upgraded us to an executive suite. The only down side is the lack of convenient internet, though this may by typical for New York City. The hotel is steps away from Times Square and Broadway shows. The St. Patrick's Day parade sets up right outside the door. Overall a very nice place to stay.

I have had the pleasure of staying here a few times. I'm always pleased with the excellent service of everyone at the front desk who all go above and beyond what's necessary to welcome you and make sure you have a good stay. Not many hotels have staff who are able to call you by name after you first check in and remember your name when you return on another stay! The regular rooms are a bit on the small side but I still had room for my young adult aged child and me. On another stay they surprised me and upgraded my room. Cassa has everything you need on site, exercise room, room service, food service within the hotel (including a lounge with a nice blues band and a complimentary glass of wine), and a business office (even offered an email address to use to eprint at their printer without needing to pay for internet time). There are numerous restaurants, a park, and attractions close by. It is not located right at Times Square but is close by. Staff and security were always visible and I always felt safe. I have recommended Cassa many times to others who were just as satisfied and I, like them, plan on returning in the near future.

Had a single night in NY on business and took a recommendation of a colleague - not something I normally do but was pressed for time. This time it worked a treat - this place is a real charmer. Possibly the narrowest hotel I have stayed in but rooms are NY hip and, for the price, relatively roomy. I was told I was upgraded on arrival so there could be smaller rooms. Bathrooms very nicely decorated, minimalist but with a robe. Room had room for a sofa as well as a small desk and a big TV (possibly a little too big because you can't really get that far back from it.Restaurant on the roof had a limited but funky breakfast menu. Everyone very helpful with directions and the usual front of house stuff.I'd go back.

The location is great. not -ON- Times Square, but just a block away...enough to be quiet. The room was very comfortable with modern fixtures and the bed was excellent.The staff is very courteous. Not the fake kind, but genuinely caring about making the experience a good one.The restaurant was not finished when we stayed, but we read the bio of the executive chef and look forward to staying there again when it's open.This is another great example of getting your money's worth.

Nestled among the skyscrapers in an enviable location on 45th St between 5th and 6th Avenues, the Cassa stands out as a little known gem that I predict will develop a following. A tall, skinny, 44 story building, the rooms are comfortable with high-tech radios, flat screen TVs, comfortable amenities and lighting, a luxurious bathroom and amenities (Frette robes, for example), but it's the staff that excels. Just a mention of a want or a need at the front desk, and they magically appear. Elevators are super efficient; there's a gym; a new restaurant is under construction, although breakfast can be delivered by room service yet Starbucks is literally a 15 second walk from the front door. Highly recommended.

Second time in 4 months that we've stayed here. The location is great for just about everything. We use the subway to get around and this location is central. Hotel is small,quiet, elegant, and completely comfortable. The staff has been universally friendly and accomodating. We lived in NYC 40 years ago and come back, from Boston, often to visit. We've stayed in many of the "best hotels" and this rates at the top.

I found the Cassa NY on Tripadvisor based on the reviews I read I booked it. I was not disappointed. Great hotel in great location. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Hotel has a very cool feel about it. I got upgraded to a suite. Rooms are small but it's all you need when in the middle of Midtown Manhatten. Most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. Location is unbeatable. Between Times Square and 5th Avenue. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Thanks to a business to New York I had opportunity to stay at Cassa Hotel at 70 W. 45th St. Frankly I'd forgotten what real hotel service was like and to my delight they've reminded me. The hotel is tucked away among the corporate buildings but you don't want to miss it. It's clean, modernly and fashionably furnished, thoughtful amenities, sizeable bathrooms and excellent service. A doorman actually helped with my luggage while keeping up engaging and personal dialogue. Menus and information were easily accessed. Help arrived within if not seconds for the slightest request. Then of course the location is perfection with minutes walking access to everything you want to see mid town, trains, shopping, restaurants etc.. I'm coming back to Cassa hotel on my own dime...that's how good it was!

We travelled here in early 2011, when the Cassa Hotel was just opening up. Because of this we got an amazing deal on the hotel and were blown away by the rooms, the view and the service. The concierge was amazing and helped us arrange all of our shows and sites with no hassle whatsoever. The location is unbeatable, a short walk to Times Square and to all the public transport and amenities you need on Manhattan. We would love to stay here again if we could, but i don't know if the regular rates are in our price range for a weekend away in the Big Apple. Bottom line: if you do find a good deal on rates (or if you can afford the price-tag) you would not be disappointed staying at Cassa on your next trip to NYC.
user_name:
AbsolutelyNoBorders
Long Island City, New York

review_body: This is a great hotel. Excellent location, quiet but very central. We loved everything about the stay. The staff was nice and helpful. I needed help to locate a suitcase and they could not have done more to help me. I personally think the rooms are decent size for Manhattan. Stayed in a standard room on 15th floor facing the backyard, and had plenty of space although the bed was not large. The bathroom is simple but done to a high standard with Frette towels and linens. The restaurant is under refurbishment, and the 'Tapas Bar' on 10th floor double as a breakfast room and certainly feels more like the latter - a bit cold, underfurnished and uninviting, although the terrace might be nice in the summer. Please bear in mind that most restaurants in the area are quite touristy.Would definitely consider Cassa again if we are staying in mid-town.
We loved the location of this hotel and the concierge Eric was really nice. We can't wait for the restaurant to open

As others say, tremendous locationjust off 5th Avenue and very close to Time Square, walking distance for many iconic places and shopping. Staff very helpful, espaecially concierge Eric who sorted several things including ice hockey with a big smile. No real eating facilities but lots of good cafes and restaurants close by, including Cranberry cafe which is used by NYPD and locals. Within Cassa Hotel there is an American brasserie waiting to open dependong on liquor licence. Rooms are quite small but the beds and shower are amongst the best we have had in any hotel for comfort and hot water. Weather was good in New York when we were ther Feb 11-14, otherwise might have been a bit short of hotel comfort as no real relaxation area. For a city break however, this was great.

Cassa hotel has a great location if you want to stay in midtown. The hotel seem to be quite new and is halfpart hotel /half residence. The rooms are all quite small even though it states that they should be large, we booked a executive king which should be 37 sqm but were in fact more like 25-28 sqm. We even changed rooms during our stay and the were all the same. Still the rooms are quite nice, with comfy beds and all amenities. The hotel is quite pricy and not sure if it's worth the price? The hotel don't have any restaurant only a very small area for a quick snack and the lobby dont have any sit down area only two small sofas.

I stayed for two nights back in August 2011 and must say that it left a very nice impression. Location wise, you can't ask for a better place. Bryant Park and Times Square is only a few blocks away while Rockefeller Center, Central Park, 5th Ave, Broadway are all within walking distance. The rooms were small, something expected in Midtown. But it was kept clean and I appreciated the relatively spacious bathroom. Also the beds were extremely comfortable. Can't leave out the front desk. They were always ready to ask any answers a first-time visitor to NYC might have and the sheet of paper they provide under the door, containing info on the weather and various festivities, was a plesant surprise. Would definitely consider staying again for my next trip.
user_name:
Sukil Y
Seoul, Seoul, South Korea

review_body: This was our 8th visit to NYC and we have stayed in various hotels in different locations. Cassa suites on45th was ideally situated for everything, so close to Times Square,Broadway and Fifth Avenue.The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful and even greeted us by name most unusual for this City. It was my birthday whilst I was there and I was wished a happy birthday by everyone. Rooms are that large but very few rooms in New York are, but very clean and have everything you need. If you needed anything else the staff were only happy to oblige. Will definitely stay here again. Well done to all the staff.The Sweetmans
