Very minimalist hotel lobby. On check in we were told we were given an upgrade. Our room was tiny. Not much more than room for a bed. Tiny,tiny closet. No drawer space. The restaurant was closed for renovation. We were not told that on check in. We would not stay here again. There are so many hotels in NYC, choose a different one.

I purchased through Hotwire and became concerned with some of the comments from similar customers. HOWEVER, I had a fantastic stay! I'm a tall man and they upgraded me, at no cost, to a king bed. Front desk staff were the best! They know where the great deals are in town and were very helpful.

Stayed at Cassa for a few days this week for a work training (at the hotel's meeting room). I travel to NYC often and had never heard of this hotel and was skeptical - especially since I never stay in Midtown. No need for my skepticism as the hotel was above my expectations. The front desk and door staff are very welcoming and always willing to help (I should say that they were more pro-active than most Midtown hotels). My room was average size for NY but never did I feel that it was too small - the decor is minimal but well designed. The bathroom also was the perfect size for the amount of space. Pros:Good location if you want to stay in MidtownGreat, comfortable roomsGREAT bedding and mattressQuiet room - no street noiseExcellent service (Four Seasons service at less price)Good meeting room space Cons:Limited room serviceRestaurant was under construction (but looks promising)It's in Midtown (that's my personal issue)WiFi is not includedOverall I loved this hotel and may stay here again. It is perfect for those who want a hotel that is modern without sacrificing space/comfort, in Midtown and don't want to pay for a 5 star hotel but want the service :)

We may have hit the hotel on a bad weekend - but it certainly WAS a bad weekend. They're renovating their restaurant and the smell of paint and/or polyurethane was overwhelming through much of the day. (They were inundated with complaints and, by evening, it had improved.) At 3:00 am, our thermostat began making a loud clicking noise and a repairman came up 15 minutes later to fix it. Then, at 6:30 am, we were woken by a very loud screeching noise coming from the water pipes (this is a criticism in some of the very few bad reviews we've read, so it appears to be an ongoing problem). We again had to call the front desk, who said they'd send someone up; but the noises continued periodically throughout the morning. Upon checkout, we were asked about our experience and said it was one of the worst experiences we've had in a long time. We were told a manager would contact us to discuss our stay, but no further contact was made. It is a beautiful hotel in a great location - but the lack of follow-up or even moderate level of sympathy/interest from the management has perhaps been the most disappointing aspect of the stay.

Stayed for one evening in a King room and wished we had at least another night! The room itself was small but adequate and comfortable, especially the bed! Like sleeping on a cloud! Beautiful bathroom, very clean, quiet (request a high floor...we were on 27). If you are looking for a room with a view, you may not find it here, but if you want a clean room, super comfy bed, awesome shower and helpful friendly staff, this is the place for you! Our only gripe was no bar in the building. It was pouring down rain and we wanted to have a drink after attending a show, and had to walk down the block to a pub. Not horrible....but would've been nice to just be able to stay in the building on such a miserable night.

Me and my wife were here in the soft opening period. Staff are extremely polite and helpful with tips. Although the room is small it is very well decorated and comfortable (specially the bed) and bathroom has a good size with an amazing shower. Certainly will be back!

We stayed in this hotel for Christmas, and it is in the middle of everything. Times Squere is 5 min. Lots of restaurant next to hotel, try the Turkish Antalia across the street. The staff in the hotel is very friendly and helpfull, rooms are on the small side, but anyway you will spend most of the time outside and enyoj the action and the vibe of NYC!

I stayed here for a night here with my boyfriend over MLK weekend. The hotel lobby is pretty tiny, but it's well decorated with a modern feel and the staff was very friendly, we were upgraded without even asking! Once in the room, it seemed small, but the space was efficiently used so we weren't lacking room to move around, and it was clean and comfortable. The walls were a bit thin, we could hear the staff cleaning the room next door, but luckily they had waited until 11am, so we weren't woken up or anything. The staff was the highlight of the hotel, they took care of our bags while we walked around before/after we checked in/out, one gentleman even spun the revolving door for us! I would definitely stay here again, the location was perfect as well.

Lovely accommodations. A couple of blocks from Time Square. This quiet, modern new property was the perfect place to spend the weekend. Rooms were small a la "W" hotels but the king size bed made up for it. Loved the bathroom--well lit and the cascade shower head was perfect. BLT restaurant slated to open next month. Skating and museum package was great. No coffee maker. An array of toiletries and intimacy items at extraordinarily high prices. Request minibar key at checking if you are so inclined.

My wife travel regularly and have been to NY several times in the last two years. We found the Cassa Hotel and Residences on a discount website but still paid just under $200 for a "Standard Room". We spent 3 nights and have the following comments:Positives - The location is exceptional with close proximity to theaters and shopping.  - The staff was very pleasant and helpful - The linens and mattress were above average  - the bathroom was exceptionalNegatives - The room had one double bed instead of queen size. We are not large people but feel that a good hotel room should have at least a queen size bed to offer (even in a standard room!). When we asked for a room with a Queen size we were told there would be a $50.00 a night upgrade fee. Really!! - There was no dresser in the room, only a wardrobe, which also contained the mini bar, room-safe, an iron and ironing board, and allowed you enough room to hang a your shirts and pants. It also had little cubbies to "roll up" your all other clothing. Basically, you have to live out of your suitcase. - It's been a long time since we have been given a room without a coffee maker of any kind. This is a basic amenity to us. When we queried this we were told that we can order coffee from room service for $3.00 per cup! Overall the location makes up for a lot of the deficiencies but there is significant room for improvement.
My wife and I stayed here two days before Christmas 2011. The location is superb, 200 meters from Times Square. Rooms were nice and clean, and the staff was very friendly.

+ Location! A few minutes walk to everything. Go West to Times Square, East to Fifth/Madison Ave and Grand Central Terminal, North to Rockefeller.  + Staff are mostly very good; print out emails, give directions. Upgraded us to a better room because it was available and gave us a free bottle of wine on arrival. Nice touch.+ Room was comfortable, clean and a decent size for NY. Most importantly, it was quiet; We could have been staying in a country home by ourselves. We didn't hear a sound!- Wi-fi is not free. $15 for 24 hours of fast wi-fi or $10 for slower speed. - No bath. We love a soak in the tub after a big day of walking.Overall: Definitely stay at the Cassa. Fair price, nice room, good staff, great location.Note: AU$1360 incl. all taxes for 7 nights plus 48 hours fast wi-fi. Upgraded to executive room king bed.

My partner and I stayed here for four nights in early January 2011. We had a wonderful stay and the hotel met all of our expectations. We booked on Hotwire and got a very favorable rate of $122/n. Upon check-in, the staff told us that we were automatically booked into a room with a full bed only, and offered us an upgrade of $50/n for a queen room and $70/n for a king room. We declined, but were then upgraded to a queen room at no charge.The room was compact, but wonderfully outfitted. Yes, the room is small, but for all the reviewers that complain about the size of the rooms - it's New York city, most hotel rooms are very small. The bathroom and shower were a good size, as was the TV.The hotel itself was very quiet considering the amazing location and tons of street traffic. We didn't run into any other guests at the hotel at all, and so we slept very soundly.All in all, a great hotel, great location, and great price. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

I took a gamble on booking this hotel, not knowing much at all about NYC, having never really been then for more than a quick in and out of the city. The Cassa seemed centrally located, classy and still a decent price so I went for it. I could not have guessed better. This hotel is amazing. It is in the perfect location from anything and everything that you could want to walk to and with the Buss and Subway stops a minute away the rest of NYC is at your fingertips. The room was really nice, clean and quite, especially the bed after a long day of walking around. But the true gem of this hotel is their staff. From the doorman, front desk, cleaning staff...they were all just amazing and kind and always smiled and said hello, not something you get at most hotels. But the Concierge was the crown jewel of the staff. He made this the best trip for my girl and I. Best restaurant suggestions. He saved us four hours of waiting in the TKTS line and got us a print out for the same discount that we took to the box office and got our tickets for Mary Poppins and he gave us the suggestion of where best to sit in the theater. His directions and suggestions on where to go and how to go were perfect. He really made this trip work for us.

Stayed here in August 2011 for 2 nights after booking through Expedia's Unpublished Rates. The hotel's location is perfect. 1 block from all of the best shopping on 5th Avenue. 2 blocks from the Times Square. The service was great. They were also very helpful with directions and recommendations.The rooms were modern and clean. The bathroom was incredible.

We stayed here only one night and it was a great place! The location was steps from Times Square but the hotel itself was nice and quiet. The staff was friendly, efficient and knowledgable. We had a king room that they upgraded us to when we arrived and although it was small, it was quite comfortable and decorated in a sleek, contemporary style. They provided nice robes and toiletries. Very large flat screen tv, rainfall shower head with good pressure and large window. Convenient Starbucks across the street, as well as a good pizza and pasta place and a sandwich shop next door. Plenty of bars and restaurants just steps away. Parking was $50 for 24 hours by valet and they will hold your luggage for you after checkout if you want to leave your car and spend more time in the city.

We had a pleasant stay in the Cassa Hotel in New York. It's very good located close to the shops, MOMA, Rockefeller Center, Time Square etc... We had a room on the 7th floor at the street side, but without any street noice. Our room was rather small but well decorated and very clean. The wardrobe was very small and an extra coat rack or shelf at the enterance of the room would be nice. The batroom was very clean and spacouis with a good rainshower.We didn't hear any noice of the neigbouring rooms, the only thing we heared was the lift bell what can be annoying for some people (not for us).We didn't take our breakfast in the hotel becaus there is only a limited choice at a high price.I would recommend the hotel to change the light in the lobby, because though it is well decorated the cold light gives it a gloomy atmosphere.I would stay again in this hotel.

We visited New York with our three children aged 11,8 and 5 and were given two rooms next to one another. The rooms were a good size (although cupboard space was tiny) but we managed by keeping clothes folded in our suitcases. The room had ample space for our suitcases and mountains of shopping as well as a small desk and comfortable chairs for when we brought back take-away meals. The staff went out of thir way to recommend the best sights and restaurants. I noted on our helicopter trip that we had actually got a better deal for 5 of us by booking via Cassa Hotel than the couple in the queue ahead of us who were using a Groupon voucher. Ditto with the theatre tickets. We were recommended the best show for kids and told when the optimal time to go would be. Looking for the best hot-dogs in town, we were recommended the Shake Shack, which richly deserves its reputation and long queues - everyone loved it.The staff at the front desk couldn't do more for us, especially on the day we left, which was New Year's eve. It was obvious that people were pouring into town and the hotel were checking in lots of new guests yet they still gave us two hours extra time to pack after we should have checked out and the icing on the cake was the limousine booked to take us to the airport at a fixed price of 69 USD. They negotiated the rate for us to save us the hassle.The location is ideal for shopping on 5th avenue , catching shows on Broadway or eating out in Times Square, our three favourite activities...so we will definitely be recommending Cassa and would book to stay there again.

I stayed here for my birthday and it was a great experience. The room was very clean & up-to-date! The staff was very friendly & the service was very prompt. It's a great location and I am planning on staying here again.
Lovely hotel, a short walk from the theater district. Rooms small, but very clean and modern. Was only there for a short overnight, but would have liked to stay longer.

I stayed here over Christmas and was booked into a standard room which was fortunately upgraded to a King-size bed (I requested 2 twins, which is basically impossible here and at most hotels in NYC without extra fees). The room was just big enough for my girlfriend and myself (I would probably have felt a bit crowded in the standard queen room I'm guessing) however it was well done with a clean layout and a very nice bathroom (big shower - big enough to make me wonder why they didn't put in bathtubs). The closet in the room is micro sized - so if you have any real plans to use a closet - you better rethink them.The main highlight of the trip was the OUTSTANDING service from the front desk staff. They really have the right attitude about customer service - no doesn't appear to be a word they've heard before. Always willing to try and figure something out for you and do it with a smile. Really impressive. This was certainly the best front desk staff I've seen in years of stays in NYC (and I would rank them right up there with staff at the Mandarin). If you want to be treated with top notch service in a clean setting (but don't mind a potentially smallish queen room if there are 2 of you) - this is the place to go. I booked via Hotwire, so great value for me - although the rates on their website seemed a bit expensive for the dates I was traveling (I could have booked virtually any hotel in the city for their website prices). Oh yea... location was great if you want to be in mid-town. About 1.5 blocks from times square.. and half a block from strolling up and down 5th ave.

This hotel is extremely well located for tourists - within walking distance to subways and many of the major sites. The hotel service was excellent, friendly and courteous. The decor is modern and recently renovated -- new spiffy bathroom with a stand-up glass shower and rainfall showerhead were awesome. No coffee maker in the room, but there are many coffee shops within a 20 second walk. The room was very quiet -- we thought we were the only guests on our floor, until we saw others leaving their room in the morning = and we didn't hear any street noise.

I have stayed at many New York City hotels in the Midtown area, and this hotel ranks among the top three. Interesting, modern decor with a great use of the space. Perfect view of Times Square from the large bathroom window. Friendly staff (the word "No" is not in their vocabulary), great food from room service (best scrambled eggs ever). The location is centrally located, yet off of the busy main streets, which is nice. I went with my teenage son, who also loved the room (he enjoyed the nice sound system for his iPod). We will definitely return! One word of caution: If you need two beds, make sure you book through a site that allows you to specify! Otherwise, you may have to share a bed or get a cot (which takes up most of the free space in the room!!)

Just returned from a 2 night stay at Cassa. My husband and I stayed in an Executive King room with our 6 year old son. We usually stay in Murray Hill, but decided to try a new location this time. Cassa is close to everything! You can walk to Bryant Park and Times Square without a problem. Although it is located in a busy area of the city, our room was remarkably quiet. It was immaculately clean and the bed was super comfortable. Everything appears to be new and nothing is work down. Staff was so accommodating...brought up extra towels within minutes of us requesting them, offered dinner spot suggestions, took the time to chat with our son, and Eric was kind enough to arrange for us to get an extra pass to skate at Bryant Park when our room deal only included 2 skaters. Warm greetings from everyone who worked there at all times-from the guys cleaning the doors to the concierge to the housekeeping staff. I can't say enough about how impressed we were with Cassa. We will definitely be staying with them again, and I look forward to them adding a restaurant in the near future!

What an awesome time we had at this Hotel... The staff was friendly and personable. The room was beautiful (not much of a view) modern and clean. The bed was very very comfortable and we had a great night sleep. The hotel is close to Rockefeller Center (2 blocks) and a short walk to Time Square we actually only used the subway to get to the WTC site.... Otherwise we walked. I would highly recomend this hotel!

The room was nice and clean. More spacious than what I imagined for a New York City hotel. It was close to the main attractions - Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, Central Park. On the map, it didn't look walkable, but when I got there, it was very walkable. The staff were very friendly.

Not only is the Hotel stylish, the rooms were comfortable and quiet, considering the central location. Perfect for great shopping, times square, theaters, etc. The staff upgraded us when there was an issue with the room. Yes the rooms are small, but that is typical of New York City hotels. The room service is overpriced, but then again so is al of NYC. Had a reservation at another hotel but decided to stay here or the entire t

Cassa Hotel & Residences is a beautiful and have a really good location, 5 mins to Time squre and 15 min for the Empire State Building and close to Pen Station The rooms are lovely furnished with good beds and nice large bathroom with large shower Breakfast is paid for, and it was the only drawback to the hotel, you pay a relatively high price for almost nothing .. go either into one of the local Sanwich bar and buy breakfast there, there is a wide range The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful .. Will be back :-)

The short review: I recommend this hotel to anybody whether it's their first time or the 100th in NYC! It is very convenient to get anywhere in the city and it is CLEAN. My husband and I stayed here for a weekend in December. We had originally booked only one night, but that's never enough in NYC - so we extended our stay for another night. We were on the 6th floor, the hotel is very clean, the location is just perfect. You are away from the noise of Times Square, but can walk there in 5-10minutes. It is walking distance to the Museum Mile... AND to top it all off, you have Starbucks right in front of the hotel!The room was very clean. Everything in the room seemed to be new. The bed was more than comfortable, there's an iHome, TV and the standard mini-bar. The bathroom is just a bathroom and shower, but the shower is updated and is just an experience. The only "lacking" piece of the room is that there is practically no closet space. But it is New York and most hotels are that way - unless if you're paying more obviously. The only reason I cant give it a 5 star review is due to the lack of wi-fi (you have to pay a daily fee to get access to their wi-fi) and the customer service. In this day and age wi-fi is just a standard. It's even free at most fast food locations! Customer service, was slow. Everybody at the front desk is friendly and helpful for the most part, but there were just long wait times. Having a guy cut in front of me after I'd waited 15 minutes to check out didnt really help... But all in all it was a great place to stay.

Close to Time Square and Fifth Ave. (actually right in the middle) Luxurious soaps and bath products.. nice radio with I-pod connector. comfortable beds nice flat screen-- good value.Concierge was nice and helpful.

The staff is what makes this hotel the best in the new york city area. You can not go wrong staying at the Cassa. Great rooms and a fantastic vibe. Staff so helpful to out of town tourists and friendly all of the time. If location is what you are after without being in the absolute thick of times sqaure of rockefeller, then this is the place. The beds are amazing. We spent 5 nights here and absolutely loved it. Highly recommend to anybody staying in new york.

Stayed 3 nights at Cassa as part of our honeymoon travels. From the genuinely kind bellhop to the always-accomodating concierge staff, we had a wonderful experience. We stayed in a presidential 2-room suite that was clean, comfy, well-sized and decorated with great taste. Room service was delicious (try the french toast and berries and oatmeal!!!). Location was PERFECT for us, with great restaraunts, theater, and attractions in walking distance. We highly recommend staying at this charming hotel!

This is a condo hotel and the amenities reflect the fact that a good many of the units in the building are residences. This fact is also reflected in the quality of the doormen, desk staff, etc. These are all a cut above what you will find in a hotel only property.The "deluxe" rooms are good sized for the city. Bathrooms are small as are nearly all hotel bathrooms in New York, but they are well appointed and manageable for a male traveler. Females may have trouble depending on the number of items they use (dryer, curling irons, makeup, etc).I used Hotwire to book the room and got a fair rate. The rates booking directly seem a bit high, but again this is NYC and that goes with the turf.The location is great. Far enough from Times Square to avoid the thronging masses of tourists with no idea where they're going or what they're doing yet close enough to enjoy some of the benefits the area has to offer. Hotwire calls this a Times Square hotel, but I would characterize it as midtown.

A great hotel with emphasis on the care team! Great location, fast lifts, great service. I think that area could have a better breakfast.Um otimo hotel com destaque para o atendimento da equipe! Ótima localização, elevadores rápidos, grande atendimento. Penso que poderiam ter uma melhor área de cafe da manhã
user_name:
Esther e jose D
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

review_body: We are very happy with everithing, de staff, the room, the localisation, perfect.

The Cassa is fresh & new, the furnishings are modern and the bed is fabulously comfy. It's location is great being close to times square and within walking distance to all that New York has to offer. The room is classic NY small but they have creatively made the best use of the space available. The concierge and several staff were on hand at reception to help with any requests and a quick check-in. Some of their amenities like the hotel restaurant were not completed at the time we were there, but we didn't miss it as New York itself had more than enough to offer. We were able to obtain a good rate online, which made our stay even better.

i stayed a few days with the family and we loved the hotel.The location is great close to shopping and restaurant.The rooms are new and very very modern.The service is awsome. Personnal take care about you and offer you the best!I recommend this hotel to evryone!!
Excellent location, super clean,very warmlyIs one of my favorite hotel in ny

i actually staye at this hotel the first day/night they opened in august 2010.it's a really nice hotel with very nice rooms! Bed was amazingly comfortable, bathroom was light and fresh. The shower was big and amazing!Very quite rooms, not that big but good enough!They were still building the resturant and other thing but it never bothered me much. Once they were fixing the elevators, but luckily i was "only" on the 12th floor so i could take the stairs down. Otherwise the elevators were quick.When the resturant not was ready when i arrived i got free breakfast at a very nice place around the corner, Café Un Deux Trois. I really recommend this hotel! it's in the middle and you have nearly nothing to complain about!

The room was very clean and very comfortable. We got a large room on 26th floor.Air conditioning was a little noisy, but you can sleep with it.The bathroom was excellent, with a very large shower and excellent lighting.The view from the room wasn't exciting.The hotel is in a new building, very fashion.There was a big LCD, but without satellite channels.Very Bad: they want 10$/day for internet access. For the price of the hotel, I wanted it for free.However, there is a Starbucks in front of the hotel, so you can connect from there.

Although the location is good, the hotel is really overpriced! The room I checked was supposed to be a double room to saty 3 days, but it was very very small. I totally agree with the other comments. There was no living and storage space! Personal not polite. Find another hotel with best quality-price ratio! they cannot charge 350$/day for this!!!!!!!

I stayed at this hotel for a week end family get together. I thought it was an oasis in a sea of over priced, big box hotels. My room was no smaller then a family member's who stayed at the Marriott a few blocks away. I thought the room was well appointed and the staff was excellent!The hotel and room were very clean and well maintained. The only down side was the restaurant had not yet opened but the neighborhood provided excellent choices so this wasn't a problem. I can't say enough of about how pleasant and professional the staff was not just to me but to everyone they encountered. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay here again when in town.
Everything was perfect! Staff was awesome, room was very nice and the location was great! Will hopefully be back soon!

We booked through Hotwire, 4star last minute Midtown for $165. Had never heard of Cassa so checked TripAdvisor, most reviews were good but some said they were treated poorly due to booking through Hotwire. That wasnt the case with us, it's a pretty small hotel, since a lot of the buidling is condo's, the staff was very friendly and very helpful with where to buy what, where to eat, had plenty of menu's available to print off for us and always smiled and wished us a nice day as we left for the day. The bed was a double or maybe a queen, so that was a bit a detractor. Location is great, 2 blocks from time square, 4 blocks from 30rock. 1 block from a subway stop. Grreat stay

Booked through Hotwire.Arrived late evening after flight from London. Small room with small bed -air conditioning so noisy we complained and engineer stripped it down. However this made no difference so we asked to move to another room. This about 2 a.m. UK time!We moved to another room with no air con noise. Offered an upgrade for the following three nights (which we had to pay for - $75 + taxes!). The upgraded room had a king size bed but again noisy air con so we were offered the choice of two other rooms - that's four within 24 hours!We chose a suitable room and it was ok after this. The front desk staff were helpful, especially Eric the concierge. We were given a complimentary continental breakfast as we'd had all the trouble with the room. But beware if you book with Hotwire the rooom is a single , not a double and you lose any benefit you might have gained through booking with them by having to upgrade.

I just checked in in this hotel in the executive room. It is very small. I totally agree with the comments below. There is no storage space!!! Very disappointing !! There is not a lobby and a restaurant.I do not recommend!

This is yet another NYC hotel that gives you style over space and functionality. Location is great, but you would think that in this day and age, a new business hotel would have this figured out. We had an executive room (two steps up from the standard) that was quite small. Work desk was only large enough to hold a laptop. No dresser, and a tiny closet -- we ended up living half out of our suitcases because there was nowhere to unpack. The bed was terrific. I'm not sure where other reviewers stayed, but we saw two rooms of our type, and both were small and totally lacking in storage (second room was worse than ours).Bathroom was good (shower only - no tub) and all worked well, but again, no storage space. We had some difficulties with things not working in our room, and the staff was polite but not terribly helpful - they acted as if we were just being difficult, when in fact something was actually broken (the air conditioner). And after being open for a year, there is still no restaurant (and it doesn't look as if one is on the horizon soon).We wanted to like the Cassa, but there were just too many issues, and for the price (we paid over $400/night), there are better places to stay in NYC.PS -When will good business hotels stop charging for internet service?!?
As stated, excellent location and excellent service. The only downside is the small bed.
We spent a pleasant week in the hotel. The rooms are large and beautiful. The hotel is very new Room service is very good. I recommend it to all those who wish to be close to Time Square

Sup guys! We had been in Las vegas nov 2010, Florida March/April 2011, Florida July/August 2011 and Here NYC October 2011 and This hotel is GREAT!!!!We passed a good vacations there, the staff was great and very helpfullthe standard room was pretty and enough for 2 personnes this is why I said under that Don't be demanding if you choose this room because if you guys are still outside so you don't need to get a big room...only if you're rich or with your familly, clean room to the bed till the bathroom I recommend this hotel because the staff is very great all day they are still smiling We'll come backSalut tout le monde!Nous avions ete a Las vegas nov 2010, Floride Mars/Avril 2011, Floride Julliet/Aout 2011 and Here NYC Octobre 2011 est cette hotel est Super!!!Nous avons passés des excellents vacances, le personnel ete super gentil et tres serviableLa chambre standard est très belle et assez pour 2 personnes et c'est pourquoi en dessous j'ai dit ne soyez pas exigeants! si vous choisissez cette chambre parce vous allez toujours etre dehors donc c'est pas la peine de prendre une grande chambre sauf si vous etes riches ou en famille...chambre propre du lit jusqu’à la salle de bainJe recommande cette hotel parce que le personnel est tres sympa toute la journee et tres souriant Nous reviendrons

I booked the Cassa Hotel and Residences through Hotwire, this past August, the rate was $170. Everything was fine, the room, was on the small side but seemed recently renovated. Since I was travelling alone, no issues with the bed size. As already mentioned the hotel is well situated and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful.I think with a 4 Star rating I was expecting the facilities to be a little nicer, the rooms a little bigger etc. For example, the gym was fine but not amazing. Given the rate I think it was a good deal and would stay here again.

First the good news: The hotel is well located for both business and pleasure. I was there on business and was able to walk to four different meetings with large financial institutions all located in the area. After hours there were plenty of restuarants and bars nearby and, of course, just a short walk to Times Square. Also, the front desk personnel were without exception friendly and helpful.Now the bad news: I had a room on the 26th floor which I believe is the highest floor of the hotel (the residences start on 27). Each morning I was awakened around 7:00 by a very loud, obnoxious noise that sounded like the howl of a prehistoric monster or a creature from the TV show Lost. I believe the noise came from the elevator shaft but have no idea how it was generated. Perhaps some air compression from the operation of the elevator? For that reason alone, I would not chose this hotel again. I will also say that although my bed was perfectly big and comfortable, the room itself was quite small. And by the way, there is no lobby.Lastly, for some reason my room was not properly outfitted. There was no TV channel guide, no umbrella in the armoire, and no mini-bar refrigerator (which my colleagues had in their rooms).I was booked into this room by my travel agent who said it was a much better deal than the higher end hotels I usually use. Perhaps I am out of touch with NYC hotel rates but at $350 for night one, and $450 for nights 2-3, it didn't seem like much of a bargain.

Firstly I agree with the bed size issue. If you're a couple then you must aim for a King sized bed as otherwise you'll end up hugging each other in their so called Queen size... which is more like a large single. After some discussions we managed to obtain a room with a King size bed in a delux room free of charge which made a huge difference to us given we stayed for five nights. The room decor is very neat, the large TV on the wall is a nice touch too. Bathroom has a nice spacious shower and all is clean and proper as one would expect. Internet is $10 for 24hrs which is a bit of a nag but acceptable. We didnt bother with breakfast at the hotel as you have numerous cafes around you with in meters from the hotel (Starbucks, Pret-a-Manger etc) not to mention being one block (yes thats right, one block!) away from Times square. We booked very late and this was the best we could get for the money and I must say it was a great choice. Patrick at the front desk was a delight to deal with and helped us where possible. Some of the other staff did come off more rigid so its a bit of a mixed bag. Also, advise given was that the standard rooms are very small and that a deluxe room is a must for longer stays. So if you're a couple then try and grab a deluxe with a king bed as it will make all the difference.

Cassa is centrally located to all the Midtown attractions. We liked that it was far enough away from Times Square but still close to all the other fun places. Front desk was friendly. The rooms were appointed nicely. Really liked the open shower and bathroom vanity.

We stayed at Cassa in June of 2011 on our honeymoon. Firstly the hotel is very well located for NYC first timers, roughly in the middle of Manhattan Island at 70 West 45th Street, between Fifth and Sixth (just west of Times Square). Secondly it is new (works were still being completed to the adjoining residences during our stay, they had no impact upon us though I note) and the rooms are accordingly clean and modern. The other thing about the rooms is, for NYC hotels (we saw several friends rooms), they are big. We had plenty of room for cases and luggage, something some of our friends envied very much! The hotel also has a gym in the basement which is functional, if not a little small. One thing we did not try during our stay was the restaurant, partly because it seemed a little pricy, partly because there were many options around the hotel (Starbucks across the street, street vendors outside and a short walk to the offerings of Times Square and Broadway). NYC also provides so many amazing food and entertainment options we were hardly in the hotel, we loved that city. In summary I would have no problem recommending the hotel to anyone, it is modern and clean with large (for NYC standards) rooms and friendly, efficient staff.
Treated as second class citizen when booking through Hotwire. DON'T risk it !

Like others who have booked Cassa through Hotwire, we ended up with a small room but we had paid a small price so fair's fair. We were welcomed at the reception by staff who were very helpful throughout our three night stay. The Cassa felt fresh and new with smart, modern decor. Unfortunately, it also feels unfinished (there's an underground area that looks like it might be a restaurant someday) and we never saw any sign of a bar, dining area or business facilities. Speaking of facilities, I've automatically deducted one star for not providing complimentary internet access. In this day and age, I'd rather bring my own towel than pay exorbitant fees for a basic wireless service. Hint: Starbucks across the road provides free ATTwifi. The bed was fine, nothing amazing but OK. The bathroom had a good rainfall shower and felt much bigger than it looked. Unfortunately, the crap ironing facilities deduct another point. The ironing board is two feet long, slides around dangerously on the worktop, and some glue stuck to the bottom of my iron ruined my shirt. The helpful staff immediately replaced the iron before too much damage was done, attempted to dry clean the shirt, and paid for my limo to Newark as a remedy so at least they made every effort to fix the fault.

Saw a 4 Star Hotel in Midtown for $138 a night on a Sunday night on Hotwire, and was booked into the Cassa. I immediately read the trip advisor reviews, so I was prepared to deal with the full size bed problem that others have detailed.I checked in, and was told that since I booked on Hotwire, I would be given a room with a full size bed. I asked for an upgrade, and the clerk told me $50 for a queen bed or $75 for a king bed. I then asked for a complimentary upgrade, and was told that that would be very difficult since their hotel has been sold out for months. Terrible reasoning, given that she already has indicated they have rooms with queens or kings available. She typed away for a while and continued to discuss the fact that hotwire bookings automatically get put in the smallest rooms. Then out of nowhere, she realized that the room that the computer had already booked me into was a room with a queen. So I said "great" and was ready to take the keys. She then had to radio up to staff to inspect the room. After waiting for 7-8 minutes, I was given my keys and we were on our way. Very long check-in process.The room was good. Large Flat Screen TV, good A/C, Queen Bed, Walk-in shower. Got ready and headed out for the night. After returning to the hotel around 2am, we got ready for bed. At 3:30AM, I woke up to the sound of someone sliding a key into my door and trying to open the door. By the time I got up and looked through the peephole, the person was gone. Strange. At 8am, we were woken up by VERY loud drilling above us. I called down to the front desk and they said there was no construction going on in the hotel. I told her there clearly was as I could barely hear her on the phone with the loud drilling. After 10 minutes the drilling stopped. Drilling noises were not a nice alarm clock, particularly after a night of drinking.The front desk arranged for a car service to JFK on the way out, which was helpful.Overall, Cassa is lucky to receive an Average rating. Worth $138 for sure. But nowhere near being worth the $350+ their website was showing.

Beware. When I checked in, I was informed that Hotwire customers are automatically given a smaller room with a full-size bed (rather than a larger queen or king), a blatant attempt to upsell. When I asked if the hotel was sold out, I was told no. So I said, then how about upgrading me? Not without more money, said the check-in clerk. So I went to my tiny room, so small that the bathroom door had to be shoved past the toilet seat to open all the way. Worse, the room had a bad dirty-diaper smell. When I informed the front desk, I was told someone would look into it -- and no one ever mentioned it to me again. The next day, I discovered that the room next door had some sort of leak, which is probably what was causing the smell. Also, I went out 10 am and when I returned to the room at 3, it still hadn't been serviced. Oh, and the modern-design room has such idiotic touches as a recessed space for plugging in laptops that prevents anything except standard-size plugs from fitting unless you pulled the entire outlet out of the desk, which someone before me had already done. So, nice location, but small room, bad smell, lousy service equals no deal.

The marketing department for this hotel needs to be hired by the US government, they could make the current debit situation seem like the best thing since slice bread was invented. Please take note their web site view of the lobby is an artist rendering only the real lobby is very cold, like you are walking into a meat chill room. There are so many things wrong with this place I don't know where to begin. Let's go with small rooms, how small, yes I'm going to say it. It was so small I had to leave the room to change my mind. The tv was wider than the bed, no tub only a shower with one towel. Not to mention the 3ft ironing board, thank goodness we were only there for two nights. This is not a four star property, it is a hostel with bellmen.

We booked our room using Hotels.com, because of a rebate offered by Mr. Rebates (www.mrrebates.com). The rate was $199 a night, not bad for midtown Manhattan! We stayed here from September 30th till October 1st. We absolutely loved it!We were looking for a place near Times Square but not right IN Times Square (too noisy). The Cassa is just a couple of blocks away--a quick, easy walk. We booked a standard room which had a full-sized bed. When we got there the concierge said "I see that you requested a quiet room, so we upgraded you to a deluxe room at no charge". Sweet!!! Let me just also say that everyone, from the valet who met us at the curb (we drove) to the ladies and gentlemen at the front desk, and every single person we came into contact with was genuinely warm, welcoming and attentive. The concierge handed us a list of special activities in the city that day and night (free Black-Eyed Peas concert in Central Park!) and many other suggestions for fabulous things to do. The next morning, we had a new one under our door.Our room was 2308. There's a very fast elevator, actually two of them. Walking down the hallway to the room, I thought, "ho-hum", didn't seem like anything special, but when we opened the door to the room, wow! The rooms have obviously been completely remodeled and are done in a very modern motif. Everything was stylish and functional--and beautiful! I told my husband I wanted a bathroom just like the one in our room, and took lots of photos to remember all the little details. (I do have photos and when I get them transferred from my camera I'll post them here).Everything you need is in this room. Refrigerator, safe, ironing board and iron, fax, really nice hair dryer, umbrella, wall mounted flat screen TV, MP3 docking station with remote, comfy leather chairs, high-quality linens on a bed that was heavenly to sleep in, thick terrycloth bathrobes on satin hangers for both of us, high-quality toiletries (the soap was so luscious and lathery I made sure to take the extra bar home with me). The rooms are not large, but big enough. The one thing I was disappointed in was that the high speed internet was not free--you had to pay at least $10 a day to use it. This is a pet peeve of mine with hotels. Internet access should be standard, not an add-on, especially in this day and age! However, everything else was so good I won't complain too much about that (and I did NOT pay the money to have internet access--just used my phone.) I didn't hear any noise all night from other rooms or from the street. It really was quiet, so if you want a quiet room, this is a good one.There's a cafe on the tenth floor with tables indoors and also outside on the Terrace. You can have breakfast there, or not. You can just sit there and relax on the Terrace if you want. Breakfast is very expensive, and the Cranberry Cafe is steps away on 45th Street and an amazing and inexpensive place for breakfast or any other time of the day. I highly recommend you walk over there!We had tickets for Jersey Boys and walked from the hotel to the theater, stopping along the way at Arriba Arriba Mexican restaurant at 762 9th Avenue. They have an early bird menu until 6 PM and unlike most prix fixe menus, the portions were full-sized (none of us could finish) and included an appetizer, and entree, and either a frozen margarita or sangria. The service was great and the food delicious. I had the quesadillas as an appetizer, the taco salad as an entree (shredded beef--not ground, and lots of it!), and the frozen margarita. Everything was superb. If you order the same thing you'll be happily surprised. All this for $14.95! Then on to the show, which was also great (don;t be afraid of the partial view seats in the last rows of the orchestra--you can actually see everything), then another walk back to the hotel.Check out time is noon. Valet parking is $50.00 and if you have a car I recommend it. Give them about ten minutes advanced notice and they bring your car right up to the front entrance when you want to leave.We had a wonderful stay and were so comfortable! We'll book this hotel again the next time we're in NYC.A couple of hints: If you absolutely have to drive to the hotel, it's on the left side of W 45th Street heading north, right before the intersection of 45th and 6th Avenue. (Between 5th and 6th Avenues) It has a cream-colored entrance that's easy to miss. It has the words CASSA written sideways on the outside wall next to the front revolving doors, so look for that. When we first drove up to the hotel, we couldn't see anywhere to go with our car--there's no place to park and no obvious signs for valet parking, so we had to go around the block again. I called from the car and asked what to do with the car and was told to just pull up in front of the hotel and they'd come out and take the car to the off-site parking garage. That's what we did, and the valet was waiting for us and waved us into a spot, then unloaded our luggage and handed off the car to a parking attendant. So remember, don't look for a garage, just stop right in front of the hotel and don't worry if someone behind you honks--it's NYC after all! Also, there's a minibar in the room. We didn't open it. Why be tempted?Overall a great place. Highly recommended. Pictures to follow very soon.

We couldn't have been more pleased with the Cassa. Everything from the location, room, & friendly staff combined for a great week in the Big Apple. We didn't use any public transportation, walked to the theatres, restaurants and shopping. The staff is very friendly and went out of their way to please us. The room was small but, hey, it's NYC! The bed was comfortable and the linens were cozy. We loved the shower and the flatscreen TV was a nice treat. I would definitely recommend it and will stay there again.

I stayed at the Cassa hotel for four nights last week (9/15-9/21/2011). This is my second stay at this hotel. When I arrived there was an issue with the air conditioning and the size of the bed. These things happen anywhere and I was very pleased and impressed by the manner in which it was taken care of by the chef concierge, Nick. Please pass on my compliments to the management. The front desk people the last time I stayed there were also excellent.I like this hotel for its location 3 blocks from Bryant park and 7 blocks from MOMA. It is midtown without the extremes of Times square. The hotel is actually quite quiet and I love having that vest pocket park right across from the hotel. The rooms are fitted like a ship....not especially large but very well planned. The closet space could be larger but for a few days stay it's sufficient. The bathrooms are very european modern in the best sense. (love the rain forest shower head)The restaurant on the first level hasn't opened yet but the 10th floor suite they use for breakfast and cocktails is quite special in that it has this huge balcony you can sit on across from that vest pocket park I mentioned.Again, I was very pleased and were it not for the lobby area construction I'd give it 5 stars.Also please pass on my compliments to the management and particularly to the chef concierge, Nick.Gerard, Portsmouth NH

My daughter and I just came back after 6 nights in the Cassa hotel. The location is great. Some days we didn't use any public transportation. It is a couple of minutes from Times square, 5th avenue, Rockefeller center, MoMa the theaters, and if you're not lazy and enjoy walking - Central park as well. We were upgraded and got a junior suit, with a very large bed which was the most comfortable bed I ever had. The room had nice size, looks new and was very clean. The bathroom was shining clean as well. The staff is amazingly nice and helpful. You can ask them anything and always get good recommendations. I only missed the Lobby which is not ready yet, and free internet (but you can get it at Starbucks just across the street). The only thing I didn't like is the prices at the little restaurant they have, but it sent us to look for breakfast adventures in many different places. I will definitely recommend this hotel and hope to be back soon.

Booked through hotwire which mis -classified it as a 4 star hotel. It may be if you pay more than the base rate. For the rate hotwire offers it is a 2-3 star hotel.For $320 per night you get a tiny room & a tiny bed. Service is pretty minimal-there is no turndown service & we got 1 terry cloth robe to share between 2 of us. As another reviewer notes, the place is stark. Not pleasant or romantic or attractive. Minimal & adequatedescribe it.

Stayed here with a girlfriend during a recent visit to NYC. Close enought to Time Square to walk, yet not right in the middle of the craziness. Minutes to restaurants, subway, etc. Staff was very welcoming and friendly. Room has modern ammenities, larger than normal "NYC rooms". Comfortable bed, and quiet. This property also has residents so they keep out the rif raff so to speak. If you want a location close to Time Square that is clean, updated, and has friendly service, this is your place.

This is a midtown hotel with a good location. the lobby is very stark as is most of the hotel. but it is very new and well done. the rooms are decent sized for New York, but depending on location some are larger than others. The amenities are good and the staff is very helpful. Bottom line is that if they are offerring decent prices I would definitely return.

I have no major complaints. Realize, the restaurant is still not open, the "lounge" is empty, ask them for a Cosmo, they don't serve "speciality" drinks. Location is great. Was on the 6th floor, it was in a different area than the newer tower. I think the first ten floors are converted from an older building, higher floors are in new construction. Hallways very narrow and carpet was dirty, housekeepeing did a great job with what they had to work with.

The location is fantastic. When you exit the hotel - if you turn right, you hit 5th Avenue. If you turn left and cross one block, you hit Times Square. Across the road is a Starbucks. Around the corner are convenient stores.The room itself is small and ordinary.There is no fridge.Internet is at least $10 / day.The aircon is quite cold.There was one incident that sort of marred my entire experience. 20 minutes after I just checked in and was in the shower, there was knock on my door and 5 seconds later - a staff just walked in. Then he apologised saying he was checking to see if things was alright. I thought this was VERY rude and unprofessional. Since then, I locked the inside door latch every time I was inside.Would I stay here again? Sure, but only if I could get it at a discount. I think $400 ++ per night is incredibly overpriced. However, I got this $200 via Hotwire so it was a great deal for me.

The hotel is at an exteremly good location between Times square and 5th Avenue. Most places are at walking distance. Since the hotel not finished yet there are not much ammaneties available but rooms are cleana nd adequate for a room in Manhattan. Therefore if your need is a good bed, clean rooms and decent bathrooms. This is the hotel.Though I don't like to be charged for Internet when I pay this much or hear breakfast not included. Besides that all hotel personnel was helpful and nice.

We stayed at the Cassa for a week at the end of august. When we arrived check in was extremely quick and our room was upgraded. The room was small, but who stays in there room in New York (except during Hurricane Irene maybe). Nice big TV in the room and a radio with alarm clock, also having a travel adapter provided in the room was very helpful. The room and bathroom were always spotless and the shower was great, very powerful. The best part of the hotel is its location, 2 blocks from times square and 5th avenue in the other direction. Everything is in walking distance. We were given weather information every morning under the door and this was very useful for planning each day and even more helpful during the hurricane at the weekend. Only 2 very small negative points are the WIFI is not free and the duvet is not put in a cover, just between 2 sheets and we found a coverless duvet on top of us every morning. Overall a great place to stay in New York City,
Very accommodating, was still under construction at the time, but they did their best to make us happy. I would stay here again, but I usually like to stay in a more quiet side of town.

We booked Cassa after reading decent reviews on Trip Advisor. The real advantage of this place is the location. Two blocks from time square, two blocks from 5th Avenue, a stroll from Radio City and Rockafellar centre. This hotel means that you can walk most places of interest very easily. We were upgraded from their basic room. The room was smaller than we might have like but to be fair this is central manhattan and it is about two blocks from time square so I didn't expect a huge room. The room was well equipped with a decent hair dryer, iron and ironing board and a large full length mirror. The shower was very spacious and the room was spotless. We stayed during hurricane Irene and the staff were extremely helpful, providing us with regular updates on the progress of the storm, what restaurants and shops were planning to open etc. Our flight out on Sunday was cancelled and we had to book an extra night. I couldn't help but thinkg that they exploited the situation and charged us nearly $500 for the night. There was also a mistake on our bill and when we queried it and pointed out that we hadn't eaten breakfast at the hotel and the signature clearly wasn't that of my husband or I, it was removed but we didn't get an apology for the mistake! Otherwise the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful.

My husband and I just spent 5 nights at the Cassa and we were absoultuely pleased with everything! We had booked though hotwire.com and had some concern that the hotel might be a bust. But instead it was fantastic. The staff....all of them....are extraordinarily friendly and helpful. When we wanted tickets to shows...they got them for us at a discount and had them delivered to the hotel. When we wanted restaurant recommendations...they picked the best! The location is two blocks from Times Square, and you can get to anywhere from there on the subway. We will highly recommend the Cassa to all our friends and co workers who will be going to New York. Thank you wonderful staff....I hope you are all there when we come back again....and we will be!

I would highly recommend this hotel! The hotel itself is very nice. It is new and very modern. Very clean! The staff are all extremely friendly. I booked on hotwire and had no idea what to expect. They upgraded our room for free to a queen size bed deluxe instead of the double size bed that comes standard when you book with hotwire. Every time we went in and out of the hotel we were always greeted genuinely and there was always a door man there to help assist if your hands were full. The rooms are amazing! Small but in New York City all the rooms are small in the hotels. Nice and clear large flat screen T.V., VERY comfortable bed! The location of this hotel is PERFECT, close to literally everything in a safe, nice area. 5 minute walk to times square, walking distance to shopping, restaurants, empire state building, etc. Overall, this was the best experience I have ever had at any hotel! I am a loyal member to the Hilton hotel chain and have stayed in many nice hotels but never have I experienced customer service as I did here. Nothing negative I could say about this hotel. PERFECT LOCATION, EXCELLENT SERVICE, CLEANLINESS, MODERN NEW HOTEL. RECOMMENDED!!!

We had an amazing time at Cassa. We went there for a week's holiday to celebrate our anniversary and it was superb. The hotel was excellent: an amazing location just next to Bryant Park and only a short walk from Central Park; the room was incredible (the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on); and the staff were amazing - so friendly and helpful. I couldn't recommend it strongly enough. We'll certainly be staying there when we go back to NYC.

Hotel is located between Times Square on one side and 5th ave on the other. Our room had a double bed and a huge TV and huge bathroom - it was so clean and airy and big - not your standard NY hotel box room. Whilst the reception area was (is?) under construction the staff were so so friendly and very helpful -a simple thing like someone smiling and saying hello makes a big difference after spending all day braving the streets/subways of NY.

My wife and I stayed at the Cassa for four nights during July. Rooms are clean, service is good, and the hotel location is quite practical for someone with a shopping agenda in NYC. the hotel gym is rather small but has the basic equipment. Hotel price is rather too high for the overall value of what is offered

Can't really beat the location, it's perfect as 5th ave and times square are only a block away. The hotel is modern and well kept. The room was quite tiny and we experienced the elevator problem too (although they did say they were in the process of fixing this) but these are minor complaints, if that. The staff were probably better than anywhere we've ever stayed - Kevin helped us out with anything and everything we needed, definitely ask for him!! Overall extremely happy with Cassa.

Our room wasn't when we arrived (early) so we checked our bags and wandered the city. In a short while, the hotel staff called to let us know our room was ready. A lovely surprise awaited us. The manager had upgraded us from a queen room to a king suite! Beautiful white leather sofas, plasma screen television (huge) and luxury bedding and bath. Very nice hotel and great location.

Close to times square and billed as boutique but still small rooms, small lobby and passageways so not much room to enjoy any public areas. We booked on hot-wire and for one night was ok but for longer you need more room

Perfect location 2 minutes away from 5th ave and time square I came on a business tip with a Business partner and had 2 rooms at this hotel, the stuff were great as we needed allot of help, and the rooms were great Can't wait to go back and stay At this hotel

I found the staff at this hotel very helpful. Before leaving for NYC I emailed the hotel looking for the easiest way to get there from JFK airport. They answered me within a few hours. When we got to the airport we looked for the shuttle that would drop us at Grand Central Station. This cost $15. There was none there so we ended up getting the G0-airport link shuttle. It's a mini bus that brings you to your hotel for $19. You have to share it with others but we didn't mind that. When we got to our hotel room, it was very clean but also small. This didn't bother us but it did surprise us a little! The room was cleaned everyday and had a great TV and air conditioning. The bed was very comfortable. The location of the hotel is excellent - just a few minutes from times square, shops and restaurants - everything you need really! Every morning the hotel gave us an information sheet on the weather and what to do in NYC. It's a lovely idea and helpful as we knew when to expect rain!! You can walk to most places from the hotel but a metro card for the subway also came in handy - $29 for unlimited use. We got an NYC explorer pass on line before we left and I think it's a good idea. You still have to queque to get your tickets but it save you a little money. I really enjoyed my visit to New York and would definitely stay at this hoyel again.

Still a bit of construction, and there must have been a flood on my floor as the rug was wet, but if the price was right, I would stay here every time I am in New York!First, the staff are outstanding! Genuinely nice, friendly, helpful, and proud of where they work.The rooms have everything you need and is totally up to date - comfortable...The neighborhood is great - enough food and variety.Close enough to walk to Grand Central.

My wife and I stayed here for one night in June 2011. We arrived at 09:30 am, before check in time but this was no problem for the staff. We were able to check in as normal and a room became available about an hour later.The hotel is ideally located for Times Square. The concierge service is great, there is always someone on hand to offer advice. The room itself was clean, modern and well equipped. There was some on going building work going on at the hotel during our stay however we did not notice any inconvenience.We stored our luggage at the hotel after check out for all of the following day at no extra cost, a fine hotel, highly recommenced, if I had to stay in that part of New York again I would stay in that hotel.

Being the first time to NYC my wife and I were unsure what response we would have from New Yorkers and what a good location would be. When we arrived at Cassa we were greeted warmly at the door and at the front desk. Abraham checked us in promptly and efficiently and it was obvious he enjoyed being part our experience. Although the hotel is under renovation the areas were behind glass and curtained off. The elevators were available with little waiting time during our stay. The rooms were small by our usual (non NYC) standards but spotless and clean. The concierge service was very helpful and got us off to a great start on our weekend experience. Being located so close to Times Square and a couple of great Irish Pubs was a big plus as well. I would definitely recommend the Cassa Hotel to my friends.

We did get a good rate on Hotwire for this hotel, but the bed was TOO small! We had the option to pay 50 dollars more for a queen. We thought this was too much to pay for that size bed. We were disappointed that others here who posted here got free upgrades but we did not. It would seem to make good business sense to allow upgrades for empty rooms. We did think that location was great and the shower was awesome. The front desk was fine although we did get some incorrect information about the TKTS booth. Be sure and confirm all info online if that is possible.

We had a tiring 5 days in NYC from this excellent location, right between Times Square and 5th Ave.Reception staff were excellent and especially Eric, who helped us out with info & dinner bookings.The room was very clean (and I am OCD) and the air con was definitely required!My only criticism was the fact that the bed was only a double but worse was the fact that the duvet did not have a cover - only two sheets around it to resemble a cover. These obviously came off during the night to expose the duvet which freaked me out (the OCD cleanliness thing - other people had had this next to them!!) I think this is definitely something that should be addressed from a health point of view. If I went again I would take my own duvet cover!!!

There is a bit of a design problem with this hotel that is more or less a deal killer. Only two elevators service more than 30 floors. When I arrived back after work at around 6:30, after walking 8 blocks in the NY summer heat carrying my laptop bag, one of the elevators was broken and there was a long line for the other. The line wasn't moving so after about 10 minutes, me and another guest decided to walk it. At least there was another elevator bank that got me to the tenth floor so I only had to walk six flights to my room on the 16th. But this is unacceptable. Also, my room was tiny and the hallway was all torn up even though this place is supposedly brand new. I won't stay here again. I just value the basics and having to walk up and down isn't right.

Rating is 3 1/2.Unfamiliar with the hotel but very familiar with the area combined with my urgent need for a room, and prices outrageous in the city during this week, I took advantage of a low rate I found on Quikbook.Perfect location, attentive front desk staff and an upgrade to one of their condos had me thinking that after my long flight I had really lucked out. Entering the one-bedroom unit, I thought something had been forgotten. Namely a personality. This looked like a place that had been on the market for awhile and had reluctantly been set up as a rental. If I was in the market for a NYC condo in a fantastic location - 45th and 6th - I would jump at this place. But I'd have to furnish.- Hardwoods throughout- Large living/dining area with a table, loveseat- Very nice modern kitchen with plates, glasses, but NO utensils. In this room, I guess you eat with your fingers.- Really nice bathroom- Nice sized bedroom with NO TV. I thought someone stole it- White stark walls with little decoration- Broken elevator for a 30+ story building leaving only one in working orderThis upgrade found me in a tremendously large room but while large, it was a shell. And the hotel should understand that some touches of warmth, decor and the usual necessities of a stay would put this place over the top in a major way. And it did make me wonder what the regular hotel rooms were like.Oh, and if someone did take the TV out of the bedroom, please return. Who doesn't like to fall asleep after a long day in the city with the glow of a TV.Woudl I return? Probably but it would need to be at a great rate.

This hotel was a surprise. It had everything - - great location, helpful & courteous staff, comfortable & clean rooms, and for NYC standards, large rooms - - and all at a great price. What a find! We will definitelyuse thisplace again.

We wanted a more 'boutique' experience from our NYC trip...but with all the mod cons and comfort. This hotel had outstanding comfort and space right in the centre of Times Square precinct.On a previous stay we used the Westin Times Square which was great...but the Cassa gave us all the comfort and location, but more intimate and...well... cheaper!The staff here are great. The service is not stuffy or pretentious.We travel a lot and clean and quiet rooms with comfortable beds and good bathrooms are critical to our hotel selection. Big ticks at the Cassa!We are both very tall, so chose the Executive Room...it had plenty of space for us to relax and unwind, as well as a large King bed (which was divine).Simply put...the Cassa will be our choice for our next trip to NYC...no contest.

We stayed here the first weekend of July for two nights. We booked through booking.com about two months out and got a really good deal. The hotel was easy to find (despite lack of signage outside) and check in was quick and easy. Pros: The room was clean and modern with a great comfortable bed and large flatscreen tv. The shower was amazing and wish I had one at home! The room had a fridge/mini bar, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and a blow dryer. Staff were friendly and it was nice to have a list of things to do and the weather slid under the door each day. The hotel was in a great location with easy access to Times Square.Cons: 1) When we first used the bathroom I noticed that the floor felt like there was sand all over it. Wouldn't have noticed without bare feet. Also, old used soap was left in the shower. 2) When we went to store our drinks in the mini fridge, the door had been left ajar so nothing was cold and we noticed that it wouldn't shut at all. We told the front desk who sent maintenance to fix it while we were out. When we got back, we saw that while they rigged it to shut, the bottom seal still didn't touch and you were able to stick your fingers in while closed. Needless to say we didn't have any cold water during our stay, but didn't feel like complaining a second time. 3) We'd love free internet! Regardless, no con was a big deal or affected our view of the hotel!Overall, it was a great stay and we'll stay again when we go back to NYC!

I had the opportunity to stay in this hotel twice, the first was around christmas 2010 during the snow storm that NY got and we were so happy to be in this hotel. The location is perfect, close to everything, from the hotel you can walk to Time square, fifth avenue and central park in minutes. During last christmas NY colapsed with the tons of snow everywhere and traffic was impossible but we walked to everywhere with no problems. Another concern that we had was bed bugs, we were told that lots of hotels were infected with bed bugs so once we got into the room we made sure that the room was clean enough and we didn't have any problems with bugs.The only recomendation that we had is improving amenities in the rooms, no coffee machine or microwave are available but the staff is friendly , the reception very helpful, even helped us to print cupons from Macy's to get discount on shopping and we were able to print our boarding pass before we headed to the airpot.I will certanly recommend this hotel to everybody .

As others have pointed out, the location is great. We booked through Hotwire, but were surprised to learn that we only were going to get a full-sized bed for two men. Cassa charged us an additional $50 a night to upgrade to a king bed. We liked the room, and the bed. It was quiet as well. Staff were friendly. Only drawbacks, besides the added charge, were the lack of ice and soap in the bathroom. They offered a very nice bar of soap, but when it was gone, we were only given two thin sticks of soap for the last day of our 4 night stay.

The presentation of this hotel is terrific as is the location. Can't fault either. The rooms certainly are small but you knew that right! It was the little things though that really let this hotel down for us. We stayed there for a few days, went to Boston for a couple of days and were returning to the Cassa - they wouldn't keep a bag for a couple of days for returning clients. When my husband arrived he stored his bag for a day at the hotel and when we collected it later the bag was wet, as was all the contents. We've stayed in a few hotels around the US on this trip and this is by far the most ridiculously priced inroom wifi and phone call costs.

This hotel is situated in a nice quiet location just a few minutes walk to Times Square. Staff were exceptionally pleasant, knowledgeable and attentive to guests' needs. The rooms are decorated nicely but lacking in amenities - there were no coffee machines in rooms (nor was coffee available in the lobby), no ice buckets or ice (unless ordered by room service), and the closets are poorly designed with little space to hang/store clothing. The showers are large but there are no shelves for toiletries, etc. The hallways are dark, dingy and not air-conditioned. The lobby is very small and unfinished. Beds were very comfortable. We got an exceptional rate by booking with hotwire but would have been very upset had we paid more.

We stayed at the Cassa hotel June 25th. I could not complain about the hotel's location one bit, as we were no more than 4 blocks away from Time Square, great as we'd been wanting to see a Broadway show that evening. The hotel staff was friendly (barring the concierge, which I will explain in a moment), the room clean (though fairly small - I didn't even realize until we opened the door to our room that double-beds were even an option much less the norm), and the shower amazing (one of the natural rain-type shower heads). Again, though the room was clean, it was small enough that the ~37" LCD television felt too big to watch if that says anything. It lacked coffee in the room and in the lobby as well which I've come to expect in better hotels. As for the hotel's concierge - he was... obnoxious. We arrived at the hotel early that afternoon and were running out to get show tickets and asked him to get us reservations for some good Italian, quoting 'Babbo' (though knew getting a table would be next to impossible). I let the concierge know to try, and if not then to provide us with a small comparable selection. Coming back to the hotel the concierge asked what show we'd purchased tickets to to which we replied "Bengal Tiger (...)" and received a "you wasted your money" speech that lasted no less than 5 minutes. Excuse me? And what does he say for a restaurant, $70 for Chef Boyardee's best in my opinion. Stay at the hotel for the location, but don't even look towards the concierge's desk.

Though the standard room was on the small side it was kept clean and towels were changed daily.I cannot express how fantastic all the reception staff are, Eric was especially helpful there was nothing that we asked that he did not deliver. The bell boys were also always at hand to open doors and flag down taxi's.First time in NYC and because of my stay cannot wait to return to both the hotel and city.

I recently stayed at this hotel and although I didn't find any glaring weaknesses, I also didn't find any memorable strengths. Pros: great location near all the action, clean room, modern decor, friendly staff.Cons: tiny room, no coffee maker, no ice, stuffy room, lots of street noise, not for traditional families with children, expensive, construction going on in the lobby.With the above information taken into consideration, I would rate this a 3 star hotel. Would I ever consider staying at this hotel again--yes. Would I look elsewhere first--yes again.

Me and my (now fiancé) have just returned to the uk after staying in NYC for the first time. We chose this hotel based on the reviews and let me tell you we weren't let down! The location is brilliant! 5mins from times square and a few mins more to all the other excellent tourist sites. Every member of staff there were extremely professional, friendly and hold an extensive knowledge of the area. Our stay was made even more special as after proposing to my girlfriend in central park Eric from concierge arranged a chilled bottle of wine sent to our room compliments of the hotel and a card! I mean that's great customer service, they really do make u feel welcome and will do there upmost to make your visit memorable. Room was always very clean, excellent bed and large flat screen tv. So to summarise, great location, great rooms and excellent staff at a low cost price (by NYC standards). Hope this review was helpful, and if you do chose this hotel I think you have made a good choice. Have a nice stay in NYC!

I got a great deal through hotwire but if I had paid full price would have been VERY upset. The location is awesome a few blocks from Times Square. The hotel is actually quiet, which is hard to find in NY and great for sleeping. There is a nice radio with an ipod docking station in the room. The shower is really nice (there is no tub if that matters to you.) There is no fridge in the room or ice maker to get ice (this mattered more than I thought cause food and drinks are expensive in the area), there is no room service, there are no electrical plugs near the bed so your cell or lap top can't charge while trying to use it in bed. You have to pay for internet. There is no bar or restaurant. There were no drawers to unpack stuff, the two concierges that I asked 4 questions or recommendations didn't know the answers, and one tried to send me to Brooklyn to get Broadway tickets as opposed to 47th st because he said the line is shorter. (The line moves really quickly and took me 5 mins.) My view was off a hotel next door. The hotel ran out of conditioner but they replaced it by night. Anyways it's a good hotel and due to location and quietness I gave it a very good rating but if I had paid full price I would have been sooo mad.

We stayed here last year. The hotel was not totally finished. It was on its soft opening.Location is very good. Its a short 3-5minutes work to times square. It is in between upper and lower manhattan. You can enjoy the busy times square but sleep at night without the hassle of noise and lights. It is opposite starbucks and other local mini store/pastry shop. It is also close to subway and other major tourist attraction.The hotel is very modern. Bed is very comfy. Room size is not too small or too big. Bathroom has a big window. All stuff in the room are branded. The staff are very hospitable and warm. Free cookies in the reception.The restaurant was rendering when we stayed so they gave us vouchers to other restaurants for breakfast. Where to eat is not really a problem since there are plenty of restaurant in the area. Im only giving the rate 4 coz there are still few contruction goign on when we stayed. im sure at this time, the hotel is fully finished and the stay will be much better.it may be a bit expensive compare other hotels but it's worth it!

Checked in early in the morning and the reception accomodated us as well as upgraded our room! Nice stylish bathrooms and big lcd tv. Walking distance to all theatres as well as 5th avenue. Hardly had to take any taxis during my stay in New York. Also, the hotel looks new which is a plus.Only reason why I am not giving the full marks is that we were locked out of our room one night and had to wait before the electronic lock was fixed. Also, this hotel charges for internet which is a bit unusual nowadays.

We stayed at the Cassa Hotel from the 3rd May 11 to 7 May 11 and enjoyed our experience. We were on our honeymoon and were upgraded to better room by the guest services manager/concierge Eric Hall.The room was of a good standard, a bit of a weird shape which made it feel a bit cramped but it was still a good size. The room was clean the bathroom was modern and of a good size. There wasn't a view which didn't bother us as we weren't sitting in our room looking out the window.
