We found the room comfortable and had a good quality sleep.The hotel didn't have a restuarant although they did do breakfast and some sort of evening drinks and nibbles that we didn't try. They are in the process of putting in a restuarant but no works were being carried out during our stay.The location was fantastic, the hotel was not on a buy street but close to times square, grand central station. There a numerous good restuarants around the area of the hotel.A very big plus for the hotel was the guest services manager Eric Hall we went to him to ask a few questions about some things to see and when he found out that it was our first trip to New York he basically planned out the our trip on a map of all the things to do. We loosely followed these points of interests and had a great time.

We thought this hotel was really nice. The room was a little small, but it was very clean and the staff were extremely courteous.The concierge was very helpful and everyone was very friendly. It was close to Times Square and various restaurants. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to New York City.

This hotel is a winner as for location&cleaniness. Only downfall is the internet excess but it was manageable as starbuck across the road offers free WIFI. The concierge is ver helpfull, we had an offer for free wine which due to a mistake wasnt delievered up to our room till the last night we were there.However they said sorry with 2 bottles which was sweet of them.

We really enjoyed our recent trip to New York and staying at Cassa Hotel and Residences played a significant part in it.We got the hotel through Booking.com at a reasonable but under no circumstances cheap price. It is worth having a look on priceline or hotwire since the hotel is quite often offered at significantly lower prices through the “veil of anonymity”. Unfortunately, I didn’t have a US credit card to try my luck but can’t really complain on the price I got for a 4-star hotel right in the middle of Manhattan.In terms of location, Cassa is ideal for walks to all Manhattan attractions. One block from Times Square (close but not too close to this central but really packed area) and 3-4 blocks from Grand Central Station, it was situated very close to restaurants, theaters, cafés, shops and museums. We are indeed very fond of walking around a new city (we feel we are getting most of the real city rhythm that way) and we never felt threatened when we were walking around there even when we were returning to the hotel late at night.The room was very cozy with modern decoration and all the amenities we would expect. Big and comfortable bed, huge TV with a great selection of channels, mini-safe, mini-bar, iron and ironing board, radio, etc. We were staying on the 18th floor but unfortunately our view was to the building right next to us so not much to see. One thing that I would like them to add is free WiFi in the rooms. I honestly cannot understand with today’s internet prices, why they need to charge USD 10 per day for internet access. OK, I understand that they are after the profit they lost when people replaced hotel telephones with mobile phones but still internet is so cheap these days. Don’t think that you will have a problem in finding a free wifi location though since there is a Starbucks right across the street where you can get a nice coffee and check emails on your phone/laptop.The hotel staff was really polite and helpful in the 1-2 things that we asked from them. The daily recommendation list from the concierge that they were leaving in our rooms every day was a very nice touch and twice we had dinner at these places and enjoyed it very much.All in all, we had a great stay at the Cassa Hotel and Residences and I would definitely stay again. Please note that the hotel is very new and some parts are still under construction (e.g. lobby) so I guess that it will be even better when the construction work is finished.

This was a cool, modern, clean hotel in a perfect midtown location - just a few blocks from Rock. Center. It is hands down the quietest hotel I have ever stayed at in NYC. I heard no street noise and no hallway noise (even though my room was right on W. 45th St. and right across the hall from the elevator. Bed was super comfy and the shower was one of the best. The mini bar had all this Dean and Deluca stuff - I spent $16!! I booked this place through Travelocity's secret hotel search - I couldn't have been happier with how it ended up!

My stay at Cassa portait as a luxury hotel has been a forgettable experience.The place has a great location but that it's as far as it goes in terms of appreciating the place.The hotel has not a breakfast room that still undergoing construction, you can have breakfast on a bar on the 10th floor that clearly cannot accommodate everybody. An the choices of food are pathetic.Cassa is not a cheap place to stay, and if you come for business as I do, you expect a wifi service and 2 days the service was down although I still got charged for it.The business room where you should have the alternative to use a computer was also down however I lost money twice trying to access Internet there, because no one said the service was also downLaundery was delivered late and they forgot to deliver more than half of the items I sent to get cleaned.The answer to my complained was go to block down to an Internet caffe'. Charging a full price for something it's not up running it's simply unacceptable.

We absolutley loved our stay at this fabulous hotel. From the minute we checked in the staff were friendly and welcoming. The hotel lobby was very stylish and we really felt we were in New York. It was exactly what we had imagined it to be, and more.Our room was clean, well presented (maybe a little bit small - but hey, it's New York and we stilll found it comfortable and not at all claustrophobic) We were not disturbed by noise at all. Good sized bathroom with huge shower. Decent sized plasma TV with cable channels.The only thing would change (and I stress: only thing) was the size of the bed - it was a double. The concierge and reception staff were always so helpful with directions, dining recommendations and even helping us out with Broadway tickets.But what really made this hotel was the location. We were in this amazing city for a week and did not have to catch public transport once! One block to Times Square (but not to close) 2 blocks to Rockerfella and about a 15 minute walk to Central Park. If we are ever lucky enough to visit this incredible city again we would absolutely stay at the Cassa and recommend it to everybody.

Location: Great, between 5th and 6th. Times square a few minutes walk away as were the shops on 5th Avenue. Very safe location, although in the hustle of everything street was actually quite quiet.Rooms: Great rooms, modern, clean, great large TV, bathroom was great. Staff: Really friendly, always smiling, arranged taxis for us and concierge always willing to help recommend things for tourists.Seriously, stay here you won't be disappointedSlight notes worth mentioning: Small double beds, being a small hotel it wasn't particularly buzzy but good for a city break hotel, it's not a resort and also the wifi should be free

We stayed at Cassa on our first trip to NY for 8 nights. I couldn't be more happy with the room and the service they provide. Our room was upgraded from double bed to a king, staff at the front office were friendly, concierge guys couldn't be more helpful in giving us information and tips. Room was perfectly cleaned daily. Modern looking bedroom and bathroom, nice flat screen tv. The only negative of the room is that it is lacking a kettle/cups which I think is basic necessity as many people want to drink coffee or tea (including me). I love how a note is always placed in front of the room every morning advising the weather of the day.Last but not least, location is perfect. Midtown, close to Bryant Park station and many attraction & shopping areas. We especially enjoyed our late supper at Chipotle (mexican food) just across the road, or the food cart round the corner of 42nd st/6th ave.I will definitely stay at Cassa if I even go back to NYC!

Our experience at Cassa hotel was amaizing.the location is perfect, we got an upgrade as soon as we arrived and we couldn't speak highly about this hotel. The rooms are a little bit small but hey you are in NY.Before we booked we spent lots of time checking hotels in NY, our main concern was "bed bugs" even when we got into the room we checked everything but evething was perfectly clean and ina very neat condition .....Now we know where we will stay on our next visit to NY.Only one comment: I hope I had a microwave at the room , other than everythin was perfect about Cassa Hotel.

You can find the hotel in the city center between 5th and 6th avenue., only 5 min far from Times Square. The stuff is polite and ready to give kindly any information needed. The room was clean and comfortable offering all the necessities. New York is an excellent destination and if you are willing to combine it with a stylish hotel in the heart of the city Cassa Hotel is the perfect choice.

Stayed for 5 nights in this hotel. Upon arrival, we spent approx. 30 seconds checking in! the front desk has several people working behind it and they are super efficient. We were delighted to find that we had been upgraded to a condo from a King room.The lifts were super quick and when we got to the room we were delighted. Very large bed which was extremely comfortable. A fully equipped kitchen and dining area, A large TV facing the bed, A walk in closet and a fabulous bathroom. Everything was spotlessly Clean. Plenty of towels and soap etc. Shower head is quite large which is nice in the mornings or after a long day walking about new york. The Bath is quite deep and great for a long soak to ease those muscles.Starbucks is straight across the street (free wifi) and Times square is a short walk away. You literally come out of the hotel, turn left, cross the street to the Irish pubs, and time square is at the next intersection. We could see the glow from TS at night from our room windows. If you turn right when you leave the hotel, you will come to madison avenue.The hotel was very quiet, virtually no street noise at night at all which meant a sound night sleep.The only negative I would have is that there was virtually no information about the hotel facilities in the room. There was a breakfast menu but that was it. There was no information about the cost of wifi or how to get it, there was no info about how much the drinks cost in the fridge, recommended restaurants close by, Local Doctor in case of emergencies etc…. that type of thing. Most hotels I have stayed in have a welcome pack with all relevant info enclosed inside. This might be a suggestion for the hotel to do in the future.Do take the time to do the Grayline tours. They leave straight from time square beside the TKTS Booth. The tour guides are very knowledgeable and you can hop on and off as you like.I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again when I return to NYC.Thank you Cassa Hotel for a great stay.

We've just come back from NY. we stayed at Cassa Hotel and overall our stay was extremely pleasant.I don't really understand how one can write negative reviews about this hotel. we have stayed for more than a week there and there was not a single thing that you could possibly blame them for! apart from paid wi-fi :-) I hope they will make it free for their guests cause I consider it today to be not a luxury but a must for free.we didn't get an upgrade from our standard room, mosty likely because of high season - May holidays for many countries, hotel was full of Spanish and Russian people.after reading reviews we expected our room to be very small, but were gladly surprised that it was not THAT small. believe me, we stayed in deluxe rooms in Prague and Rome and they were same size as standard room in Cassa! Room was very nice, clean, stylish, modern, equiped with different appliances. It had LG LCD screen, Apple dock, iron and ironing board etc. Bathroom was spacious and fancy. it had everything u need including proper blow dryer. it made some weird noise the first night we stayed so we asked the staff to replace it. and they did.Every morning the staff was leaving print-outs with weather forecast for the next 2 days, recommendations of the restaurants, museums and shops. we tried 2 of the restaurants tehy recommended an tehy were wonderful! you couldn't find a tourist in there, all the visitors seemed to be local. food, interior and atmosphere were excellent and prices were acceptable!Location of hotel is JUST PERFECT!!!! u r located extremely lose to everything w/o street being overcrowded like at TS location. we could easily walk everywhere and if u r not a very walkable type u could get a train which is not far either (different lines).I will definetely recommend this hotel to everyone!!!!

After opening late last year, this relatively new hotel exceeding all our expectations! Situated just 5 mins walk from TIMES SQ, YES FIVE mins and 10 and 15 mins from Grand Central Station/Chrysler Bld and Empire State Bld respectively. The location is just perfect as we were within 5 mins from local attractions and from TIMES SQ 42nd st Subway which we used to travel Downtown, to Greenwich Village, Chelsea, Soho, Little Italy, Wall St etc and the 1 Line to the Statue of Liberty. It was near to the Rockefella centre to where if you visit 'the Top of the Rock' you get the most incredible view of the Manhattan skyline. For shopping you are with a few mins from the shops on 5th and Madison Aves. Macys, Tiffany and Bloomingdales are all within a short subway/20 min walk away. The staff were SO helpful and courteous - but not pushy, making you feel very welcome. We were greeted on arrival with a beaming smile and told that we'd recieved a free upgrade from studio to deluxe room. The room was spacious, clean, pretty chic and very comfortable. Great TV and trendy bathroom. By the way the carpets were cool - the colour not to everyones taste but what IDIOT gives a hotel a bad review because of this? Clutching a straws you miserable people! HIGHLY RECOMMENDEDJUST BOOK A ROOM AT THE CASSA - FOR THE LOCATION, STAFF AND PRICE, YOU WILL FEEL LIKE YOU'VE WON THE LOTTERY....

I can't speak highly enough of the Cassa! My room had been upgraded on arrival and though not arriving until 1.15am, the front desk staff were friendly and obliging, helpfully explaining everything to me! My room on the 6th floor was lovely - not overly big, but I was only there to sleep. My bed ( and especially the pillows) was so comfortable, the bathroom huge with quality soaps and shampoo and it was wonderful to have such a big, flat screen TV. Being a first time visitor to New York, I found the Concierge and front desk staff continually helpful, offering suggestions for what to do and the easiest way to get to places. Internet was offered at a reasonable rate ($10 for 24 hours) and the Business Centre on the 10th floor provided computers, fax and a printer service. This hotel has many positive attributes, but location is fabulous - only 1.5 blocks from Times Square and half a block to 5th Ave. I walked to most places in the Midtown area - the Rockefeller Centre, Times Square, Grand Central Station and St Patrick's Cathedral are only minutes away and the Empire State Building and Central Park, though slightly further away, are easily walkable. There was never a time when I didn't feel safe in this area. There are also many interesting cafes, restaurants and pubs in the vicinity. I look forward to returning to the Cassa when the renovations are complete. My stay was fantastic!

Was in NYC for a conference and could not have been happier with the hotel my company booked - they usually book the cheapest place they can find! The staff was very nice and helpful, rooms where spacious (especially for NYC) and clean, great view, outstanding location. Delicious menu at the lounge, very informative concierge for things to do and see and most of all everyone was extremly nice!Hopefully lightening will strike twice and I'll be back to Cassa on my next trip to NYC!

The hotel was very clean and modern, and the staff were very friendly but there were a few things that could have been improved. The room was cute and comfortable, but very small and only had a double bed. The cooling system wasn't working so it was unbearably hot in our room. We opened the window but there was no screen and it was very loud. They charge for everything, including the corkscrew in the room, which I have never seen before. They charge what seems to be a lot for wifi, local calls and toll free calls.The girls at the front desk were very sweet and suggested a good restaurant for dinner one night. Unfortunately they also sent us to a liquor store at 10th and 42nd, which was a bit of a hike. We found out later there were at least 3 that were closer (just saw them while walking around). Also we wanted to try a specific restaurant, and they ended up making a reservation and sending us to the wrong place with a similar name. Not really their fault but it sucks when you only have a few nights.It was a good price (we paid 220/night over easter though hotwire) and you can't beat the location if you are a tourist. But for four stars I would expect there to be a corkscrew in the room for guests to use.

From whence cometh the star ratings? There must have been a sizable payoff for this Place to get 4 stars! Small, dark, and chincy, this place rates 3 stars at best. The designer must come from the Munsters. The surfaces are all dark brown and dreary. The furniture- if you can call it that is dark laminated (starting to delaminate) plastic. The hardware is vintage Lowes, and failing, and the "standard" room has a full size bed an reading lights for one. It is not really a two person room.

This hotel has a great location. It is within walking distance of Times Square and the Broadway theatres. The staff were extremely helpful and the concierge was amazing. It you want a luxurious room, this is not the hotel for you since the rooms were very small but you couldn't ask for a better location and staff.

Everything about this hotel was perfect--especially the location and the concierge. It is close to Times Square and the major theatres. Also a number of good restaurants nearby. All of the staff members were cheerful and friendly and efficient. The room was small, but cheerful and clean.

We choose this hotel because we did not want to stay at a cookie cutter place but wanted a hotel with some style. We got a great rate since we booked it 2 months ago. The location was great as we had never been to New York before and wanted to be close to central park as well as the theatre district. The staff at the front desk was very friendly and seemed to know us when we came in and out. The hotels public spaces are well designed –we never waited for an elevator and in fact always rode it by ourselves.The room was surprisingly small and did not have closet but instead a tiny cupboard where you can hang a shirt but nothing long. I had brought a dress with me and the only place I could put it was on a hook on the back of the door in the bathroom. Also the room had no where to hang a coat which is a problem when it has been raining. Sleep quality was affected by the sudden roar of the air conditioning unit when it turned on and off. All in all I might stay here again but the size of the room might make me look elsewhere.

The Cassa Hotel in NYC is awesome! The staff are so friendly and accomodating. They helped with dinner selections, theatre and directions. The hotel is very clean ~ and very centrally located to Rockafella Center and Times Square. The Manhattan Cafe just a few doors down offer a wide selection of food and beverages. Being a fairly new hotel (opened in Sept 2010), it is not widely known but once it is... watch out....everyone will want to stay. This was our second stay and was as great as the first.

I stayed at Cassa Hotel for about four weeks. I was very impressed with the level of service that Albania and her team at the front desk gave. Having worked in hotels before, I know how stressful it can be working at the front desk especially at a new hotel. Everyone was very helpful and went out of their way to make me feel at home.The rooms are small, but most rooms in NY are small. However, the rooms are laid out in an ergonomic way so that you can make the most of the space. It is within walking distance of Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center and Times Square. There are some good restaurants within walking distance too.

Nice rooms, nice people, nice location. The lobby is under construction but did not interfere with anything. Sounds like it will be nice when done.Pretty funky and hip, but wouldn't that mean free internet?I just wish hotels provided foam pillows!

I have been to New York on many occasions and have always been disappointed with our accommodations and the prices!!! I spent quite a bit of time reading TripAdvisor reviews of hotels in New York and this hotel seemed our best choice. I looked at location, price and cleanliness.I was not disappointed. We booked and pre-paid the hotel a month before our trip. The check-in was a breeze. The room was small but cozy. I check all the corners and the mattress - all were very clean. The shower had lots of pressure, plenty of hot water and two shower heads. The lighting in the bathroom was excellent. The employees were very friendly and helpful. We visited the restaurant on the 44th floor which has an excellent view but found the atmosphere too “stark” to have breakfast.Best was the location. Times Square is only a block and a half away. The bus to Newark airport is only a five minute walk. We could walk to all our destinations from the hotel.My only wishes would be to have free Wi-Fi and local calls. I crossed the street to Starbucks for free Wi-Fi.At check-out, my parting words were: “We’ll be back!”.

Excellant service, small hotel, staff remembered everyone's name. Location couldn't have been better, just a 2 minute walk to time square, about a 5 minute walk to Grand Central Station, restaurants everywhere. The room was very clean, great shower, loved the shampoo, soap and lotions. There was no lounge or restaurant on property but the area made up for that. I recommend an Italian restaurant by the name of Trattoria on 44th street

I have been to NYC numerous times and usually stayed at the bigger luxury hotels, Le Parker Meridien, The Plaza, The Waldorf. That said, I found the Cassa to be an exceptional boutique hotel. Loved it's convenient central location in Midtown, making it easy to access everything. Especially loved our beautiful, CLEAN room. I *love* clean. Hotels can gross me out in general, but this room was spotless. The entire room was beautiful, but the bathroom was my favorite. Modern, white, giant luxury shower. The bed was also extremely comfortable. The front-desk staff were all extremely friendly and kind. We called and asked for a late check-out as we couldn't make it back to the room in time and they were very accomomdating.All in all, we had a wonderful experience at the Cassa hotel and would gladly stay there again! Highly recommended!!!
Very trendy, boutique hotel. Reasonable price.Staff provide great service.The rooms are very chic.Nice location.

Liked the look of the hotel so chose it based on what i find desirable in a hotel. DESIGN, LOCATION and PRICE. Couldn't have made a better choice! Not only did it meet all criteria but the hotel staff were amazingly helpful, friendly and down to earth too. Would recommend this place for sure! Wicked experience and great staff!

I stayed at Cassa multiple times for business in 2010. The staff was exceptionally attentive, the rooms were high style yet simply modern, and the location is right in the heart of the times square district. I could not have asked for more. I will definitely stay at this property every time I return to NYC from hereon in.
The BEST location in NY both for business and to discover the city. Also great achitecture and service. This is the place to stay in the Big Apple. No question.

Let's face it, there's really no such thing as a good budget hotel in NYC, unless you're willing to put up with bed bugs and shady locales. The Cassa Hotel was a great hotel in a great location for a great introductory price. Get it while you can! I gave it a 3 score on value, because I believe, anywhere you go, anything over $150 is too much!! Slainte!!!

The staff at this hotel make your stay. They always acknowledge you and seem to take a genuine interest in your plans and all they're restaurant recommendations were good, I found them very helpful, responding to requests for non feather pillows and for more hangars speedily. However one of my colleagues did have to ask for technical help with her alarm several times.The rooms are ok for New York, not as small as some but we did get an upgrade but the beds are really comfortable. They could still work on the lighting more had been added since I last stayed there but still dark at times in the room. UseThere is not enough room in the bathroom to put your toiletries but you can work around it.

I went there last week and stayed at Cassa for 4 nights. I booked it at the beginning coz it is a new hotel and even with some of the down sides (people commented about it), it turned out my stay was fantastic!I didn't do any info search before my trip, flew in from Orlando and had absolutely no idea how to get to the hotel from Newark, NJ airport. However it was just very easy ... took an airport express bus from the airport and got off at the first stop (at 42nd street, 8 Av.), walked 3 blocks then you were there.Staff were absolutely amazing. Really helpful! Hotel decor is trendy and cozy.NYC ROCKS! ... I am a "road-blind" ... but it was enjoyable to get lost in NYC ...just keep walking and seeing things. :)

I enjoyed my stay at the Cassa hotel. The hotel is a block away from Times Square, few blocks from Rockefeller Center, Empire State building, Murray Hills, and Broadway. The staff (Kevin, Albany, and Eric) was very outgoing, knowledgeable, and friendly. Albany and Eric booked reservations for us from restaurants’ to a Broadway show. Kevin was very outgoing. Kevin helped us with our bags and provided us with details of the city. We stayed at the Cassa for four days and only experienced two small problems. The first problem was a clogged toilet. The second one was not receiving a wake-up call as requested. Before leaving the hotel for the evening, I informed a gentleman at the front desk about the clogged toilet and asked him to send someone up to fix it. The front desk person quickly told us that the problem had already been taken care of and not to worry about it. Now, I know the service is quick, but in this case--we had not informed anyone of the problem--we just assumed it was taken care of. After several hours sightseeing, we arrived back to the hotel and discovered that the toilet was still clogged. As a result, I called the front desk and informed a woman that the toilet was still clogged. Within minutes, maintenance was knocking on our door to fix the toilet. The second problem was in regards to the wake-up call. On our last night stay at the hotel, we asked for a wake-up call for 5:30 AM. The same person said he would notate the request. Unfortunately, we did not receive a wake up call until another person called our room the following morning (6:15 AM) to inform us that our car service was waiting for us downstairs. Other than those minor issues, I highly recommend this hotel for any traveler; solely based on its location and for the most part, their commitment to professionalism and customer service. Note:We were given a standard room and were offered an upgrade for a fee (50/75). We declined the upgrade. The room was tiny but comfortable. The bed was more comfortable than the Westin's Heavenly bed. In addition, I have read other comments about the closet space and found that there was adequate space in the clothing storage space provided.

My father and I have just returned from a three night stay at the Cassa Hotel. The room was a perfect size and the staff could not have been more helpful. Only minor complaint is the lack of a bar; I was travelling with my father and it would have been nice to have ended the day with a relaxing drink in the hotel rather than having to head out. Other than that no complaints at all.
Great location, very friendly helpful staff and beautiful room. We were upgraded to larger room, which was comfortable and very quiet. Can't wait to return.

This is a nice new hotel in the middle of town. Very convenient location and nice rooms and staff. I think the hotel is still missing things it needs to be considered a 4 star hotel. I was OK with our stay since I got a great rate on Hotwire but if I had paid more I would have been unhappy. The heat in the hotel was stifling and it made the room very dry. The hotel has no humidifiers available for guests. This is something I have been able to request from other 3 and 4 star hotels with no problem. The room is also missing an in room coffee maker, pretty standard these days. When I had a need for a missing toiletry item they had nothing to offer, but they did offer to send a staff member to go and buy it for me which was very nice. There is still construction going on in the hotel and I am sure it will be nicer when it is finished. One last missing item was free internet in the lobby. I have always been able to have that available in other hotels. I expect pay for this in my room but not the lobby. The hotel needs to have a proper concierge service. We asked for dinner reservations to be made at the front desk/ concierge and we were told that would be no problem. It was never done and when we asked if it was taken care of we were told the man handling it had left and would be back in the morning. We never heard from him and took care of it ourselves in the end but we were concerned we might have been double booked if he had indeed taken care of it. Overall I would stay here again if I had this low a rate but not for more.

HIDDEN COSTS, BAD SERVICE, NO RESPONSE, ENDLESS PHONECALLS and EMAILS.......and STILL WAITING.....After booking a promo deal with Travelzoo, I was advised I would have to PAY $120 EXTRA, without TAX, to accomodate us. I can't believe that a NEW hotel would treat its customers in such a mannrer. After 6 phonecalls this morning, with the reception placing me on silent hold and giving me the runaround........and all I wanted was a total price for my reservation (with the additional fees). If this is the type of service I have to adhere to, and I HAVEN"T EVEN GOT THERE......no wifi, no laundry facilites, no breakfast.....DON"T EVEN BOTHER!!!!!
The hotel is just perfect. The price is really worth. Attention is the best. Rooms are very clean. It was better than I expected. I don't have to search more hotels for my next stay at NY.
Great Location, friendly staff, clean room, spacious bathroom.

Stumbled onto this hotel by accident, as I booked on Hotwire.com, where it was listed as 4 star. I agree. Very comfortable room. Small but not tiny (typical NYC size). Great bed, large TV, wonderful shows, robes, in room safe. Friendly and helpful staff. I was upgraded to a "suite" - not a true suite, but slightly larger room. Good fitness room. Onsite restaurant is only so-so; has minimal choices but great view. Tons of other choices in easy walking distance. No in-room coffee maker. Perfect midtown location: three blocks from Grand Central, block and a half from Times Square

We had a wonderful experience at Cassa Hotel. The staff was amazing. They were friendly, courteous and extremely helpful. They went out of their way to make our visit memorable. The hotel was exteremely clean and well kept. Our room was very nice and large by NYC standards. It is also conviently located a couple of blocks off of Time Square in a very nice neighborhood. I could not reccomend this hotel more.

My stay at the Cassa Hotel was so exceptional, I felt like I'd won the lottery. I'd done extensive research on hotels around Times Square, since I was traveling to Manhattan for a business conference and wanted to take in a Broadway show while I was there. So, for my price range, my expectations were that I was going to get a tiny room with a bed up against the wall, barely space to turn around, lots of street noise, and iffy service. Then I spotted a great deal for Cassa on Travelzoo, and the reviews on Tripadvisor looked good, so I decided to give it a try. Wow, was I blown away! I was upgraded to an executive suite, and the room was exceptional. Spotlessly clean, a fantastic view from the 27th floor (I could see right down the street to Times Square a couple blocks away), a small desk where I could work comfortably, and solidly reliable internet access, both wired and wireless. There was even an iPod/iPhone charging station right in the room, so all I had to do was place my iPhone into it and not only was it charging, but the room could be immediately filled with my favorite music. Even without music though, I had zero trouble with street noise, and there were adequate curtains to draw across the windows if I wasn't interested in the flashing lights of Times Square. Manager Patrick N. was extremely helpful, as was the housekeeping staff. The mini-bar was extremely well-stocked, with drinks and munchies and even a discreet "intimacy kit". The bathroom was enormous, clean and well-stocked (shampoo, lotion, bathrobe, hairdryer, etc.). No bathtub, but a gigantic walk-in shower, and water pressure and temperature were always good. The elevators worked reliably, and the hotel's location near Times Square was superb. It was a breeze to catch a taxi to the Convention Center, or walk to Times Square if I wanted to find a restaurant or buy discounted tickets at TKTS for a Broadway show, and all theaters were within walking distance. The only downsides to the hotel are minor, and I put them down to Cassa still being a relatively new hotel: The lobby is tiny, decorated but still has a bit of an unfinished look, with a curtain partitioning off the parts that haven't been completed yet. There's no bar or anyplace to really meet with someone in the hotel itself, though there are plenty of other suitable locations nearby. Another tiny pet peeve of mine is that in the bathroom, though the amenities were beautiful, the soap dish, though stylish, doesn't have drainage holes or ridges, so wet soap placed into the dish tends to just glue in place and become a soggy mess. Electrical sockets in the room were a small issue, as there are plenty near the desk, but none near the bed (but I asked for an extension cord and one was delivered within 5 minutes). Drawer space was also minimal. There was plenty of shelf space in the closet, and nightstands with a tiny bit of storage space, but personally I prefer to have a chest with deep drawers near the bed where I can easily store things from my suitcase. All of those issues were extremely minor though: Overall I was absolutely delighted with the room: I loved the view, I loved the location, I loved the service, and the value was superb. When I return to Manhattan, Cassa will be my first choice!

The hotel is still undergoing some construction, but The staff more than made up for it. I was traveling for work on valentine's day and shortly after I checked in, I received a complimentary bottle of wine. About 5 minutes later I received a hand written thank you note from the general manager (nice touch). I felt like the room decor was a little tacky and cheap, but the tv & bathroom made up for any of the room's shortcomings. Also the hallway from the elevator to the room was a bit dingy, dark, and cheap. Overall, for the location, value, and friendly staff, I would recommend this hotel. However, next time I'm in NYC, I will probably try a different place just for the variety and to be able to compare.

As a frequent traveler I must admit this was a pleasant surprise. Especially when you consider it was a Hotwire booking. Excellent location just blocks from Times Square but with none of the street noise and pedestrian madness. Clean room and excelent bathroom facilities. The only knock was a bit of a smell from the A/C which was atributed to a filthy filter.Typical NY sized room but thrown in a flat screen TV, comfy bed and quality linens and call me a soon to be repeat customer.

A friendly welcome awaited us upon check-in, and we were given a room on the 6th floor. The bathroom was well proportioned with an excellent walk-in shower. The rest of the room was small but very comfortable with a huge plasma TV. Perfect location for exploring the city, with an excellent array of restaurants etc on the doorstep. Work is still in progress to develop the hotel even further, but none of this distracted us from an enjoyable stay. Our only minor niggle would be the bell sound / recorded announcement from the elevator through the night so try and get a room as far away from the lift doors as possible. Customer service from front-desk staff was excellent. We plan to return.

We got a great deal through booking. We found it very nice, well located, clean, new, well designed and friendly stuff. Though 70 dollars for a breakfast is a bit crazy hehehe.The rooms aren't big but there'snt any new hotel in Manhattan with big rooms, same size than Mandarin Oriental ,, no same views though hehe, the Views are good but not as in Mandarin.

I have just come back from a 3 night stay in the Cassa hotel and I loved it. The Location was perfect just a block away from times square and fifth avenue. Nothing was to much trouble for the staff they were all so helpful and polite. The rooms were a little small but again we were only in the room at night. The Rooms were kept very clean and the bed was so comfortable! The bathroom was very modern with a lovely big shower. Great experience and I would stay in this hotel again. The service people whre real helpfull as well. Got real good recomendations from them!!!! Thanks,

I stayed at Cassa for 4 nights in January and I don't know if I can say enough good things about it. The location is excellent and within walking distance to almost all tourist attractions; a block from Times Square and the Broadway shows. We also walked to the Museum of Modern Art, Grand Central Station, and Rockefeller Center. The only time we took the subway was to shop or meet up with friends downtown.The rooms at the hotel are very nice. There's enough room for two people to move around comfortably and the furnishings modern, stylish, and new. It also has the best smelling bath soaps I've ever encountered at a hotel.Lastly, when I was shopping for hotels in NYC, I kept reading about rude service at all the 4-star hotels. I assumed this was just the New York way and thus I wasn't expecting much in terms of service for this trip. However, everyone at Cassa was very friendly and helpful. There were lot's of personal touches like a thank you card from the manager on our second night, a short list of recommended restaurants and activities under our door every morning, and a special notice about the impending bad weather a few days before a forecasted snow storm. Overall a great stay and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

The hotel is situated in the perfect location. Nothing was more than a few blocks walk. The hotel was easily accessible for everything - airport, public transportation, tourist sights, great restaurants, etc.The customer service is amazing. Spectacular personal service, attention to detail was great. Everyone is extremely professional, helpful, friendly and welcoming. Upon check in, I even got a free room upgrade.My stay was worth for every penny. Very comfortable bed with luxurious bedding, modern design and furniture, great amenities, luxurious bath and products. The room was virtually free from street noise - I have no idea how that's even possible!I was completely satisfied and happy with my stay. I don't travel much but if I come back to NYC, I will be staying here again. My friends will definitely be hearing about this one!

It was our first trip to New York, and we couldn't have been happier at the Cassa Hotel. All of the staff were wonderful! By the time we left, we felt like we had been visting with friends during our whole stay. Everyone was so helpful including but not limited to Jillian, Nick, Chris, Patrick N., Patrick P., Regina, Ivana, Armando and of course Kevin. Kevin, Patrick N. and Patrick P. were so accomadating. We WILL BE STAYING at the Cassa next May when we attend our son's college graduation. Thanks again for everything ya'll did for us.Steve & Allison KaiserHomewood, AL

I've stayed in boutiques hotels in Europe and USA, and I can say that Cassa Hotel is one of the best!!! During last November we made a weekend trip to celebrate my wife's birthday to NYC. After a little research, I found this hotel and decided to stayed there. Since the moment that we arrived, the staff greeted us with a great smile. We got a very nice and confy room, very trendy furniture and very spacious. Location is great and close to a lot of attractions. The bathroom is very nice and clean. I will definitely stay here on every trip to NYC.
the best and most wonderful place to stay to celebrate something special,ie. (anniversary).....food was great...servvice spectacular
Excellent location, great service, clean rooms. I had been in lots of hotels around this area and the price that you pay for it woth for every penny.
It is a great hotel, just steps away from Fifth Avenue, Bryant Park.Great service, elegant, comfortable, clean.Of course I will stay in this hotel again on my next visit to NY

A last minute business trip led me to reserve the Cassa Hotel two days before arriving. While I typically avoid midtown, I was fortunate to find a discounted rate here. Overall the hotel was easily accessible, clean, and comfortable for a night’s sleep. Staff were friendly and permitted me early check in. I appreciated the green apples at the front desk as well. While I will likely return for leisure travel (at a discounted rate, their rack prices are absurd) I would not choose it again for a business trip. There was literally not a surface in the standard room on which to write or use a computer. The lighting was so dim it was very difficult to read. The room lacked a full closet to hang one suit and a winter coat. And no free wireless. In this day and age when every single starbucks on every corner has free wi-fi, this seems absurd for any hotel, particularly one of this standard. For all of the reasons mentioned, I had to work in a coffeeshop.3.5 stars for leisure travel, 3 for business.

we can't whait to come back, the service was better than excelent, everybody was very kind, the rooms are cozy and very clean, the bed is perfect, we will come back to cassa every time we come to ny, we have been in a lot of different hotels in ny and we can say cassa is the best pleace. we allredy make it ours. thanks for making our stay so great.we fully recomend cassa to all our friends.

Upon arrival Abraham offered free room upgrade. Every one at the reception very proffessional, helpful, friendly and welcoming. Rooms are clean, looks new and free from noise. Great loction walking distance to Times square, Central Park and many other places. Certainly recommend and will stay there again.

This is a new hotel with residential floors (still under construction- the residential design looks gorgeous). The newly-renovated rooms are small and nicely furnished; the bathroom was huge - unusual lay-out. Front desk service was good, a bit slow and also chaotic with the construction (entry and lobby were confusing). The elevators are slow, the 'lounge' is not functional except as a place to sit and chat, with wireless. Wireless has a charge. The fitness room is very small but functional, in the basement - not sure how it compares to other downtown NY small hotels. Hotel staff was very responsive and pleasant - and best of all is the location, on a reasonably quiet side street very close to Times Square. Access to the subway is not convenient though. Stayed there for a short overnight trip, so we didn't need the room to be spacious. It was clean, quiet and well-located for us. Considering this is a new and small hotel, and we got a discounted internet rate, overall our stay is rated very highly - we got a bargain at a very nice place.

First time at this hotel and is still currently being built. location is ideal, 2 streets away from 5th avenue & times square, amazing beds which you dont want to get out of in tnhe morning, staff and very friendly and rooms are clean. only down point is the room does not have free wi-fi and the cupboard space is tiny, only about room for 3 hanging items otherwise will be returning there very soon.RECOMMENDED

I arrived at the Cassa Hotel around 4 PM on Dec. 14th for a three night stay. I had booked through a third party site that offered a guaranteed upgrade, if available. Sure enough the friendly front desk person told me I had been upgraded to an Executive Room.I went up to room 2707, and what I noticed at first was that it seemed quite small. The king bed was only inches from the wall with curtained windows, and there was not much space on the opposite side either. It looked nothing like the spacious room pictured on the Cassa site, and I felt ridiculous having to smush myself between the bed and window to open and close the curtains.Next I noticed the television mounted to the wall. None of the TV input connections were accessible. This was troubling, as I had checked with hotel staff (both reservations and front desk) three times prior to my arrival to make sure I could attach an external device to the TV. I had been assured three times it would be no problem provided I had the proper connection cables. It was important, since I needed to watch some students' short films for a workshop I was facilitating. I called down to the front desk, and they sent an engineering staff member. He came in and told me rather curtly that I was "out of luck" and that hooking anything to the TV was not going to happen.I sent an email to the hotel's executive assistant, explaining my dilemma. She responded the following morning, informing me that she was going to assist me. Finally, later that day, someone attached a DVD player (provided by hotel) to the TV. This was useful. Unfortunately, in doing so, they managed to lock the TV so I could only use the DVD player and not watch any channels. The following day two engineering teams spent over an hour in my room trying to rectify the problem. It was never resolved.Cleanliness was also an issue. My first night, upon lying back in the bed, I noticed a strange aroma. It was like an industrial solvent-type smell. I discovered the culprit was one of the four pillows on the bed. It smelled as though someone had dumped a whole box of detergent on it. I removed it from the bed, replacing it the next morning with a card asking that the sheets be changed. When I came back to room, the bed was made but the case had not been changed--it still smelled. Afterward, I flagged down a housekeeper and asked him to remove the pillow entirely. He smelled it and agreed that something was very wrong with it.The first time I went to use the shower, I discovered several coiled black hairs (not mine) on the floor. What's more, the next morning when I opened my new shower-mat, there were longer curly black hairs inside of it. For the most part the staff was friendly and accommodating. However, during one of my many interactions with them, I mentioned to Patrick--a front desk manager--that my room was much smaller than advertised on their website. He told me I was mistaken. That I was not taking into account the large bathroom. According to him, even the smallest Executive Rooms were about 380 square feet.I was bothered by his condescending attitude. So, when I went back to room, I measured the square footage (my brother is a real estate appraiser, so I know precisely how to do this). The total? 238.4 sq. ft., including the bathroom. I was shocked, as this is actually less than what the Cassa claims is the amount of space in their smallest standard rooms. My upgrade was actually a downgrade to a room that shouldn't even exist.The difficulties mentioned in other reviews are true. The wait for an elevator can be extremely time-consuming. Parts of the hotel appear unfinished. The lobby is small and cramped. The thermostat is unreliable: I had to get up several times each night as it became either too hot or cold. Also, even though the windows are double-paned, traffic noise was audible on the 27th floor.After a volley of emails, the hotel's executive assistant did apologize for my many difficulties. And she offered me a 20% discount on my next stay. But I booked this stay for more than 40% off. I think it highly unlikely I would spend more money to return. In my opinion, for a hotel billed as a four-star property, the Cassa will need to make drastic changes in its service and cleanliness before it can hope to sustain the goodwill that brings repeat customers.

My wife took me on a surprise trip to New York for my 40 birthday and it was my 4th time in New York and this is the nicest hotel i have stayed in. It is clean, secure, comfy and possibly the most plesant hotel staff i have ever dealt with. Not over the top friendly but genuinely nice cordial staff. The hotel is close everything you go to New York for, 5th Avenue, Times Square, the subway, bars and restaurants etcThe room was very comfy and the bed was great. Can't wait to return when it is finished and see what it is like, but hard to see how they improve upon perfection!

My fiancee and I stayed here and we loved it. Clean and urban style room with fantastic products. Very comfortable bed with luxurious bedding and perfect location near Times Square. Will definitely stay again!
user_name:
Jeniam
New York City, New York

review_body: My mom and I stayed at Cassa 3 nights in November 2010 for a wonderful weekend in NYC. As we checked in, Abraham gave us a complimentary upgrade to a Junior Suite with a King bed. Everyone working there was so kind and accommodating and genuinely friendly. The rooms were modern and impeccably clean with fresh cut orchids. Gorgeous bathroom, flat screen TV, white leather chairs. The king size bed was wonderful to fall into after a long day walking in NYC. Crisp white linens and so comfortable.The location was right in the heart of everything - just a block or two to Times Square, Rockefeller, shopping. Starbucks right across the street. Very safe and busy area on 45th between 5th and 6th, but quiet at night while sleeping.The hotel was still under construction while we were there. Just a bit of scaffolding in front of part of the hotel (right in front of our window). We didn't check out the gym or restaurant, didn't even know if it was open but we were there to see New York, not the gym.The best hotel with the best location. I hope to stay there on my next visit.

Stayed one night and swayed in a 4th flood room. Room was nice and nit small for the price I paid. Room had comfy bed and adjoining room with second bathroom and living area. Wifi was advertised for my room and I stupidly thought that this was free. It wasn't and they even charged me twice, although one was refunded eventually. There is a star bucks across the road where youll get free wifi and a cheaper coffee then their breakfast prices. Didn't use the restaurant or gym. Looks like there may be more to open in the lobby so will look forward to seeing what changes are made as it gradually opens.

Having seen dozens of hotels in Manhattan an Brooklyn, the Cassa was a very positive experience. The room was utterly clean, comfortable beds, excellent bathroom with walk-in shower.The location (between 5th and 6th Avenue at 45th) couldn't be any better and the deal we got was extremly good (maybe because the hotel only opened in August 2010 and some construction work was still ongoing).But the best thing about the hotel is the staff: Never have I seen so friendly and helpful staff with such a positive attitude anywhere before (not even in hotels in Asia). From welcome desk to concierge to cleaning staff - everybody did an excellent job!

I booked a two-night stay here during a business trip to NYC. The location is very good for mid-town meetings, nothing was more than a few blocks walk from the hotel.The arrival experience wasn't bad - after a long flight all I want to do is get checked in and crash in the room. Weirdly, there is ONLY a revolving door meaning if like me you have a carry-on bag it's tough to get through the door - seems like the idea is that you have to hand your luggage over to the bell man when you get out of the cab and they bring it in a different way. Problem with that is that I don't like to hand my bags over and I really don't like having to wait for them to be delivered to the room - plus it's only a carry-on. Small thing I guess. Check-in was efficient, however only one elevator was functioning and so each time there was a long wait to get up to the room - on one occasion there was a line of maybe a dozen people waiting more than ten minutes to get access to the lift. That's really not acceptable when you're paying $400 per night.Rooms were very nice - mine (1206) seemed to be part of a two-room suite (with 1205) so I guess if you were a family the setup would be pretty amenable.Small desk, armchair and little sofa as well as comfortable bed and nicely configured bathroom. Only issue I had with the room was that there were no instructions - e.g. nothing to tell you how to get internet set up, nothing to indicate if there was room service or what was available in the gym. Strange.I didn't try the gym or restaurant.Checkout was also efficient and the staff were generally friendly.

I have just come back from a 4 night stay in the Cassa hotel and I loved it. The Location was perfect just a block away from times square and fifth avenue. Nothing was to much trouble for the staff they were all so helpful and polite. There was a some work going on in the lobby (as it is a new hotel) but that didn't bother us at all as we were out most of the time. The rooms were a little small but again we were only in the room at night and it would of been perfect if the there had been facilities to make tea and Coffee in the rooms. The Rooms were well decorated and kept very clean and the bed was so comfortable! The bathroom was very modern with a lovely big shower. Manhatten Cafe is more or less opposite which offers a great range of foods and reasonable prices and Starbucks is directly opposite. Great experience and I would stay in this hotel again.

The Cassa Hotel was such a great find. I happened onto it at Trip Advisor, then went out to their website for further investigation. I hate staying at a hotel to find it looks nothing like the website; this was not the case with the Cassa. The room was expertly decorated and spacious for NYC. The bathroom had a vanity area, designer soaps and a huge walk in shower. The 42 inch plasma TV was great to watch from the bed. The hotel staff was so friendly and helpful. They would greet us each time we passed through the lobby and inquire upon our needs. The hotel is very close to Times Square, but so quiet I forgot I was sleeping in the middle of NYC. We have used many hotels in NYC and the Cassa is by far our new favorite.

The room was clean, modern and quiet. The bed was amazingly comfortable and I heard absolutely no noise from the street which is unusual for NYC. The bathroom was large and modern. It was a good location for midtown. The rest of the hotel had zero ambiance. The lobby is very small and basically a desk with concrete walls. I did not see a restaurant or a bar.I would say that if you are traveling for business and need a good midtown location and a quiet, comfortable room, this is a good choice. Also, the rate was very reasonable.If you are traveling for pleasure and looking for an elegant New York "experience" I would say you might be disappointed in the starkness/simplicity of the hotel. Went to the Waldorf to meet up with colleagues and the lobby/bar/overall grandeur was completely different level than the Hotel Cassa. The folks working at the front desk were very nice and friendly. Overall a solid 4 stars.

We stayed at the the Cassa over the Veteran's Day weekend. The location is fabulous, but the service is an issue. Our rooms were not ready at 3, we waited until after 4 before we were given our keys. Upon return from a show on Friday night we found our suite door wide open! The door to the rooms were still closed and locked, but the suite door was wide open. Someone from the front desk came right up and inspected our rooms with us; all was well. He promised to bring up a bottle of wine as an apology for our scare and inconveneince.......never received it! In speaking the the hotel manager I was assured that she would take care of our concerns.....swell......there was no reimbursement for the time we could not get into our room and no apology for the security issue either. I was truly disappointed in our stay as I had high hopes that we had found the perfect hotel for our visits into the city. I cannot recommend this hotel.

room not ready at checkin however did allow us a free international call for ill relativeroom was too smallno tea making facilities !front desk staff very courteous and polite always helpful and very friendlyesp eric and abraham

I landed at the hotel late in the evening after my flight home had been delayed. I was alone in a big city (the biggest) and had never traveled before. They had not received my booking when I had arrived. I was exhausted and anxious....but I was taken care of by the staff. The desk manager, Patrick, got on the horn and straightened everything out; he spent a long time on the phone getting me a room. Eric offered to go across the street to buy me a coffee. I couldn't believe it! Everyone was so warm and caring; I told my father on the phone I was in good hands! I would also like to give a special mention to the lovely door man, Justin, who kept me company outside and gave me lots of great ideas on what to do in the city :)...I really cannot express enough how impressed I was. It was like staying with family....everyone was so kind, professional and wonderful. Thank you, Cassa!

My family recently stayed at Hotel Cassa for a long weekend of shopping and theater. We brought our 2 year old son and we were very pleased the helpful and thoughtful staff. The hotel provided a very nice pack-and-play system with very cute (and clean) bedding. The doormen (especially Justin and Henry) were always helpful as we came and went with our stroller. The front desk staff were freat (especially Eric).Easy walking to Times Square, Broadway district, Rockefeller Center, shopping.Clean, modern rooms. Can't wait to see the restaurant and bar when finished.

The hotel is not finished is why they are all excited about the deals. Be wary on any web search because u can't choose your room- get what u get. All in all it had great rooms and comfy but zero and I mean zero amenities. No lobby or bar or restaurant etc and in NYC a Drink before heading out is always fun. Right on times square so that's good if u r seeing a show. Honestly- it's just ok, and it is expensive for ok. The staff are ok but inexperienced but you get no grand NYC feeling in a lobby of matte black cinder block that is smaller than a luxury suv. NYC is about experience. Hook yourself up slightly better for the ( substantial) dough. But I'll give u this- comfy beds!

Had kind of a rocky start. Arrived at 2PM and room wasn't ready but bellman took our bags. Came back at 5PM and while I was upstairs in the room a maintenance man let himself in without even knocking. 15 minutes later a maid let herself in to place fresh orchids in the room, again without knocking. Bellman brought up one less bag than we had given him but promptly returned with the remaining bag. Rooms are very modern and nicely decorated but incredibly small. We had the "Deluxe King." There is a mini bar, fridge and safe. They give you a suitcase stand but there is hardly any place to set it up. We were on the 17th floor which was quiet and didn't hear any street noise but were also next to the elevator and did hear that occasionally. Shower was fantastic and they had nice amenities like a huge flatscreen TV which seemed even bigger because it was only 3 feet away from your bed. Also had a nice stereo system with satellite radio and iPod dock. There is a small gym in the basement with about 6 cardio machines of various kinds and some free weights and also towels and bottled water. Internet was reasonable at $9.95 per night. I told the manager of the hotel about our rough start and they comped us internet for the remainder of our stay and continental breakfast the next morning. They were quite apologetic and we didn't have any issues the rest of the stay. My fiance ran the marathon and they gave us a really late check-out at 4PM without any additional charge so that he could shower. The restaurant hadn't opened yet so I can't comment on that. Maid service was spectacular. Of special help were Carmen, Abraham, and Henry. The location is definitely the selling point of this hotel--wedged right between 5th and 6th Ave and a quick walk to any subway, Times Square, shopping on 5th Ave. Would stay here again.
